Add the olives and mix until they are coated with the cheese mixture. Divide the mixture into 16 portions. Using your hands roll into balls. Place the balls 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet and flatten slightly with the back of a spoon. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 16.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a mixing bowl combine flour and salt. Blend with a pastry blender or fork until crumbly. Add butter pieces to flour mixture, using a pastry blender or fork. Toss until mixture is crumbly. Gradually add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing to combine. Once all water has been added, pull mixture together with hands. Form into a ball. Flatten ball into a 4-inch round. Wrap in plastic wrap or wax paper. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Roll out dough on floured surface to fit pie plate. Trim dough to 1/2 inch larger than pie plate. Fold overhang under. Flute edge as desired. Bake for 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees. Bake 40-45 minutes or until lightly browned.

Place ham in a 9x13 pan and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove and set aside. Saute potatoes in a skillet until done. Crumble and drain the potatoes into a strainer or colander and press out the excess liquid. Add the egg and mix well with the potatoes. Pour the mixture into the greased baking pan and bake for another 15 minutes. Crumble the biscuit and sprinkle it over the potato mixture. Top with cheese and bake for another 10 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 2-quart baking dish with butterset aside. Cook macaroni in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but firm to the bite, about 8-10 minutesdrain well and return to pot. In a large bowl, whisk together butter, eggs, salt and pepper until smoothgradually add milk, whisking until well blended. Stir in macaronispoon into prepared dish and sprinkle with both cheeses. Cover with foilbake 30 minutesuncover and bake 20 minutes longer or until top is golden brown and a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting into squares. Serve hot.

In a large mixing bowl combine the corn syrup and 3 tablespoons of the water. Add the remaining 1 cup of water in a slow steady stream while stirring constantly. Add the cornstarch and vanilla and mix well. Add food coloring.

In saucepan combine strawberries, sugar and lemon juice. Bring to boiling. Stirring constantly, boil 2 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in pectin. Fill clean hot canning jars with hot mixture, leaving 1/2 inch head space. Wipe rims, seal with lids, process in hot water bath 10 minutes. Makes 4-5 half-pint jars or 2-3 pint jars.
Combine cream cheese, dill, garlic powder and salt. Stir until well mixed. Add scallions and red bell pepper and stir well. Chill. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flour until smooth. Add milk and creambring to a boil while stirring constantly. Cook until thickened. Stir in garlic powder, salt and pepper. Place the potatoes in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Spread the sauce over the potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Stir. Bake an additional 20 minutes in the preheated oven.

Sprinkle the chops with the salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium-high heat. Add the pork chops to the skillet and brown on both sides. Add the onion and garlic to the skillet and cook 5 minutes or until the onion is tender. Stir in the chipotle chiles. In a small bowl, combine the adobo sauce and oregano. Add the mixture to the skillet along with the remaining tablespoon of oil. Cook 1 minute. Transfer the mixture to a serving platter. Serve the pork chops with the chipotle mixture and garnish with the parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat oil in pan over medium heat. Add onion to pancook 3 minutes or until tender. Add tomato soup to pancook 3 minutes or until slightly thickened. Coat pork with soup mixtureset aside. Combine sour cream with dill pickle juiceset aside. Heat oil in pan over medium heatcook pork chops 4 minutes on each side or until done. Combine sherry and saltbrush over pork chops. Bake 5 minutes or until slightly browned. Top each chop with sour cream mixture. Garnish with parsley.

Drain the pink salmon well. Grind the salmon with the eggs in a food processor or blender. Add the curry powder and process until well blended. Add the instant oats and process until just blended. Shape the mixture into patties and grill. Serve with tartar sauce and your favorite salad. Serves 4.
Boil yams until tender. Drain and mash. Add lemon juice, parsley, salt and pepper. Mix well and serve warm.

Dissolve yeast in the water. Mix the rest of the ingredients. Let stand for 30 minutes. Divide into 4 balls and roll each ball out on a pizza pan to your desired size. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and top. Return to oven for another 10-15 minutes or until crust is golden.

Mix flour with baking soda, ascorbic acid, salt, and stevia powder in a bowl. Add lemon rind and stir well to blend. Beat egg with ascorbic acid in a measuring cup or bowl. Add lemon juice. Add almond milk and stir well to blend. Add egg mixture to dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Heat a lightly oiled frying pan over medium-high heat. Drop batter by teaspoonfuls into pan to form pancakes. Brown pancakes on both sides and serve immediately with butter and syrup. Makes 6 to 8 pancakes
Combine first six ingredients. Rub over salmon filletssprinkle with salt and pepper. Broil 4 inches from heat 2 minutes per side. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 13x9 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, stir together the flour, brown sugar, butter, and pecans. Press into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Meanwhile, combine the caramel ice cream topping and milk in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave for 1 minute or until smooth. Spread over the crustsprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool before cutting into bars.

Pound the pork to 1/4 inches thickness with a meat tenderizer or rolling pin. Season with shaoxing wine, soy sauce, ginger juice and potato starch and let marinade for 30 minutes. Drain and heat a wok with oil over high heat until smoking. Fry the pork until crisp and brown on both sides. Remove from wok and set aside. In the wok heat the black vinegar and rice vinegar until reduced by half and thickened. Add sugar to the mixture and stir until dissolved. Add the pork and toss until heated through and glazed. Serve immediately with rice.

Cook ravioli according to package directions. Drain and put in baking pan. Add spaghetti sauce and water and stir. Add in diced tomatoes and mix together. Top with remaining cheese and parmesan. Bake in 350 degree oven for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Slice zucchini lengthwise into 1/4-inch thick rounds, cutting into 1-inch chunks. Toss the zucchini with the garlic and 1 tablespoon of the oil. Spread evenly over a large baking sheet. Roast for 10-15 minutes, tossing once or twice during cooking until the zucchini is tender crisp and lightly browned. Remove from the oven. Remove the garlic from the pan and let cool. Stir the zucchini with the remaining tablespoon of oil, vinegar, and seasonings. Taste for seasoning and serve.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the pasta according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta waterdrain pasta. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic, shallots, and crushed red pepper flakes and cook until softened and fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook until slightly softened, about 5 minutes. Add the squash and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the pasta, 1/2 cup of pasta water and parsley and toss to combine. Drizzle with additional oil.

Brown the ground beef with celery, green pepper and onion. Drain off excess fat. Add the potatoes and bouillon cubes. Add water to cover. Bring to a boil, lower heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the flour and milk. Stir over low heat until thickened. Add the shredded cheese and heat through. Serve hot.

Heat oil. Add onion, paprika, chili powder, and red pepper. Cook 1 to 2 minutes or until onion is tender. Add chicken and cook 3 minutes on each side. Add tomatoes and pineapple. Heat through. Serve over rice. Sprinkle with red kidney beans.

Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until the pan is very hot. Add the olive oil. When it begins to smoke, add the chicken pieces in a single layer. Brown them on the first side, 2 minutes per side. Turn the pieces over. Add the tomatoes, orange juice, garlic, and capers. Season with additional salt and pepper. Cover and simmer over low heat for 5 minutes. Uncover the pan. Continue cooking until the chicken pieces are cooked through and tender, about 5 minutes. Remove the thighs from the pan. Pour off the fat from the pan juices. Heat the juices over medium heat until they are reduced by half. Taste and adjust the seasonings. Return the thighs to the pan. Heat through. Transfer the thighs to a platter. Serve the pan juices alongside or over the thighs.

Mix all the ingredients except the onions, pepper and worcestershire sauce. Form into patties. Brown lightly in a skillet. Add 1 cup water and onion and simmer until onion is tender and liquid is reduced to a glaze. Add pepper and worcestershire sauce to taste. Pour over meat patties and serve on hot buns. Freeze burgers in a ziplock bag. Frozen hamburgers can be prepared from the freezer in about 45 minutes. You will need to add 2 cups of water to the sauce and simmer for a few minutes longer to thicken it enough to cover the meat patties. If you make the sauce ahead of time and refrigerate it until serving time, you will need to add the pepper and worcestershire sauce at serving time as well.

In a small saucepan bring milk to a simmer. In a bowl combine margarine with 2 Tbsp hot cocoa. Place bread in bowl with margarine mixture. Pour hot milk over bread and margarine. Melt bread in milk for a few minutes. Serve with whipped cream.

In a large bowl, soak the couscous in the milk for about 1 hour. Drain the excess liquid and set aside. In a nonstick skillet, combine the couscous with the cinnamon, cardamom and rose water and heat over medium-low heat for about 7 minutes or until golden and dry. In a small bowl, mix the raisins and nuts with the sugar and cardamom. Stir the strawberries and nuts into the couscous and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat together butter and sugar. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Combine the flour, baking soda, applesauce, cinnamon chips in a bowl. Stir the flour mixture into the sugar mixture. Pour batter into a greased 9 inch square pan. Bake for 40-45 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan. Drizzle with icing.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c).Place garlic in the center of a piece of foil. Drizzle with olive oilwrap foil securely around garlic and place in the preheated oven. Bake until garlic is very soft when squeezed - about one hour. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pancettacook until crisp, about five minutes. Add red onions, stirring until tender, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with thyme and salt. In a small bowl, combine butter and garlic. Spoon over chickenplace chicken in the preheated oven until cooked through - about 10 minutes. Serve with mixed salad greens tossed with garlic butter.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix ketchup with remaining ingredients in a large saucepan or dutch oven. Bring to boilingstir occasionally. Add beanscook for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Cool slightlyspoon in 12 individual casserole dishes. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until heated through. Makes 12 servings.

Mix together the first three ingredients until well blended. Spread in an ungreased 9 inch pie plate. In a blender combine the next three ingredients and process until smooth. Pour over the peanut mixture. Cover and refrigerate. To serve, top with whipped topping.

In a small bowl combine brown sugar, garlic powder, chili powder, ground black pepper, oregano leaves and salt. Rub mixture all over tenderloin. Grill tenderloin until juices run clear. Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing.

Combine garlic and lemon juice to make a paste. Spread over chicken halves. Sprinkle with sea salt and ground black pepper. Place chicken halves skin side down in a broiler pan. Broil for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Mix all-purpose flour with milk in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Mix in egg yolks, crabmeat and green onion. Add salt and pepper. Pour mixture into a pie pan that has been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray or lined with wax paper or foil. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack before serving.

Place cranberries and dried cherries in large bowl. In medium saucepan over medium heat, combine shallot, vinegar and orange juicecook until mixture comes to a boil. Pour over cranberries and cherries and let cool. Stir in gingerroot and brown sugar. Chill for 2 hours. Makes 6 servings.

Mix together stuffing and soup. Add chicken and vegetables. Spread into lightly greased casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink and stuffing is lightly browned. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving. Serve with your favorite vegetables.

Combine vanilla wafers and apple butter in blender. Blend until it is fine crumbs. In a large bowl combine crumbs and 2 cups of cool whip. Fold in 1/2 cup of cool whip. Refrigerate until serving. Spread on cake plate with the remaining 1/2 cup of cool whip. Sprinkle with pecans.

Preheat oven to 375f (190c). Grease and line a 20cm (8inch) springform tin with baking paper. Beat margarine and 1/2 of the sugar till light and creamy. Add eggs and beat till well combined and light and fluffy. Add flour and beat till smooth and combined. Pour into tin and bake for 1 hour 10 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean. Cool in tin for 10 minutes before removing from tin and cooling on a wire rack. Beat remaining sugar and juice till light and creamy. Spread over top of cake and sprinkle with nuts and sultanas before serving. Serves 10-12.

To make the sauce, melt butter in a large saucepan and cook the onion and garlic over medium heat for 5 minutes until the onion is softened but not colored. Add broccoli and cook for a further 5 minutes until softened. Add the milk and stir until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Add the pasta and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the salmon and cook for 2 minutes. Place a quarter of the pasta mixture into each bowl and top with an egg. Sprinkle with black pepper and serve immediately.

Cut the peaches into small cubes. In a large bowl place the sugar, ginger and water. Stir till sugar dissolves. Add the lemon juice and stir again. Add the fruit and let it stand for 3 hours. Pour the mixture into a colander set over a bowl. Let it drain for 2 hours. Squeeze out as much juice from the fruit as possible. In a large pitcher add the wine. Slowly add the juice. Add the orange liqueur. Chill. To serve pour into a tall glass filled with ice. Garnish with a fresh peach slice.

Heat the oil in a large soup pot over medium heat. Add the garlic and marjoram. Cook until the garlic is golden brown. Add the chickpeas, vegetable broth, diced tomatoes and pasta. Cover the pot and bring the soup to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pot again and simmer for 30 minutes or until the pasta is tender. Add the baby spinach and simmer for an additional 5 minutes, or until the spinach wilts. Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish each serving with Parmesan cheese.

Spread ham, turkey, and green peppers on bread slices. Lightly coat with olive oil and grill over hot coals until crisp and golden brown on each side. Place tomatoes and onions on grill. Let tomatoes cook until tender and brown slightly. Place onions in a small skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until soft, about 1 minute. Add oil and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Combine onions and garlic in a medium bowl with tomatoes and oregano. Serve sandwiches on grilled bread slices with tomato-onion mixture and melted swiss cheese. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine taco seasoning and waterset aside. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add ground beef to skillet. Cook until meat is browned. Drain off any excess fat. Add taco seasoning mixture. Stir until completely combined. Set aside. Spray mini muffin cups with cooking spray. Press dough into each cup with fingers. Fill with meat mixture. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Top with cheese and return to oven for 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Let stand for several minutes before removing from pan. Makes 15 miniature tacos.

Preheat the broiler. In a skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the beef and cook for about 5 minutes, until browned. Add the onion and cook for about 5 minutes, until softened. Add the garlic and cook for about 2 minutes more. Stir in the cumin, paprika, coriander and cayenne. Stir in the tomato paste and cook for about 1 minute. Add the beans and cook for 3 minutes more. Stir in the green chilies and cilantro and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from the heat and stir in 2 tablespoons of the cheese. Place 1 tortilla on a microwave-safe plate and sprinkle with 1/3 cup of the filling. Add a sprinkling of the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese. Fold over and microwave on high for about 1 minute. Turn over and microwave for another 1 minute. Repeat for the remaining tortillas. Serve warm.

Thaw dough in the fridge overnight. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Roll out dough and spread with olive oil and spices. Sprinkle cheese on top and bake for about 12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce for a meal or appetizer!

In saucepan over low heat, combine beans, broth, green chili, and enchilada sauce. Heat through. Place tostadas on baking sheet. Bake about 3-4 minutes. Top with lettuce, tomato, cheese, salsa, and beans. Serve with additional salsa.

Cook eggs. Remove shell and mash yolks in large bowl. Add mustard, salt and pepper to taste. Add mayonnaise and worcestershire sauce and mix well. Stir in the sweet pickle. Spoon into egg whites and sprinkle with paprika.

Combine cream cheese, pineapple and pecans in a medium bowl. Form mixture into a ball. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or longer. Mix onions and green pepper with mayonnaise. Spread over ball or serve as a dip for crackers. Store in the refrigerator.

Heat 1 3/4 cups warm water (about 105 degrees f) in the microwave. Sprinkle yeast evenly over the top. Let sit for about 2 minutes or until the yeast begins to foam. Stir 1 cup of the flour into the yeast mixture. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons molasses and the gluten. Beat at high speed of a heavy-duty electric stand mixer for 5 minutes. Add remaining flour 1/4 cup at a time. Beat at medium speed until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl but is sticky. Cover and let rise for 30 minutes. Divide the dough in half. With your hands, stretch and fold the dough 12 times. Let rise for 15 minutes. Divide the dough into 3 equal portions. Roll each into a log about 10 inches long and 2 inches thick. Place the logs on the baking sheets. Cover and let rise for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Bake the loaves for
Cook and drain potatoes and put in a large bowl. Add yogurt and dressings and mix well. Refrigerate for several hours before serving. Garnish with pickles and olives just before serving.

Prepare gelatin as directed on box. Cool to room temperature and pour in a 9 x 13 inch pan. Chill in refrigerator until firm. Combine all remaining ingredients and chill in refrigerator until serving time. Spoon fruit mixture onto chilled gelatin and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 F . In small saucepan, bring chicken stock to boil. Saute shallots and garlic in olive oil in saucepan until translucent about 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and saute until mushrooms are tender about 8 minutes. Stir in stock. Bring to boil. Add orzo and simmer until tender about 15 minutes. Drain orzo in colander. Toss orzo with butternut squash and rosemary. Season with salt and pepper. Place in shallow baking pan. Pour butter mixture over top and bake about 15 minutes or until bubbly.

Melt butter in large stockpot. Add onion, curry powder and cook over low heat until onions are transparent. Add broccoli and cook for about 5 minutes. Stir in chicken broth, potatoes, carrots and milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender. Add cheese, stirring until melted. Serve immediately.

Combine rice, sugar and saffron in a large pot. Stir in water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Cook until rice is tender. Add rose water. Cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in cinnamon. Stir in pistachios. Spread in a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with almonds. Cool completely. Cut into squares.

Preheat grill or grill pan. Combine shallots, mushrooms, garlic in olive oil. Season lightly with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Grill until tender, about 2-3 minutes per side. While mushrooms are cooking, combine lemon juice, dijon mustard, rosemary and parsley in small bowl. Serve mushrooms topped with lemon mustard sauce. Serves 4.

In a medium bowl stir together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. In a large bowl stir together sugar and malted barley syrup. Add margarine and beat until well blended. Beat in egg and vanilla. Stir in flour mixture until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop batter by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 400 degrees for 12 minutes or until cookies are puffed and golden. Cool on baking sheets for 1 minute. Transfer cookies to wire racks. Cool completely. Store in airtight container. Yields approximately 4 dozen.

Place chicken breasts between sheets of wax paper or plastic wrappound to 1/4-inch thickness with a meat pounder or small heavy skillet. Place chicken breasts between sheets of wax paper or plastic wrappound to 1/4-inch thickness with a meat pounder or small heavy skillet. In a small bowl combine the honey, vinegar, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, and black pepperblend well. Place chicken breasts between the two sheets of wax paper or plastic wrappound to 1/4-inch thickness with a meat pounder or small heavy skillet. Place chicken breasts between the two sheets of wax paper or plastic wrappound to 1/4-inch thickness with a meat pounder or small heavy skillet. In a small bowl combine the honey, vinegar, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, and black pepperblend well. In a small bowl combine the honey, vinegar, mustard, Worcestershire sauce,

Place graham crackers in the food processor. Pulse 10 seconds to coarse crumbs. Transfer to a large bowladd sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, and nutsmix well. Shape the mixture into 1-inch balls. Place the balls onto wax paper-lined baking sheets. Bake at 325 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from the oven. Cool. Makes 3 dozen.

Bring water to boil in saucepan on stovetop. Stir in ricecover and remove from heat. Let stand for 10 minutes or until water is absorbed and rice is tender. Meanwhile, in large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlicsaute for 2 minutes or until tender. Stir in rice, paprika and peppercook for 1 minute or until well blended. Spoon rice mixture into 2-quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Top with chickensprinkle with parsley. Bake for 45 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center and juices run clear. Sprinkle with parsley just before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Bake the pizza crusts according to directions on the package. Spread pizza sauce onto each pizza crust. Top each pizza crust with 1 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese. Layer each pizza crust with 1/2 cup of each of the following: mushrooms, tomatoes and peppers. Top with 1 cup of pepperoni. Bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes or until crust is crisp and cheese is melted. Cut into 12 squares.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the brown sugar and the beer. Add the salmon fillets. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 20 minutes. Drain the fish and discard the marinade. Place the fish in a large plastic bag. In a medium saucepan over low heat, melt the butter. Add the sugar and the beer. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Pour the mixture into the plastic bag. Seal the bag and place the fish in the refrigerator for 4 hours. Heat the grill to high heat. Remove the fish from the bag and place on the hot grill. Grill the fish for 2 minutes per side or until the fish is cooked through. Serve the fish with a lemon wedge.

Preheat oven to 375f. Mix soup with 1 cup water in medium bowl. Place chicken in shallow 2-quart baking dish. Spoon soup mixture over chicken and sprinkle with brown sugar and vinegar. Cover dish with foil. Bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake 10 minutes. Serves 4.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 9-inch pie plateset aside. Cook onion in butter in medium skillet on medium heat until tender and translucent. Stir in crab and Parmesan cheeseremove from heat. Combine eggs with milk in medium bowlstir in crab mixture and feta cheese. Pour into pie platebake 18 to 20 minutes or until firm in center and golden around edges. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut into wedgesserve immediately. Serves 6.

Heat oil in pot. Add green pepper and onioncook and stir until tender. Stir in salt, pepper, and spices. Add beef. Stir until meat is browned. Stir in tomatoes. Cook over medium heat until slightly thickened. Serve over rice.
Puree garbanzo beans and garlic in a food processor until smooth. Stir in tahini, lemon juice, cayenne, and salt and pepper to taste. You can add the red pepper at the end if desired.

Cut fruit into small pieces and combine in large bowl. Stir in fruit preserves. Cut tortillas into wedges and place in single layer on a large baking sheet. Brush wedges on both sides with cooking spray and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar. Bake in 400 degree oven for about 12 minutes or until crisp and golden. Cool for 10 minutes, then serve warm or at room temperature with fruit salsa.

Slice zucchini into rounds about 1/4" thick and toss with salt and pepper and let sit for about 10 minutes. Toss zucchini with onion and tomatoes, set aside. Heat olive oil over medium high heat and saute zucchini mixture for 5 minutes. Combine milk, eggs, and Bisquick in a large bowl and beat with a wire whisk until smooth. Pour 1/3 of mixture into baking dish and layer zucchini mixture over it. Top with mozzarella and 1/3 of mixture and top with parmesan and more mozzarella. Pour remaining mixture over top and sprinkle with parmesan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 35 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes then cut into squares and serve with crushed red pepper if desired.
In a saucepan combine all ingredients except Tabasco. Bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes or until reduced by half. Stir in Tabasco and cool. Makes 1.5 cups.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a medium bowl, combine the feta cheese and mayonnaise until well blended. Stir in pimientos. Spoon mixture into a shallow baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until hot and bubbly. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and garlic cloves. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and lightly browned. Garnish with tomatoes and green onions just before serving.

In a small sauce pan bring coffee to a boil over high heat. Turn off heat and add sugar and half-and-half. Pour in mugs. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Top with milk and vanilla extract to taste. Serve warm or chilled.

Bring broth to a simmer. Add cabbage mixture. Cover and simmer for 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Meanwhile combine butter and mustard until smoothstir in pecans. Serve cabbage mixture on buns or in lettuce cups, top with butter mixture.

Preheat oven to 325°F. Lightly grease an 8-inch square cake pan with cooking spray. Combine cornmeal, salt, and sugar in a bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, melted margarine or oil, eggs, baking powder, baking soda, and 1 cup water to make a smooth batter. Add half of the cornmeal mixture to the batter and stir to combine. Add the remaining cornmeal mixture to the batter and stir to combine. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center of bread comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Cut into 16 squares. Place 1 square on each plate. Spoon 1/2 cup of Creamed Corn over each piece of bread. Garnish with chopped parsley or chives. Serve immediately. Makes 16 servings.

Brown ground beef with onion in skillet. Drain off grease. Add soup to beef mixture and heat through. In mixing bowl, combine bisquick baking mix and milk until soft dough forms. Spread evenly in bottom of casserole dish. Layer with vegetables, then beef mixture. Sprinkle with cheese on top. Bake at 350f for about 15 minutes or until top is golden brown.

Saute butter and onion in a large pot until lightly browned. Add cabbage and cover with apple cider and apple cider vinegar. Add salt and pepper. Bring to boil. Cover and simmer 30 minutes or until cabbage is tender.

In large skillet brown pork sausagedrain well. In medium bowl beat eggs with picante sauceadd sausage. In individual tortillas place 3/4 cup sausage mixture, 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese. Fold in halfpress edges with fork to seal. In ovenproof skillet place 2 burritos at a timeturn over after 10 minutes. Sprinkle with green chiliescover skillet with lid or foil. Bake 10-15 minutes or until cheese melts. Makes 8 burritos.

In a bowl combine shallots, parsley, avocado, mustard, lime juice and light olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. In a non stick skillet over medium heat heat grapeseed oil. Place salmon skin side down in the pan. Cook for 3 minutes or until the bottom is crispy and golden. Turn the fish over. Cook for an additional 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Place the salmon on a platter and top with remoulade.

In a large bowl beat together cream cheese and butter. Add powdered sugar and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Fold in pumpkin and spices. Pour into graham crust and refrigerate. Beat together cream and sugar. Beat in vanilla. Pour over the pumpkin mixture and refrigerate. Serve chilled.

Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add the rice and stir until the rice is completely coated in butter. Add the lemon zest and stir well. Add the white pepper and cook for about a minute. Add the chicken broth and salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium low and add the lemon juice. Cook until the rice has absorbed all the liquid. Add the parsley and stir well. Cover the pot and let sit for about a minute. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 2 8x4 inch pans. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. In another bowl, sift together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt. Stir the flour mixture into the batter. Pour the batter into the prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack. Whip the cream in a medium bowl until soft peaks form. Gradually beat in the sugar until stiff peaks form. Spoon the whipped cream onto the tops of the cakes and spread evenly. Garnish with chocolate curls if desired.

In a large microwave safe bowl, melt margarine and marshmallows in a microwave at high for 1 minute and stir. Stir in the rice crispies and stir well until well combined. Press into a greased 9x13x2inch pan and let cool completely before cutting into squares and storing in a tightly covered container.

Combine vegetables in a large pot. Cover with chicken broth. Simmer for 5-8 minutes until vegetables are tender. Add mushroom soup. Tear up some of the dough. Add to mixture and stir. Place in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Cut remaining dough in strips about 1/4 inch wide. Place strips on top of mixture in a lattice pattern. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir. Top with shredded cheese. Bake for another 15 minutes until cheese is golden brown.

In a saucepan, over medium heat melt margarine. Add onions, garlic, cheese, olives, and salsa. Cook for 5-8 minutes or until cheese is melted and mixture is thick. Remove from heat and stir in seasoning salt. Cut wontons in half and place a teaspoon of mixture in the center of each wonton half. Press edges together to seal. In a deep fryer or deep saucepan heat oil to 350F. Fry wonton bites for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown. Remove with tongs or slotted spoon and drain on paper towel lined tray. Serve with salsa.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. In a 12-inch skillet, heat 1/4 cup oil over medium heat. Add onionsaute 2 minutes. Add potatoessaute until golden. Add garlicstir until fragrant. Add remaining 1/2 cup oil. Add rosemary, sage and thymestir until fragrant. Add butter. Add 1/4 teaspoon saltstir. Add 1/4 teaspoon pepperstir. Spread potatoes evenly into a shallow 13x9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake 20 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes more or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Unroll crescent rolls. Layer half of the ham on the bottom of the rolls. Layer half of the asparagus spears on top of the ham. Sprinkle with half the mozzarella cheese. Top with half the onions. Sprinkle with half the Parmesan cheese. Roll up jelly-roll style. Repeat with other half of ham, asparagus spears, mozzarella cheese, onions and Parmesan cheese. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Cut up onion and peppers. Mix in curry powder and turmeric. Cut off corn kernels and add. Mix in olives. Add miracle whip and seasoning to taste. Refrigerate for several hours.

Peel and cube the potatoes. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter and saute the onion until softened. Add the potatoes and stir until well coated. Add the chicken broth and stir until all of the liquid is absorbed. Season with poultry seasoning and rosemary and stir in the pepper and parsley. Add the chicken and apple and stir until evenly distributed. Serve with fresh parsley sprinkled on top.

Cook spaghetti in sauce for 10 minutes. Drain, add milk to the pot with spaghetti and spaghetti sauce and cook over low heat for 20 minutes. Add mozzarella cheese, mix well and spoon into casserole dish. Cook in oven at 350 for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with pepperoni while hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a baking pan with aluminum foil and spray the foil with cooking spray. Lay bacon on the foil in a single layer. Sprinkle with brown sugar and spices. Bake for 20 minutes or until crispy, turning once during baking. Cool on the foil for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a large saucepan. Cook over low heat until the butter is melted. Add the Rice Krispies and stir until they are coated. Spray a 13x9x2-inch pan with cooking spray. Spread the mixture in the pan. Sprinkle with the peanuts. Let cool until firm. Cut into 48 bars. Store in an airtight container.

Wash and drain mushrooms. Remove stems and set caps aside. Clean and chop stems and set aside. Slice caps into thin strips. Cook chopped stems in olive oil until soft and liquid is gone. Cut mushroom caps in half and chop olives and feta cheese. In large bowl combine all ingredients and spoon into mushroom caps. Place caps upside down on baking sheet and bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve as a snack or appetizer.

Melt the butter flavor shortening and stir in the water, eggs and vanilla extract. In a separate bowl combine the flour, baking soda and baking powder. Add to the butter mixture and beat until well blended. Stir in the milk chocolate chips. Pour into a greased and floured 8" x 8" pan and bake at 350 degrees F for 30-35 minutes. Cool and cut into bars.

Melt the butter in a medium-size saute pan over medium heat. When it is hot, add onion and garlic and saute 2 minutes or until onion is translucent. Add flour and stir constantly for 1 minute. Add milk and stir constantly until thickened. Add cheese and stir until melted and well blended. Add pepper sauce and white wine and stir until blended well. Serve over steaks or burgers. Serve over chicken breasts or strips.

Remove center rib from kale leavesslice leaves into 1/2-inch strips. Heat 2 tsp oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add kale and sprinkle lightly with salt. Cook until kale wilts, about 4 minutes. Add remaining 2 tsp oil, lemon juice, red pepper flakes and parmesan cheesetoss to coat. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, cream together cream cheese and goat cheese. Blend in fresh lemon juice, chives and basil. Add garlic and black pepper. Blend in pecans. Divide cheese mixture into 16 balls. Roll each ball in pecans. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with fresh fruit.

Mix together egg white, garlic powder, celery salt, salt and liquid smoke flavoring. Add almonds and coat well. Place on a cookie sheet and bake at 300 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool thoroughly before eating.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Sift together flours, bran, soda and salt. Cut in butter until it resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in brown sugar. Add buttermilk and mix just until moistened. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Roll or pat dough into a 1-inch thick round. Cut with a biscuit cutter or a glass. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes about 12 scones.
Combine basil, garlic and nuts in a food processor. With the machine running slowly add in olive oil. Add parmesan and season to taste. Serve on pasta.

In a large Dutch oven, brown ground beef over medium-high heat until no longer pinkdrain. Add bell peppers, onion and garliccook for 5 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in chili powder, cumin and cayenne peppercook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add green chili salsabring to a boilreduce heat. Add beanssimmer for 15 minutesstirring occasionally. Serve with tortillastop with cilantro, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Cut the peaches in half, removing any pit. In a saucepan, combine the sweet potatoes with water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until tender. Drain the sweet potatoes, reserving 2 cups of the cooking water. In a medium bowl, combine the cooked sweet potatoes with lemon juice, brown sugar and ground cloves. Mash with a potato masher. Stir in enough reserved cooking water to reach desired consistency. Spoon into a greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the peaches with brown sugar in another small bowl. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons flour. Toss to coat. Place peaches over potatoes. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes longer or until heated through. Sprinkle with additional flour. Serves 6 to 8. Delicious & dependable slow cooker recipes. Created for canadas kitchens.

In a small bowl combine the buttermilk, mayonnaise and sour cream. Add the basil and oregano and mix well. Cover and refrigerate until serving time. In a large salad bowl combine the lettuce and bacon pieces. Top with tomatoes and chicken pieces. Just before serving sprinkle the salad with the herb mixture and toss lightly. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving time.

Heat olive oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft and translucent. Add mushrooms and cook until done. Stir in flour until well blended. Pour in half-and-half and heat until bubbly. Add peas. Salt and pepper to taste. Add sugar for sweet peas. Stir. Serve over noodles. Serves 4.

Place 4 tea bags into a 1-quart pitcher. Add 1/2 cup of sugar and 1/2 cup of fresh mint leaves. Pour over boiling water. Let steep for 20 minutes. Strain tea through a fine mesh sieve into a large pitcher. Add 1/2 cup of freshly squeezed lemon juice. Stir in 1/2 cup of freshly squeezed orange juice. Add ice cubes. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, mix the butter and sugars on medium speed until creamy. Add the egg and vanilla and beat until well combined. Add the flour and baking soda and beat just until combined. Fold in the chocolate chips. Line cookie sheets with parchment paper. Using a small cookie scoop (1 tablespoon), drop the dough onto the cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Soak lentils in water for 12 hours. Drain. Blend lentils with the celery, carrots, curry powder and water in food processor until pureed. Add the all-purpose flour and egg whites. Blend. Heat breadcrumbs in a frying pan over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the lentil mixture and form into patties. Dip both sides in the breadcrumbs. In a frying pan over medium heat, heat the oil and fry patties until golden. Turn and brown other side. Serve with lettuce and tomato on a whole-wheat burger bun. Serves 4 to 6. Prep time includes 12-hour soak.

Remove stems from Swiss chard leavesdiscard stems or use to make a soup or sauce. Rinse the leaves, then chop. In a large skillet over medium heat, add the chopped Swiss chard leaves. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and saute for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the chopped onion and garlic. Saute for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the lemon juice, seasoning to taste with salt and pepper. Add the chopped parsley. Drizzle with olive oil and serve. Serve the Swiss chard with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkling of feta cheese. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut the bread into 1/2-inch thick slices. Melt the butter in the microwave oven until bubbling. Brush the butter onto the bread slices. Sprinkle the slices with the cheese and mustard. Bake on an ungreased baking sheet for 6 to 7 minutes or until the cheese has melted. Serve warm.
Place chicken in crockpot. In a bowl mix together margarine and curry powder. Brush mixture over chicken. Add heavy whipping cream and water. Cook on low for 8 hours.

Heat oil in pan over medium heat. Cook mushrooms until browned. Add gorgonzola and heavy cream. Cook until mushrooms are softened, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice and zest. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in cooked rice and spinach. Serve immediately.

In a saucepan melt the butter, add the onion, saute till the onion is translucent add the rice, stir well and add the stock a ladle at a time, stirring well as you add the stock. Keep adding the stock till the rice is cooked. Add the parmesan cheese, salt and pepper stir well then serve. This dish can be garnished with parsley or tomato slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine garlic powder, pepper, and 2 teaspoons lemon zest in a shallow bowlset aside for breading fish. In a medium bowl, combine cracker crumbs, remaining lemon zest, and parsleymix well and set aside for topping fish. Dip fish into flourdip into eggthen dip into cracker crumbs. Place fish on a baking sheet coated with cooking sprayspray tops lightly with cooking spray. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine wine, lemon juice, and butterbring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until reduced by halfadd scallops and shrimp, and cook for 1 minute longer, or until scallops are opaque and shrimp are pink. Remove from heat and stir in parsley and remaining lemon zest. Serve fish

Melt butter in a large skillet or pan over medium heat. Add flour, and stir constantly until smooth, 1 to 2 minutes. Add 1 cup half-and-half cream, 1 cup milk, 1/2 cup chicken broth, and seasoning, stirring constantly until smooth. Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat. Stir in the remaining half-and-half cream, milk, broth, and parmesan cheese. Add the onion, garlic, and cooked spinachheat through. Serve immediately or chill up to 24 hoursgarnish with parsley if desired.

Preheat oven to 350f. Salt the lamb leg. In a heavy skillet or pot cook the drippings over medium heat until they are browned. Add the lamb to the skillet. Add the wine. Turn heat to high. Add the garlic and saute until golden. Add the other vegetables. Add the peppers flakes and pimiento. Mix well. Cover the pot and place it in the oven. Bake for 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Turn the lamb occasionally so it cooks evenly. Serve with basmati rice.

Cook the egg noodles according to directions on the package. While the noodles are cooking, cook the broccoli florets in the microwave. Drain the broccoli and the noodles and add the soup and sour cream to the noodles. Mix well. Pour mixture into a 9x13 pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until the top is browned and bubbly. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese, add the garlic powder and bake for 5 minutes more. Serve warm.

Cut the tilapia fillet into halves and sprinkle with soy sauce and ginger. Arrange on a plate. Combine sesame oil, garlic, red pepper flakes and the remaining soy sauce in a small bowl. Pour over the tilapia. Microwave on high for 3 minutes. Meanwhile, trim the tough ends off the green onions and cut the cabbage into thin strips. In the remaining soy sauce, combine the cabbage and green onions. Cover and microwave on high for 2 minutes. Drain the cabbage and green onions and combine in a bowl with the tilapia. Sprinkle with scallions and sesame seeds. Season with pepper.

In a small bowl combine the sesame seeds, dark sesame oil, soy sauce, hot pepper sauce, and garlic. Reserve 3 tablespoons of the mixture for garnish. Cut the tofu crosswise into 4 slices, about 1/2-inch thick. In a nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the tofu slices and cook for 3 minutes on each side or until lightly browned and crisp on the edges. Add the reserved sesame mixture and spinach. Toss gently until heated through. Garnish with the remaining sesame mixture if desired.

Combine honey, soy sauce, mustard and lemon juice in a shallow bowl. Heat a grill pan or broiler over medium high heat. Place the tuna steaks in the honey mixture and turn to coat both sides. Place the tuna steaks in the broiler or grill pan for 2 minutes per side or until cooked through. Top with sesame seeds and sprinkle with horseradish before serving.

Peel away the outer layer of the celery ribs. Chop the celery into 1 inch pieces. Combine the mayonnaise and mustard in a bowl. Add the ham. Fold in the chopped celery and parsley. Add the wine vinegar and season with pepper. Serve the salad on a bed of celery.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl, combine pecans, parmesan cheese, garlic salt, and dried basil. In a small bowl, combine lemon juice with enough water to make a thin paste. With a sharp knife or a paring knife, cut about a half inch incision into each side of each breast. Spoon in the paste mixture, then spread a little of the nut mixture over each cut. Sew up each breast with a toothpick. Place the breasts in a single layer in a roasting pan or large baking dish. Drizzle with the olive oil. Roast for 45 minutes or until no longer pink inside. Sprinkle with more nut mixture during the last 15 minutes of baking. Serve hot or cold.

Cook egg noodles in boiling water until tender. Drain. Set aside. Heat oil in a wok or frying pan on high heat. Add prawns and stir-fry for a couple of minutes. Add garlic and stir-fry for a couple of minutes. Add cherry tomatoes and stir-fry for a couple of minutes. Add dry white wine and stir-fry for a couple of minutes. Add seasoning and stir-fry for a couple of minutes. Add cooked egg noodles and stir-fry for a minute or so. Add broccoli florets and stir-fry for a couple of minutes.

In a large skillet, brown ground turkey and onion until no longer pink. Stir in taco seasoning and 1/4 cup water. Bring to a boilcover and reduce heat to medium low. Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until liquid is almost gone. Stir in zucchini and corn and cook 5 to 7 minutes longer. Stir in tomatoes. Serve in bowls over rice. Garnish with cheese.
Bake cake according to package instructions. Cool completely. Frost with vanilla frosting. Using a small spoon, press cherry pie filling into the middle of the cake. Top with maraschino cherries.

Place chicken breasts in the crockpot and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add the broth and cook on high for 6 hours. Cut the breasts into bite sized pieces and set aside. In a saucepan melt butter. Add the soup and cook until heated. Stir in the cheese and milk. Remove the stuffing from the box and pour in the sauce. Mix well. Place in the crockpot. Turn crockpot to low and cook until heated. Remove chicken and stuffing from the crockpot. Serve together.

Peel and dice mango into 1/2-inch cubes. Peel tofu into 1/2 inch cubes. Set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce and pepper. Marinate tofu in soy mixture for 30 minutes to 1 hour or until firm tofu is firm but still retains its bite. Drain tofu and set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together fish sauce, lime juice, and mangoes until mangoes are coated. Set aside. Grill tofu until lightly browned on all sides. Serve tofu over mango slaw with Thai vinaigrette.
Combine first five ingredients in medium bowl. Mix well. Add remaining ingredients. Toss lightly. Chill. Serve on lettuce leaves.

In a medium bowl combine the garlic and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add the green beans and toss to coat. Add the vinegar and mustard and toss to combine. Set aside. In a medium saute pan over high heat, add the baby bella and saute until browned on all sides. Transfer to a plate. In a small bowl combine the green onions and parsley. Slice the baby bella thinly. Arrange the green bean salad on a platter. Garnish with the parsley mixture and the baby bella.

Bring apple juice to boil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add apple cubes. Reduce heat to medium. Cook until apple is tender. Mash apple with wooden spoon. Stir in green onions. Add curry powder. Set aside. Meanwhile, bring broth to boil in small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in couscous. Cover. Remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Mix apple mixture with couscous. Stir in chives. Season to taste with salt. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a large saute pan, over medium heat add the olive oil and saut the onions and garlic until lightly browned and tender. Add the mustard, sage, pepper and worcestershire sauce and saute until thickened. Place the chicken in a single layer in the pan. Pour the onion mixture over the chicken and season with salt. Roast for 45 minutes in the oven. While this is cooking, brown the sausages in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat until just browned on all sides. Add them on top of the chicken and roast for a further 30 minutes. Remove chicken from the oven and scatter over fresh sage leaves. Serve immediately with lemon wedges on the side for squeezing over.

Preheat oven to 450f. Combine hot sauce and margarine in a small bowl. Combine water, white vinegar and pepper in another small bowl. Place thighs in a single layer in a baking pan. Bake 45 minutes, or until juice runs clear when thighs are pierced with a fork. Meanwhile, combine blue cheese and 2 tablespoons hot sauce mixture in a small bowltoss to combine. Serve with thighs. Serve with blue cheese sauce.
Preheat oven to 425. Slice mushrooms. Lay out puff pastry. Brush with egg. Place mushrooms on pastry. Sprinkle gorgonzola on top. Bake at 425 for 10-15 minutes until pastry is crispy. Serve hot.

In a medium bowl combine the pudding mix and milk. Mix well until thickened. Add the coconut extract. Let cool to room temperature. Pour into a 9-inch pie crust. Chill in the refrigerator for a few hours or overnight. Garnish with whipped topping or a dollop of cool whip topping. Top with shredded coconut. Store in the refrigerator.

Brown the chicken in a large skillet. Remove the browned chicken. In the same skillet, add the mushrooms, garlic and cook until mushrooms are tender. Stir in the soup and wine. Return the chicken to the skillet and turn the heat off. Place a tablespoon of bread crumbs on each breast and sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. Serves 4.

Mix butter and both sugars together in the bowl of your electric mixer. Add egg and vanilla and beat until blended. Add flour and cornstarch and beat just until combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake in a 375 degree F. oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden. Let stand for 1 minute before removing from pans. Yields 30 cookies.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 9x13x2 inch pan. Combine sugar and eggs. Add carrots. Mix well. In a separate bowl sift together flour, salt, cocoa, baking powder. Add to carrot mixture. Stir until well mixed. Pour into greased pan. Bake for 30-45 minutes. Allow to cool for 10-15 minutes. Drizzle with glaze. Makes 12 servings.
Place roast in a crockpot. Add the water, onion, bay leaf, soy sauce and garlic powder. Cook on low for 8 hours. Remove the bay leaf and shred the roast. Serve on buns.

Melt butter and olive oil together in a large pot over medium high heat. Add green onions and cook until soft and translucent, about 2-3 minutes. Add rice and stir well. Add chicken stock and water and stir to combine. Add peas and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium low and cook covered for 20 minutes. Add lemons juice and zest and stir well to combine. Add parsley, salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium heat melt 2 TBS of butter. Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the parsley, bouillon cubes and boiling water. Bring to a boil. Add the raw rice. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed, about 30 minutes. Stir in the cranberries and serve.
Mix all together well. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes. You can add 1/4 cup of chopped walnuts to this recipe and a 1/2 cup of raisins as well. Yum!

Heat olive oil in skillet. Cook onion, garlic, and fresh thyme until onion is translucent. Add carrot and cook until soft. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, salt & pepper. Let simmer until thickened. This can be made with fresh tomatoes. Use 3 cups chopped tomatoes in place of the canned tomatoes.

Spritz aluminum foil with cooking spray. Place 1 layer of corn and 1 green pepper in the middle of each packet. Top with 1 chicken breast and drizzle with about 1 tbsp barbecue sauce. Fold the sides of the packet over the filling. Fold the ends over and seal. Bake until chicken is done. Remove from heat and serve.

In medium saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add shallots and ginger and cook until softened, about 4 minutes. Add chicken broth and lime juice and bring to boil. Stir in half-and-half and cayenne pepper, turn off heat and let cool to room temperature. Puree until smooth. Add avocado and pulse until mostly smooth and just slightly chunky. Stir in cilantro and lime slice and serve chilled or at room temperature with tortilla chips or crackers for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350 f. In a large bowl beat egg yolks until thick and lemon colored. Add cold water and stir. Add salt and sugar gradually beating until thick and lemon colored. Beat in lemon extract. Add flour sifted with cream of tartar and baking powder. Beat until smooth. Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. Fold into batter. Pour into ungreased tube pan. Bake for 35 minutes. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Unmold and cool completely on wire rack. Makes 10 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8-inch square baking dish. Mix together flour, oatmeal, butter, brown sugar and baking soda. Press into the bottom of the prepared dish. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool completely. Meanwhile, melt caramels in heavy whipping cream. Spread over cooled crust. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake for 5 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into 16 bars.

Soak rice flour and ground almonds together in milk for half an hour. Add sugar and evaporated milk. Boil. Add rose water and ground cardamom. Remove from heat. Add almonds and pistachios. Pour into a bowl and allow to cool. Serve chilled.

In a medium saucepan, combine oats, water, raisins, apricot, figs, sugar, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon and ground cardamom. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until boiling. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes or until thickened. Stir before serving. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.

Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan and cook over medium high heat for about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Makes about 3/4 cup. Serve with raw vegetables.

Cut zucchini into 1/4-inch dice and scallions into 1-inch lengths. Prepare the grill according to manufacturers directions. Place chicken on grid. Brush with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill chicken 3 to 4 minutes per side or until no longer pink. In medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Drizzle chicken with pesto and serve with zucchini mixture and tomato wedges. Serves 2.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 9 inch round cake pans. Sift the flour, brown sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt into a large bowl. In a separate bowl, stir together the water, vegetable oil, and vinegar. Combine the dry ingredients and the liquid ingredients in a large bowl. Beat at medium speed for about 1 minute. Fold in the chocolate chips. Divide the batter evenly among the two prepared pans. Bake for 35 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow the cakes to cool before icing.

Mix sugar, drink mix and 3 cups of water in small saucepan. Heat just to a boil. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Refrigerate until cold. Pour 1/3 into each glass. Add 1/4 of a cup of lemonade and 1 lime to each glass. Repeat until glasses are filled to top. Add ice cubes. Serve in tall glasses.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. In a large skillet or dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat. Cook onion, stirring occasionally for 5 minutes or until softened and beginning to turn golden. Add beer and stir to combine, scraping up any bits of onion on the bottom of the pan. Add brats and bring to a simmer. Transfer to oven and cook for 15 minutes or until heated through and beginning to brown on the outside. Serve in hot dog buns with mustard and desired toppings.

In a large heavy bottomed pan, fry spaghetti in oil. When spaghetti is browned, add garlic and pepper. Fry for another minute. Add 1 cup water. Bring to boil. Season with salt. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, fry eggs. Spoon spaghetti into 4 warmed bowls. Sprinkle with parmesan. Break an egg over each serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a shallow bowl combine the cinnamon and paprika. Sprinkle the inside of each of the four chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then place one in the flour mixture and turn to coat on all sides. Repeat with the remaining breasts. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic clove and cook for 1 minute, then add the sherry and lime juice. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 4 minutes or until the mixture is slightly thickened and reduced by half. Place the coated breasts in the skillet and cook for 2 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Remove the breasts to a platter and cover with foil to keep warm. Brush the pan with honey and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes or until thickened. Serve the breasts with the glaze spooned over the top.

In a large pot or dutch oven add 2 cups of water. Add in green onion and green pepper and cook on low for about 5 minutes until softened. Add in cabbage and celery and cook on low for about 2 minutes until softened. Add in tomatoes, onion soup mix and bouillon cube and cook on low for about 2 more minutes until well blended and hot. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve with crackers or bread.

In a bowl combine mayonnaise, vinegar, onion, celery seed, and seasoningsstir well. Stir in the shrimp and coleslawmix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Top with grape tomatoes before serving. Serve cold.

Heat 2 tbsp oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and ginger paste, cumin powder and garam masala. Add tomatoes and cook until thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in chickpeas and salt and cook until heated through, 5 more minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve with warm naan bread and rice.

Wash potatoes. Peel potatoes, slice in half lengthwise. Cut each half into 3 to 4 strips. Layer the strips in the bottom of a shallow casserole dish. Repeat this process until all potatoes are used. Cover potatoes with water. Add the onions, celery, green peppers, and bay leaves. Cook over medium heat for about 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Drain well. In a small mixing bowl combine the Velveeta cheese, Longhorn cheese, and 1 can of the soup. Blend well. Pour the mixture over the potatoes. Add the remaining can of soup. Mix well. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes at 350 degrees. Then uncover the dish. Bake for another 20 minutes until potatoes are bubbly.

Bake biscuits according to directions on box. Brown hamburger. Drain. Add sauce and oregano. Cook for 1-2 min. Spread on biscuits. Top with cheese and pineapple. Broil for a few min. or until cheese melts. Serve on biscuit.

Rinse beans and soak them overnight in several changes of cold water. The next day, drain and rinse the beans again and place in a pot with enough water to cover them by about an inch. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to a simmer and cook until tender - about two and a half to three hours. Meanwhile, peel potatoes and cut into small cubes. Boil in a pot of salted water until tender - about twenty minutes. Drain and set aside. Cut the celery into thin strips and slice the onion in half. Heat olive oil in a frying pan and saute celery and onion over medium heat until onion is translucent. Add beans and potatoes and cook over medium heat for three minutes or so. Turn off heat and serve hot or at room temperature. Serve with fresh bread.

In a medium sauce pan add beef, onion, carrot and zucchini. Cook until onion is tender. Drain. Add spaghetti sauce and cook for 10 minutes. Cook pasta according to package. Drain. In an 8x8x2 pan layer the cooked pasta with the beef mixture. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes.

Heat the olive oil in a sauté pan over medium-high heat. Season the pork chops on both sides with salt and pepper. Add the pork chops to the hot pan and cook until brown on the bottom side. Turn the chops over and add the onions to the pan. Cook for about one more minute. Deglaze the pan by adding the white wine and stirring well. Add the soup and the thyme and bring the mixture to a boil. Simmer for one minute. Add the apple slices, celery and chicken stock. Bring to a boil again. Cover the pan and place in the oven for about one hour. The chops are done when they are very tender and the sauce is slightly thickened. Serve over hot rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In large bowl, combine 1 cup butter with 2 cups granulated sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, 2 eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla. In medium bowl, whisk together 1 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon baking powder. Stir dry ingredients into wet ingredients until just combined. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon baking soda. Stir in 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake 9 to 11 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool 2 minutes on baking sheets before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Store tightly covered at room temperature or freeze. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Peel the potatoes, then cut into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Toss the potato wedges in the vegetable oil in a large bowl. Spread the potato wedges onto two baking sheets. Bake for 20-25 minutes, turning the potato wedges once halfway through baking. Remove the baking sheets from the oven. Sprinkle the potato wedges with the paprika. Bake the potato wedges for another 10-15 minutes or until they are golden brown. Serves 4.

Place the milk and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar has dissolved completely. Add the papaya slices to the milk mixture, and cook for 2 minutes. Place the milk mixture with the papaya into the blender or food processor. Add the cardamom and nutmeg. Blend until smooth, about 30 seconds. Pour the drink into glasses filled with ice cubes. Serve immediately.

Wash and halve green tomatoes and red bell pepper. Pack into sterilized canning jars and add onions and jalapeno. Pack in pickling salt and seal jars tightly. Set jars aside for a day or two. Drain and rinse jars and pack tomatoes and red bell peppers into jars and add onions and jalapenos. Add enough of the pickling solution and vinegar to fill each jar leaving a headspace of 1/2 inch at the top of each jar. Add mustard seeds and seal jars tightly. Process in boiling water bath for 15 minutes. Allow jars to cool and store them in a cool dry place.

In a large skillet or saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic, onion and saute for about 5 minutes. Add the spinach and cook for 10-15 minutes or until it is wilted and the liquid has evaporated. Add the tofu. Cook the tofu in the skillet for about 5 minutes. Add the chicken bouillon granules, salt and pepper. Mix well. Pour into a baking dish. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Serve warm. You may need to add more liquid.

Wash couscous under running water. Pour into a bowl and cover with water. Let sit for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse under running water. Pat dry with a towel. Toss with olive oil and vinegar. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Let stand 1 hour for flavors to marry. Toss again. Arrange basil leaves on a serving plate. Spoon couscous over the basil leaves. Top with mozzarella cheese and cherry tomatoes. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle with a pinch of salt and freshly ground black pepper.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the beans for 4 minutesadd the spring onions and cook until crisp-tender, about 1 minute longer. Drain the beans and cool them under running water. Drain the spring onions and cut them into thin stripsset aside. Heat the oil in a small saucepan over moderate heat. Add the garlic and red chile and cook until the garlic is softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in the white wine vinegar and simmer the mixture until it is reduced by half and syrupy, about 4 minutes longer. Season with salt and pepper and pour the dressing over the bean and spring onionstoss gently and transfer the salad to a serving bowl. Toss in the parsley. Serve at room temperature or cold. Serves 4 as a side dish.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. In a large bowl, stir together the egg substitute, butter, whole kernel corn, cream-style corn, corn muffin mix, yogurt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Spread the mixture in the prepared baking dish. Bake for 40 minutes or until set. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve warm.
To make the dressing, combine the sugar, mayonnaise, vinegar and salt to taste. Pour over the cabbage, carrots and onions. Chill. Stir before serving. Serves 10.

Heat ghee in a heavy dutch oven. Add onions and cook until soft. Add lamb and cook until browned. Add mixed spices. Add salt. Add 1/2 cup water. Add 1 1/2 cups of yogurt. Simmer until thickened. Add cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 cup of water. Simmer until thickened.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Peel the potatoes and cut into 1/4 inch slices. Soak the potatoes in cold water for 5 minutes. Drain the potatoes well. In a large bowl combine the flour, evaporated milk, egg white, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Whisk until smooth. Add the potatoes to the batter, stirring carefully. Heat 3 inches of vegetable oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until a deep-fry thermometer registers 350 degrees f. Working in batches, carefully add the potatoes to the hot oil. Fry until golden brown on both sides, about 5 minutes per batch. Transfer to a rack set over a baking sheet. Sprinkle the hot fries with 1 tablespoon salt and 1 tablespoon black pepper. Bake until the fries are crispy and dry. Serve immediately.

Grease 9x13 baking pan with butter. In a large bowl stir together the brown sugar and cinnamon. Add the pecans and toss to coat evenly. Place the bread dough on a floured work surface and roll out to about 1/2 inch thick. Using a pizza cutter or sharp knife cut into 12 even squares. Place a tablespoon or so of the pecan mixture in the center of each square and pull the four corners of the dough together over the nuts. Pinch the corners together and place into the baking pan seam side down. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until the tops are golden brown. Meanwhile in a small bowl combine the powdered sugar and milk and stir until smooth. Drizzle over the warm rolls and serve warm with extra powdered sugar for sprinkling if desired.

Preheat oven to 250f. In a small bowl, mix together smoked paprika, black pepper, cayenne, and dried thymesprinkle over pork butt. Add garlic powder and salt to taste. Wrap pork butt in foil and place in a baking pan or roasting pan. Roast for about 8 hours or until pork is tender when pierced with a fork. Add about ½ cup water to pan and cover tightly to help keep pork moist and tender. When pork is done remove it from oven and allow to rest for about 30 minutes before slicing to serve. Slice pork thinly and serve warm or at room temperature in buns.
Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl and whisk well until smooth. Freeze in a covered container overnight.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, carrots and celery. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the garlic, leek, rosemary and a pinch of salt and cook for 2 minutes. Add the lentils, tomato paste and stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the potato. Cook for another 10 minutes. Add the frankfurters. Cook for 5 minutes. Season with the remaining salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Slice the salmon into cutlets. Combine yogurt with cumin, coriander leaves, parsley and season to taste. Heat 1/2 tbs of the oil in a pan and cook the salmon for 3 minutes each side or until cooked through. Remove from pan and put in warm dish. Pour yogurt sauce over and serve.

Preheat oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas Mark 6. In a mixing bowl, beat the butter and syrup together with an electric mixer. Stir the flour in until it makes a soft dough. Knead lightly and roll out to 3mm thick. Cut out with a 5cm cutter. Place 2cm apart on baking trays. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden. Transfer to wire racks to cool. Dust with icing sugar. Makes 24 biscuits.

Place all the dip ingredients, except the herb, into a food processor and process until smooth. Add the herbs and process until well combined. Taste the dip, adjust the seasoning if necessary, then leave to stand for a few minutes. Serve with crudites.
In a medium bowl stir together all ingredients. Chill until serving time. Makes 1 cup.

Place carrot and cucumber in a bowl, season with salt and pepper. Cut the salmon into strips about one inch wide. Place a sheet of rice paper on a clean work surface. Add a little bit of water around the edges of the rice paper, about one inch away from the edge of the rice paper. Add the carrot/cucumber mixture and avocado. Top with salmon strips. Fold the bottom edge of the rice paper sheet up over the filling. Fold in the sides of the rice paper over the filling. Then fold the top over the filling to create a roll. Repeat until all the fillings have been used. Serve immediately with sweet chili sauce, lime juice and fresh coriander & mint leaves as garnish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place ribs in single layer in shallow baking dish. Combine brown sugar, catsup, soy sauce, dry mustard and chili saucemix well. Pour over ribs. Cover baking dish with foil. Bake 1 hour. In small saucepan, combine rum, worcestershire sauce, garlic and pepperbring to boil. Remove from heat. Pour over ribscover dish with foil. Bake 1 hour longer or until meat is fork-tender. Serve with cole slaw if desired.

Combine crackers, butter and sugar in a large bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until the mixture is crumbly. Add the vanilla and beat until smooth. Press mixture into a lightly greased 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the chocolate chips over the crust. Bake 8 minutes longer or until the crust is golden brown. Let cool completely. Cut into bars. Makes 15 bars.

In a small bowl combine honey and Splenda granular. Add soy sauce and stir. Dip wings in the mixture. Heat oil in a large skillet. Place wings in skillet. Add garlic. Stir over medium high heat until wings are brown. Add ketchup. Stir. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Place the pork chops in a shallow dish. In a small bowl combine the cloves, white wine, celery leaves, bay leaves, celery ribs and butter. Pour over the pork chops and refrigerate for 3 hours. Drain the chops, reserving the marinade. Heat the oven to 400. In an 11 by 14 inch baking dish, arrange the chops in one layer. Spoon the reserved marinade over the chops. Top with the apples. Dot with the butter. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with the brown sugar. Bake for 10 minutes longer. Sprinkle with the swiss cheese. Bake for 5 minutes more. Serve hot.

Peel pineapple and cut off ends of stem and top. Cut pineapple into 1/2 inch dice and place in a bowl. Peel and core mango and dice. Add to pineapple with red sweet bell pepper and cilantro. Stir in vinegar and jalapeno. Let stand 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate 1 hour, stirring once. Stir in lemon juice just before serving. Serve with tortilla chips or fresh vegetables.

Combine Bisquick, sugar, oats and butter in large bowl. Press mixture onto bottom of foil lined 11x15-inch pan. Spread with jam. Sprinkle with cake mix. Dot with butter. Bake at 375 degrees for 18-20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Cut into bars.
Cut avocados into pieces and put in a blender. Add sour cream and milk. Blend until smooth and creamy. Add the rest of the seasonings. Serve on a bed of lettuce with tomatoes and bacon.

Clean the polish sausage and cut into small pieces. In a heavy bottom pan melt the butter and add the onions. Saute until translucent. Increase the heat and add the flour and stir well for 1 minute. Add the water and tomato puree and stir well. Cook for 15 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Add the sugar and seasoning and cook for 3 more minutes. Add the polish sausage and cook for 1 more minute or until the sausage is fully cooked and heated through. Serve over hot rice and enjoy.
Crush snack cakes and set aside. Mix cream cheese, pudding and milk. Spread between cakes. Top with cool whip. Chill.

Melt the chocolate in the top of a double boiler. Remove from heat and stir in the peanut butter. Mix until smooth. Refrigerate for about 2 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the butter in small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave for 1 minute. Stir in the cream. Continue to microwave for 1 minute longer until melted. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat. Add the vanilla. Drop spoonfuls of the mixture onto wax paper. Place the nuts in one of the bowls. Roll the spoonfuls of the mixture in the nuts. Place the nuts in one of the bowls. Roll the spoonfuls of the mixture in the nuts. Refrigerate until the mixture is hardened.

Place potatoes in a medium saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Boil for 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender but not falling apart. Drain the potatoes in a colander. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher. Add the butter and seasonings. Continue mashing until the potatoes are creamy. Stir in the milk and cheese and mix well. Transfer to a greased 2-quart casserole. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley.

Heat oven to 220c/fan 200c/gas 7. Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper. Season chicken breasts with black pepper. Mix lemon juice with a little natural yoghurt to form a thin paste. Spread mixture over chicken breasts. Combine breadcrumbs with Parmesan cheese. Spoon mixture over chicken breasts. Bake for 25 mins. Serve with dukkah.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute onion and green pepper until crisp-tender. Add garlic and cook and stir for 30 seconds. Add tofu and stir-fry 1 to 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir in remaining ingredients. Serve with rice.

Combine orange juice, peanut butter, soy sauce, curry powder and garlic in small saucepan. Heat over low heat just until melted. Add chicken and toss to coat. Marinate in refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Heat grill to high. Thread chicken onto skewers alternating with bell pepper and onion. Grill on the preheated grill until done. Serve with cooked rice. Sprinkle with shredded coconut and golden raisins.

In a small saucepan combine sugar, cornstarch and salt. Stir in pineapple in syrup. Cook and stir until thick and bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice and prepared mustard. Spread over ham and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Wash potatoes well and boil in water until tender. Drain potatoes and place in greased baking dish. In skillet, brown ground beef over medium heat and add garlic powder and onion powder. Once browned, drain meat and pour into baking dish with potatoes and mix well. In a bowl combine gravy mix, milk, and melted butter and pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and bake for 30 minutes or until heated through.

Heat canola oil in wok over medium-high heat. Add onion and stir-fry until soft. Add garlic and stir-fry 30 seconds. Add gai choy and stir-fry 1 minute. Add fish sauce and stir-fry 1 minute. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until gai choy is tender. Add sugar and sesame oilstir well.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat and add onion. Cook for a minute or two until translucent. Add in chicken stock and cauliflower and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to a simmer for about 20 minutes until cauliflower is soft. Mash with a potato masher until desired consistency is reached. Add in milk and nutmeg and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in white cheddar cheese and serve warm.
