To prepare salad: Place beet in a small saucepan of cold water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and boil 20 minutes or until tender. Draincool slightly. Peel and cut into julienne strips. Whisk together the oil and vinegar. Place beet in a large bowl. Add oil mixture. Add garlic and nuts. Toss gently.

Place artichokes in a large pot of boiling water. Cook until tender. Drain. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute or until garlic is lightly browned. Remove garlic and set aside. Place artichokes in skillet. Cook 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add lemon juice and stir to coat. Add basil, garlic, pine nuts and salt. Toss well. Cook 1 minute longer. Serve warm.

Peel the ginger and cut into thin matchsticks. Cut the lemon into wedges. Place the sea bass steaks in a large bowl. Pour the olive oil over the steaks and toss to coat. Spread the steaks out evenly over two rimmed baking sheets. Sprinkle with the ginger and lemon wedges. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for about 25 minutes or until the fish is cooked through.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place tomatoes in a blender. Add remaining ingredients. Process until smooth. In a 13x9-inch glass baking dish, coat the bottom with pasta sauce. Arrange the chicken in a single layer. Top each piece of chicken with a tomato slice. Cover the dish with foil and bake for 10 minutes. Remove the foil, sprinkle with feta cheese, and bake for 10 minutes longer. Serve warm.

Place rice cakes in pot with water. Add beef shoulder and bring to boil. Simmer for 1 1/2 hours or until meat is tender. Add dashida and season to taste with salt. Sprinkle with sesame oil and garnish with green onions and sliced garlic.

In a heavy bottomed pot bring together the condensed milk, cocoa powder and butter. Mix well so that you get a smooth chocolate mixture. Add the vanilla essence, mix well once again. Cook on medium low heat until it thickens (about 30 minutes). Remove from heat. Let it cool down completely. Roll the mixture into balls. Place chocolate sprinkles on top of each ball. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Toss potatoes and garlic with oil and salt and pepper to taste and spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake potatoes until they start to turn golden brown and garlic is browned about 20 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in chipotle chili sauce and butter.

Saute the onion and mushrooms in 1 tablespoon margarine until onions are tender. Stir in the broth and cook until liquid has evaporated. Stir in the peas and rice. Bring to a boilreduce heat and cook for 10 minutes or until rice is tender. Melt the remaining 1 tablespoon margarine in a skillet over medium heat and stir in the rice mixture. Cook and stir until the mixture is heated through. Stir in the cheese until melted and serve immediately.

Mix together butterscotch chips and peanuts. Set aside. In large mixing bowl combine Rice Krispies and marshmallows. Heat together over medium heat butterscotch and peanuts. Add marshmallow mixture. Stir until well blended. Add chocolate chips and peanuts. Spread onto wax paper. Cool. Break apart. Store in air tight container. Makes 15-20 servings.

Beat cream cheese and marshmallow creme until smooth. Add eggs, beating well after each. Combine flour and water and stir into mixture. Pour into a greased 9 inch pie pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool and refrigerate.

In a large saucepan combine rutabaga and 2 quarts of water. Bring to a boil. Add the allspice, peppercorns and saltreturn to a boil, cover and reduce the heat to low. Cook until the rutabagas are tender, 25-30 minutes. Drain the rutabagas and reserve the cooking liquid. In a large bowl toss the rutabagas and carrots with the potatoes and the cinnamon. In a small saucepan combine the reserved cooking liquid and butterbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Pour the hot liquid over the potato mixture and toss to combine. Serves 6-8.

Soak beans overnight. Drain and rinse well. Put beans in a heavy pot with cold water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer slowly until tender, 1-2 hours. Drain beans and set aside. Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium heat. Stir in saffron and paprika and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in garlic and cook until golden. Add ham hocks and cook until browned, about 15 minutes. Stir in bacon and cook until crisp and browned, about 10 minutes. Stir in chorizo, blood sausage, onion and cook until onion is translucent, about 10 minutes more. Stir in beans and cook until beans are heated through, about 30 minutes more. Serve with crusty bread.

Place black eyed peas and corn in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and then reduce to simmer for 30 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold running water. Meanwhile, place avocados in a food processor and process until smooth. Add peas and corn. Process until smooth. Stir in onion, cilantro and tomatoes. Add vinegar, tabasco sauce and pepper. Refrigerate overnight to allow flavors to blend.

combine all the above except the raisins and oranges. Place in a saucepan and heat until the mixture thickens. Add the raisins and orange peel and simmer until the raisins plump up. Serve as a sauce with grilled steak or chicken.

Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Sprinkle chicken evenly with salt and pepper. Cook 3 minutes per side or until browned on both sides. Remove to a platecover with foil to keep warm. Add onion, green pepper and garlicsaut until tender. Add wine and stockbring to a boil over high heat. Stir in tomatoes, tomato sauce and oregano. Reduce heat to lowsimmer 10 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Return chicken to potstir in tortellini and basilcook 3 minutes or until tortellini is tender. Sprinkle with cheesecover. Let stand 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes 6 servings

Cut the sausage into about 20 slices and brown them in a large cast iron pan on medium heat for about 15 minutes or until cooked through and a little crispy on the outside. Slice the bread in half lengthwise and spread each slice of bread with mustard, mayonnaise and the worcestershire sauce. Lay the sausage slices on the bottom half of the bread and top with the dill pickle slices and the onion slices. Add the tomato slices on top and sprinkle with the parsley. Drizzle a little bit of the tabasco sauce on the tomato slices and serve immediately.

Cut each orange peel into 2 thin strips and each lemon peel into 3 thin strips. Peel and cut lime in half. Using vegetable oil cooking spray, spray grill rack. In small bowl, mix orange peels, lemon peels, lime peel and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Place on grill. Grill peels for 3 minutes or until charred and crisp. In small bowl, combine butter and 1 tablespoon water. Set aside. Spray corn with cooking spray. Grill corn for 3 minutes on each side or until charred. Serve corn with peel and butter mixture.

In a small bowl, combine lemon juice, mustard and 2 teaspoons of the breadcrumbs. Set aside. Combine green onion, remaining breadcrumbs, egg whites and parsley in another small bowl. Combine salmon, 1 tablespoon lemon juice mixture and 1 teaspoon green onion mixturegently mix well. Form into 8 equal-sized patties. Gently press each side of each patty into green onion mixture to coat. Coat each patty on both sides with lemon juice mixture. Heat oil over medium heat in a large nonstick skillet. Gently place patties into skillet. Fry for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until cooked through. Yields 4 servings.
In a skillet heat margarine over medium heat. Add green beans. Saut for 3 minutes. Add basil leaves. Continue saut for 3 more minutes. Sprinkle onion. Saut for 1-2 more minutes. Season with pepper.

Heat olive oil in a frying pan. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned. Add tomato and anchovy fillet and cook for 5 minutes. Add capers and olives. Add the basil leaves. Cook for a further minute or so. Cook spaghetti until al dente. Drain well and toss in the sauce. Garnish with basil leaves. Serves 4.

In large resealable plastic bag, combine all dressing ingredientsmix well. Refrigerate.In small bowl, toss chicken with chili powder and cuminset aside.Heat grill or broiler. On each tortilla, spread about 1/4 cup dressing to within 1 inch of sides. Top with lettuce and 1/2 chickentop with remaining tortillas.Place tortillas on grill or under broilergrill 2 minutes or until tortillas are heated through. Place 1 tortilla on each of 4 platestop with tomatoes, corn and remaining chicken. Sprinkle with cheese.Serve with remaining tortillas.

Grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans.In a large mixing bowl cream butter and crisco together until fluffy. Add sugar, cocoa and water. Mix well. Combine flour, eggs and vanilla. Add to butter mixture and mix until combined. Pour batter into pans. Bake at 350 degrees for about 35 minutes. Cool completely.Frost with chocolate frosting.
Juice the lemons, limes and oranges. Mix with the water in a pitcher. Add the sugar and stir until it's dissolved. Add ice cubes.

Preheat a gas grill to medium heat. Lightly spray both sides of each hot dog with cooking spray and wrap each hot dog in a slice of bacon and secure with a toothpick. Grill until bacon is crisp and cooked through, about 3 minutes per side. Remove from the grill and serve in a hot dog bun with sour cream and salsa.

In a large wok or skillet over high heat, stir fry the spinach and garlic until spinach wilts and garlic is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Add the white wine and cook until the wine is almost evaporated, about 30 seconds. Add the celery, mushrooms and rice and stir fry for 2 to 3 minutes until the rice is heated through and the vegetables are tender crisp. Stir in the scallions and soy sauce and cook until the vegetables are bright and the rice is heated through. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine curry paste with chicken stock. Stir in fish sauce. Bring to a boil. Add sugar and brown sugar. Reduce heat. Simmer 10 minutes. Add zucchini and sugar snap peas. Simmer 2 minutes. Add mushrooms. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Serve over rice. Garnish with bamboo shoots. Serve with lime.

Cut slices of bread in half lengthwise. Spread with butter. Sprinkle each slice of bread with half of each of the cheese, ham, bacon and turkey. Top with lettuce leaves. Place sandwiches on grill and cook until bread is toasted, about 3 to 4 minutes per side.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Slice sweet potatoes 1/4 inch thick. Place in a single layer in a lightly greased shallow baking pan. Drizzle with olive oil, then sprinkle with red chili pepper, garlic, gingerroot, salt and pepper. Roast until potatoes are tender and browned around edges, about 30 minutes. Whisk together balsamic vinegar and brown sugardrizzle over potatoes. Serve immediately.

Bake fish sticks in oven according to package instructions. While fish is baking, combine the other ingredients in a large bowl and stir well. Spread over fish and bake another 5 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Broil 2-5 minutes until cheese is melted.
Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add zucchini and squashstir fry until tender. Stir in red bell peppercook 2 minutes. Sprinkle with Italian seasoning. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Wash and dry pickling cucumbers. In a large bowl combine cucumbers, onion and spices. Mix well. In a separate bowl combine vinegar and sugar. Bring to a boil. Pour mixture over cucumber mixture. Toss well. Pack into hot sterilized jars. Process in a boiling water bath for 15 minutes. Makes about 6 pints.

Combine milk and chocolate pudding mix. Beat with electric mixer 2 minutes or until thickened. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon into 4 individual glasses or 1 large glass bowl. Top with brownie cubes. Arrange raspberries on top of brownie. Garnish with mint sprigs.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile in a medium saucepan, add broccoli florets, garlic cloves and butter. Stir until broccoli is tender crisp. Add pasta and sauce. Toss well. Top with parmesan.

Heat oven to 375f. In 9-inch square baking pan combine all ingredients except brown sugar. Spread evenly in pan. In small bowl mix together sugar and enough water to dissolve sugar. Pour evenly over bean mixture in baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until heated through and brown sugar is melted. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine crisco and brown sugar. Beat until well blended. Beat in egg and vanilla. Stir in flour and baking soda. Stir in milk. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 for 12-14 minutes or until done. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 3 dozen.

In a medium sized bowl mix wine, soy sauce and tabasco sauce. Add onion powder, garlic powder, sugar, pepper, non-iodized salt and mix thoroughly. Marinate salmon fillets in refrigerator 4-8 hours in mixture. To make salad, cut up 2 tomatoes, 2 celery ribs, 1 green onion and 2 carrots. Toss in salad bowl with 1/2 cup salad dressing. Slice salmon fillets 1/2 inch thick and saute in frying pan 2 minutes on each side with 1 tbsp olive oil per fillet. Serve salad on salmon.

Prepare crust by adding flour and baking powder into melted margarine. Add milk and mix until soft dough forms. Wrap and chill for 30 mins. Preheat oven to 350f. Roll out dough on floured surface and fit into a 9-in pie plate. Bake for 10 mins until set and edges are lightly browned. Beat sweetened condensed milk and custard powder until thickened. Stir in eggs and vanilla. Pour filling into crust. Bake for 1 hour or until edges are lightly browned and center is firm to touch. Cool completely before cutting into wedges.

Cut the liver into small pieces. Fry with the onion. Add the butter and the bread crumbs. Beat the eggs and mix with the flour and seasoning. Add to the liver and mix well. Leave to cool. Knead well until the mixture is smooth. Form the liver into meatballs and fry them briefly in boiling water. Serve with a thick brown gravy.

Season both sides of the breasts with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat until it shimmers. Add the breasts and cook for 5 minutes. Turn them over and cook for an additional 5 minutes or until they are cooked through. Remove the breasts to a platter. Add the garlic to the skillet and stir for 20 seconds. Stir in the stock. Return the breasts to the skillet. Stir in the spinach. Cook for 1 minute. Add the coconut milk. Bring to a boil. Add the parsley. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400-degrees f. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in breadcrumbs. Stir occasionally until butter is absorbed. Remove from heat. Add oysters and celery seed. Season with salt and pepper. Spray a 2-quart casserole dish with cooking spray. Pour in oysters. In a bowl beat the cream until thick. Spoon over the oysters. Arrange the scallops on top of the cream. Bake for 10 minutes or until the scallops are just opaque. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 300F. Butter six 6-ounce ramekins. Combine chocolate and butter in a double boiler over hot but not boiling water. Stir constantly until chocolate has melted and mixture is smooth. Remove from heat and cool for 5 minutes. Add the eggs one at a time and whisk well after each addition. Add the whisky and beat until smooth. Fold in the heavy cream and mix until well combined. Divide the mixture evenly among the ramekins. Bake until the center is just set, about 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool to room temperature. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Whisk the heavy cream in a medium bowl until it forms soft peaks. Gently fold the whipped cream into the chilled mousse. Top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream and a few grated orange rind. Dust with a little bit of powdered sugar. Serve immediately.

Mix pork, salt, fennel seeds and black pepper together in a medium bowl. Add sugar and water and mix well. Divide mixture into four 1-1/2 pound portions. Shape each portion into 6-inch sausage links and place in a shallow baking dish. Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 days. Cook sausages in boiling water for 6 to 8 minutes or until done. Drain and serve. Makes 16 sausages.

Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the cabbage, carrots, garlic, ginger and scallions. Cook for 5-6 minutes or until the cabbage is tender-crisp, stirring occasionally. In another bowl, combine the plum sauce, vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil and cornstarch. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixturetoss well to coat. Serve the salad over cooked rice sprinkled with chopped cilantro leaves.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Add the venison steak and marinate for at least an hour in the refrigerator. Remove the steak from the marinade and grill to desired doneness.

Place broccoli in a microwave-safe bowl and cover with water. Microwave for 2 to 2 1/2 minutes or until broccoli is tender. Drain and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the mustard and the olive oil. Mix well. Add vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss the broccoli with the mustard mixture and serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.

Heat bacon in a Dutch oven over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacondrain on paper towels. Drain off all but 2 tbsp drippingsdiscard drippings. Add onionsaute until soft. Add garlicsaute 1 minute longer. Add brothbring to a boil. Add chickensimmer 5 minutes. Add potatoessimmer 5 minutes longer. Add beansbring to a boil. Reduce heatcoversimmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in bacon. Place a dollop of stew in each of 4 bowls. Top with arugula and drizzle with vinaigrette. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Sift dry ingredients together in a bowl. Add arrowroot powder (and optional cinnamon). Stir in water. Knead into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap. Let rest at room temperature 30 minutes. Roll out between 2 sheets of parchment paper into a 9-inch pie dish. Bake at 350F for 10-12 minutes. Cool in pan on wire rack. Makes 1 9-inch pie crust.
Mash avocados. Add rest of ingredients and mix. Serve with tortilla chips.

Saute garlic in oil until it is golden brown but not brown. Add the crushed tomatoes and the basil and cook for a few minutes longer. Drain the spaghetti and add it to the sauce and toss well. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a heavy skillet, saute parsnips in butter until tender. In a small bowl combine the water and sugarmix well. Add parsnip mixture to the sugar mixture in the skilletstir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Serve immediately. Serves 4 to 6.

Cut chicken into finger shapes. Set aside. Mix together sour cream and crackers. Form fingers into balls with mixture. Roll fingers in cracker mixture. Melt butter in frying pan. Place fingers in pan. Cook about 5 minutes or until done. Serve with ranch dressing.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cook the beef with the onions and garlic in a large skillet over medium heat until beef is brown. Add oregano, basil, and salt. Stir until blended. Add tomatoes with their liquidheat through. Drain pastastir into beef mixture. Top with Parmesan. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 F (200 C). Cut 2 slices of bread into 1-inch cubes. Place in a greased baking pan. Combine butter and garlic in a small saucepan. Cook over low heat until butter melts. Pour mixture over cubes of bread. Sprinkle with cajun seasoning, parmesan cheese and salt and pepper to taste. Bake for about 15 minutes or until crisp and golden. Makes 1/2 cup.

Wash Savoy cabbage leaves in cold water. Bring chicken broth to boil in saucepan. Cut Savoy cabbage into thin strips. Heat 4 tablespoons butter in medium sized skillet. Saut onions in butter. Add Savoy cabbage. Season with salt. Cover. Stir occasionally. When cabbage is tender (about 40 minutes), stir in rice. Add wine. Bring to boil. Add 1 cup broth. Reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender. Stir in remaining broth. Stir until rice is creamy. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining butter. Stir in camembert cheese. Season with pepper. Garnish with fresh dill. Serves 4.

Place chicken in large roasting pan. Rub with mixture of 1/2 tsp. salt and 1/4 tsp. pepper. Cover pan with foil. Bake for 1 1/2 hours. Remove chicken from pan. Place pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add remaining 1/2 tsp. salt and 1/4 tsp. pepper. Cook until onion is soft. Stir in remaining ingredients. Place chicken in pan and heat thoroughly.

In a large bowl combine hamburger meat with the canned soups. Heat oil in large frying pan on medium heat. Add hamburger mixture. Stir until well blended. Add rotel. Cook over medium heat until well blended. Remove from heat. Add doritos and mix thoroughly. Spray a 9 by 13 casserole dish with cooking spray. Pour mixture into dish. Top with green onions and mexican cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve with lettuce and tomato slices.

In large saucepan combine oil and onionsaute until tender. Stir in rice and vermicellicook for 3 minutes. Add stock and waterbring to a boilreduce heatcover and cook for 10 minutes. Remove bay leafadd pepper and cheesemix well. Serve with green salad.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large saute pan over medium heat, melt 3 tablespoons butter until foamy. Add jalapeno, corn kernels and onionstir occasionally until jalapeno is softened. Remove from heat and set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, bring 6 cups water to a boil. Stir in gritscook until grits are tender and water is absorbed, about 10 minutes. Stir in 3 tablespoons butter, thyme and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Stir in corn-jalapeno mixture. Spread mixture evenly in a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining tablespoon butter and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Bake until top is golden, about 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Pre-heat the grill. Lightly grease the grill tray. Bring a small pan of water to the boil. Cook the noodles in the boiling water until tender. Drain. Transfer to a large bowl. Add the egg and beaten together until well mixed. Add the flour and beat until smooth. Add the milk and beat until combined. Season with salt and pepper. Add the spring onion. Gently fold through. Heat a little oil in a large non-stick frying pan. Add 2 heaped tablespoons of the mixture to the pan and flatten with a spoon or spatula until a thin pancake is formed. Cook for 2 minutes on each side. Transfer to a plate lined with kitchen paper to drain. Repeat with the remaining mixture until all the mixture has been used up. Arrange the cakes on the grill tray. Sprinkle with the cheese. Cook for 3 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the cakes are heated through. Cool for a few minutes before serving with a fresh tomato and basil salsa.

Preheat grill to medium-high. Pound chicken breasts to 1/2-inch thickness between 2 sheets of plastic wrap, with smooth side down. In a small bowl combine scallion, garlic, honey, sherry and gingerset aside. Brush chicken on both sides with soy saucesprinkle with cornstarch. Grill chicken for 4 minutes on each side. Brush chicken with honey mixturecontinue grilling 4 to 6 minutes more, until chicken is no longer pink in center and juices run clear when chicken is pierced. Serves 4.

Combine milk and sugar in medium saucepan. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Cover and boil for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in rice. Cover and let stand 10 minutes. Stir in egg yolks. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Stirring constantly with wooden spoon remove from heat. Add butter and stir until butter is melted and mixture is thick. Stir in cinnamon and vanilla. Chill for 2 hours. Spoon into bowls. Garnish with golden raisins and cinnamon.

Prepare crust: in a 9 inch pie pan, combine bread cubes and milk. Microwave on high for 2 minutes or until milk is absorbed. Let cool 5 minutes. Spread bread crumb mixture in pie pan. Prepare filling: In a large skillet over medium high heat, cook sausage and bacon until browned and crumbled. Drain and set aside. In same skillet, beat eggs and milk with salt and pepper until well blended. Add sausage and bacon mixture, cheddar cheese, and Worcestershire saucestir to combine. Pour mixture over crumb mixture in pie pan. Bake 40 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool 5 minutes before slicing.

Cook rice according to package directions. In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and onion. Cook until onion is translucent. Add rice, soy sauce, eggs, ham and teriyaki sauce. Stir well. Add the peas. Cook until rice is heated through. Serve.

In a large pot saute carrots, celery and onion in butter for 10 minutes. Add potatoes and saute for 10 minutes more. Pour in evaporated milk and water. Cook for 10 minutes more. Pour in mushroom and celery soup and heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Add all ingredients to pan over low heat. Stir frequently until chocolate is melted. Remove from heat. Stir in half-and-half until well blended. Serve in mugs. Top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with nutmeg.

Cut zucchini into strips about 3/4 inch thick. Heat oil in fry pan over medium heat. Add zucchini and onion. Saut until tender. Add garlic, beating constantly. Add eggs. Continue to stir until eggs are set. Add lemon juice and dry oregano. Stir well. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve hot with toasted bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a food processor, combine almond flour, cocoa powder and arrowroot. Pulse until smooth and combined. Add coffee and sea salt. Blend to mix. Add baking soda and agave nectar and blend. Add dark chocolate and blend until just combined. Spoon batter onto prepared baking sheets. Bake 14 to 16 minutes. Allow to cool 5 minutes. Remove biscotti from baking sheets and cut into 1/2-inch slices with a serrated knife. Place biscotti slices on prepared baking sheets. Bake 10 to 12 minutes. Turn biscotti over and bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 10 minutes. Store biscotti in an airtight container.

Prepare the cheese by crumbling it. In a large bowl, combine the cheese, cilantro, onion and radishes. Toss gently. Divide the mixture among four plates. Top each plate with a few tomato slices and a few pickled jalapeno slices. Sprinkle with Kosher salt. Drizzle each plate with the olive oil and cider vinegar. Serve immediately.

Place bay scallops on a broiler pan and drizzle with butter and olive oil. Sprinkle with lemon pepper and garlic powder and seafood seasoning to taste. Broil about 3 inches from heat until the scallops are opaque and the tops are light brown, about 5 to 6 minutes. Sprinkle with lemon juice and parmesan cheese and serve.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. When foam subsides, add broccoli and cook for about 10 minutes or until tender crisp. Stir occasionally. Add fresh gingerroot, orange peel and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for another 2 minutes. Serve over rice.
Bring water to boil and add ramen noodles. Cook until tender, about 6-7 minutes. Drain, and add stir fry vegetables, crabmeat and marinade to noodles. Serve and enjoy.

1. Bake and cool miniature graham cracker pie crusts according to package directions. 2. In small saucepan, combine yogurt, cottage cheese and vanilla over medium heat until blendedcool completely. 3. Beat egg white and salt until stiff peaks formgently fold into yogurt mixture. 4. Fill miniature pie crusts evenly with yogurt mixture. Cover and refrigerate for several hours or until set. 5. To decorate, place about 1 tablespoon strawberry spread on top of each tartspread to edges of crustgarnish each tart with 1 strawberry half. Makes 24 servings..

Melt butter in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add shallots and cook for 2 minutes or until softened, stirring frequently. Add garlic and cook for an additional minute or until fragrant, stirring frequently. Add lemon juice, vermouth, and white wine to pan, increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Add shrimpcook for 2 to 3 minutes or until pink and opaque. Add pasta to skillettoss to combine. Remove from heatstir in tomatoessprinkle with chives. Serve immediately with lemon wedges on the side.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Melt butter in 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in flour and cook 2 minutes or until bubbly and golden. Add milk, stirring constantlybring to a boil. Reduce heatcook and stir 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in cheese until melted. Stir in asparagus and ham. Spoon into 8-inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake 20 minutes or until golden.
Place all ingredients except parmesan cheese into crock pot. Cook on high for 6 hours or low for 8 hours. Serve with parmesan cheese sprinkled over the top.

To make the butter. In a small saucepan heat the butter over medium heat until melted. Add the garlic and thyme and cook, stirring until fragrant and slightly browned. Remove from the heat and stir in the sea salt and pepper.To make the grilled garlic bread. Slice the rolls horizontally about half way through. Lightly butter both sides of the rolls and place on a grill over medium heat. Spread the top of the roll with a generous amount of thyme butter and sprinkle with sea salt. Grill until the top is nicely browned and the bread is crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Serve immediately.

Wash and scrub potatoes, do not peel them. Chop up bacon into small pieces. Boil potatoes in salted water until fork tender, drain water off and let sit until cool enough to handle. Cut potatoes into smaller cubes and place in a large bowl. Mash potatoes with a potato masher until broken up in bits. Add chopped bacon, sour cream and chopped green onions. Season with salt and pepper, as much as you like. Transfer mixture into a casserole dish or pan and sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake in preheated oven until cheese is melted and top is golden brown, about 15-20 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

Season pork chops generously on both sides with salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add pork chops and sear until golden brown. Transfer pork chops to a baking pan and continue to cook in the oven for 15 minutes. Combine water, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce and lemon juice in a small saucepan and heat over medium high heat until bubbly. Remove pork chops from oven and pour over sauce. Cook in oven for an additional 10 minutes. While chops are baking, in another skillet over medium high heat cook apples in butter until soft. Remove from heat. Serve chops topped with apples.

Roll out bread dough to about 1/4 in thickness. Spread with spaghetti sauce and top with mozzarella cheese. Top cheese with ham, salami, mushrooms and pepperoni. Sprinkle with italian seasoning. Roll up dough like a jelly roll and place seam side down in 9x13 pan. Cover with melted butter. Bake at 350 degrees about 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with salad or garlic bread.

Melt butter in large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add pumpkin to pan and cook until it starts to brown. Add bacon bits, garlic clove, salt and pepper to taste. Add green onions and sprinkle with parsley to garnish.

Combine brown sugar and white sugar in small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in butter until melted and blended. Drain bread dough and spread with mixture of sugars and butter. Roll up and place seam side down in baking pan. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Drizzle with powdered sugar. Serve warm with whipping cream if desired.

Crush the cookies in a food processor. Add cream cheese and butter. Mix well and press into a pie pan. Chill. Beat pudding mix and milk in a bowl until thick. Spread over crust. Fold in cool whip and top with crushed cookies. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a sauce pan. Remove from heat. Whisk in milk, then egg yolks, then gradually add the flour. Whisk in vanilla. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy then gradually add the sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold the beaten egg whites into the pancake batter. Pour the mixture evenly into 4-6 greased custard cups or ramekins. Bake at 375 degrees Fahrenheit for 20-22 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve warm with butter and maple syrup.

Cook potatoes in salted boiling water until tender, about 25 minutes. Drain and transfer potatoes to a large mixing bowl. Add cream cheese and milk and mash with a potato masher or hand mixer until smooth. Stir in chives and season with salt and pepper. Serve with steak or roasted chicken or use as a side dish for dinner.

Mix together yellow cake mix and crushed pecans, then press into a 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake at 350f for 10 minutes and let cool completely. Mix cream cheese and powdered sugar until well blended. Beat in eggs one at a time, then mix in crushed pineapple in syrup. Spread mixture over cooled crust. Refrigerate for 4-8 hours and cut into squares. Melt butter and add pecans and brown sugar and bake until golden brown. Cool completely and crumble over the cheesecake. Serve and enjoy.

In a large bowl, toss the carrots with the oil, salt and cumin seeds. Spray a large baking sheet with the spray. Spread the carrots evenly over the sheet. Bake in the middle of the oven for 1 hour or until the carrots are tender when pierced with a fork. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Heat butter in skillet. Add flour and brown. Slowly add milk. Bring to boil and thicken. Add mashed potatoes. Add hard boiled egg and bacon. Salt and pepper to taste. Add parsley. Add cheese and blend. Spread in buttered pie shell. Bake 1 hour at 350 degrees f. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Sift together the cornmeal, flour, and soda together in a large bowl. Stir in the shortening, and mix until crumbly. In a medium bowl, combine the buttermilk and egg. Mix the dry ingredients into the buttermilk mixture until well-blended. Pour into the prepared pan, and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Check with a toothpick for doneness, if it comes out clean remove from oven. Cool for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.

Brown steak in oil in large skillet on medium-high heat for about 2 minutes per side or until browned on all sides. Remove steak from skillet and set aside. In same skillet, add soup, water and onion soup mix and mix well. Cook on medium heat for about 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and sauce thickens. Add sour cream and heat through and cook for 2 minutes or until heated through. Serve over hot cooked noodles and sprinkle with paprika - optional - or parsley - optional.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Brown pork chops on each side. Add potatoes. Cook, stirring frequently until potatoes are heated through. Add onion and diced tomatoes. Cook until heated through. Serve with tortillas.

Peel and dice avocado. Add to a food processor with lime juice and zest, cilantro and salt to taste. Process until smooth. Add more lime juice if needed. Add sour cream and process until incorporated. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and/or pepper to taste. Serve with chili, onions and parsley on top.

Cook corn in boiling salted water until tender. Drain well. Combine corn, remaining vegetables and remaining ingredients in medium bowl. Let stand at room temperature 30 minutes to blend flavors. Taste and adjust seasonings with more salt if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a bowl, mix together the brown sugar, garlic powder, ginger, soy sauce, bourbon, ketchup. Place the wings in a shallow pan and coat each wing with a generous amount of the sauce. Cover the wings with a sheet of foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil, flip the wings over so each side is coated with sauce and continue cooking for another 15 minutes.

Preheat broiler. Place salmon on a broil pan or foil-lined baking sheet. Mix soy sauce with bay leaf and thyme sprig. Brush salmon with the mixture. Broil 4 inches from heat for 6 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove from oven. Combine mustard and dill. Spoon sauce over fish. Serve immediately.

Beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth and creamy. Add vanilla and mix in eggs. Pour into prepared graham cracker crust and bake for 1 hour at 325 degrees or until lightly browned and firm in center. Cool and chill before serving.

Sift flour with baking powder and sugar. In a separate bowl beat egg with milk. Add oil and honey. Slowly add the dry mixture to the wet mixture. Make pancakes. Put ice cream in a bowl and crush with a fork. Add nuts and mix. Put ice cream mixture on top of pancake. Roll up. Serve with honey or syrup.

Preheat oven to 350. Prepare bacon as directed on package. Cut each slice into 8 strips. Mix together the pineapple and french dressing. Spoon pineapple mixture into center of bacon strips. Wrap strips around pineapple mixture. Secure with a toothpick. Place wrapped strips on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until bacon is crisp.

Lightly pound out chicken breasts to flatten them. Dip in eggs then coat in breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until cooked through. Slice into 1/2 inch slices. Place a slice on a slice of french bread and top with barbecue sauce and mozzarella cheese. Grill in a toaster oven until cheese is melted.

Mix potatoes, cream cheese and onions in a large bowl with a wire whisk or wooden spoon until combined. Add eggs, milk and flourbeat until smooth. Spread evenly in a greased 13x9x2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes or until set. Top with french-fried onions. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting.

Combine mayonnaise, mozzarella cheese and herbs in a medium bowl and blend well. Slice the baguette into 12 to 16 pieces and toast under broiler until lightly browned on both sides. Spread mozzarella cheese mixture on toast and top with tomato slices and sprinkle with basil and pepper.

Place biscuits and pecan nuts into bowl. Crush biscuits until fine. Melt butter. Add molasses and chocolate. Pour over biscuits. Stir in cherries and almonds. Turn into greased 20cm square cake tin and press down. Cover and chill for 4 hours. For the icing combine cocoa and icing sugar. Spread over cake. Decorate with cherries and almonds.

In a large saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch, water and corn syrup. Stir until smooth. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add butter one piece at a time, stirring until smooth. Add rum. Stir in vanilla. Serve hot or cold.

In a small bowl combine graham cracker crumbs, icing sugar and butter. Press into the bottom of an 11x7 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. In a medium bowl stir together condensed milk and crushed pineapple. Spread over crust. Sprinkle with coconut and almonds. Bake for 15 minutes longer. Cool for 1 hour. Cut into 12 bars. Sprinkle with white chocolate chips.

Peel and slice pineapple and grapefruit into slices and reserve the juice in a separate bowl. Squeeze the juice from the limes and oranges and add to the bowl of juice. Cut the lime and orange into slices and reserve for garnish later. Add the pineapple and grapefruit slices into the bowl and mix well. Add the strawberry and raspberry into the bowl and mix well. Add 1/4 cup of icing sugar and mix well. Refrigerate and serve chilled.

Heat 1/4 cup oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add parsley and garlic and cook for about a minute. Add lime juice and season to taste. Divide halloumi into eight and flatten each piece out between two sheets of plastic wrap and press into a disc about half an inch thick. Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan over medium heat and fry halloumi until golden and crisp on both sides, about a minute or so. Drain on paper towel and serve at once with lime wedges and parsley sprigs.

Preheat grill to 375 degrees. Spray chicken thighs with cooking spray. Mix all ingredients in a bowl and coat each piece of chicken with it. Place on grill and cook until juices run clear and meat is done. Let sit 5 minutes before serving.

Cream shortening and sugars. Beat until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix until smooth. Stir in white chocolate chips and flour. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Bake at 350 for 12-14 minutes. Cool. Store in tightly covered container. Makes 100 cookies.

Melt butter and saute garlic and spinach until spinach is wilted and garlic is lightly golden. Season with nutmeg and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in flour and broth. Cook until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Remove from heat and stir in half-and-half.

Cut potatoes in 1/8 inch slices and place in 2 qt casserole dish. In a small bowl combine sour cream, soup and cheese. Pour over potatoes and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until potatoes are tender. In a small skillet, melt butter over low heat. Add onions and saute until tender. Stir in corn flakes and remove from heat. Sprinkle over potatoes. Serves 8-10.
Saute leek and carrots in chicken stock with a little water for 20 minutes. Add rutabagas and saute for another 20 minutes. Add bratwursts and simmer for another hour.

Bring the beans and the water to a boil. Turn down the heat and simmer until tender. Drain the beans and return them to the pot. Add the lemon juice and butter. Cook over low heat until the butter is melted. Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the lemon rind and fresh parsley. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper liners. In medium bowl stir together eggs and butter until well blended. Add broccoli and stir well to combine. In another large bowl stir together muffin mix and milk until well combined. Gently stir broccoli mixture into batter just until combined. Spoon batter into prepared cups to about 2/3 full. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until muffins are golden brown and toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to serve.

Heat oven to 375 F. Grease bottom only of a 9-inch square baking pan with butter. In a large bowl combine sugar and butter. Beat until light and fluffy. Beat in egg. Add milk and mix thoroughly. Sift together flour and baking powderadd to mixture. Add saltmix thoroughly. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool thoroughly. Combine brown sugar and cornstarchstir into milk. Bring to a boilcook and stir until thickened and clear. Add blueberriescook and stir until blueberries are coated with sauce. Spoon onto cakespread to edges. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until sauce is bubbly. Cool on a wire rack. Serve warm or chilled.

Pick over dandelion greens for grit and slime. Wash and chop greens into small pieces. Heat butter in a heavy saucepan and saute onion and garlic for 1 minute. Add flageolet beans and stir to coat them in the butter. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add carrots and stir. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Add greens and cook uncovered for 10 minutes more. Stir in the thyme and savory and cook for another 5 minutes. Taste and add salt and pepper. Serve sprinkled with dandelion greens.

Melt butter in a saut pan over med-high heat. Add celery and saute for about 5 minutes. Add beef. Break up with spoon. Cook until no longer red. Drain fat. Add au jus mix. Stir well. Add bread crumbs. Stir well. Shape into 4 patties. Grill on high for about 4 minutes on each side. Place in buns with lettuce, tomato, and onion. Serve with french fries.

Bring the milk and butter to boil over medium heat. Add the egg whites and cook, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens and comes to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in the salt. Cool to room temperature. Mix the vanilla and both sugars into the egg white mixture. Line an 8 inch square pan with wax paper. Spread the cooled mixture into the bottom of the pan and refrigerate until firm. Preheat oven to 325f. Line another 8 inch pan with wax paper and place it on top of the one with the firm mixture in it. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool completely. Spread the chocolate filling over the top. Sprinkle with the pecans. Cover and refrigerate.

Place chicken in bottom of slow cooker. Combine onion soup mix and garlic salt. Sprinkle over the chicken. Pour water over all. Cover and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours. Stir occasionally. Remove from slow cooker. Skim fat from surface of liquid. Pour dressing over chicken. Serve on hamburger buns. Makes 8 servings.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In large bowl, mix cake mix and butter until crumbly. Press onto bottom of ungreased 13x9-inch pan. Bake for 12 minutes or until set. Cool on wire rack. In small bowl, mix frosting and coconut until blendedspread over crust. In small bowl, mix nuts and cocoa until blendedsprinkle over frosting. Cool completely (about 2 hours). Cut into bars. Store in refrigerator. Makes about 2 dozen bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare cake mix as directed on the box, except replace 1 cup of the cake mix with the dry cake mix and 1 cup of the butter mixture for 1 cup of the oil called for in the mix directions. Bake as directed.

Mix together the first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Add the milk and beat until smooth. Drop by spoonfuls into a greased 9x13 baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.

Combine soy sauce, vinegar and honey in a small bowl. Stir well and set aside. In a small bowl, combine ginger and scallion. Stir well. On a lightly greased broiler pan, broil salmon for 2 minutes on each side. Transfer to serving platter and drizzle the ginger-scallion mixture over the top. Drizzle the soy mixture over the top. Garnish the top of the salmon fillets with sesame seeds and serve.

Bring 3 cups of salted water to boil in large pot over high heat. Gradually stir in grits. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring constantly, until grits are thick and tender, about 30 minutes. Stir in half-and-half and butter. Cook over medium-low heat until grits are creamy and soupy. Season with salt. Sprinkle each serving with 1/4 cup of cheese and a few green onions. Serve hot.

Mix together liver with bacon and breadcrumbs until well blended. Shape into small patties about 1 inch thick. Roll in grated parmesan cheese. Place patties in a single layer in a baking dish. Bake 400 for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Combine soup, mayo and cheese. Add chicken. Mix well. Spread in 9x13 inch pan. Spread 3/4 cup chips over top. Combine remaining 3/4 cup chips with almonds and mix. Sprinkle over top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Melt butter in a saucepan and add onions. Stir until onions are clear and then add the beef bouillon. Cook for about 1 hour over low heat. Add salt and pepper. Add worcestershire sauce and heat for another 1/2 hour. Remove from heat. Cut the french bread into cubes. Add the cubes of bread to the soup. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees until the crust on the bread is brown. Serve hot.

Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper or waxed paper. In a large bowl combine graham crackers and butter. Use a rolling pin to crush crackers into fine crumbs. Add brown sugar, almonds and mix well. Press mixture onto bottom of prepared cookie sheet using a buttered spatula or a spoon. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely before cutting into desired sized pieces. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for several weeks or freeze for up to 6 months. Makes about 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheet or line with parchment paper. Combine walnuts, dates, egg, and sugar together in a large bowl. Stir until well mixed. Roll mixture into 1 inch balls and place onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 8 minutes in the preheated oven, or until cookies are lightly browned. Remove from oven and immediately press a walnut half into center of each cookie. Melt chocolate chips according to package directions, or melt chocolate with shortening until smooth. Dip cookies into melted chocolate until fully coated. Place on wax paper to set for 1 hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. Slice cinnamon-swirl bread into 1/2-inch cubes (about 4 cups). Spread cubes evenly over bottom of prepared dish. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, whisk together eggs, egg yolks, sugar, milk and half-and-half until smooth. Pour custard over bread cubessprinkle with cinnamon. Bake until custard is set, about 1 hour 20 minutes. Let cool to room temperature. Dust with powdered sugar before serving. Serves 4-6.

Sauté the onion in the olive oil until translucent. Add the beef and brown thoroughly. Drain off the fat. Add the other ingredients and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat and simmer until the beans are tender. Serve with tortilla chips or over rice.

In a large bowl combine all the cheeses, mustard, parsley, milk and garlic powder. Mix well. Form into a ball. Roll the cheese ball in the pecans. Wrap in saran wrap. Refrigerate over night. Serve with crackers.

Dissolve jello in 1 cup boiling water in a large bowl. Add pudding mix and continue to stir until thickened. Add mandarin oranges and continue to stir for another 2 minutes or until pudding is completely cool. Chill for 2 to 3 hours or until ready to serve. Fold in Cool Whip and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9-inch-square baking pan with butter or vegetable shortening. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs with the sugar until thick and pale, about 2 minutes. Whisk in the lemon zest and juice. In a separate bowl, whisk together the pistachios, baking powder, salt and 3/4 cup of the icing sugar until combined. Stir the pistachio mixture into the egg mixture. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake until the cake is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, 45 minutes to 1 hour. Cool the cake on a rack before cutting. To make the glaze, whisk together the confectioners' sugar with the remaining 3 tablespoons of icing sugar. Spread the glaze over the warm cake. Let stand until the glaze is set. Store the cake in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

Heat the oven broiler. Season the fish with the garlic powder. Rub the fish with the lemon zest. Sprinkle with lemon juice, salt and pepper. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of the oil. Place the fish under the broiler until the fish is opaque, about 8 minutes. Transfer the fish to a serving plate. Drizzle with the remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Serve.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until lightly browned and softened, about 5 minutes. Add kohlrabi and cook for 5 minutes more. Stirring often, pour in the wine to deglaze the pan (scrape up any brown bits that have stuck to the bottom). Add the broth, season with the salt and pepper, then bring to a boil. Cover and reduce the heat to medium-low. Cook until kohlrabi is tender when pierced with a knife, about 15 minutes. Stir in the flour, then gradually add the milk. Continue to stir until mixture comes to a gentle boil, then cook for another minute or so until thickened to your desired consistency. Stir in the parsley and serve immediately. Serves 4-6.

Place pork in a plastic bag and add teriyaki sauce and water and marinate in refrigerator overnight. Remove from bag and pat dry with paper towel. In a bowl combine flour and 1/4 cup teriyaki sauce and dip the pork tenderloin in flour mixture and shake off the excess. In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon oil until smoking over high heat. Add the pork and cook for 5 minutes turning once until cooked through. Remove from the pan and keep warm. In the same pan add the remaining teriyaki sauce and whisk in the remaining tablespoon of oil and bring to a boil and cook for 30 seconds or until thickened. Serve with cooked rice and garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.

In a small saucepan combine 1/2 cup water, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 2 tablespoons orange zest, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract and 1 1/2 cups cognac. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in 2 tablespoons glycerine. Cool to room temperature before serving.

Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add pastacook 7 minutes or until tender. Drainrinse under cold waterdrain well. Melt 1 Tbsp. butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 2 Tbsp. of sour creamcook 3 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Add 2 Tbsp. of flourcook 1 minute or until mixture is smooth. Stir in 1/4 cup of scotch and 1/2 cup of milkcook until mixture thickens and bubbles. Add the salmon and remaining sour creamcook 1 minute or until thoroughly heated. Toss with pastatop with parsley and remaining 1/2 cup of scotch and 1/4 cup of milk.

Combine milk and honey in a small saucepan. Heat to 120f. Stir in yeast. Let stand 5 minutes. In a large bowl, stir together flour and salt. Using an electric mixer, beat together the honey mixture, egg and butter. Add the flour mixture and beat at low speed until a dough forms. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth and elastic 6-7 minutes. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl and turn once to oil the top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk about 45 minutes. Punch down dough. Divide dough in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll each half into a rectangle about 12 inches wide and 1/8 inch thick. Cut each rectangle into 2 inch pieces. Place 3 inches apart on lightly greased cookie sheet. Let rise until doubled about 25 minutes. Bake at 375f for 10-12 minutes or until tops are lightly browned. Cool for 5 minutes before removing

Dip tomatoes in egg and then in cornmeal. Place in a shallow dish. Spray with cooking spray. Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes. Flip tomatoes and spray with cooking spray. Bake 10 more minutes. Serve with ranch dressing.

Place loquats in a large pan with 3/4 cup water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, reduce heat and cook for 20 minutes. Mash loquats to a pulp. Add cinnamon stick, 3 cups water and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool slightly and strain through a sieve. Stir in liqueur. Pour into jars. Refrigerate for up to 2 weeks.

Rinse beef and pat dry. Combine all ingredients except meat in large crock pot and heat over medium low heat until boiling. Add meat and cover. Cook on low for 8 hours. Cook on high 2-3 hours if you are short on time. Serve over cooked egg noodles or rice.

Heat vegetable oil in a large wok over high heat. Add the chicken thighs and stir fry for 3-4 minutes or until browned all over. Remove the chicken to a plate. Add the shallots and garlic to the wok and stir fry for 30 seconds. Add the ginger and the black bean sauce. Stir fry for 1 minute. Add the chicken thighs and stir fry for another 2 minutes. Serve over rice. Serve with chopped green onions and soy sauce.

Mix pineapple with cornstarch. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet. Add pork chopscook about 5 minutes on each side. Add the pineapple mixture to the skillet. Stir in raisins. Add chili sauce, brown sugar and cinnamon. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Cover and simmer about 15-20 minutes. Serve over rice.

Cream the butter and brown sugar together. Blend in the saltine cracker crumbs and the chocolate chips. Form into 1 inch balls and roll in the chopped pecans. Place 2 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Yields 36 cookies.

Preheat oven to 375f. Roll crescent rolls in half. Place a strip of bacon down the center of the roll. Sprinkle with onion powder. Roll up. Pinch ends together. Place in a lightly greased pan. Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Bake for 10-12 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line muffin tins with paper cupcake cups. Cream the sugar and the eggs together until light and fluffy. Beat in the flour, milk and lemon zest. Fill the prepared tins two-thirds full with the batter. Bake the cakes for about 25 minutes or until the cakes are golden brown and spring back when lightly pressed. Remove the cupcakes from the oven and let cool on a wire rack. Make the filling: Whisk together the flour and milk until smooth. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat. Remove from the heat and stir in the sugar. Cook the sugar until it is completely dissolved and the mixture thickens. Remove from the heat and let cool. Beat the yolks with the lemon juice until they are thick and pale yellow. Beat in the sugar, lemon zest and the cornstarch. Add the milk mixture and beat until completely blended. Stir in the butter and vanilla. Pour the filling into the cupcakes. Bake the cupcakes for an additional 15 minutes or until the

Peel potatoes and cut into 1-inch cubes. Place potatoes in a large bowl and cover with water. Cover and refrigerate overnight or at least 12 hours. Drain potatoes and place in an ungreased 15x10x1-in. baking dish. Cover and bake at 375° for 45-50 minutes or until tender. In a 10-in. skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add peppers and onionscook and stir 8-10 minutes or until tender-crisp. Remove from heatcool 10 minutes. Stir rosemary into vegetables. Mash potatoes. Add vegetables and milkmash until smooth. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon rosemary and season with salt and pepper. Spoon potato mixture onto serving dishtop with remaining rosemary. Makes 6 servings.
Pour juice and lime juice into a tall glass. Slowly add the fine sugar. Stir until sugar dissolves and swizzle with a spoon. Add orange bitters. Top with club soda and serve over ice.
Slice pork into 1-inch cubes. Brown in hot oil. Add prunes, tomatoes and chipotle. Mix well. Cook covered over medium-low heat for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Beat eggs and sugar together in a large bowl. Stir in milk. Heat in a double boiler until thickened. Cool. Add vanilla and nutmeg. Top each serving of cooked eggnog with whipped cream.

In a large pot of boiling water, add tortellini and cook according to package instructions. Drain and rinse in cold water until cool. In a large bowl, combine cream cheese with garlic and herbs and milk. Add tortellini and stir until well coated. Add parmesan cheese and black pepper. Stir well. Serve in individual bowls or on a platter with baby spinach leaves, cherry tomatoes and fresh basil leaves.

In a bowl combine peanut butter, water, soy sauce, and balsamic vinegar. Add the good seasons salad dressing mix and lemon juice. In a small bowl combine the sesame oil and cornstarch until smooth. Stir the sesame mixture into the sauce mixture until combined. Heat the oil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook the beef until done, 3-5 minutes per side. Remove the beef from the heat and toss with the sauce in a small bowl until coated. Serve warm with your choice of vegetables or dipping sauce.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add meatcook until evenly browned. Add crushed tomatoes in puree and next 4 ingredientsbring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in beanssimmer 10 minutes. Add chili powder and cumin. Serve with shredded cheese.

Place the chicken wings in a large bowl and pour over 1/3 cup of warm water. Let stand for 10 minutes. In a bowl whisk together the honey, hoisin and 1/4 teaspoon of each salt and black pepper. Add the garlic, scallions and ginger and set aside. In a large skillet heat the canola oil. Add the chicken wings and brown both sides. Remove from pan. Pour off any excess fat from the pan. Add the honey mixture and heat until bubbly. Add the wings and toss. Continue cooking until wings are heated through and sauce is thickened and glazed. Serve with lemon wedges.

Place carrots in a large sauce pan. Cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook 2 minutes. Drain. Combine brown sugar and cornstarch in a small bowl. Gradually stir in water. Heat until thick and clear. Stir in vinegar. Add carrots and raisins. Heat through. Remove from heat. Stir in butter. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Combine all ingredients in large heavy skillet and stir to dissolve sugar. Bring to boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until thick syrup forms. Stir frequently until syrup thickens enough to coat a spoon (about 10 to 12 minutes). Pour onto wax paper to cool. Break apart nuts. Store in tightly covered container for up to 3 weeks.

Boil potato until just soft. Peel and cube the potato and set aside. In a large frypan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add cauliflower and cook for 1 minute. Add white wine vinegar, salt and white pepper and cook until just tender. Stir in potato. Remove from heat. Serve immediately.

Wash and scrub the potatoes and prick a few times. Bake in a preheated 350f oven for about 1 hour. When cool enough to handle, cut into sticks. Melt the butter and mix with cinnamon and sugar. Coat sticks and bake for a few minutes or until the topping is a bit brown.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In 8-quart Dutch oven or heavy bottomed pot, melt 1 pound of butter over medium-high heat. Add 1 1/2 cups diced celery and 1 1/2 cups diced onioncook 6-8 minutes or until tender and beginning to brown. Stir in 4 pounds potatoes (peeled and diced) 1/2 teaspoon celery seed, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1/4 teaspoon ground black peppercook 2 minutes or until potatoes are coated with fat. Stir in 2 quarts chicken brothbring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-lowcover and simmer 15 minutes or until potatoes are almost tender. Increase heat to mediumadd 1 pound milkcook 4 minutes or until slightly thickened, stirring occasionally. Stir in 1/2 cup chopped parsley and 1 1/2 teaspoons paprikacook 1 minute or until heated
Place 4 tortilla chips on each of 4 plates. Top with 1/4 cup beanssprinkle with 1/4 cup cheese. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon salsa. Makes 4 servings.

Lightly beat eggs in a shallow bowl or dish. In a separate shallow bowl or dish combine bread crumbs and crushed peanuts. Dip fish in egg mixture then in the crumb mixture. Lightly spray a baking sheet with olive oil cooking spray and lay fish fillets flat on the sheet. Bake in preheated 425 degrees oven 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Serve with lemon slices.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic. Cook about 3 minutes or until lightly browned. Add clams. Sprinkle with lemon juice, red pepper flakes, and oregano. Pour white clam sauce over the clams. Reduce heat to medium low. Cook about 5 minutes or until clams open. Stir in butter and parsley. Cook 2 minutes. Serve with toasted french bread.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the turkey bacon. Remove bacon with slotted spoon to a plate lined with paper towels. Add the beans to the skillet with the bacon drippings and brown. Drain off the excess fat. Add the pepper and onion. Stir in the chili sauce. Add the bacon back to the skillet and serve on top of the beans. Garnish with the green onions.

In a large bowl combine the cornmeal, flour, onion, egg, milk, salt and pepper to taste. Heat vegetable oil in a deep skillet to 375 degrees F. Drop the batter by teaspoonfuls into the hot oil to form pancakes. Fry until golden brown (about 4 minutes) Turn them over and fry the other side until golden brown (about 4 minutes). Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with a dipping sauce of your choice.
Combine chicken, cream cheese, pepper and seasoning salt. Mix well. Fold in walnuts. Serve with assorted crackers.

Roll out each crescent roll rectangle to a large circle (approx. 10 inches across). Cut circles into 6-8 wedges. Place salami in a zig zag pattern along the circle. Add cheese and sprinkle with italian seasoning. Roll up starting with the bottom edge and ending with the top edge. Place seam side down on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until golden brown and cheese is melted, about 8-10 minutes. Serve warm.

Cook soba noodles according to package directions, rinse with cold water. In a small bowl, combine wasabi powder and soy sauce. In another bowl, combine soba noodles with 1/3 cup dressingtoss to coat. Divide noodles evenly among 4 plates. Arrange spinach on each platesprinkle with green onion and shrimp. Serve with remaining dressing.

Prepare the vinaigrette by combining the olive oil, vinegar and basil leaves. Soak the bay leaves with the garlic cloves for 30 minutes. Remove the garlic and bay leaves from the oil and discard them. Place the tomatoes on a platter and pour the vinaigrette over them. Garnish with the bay leaves and fresh basil leaves.

Mix cream cheese and miracle whip. Spread one side of each bread slice with mixture. Top with cheese and remaining bread slices. Heat sandwiches in a lightly greased skillet or griddle over medium heat until bread is browned and cheese is melted. Serve warm or cool completely before serving. Serve with sliced tomatoes or cucumber slices if desired.
Soak cheese in warm water for 10 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water. Mix with remaining ingredients in a small mixing bowl. Serve with assorted crackers.

Cut butter into flour, oats and salt. Add baking powder and milk. Work into dough. Add sparkling water and mix well. Roll out on lightly floured board. Cut into shapes. Place on greased baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes.

Combine sugar and water in small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil and boil 1 minute. Stir in gingerroot and lime juice. Remove from heat and cool 10 minutes. Cut fruit into 1/2-inch slices and arrange on skewers alternating with cilantro leaves. Brush with syrup and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Combine all ingredients in small bowl and stir well to blend. Arrange tilapia on oiled baking dish. Spread ginger miso mixture evenly over top of each fillet. Bake at 425 degrees until fish flakes easily (15-20 minutes). Serve over rice.

Cut eggs in half lengthwise. Remove yolksplace in medium bowl. Add cream cheeseblend well. Stir in olives, olive juice and mustard until well blended. Spoon yolk mixture into egg white halves, filling completely. Refrigerate 2 hours or until well chilled. Garnish as desired.

Preheat oven to 450 F. Stir together cornmeal, pancake mix and milk until well blended. Stir in oil. Spray a 9 x 9-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Pour in mixture. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Makes 8 servings.
Combine all in small bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. Makes 1 cup.

Bring water to boil in a large pot over high heatadd corn kernels. Cook 3 minutesremove from pot with slotted spoon to bowl. Melt butter in potadd cream cheese and cook over low heat until smooth. Stir in corn, Rotel tomatoes & chiliescook over low heat for 5 minutes or until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Mix together the cake mix and margarine until crumbly. Spread the mixture in the prepared pan. Bake for 12 minutes. While the crust is baking combine the cream cheese, eggs and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Remove the crust from the oven. Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over the crust. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until the cream cheese is set. Cool completely. Sprinkle with nuts and coconut. Cut into bars. Store in the refrigerator.

Beat butter with sugar and egg until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and water and beat well. In another bowl, stir together flour and salt. Gradually add to butter mixture, beating until well blended. Stir in pecans. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on baking sheet for 1 minute. Remove to wire rack to cool completely. Store in air-tight container. Makes 2-3 dozen cookies.

Line baking sheet with wax paper. In a small bowl, stir together the sugar, egg white, chili powder, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper to blend. In another bowl, stir together the pepitas, salt, and cumin. Dip the pepitas in the sugar mixture, tossing to coat evenly. Spread the pepitas on the wax paper to cool. Store in an airtight container in a cool, dry place. Makes about 3 cups.

Melt margarine in medium saucepan. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Drop by spoonful onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes. Allow to cool completely. Drizzle powdered sugar over the top.

Preheat oven to 200C. Combine flour, butter and egg to form a dough. Add milk to loosen. Knead lightly on surface. Flatten into round cakes. Place on baking tray. Brush with milk. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10-15 minutes or until golden. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line muffin tins with paper or foil liners. With an electric mixer, cream together the almond paste and the butter. Add the sugar and mix well. Add the eggs one at a time and beat until smooth. Add the baking powder and baking soda and mix well. Add the flour and the almond extract and mix just until smooth. In another bowl, stir together the milk and the preserves. Add half of the milk and preserves mixture to the batter and mix well. Spoon batter into muffin tins and divide the remaining milk and preserves mixture among the muffin cups. Bake for 15 minutes or until done. Serve warm or cool. Makes about 18 muffins.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a loaf pan. In a bowl, combine grapenuts, buttermilk, egg, all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and saltbeat until smooth. Pour batter into prepared loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean. Cool bread in pan for 10 minutes before removing to wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet leaving drippings in skillet. Add onion and saute until tender. Add tomato juice, rice, salt, pepper and Tabasco. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 35 to 45 minutes.

In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Beat with a wooden spoon until smooth. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake at 350f for 35-40 minutes. Cool for 2 hours. Cut into 1 inch squares. Store in airtight container.

Cook cabbage in margarine over medium heat in a large pot until tender (approximately 20 minutes). Add corned beef and cook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with potatoes cooked in water until tender. Serve with mustard and horseradish for dipping. Enjoy.
In a large skillet saute mushrooms in oil and garlic over medium heat until tender. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice and pepper to taste. Serve warm or chilled.

Peel peaches and cut in half lengthwise. Cut out the pit and chop peaches into small pieces and place in a blender with lime juice and schnapps. Process until smooth. Pour into a pitcher. Add champagne and stir well. Serve over ice with sliced peaches for garnish if desired.

Spray pizza pan or baking sheet with non-stick cooking spray. Rub pork all over with barbecue sauce. Grill pork until it reaches an internal temperature of 160 degrees F (about 1 hour). Remove pork from grill and shred into pieces using two forks. Heat griddle to medium high heat. Spread pizza dough onto griddle and sprinkle cheese onto crust. Top cheese with barbecue pork, onion, pickles, tomatoes and any other desired toppings. Bake pizza until cheese is melted (about 5 minutes).

Mix all ingredients except nuts until dough is very smooth. Roll dough into balls and press in nuts on all sides of ball. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and refrigerate for 30 minutes or until firm. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cookies will be very soft, but will firm up when cooling. Makes about 30 cookies.

Drain fries. Put fries in greased casserole dish. Add ranch dressing. Mix together taco seasoning and water. Pour over fries. Bake at 350 for 40-45 minutes. Remove from oven and add bacon and cheese. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with warm fries. Dip is a creamy cheese sauce that is served over fries. Recipe for dip is below.

Mix yogurt, curry powder, ginger, garlic, cayenne pepper, salt and lemon juice in a bowl. Marinate chicken for at least 2 hours or overnight in the fridge. Grill chicken over medium high heat for 5-7 minutes per side or till juices run clear and no pink remains when cut into with a knife. Serve with rice or couscous.

Peel the apples. Cut them into 1 cm thick slices. In a large saucepan, combine the apples with the sugar, lemon zest, vanilla powder, white wine, and jam. Simmer over low heat for about 20 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Butter one side of each slice of sandwich bread. Place the apples in a large gratin dish. Top with the bread. Drizzle with the remaining white wine. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar.

Prepare chicken. Cut broccoli stems into thin slices. Stir together soup and milk. Spread breadcrumbs in shallow dish. Dip chicken in soup mixture. Roll in crumbs. Place in 13x9x2 baking dish. Spoon broccoli over chicken. Top with cheese. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Serve with chow mein noodles.

Beat the cream cheese in an electric mixer. Add the white sugar, orange-flavored liqueur and orange extract and continue to beat until well combined. Set aside. Prepare the crust by combining the crushed cookies and the melted margarine. Press the mixture into the bottom and sides of the 9-inch pie plate. Pour the cream cheese mixture into the pie crust and spread evenly. Put the pie in the refrigerator for 4 hours. About 1 hour before serving, cover the top of the pie with the whipped topping. Garnish with orange segments and orange zest. Serve and enjoy.

Preheat the oven to 350f grease 24 muffin cups or line with papers. In a large bowl, combine the oatmeal, flour, baking powder and salt. In a separate bowl, combine the eggs, sugar and milk. Stir in the oatmeal mixture. Stir in the vanilla. Add the butter and mix just until moistened. Spoon into prepared cups. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely.

Mix flour, oil, water, salt, baking powder together in a bowl. Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth. Pat out into a rectangle about an inch thick. Use a pizza cutter or a sharp knife and cut into strips about 2 inches wide. Bend each strip in half lengthwise. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 400 degree F oven for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes about 18 strips.
Mix together and rub over roast. Let sit for about an hour. Roast in oven for 3 hours at about 325F. Baste several times.

In a large bowl, combine eggnog with bourbon, dark rum and brandybeat with a mixer at medium speed until well blended. Fold in eggnog ice cream until blended. Divide among 8 mugsgarnish each with a nutmeg pinch. Makes 8 servings (about 1 cup each).

Preheat grill to medium heat. Brush cut side of bread with olive oil. Lay bread on hot grill, cut side down. Grill 2 to 3 minutes or until slightly toasted. Turn and brush with more olive oil. Sprinkle with onion, garlic, bell peppers, feta cheese and oregano. Grill until cheese is melted, about 1 minute. Season with pepper. Serve warm.

Cut angel food cake into 4 triangles. Crush them with your hands. Mix with 1 can of Cool Whip. Fold in 1/4 cup of sugar. Add vanilla extract to taste. Place in refrigerator. Fold 1 can of Cool Whip with 1/4 cup of sugar. Place in refrigerator. Slice strawberries. Place on serving plates. Top with angel food mix. Place remaining Cool Whip on top of angel food mix. Serve.

Peel and cut the baking potatoes into chunks. Cook in salted water until soft. Drain. While potatoes are boiling chop up garlic and parsley. Add potatoes back to the pot and mash with a potato masher. Add chopped parsley and garlic and mash a few more times. Add tabasco sauce and salt. Taste. If you want more heat add more tabasco. Add mustards and mash again. Taste for seasonings. If you want it to taste more like a potato add more water. Add prepared horseradish. Add more water if you want it to be like mashed potatoes. Stir in the sour cream. Enjoy.
Beat eggs well. Add milk, sugar, flour, baking powder and salt and beat until smooth. Cook in a greased pancake pan over medium heat. Makes about 12 pancakes.

Heat oven to 375f. Grease 2 1/2 quart casserole. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in saucepan. Stir in flour to make roux. Add onion. Cook 1 minute. Add 2 cups water, stirring until boiling. Cook 1 minute. Add peas. Stir in 1 cup milk. Cook until thickened. Cool. Grease 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Layer 1/2 of breadcrumbs. Spoon 1/2 of ham mixture over crumbs. Layer with 1/2 of remaining breadcrumbs. Spoon remaining ham mixture over crumbs. Combine 1 cup milk, eggs, parsley. Pour over ham mixture. Sprinkle with remaining breadcrumbs. Bake uncovered 40 to 45 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl or measuring cup. Stir well. Pour over ribs or pork chops. Barbecue or broil until meat is no longer pink. Serve with additional barbecue sauce for dipping.

Mix cream of chicken soup, 1/2 cup of the cheese, the chicken breast, and the dill in a large bowlmix well. Unroll rolls. Place one triangle on each plate. Top each triangle with a heaping spoonful of chicken mixture. Fold triangles in half. Brush tops with milk. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 400 for 10-15 minutes or until golden. Serve warm.

To make the soup, cut the fennel bulb and fennel leaves into 1/2-inch dicemince the shallots. In a large heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the fennel and shallots and cook until the fennel is softened and the shallots are translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the chicken broth and increase the heat to high. Once the mixture comes to a boil, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and heavy cream. Slowly pour the hot broth into the egg mixture in a thin stream, whisking constantly to temper the eggs. Return the mixture to the pot and cook over low heat, whisking constantly, until the egg mixture thickens slightly. Season with more salt to taste. Pour the soup into bowls and top with the fennel fronds.

Heat olive oil in a large pot or skillet set on medium-high heat. Add shallots and garlic and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in pasta and cook until pasta is tender and has absorbed all of the sauce, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in parmigiano-reggiano cheese, parsley, and salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Spread reduced-fat peanut butter on bread. Spread honey on other slice of bread. Place banana slices between bread slices. Combine eggs, milk, ground cinnamon in a small bowl. Beat until well blended. Melt butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Dip each sandwich in batter, coating both sides of bread. Add to hot pan. Cook for 1-2 minutes per side. Serve with fruit preserves.
