Beat butter, sugar and salt in a large bowl until creamy and fluffy. Beat in pecans and bourbon, then form into 1 1/2 inch balls and place on wax paper. Chill 4 hours to firm up. Melt dipping chocolate according to directions on package. Dip balls in the chocolate, allowing excess to drip back into bowl, place on wax paper and let set on wax paper at room temperature. Store in the refrigerator.

Sift flour into a large bowl. Add salt, sugar and the butter. Rub the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs. Add the dates and nuts. Stir gently to mix. Add milk and cream. Stir gently to mix. Add the egg yolks. Stir gently to mix. Beat the egg whites until stiff. Add the sour cream. Stir gently to mix. Turn the dough onto a floured surface. Knead lightly. Divide into 6 pieces. Roll each piece into a 20 cm round. Cut each piece into 6 wedges. Place wedges onto a baking tray. Brush with a little milk. Bake at 180 degrees C for 12 minutes or until browned.

Preheat oven to 425f. Mix together 1 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 2 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/4 cup butter. Spread evenly over the bottom of a deep dish pie plate. Add the berries. In a medium bowl beat the eggs lightly. Add the lemon juice, the remaining 1 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, and 2 tablespoons cinnamon. Add the melted butter. Pour the filling into the pie shell. Place the pastry on top of the filling. Brush the top of the pastry with the egg wash. Bake for 45 minutes at 425. Lower the heat to 350f for 30 minutes more. Remove from oven and allow to cool on a wire rack.

Peel mango and cut into 1/2 inch dice. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add mango and cook until tender. Add green pepper and red pepper and cook for 2 minutes. Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is translucent. Add remaining ingredients except chicken and stir to blend. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and place in a 13 inch by 9 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve over rice.

Cook bacon. Remove bacon to paper towel-lined plate. Pour off all but 1 tablespoon bacon drippings from pan. Add onion to bacon drippings. Saute over medium heat until translucent. Add chicken. Cook until no longer pink. Stir in potatoes and chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for about 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Stir in milk. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add corn. Heat through. Serve with chopped bacon.

Beat together cream cheese and butter until smooth. Stir in vanilla and powdered sugar. Fold in toffee bits and pecans. Place in refrigerator until ready to serve. Remove about 15 minutes prior to serving time and roll into ball. Press pecans around ball and place in bowl with toffee bits. Serves 6 to 8.

Mix flour, milk and egg together in a bowl. Stir in the melted butter and sugar. Pour into a hot skillet with some melted butter and cook on both sides, when brown sprinkle with nuts and serve with some jam, for example raspberry or strawberry.

Brown beef and onion in a large pot over medium heat. Add water and bouillon cubes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Add mixed vegetables and potatoes. Simmer for another 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add tomatoes and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer for 5 minutes more. Serve with cornbread or biscuits.
Slice eggs in half and remove yolks to a small bowl and mash with a fork. Add all other ingredients and mix well. Spoon yolk mixture back into egg halves and sprinkle with paprika.

Place skim milk in a small saucepan over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Stir in bittersweet chocolate until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in peppermint schnapps. Serve in mugs and garnish with whipped cream and peppermint stick candy.
Combine first 3 ingredients in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Cook until beef is tender. Add remaining ingredients. Heat through. Serve in hamburger buns.
Slice cheese into thin pieces. Slice bread into thin pieces. Spread cheese on bread and top with mustard. Dip into ale and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Add the blue cheese to the jiffy mix and stir until it is well blended. Add the milk and egg and stir until everything is combined well. Pour the mixture into a greased 12" baking pan and bake for 30 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and firm to the touch. Cut into wedges and serve with butter or sour cream if desired.

Melt butter, stir in rice bubbles. Add egg, mix well. Add vanilla extract. Sift flour with chocolate chips. Stir into butter mixture. Knead dough until well combined. Roll out on a floured surface to about half a centimetre thickness. Cut into shapes with a cutter. Bake at 180 degrees for about 15 minutes.

In a large bowl mix honey, soy sauce and barbecue sauce. In a separate bowl combine green onion and garlic. Combine marinade mixture and chicken breast cubes in a large bowl. Marinate overnight. Grill skewers on an oiled grill over medium-high heat for about 8-10 minutes per side. Brush occasionally with marinade. Arrange on a platter and sprinkle with green onion and garlic mixture.

Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add onion and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add tomatoes, basil, and corn. Cook until mixture is well blended and tomatoes are cooked through. Remove from heat and set aside. In another large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add cornmeal and cook 1 minute. Add crabmeat and cook until just heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss pasta with tomato mixture and crabmeat. Serve warm.
Peel and slice banana crosswise and place in a bowl. Add yogurt and top with peanutbutter and sprinkle with grapenuts cereal.

Heat oil in wok or large skillet. Add mushrooms and garlic and saute until mushrooms are brown. Stir in water, ramen noodles and sherry wine. Bring to boil and cook 2 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and tabasco sauce. Add green onion. Serve hot.

Mix together cake mix and water. Put into cupcake tins and cook at 175 for about 20 minutes. Take out of the oven and let cool. Prepare frosting by creaming together the cream and vanilla extract. Mix in the cocoa and slowly add the icing sugar. Frost cupcakes and top with black licorice.

Fry sausages and onions till onions are translucent. Remove from pan and set aside. In same pan add paprika and 2 tbls. of the butter. When butter is melted add tomato puree and bouillon cube and stir well. Add water and mustard stirring well to combine and add sausage and onions. Bring to a boil and then turn down to simmer and cook for 15 to 20 minutes or until gravy thickens slightly. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Preheat grill to 350 degrees farenheit. In a large bowl, mix all of the ingredients until well combined. Form into patties. Spray the grill with pam cooking spray and cook for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown. Serve on toasted hamburger buns topped with lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise.

In crock pot cook onion and cranberries in catsup until mixture thickens. Place chicken in crock pot. Cover with cranberry mixture. Cover and cook on low setting for 6 hours or until chicken is tender.

Mash avocado with fork. Add cottage cheese, lime juice, green onion, jalapeno, garlic cloves and season with salt and pepper to taste. Chill for 1 hour or more before serving. Serve with tortilla chips. Makes about 1 1/2 cups guacamole.

Beat eggs with vanilla and add the flour and salt. Beat well and add milk and butter. Beat again. Heat waffle iron and use cooking spray or butter to grease iron. Bake according to waffle iron directions. Add cinnamon and sugar to waffle and drizzle with lemon juice and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 500 degrees F (250 degrees C). Heat pizza crust in oven for 3 minutes. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine barbecue sauce and 1/4 cup water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Remove saucepan from heat and stir in chicken and 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepperset aside. Top crust with 1/2 of the mozzarella and cheddar cheeses. Top with barbecue mixture and remaining cheeses. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes or until the crust is browned and the cheeses are melted and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Place oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add garlic cloves to pan and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add chicken breasts and cook for about 3 minutes, until just golden. Add in cumin and ginger and cook for an additional minute. Add in lemon juice and water and bring to a simmer. Transfer to a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour brown sugar and melted butter over top. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Serve.

In a small bowl, whisk together the extra virgin olive oil, red wine, garlic, parsley, oregano, bay leaf, and pepper. Place beef in a shallow bowl or glass baking dish. Pour marinade over the meatcover with plastic wrap or a plate to avoid drying out. Allow to marinate in refrigerator for at least 1 hour or up to overnight. When ready to cook, heat grill to medium. Remove meat from marinadediscard marinade. Cook on the grill for 3 to 4 minutes on each side for medium rare. If desired, sprinkle with chopped parsley to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch pie plate. In a bowl, combine the pie crust ingredients, and mix until a ball forms. Roll out the pastry to fit the pie plate, then crimp the edges to form a pie shell. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned. In a medium saucepan, combine the corn syrup, sugar, salt, eggs, margarine, vanilla extract, and pecans. Mix until well blended, then pour into the pie shell. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the center is set and the pie is slightly puffed. Cool before slicing and serving.

Melt butter in heavy large pot over medium heat. Add celery and onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add flour and cook 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in clam juice and milk. Bring to simmer. Add clams and potatoes and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in thyme and season with salt and pepper.

In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese, zest and cranberries until well blended. Spread on crackers. Sprinkle with pecans. Roll into 1-in. Logs, wrap and refridgerate until serving time. Makes about 50.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. In small bowl combine bread crumbs and soymilk. In large bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. Beat the egg whites and slowly add to flour mixture. Mix until smooth. Pour batter into hot oil. Brown on each side. Serve with syrup.

Heat olive oil on medium high heat in skillet. Add onion and garlic and saute until onion is translucent. Add tomatoes and herbs and simmer until thickened. Season with salt and pepper. Add the sugar and garlic clove. Serve over pasta.

Heat sesame oil in a small pot on medium heat. Add minced garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add spinach and toss in oil for about 1 minute. Add soy sauce and sugar and continue to cook for another 1 minute or until spinach is bright green and wilted. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Brush tomatoes and asparagus with oil. Sprinkle thyme leaves, garlic clove, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt over asparagus and tomatoes. Sprinkle brown sugar over asparagus and tomatoes. Arrange vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet, making sure to not overlap asparagus or tomatoes. Bake in the preheated oven until vegetables are tender and juices are bubbling, about 12 minutes. Remove from oven and drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Let stand until cooled slightly before serving.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease and flour two 9x5 loaf pans. Combine mix and pudding mixes. Add the eggs and mix until smooth. Add the water and mix until smooth. Stir in the oil and vanilla extract. Pour into loaf pans. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake at 325 degrees for 2 hours. Cool on a wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve.

Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add green bell peppers and cook 2 minutes. Stir in water and bring to a boil. Add couscous. Cook and stir until couscous is tender, about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Bring water to a boil and add orzo. Boil until done. Remove from heat and drain. In a large skillet saute onions in margarine until tender. Add green peppers and mushrooms and cook until tender. Add squash and bamboo shoots and cook until tender. Add orzo and soup mix and stir. Cook until heated through. Serve with a salad and meat.

In a medium bowl, combine Bisquick, water and margarine. Stir to blend. Divide the dough in half and shape into 2 balls. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes. On a lightly floured surface with a rolling pin, roll each ball into a circle about 1/8 inch thick. Cut the rounds into 1 1/2-inch squares. Place the squares on a cookie sheet. Bake for 8 minutes. Remove the cookie sheet from the oven. In a small bowl, combine the sesame seeds and the 1 teaspoon of water. Brush the sesame mixture over the squares. Bake for 2 minutes more. Cool on a wire rack. Makes 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream butter and brown sugar. Add egg and applesauce. Mix well. Add Bisquick and flour and mix until blended. Stir in spice and raisins. Drop by teaspoonfuls on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Makes about 2 dozen cookies.

Heat oven to 350f. In large skillet, heat alfredo sauce over low heat. Add chickencook 15 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, combine pasta and frozen peas in a large bowl. In small bowl combine the 2 cups alfredo sauce and cheese. Add to pasta mixturetoss lightly. Spread mixture in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Arrange chicken over pasta. Spoon remaining sauce over chicken. Bake uncovered 15 minutes or until hot. Makes 6 servings.

Grate onion and cook in pan with butter until soft. Add milk and let boil. Add potatoes and cook until potatoes are tender. Beat eggs with white pepper, salt, and milk and pour over potatoes. Let cook over low heat until set. Remove from heat, add smoked salmon and fresh dill, and sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Line a 9x13 pan with foil and grease with cooking spray. In a large pot over medium heat, mix sugar, marshmallows and eggnog until smooth and melted. Stir in butter, light corn syrup, vanilla and salt. Cook until the mixture reaches 234 degrees or until a small amount drops to the bottom of a spoon and forms a soft ball. Remove from heat. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan. Smooth with a rubber spatula. Let cool for about 30 minutes. Spread nuts on a plate and roll the fudge in the nuts to cover completely. Lift the foil out of the pan by the edges and transfer the fudge to a cutting board. Using a sharp knife, cut into 1 inch squares or any shape you want. Sprinkle with cherries on top of each piece. Store in an air tight container.

In large bowl combine sugar, eggs, butter and almond extract. Beat well. Stir in flour and cranberries. Fold in pecans. Spoon batter into paper lined muffin cups. Bake in preheated 375 degree F oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

Cook macaroni until tender according to package directions. While macaroni cooks, cook bacon until crisp and drain. In a large skillet brown onion in bacon drippings. Add macaroni and sauce. Cook 2 to 3 minutes longer. Add bacon and stir until heated through. Pour mixture into a 2 quart casserole. In a small saucepan melt butter and sprinkle in flour. Cook and stir until smooth. Gradually add milk and continue stirring. Cook and stir until thickened. Remove from heat. Pour over pasta. Sprinkle with cheese and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet until thoroughly cooked. Drain fat from skillet and place beef in large bowl. Add remaining ingredients to beef mixturestir well. Heat oven to 375. Dip tortillas in melted butter. Fill each with 1/3 cup beef mixture. Roll up each enchilada and place in 9 x 13 glass baking dish. Cover with 1 can cream of mushroom soup. Sprinkle with 1 1/2 cups grated cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until mixture is heated through and enchiladas are golden brown. Sprinkle with 1 cup grated cheddar cheese. Bake for additional 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with salsa.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the butternut squash, eggplant and beefcook 8 minutes or until the beef is no longer pink. Add the pepper and onioncook 1 minute. Stir in the tomatoescook 1 minute. Season with cayenne and coriander. Serve over the rice.

Cook lasagna sheets according to package directions. Spread 1 cup of pasta sauce in 9 x 13 pan. Layer half of pasta sheets in pan and sprinkle on 1 cup of ricotta cheese. Top ricotta layer with half of baby spinach. Sprinkle this layer with 1 cup of mozzarella cheese. Repeat layering once. Top last layer with 1 cup of cheddar cheese. Bake 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and golden. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

Cook bacon in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add remaining vegetables and cook until soft. Preheat oven to 180 C. In a large bowl mix together flour, eggs and milk to make a batter. Season with salt and pepper. Fry the mixture in a frying pan with vegetable oil over a medium heat until cooked. Transfer to a baking tray and add the cheese. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Sprinkle over chili sauce before serving.

Bring water and broth to a boil. Add macaroni and cook for 8-10 minutes or until pasta is tender but still firm. Drain pasta and set aside. Heat spaghetti sauce over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook until browned and crumbled. Stir in beans and cook for an additional minute or two. Stir in pasta and vegetables. Serve hot.

Peel potatoes and cut into quarters. Place in a large pot with cold water to cover by 1 inch. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook 10 minutes. Drain and place potatoes in a bowl. Melt 2 Tbs. Butter in a heavy large pot over medium heat. Add leeks and saute until tender. Add potatoes and 4 cups stock and boil until potatoes are tender. Working in batches, puree soup in a blender until smooth. Return to pot. Add cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve topped with avocado and chives.
Cook potatoes until tender. In a bowl, combine potatoes, green onions, pickles, mayonnaise, mustard, salt & pepper, mix well. Serve chilled or at room temperature. Serves about 8.

In medium bowl, stir together graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press onto bottom and sides of 10 inch pie plate. Refrigerate. In large bowl, combine cream cheese and cool whip. Beat with electric mixer until fluffy. Add confectioners sugar and beat until creamy. Stir in nuts. Spread onto crust. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with cherry pie filling.

In a heavy small saucepan combine cream and basil. Cook over moderate heat until cream is thickened slightly, about 5 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and serve spaghetti with cream sauce. Garnish with basil.
In a large saucepan combine all ingredients. Cook over medium heat until reduced to 3/4 cup. Simmer for another 10 minutes or until the carrots are tender. Remove from heat and cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut 2 1/2 lb white bread into 1/2" cubes, place in a large bowl with 1 1/2 c milk. Melt 1/2 lb butter and stir into mixture. Stir in 3/4 c castor sugar. Place 1/2 of mixture into a greased 9"x12"x1 1/2" baking dish and press down firmly. Beat 3 eggs well. Stir in 1/2 c milk and 1 tbsp lemon rind. Spoon over bread mixture. Repeat layers. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until golden. Dust with icing sugar and serve warm with raspberry jam.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add cumin, pepper and oregano. Cook 30 seconds or until fragrant. Stir in broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer 8 to 10 minutes or until beans are tender. Stir in vegetable cocktail, lime juice and cilantro. Makes 4 servings.

In a blender combine the vodka, lime juice and jalapeno peppers, blend for about 20 seconds or until smooth. In a medium bowl toss together the scallops with the olive oil, season with salt and freshly ground black pepper, set aside to marinate for about 20 minutes. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat until very hot. Add the scallops to the skillet and saut until golden brown on both sides about 2-3 minutes per side, depending on the size of the scallops. To serve place the scallops on a bed of lettuce and garnish with the red peppers, yellow peppers, green onions and coriander. Serve with the martini sauce on the side and enjoy!

Melt butter in large saucepan. Add sugar and cook 5-7 minutes over medium heat, stirring constantly. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add pineapple, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Cook 2 minutes more over medium heat, stirring constantly. Butter a 1-1/2-quart casserole dish. Spread half the bread cubes in the bottom of the casserole dish. Pour half the pineapple mixture over top. Sprinkle with half the cheese. Repeat layers. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Makes 6-8 servings.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. In a small bowl mix the flour, baking soda, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice, salt and white sugarset aside. In a large bowl combine the vegetable oil, eggs and pumpkin pureestir well. Add the flour mixturestir until just combined. Pour into prepared loaf pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutesremove from pan to cool completely on a wire rack.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add roast and onionscook until browned on all sides, about 12 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boilreduce heat and cook until liquid is almost evaporated, about 12 minutes more. Remove from heatstir in butter and flour. Whisk in milk until smoothbring to a simmer over medium heat. Season with pepper and stir in cheesecook until cheese is melted and mixture is thickened, about 2 minutes more. Spread mixture on each roll and top with pepper and cheese.

Place the apple cider vinegar, brown sugar and smoked bacon in a small pot. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to a simmer. Add the apple cider and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the apples and simmer for another 10 minutes. Add the fresh orange juice and simmer for 5 more minutes. Transfer to a jar and refrigerate. Makes about 4 cups.

Cut pork cutlets into a large piece. Coat each with flour, egg and breadcrumbs. Heat 1/4 inch of oil in a deep-fat fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Fry cutlets in the hot oil until golden brown. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Serve over noodles.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly spray two muffin tins with cooking spray. In medium bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. In large bowl beat milk, applesauce and egg whites until well blended. Stir into flour mixture just until combineddo not over mix. Fold in blueberries. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake until muffins are golden brown and tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 18 to 22 minutes. Cool on rack for 10 minutes before removing from pans. Makes twelve muffins.

Preheat oven to 350. Beat eggs with sugar and vanilla in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed 3 minutes. Add hot cocoa and next 3 ingredients. Beat until well blended. Combine flour and next 3 ingredients in small bowl. Add flour mixture to egg mixture alternately with milk on low speed. Beat until blended after each addition. Pour batter into greased and floured 10 inch tube pan. Bake at 350 for 50 to 60 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack. Top with frosting. To make frosting, combine first 6 ingredients in small bowl. Beat with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Spread evenly over top of cake.

Peel and chop cucumber and onion into small cubes. Add cucumber and onion into mixing bowl and add salt and pepper. Stir and leave in bowl for about an hour in refrigerator. After an hour mix in diced tomatoes and toss again. Add honey and apple cider vinegar to taste and pour into bowl. Stir. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Cream butter, sugar and golden syrup. Beat until light. Add bicarbonate of soda. Stir in oats. Add flour and coconut. Mix well. Press into a lightly greased tray. Bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes. Cut while still hot. Dip into melted butter.

Peel carrots and slice them lengthwise. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add garlic and saute for about 30 seconds. Add carrots and mushrooms. Saute for about 5 minutes or until carrots are tender. Add sugar, thyme and seasonings. Saute for another 3 to 5 minutes. Stirring constantly. Remove from heat.

Split banana in half lengthwise and lay cut side down on a sheet of foil. Combine marshmallows & chips in a microwave safe bowl & melt in 30 second intervals at medium power until smooth. Pour over banana. Top with scoop of ice cream. Wrap foil around banana & ice cream & place in freezer until firm, about 2 hours or until ready to serve. Cut foil open & serve with a spoon or a plastic knife & fork. Serves 4.

In a small saucepan, combine brown sugar with water to make syrup. Bring to boil. Boil for about 3-4 minutes or until syrup is thickened. Remove from stove top, add vanilla and butter. Pour into Bundt pan or cake plate. Let cool completely. Drizzle with caramel sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees and bake pie shells for 10 minutes. Combine pumpkin puree with condensed milk and mix well. Add eggs, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg and mix well. Pour into pie shells and bake for one hour or until set.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Crush crackers and place in a 9x13 glass baking pan. Add sugar, pecans, and egg whites. Mix together. Add vanilla and heavy whipping cream. Blend until all ingredients are well incorporated. Place chocolate bar in a medium size bowl and microwave for 1 minute. Stir until melted. Pour over pecan mixture and spread with a spatula. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. Cool and serve.

Prepare cucumber salad while chicken is cooking. In a small bowl combine the soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, sesame oil and garlic. Stir to combine. Add the scallions and set aside. Prepare chicken breasts according to package instructions (I prefer to bake them in the oven or broil them). When the chicken is cooked and cool enough to handle, chop it up into bite size pieces. Stir the chicken into the cucumber salad mixture. Serve over rice, in a sandwich or as an appetizer. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Wash the acorn squash well and cut off the top and bottom so that the squash can sit flat on a baking dish. Cut the squash in half lengthwise with a very sharp knife. Scoop out the seeds and discard.Melt 2 tablespoons of margarine in a skillet over medium high heat. Place the squash cut side down in the skillet, cover with a tight fitting lid, and cook for 20 minutes or until soft.Remove the lid from the skillet and flip the squash over so that the flesh side is up. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of honey, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper. Cook uncovered for another 20 minutes or until the honey has browned to your liking and the squash is heated through.Makes 2 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat cook ground beef until browndrain. Add onion flakes, ketchup, mustard, and watermix well. Simmer for 5 minutes. In a medium saucepan over low heat heat the macaroni in the milk until tender but still firm. Stir into meat mixture. In a medium bowl toss the cheese with the bread crumbs. Spread about 1 cup of the mixture in a lightly greased 1-1/2 quart shallow baking dish. Spread macaroni mixture over crumbs. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese mixture. Bake in a preheated 375 degree F oven for 20-30 minutes or until the mixture is bubbly.

Drain the juice from the peaches in the syrup. In a saucepan over low heat, combine the peaches with the peach nectar. Cook until the peaches are heated through. Pour into an 8 by 8-inch baking dish. Spread with the sliced frozen strawberries. Cover with the sliced cantaloupe. Spread the whipped topping over the fruit. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Cook pasta shells according to package directions. Cool and toss in a large bowl with shrimp, dressing and mayonnaise. Chill. Just before serving, add celery and grapes. Toss to coat. Garnish with almonds.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add sweet potatoes and season with salt and black pepper. Cook for another 10 minutes. Add in curry paste and cook for an additional minute. Turn off heat. In a bowl whisk eggs, then pour over potatoes. Add cilantro and lime wedge and stir. Pour into skillet and cook until set. Frittata can be stored in refrigerator for up to a week.

Beat butter for 30 seconds. Add cake mix and beat until dough forms. Pat into a ball and chill for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 375. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Bake for 7-9 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and place 2 pecans into the top of each cookie. Cool completely. Drizzle glaze over cookies. Makes 4 dozen cookies.
Mix together first 6 ingredients in small bowl. Stir in oil and vinegar. Refrigerate overnight to blend flavors. Yields about 1/2 cup.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray 2 8 1/2x4 1/2x3 inch loaf pans with cooking spray. In a bowl combine the blueberries, sugar, salt and lemon rind. Let stand for 10 minutes. In another bowl whisk together the oil, baking powder and 1/4 cup flour. Whisk in egg until smooth. Stir in the blueberry mixture. In a third bowl combine the milk and remaining flour. Stir into blueberry mixture. Fold in the nutmeats. Divide the batter equally between the pans. Bake for 50 to 55 minutes or until the tops are golden brown. Remove from the oven and let stand for 10 minutes before removing the bread from the pans. Serve warm.

Cut asparagus spears into thirds lengthwise and place in a large bowl with garlic and lemon zest. Add salt and pepper and toss gently. Drizzle with butter and toss again until evenly coated. Add fresh bread crumbs and stir in Swiss cheese until well combined. Pour into a shallow gratin pan or casserole dish. Bake for 18 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with lemon juice and additional fresh bread crumbs if desired.

Beat butter and caster sugar together till light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time beating after each addition. Add coffee and hot water and mix well. Sift together flours. Beat in sour cream alternately with milk until mixture is smooth. Spread into a buttered and floured 20 cm springform tin and bake at 180 degrees for 40-50 minutes. Cool in tin 10 minutes then remove from tin and cool completely. Dust with icing sugar before serving.

Peel the squash and cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Place the squash cubes in a large saucepan. Add enough cold water to cover the cubes. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pan and cook for 40-45 minutes or until tender. When the squash is cool enough to handle, squeeze the excess liquid from the squash cubes using a colander or strainer. Combine the squash cubes with the evaporated milk, eggs, rum, vanilla, sugar, cinnamon, ginger and salt. Pour into the pie shell. Bake for 50 minutes or until the filling is set. Cool completely before serving.

Peel the garlic cloves and place in a small bowl with the olive oil and butter. Mix well and allow to sit for at least 5 minutes to let the flavors meld. Add the crushed red pepper flakes and mix well. Thread each shrimp with a toothpick and place in the marinade for 15 minutes or longer to let the flavors meld. Remove the shrimp from the marinade and grill or broil until cooked through. Serve immediately with the marinade drizzled over the top. Serve with a side of pasta or rice for a complete meal.

Remove any excess fat from the ribs, then place them in a large pan with the cabbage leaves. Cover with freshly boiled water (the cabbage will float). Bring to the boil, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 2 hours. Remove the ribs from the pan, leaving the cabbage to cook for 5 minutes longer. Season the meat with salt and pepper to taste, then serve with the cabbage.

Hack out the meat from the coconut. Chop the meat. Add the milk. Add sugar to taste. Add cinnamon and nutmeg to taste. Put in blender. Add ice cubes. Blend. Add gin to taste. Add sliced bananas. Stir. Serve in tall glasses with paper umbrellas.

In a 12 oz mug, stir together coffee and chocolate syrup. Stir in 1 tablespoon of orange extract. Microwave until heated through, about 30 seconds. Stir in 1 tablespoon of cocoa powder. Top with whipped cream and remaining orange extract. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease and flour loaf pan. In large bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add egg and banana, beat well. Add milk and mix well. Combine dry ingredients in small bowl. Add to banana mixture and mix well. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Pour into prepared loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour. Check with toothpick. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing.

Prepare rice according to package directions, substituting water for the broth or stock called for. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Cook the onion and garlic until onion is softened. Add shrimpcook and stir until opaque throughout (about 2 minutes). Drain well. Stir together lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, Cajun seasoning and paprika. Add to shrimp mixturetoss gently to combine. Stir together soup, milk, lemon juice and worcestershire saucespoon over shrimp mixture. Cook over medium-high heat until heated through. Serve over rice.

Combine the sugar and cranberries in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until the sugar is melted and the cranberries are coated. Add the pineapple and continue cooking until the pineapple is heated through and the cranberries are soft. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature. Fold in the cream and mix until well blended. Chill for at least 4 hours. Place in a serving bowl and garnish with apples, grapes and nuts.
Mix all together and bake in a 9x13 greased pan at 350 for 20 minutes. Makes 12.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cut off the bottoms of the asparagus and discard. Add the tips of the asparagus to the boiling water and cook for 3-4 minutes or until just crisp tender. Remove the tips of the asparagus from the water and immediately rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process. When cool enough to handle, trim the ends of the asparagus and place into a medium mixing bowl. Add the olive oil, lime juice and sugar and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately with a sprinkling of fresh chives over the top.

Peel the potatoes and slice them thickly. Toss them in a bowl with the garlic cloves, then drain off the excess moisture in a colander set over a bowl for a few minutes. Heat the butter in a saut pan over a medium-high heat. When the butter is foaming add the potatoes and garlic and cook until they are golden and crispy. Season with black pepper and add the cheese. Cook for another minute then serve immediately with the double cream.

Combine cream cheese and ranch dressing mix until well blended. Stir in cheese and beer. Cover and chill 1 hour or until firm. Roll mixture into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and chill until serving time. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Hard-boiled eggs-bring eggs to a boil in a small saucepan over medium high heat, then reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove the eggs from the heat and let them cool in the hot water for an additional 10 minutes. Peel the eggs and mince the whites and yolks together in a bowl using a fork until the whites are fluffy. Combine the eggs with the mayonnaise and mix together using a fork until well combined. Add the dill relish and Louisiana hot sauce to the mixture and mix well. Add the tuna to the mixture and mix well again. Add the Grey Poupon to the mixture and mix well again. Mix well and serve on your favorite bread or crackers.
Mix together yogurt and applesauce. Add cinnamon to taste. Pour into paper cupcake liners and freeze. Eat immediately for best results.

Heat oil over medium heat in a skillet with a lid. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add mushrooms, rosemary, broccoli and cook for 5 minutes or until mushrooms are soft. Season with salt & freshly ground black pepper to taste.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the red onion and garlic and saute for 5-7 minutes or until onion is translucent. Stir in the mushrooms and cook for 4-5 minutes or until mushrooms are softened and slightly browned. Add the chicken stock cubes and water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes or until the stock is reduced by half. Puree the soup in a blender or food processor until smooth. Add salt and pepper and garnish with chives if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and saut until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the carrots, celery, peppercorns, bay leaves and flour, stirring constantly until the mixture is smooth and bubbly. Remove from heat and gradually add the vegetable broth. Return to the heat and cook until the mixture thickens, stirring constantly. Season with salt and pepper if desired. Serve hot.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine brownie mix and all-bran. Add water and baking powder. Mix well. Spray muffin tin. Place batter in pan. Bake for 18-20 minutes. Cool. Makes 12 brownies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Pierce squash in several places with a sharp knife. Bake for 45 minutes or until squash is easily pierced with a fork. Let squash cool until you can handle it. Scrape out seeds. Cut squash into strips. Toss squash with parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, pimientos, parsley, salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium high heat. Add garlic and saute until aromatic. Add broccoli florets and saute until tender crisp. Add chicken broth and wine. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Simmer until broccoli is tender. Add roma tomatoes and basil and cook 10 more minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room tempature. Puree in a blender or food processor until smooth. Add more broth if needed for a creamy consistency. Garnish with fresh basil or parmesan cheese if desired. Serve warm.

Sauté onion and red bell pepper in olive oil. Cook until onion is tender. Add kielbasa and cook until no longer pink. Add diced tomatoes and tomato sauce. Simmer until tomatoes are soft. Add whole wheat penne. Cook until pasta is al dente. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat the sugar and butter in an electric mixer until well blended. Add the egg and mix until smooth. Add the lemon juice and zest and mix again. Add the almond extract and coconut extract and mix well. Combine the flour and salt and then add to the mixer and mix until blended. Roll the dough out between two pieces of wax paper to ¼ inch thickness. Remove the top layer of wax paper and cut out shapes with cookie cutters. Place cookies on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 6 to 8 minutes or until the edges are just turning golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool on the cookie sheets.

Rinse chicken well with cold water. Remove giblets and set aside for use later on. Pat chicken dry with paper towel. In a large bowl, mix dressing with soy sauce, barbecue spice, apple juice. Add chicken to bowl, toss to coat well. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours. Place chicken in smoker, cook to desired degree of doneness (I prefer 180 degrees internal temperature). Remove chicken from smoker. Allow to sit for 5-10 minutes, then carve into pieces and serve.

In a large pot over medium heat, saute the onions in the olive oil until soft. Add the arborio rice and stir until the grains are coated. Add the vegetable broth. Add the beer and bring to a boil. Lower the heat, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender. In a large frying pan over medium high heat, cook the broccoli until crisp tender. Add the broccoli to the risotto. Add the mustard, cheddar cheese and tomatoes. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve.

In a medium saucepan combine water, vinegar, and allspice. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add red cabbage and cook until softened and almost translucent, about 30 minutes. Drain and cool. Add apple and brown sugar to red cabbage and toss to combine. Store in an airtight container up to 1 week.

Cut onion in half lengthwise. Slice one half thinly, then mince the other half. Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter over medium heat in a medium saucepan. Add the minced onion, cook, stirring occasionally until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium-high. Whisk in the flour until well combined. Gradually whisk in the water. Bring to a boil. Stir in the vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper. Cook until the mixture thickens to a glaze, about 1 minute. Stir in the cabbage and the polish sausage. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve on rolls.

To assemble the wraps, spread 1/2 teaspoon of the cream cheese mixture on each tortilla. Top each tortilla with 1/4 cup of the lettuce. Spread 1/4 cup ranch dressing over the lettuce. Top with 1 tablespoon prepared horseradish, 1/2 cup roast beef, and 2 tablespoons tomatoes. Roll up the tortilla and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate until serving. To serve, slice each tortilla in half. Makes 4 wraps.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add cream and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat. Whisk in cream cheese until smooth. In a large bowl combine halloumi, corn, green onions and parsley. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add cream mixture and toss to coat. Spoon mixture into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Garnish with green onions and serve.

Cook chicken and noodles in boiling water. Drain and cool. Saute onion in butter until tender. Add mushroomssaute until tender. Add soup, cream, seasonings and noodles. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve hot.

Rinse pork loin under cold running water and pat dry. Coat both sides of the pork loin with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Rub with rosemary and garlic cloves. Place pork loin on rack in a roasting pan and place in oven. Bake for 40 minutes. Remove from oven and pour port wine over pork loin and place back into the oven for 15 minutes. Serve with your choice of sides.

In a large frying pan add the ground beef. Brown it well over a moderate heat then drain off any fat. Add the onions. Sweat the mixture for 5 minutes or until the onions are tender. Add the beef stock, the worcestershire sauce, the self raising flour and the cornflour. Stir well. Add the milk and cook until the mixture is smooth and thickened. Remove the mixture from the heat and set aside. In a large pie dish add the suet. Place a little of the mixture in the centre of the suet. Continue until the pie dish is completely filled. Cover the pie with foil and bake in the oven at 220c/425f/Gas Mark 7 for 1 hour or until the top is golden brown. Serve hot.

Combine all ingredients except shrimp in a blender. Blend until smooth. Drain shrimp and pat dry. Place shrimp in a shallow dish or large resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over shrimp. Refrigerate at least 2 hours. Remove shrimp from marinade. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Cook shrimp until they turn opaque, 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Serve over hot rice.

Sirloin steaks are very popular because they are so meaty and flavorful. However, they can be tough if not cooked properly. The trick to cooking sirloin steaks perfectly every time is to use a meat thermometer. When the steak reaches the desired temperature, pull it off the grill. Then let it rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving. This rest period allows the juices to settle back into the meat instead of dripping out when slicing. If your sirloin steaks are on the tough side, try using a tenderizing marinade before cooking. You can also tenderize by pounding the meat with a mallet. Just make sure not to overcook the steaks or they will become dry and tough.

Cream butter. Add powdered sugar. Beat in nuts and vanilla. Add flour and mix well. Roll into 1 inch balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Drizzle with icing.

Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat from pasta water. Drain pasta and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. In a large bowl, combine pasta and cabbage. In a small bowl, stir together broth and garlic powder. Pour over pasta mixture and toss to combine. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes or up to 24 hours before serving. To serve, stir in sour cream and top each serving with chopped parsley.

Thinly slice oranges on bias. Place in a bowl with honey and cinnamon stick and toss to coat. Chill 30 minutes to 1 hour or until ready to serve. Just before serving, toss with orange flower water. Top with almonds and serve with greek yogurt.

In a large bowl, combine butter and peanut butter. Beat until well blended. Add sugar and beat until smooth. Add flour and baking powder. Stir until well blended. Beat until smooth. Press mixture into a greased 15-by-10-by-1-inch jellyroll pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 2 minutes before cutting into bars.

Wash and scrub potatoes. Cut each potato in half lengthwise. Place in shallow baking pan. Brush lightly with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove and sprinkle with sour cream. Top with parsley and cheese. Bake until cheese melts.

Cook noodles according to package. In a medium bowl combine peanut butter, soy sauce, and garlic. Stir together until smooth. Add lime juice and red pepper flakes. Stir in vegetables and carrots. Toss with cooked noodles and serve.

Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F. Pat the duck dry with paper towels. Score the skin all over with the tip of a knife. Sprinkle the duck all over with salt. In a heavy-bottomed Dutch oven or pot, combine the duck quarters and the thyme. Add the salted wine and garlic and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover the pot and transfer it to the oven. Bake for about 1 hour and 45 minutes or until the duck is very tender. Check the duck occasionally during cooking to make sure the wine doesn t evaporate completely. If the duck is cooked and the wine is gone, add more wine or water. Once the duck is done, let it cool in the liquid for at least 1 hour. You can also refrigerate it overnight. The next day, remove the duck from the pot and rinse it gently under cold running water. Use paper towels to pat the duck dry. Once dry, use your fingers to pull the skin away from the flesh. Use the skin as a handle to gently tug at

Place all of the ingredients in the slow cooker and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Shape stuffing mixture into balls and place them around the outside edge of the pot. Cook for 1 more hour. Remove chicken with slotted spoon and place in bowl. Stir stuffing balls into pot with liquid until melted. Pour liquid over chicken. Serve with extra gravy.

Prepare pie shell according to directions on package. Combine pudding mix, coffee, cocoa mix, milk and whipping cream and stir until smooth. Pour into pie shell. Arrange sliced almonds along the top edge of the pie. Chill until set. Serve cold.

Mix all ingredients except chicken breast halves in a small bowl. Add chicken and mix well to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken in batchescook 5-7 minutes per side or until done. Remove to a platter. Combine 2 tablespoons soy sauce and 1 tablespoon broth in a small bowl. Add cooked ricetoss to combine. Spoon over chicken. Garnish with scallions. Serve with remaining soy sauce mixture.

In a heavy saucepan, saute onion and garlic with olive oil until tender. Add lentils and stir. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered until lentils are tender, about 15 minutes. Add rice and onion soup mix and stir. Cover and simmer until rice is tender. Add butter and salt. Stir gently and serve.

Dip each slice of french bread into a mixture of 1/4 cup milk, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1/4 cup sugar. In a skillet heat butter, add eggs and stir constantly just until scrambled. Spoon a layer of cream cheese mixture into a slice of french bread. Top with scrambled eggs and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon powdered sugar. Dip into remaining milk mixture. Cook in a preheated skillet over medium heat 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Drizzle with syrup and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon powdered sugar. Serve immediately.

Slice zucchini thinly and brush with margarine. Sprinkle with garlic powder and top with mozzarella cheese. Bake in oven at 400 f for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve as an appetizer with salsa or relish.

Brown bacon in skillet. Remove bacon with slotted spoon. In skillet saute onions in bacon drippings for about 5 minutes. Add potatoes and saute until slightly browned. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and cheddar cheese. Bake in crock pot for 4 hours. Add butter when potatoes are done. Serve hot.

In a small bowl stir together italian dressing and teriyaki sauce. Combine garlic and next 5 ingredients. Cut each chicken breast half into 3 portions. Place a portion of mixture in centre of each piece of chicken. Roll up each piece of chicken and secure with a toothpick. Place chicken in a lightly greased 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Combine remaining marinade and pour over chicken. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Heat grill to medium high heat. Grill chicken 5 minutes per side or until no longer pink. Remove toothpicks.

Combine first 5 ingredients. Add onion and garlicmix well. Marinate wings in mixture, cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Drain marinade. Line a baking pan with foil. Place wings on foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Turn wings and bake 15 minutes more. Broil wings for 3 minutes. Serve with extra catsup. Makes about 80 pieces.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Blend in milk, eggs and melted butter. Add huckleberries and stir. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake for 18-20 minutes. Makes about 12 muffins.
Blend banana and pineapple until smooth. Add yogurt and blend until smooth. Add orange juice, vodka and blend again. Pour into glasses with ice cubes. Add orange wedges on top. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).In a 12x8x2 inch baking dish, arrange pork chops in single layer, season with salt and pepper.In a medium bowl, combine apples and bread cubesadd butter, water, sugar and cinnamon. Stir well to blend. Spoon apple mixture over pork chops.Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven.

Place flour in a large plastic bag and add chicken piecesshake to coat. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heatadd chicken pieces and cook until browned and no longer pink (about 8 minutes). Remove chicken from skilletset aside. Add onions to the skilletcook and stir until tender. Stir in the soup and milkbring to a boil. Cook and stir for 1 minuteremove from heat. Stir in the cream cheese until meltedstir in the chicken and season with pepper, if desired. Place a biscuit piece in the bottom of each of 8 greased 1/2-cup ramekinstop each with about 1/4 cup of the chicken mixturecover with another biscuit piece. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown and chicken is bubbly. Serve warm with a salad if desired.

Mix crumb crusts and melted butter in 9 inch pie pan and press into pie pan. Bake at 350 degrees 10 minutes. Cool. Mix pudding and milk and pour into crust. Refrigerate until set. Mix cool whip and peanut butter. Spread over pie. Refrigerate until set. Serve topped with ice cream topping.

Brown steak in butter in a small skillet or saute pan over medium high heat for about 10 minutes or until very dark on the outside and rare on the inside. Drain and cool slightly. Finely chop the steak and combine with anchovies, salt and pepper to taste and a pinch of cayenne pepper in a bowl. Spread on toasts or crackers. Makes about a dozen appetizers.

Cook cauliflower and broccoli together until crisp-tender. In saucepan, combine soup and water. Cook until hot. Stir in parmesan cheese. Spread half of soup mixture into 2-quart casserole dish. Layer with cauliflower and broccoli mixture. Sprinkle with french fried onions. Repeat layers. Bake at 350 degrees about 30 minutes or until bubbly. Serve immediately.

Melt shortening in heavy large pot over medium-low heat. Add onion and cook until tender about 5 minutes. Stir in flour and cook 1 minute. Add broth and milk graduallybring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Stir in cheese until melted and blended. Sprinkle with paprika.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a small skillet heat 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil over medium heat. Add onions and sauté until tender. In a large bowl combine the cream of mushroom soup, sour cream and mayonnaise. Add spinach and onions. Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium high heat. Sprinkle chicken with seasoning and coat with flour. Add to skillet and brown chicken on all sides. Place chicken in baking dish. Top with spinach mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 45 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Serves 4.

Melt chips in heavy saucepan over low heatstir until smooth. Let cool about 15 minutes. In medium bowl, beat cream until stiff peaks formfold in melted butterscotch mixture. Refrigerate icing 1 hour or until ready to use. Stir in powdered sugar 1/2 cup at a time until desired consistency is reached.

preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a bowl cream together butter and sugar. Beat in egg and vanilla until well mixed. Add flour and baking powderbeat until smooth. Stir in the cinnamon. Roll dough into 1" balls. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes. Remove to wire rack. Makes 3 dozen.

Bring milk to a boil. Add macaroni. Cook for about 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a saucepan, melt the butter. Add the milk. Stir in the pepper and salt. Add the macaroni. Add the cheeses. Stir well until melted. Add the crackers. Serve immediately.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the cream cheese and garlic and cook until smooth. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Arrange mushroom caps on a greased shallow baking dish. Fill each mushroom with 1 tsp. of the cream cheese mixture and sprinkle with 1/4 tsp. each of the lemon pepper and salt. Bake for about 15 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese. Bake for about 5 minutes more or until the mozzarella is melted.

Drain tuna, reserving 1/4 cup of liquid. Melt margarine in a large pan, add onions and green peppers. Cook 5 minutes. Add tuna and reserved liquid. Cook 3 minutes. Drain spaghetti and add to pan. Add mushroom soup and milk. Season with pepper and salt to taste. Sprinkle with potato chips. Bake uncovered 30 minutes at 350 degrees F. Serves 4-6.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius. Heat a large saucepan over medium heat and add the olive oil. Add the garlic and gently sweat for a minute or so before adding the leeks, kumara and carrot. Season with salt and pepper and cook for a couple of minutes before adding the parsnips and celery. Cook until softened. Add the chicken stock and cook until the vegetables are tender. Add the pumpkin and cook for a further minute or so. Puree with a stick blender until smooth. Add the creme fraiche and season with salt and pepper. Serve with freshly grated parmesan.

In a large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add beef steakssprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Sear until brown on all sides. Transfer to a plate. Add onions and garlic to pancook until lightly browned, stirring frequently. Add bouillon cubes and oreganostir to dissolve. Stir in beef broth. Add bay leafbring to a boil. Add carrots and barleyreduce heat to low. Coversimmer 35 to 40 minutes or until beef and barley are tender. Remove bay leaf. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

To prepare the crust: Place the thyme, marjoram, parsley, rosemary and 2 tablespoons water in a blender or food processor and process until the herbs are finely ground. Place the flour in a large shallow dish. In another dish or shallow pan combine the fat with the remaining 4 tablespoons water. Dip each chicken piece in the flour, shaking off excess, then in the fat mixture and coat thoroughly with crumbs. Place the pieces in the baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes, until the crust is golden brown and the chicken is tender when pierced with the tip of a knife. To serve: In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the butter with the garlic. Stir the herb butter into the sauce until combined and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Remove fat from surface of chops. Combine remaining ingredients in a saucepan over medium-low heatcook until sugar has dissolved. Pour over chopscover with foil. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, basting every 15 minutes. Uncoverbake an additional 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread cheese evenly over the bottom of pie crust. Layer onion rings on top of cheese. Next layer mushrooms on top of onion rings. Add beaten eggs and cream over all. Bake 45-60 minutes or until set and golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting and serving.

Mix egg, lemon juice, seasoning salt and mustard well. Add chopped onions to the egg mixture and mix thoroughly. Add dried parsley flakes to the mixture. Place the fish fillets in the egg mixture, turn to coat thoroughly and allow to stand for 10 minutes. Drain well after 10 minutes. Divide the fish mixture into four portions. Press each portion of the mixture into balls. Dip each ball into the corn flake crumbs. Heat oil or butter in frying pan to medium heat and fry the fish cakes for about 3 minutes each side or until golden brown. Remove from frying pan drain excess oil. Serve hot with sour cream or mayonnaise if desired.

Soak black tea bags in water overnight or for 4 hours. Bring to a boil and add eggs and remaining ingredients. Simmer for 1 hour or until eggs are done to your liking (45-60 minutes). Remove eggs from pot using a slotted spoon or spider strainer, placing eggs in a bowl of ice water to stop cooking. Serve peeled or unpeeled, refrigerated or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl, stir together flour, sugar, cinnamon and baking powder. In a separate bowl, combine milk and eggs. Add to dry mixture and stir just until moistened. Fold in apple and melted butter. Pour batter into waffle maker and bake 5-6 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oil in a 5-6 quart dutch oven or stockpot. Add onions and cook slowly until lightly browned. Add sugar and flour. Cook for 1 minute. Add beer and stock. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add cheese and stir until melted. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. To serve: Pour soup into bowls and add croutons and parsley.

Place the peanut butter, corn flakes, soy protein, brown sugar and chocolate chips into a large mixing bowl. Stir until the mixture is well blended. Roll mixture into 12 equal balls. Place balls in the refrigerator to chill for about 1 hour. Meanwhile melt the chocolate chips and dip balls in the melted chocolate. Place on wax paper to set. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a food processor, process carrots until finely chopped. Add walnuts and process until finely chopped. Add raw cashews and process until finely chopped. Add dates and process until dates are finely chopped. Add ginger and cinnamon and process until well combined. Transfer the carrot mixture to a bowl. Stir in the orange zest and coconut. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Using your hands, roll the carrot mixture into balls the size of walnuts. Place the balls on the baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. Store in an air tight container at room temperature. Makes 25 balls.

In a large pot bring apple cider and spices to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Strain and cool completely. Pour apple cider mixture into a large bowl. Add vodka and everclear alcohol. Stir until well combined. Refrigerate overnight. Pour into glasses and serve cold. Serves 10.

Cream the shortening and sugars. Add the salt and vanilla and cream together. Beat egg and stir into mixture. Add the flour and baking soda and stir together well. Put on a lightly floured surface and roll out to about 1/2 inch thickness. Cut into shapes or drop by teaspoonfuls on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack and dust with powdered sugar.

Prepare beans as directed. Rinse well. Cut beans into thirds. Place in a bowl. Add oil, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, paprika, coriander, preserved lemon, olives. Mix well. Season to taste. Serve cold or room temperature. Serves 4.

Cream butter and peanut butter in a large bowl. Add sugars and mix well. Add egg and vanilla and mix well. Sift together flour and baking soda. Add to creamed mixture and mix well. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 9 minutes in preheated oven, until lightly golden on the edges. Allow to cool slightly on cookie sheet before removing to a cooling rack.

In a large bowl, combine the tapioca starch and 1 cup cheese. Add the eggs and stir until just combined. Add the butter and salt and stir until smooth. Spoon the batter into a greased 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350F (175C) for 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Return to the oven and bake for another 5 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into 12 slices.

Sautee onion and garlic in sesame oil until softened. Add shrimp and cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until pink. Add frozen peas and broth. Bring to a boil and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in curry paste. Serve over cooked rice.

Melt the butter in a pan and add the brown sugar. Cook on low heat until the mixture thickens. Add the vanilla extract and the banana slices. Cook for 2 minutes and serve hot over the vanilla ice cream with some freshly whipped cream.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Brown beef in skillet stirring until no longer pink. Drain off fat. Add water, soup mixes and herbs. Bring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 1-1/2 to 2 hours. Transfer to 2-quart serving bowlssprinkle with parsley. Serves 6.

Line a 9 inch pie plate with chocolate cookie pie crust. Beat coffee ice cream with electric mixer until smooth. Pour into pie plate. Freeze until firm. Beat fudge sauce with electric mixer until smooth. Pour over ice cream in pie plate. Beat chocolate ice cream with electric mixer until smooth. Pour over fudge sauce in pie plate. Freeze until firm. Decorate with almonds & chocolate curls.

Place 1 cup starter in a large bowl, sprinkle with 1 teaspoon sugar and mix well. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and set aside at room temperature for 24 hours. The next day add 2 cups all-purpose flour and mix well. Add 1 teaspoon baking powder and 1 teaspoon baking soda and mix well. Add 2 cups all-purpose flour and mix well. Add 2 cups all-purpose flour and mix well. Add 1 tablespoon canola oil and mix well. Add 1 cup sour cream and mix well. Add 1 teaspoon salt and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Place 4 tablespoons canola oil in a 9-inch square baking dish and place in oven. Heat oven to 350 degrees and bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and take dish from oven and turn upside down on a cooling rack. Place biscuit dough in dish and spread out to edges of dish. Cover

In a saucepan combine the boiling water, brown sugar, and butter. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and boil for 3 minutes. Add the raisins and vanilla. Add the flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir until smooth. Beat the milk until it is light. Add to the flour mixture. Stir until smooth. Add the pecans. Drop by teaspoons into boiling water. Cook for 5 to 6 minutes or until they float to the surface. Drain. Place in bowl. Pour the raisin sauce over the dumplings. Let cool. Store refrigerated.

Saute onion in butter until soft and golden, about 10 minutes. Add garlic and celery and continue to saute until golden. Add crushed red pepper flakes to taste and continue cooking for 2 minutes longer. Stir in flour and cook 2 more minutes. Gradually whisk in chicken broth to make a smooth sauce. Add peanut butter, soy sauce, and Worcestershire sauce and simmer over medium heat for 10 minutes. Stir in peanuts. Serve hot with a sprinkling of parsley.

Spray a microwave safe bowl with cooking spray. Mix together veggies, coffee creamer, flour and seasoning. Pour over the veggies and sprinkle with cheese. Microwave on high for 5 minutes. Stir and then microwave another 5 minutes. Stir well. Serve hot. Serves 2.
Mix gelatin with boiling water. Add orange sherbet. Add orange juice. Pour into punch bowl. Add seltzer water to taste. Top with orange slice. Garnish with lime slice.

Mix together crushed tomatoes, water, tilapia fillets, salt and pepper in a shallow bowl. Preheat oven to 375f. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Spread half of the corn chips in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Top with half of the tomato mixture. Sprinkle with half of the parmesan cheese. Repeat. Bake 15 minutes. Serve with butter.

Peel and slice cucumbers and onions. Toss together and place in a serving bowl or platter. Mix together remaining ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and pour over cucumbers and onions. Refridgerate at least 2 hours before serving. Serve at room temperature.

Combine butter, sugars, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl. Beat with mixer until smooth. Add peanut butterbeat until well mixed. Combine oats and baking sodastir into peanut butter mixture. Stir in chocolate chips and baking bits.Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until set. Cool 1 minute on baking sheetremove to wire rack to cool completely.
Cover boneless skinless breasts with shake and bake. Place in baking dish. Cover with 1/2 cup of milk and 1/2 cup of miracle whip. Cover with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Prepare pizza crust according to package directions. Spread barbecue sauce over pizza crust, leaving a 1/2 inch border around the edge. Arrange chicken on top of sauce in a single layer. In a medium bowl, stir together chili sauce and onion until evenly blendedspoon evenly over chicken. Sprinkle with cheese and cilantro. Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted, about 20 minutes. Cool before serving.

Prepare lime jello as directed. Chill. Fold in cream cheese. Fold in whipped topping. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Mix mandarin oranges and pineapple. Fold in jello mixture. Spoon into a 9x13 pan. Garnish with pecans. Drizzle with carbonated lemon-lime beverage. Chill. Makes 10 servings.

In a medium bowl, combine the garlic and egg yolksmix well and set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, warm the oil until it reaches the smoking point (the oil will begin to smoke and the foam will turn golden). Pour a small amount of the warm oil into the garlic mixture and whisk well. Pour the egg mixture into the oil and continue whisking until it becomes thick and creamy (about 1 minute). Slowly pour the oil back into the saucepan and continue whisking until the mixture becomes smooth and thickens (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat and add the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 1 week. To use as a spread on sandwiches or vegetables, remove from refrigerator for about 10 minutes before serving.

Brown beef and onion. Drain fat. Combine beef mixture with tomato paste, steak sauce, bouillon, garlic powder and spices. Cook on low until ready to serve. Serve on hamburger buns or pita bread and top with shredded lettuce and chopped tomatoes.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cook beef in a skillet with green pepper until browned. Drain. Stir in mushroom soup, tomatoes, onion powder, garlic powder, pepper and salt. Pour over hot pasta. Top with french fried onions. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes.
Place chicken breasts in slow cooker. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients except the olives. Pour over the chicken and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve over cooked fettuccine.

In large bowl, combine flour and cinnamon. In saucepan over low heat, melt butter, add eggstir to combine. Add flour mixturestir until soft dough forms. Pat into 13x9-inch pan coated with cooking spray. In small bowl combine sugar and vanillaspread over dough. Bake 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 10 minutes. Cut into bars. Yields 16 servings.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Mix together baking mix, chicken, frozen chopped broccoli, cheddar cheese, milk, eggs and seasoning salt. Bake for 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.

Heat oven to 325f. Line 8 by 12 by 2-inch pan with foil, with ends of foil extending over sides of pan. Butter foil. In 3-quart bowl, melt butter. Add unsweetened chocolate and whisk till smooth. Stir in granulated sugar. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla. Whisk in espresso. In small bowl, sift together cocoa, all-purpose flour, kosher salt. Add to butter mixturebeat till blended. Spread into pan. Bake till wooden toothpick inserted at center comes out with a few moist crumbs attached to it, 30 - 35 minutes. Cool on rack. Remove from panuse foil handles to lift brownies from pan. Cut into 24 bars. Cutting tip: cut into 4 rows by 6 rows. If bars are too big, cut bars into thirds.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine 1 tbsp of brown sugar with 2 tbsp of water in a small saucepan and cook until thickened to a glaze consistency, about 5 minutes. Stir in 1 tbsp of olive oil and 1 tbsp of soy sauce. In a small bowl combine 1 tbsp of lemon juice with 1 tbsp of dry white wine. Arrange salmon fillets on a greased baking sheet. Spoon on glaze mixture. Brush with lemon mixture. Bake in preheated oven about 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with brown rice, if desired.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a high heat. Fry the steaks for 3-4 minutes on each side. Remove from the pan. Add the chopped onions and fry for 2-3 minutes. Add the curry paste to the pan and stir well. Add the stock and the tomatoes. Bring to the boil. Add the couscous, seasoning to taste. Serve with the steaks and the herb salad.

Soak prunes in 1 cup apple juice for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Grease and flour a 10x15x3-inch baking pan. Mix 2 cups flour and 2 teaspoons baking powder together in a bowlset aside. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and 1/3 cup powdered milk. Beat in the prunes and the egg until smooth. Beat in the 1/3 cup apple juice and the vanilla extractmix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture. Beat in the baking powder and baking soda. Mix 1 cup apple juice and 1 cup flour togetherstir into batter. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a wooden pick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool completely before serving.

Combine sour cream, garlic and basil leaves. Let stand for 10 minutes to allow flavors to blend. Add vinegar, mayonnaise, crushed red pepper and season with salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate 2 hours before serving. Serve with your favorite salad.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onioncook and stir until tender. Add corn kernels, chicken broth, and red peppercook and stir until heated through. Season with rosemary, thyme, pepper, and cayenne pepper. Sprinkle with fresh basil before serving. Garnish with more fresh basil if desired. Serve with a loaf of bread or biscuits. Makes 6 servings.

In a small bowl combine the first five ingredientsset aside. Heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. Brush the pork with 2 tablespoons of the mustard glaze mixtureseason with salt and pepper, to taste. Grill the pork for about 5 minutes per side or until cooked through. Brush with remaining mustard glaze mixture during the last 5 minutes of grilling. Serve hot with additional mustard glaze for drizzling over the top of the pork.

Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl until thoroughly mixed. Divide mixture evenly between tortillas. Roll burritos up tightly and wrap in plastic wrap or foil. Refrigerate until ready to eat. Makes 4 servings.

Fry bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet with slotted spoonset aside. Add cabbage to bacon drippings in skilletcook over medium heat until tender. Stir in bacon, soy sauce and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Combine cooked egg noodles with cabbage mixture. Garnish with reserved bacon.
Mix apples with milk, sugar and green cardamoms in a blender. Blend till smooth. Add ice cubes and blend till smooth. Serve with a straw

Combine cream cheese, corned beef, mustard, horseradish, and mayonnaise in food processor or blenderprocess until smooth. Spread onto toast or crackers. Serve with a green salad or fruit cup if desired.

Dice the garlic cloves. Put into blender with the sugar, dry mustard and salt. Add the sour cream and pulse. Add the oil and vinegar and blend till smooth. Taste for seasoning. Stir in the parsley and pepper and refrigerate till needed. Makes about 2 cups of dressing.

Cut the chicken breasts in half lengthwise. Cut each half into three pieces. Place in a ziplock bag. Add the garlic clove, vinegar, soy sauce, honey, dried red peppers. Marinate in the refrigerator for one hour. Preheat the oven to 350&deg. F. Place the marinated chicken into a single layer on a cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven. Add the green onion slices and sesame seeds. Bake for an additional 5 minutes. Serve hot over rice.

In large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chicken and brown on both sides. Add kale, garlic and chicken broth. Cover and simmer for about 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Add pasta and butter. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Toss with feta and season with salt and pepper.

Mix together the sugar, light brown sugar, salt and cream in a heavy saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Cook 4 minutes until mixture thickens into a ball when dropped into cold water. Remove from heat. Add pecans. Stir until nuts are evenly coated. Stir in 1/2 cup praline liqueur. Drop by heaping teaspoons onto waxed paper-lined baking sheets. Let stand at room temperature until firm. Makes about 4 dozen. Store at room temperature. Makes about 4 dozen. Store at room temperature.

Wash the baby potatoes and cut them into halves. Boil them until they are cooked through. Drain the water and keep aside. In the meantime boil the peas for about 5 minutes and then drain the water. In a bowl add the potatoes and the peas. Add the eggs and the basil and mix well. In another bowl add the olive oil and the lemon juice. Pour this over the potatoes and mix well. Add the black pepper and the Parmesan cheese and mix well. This can be served warm or cold.

In a medium size mixing bowl combine brown sugar and granulated sugar. In a small pot heat butter and vanilla until melted. Stir in the brown sugar mixture. Stir in the evaporated milk. Stir in the peanut butter. Stir in the marshmallow cream. Pour into an 8x8 square pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.
Combine whiskey, lemon juice, and simple syrup in a pitcher. Add ice to pitcher. Serve in tall glasses.

In a large sauce pan combine the tomatoes and basil and mint. Stir in the salt and jalapeno pepper. Simmer covered over low heat for 10 to 15 minutes. Drain off excess liquid and allow to cool. Add the tomato mixture to the spaghetti and toss to blend. Sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese. Serve hot.
Cook couscous according to package directions. Fold into mixture. Stir well. Let stand 1 minute. Top with bananas, and sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve with whipped vanilla topping.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel and cut potatoes in half. Place in a shallow baking dish. Drizzle each half with butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. In a medium bowl, combine ranch dressing and cheese. Stir until smooth. Spoon ranch mixture over potatoes. Sprinkle with bacon and green onions. Bake for 5 more minutes, or until cheese is melted.

Spread softened cream cheese on top of each slice. Top with basil. Sprinkle sun-dried tomatoes on top. Spread salami slices on top. Top with olives and pepperoni. Cut each bread slice in half. Wrap each half around a pick. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook broccoli until tender. Drain. Add mayo and cheese and mix well. Spoon into a greased 9x13 dish. Combine soup and eggs. Pour over broccoli mixture. Bake at 350 for 40-45 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut leaves in half. Cook cabbage in large pot of boiling water 5 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a large skillet, saute beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain. Stir in soup and rice. Heat through. Spoon mixture into cabbage leaves. Place in a 13 x 9 inch glass baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until heated through. Makes 6 servings.

Prepare pie crust according to package directions. Combine beef gravy and frozen vegetables. Spoon into unbaked pie crust. Sprinkle with roast beef. Top with sliced mushrooms. Dot with butter. Cover with pie top. Bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onionscook for 8 minutes or until lightly browned. Add garliccook for 1 minute or until lightly browned. Add dried chipotle chilescook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add tomatoescook for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in oreganocook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Stir in sugar, salt and peppercook for 1 minute. Remove from heatstir in vinegarcover and let stand 10 minutes. Season filets with salt and peppersprinkle lightly with flour. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add filetscook for 4 minutes or until browned. Turn filets overcook for 3 minutes or until medium-rare. Serve with salsaserve with french bread.
