Remove from oven and stir well again. Bake for 15 more minutes.

Preheat oven to 350. Line two rimmed baking sheets with foil. Toss chicken wings with flour on a large plate. Heat a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add canola oil. Fry wings in batches until brown. Transfer to baking sheets. Cook for 30 minutes. Bring butter to a boil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add honey. Cook 5 minutes. Whisk in tabasco sauce. Whisk in vinegar. Pour half the sauce over the wings. Cook 20 minutes. Baste with remaining sauce. Cook 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 200C/Gas 6. Slice rolls in half horizontally. Spread the inside of each roll with olive oil then place on baking tray. Bake for 10 minutes. Meanwhile melt butter in frying pan and fry onions until soft. Add peppers, thyme and stock. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add chopped tomatoes. Stir in goats cheese. Divide mixture between rolls. Bake for 10 minutes more. Serve with salad.

Sweat the mushrooms and onions in butter until onions are soft. Add flour and stir until the roux is blond. Add stock and bring to a boil. Simmer uncovered for 20-30 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Puree the soup in batches in a blender or food processor. Add the half-and-half cream and puree again until smooth. Reheat the soup without boiling. Serve garnished with fresh parsley.

Melt dark chocolate in a bowl over a pan of hot water. Add condensed milk and cinnamon, and stir well. Add the instant coffee and stir well again until the mixture is smooth and glossy. Spoon 1/3 of the mixture into the base of a 30x20cm (12x8in) baking tin lined with non-stick baking paper. Dissolve the vanilla extract in the milk in a small bowl and pour over the first layer of fudge. Now sprinkle the white chocolate over the top and melt in the microwave. Spread the white chocolate over the vanilla layer and sprinkle the sliced almonds over the top. The fudge will set within 15 minutes but it is easier to cut if allowed to set overnight before cutting into 20 equal bars.

Mix flour, baking powder, soda and salt in large bowl. Cut in shortening or drippings with pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add buttermilk all at once, stirring just until combined. Turn out onto lightly floured surface and knead lightly 4 or 5 times. Roll dough out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut with floured 2 inch biscuit cutter. Bake on ungreased baking sheet at 450 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 12 biscuits.

Cook sausage in large skillet over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in pizza sauce, water and pepperoni. Cook, uncovered, over medium heat for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, spray skillet with cooking spray. Add hash browns. Cook over medium heat for about 8 minutes. Carefully pour sausage mixture over hash browns. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook uncovered for about 5 minutes. Cut into wedges.

Wash mulberries and rinse strawberries. Combine in large bowl. In medium saucepan combine sugar and 1/2 cup waterbring to a boil. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heatstir in Jell-O until completely dissolvedstir in 2 cups berry mixture. Pour into 1-1/2 quart freezer container or 4 (1/2 pint) jarsrefrigerate 1 hour or until set. Makes 4 (1/2 pint) jars or 1 1/2 quart freezer container.

In large bowl combine boiling water, gelatin and strawberry liquid until dissolved. Add strawberries and set aside for 10 minutes to chill. In separate bowl beat fat-free whipped topping until stiff peaks form. Fold in cooled gelatin mixture until blended. Spread over slices of angel food cake. Sprinkle with berries and serve immediately.
Combine vinegar, oil, soy, sugar. Heat to boil. Add cabbage. Cook until tender. Add ramen noodles. Cook until tender. Add butter. Cool. Top with almonds and sesame seeds.

Combine all dry ingredients. Beat eggs and milk together. Add to dry ingredients. Heat 1/2 t cooking oil in frying pan. Pour batter by 1/4 cup portions. Flip when bubbles appear on top. Cook other side until done.

Preheat oven to 350. Rub chops with salt and pepper. Heat pan with 2 tablespoons oil and cook chops for about 5 minutes per side until browned. Place chops in baking dish. In the pan used to cook the chops, add the remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Add the ginger and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in the peach jam and cook until sauce thickens. Pour over chops and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with vinegar and Worcestershire sauce. Serve over white rice.
Combine mayonnaise and buttermilk in a small bowl. Add onionmix lightly. Add blue cheesemix well. Stir in pimento. Serve as a dip with vegetables or crackers. Also a good salad dressing. Serves 4.

Heat oil over medium heat. Add celery ribs, carrots, onions and garlic. Saute for 5 minutes. Pour in white wine. Simmer 5 minutes. Add dried thyme, dill and old bay seasoning. Add cream of mushroom soup. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in water. Add fish fillets. Cover. Simmer until fish flakes with a fork. Serve over rice.

Boil the potatoes until just barely fork tender. Drain the potatoes and mash them with the egg and salt in a bowl until the mixture is creamy. Set aside for at least 15 minutes to firm up. While the potatoes are cooking, fry the bacon until crisp and drain the grease. Combine the flour and the bacon grease in a frying pan over medium heat. When the flour has browned slightly, add the mashed potato mixture and stir until combined and smooth. Let the mixture cook over medium heat for a few minutes, stirring frequently so it doesn t stick to the bottom. Then lower the heat and let the mixture cook for about 10 more minutes until it is firm. The mixture will be very sticky so I recommend you spray the frying pan with cooking oil spray before adding the potato mixture. You can serve the kluski with butter or with your favorite gravy.
In a large skillet over medium heat, cook egg whites, spinach and bacon until eggs are set. Stir in milk and cheese. Serve immediately.

Combine butter and sugar in a saucepan. Add cognac. Heat until butter melts. Cool. Beat butter mixture with ground aniseed and instant coffee granules. Blend in walnuts. Combine coconut with baking powder and baking soda and add to butter mixture. Blend in whole wheat flour. Place teaspoonfuls of dough onto baking sheets. Bake at 180 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes. Roll in powdered sugar when cool.

Place 2 cups of water and 3 oranges in a heavy 2-quart saucepan. Cut off the top and bottom of each carrot and cut into 1/2-inch thick slices. Add carrots to the pan with the orange water and boil gently until the carrots are tender and the liquid has reduced to 1 cup, about 10 minutes. Add 1/2 cup sugar and lemon juice and boil until the sugar dissolves and the mixture thickens to a soft jam. Season with salt. Serve the marmalade with goat cheese or toasted bread. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------.

Rub ribs with brown sugar. In a small bowl combine remaining ingredients. Rub ribs with mustard mixture. Place ribs on baking rack in roasting pan and bake for 3 hours at 250f. Baste several times during cooking. Sprinkle with parsley just before serving.
Peel and dice mango and orange. Peel and slice pineapple. Place in blender with yogurt and honey. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line baking dish with celery leaves. In large bowl combine broccoli, mayonnaise, celery and cheese. Spoon into baking dish. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over top. Bake until lightly browned. Serve warm.

Butterfly the chicken by cutting down the backbone of the chicken and flattening out each side so that the chicken lies flat on the cutting board and is open like a book. This is the easiest and most effective way of getting chicken breasts to cook evenly and thoroughly without drying out the chicken. After butterflying the chicken and before placing the chicken on the grill, coat each side of the chicken with the curry and cumin mixture. You may also brush the mixture onto each side of the chicken once it is on the grill. Grill the chicken for approximately 4 minutes per side.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the ground beef and garlic powder until no longer pink. Drain and set aside. Prepare Betty Crocker Au Gratin Potatoes as directed. Pour the beef mixture over potatoes and mix well. Bring the milk and hot water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Stir in mushroom pieces and stems and simmer 5 minutesstirring occasionally. Pour the mixture over the beef mixture and potatoes and stir well. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Spray baking sheet with cooking spray or line with parchment paper. In a large bowl, mix the first 5 dry ingredients (baking soda through baking powder). Using a pastry blender or two knives, cut in the cold butter until mixture is in crumbs the size of small peas. Stir in the cheese until evenly dispersed. Add the buttermilkstir just to combine. Stir in the red pepper sauce. Divide the dough into 2 equal partsshape each into a 4-inch-diameter roundplace each on the prepared baking sheet. Bake until the biscuits are golden brown and puffy, about 15 minutes. Serve warm with Tabasco sauce, if desired.

Grate potatoes in food processor fitted with a shredding disk. Place potato in colander set in sink and sprinkle with table salt and ground black pepper. Rinse potato thoroughly under cold water. Squeeze dry with paper towel. Melt butter in 10" skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and saute until golden brown and crisp on outside and tender on inside, about 10 minutes. Place potato in center of each of 4 serving plates. Sprinkle each plate with 1/2 tablespoon ham and 1 tablespoon tomato. Top each plate with 1 slice of Swiss cheese. Broil until cheese melts, 2-4 minutes depending on thickness of slice. Serve immediately.

Place green onions in the bottom of a large serving bowl. Layer in coleslaw, cranberries, pecans. In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar and salt and black pepper to taste. Drizzle over slaw. Chill until serving. Toss before serving.

Place drumsticks in a single layer on baking dish. Sprinkle with garlic powder, season with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with fresh rosemary and parsley. Serve.

Add boiling water to raspberry gelatin and stir until dissolved. Add cold water and stir well. Add raspberry sauce and stir well. Chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Fold in 2 cups of the frozen whipped topping and mix well. Layer into 9 inch pie plate or other serving dish. Top with remaining whipped topping and fresh raspberries. Chill for 1-2 hours or until set. Cut into wedges. Serves 8-10.

In a small bowl, combine green chilies with mayonnaise and Dijon mustard, blend well. Spread half of green chili mixture onto each of two slices rye bread. Layer cheese and roast beef onto each sandwich. Spread remaining green chili mixture on each sandwich and top with remaining bread slices. Place sandwiches in a nonstick skillet or grill pan over medium heat for about 2 minutes per side, until bread is golden brown and cheese is melted. Cut each sandwich into two triangles. Makes two servings.

Prepare dough according to package directions and let rise 20 minutes. Roll out dough and cut with 2 inch round or heart shaped cutters and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Brush tops with egg white and bake at 350f for about 20 minutes or until tops are lightly browned.

Spread half of 1 can tomato paste on pizza crusts. Top with 1/4 pound salami slices and 1/3 cup mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon dried oregano and 1/3 cup diced tomatoes. Bake at 450 for 10 minutes. Serve slices. Makes 2 pizzas.

Combine broccoli and mayonnaise in a bowl. Combine chicken and sour cream in another bowl. Lay out Ritz crackers in bottom of 9x13 inch pan. Top with broccoli mixture and chicken mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and water chestnuts. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes until casserole is brown and bubbly.

In a food processor combine nuts and cocoa nibs. Blend until finely ground. Add cocoa powder, vanilla, agave nectar, sea salt and process until well mixed. Add peanut butter and blend until smooth. Roll tablespoons of the mixture into balls. Roll balls in cocoa powder. Place in the fridge for about an hour to firm up. Keep refrigerated.

Wash peppers and remove seeds and pith. Combine vinegar and sugar in a saucepan and heat to boiling over high heat. Pour over peppers in hot jars to 1/2 inch from top. Remove air bubbles and adjust lids. Process in boiling water bath for 15 minutes. Makes 5 pints.

Combine cornmeal with flour and salt and pepper to taste. Dust fish fillets lightly with flour mixture, then dunk into beaten egg. Dip into cornmeal mixture and press lightly to adhere. Fry fish fillets for 5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy. Place fish fillets on serving plate and top with sliced chives and drizzle with sweet chili sauce. Serve with french fries and coleslaw.
In a bowl combine basil, mayonnaise and garlic. Blend well. Stir in cheese. Spread evenly between two slices of baguette and serve as an appetizer with crackers.

In a sauce pan over medium-high heat melt butter. Add onion, cook until tender. Add rice and stir. Add tomatoes and their juices. Cover, bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer until rice is tender but not mushy. Add water if the rice begins to dry out. Add sugar and seasoning. Stir in parsley. Place a few spoonfuls of rice in each plate. Add a sprinkle of cheese. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, flour and walnuts in a bowl. Combine cinnamon and salt. Add apple pie filling to crumb mixture. Add melted butter to crumb mixture. Pour into pie shell. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 300 degrees. Bake 20 minutes more. Serve hot.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions, garlic cloves, and salt and cook the mixture, stirring occasionally for about 10 minutes or until the onions are soft. Stir in the potatoes and the water. Cover the pan tightly and cook the mixture for about 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are very tender. Stir in the tomatoes. Add the salt to taste and stir the soup. Cook the soup over low heat for about 2-5 minutes more. Add the pepper. Stir in the parsley or cilantro. Serve the soup hot.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft but not browned. Add pink grapefruit juice. Bring to a boil. Add stock. Reduce heat to low. Add carrot. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes. Add potato and cook until soft. Stir in heavy cream. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes or until potato is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in salt and pepper. Serve in bowls. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes 4 servings.

Heat the butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add lobster meat and cook for about 1 minute or until lobster has changed color. Add mayonnaise and cook for another minute or so until fully heated through. Let cool for a minute or so. Place lobster on bun and top with lettuce. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Thaw the puff pastry according to the package instructions. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a 12-inch square. Line a tart pan with removable sides with the dough. Scatter half of the pesto over the dough. Scatter half of the tomatoes over the pesto. Drizzle with the balsamic vinegar. Scatter the mozzarella cheese over the top. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Cool completely before slicing. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place steaks in a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Combine the remaining ingredientspour over steaks. Bake uncovered 40-45 minutes or until a thermometer reads 145 degrees for medium rare. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium bowl, combine 2 1/2 cups granulated sugar and 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon. Set aside. Mix together 1 package yellow cake mix and 1 cup water in a small bowl. Pour into greased mini cupcake pan. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in preheated oven. Cool 10 minutes in pan. Turn out onto cooling rack to cool completely. Make icing: In a medium bowl combine 1/3 cup vegetable oil and 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg. Beat until smooth. Add 1 cup confectioners sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Beat until smooth. Dip mini cupcakes into icing and place in a paper liner. Decorate with mini candy cane and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Combine 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper in a large bowl. Beat in 4 large eggs until smooth. Add 1 cup creamed corn. Stir in 2 tablespoons melted butter. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls into hot oil in a large skillet. Fry for 1/2 to 1 minute, turning once. Serve hot.

To make the sauce, combine all the sauce ingredients in a small bowl, then set aside to allow the flavors to infuse for about 30 minutes. To make the skewers, combine all the skewer ingredients in a bowl, then set aside to allow the flavors to infuse for about 20 minutes. Thread the mushroom on bamboo skewers, then grill or barbecue until lightly charred and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes on each side. Serve immediately, drizzled with the sauce and sprinkled with coriander leaves.
Mix all ingredients. Pour over pork. Bake 350f 3-1/2 hours. Turn roast and baste 45 min. more. Serve with baked beans.

In a large saucepan, heat the wine and the water over medium heat until boiling. Reduce the heat to low. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer until the sugar has dissolved completely. Ladle the wassail into mugs and serve hot.

Cream butter and shortening. Add vanilla. Beat in eggs. Add salt and vanilla. Add flour and mix well. Chill for 30 minutes. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Line cookie sheet with wax paper. Roll out dough. Cut with cookie cutters. Bake 5 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Decorate with candy sprinkles.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the milk, biscuit mix, and salt. Cook and stir for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the beaten egg. Fill a 9x13x2-inch baking dish half full with mixture. Arrange asparagus and onion over mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Pour remaining mixture over asparagus and onion. Bake, uncovered, for 25 minutes or until golden. Makes 6 servings.
Cut chicken into small cubes or strips. Combine chicken and remaining ingredientstoss and chill overnight. Serve on pumpernickel bread and top with fresh tomato and lettuce.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl, cream together the shortening and peanut butter until smooth. Beat in the white and brown sugars until well mixed. Combine the flour, baking soda, and saltstir into the peanut butter mixture. Beat in the eggs and vanilla until well mixed. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown.
Slice peaches about 3/4 inch thick and arrange on platter. Top with prosciutto and blue cheese and drizzle with balsamic vinegar and fresh ground pepper.

Cook broccoli cuts according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a casserole dish combine broccoli, chicken soup, cheese, garlic powder, pepper and salt. Mix well. In a small bowl combine milk with soy sauce and pour over broccoli mixture. Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is bubbly. Sprinkle with french fried onions.

Melt the butter over low heat. Add the flour and salt and stir for one minute. Stir in the cream until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat. Add the brown sugar. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, combine the rice with the broth and water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then simmer until tender, about 30 minutes. Stir in the beef, ginger, cornstarch mixture, green onions, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in skillet. Saute garlic cloves until lightly browned. Add onion to garlic then add beans. Cook for about 15 minutes. Stir in sour cream just before serving. Serve with cornbread or crackers.

Crush graham wafers and add to bowl. Mix cream cheese, peanut butter, sugar, vanilla extract, eggs, and milk together. Pour over graham wafers and mix well. Pour into pie shells and refrigerate for two hours or until firm. Top with whipped cream or cool whip and drizzle with chocolate syrup or use chocolate chips if desired.

Bring 2 quarts of water to a boil over medium heat. Stir in noodles and cook 2 minutes or until done. Drain noodles. Add the peanut butter to the hot noodle water. Stir until the mixture thickens. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Heat over low heat for 2 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350° F. In a small bowl, cream cream cheese and sugar. Add lemon zest and beat well. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Add flour and beat until smooth. Pour into pie crust. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool and refrigerate. To prepare topping, combine all ingredients and mix well. Spread topping over the cream cheese filling. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes at 350° F. Cool before cutting into wedges.

Heat oven to 375 F. Spray bottom of a 9-inch springform pan with nonstick sprayset aside. In a small bowl combine pecans, sugar and zestset aside. In a large bowl combine cream cheese and butter until smoothset aside. In a small bowl combine biscuits with buttermilkset aside. In a small saucepan combine orange juice and sugarbring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and add cream cheese mixturestir until smooth. Add biscuit mixture and stir until well blended. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with pecan mixturereturn to oven for another 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperaturedust with powdered sugar.
Brush the chops with the vinegar mixture and sprinkle with the seasoning. Roast in the oven for 35 minutes or until the juices run clear. Serve the meat with the tomato mixture.
Dissolve both gelatin packages with water. Combine both gelatin mixtures and stir until dissolved. Add pineapple and marshmallows. Refrigerate until set. Garnish with cherries and cool whip.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans. In a medium bowl combine flour, cocoa powder and baking soda. In a large mixing bowl combine sugar and water. Beat until sugar is dissolved. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Add flour mixture and mix on low. Beat on medium speed for two minutes. Add coffee and mix on low until combined. Pour batter into prepared cake pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until cake springs back when touched lightly. Allow cake to cool completely on a wire rack. In a small bowl combine powdered sugar and milk and stir until smooth. Pour over cake and top with sprinkles.

Pound steaks until 1/4 of an inch thick. Dip steaks into a bowl of whisked eggs. Dip egg-coated steaks into bread crumbs. Place steaks into a 9x13 baking dish. Combine tomatoes with water to make a thick sauce. Spread over steaks. Dot with cheese. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Uncover and bake for an additional 20 minutes or until browned.
Bring milk to a boil. Add vanilla extract and cool whip. Mix thoroughly. Add powdered milk mix. Serve hot or cold.

In a medium bowl combine flour, baking soda, pineapple juice. In a large skillet heat the safflower oil. Spoon pancakes onto hot skillet (1/4 cup batter for each pancake). Cook pancakes for about 30 seconds on each side.

Melt butter in a large bowl in the microwave. Stir in brown sugar. Add nutmeg and cinnamon. Stir well. Add the nuts and mix well. Add water to a thick consistency. Spread evenly in a 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Stir. Bake 5-8 minutes longer or until mixture is bubbly and nuts are golden brown. Cool. Store in an airtight container.

Thread pork pieces on bamboo skewers, alternating with slices of onion. Set aside. Combine red wine, vinegar, soy sauce, gingerroot and garlic in a small bowl. Pour half the marinade over the pork piecesreserve the remaining half for later use. Cover pork kebabs with remaining marinade and allow to marinate for several hours or overnight in refrigerator. Preheat grill or broiler. Cook pork kebabs until well browned and cooked through. Turn once during cooking time. Serve immediately.

In 4 quart saucepan heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garliccook 1 minute stirring constantly. Add cumin, ginger, cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and chicken stock to saucepan. Bring to boil. Cover reduce heat to low. Cook 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir rice frequently to prevent sticking. Remove from heat. Add apricotsstir gently. Cover. Let stand 30 minutes. Serve with green onion garnish if desired.

In a large saucepan cook potatoes and water to cover over medium heat for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Return to saucepan. Add chilies, onion and oil. Cook over medium heat until tender. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Slice onions in half lengthwise, then cut each half into quarters. Pour flour into a pie plate or other shallow container. Beat egg whites in a bowl until frothy. Combine breadcrumbs, italian seasoning, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt in another pie plate or other shallow container. Dip onion rings in flour, then in egg whites, then in breadcrumb mixture, coating each ring well. Place rings in a single layer in an 11 x 7 inch baking pan and spray with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until crisp and browned. Serve hot or warm. Makes 2 dozen rings.

Combine vinegar, oil, apple juice, honey, parsley, basil, mustard and seasonings in a jar with a tight-fitting lid. Shake well. Refrigerate overnight for flavors to blend. Keeps for at least a month in the refrigerator.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add fusillicook for about 6 minutes or until al dentedrain. Combine fusilli, remaining salad ingredients and dressing in a large bowltoss gently but well. Refrigerate for at least two hours before serving. Yields 8 servings.

Place sausage in a large skillet and cook over medium heat until browned. Remove sausage to a bowl and set aside. Cook onion and celery ribs in the rendered fat until the vegetables are tender. Add breads and sage and cook until lightly browned. Add chicken broth and cook until mixture is dry. In a small bowl, beat eggs with a fork. Stir eggs into bread mixture and add sausage and salt and pepper to taste. Pour into a greased casserole dish and bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, mix together cream cheese, sour cream and chicken. Spoon into the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. In a separate bowl, combine onions, parmesan cheese and seasoning salt. Sprinkle mixture over chicken mixture. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Combine sauce and cheese. Prepare crust. Roll out and place on baking sheet. Spread crust with sauce and cheese. Bake 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Cut each string cheese into 4 slices. Arrange on top of cheese. Sprinkle with parmesan. Bake 5 more minutes. Serve hot.

Mix all the turkey burger ingredients together in a bowl until combined well. Divide the turkey mixture into four equal portions. Shape each portion into a patty. Sprinkle panko breadcrumbs on a plate or shallow dish. Dip each burger in the breadcrumbs until coated all over, then place on another plate or tray. Continue dipping and coating each burger until all are done. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat for about 3 minutes. Add burgers to skillet and cook until browned on both sides, about 4 minutes on each side. Serve on buns with sour cream and lettuce leaves or tomato slices and condiments.

In medium saucepan heat oil. Cook chops in hot oil 5 minutes on each side. Remove chops from pan and set aside in warm place. In pan that was used for chops brown mushrooms in butter, cook 5 minutes or until tender. Add 1/4 cup water to pan and bring to boil. Stir in 1/4 cup soup and garlic. Cook 1 minute until thickened. Spoon sauce over chops and serve with green beans. Makes 4 servings.

Place chicken in a large bowl. Add black beans, gingerroot, lime zest and juice, and 1/2 teaspoon of each of the salt and garlic. Mix well. Let marinate for 10 minutes at room temperature. Thread chicken onto 8 metal skewers. Arrange skewers on a baking sheet and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the chicken is just done. Place mango and onion in a small bowl. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon garlic. Toss lightly. Serve chicken with salsa.

Prepare crust by combining graham cracker crumbs, melted margarine and sugar. Press firmly and evenly on bottom and up the sides of 9 inch springform pan. Bake at 350 for 7 minutes. Let cool slightly before filling. Blend cottage cheese and sour cream until smooth. Blend in egg substitute and lemon juice and rind. Stir in sugar free vanilla pudding until well blended. Pour filling into the pan and bake for 50 minutes or until set. Chill and garnish with strawberries or fresh raspberries.

Cook broth in saucepan on medium heat until boiling. Reduce heat to low and add barley. Simmer 40 to 50 minutes until tender. Meanwhile, heat oil in frying pan on medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until tender, about 5 to 8 minutes. Stir in soy sauce. Add to cooked barley. Stir until heated through.

Combine all ingredients except cheese in a large salad bowl. Toss until blended. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. Sprinkle with cheese just before serving. Can be made up to 4 hours ahead of time. Toss again just before serving.

Melt butter over medium heat in a large pot or dutch oven. Saute onion until softened about 3 minutes. Add zucchini, salt and pepper. Cook 1 minute stirring occasionally. Stir in stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 20-25 minutes until zucchini is tender. Stir in fresh oregano. Ladle into bowls and top with plain yogurt.

Cut plum tomato in half. Remove the seeds. Cut tomato halves into small pieces. Peel and cut the onion. Wash the basil leaves. Boil the eggs. Grind the paprika. Heat the olive oil. Add the garlic. Fry for 1 minute. Add the tomato pieces. Fry for 5 minutes. Add the onion. Fry for 5 minutes. Add the tomato paste. Fry for 5 minutes. Add the basil leaves. Fry for 2 minutes. Add the eggs. Fry for 5 minutes. Add the boiled eggs. Fry for 5 minutes. Sprinkle the paprika. Salt to taste. Serve the hot.
Combine first 5 ingredients in a small bowl. Mix well. Store in an airtight container. Sprinkle on ribs before grilling.

Combine flour and butter with water. Let stand 1 minute. Beat in mustard and cayenne. Add eggs, one at a time, beating until mixture is smooth and shiny. Drop by the teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheet and bake at 425 for 12-15 minutes or until puffed and lightly browned. Cool on baking sheet for 1 minute. Remove with a metal spatula and transfer to cooling rack. Cool completely and then sprinkle with cheese. Makes about 4 dozen.

Combine first six ingredients in bowl. Stir in pineapple juice and vanilla extract. Spread onto wax paper in thin layer and chill until firm. Cut into squares. Arrange apples on platter and drizzle with some of the pineapple juice from bowl. Top with dip.

Spray pie plate with nonstick cooking spray. Press crumbs firmly onto bottom of pie platebake 12 minutes. Let cool. Dissolve gelatin in boiling watercool slightly. Add raspberry yogurt to gelatin mixturestir to blend. Spoon into pie crustfreeze 2 hours to set. Top with whipped toppinggarnish with raspberries. Makes 8 servings.

Combine dry ingredients (flour, salt, baking powder, sugar). Mix well. In a separate bowl combine milk, oil, egg, maple syrup and cinnamon. Stir into dry ingredients just until combined. Fill greased muffin cups with batter (about half full). Bake at 400 for 20-22 minutes or until muffins are golden brown and a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes on wire rack before removing from pan. Makes 8-12 muffins.

Combine green bell peppers, yellow bell peppers, red bell peppers and 1/3 cup of olive oiltoss to coat. Lay vegetables out on large baking sheet. Roast in oven 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) 20 minutes. Combine vegetables with remaining 1/3 cup olive oil. Season with garlic cloves, salt, and pepper. Chop 1 pepperoncini pepper and 2 green onions. Add to vegetables. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve over lettuce leaves.

Boil mung beans in plenty of water until tender. Add the vegetable oil and stir-fry the garlic and chilies until fragrant. Add onions and cook for a few minutes. Add the soy sauce and fresh ginger. Cook for 1-2 more minutes. Add mung beans, stir and simmer until liquid is absorbed and beans are dry. Add coconut milk and cook for 3-4 minutes until beans are creamy and thick. Serve with fresh chard.

In a large skillet saute garlic and crushed red pepper flakes in olive oil until tender. Stir in milk. Cook for 1 minute more. Stir in pasta. Cook over medium heat for 8-10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Stir in tomatoes and parsley. Sprinkle with cheese. Stir in vodka. Continue cooking for 2 minutes more. Serve immediately.

Sprinkle pork chops with brown sugar and pepper. Place pork chops into 13 x 9 glass baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over pork chops. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until pork is tender. Serve over hot cooked rice. Garnish with green onions. Serves 4-6.

Place carrots in a pot of cold water and bring to a boil. Lower heat to simmer. Cover and cook until carrots are tender. Drain carrots. In a small bowl, combine ginger and onion. Heat oil in another pan and cook onion and ginger until soft. Add carrots and stock. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for about 30 minutes or until carrots are tender. Add the curry powder, salt and pepper. Add the coconut milk and heat thoroughly.

In a small pan heat oil and garlic over medium heat for 5-10 minutes. Cut potatoes into quarters. Toss with oil mixture. Place cut side down onto baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle cheese over potatoes. Bake for 5 more minutes. In a small bowl mix breadcrumbs with paprika. Sprinkle over top of potatoes and bake for 5 more minutes. Serve.

In small saucepan melt butteradd onioncook and stir 3-4 minutes or until softenedstir in soupcook 2 minutes or until heated throughstir in milkbring to a boilreduce heatsimmer 10 minutesstir in tomato. Cook linguine according to package directionsdrainreturn to saucepanstir in tomato mixturestir in fishheat throughserve over linguinegarnish with basil leaves.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a small saucepan, combine milk and butter. Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Place phyllo sheets on a lightly floured surface and cover with a slightly damp towel to keep from drying out. Remove 1 sheet at a time and brush with the milk mixture. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of the cheese. Lay the second sheet on top and brush with the milk mixture. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of the cheese. Continue layering the sheets and cheese until you have used 5 sheets and 3 tablespoons of the cheese. Cut the stack into 1-inch squares and place in muffin pan cups, leaving space in the middle to allow for the apple filling. Top each square with a piece of ham and an apple slice. Brush the top of each square with milk and sprinkle with the cracker crumbs. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large bowl, mix together milk and egg until blended. Add cheese and mix well. Pour into greased 9 inch pie pan. Bake for 30 minutes at 350f or until golden brown. While crust is baking, fry bacon until crisp. Crumble bacon and set aside. When crust is done baking, remove from oven and sprinkle bacon over top of crust. Cool completely before slicing. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 400. Line rimmed baking sheet with foil. Beat milk in a shallow dish. In another shallow dish add breadcrumbs. Dip chicken in milk then in breadcrumbs. Place chicken in single layer in baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes. While chicken is baking in oven, in small bowl whisk together garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper. In non-stick skillet over medium heat add oil. Cook chicken for 2 minutes per side. Toss chicken in bowl with garlic powder mixture. Bake for additional 5 minutes or until sauce thickens. Serve immediately.

Season the meat with salt and pepper. Place all seasonings in a small plastic bag and rub onto meat all over. Place roast in crockpot with seasoning bag. Pour red wine over the meat and sprinkle carrots and mushrooms around the roast and in the wine. Pour in enough water to cover meat by 1 inch. Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours until tender. Remove meat and vegetables and set aside to cool slightly. Remove meat from the bone and shred with two forks. Skim the fat from the broth and use for gravy if desired. Return shredded meat to the broth and heat through in crock pot for a few minutes until warmed through. Serve with mashed potatoes and vegetables or just the meat and gravy over bread.

Heat oil over medium heat in large skillet. Add onion, garlic and bay leaf and saute until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and simmer until thick and reduced by half. Add curry powder and salt and simmer 2 minutes. Add chicken and cook for about 10 minutes or until cooked through. Add coconut milk and simmer until heated through, about 2 minutes. Remove bay leaf and stir in lemon juice. Serve over rice or noodles

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In medium bowl, combine carrots with brown sugar, salt, butter, mustard and honeytoss until carrots are coated with mixture. Place carrots on baking sheet with parchment paper. Bake for 20 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven and toss with parsley. Serve warm or cold. Serves 4

In a large sauce pan, add the olive oil and garlic and heat over medium heat. Cook until the garlic is browned. Add the macaroni and stir until it is lightly coated. Add the zucchini and cook for 10 more minutes. Stir in the breadcrumbs and cook for 1 minute. Add the milk and cook until the mixture comes to a boil. Add the corn and cook until the mixture comes to a boil. Add the cheese and cook until it is melted. Remove from the heat and stir in the basil. Serve over cooked pasta.

Mix cornstarch and lemon pepper in a shallow bowl. Place the salsa in a separate shallow bowl. Pat the fish dry. Spray fish with garlic-flavored non-stick spray. Dip fish in cornstarch mixture. Dip in the salsa. Broil or grill. Serve with honey mustard and horseradish.

In a bowl combine all crust ingredients. Press into a 9 inch pie pan. Bake 15 minutes. Cool. In a large bowl combine the eggs, lemon juice and lemon zest. Beat well. Pour into cooled crust. Bake 20 minutes. Cool completely. Refrigerate overnight.

Heat oven to 450 degrees f. In a small bowl, combine broth and salt. Bring broth and rice to boiling in a heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cook covered, stirring occasionally, until rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed, about 40 minutes. Transfer rice to a large bowl. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onionsaute until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Add onions to rice mixture. Add freshly chopped parsley. Stir gently to mix. Transfer rice mixture to a 13x9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake until lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 9 x 13 baking pan. In a small bowl combine the brown sugar, margarine and almonds. Crumble mixture over buttermilk biscuits in baking pan. Combine coffee with hot water. Drizzle over biscuit mixture. Bake 30-35 minutes. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.
Cut the beans to bite-sized pieces. Combine the remaining ingredients. Add the beans and stir well. Cook for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with garam masala or lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease 2 loaf pans. Cream buttergradually add sugar until well blended. Beat in egg, buttermilk. Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Gradually add to butter mixture. Stir in walnuts. Stir in raisins. Spoon into prepared pans. Bake 50-60 minutes. Cool in pans 10 minutes. Remove from pans to wire racks. Cool completely. Makes 2 loaves.

Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a frypan over medium heat. Add the rindless bacon. Cook until crispy. Remove with a slotted spoon. Add the mushrooms. Cook for 2 minutes, then add the cabbage. Cook for another minute. Season with salt and pepper. Add the spring onion. Drizzle over the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Serve.

Sauté bacon until crisp in a large Dutch oven. Remove bacon from pot with a slotted spoon and set aside. Add ham to drippings in the pot and sauté until browned on all sides. Add the onions and sauté until tender. Add the cream of chicken soup and the chicken noodle soup. Add the thyme leaves. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Add the milk and simmer for a few minutes until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with the crumbled bacon, cooked hard-cooked eggs, and chopped green beans. Serve with a side of crackers.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place slices in 11x7x1-inch baking dish. In small saucepan, combine cream and chicken broth. Heat to boiling over medium-high heat. Pour over potatoesstir to coat. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered 45-55 minutes or until tender and golden brown.

Pour the coconut milk into a saucepan and add the brown and white sugars. Cook over medium high heat until the mixture boils and starts to thicken. Add the vanilla extract and cook for about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool for 30 minutes. Form into small balls. Melt chocolate chips and dip the coquitos into the chocolate. Place the coquitos on wax paper and sprinkle the coconut over the top. Refrigerate until the chocolate hardens.

Cook chicken breasts in boiling water until done. Remove from water and allow to cool. Cut into cubes. Saute onions in butter. Add chicken broth and soup mix. Cook for about a minute or until soup mix has thickened. Add milk and cream of mushroom soup. Cook until bubbly. Add chicken and veggies. Remove from heat. Preheat oven to 375. Roll out pie crust and place into a pie dish. Pour the filling into the dish. Top with more pie crust. Pinch edges together. Crimp edges together. Brush top of pie with milk. Sprinkle with black pepper. Bake for about 30 minutes. Cool. Cut into wedges and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl combine the sugar and baking soda. In a second bowl beat the butter with an electric mixer until fluffy. Add the sugar mixture, vanilla, and oats. Beat until combined. Stir in the flour. Press into a 15x10x1-inch jelly roll pan. Bake for 20-30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into 1 1/2-inch squares. Drizzle with powdered sugar.

Heat oven to 450f. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise. Arrange in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Add 1/2 tsp. salt and 1/4 tsp. hot chili powder to each cut side. Drizzle with 1 tsp. olive oil. Bake for 30 minutes or until the potatoes are soft and the cut sides are browned.
Sauté beef in olive oil. Add onions and saute until cooked. Add all remaining ingredients and simmer for about 30 minutes. Serve on hamburger buns. Serve on hamburger buns.

Place all miso soup ingredients in a small saucepan and heat over medium-high heat until boiling. Cover and simmer for 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat and add enoki mushrooms. Serve hot with tofu and sprinkled with green onions, if desired.

Heat oil in pan. Fry onion and garlic until lightly golden. Add beef mince and break up into small pieces. Cook until browned and then drain. Add tomato paste and dried herbs. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add spaghetti in tomato sauce and water. Stir well. Bring to boil. Then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until most of liquid evaporates. Add frozen peas. Cook for 2 minutes or until heated through. Place mixture into greased dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Mix breadcrumbs with milk. Add more milk if needed to make breadcrumbs stick together. Sprinkle over cheese. Bake in oven for 20 to 25 minutes.

Pre-heat the broiler to high heat and set the rack 3 inches from the heat source. Rinse the clams under cold running water and place in a medium bowl. Pour the white wine over the clams and cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let sit for 15 minutes. Unwrap the clams and pour the liquid into a large saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Cook until the liquid has reduced by half. Discard the clams and pour the liquid through a strainer into a small bowl, then set aside. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat and add the garlic and almonds. Cook for about 3 minutes and add the scallions and parsley and cook for 30 seconds more and then add the clam liquid and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the lemon juice and zest and season with salt and pepper and stir. Serve immediately.

Place chicken in a plastic bag. Add chicken stock, soy sauce and cornstarch. Seal bag and refrigerate 2 hours. Combine flour and seasonings. In a shallow dish combine the vinegar, brown sugar and mustard. Remove chicken from marinade and dip in the mustard mixture. Coat chicken with the flour mixture. Shake off excess. Place in a heated skillet with oil. Fry until lightly browned. Transfer to a serving dish. Pour the remaining marinade over the chicken. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 15 to 20 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Wash cucumbers well and place in large glass jar. Add 1/2 cup pickling salt. Cover with 1 quart boiling water. Cover tightly with lid and let stand 1 hour. Drain well and rinse cucumbers with cool water. Combine onion and pepper in a food processor and process until finely chopped. Combine onion mixture, lime juice, lime zest, garlic, mint leaves, sugar and vinegar in a large bowlmix well. Pack cucumbers into bowl. Cover and refrigerate for 4 days before serving.

Peel pears and cut in half lengthwise. Remove cores from pears with a small spoon. Cut each pear half in half again to form quarters. Place pears in a large saucepan with the orange and lemon juices. Add the crushed pineapple. Sprinkle with the spices and simmer, covered, over low heat for 40 minutes or until the pears are very soft. Stir in the sugar until dissolved. Bring to a boil over high heat and boil until the mixture thickens to a jam consistency, about 20 minutes. Remove the spices before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spread brown sugar on a baking sheet. Place Brie on top of brown sugar. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle with pecans. Serve with crackers.
Cut celery ribs into small pieces. Mix almond butter with dates in a small bowl. Spread almond mixture over celery ribs. Top with a sprinkle of sea salt.

In a small saucepan combine Jello with boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Stir in cold water. Refrigerate 1 hour. Drain pineapple chunks and combine with pineapple juice. Drain mangoes and combine with juice. Spoon Jello into individual glasses. Top with fruit mixture. Garnish with additional fruit. Chill and serve.
In a small bowl combine the lemon juice, soy sauce, sugar and rosemary. Rub over the chops. Heat oil over medium heat until shimmery. Add the chops and cook 2-3 minutes per side. Serve warm.
Combine strawberry vodka and diet 7-up and shake well. Add fresh strawberries and lime slices. Serve in high ball glass with a straw and a slice of lime. Serves 1.

Heat 2 tbsp. water in a small heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add semolina and sugarstir until moistened. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring often until pudding is very thick. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 tbsp. water, 1 tbsp. oil, raisins and cinnamon. Transfer to an 8-inch round glass dish. Press with the back of a spoon to make the top flat. Cool to room temperature. Increase heat to medium-high. Heat the remaining 2 tbsp. water with the remaining 2 tbsp. sugar in a small heavy saucepan over medium-high heat, without stirring, until the sugar caramelizes. Quickly pour the caramel over the halvaswirl to coat evenly. Let cool to room temperature. Cut into wedges.
Mix all ingredients well. Place in refridgerator 30 minutes to 1 hour before serving.

Heat oven to 425 degrees F. Place fish fillets in a shallow dish. Mix mayonnaise, butter, onion, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, old bay seasoning, black pepper, breadcrumbs and milk. Spread mixture on fish fillets. Bake 10 minutes. Turn fish over and bake an additional 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove from oven and sprinkle with additional parmesan cheese if desired. Serve with lemon wedges and hot rice.

Combine sugar, cocoa, milk, margarine, oats, coconut and chocolate chips in large bowl. Beat 1 minute or until crumbly. Shape mixture into 1 inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten each ball slightly. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes or until slightly puffed. Cool 1 minute before removing from cookie sheet. Store in an air-tight container for 1 week or in the freezer for up to 1 month.

In a large skillet heat oil and saute garlic until soft. Add shrimp and saute until done. Sprinkle with rosemary and sherry wine. Season with salt and pepper and hot pepper sauce. Serve hot over rice.

In a large skillet, saute garlic and onion in oil for about 1 minute. Add mushrooms and saute about 2 minutes more. Stir in swiss chard, olives and parmesan cheese. Cook for about 2 minutes more. Drain pasta and add to vegetable mixture. Toss lightly with sour cream and season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 350. Beat egg whites on high speed until stiff. Beat in sugar 1 tsp at a time. Fold in lemon zest. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake 10-15 minutes until edges are golden. Cool on wire racks. To make the meringue topping, beat egg whites, cream of tartar and vanilla in a mixing bowl until foamy. Gradually add the sugar 1/4 cup at a time. Beat until stiff peaks form. Spread meringue over cooled cookies. Bake 3-4 minutes more or until meringue is browned. Cool completely. Makes 36 cookies.

Cook macaroni in boiling water 9 minutes. Drain well. Melt butter in large saucepan over low heat. Add flour. Stir until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Cook over low heat 5 minutes or till thickened, stirring constantly. Add Cheddar cheese. Cook 5 minutes. Add macaroni. Stir till coated. Remove from heat. Stir in Mozzarella cheese. Spoon into 2 quart casserole dish. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake 5 minutes longer. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve warm.

Cut chicken into 1-inch chunks. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and garlic and cook until chicken is cooked through, about 7 minutes. Add broth and crushed red pepper flakes and simmer until chicken is tender, about 5 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Shred chicken with two forks. Season with salt to taste.

Cook pasta according to directions. Brown ground beef with garlic. Add spaghetti sauce and simmer 10 minutes. Add cottage cheese and mix until heated through. Add pasta and cheese and mix well. Sprinkle with parsley if desired. Serve with crackers or bread.
Cream together butter and powdered sugar. Add coconut and mix well. Add chocolate squares and mix well. Drop mixture by tablespoonfuls on waxed paper.

Mix cake mix as directed and pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Bake 15-20 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool. Meanwhile, mix pudding as directed. Let set. Cut cake into bars and frost with the pudding mixture.
Combine seafood with cream cheese. Add cocktail sauce to desired consistency. Serve on crackers for a delicious treat.

Place crescent rolls in a 9x13 pan. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of cranberry sauce on each roll. Cut brie in half and place one half on top of each roll. Bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes or until crescent rolls are golden brown. Top with pecans and drizzle with additional cranberry sauce.

Beat eggs with milk or water, sugar, lemon zest, lemon juice and a little salt and freshly ground pepper. Combine sour cream, mayonnaise and seasonings to taste. Pour over egg mixture and mix well. Pour into a serving dish. Garnish with lemon zest and chopped fresh herbs. Serve warm or cold. Serves 2

In a large skillet over high heat, cook the swiss chard in the olive oil for about 3 minutes. Add the butter beans to the skilletcook for about 5 minutes. Add the hot pepper saucecook for about 1 minute. Salt to taste. Serve over brown rice.

Heat oil in large pot. Add onions and cook over medium heat until soft. Stir in diced tomatoes. Bring to boiling. Add pinto beans. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add lima beans, water and brown sugar. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add kidney beans. Continue to simmer until limas are tender.

Rinse fillet of sole and pat dry with paper towel. Sprinkle with salt & pepper. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease an oven proof dish and lay sole on bottom of dish. Squeeze lemon juice over sole and sprinkle with rosemary and scallions. Place mushrooms on top of sole and pour in white wine. Bake uncovered in preheated oven for about 15 minutes or until sole flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle with parsley just before serving. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a large bowl combine oil, lemon juice, mustard, garlic, lemon peel, salt and pepper to taste. In another bowl toss penne with lemon mixture. Chill for 2 hours or overnight. To serve, place penne mixture in the bowl. Add tomatoes, bell peppers and green onion. Top with feta cheese.

Cook cauliflower in boiling water in a large pot for 5 to 8 minutes until just tenderdrain well. In a large stockpot over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in onion and cook for 1 minuteadd flour and cook for 1 minute longer. Stir in half-and-half and chicken brothbring to a boil and reduce heat to medium-low. Add cauliflower and bell peppercook for 3 minutes. Add lemon peel and dill weedstir well. Add imitation crabmeatcook for 2 minutes longer. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bring to boil water in sauce pan. Add in raisins and reduce heat to medium. Cook for 10 minutes or until raisins are plump. Drain and cool. In a medium bowl, combine the apples, raisins and 1/4 of the cinnamon sugar. Butter the bread on one side. Slice the bread in half lengthwise. Add the apple mixture and spread out evenly. Add the remaining 1/4 cinnamon sugar. Spread the butter over the tops and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until the tops are golden brown.
Mash avocados and combine well with sour cream and mayonnaise. Stir in salsa and seasonings and mix well. Chill until serving time. Garnish with chopped fresh chives before serving.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Scrub the sweet potatoes and cut them into bite size pieces. Toss the potatoes with the butter until they are evenly coated. Place the potatoes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake the potatoes for 20 to 30 minutes or until they are tender. Scoop out the potatoes and place them in a bowl. Add the butter, stock, brown sugar, chipotle chile in adobo, adobo sauce, salt, and pepper. Mash the potatoes until they are smooth. Serve the mashed potatoes with a garnish of parsley.

Soak the gelatin according to package directions. Combine milk and gelatin mixture in a small pot and cook over medium heat until gelatin is dissolved. Cool to room temperature and add the coconut. Chill until the mixture sets up. Combine the sweetened condensed milk, vanilla extract and decorator sugar. Stir until well blended. Fold into the coconut mixture until well blended. Chill until very firm. Form into a log shape and roll in decorator sugar. Decorate with slivered almonds if desired. This recipe is easy enough to make a day ahead of time. It keeps well in the refrigerator for several days.

Bring the butter and feta to a boil in a medium non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Once the cheese starts to melt, add the garlic and cook for a minute. Remove from heat and let cool. Spread butter mixture over each half of pita bread round. Layer with lettuce, tomato and cucumber. Serve with plain yogurt.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel and cut parsnips into 1/2-inch rounds. Toss in a large bowl with shallots and garlic. Add olive oil and honey. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Arrange in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Roast until golden brown and tender, about 1 hour. Stir halfway through. Garnish with fresh mint and sage. Serve hot or at room temperature.

In a large skillet cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Crumble. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a 13x9 inch baking dish combine the bacon, biscuits and cheese. In a medium bowl beat the eggs until frothy. Stir in the sour cream, salt, pepper and green onion. Pour over the biscuit mixturecover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle with chopped green onion before serving. Makes 10 servings.
Mix all ingredients together and bake for 45 minutes at 375.

Boil potatoes in a pot of boiling water 10 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes and mash with milk and butter. Add ham and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir together the flour and red pepper flakesstir into the soup and cook, stirring constantly until thickened and bubbly. Serve immediately and sprinkle with the cheese.

Brown bacon in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain on paper towelsset aside. Cook garlic in bacon drippings in the same skillet over medium heat until garlic is golden brown, about 1 minute. Cut chicken breast halves in half horizontally to form two large chicken breast filletscut each fillet into two pieces. Add chicken to skilletcook until chicken is browned on both sides. Add chicken brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and cook until chicken is done, about 10 minutes. Stir in cilantrocoverremove from heat. Stir in green chiliescook 1 minute longer. Stir in creamcook over medium heat until heated through. Top with cheesecovercook just until cheese is melted. Yields 4 servings (2 cups). Serve with rice.

1. In a small bowl combine all ingredients except meat and bread.2. Mix together well.3. Grease a 9x5 loaf pan and pack mixture into pan.4. Bake for 50-60 minutes.5. Cool for 10 minutes. Serve and enjoy.

Boil the potatoes until they are tender and allow to cool. Peel and mash them well. Add the onion and mix thoroughly. Beat the egg yolks and add to the potato mixture along with the olive oil and the cracker crumbs. Beat the egg whites until stiff and fold into the potato mixture. Heat oven to 350 f. Grease a cookie sheet lightly and turn out the mixture onto it. Spread lightly with the spatula and bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot or cold with any sauce of your choice or with the salad dressing.
Pour all into a highball glass over ice. Add soda water to fill glass. Stir well and serve.
Combine all ingredients in crockpot and cook all day. Serve with rice noodles and top with peanuts.

Combine herbs in a small bowl. Dip chicken in flour, then egg wash, then in bread crumb mixture. Place on a baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Serve with lemon wedges.

In large pot add all the ingredients except the mussels. Cover the mussels with the steaming liquid and cover the pot. Cook for 45 minutes until the mussels are open and the liquid is thickened. Remove the bay leaf before serving the mussels with the liquid.

Prepare blueberry gelatin as directed on package. Add 1 cup cold water to each 4-serving package of berry gelatinstir until dissolved. Add 1 cup cold water to each 3-serving pineapple gelatinstir until dissolved. Add blueberries to 1 cup of warm water and set aside for 5 minutesdrain off excess water. Stir gelatins into blueberry mixture until blendedpour into 9 inch pie plate or 8 inch square pan. Refrigerate until firmabout 3 hours. Prepare pineapple gelatin as directed on packagefold in crushed pineapple. Cut blueberry ring into 4 wedgestop with pineapple mixture. Refrigerate until firmabout 2 hours.
Mix the tuna with the milk and cornstarch in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spread over toast. Chill for 30 minutes before serving.

Boil water in a pot with the banana leaves then add sago to the pot of boiling water and cook for 15 minutes stirring constantly until sago is soft and tender then add coconut milk to the sago then stir to mix well and continue cooking until the mixture is thickened and cooked then add sugar to the mixture and stir well then add slices of bananas and cook for 5 minutes until cooked then remove from heat and serve.

Mix together ham, potatoes, butter and green peppers. Add onion and flour. Cook 2 minutes. Add milk and mustard powder. Cook until thick. Add cheddar cheese. Bake in a casserole at 350 for 45 minutes.

Combine sugar and water in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly until sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute or until a small amount of syrup dropped into a cup of cold water forms a soft ball when dropped into it (238 degrees F). Remove from heat. Stir in cream of tartar and flavoring and food coloring. Pour into molds or onto wax paper and let cool completely. When hardened, remove lollipops from the molds or paper and store in an airtight container.
Combine soy sauce, whiskey, brown sugar, garlic in a pan. Add salmon fillets. Cover tightly. Simmer 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Prepare gelatin according to package directions, except omit sugar. Add enough boiling water to dissolve gelatin completely. Refrigerate until partially set. Spoon ice cream into pie shell. Spoon gelatin mixture over ice creamspread with a knife. Refrigerate for several hours or until set. Top with whipped topping and strawberries.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook sausage until browned, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon. In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, and pepper. In another bowl combine potato, green onions, and cheese. Lightly spray two 8-inch square baking dishes with cooking spray. Divide sausage into two equal portions and place into baking dishes. Top each with potato mixture. Pour egg mixture over potatoes. Bake 15 minutes or until top is set. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Place tortellini in a medium saucepan. Add enough water just to cover tortellini. Bring to a boil. Cook for 4 minutes. Drain tortellini and return to pan. Add parsley and virgin olive oil. Stir until well coated. Stir in parmesan cheese. Add lemon juice. Season to taste. Let stand 30 minutes before serving.
Put feta in airtight container. Add olive oil, herbs, garlic cloves, lemon juice, peppercorns and poppy seeds. Toss well to coat. Marinate at least 6 hours. Drain before serving.

Beat the heavy whipping cream with a whisk until soft peaks form. Add the vanilla extract and powdered sugar and continue whisking until it forms stiff peaks. Add the nutmeg. Use for frosting, topping for cakes or on ice cream.
Combine all ingredients in large bowl and toss well. Serve over salad greens with grilled chicken or fish.

Boil water and add macaroni and cook until done. Drain and set aside. Add soup and water to macaroni. Add cheese and mix well. Add oregano and garlic salt and stir. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve.

In a medium saucepan, combine all of the ingredients and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes. Let the mixture cool for a few minutes and then pour it over the herring in the jars and seal. Let the pickled herring sit for at least two hours before serving. The pickled herring will keep for at least a week if stored in the refrigerator.

Spread both sides of each slice of bread with butter. On one slice spread a thin layer of dijon mustard. Top with swiss cheese slice and top with a slice of pastrami. Top with another slice of swiss cheese. Place sandwich in toaster oven or regular oven. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until cheese has melted. Serve with a pickle spear or potato chips if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Slice apples thinly and add to a large skillet. Add brown sugar and stir to combine. Add cinnamon and stir. Add lemon juice and continue to cook until apples are tender but still firm. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Place one wonton wrapper in the palm of your hand and add a small amount of apple mixture to the center. Brush the edges of the wrapper with water and fold over and press down to seal. Repeat with remaining wontons. Place on a lightly greased cookie sheet and bake for 5-7 minutes until golden brown. Remove from oven and dust with powdered sugar.

Combine tomatoes, onion, garlic cloves, water, salt and pepper in a blender or food processor. Pulse to form a smooth sauce. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the pork. Cook until browned, about 5 minutes per side. Add 1 cup of the tomato sauce. Cover and cook until the pork is tender, about 20 minutes. Add the remaining tomato sauce, cover and cook until the sauce has thickened slightly and the flavors have melded together, about 5 minutes.
Mix together all ingredients. Form into 2 inch balls. Brown in butter. Simmer in sauce.
Chop broccoli into small pieces. Mix the eggs in a separate bowl. Dip broccoli in eggs then roll in breadcrumbs. Deep fry until golden brown. Drain. Salt and pepper to taste.

In a large bowl with an electric mixer beat together butter and sugar until creamy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Mix in vanilla. Sift together flour, cocoa, soda and saltadd to butter mixture alternately with white chocolate chips. Spread in a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Bake at 350 for 22-24 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 2 minutesremove from pan while still hot. Cut into squarescool completely on wire rack.

Mix together flour and sugar. Cut in margarine until mixture is crumbly. Add eggs and vanillamix well. Add milk and beat until smooth and creamy. Pour into greased pie plate or custard cup. Bake at 325f for 20 minutes or until edges are lightly browned and center is set.

Line a 15 x 10 x 1 inch jelly roll pan or half sheet pan with foil or parchment paper. Melt semisweet chocolate in double broiler over hot water or in microwave. Stir in white chocolate. Spread mixture evenly over pan. Sprinkle with almonds. Let stand 1 hour at room temperature or until chocolate is set. Break into pieces. Store in plastic bag.
Mix cheeses, spread on bread and broil. Spread apricot on half, cover with cucumber and top with swiss cheese. Broil until melted.

In a large skillet with an ovenproof handle, heat 2 teaspoons of the olive oil and 2 teaspoons of the butter over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and crushed red-pepper flakes and saut for 2 minutes. Add the fennel seed and continue to saute for 2 more minutes. Add the tomato, and saute for another minute. Add the tuna and its liquid and season with the sea salt. Stir well to combine. Transfer to a plate and keep warm. Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling water, cook the linguine according to the directions on the package. Drain the pasta, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking water. Add the linguine to the skillet with the tuna and toss well to coat. Add enough of the reserved water to moisten the pasta. Season with the lemon zest and parsley. Sprinkle with the remaining 2 teaspoons of olive oil. Transfer to a serving platter. Serve immediately.

Grease and flour a 12 cup bundt pan. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine cake mix, pudding mix and 3/4 cup water in a large bowl. Beat 2 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup chocolate chips and 1/2 cup fat free sour cream. Pour into prepared bundt pan. Bake 55 minutes. Cool on wire rack. To make icing, stir together 1/4 cup milk and 1/4 cup vegetable oil. Add powdered sugar 1 cup at a time and beat until smooth. Add 1 tablespoon fat free sour cream and beat until smooth. Drizzle over cooled cake. Top with more chocolate chips.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut the ends off brussel sprouts and slice each in half. Slice mushrooms into halves. Mix brussel sprouts, mushrooms, mayonnaise, lemon juice, celery salt and parmesan cheese together. Place mixture in a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle almonds over the top. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

In a large salad bowl add tomatoes, cucumbers, green bell peppers, red bell peppers, yellow onion, parsley and feta cheese. Toss well. In a small bowl whisk together oil, vinegar, and oreganoseason with salt and pepper to taste. Pour dressing over salad. Toss well.

Sieve together the flour and bicarbonate of soda. Melt the butter in a pan and add the sugar and vanilla. Beat until smooth and creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Fold in the flour mixture and the cocoa powder. Add the nuts and sultanas. Line a 1lb loaf tin and bake in a preheated oven for 40-50 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Sift the icing sugar and melt the chocolate. Mix until smooth and spread over the top of the cooled fudge cake. Leave to set. Cut into slices and serve.

In a large bowl dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes. Add salt and mix well. Add flour and olive oil and knead until smooth. Place dough into greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise for an hour or until doubled in size. Punch down and roll out into a rectangle about 1/4-inch thick and 6 inches wide and about 20 inches long. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Roll up as you would jelly roll and pinch edges together. Place seam-side down on greased cookie sheet and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise until doubled again. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until golden brown.

In a small bowl or measuring cup, combine grapes, cilantro and honey and mix well. In a separate bowl, add lemon and lime juices and salad oil and whisk well. Slowly pour oil mixture into the grapes and cilantro mixture and stir well. Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving. Serve over fresh salad greens.

Dissolve yeast in 1/2 cup warm water. Mix with 3 cups of the flour. Add shortening and salt. Mix well. Add remaining flour to form soft dough. Knead 10 minutes. Place in a greased bowl. Cover and let rise until doubled. Punch down and let rest 10 minutes. Shape into a loaf and place in greased 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. Let rise until doubled. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Turn out onto wire rack and cool.

Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add the peanut butter and stir until smooth. Add the graham cracker crumbs to the mixture. Press the mixture into a 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 15 minutes. When the bars are baked, sprinkle chocolate chips on top. Put the pan under the broiler for 2-3 minutes until the chocolate chips have melted. Allow to cool. Cut into bars.

Heat olive oil and fry onion and garlic until soft and golden brown. Add pepper and tomatoes and fry until soft. Add tomato puree and simmer until slightly reduced. Crack eggs into the pan and simmer until eggs are cooked and yolks are set. Season with paprika and serve immediately with some crusty French bread and feta cheese. Serves 4 to 6 as part of brunch or lunch.

In small bowl combine chili powder, cumin, thyme, sugar and saltrub evenly over both sides of lamb chops. Place in large resealable plastic bag or shallow dish and refrigerate 2 hours or overnight, turning occasionally to marinate evenly. Preheat grill for high heat (450° to 500°). Grill chops 3 to 4 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Transfer to clean cutting board and drizzle with jellyserve immediately.

Heat oven to 375. In a medium bowl combine eggs and cheddar cheese. In a 12" cast iron skillet heat the spreadable cheese with garlic and herbs in a 12" cast iron skillet over medium high heat. Pour in the egg mixture and stir to combine. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Place in oven and cook for 20 25 minutes or until browned and set. Serve hot.

Preheat grill to high heat. Place bread slices on the grill for 1 to 2 minutes per side or until grill marks appear. Remove from grill. Top each bread slice with 1 slice of ham, 1 slice of cheddar cheese and 2 slices of pepper jack cheese. Place on the grill for 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Top with sliced red onion. Serve with ranch dressing for dipping.

In small bowl combine milk and soup mix. Cook over low heat until warm. Stir in mustard. Cool slightly. In each half of bread spread about 1/4 of mixture. Top with cheese. Wrap in plastic wrap and chill. Unwrap and cut each roll into 6 slices. Makes 6 servings.

Combine the butter and marshmallows in a large pot over low heat. Stir constantly until butter is melted. Remove from heat. Add the cereal and stir until well coated. Press into a buttered 8x8x1-inch pan. Sprinkle with the pumpkin pie spice. Allow to cool. Cut into squares. Serve or store in an airtight container.

Brown ground beef and onion in hot water, drain. Add Hamburger Helper mix and follow package directions. Serve over lettuce and arrange vegetables on top. Drizzle with Italian dressing. Sprinkle with Italian seasoning.

Rinse fish and pat dry. Season fish with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large saut pan over high heat until shimmering. Add fish in a single layer and saute for 2 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Remove fish from pan and set aside. Add lemon juice and zest to pan and cook for 2 minutes or until thickened. Add fish and basil and heat through for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Place rib eye steaks in a bowl. Add the juices of the orange juice, lemon juice, and lime juice. Add the garlic. Marinate in refrigerator overnight. When ready to cook, heat a skillet to medium high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil to the skillet. Place the steaks into the skillet. Cook until done to your liking. Season to taste with cayenne pepper. Serve with your favorite vegetables.

In a small bowl combine flour and beer. Season chicken breast halves with salt. Dip chicken into flour mixture. In a second bowl whisk together egg yolk and water. Dip chicken into egg wash. In a third bowl mix together worcestershire sauce, hot sauce and water. Dip chicken into sauce. In a large frying pan heat oil for 15 minutes. Cook chicken in oil 3 minutes per side. Remove chicken from oil and drain. Serve chicken fingers with hot sauce.
Spray crockpot with nonstick cooking spray. Add all ingredients. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Serve with crackers.

Cut oranges crosswise into thin slices. Cut out a rectangular section from each orange. Carefully scoop out the segments and set aside. Cut apples and grapes into thin strips and remove seeds from grapes. Cut the apple and grapes into long thin strips and press lightly into the oranges. With a sharp knife carve a face on each orange. Fill the face with the reserved segments and sprinkle with the almonds and whole cloves. Serve as is or on ice cream.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large skillet heat oil over medium high heat. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add currant jelly and cook until thickened. Add lemon peel, juice of 1 lemon and gingerroot. Cook 1 minute. Remove from heat and add lemon juice of remaining lemon. Combine mustard, salt and pepper. Rub on lamb. Place on a rack in a shallow baking pan. Bake uncovered for 1 hour or until a thermometer reads 145 degrees when inserted into thickest part. Remove from oven and brush with glaze. Continue cooking for 10 minutes or until lamb reaches desired doneness. Makes 4 servings. Serve with garlic bread.

Strawberry gelatin is found in the frozen food section. In a medium sauce pan combine 1/3 cup cornstarch and 1/4 cup cold water. Stir until there are no lumps. Add in 1 cup strawberry gelatin and stir until dissolved. Add 3 cups water and 1/2 cup white sugar. Cook on medium heat until thickened. Add frozen strawberries and cook until warmed. Remove from heat and let cool. Serve on pancakes.

Slice zucchini lengthwise into thin strips and fry in bacon fat until crisp but not brown. Sprinkle with sugar and baking soda. Add tomatoes and onions and cook for about 10 minutes over medium heat. Arrange zucchini in an oblong baking dish and top with cheese and bacon. Bake in preheated oven until cheese is melted and bacon is crisp. Serve at once.

In a blender combine garlic, cilantro, lemon juice, olive oil, and crushed red pepper flakes and process to a smooth paste. Add the fish fillets and toss to coat both sides. Chill the fish for at least 30 minutes before cooking. Heat olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the fish fillets to the skillet. Cook until fish is done (about 8 minutes) flipping halfway through. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing over the fish to taste.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering but not smoking. Add garlic, swiss chard and red pepper flakes. Cook until greens are wilted and bright green, 2-3 minutes. Add vinegar and salt and pepper to taste. Toss to combine and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Unroll crescent rolls and separate into 4 triangles. Press perforations to seal. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and spread with mayonnaise. Add cheddar cheese and bake 2-3 more minutes until cheese is melted. Remove from oven and top each triangle with 1/2 cup chicken and 1/2 cup broccoli. Bake 5-7 more minutes until crescents are golden brown. Cool slightly and serve.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ham. When the ham is cooked through and slightly crisp, remove from the pan. Add the onions and mushrooms to the pan. Cook until the onions are translucent. Add the bell pepper and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the egg mixture. Cook until set. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from the heat. Stir in the sour cream and ham. Top with the cheddar cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line muffin pan with paper cases. Sift cocoa, cocoa and baking powder into a bowl. Add flour and stir to combine. Add the applesauce, sugar and the butter substitute. Beat the mixture until smooth. Add the baking powder and beat for a further minute. Pour into muffin tin. Bake for 20 minutes or until firm to the touch. Cool on a wire rack. Meanwhile, beat the cream cheese and icing sugar until smooth. Fold in the orange rind. Cut the cooled cakes in half horizontally. Spoon the icing onto the bottom half and sandwich with the top half. Dust with icing sugar to serve.

Drain and crumble 1 block of extra firm silken tofu into a blender or food processor. Add lemon juice and pulse until smooth and fluffy. Add lemon peel and pulse until finely ground. In a bowl beat egg white until stiff. Add sugar and beat until thoroughly blended. Fold into tofu mixture. Spread over crust and freeze until firm, at least 3 hours. Top with frozen whipped dessert topping and garnish with fresh lemon slices.
