In a bowl mix together the mayonnaise, sour cream and curry paste until smooth. Add the celery and apples, mix well. Add the tuna flakes and mix well. Add the parsley and mix well. Season with the salt and pepper and chill until ready to serve.

Preheat the oven to 400F. Toss together the potato, sweet onions, oil, butter, brown sugar, salt, cinnamon. Spread out onto a cookie sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the potato is tender. In a small bowl mix together the pecans and the butter. Serve with the potato.

Cook sausage in skillet until no longer pink. Slice into thin strips. Peel away jalapeno seeds if you do not like the hot taste. Cut jalapenos into thin strips also. In a large bowl combine sausage, jalapenos, corn muffins, pumpkin, chicken broth, dried cranberries and sage. Stir until blended. Pour into a buttered casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees F until heated through. Serve immediately.

In a saucepan over low heat, combine cocoa powder, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg with 1/4 cup of the evaporated milkstir until cocoa is dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in remaining evaporated milk. Pour into a 9 x 13 baking pan or large freezer container. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream. Makes about 10 servings.

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine the lime juice and tequila liqueur in a small dish. Sprinkle the halibut roast with 1/2 tsp of the sea salt and rub it into the meat on both sides. Next rub the fish with the lime juice/tequila liqueur mixture and place it on a broiler pan. Broil 5 inches from the heat for 10 minutes. Turn the fish over and broil for 5 minutes more. Remove from the broiler and serve immediately with the remaining 1/2 tsp of sea salt and lime wedge for garnish. Serves 4.

Prepare Jell-O gelatin dessert according to package directions. Combine with pudding mix and milk in a large bowl. Refrigerate. When set, fold in strawberries. Pour into graham cracker crust. Refrigerate until firm. Garnish with whipped cream.

Bring 3 cups of water and sugar to a boil in a large saucepan. Stir in 4 teaspoons of Tang and return to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in baking soda and pectin. Let mixture cool slightly. Pour into containers and store in refrigerator. Enjoy.

In a 13x9 inch baking dish combine hash browns with enough milk or water to moisten and let stand while you prepare the rest of the ingredients. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook pork sausage until browned and crumbles apart. Drain sausage and place in a large bowl. Add flour and mix well. Stir in milk and cook, stirring frequently until thickened. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour sausage gravy over hash browns in dish and sprinkle with cheddar and green onion. Bake uncovered at 425 for about 20 minutes or until hot and bubbling.

In a large saucepan over low heat, melt the butter. Stir in the flour and stir until smooth. Remove from the heat. Add the water and beat until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Add the pudding and beat until smooth. Pour into a lightly greased 9 inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until puffy. Cool. Fill with cool whip. Drizzle with chocolate syrup.

Cream together the butter and superfine sugar until light and fluffy. Add the vanilla and almond extract. Add the flour and cornstarch and mix until combined. With floured hands, press into a 9 inch square pan. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool before cutting into 2 inch squares.

Mix together the sour cream, mayonnaise, green onion, prepared horseradish, salt and pepper in a bowl. Spread each tortilla with some of the mixture. Arrange roast beef on half of each tortilla. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with lettuce and roll up. Serve with additional horseradish for dipping.

Lightly oil the foil on one side. Place two tilapia fillets on the foil and drizzle with the soy sauce mixture. Sprinkle with the gingerroot and the green onion and sprinkle with the pepper. Fold the foil over and crimp the edges to seal tightly. Bake on a baking sheet for about 10 minutes or until fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork. Serve with steamed rice.

Heat oil and butter together over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add broccoli and cook until tender crisp. Add pasta and cook for 2 minutes. Add cherry tomatoes and cook until pasta is done. Remove from heat and stir in parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the onions and saute until softened, about 10 minutes. Add the bouillon cubes and mix well with the onions. Add the tomato puree, garlic clove, tomatoes, and green pepper. Mix well and let the mixture simmer for about 15 minutes or until the liquid has evaporated. Stir in the shrimp and rice, mix well and let the mixture cook for another 10 minutes. Stir in the fresh parsley and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 2-quart baking dish. Mix together the milk, brown sugar and butter in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat. Add in the oats and stir to combine. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the mixture is bubbly. Sprinkle the top evenly with the apple pieces, then the cream. Return to the oven for an additional 5 minutes.

Mix 1/2 cup shortening with 2 cups flour. Cut in until shortening is the size of small peas. Beat 1 egg lightly with 1/2 cup milk. Pour over flour mixture. Mix lightly with spoon until dough is smooth. On lightly floured board, pat dough into 1/2-inch thickness. Cut dough with dumpling cutter or glass. Place dumplings in boiling water. Cook 10-12 minutes or until dumplings are firm. Drain water from pot. Add 2 cups water. Cover and simmer 10-15 minutes or until dumplings are tender. Stir in 2 tablespoons butter or margarine.

Bring the heavy cream and whole milk to a simmer in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Remove from the heat and add the pumpkin, maple syrup, egg yolks and cinnamon and nutmeg to taste. Whisk vigorously until the mixture is very thick and smooth and then strain through a fine-mesh strainer. Divide between six ramekins. Bake in a water bath until set, about 40 minutes. Serve warm or cold with a dusting of nutmeg or cinnamon.

Place frankfurters in a lightly greased barbecue. Cook until browned on both sides. Remove from barbecue. Cut frankfurters into quarters. Put 2 tablespoons ketchup into a medium bowl. Add soy sauce, vinegar, garlic clove, sugar, dry mustard, tabasco sauce and American cheese. Mix well. Serve hot with frankfurters.

Whisk egg together in shallow dish. Combine cornflour & soy sauce in another dish. Dip chicken breast in egg mixture. Dip in cornflour mixture. Fry in hot oil for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Serve with your favourite dipping sauce.

Combine vinegar and honey in small bowl and mix until blended. Combine mustard and pepper in small bowl and mix until blended. Lay salmon in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with mustard mixture and top each fillet with a whole garlic clove. Drizzle with 1/4 cup vinegar mixture and sprinkle with salt. Cover and chill for 2 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Uncover salmon and bake for 10 minutes. Turn salmon and bake for 5 minutes longer. Remove salmon from oven and drizzle with remaining vinegar mixture. Sprinkle with oregano and serve.

Clean beets thoroughly under running water to remove any gritty soil. Peel beets and grate with grater or cut into very small cubes with sharp knife. Place grated beets in large colander and toss with raisins, sugar, vinegar, oil, lemon juice and salt. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Add lettuce or other greens just before serving.

Heat oven to 400f. Combine chicken and coleslaw mix. Coat 12-inch pizza pan with cooking spray. Place chicken mixture in pan. Sprinkle evenly with sesame seeds and sesame oil. Bake for 25 minutes. Meanwhile combine the stir-fry sauce. Mix well. Serve over chicken mixture. Top with lettuce leaves. Serve with dipping sauce.

In a large bowl, combine milk and pudding mix. Beat until smooth. In a 9-inch pie pan coated with cooking spray, layer half of the graham cracker crumbs. Pour pudding mixture over crumbs. Top with another layer of crumbs. Melt chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in cream cheese until melted. Cool slightly. Spread over top of pie. Refrigerate until firm. Garnish with whipped topping and candy bars. Cut into wedges to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan. Combine chocolate and butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Stir constantly until chocolate and butter are melted and mixture is smooth. Remove from heat and stir in sugar and vanilla. Add eggs one at a time, stirring after each addition. Sift together cocoa, flour and salt. Stir into chocolate mixture. Stir in walnuts. Spread batter in prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack. Cut into squares and enjoy.

In a skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and saute until tender. Stir in the soup and broth. Bring to a boil. Add the stuffing cubes and stir to blend. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Stir in the turkey. Cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days. To bake the dressing, preheat the oven to 350f. Place the dressing into a shallow baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve on soft rolls.

Mix sugar and coffee until dissolved. Add cream. Beat until stiff. Pour into a 9-inch square pan. Sprinkle with shavings. Chill for 2 hours or until firm. Cut into squares. Dip in melted chocolate if desired. Makes 2 dozen squares.

Mix first 2 ingredients. Bring to boil. Add rice. Stir. Bring back to boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer until rice is tender. Add remaining ingredients. Cook until chicken is tender. Remove chicken. Keep broth warm. Shred chicken. Add to broth. Stir. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream sugar and margarine until light. Beat in eggs one at a time. Mix dry ingredients. Stir into margarine mixture alternately with milk. Pour into a 10x5x3 inch loaf pan. Bake 1 hour. Cool 10 minutes. Combine powdered sugar, orange rind and juice. Spread over warm loaf. Sprinkle with walnuts. Cool completely. Makes 12 servings.

Sauté onion in oil until tender. Add chicken breast stripscook and stir until no longer pink. Add cumin and chili powder. Cook until chicken is cooked throughremove from heat. Spread polenta into 1-1/2 quart casserole dish. Top with chicken mixturesprinkle with tomato sauce. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with refried beanssprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Toss squash cubes in olive oil. Drizzle with additional oil if necessary. Sprinkle with seasonings and toss to coat. Add potato cubes and toss. Add onion and toss. Add parsnip and toss. Add brussels sprouts and toss to coat. Spread vegetables on a large jelly roll pan. Place in oven and roast 20 minutes. Turn vegetables and roast another 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease two 9-inch round baking pans or two loaf pans. Cream together butter, sugar, vanilla and eggs in a large bowl until light and fluffy. In a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and saltstir well. Add to creamed mixture alternately with sour cream. Beat until smooth. Stir in bananas, walnuts if desired. Divide batter between pans. Bake 55 to 60 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Loosen breads from pansremove from pans to cool completely on wire racks. Wrap with plastic wrap when coolrefrigerate at least 24 hours before slicing. Slice breads with a sharp serrated knifesprinkle with powdered sugar before serving.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Blend together the eggs and sugar. Add the dates and blend well. Sift together the flour and the baking powder. Add the dry ingredients and the coconut to the date mixture and blend well. Stir in the nuts and vanilla. Turn into a lightly greased 13x9 inch pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool in the pan for 15 minutes. Cut into 6 rows by 4 rows.

Heat cheese and green chilies in microwave until cheese is melted. Stir in half-and-half. Heat half-and-half mixture on medium-low heat until warmed. Stir in green onions. Remove from heat. Stir in cumin. Salt to taste. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with fresh cilantro.

In a medium bowl combine the imitation crabmeat, cream cheese, sour cream and lemon juice, using an electric mixer beat until smooth. Add garlic salt to taste and mix again. Serve with crackers or use on sandwiches. Makes about 4 cups.

Cook hot dogs in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain hot dogs and set aside. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add bacon. Cook bacon until crisp. Drain bacon on a paper towel and crumble into small pieces. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender and lightly browned, about 8 minutes. Add beans, bacon, hot dogs and beer and cook for about 4-5 minutes. Place a tortilla on a plate and spoon about 1/2 cup of the hot dog mixture in the center of the tortilla. Top with lettuce, tomato and cheese and roll up the tortilla tightly. Serve with salsa or sour cream if desired.

Cook rotini pasta as directed. Drain and toss with tomatoes, pepperoni, red kidney beans, and green olives. Combine with italian salad dressing and toss. Place lettuce leaves side by side on large plate. Spoon rotini mixture down the center of each leaf. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings.

Wash and cut quinces into quarters. Place in a large saucepan with water, sugar and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 20-30 minutes or until fruit is tender when pierced with a fork. Let cool slightly. Strain quince mixture through a fine-mesh strainer over a bowl. Measure liquid. For each cup of liquid, add 2/3 cup sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Bring mixture to a boil. Add crystallized ginger. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 10-15 minutes or until desired thickness is reached. Remove from heat. Stir in rose water. Cool completely. Transfer to a clean jar. Refrigerate.

Boil fettuccine per package directions. Meanwhile, cut pepperoni into strips. When the pasta is cooked and drained, combine butter with mushrooms and saute until mushrooms are tender. Add half-and-half and bring to a boil. Add cheese and mix well. Add pasta and mix well. Stir in pepperoni and parsley. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and garlic and cook for 4 minutes or until tender. Stir in broth, water, sugar and seasonings. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cook for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Add tortellini and cook for an additional 7 minutes or until tortellini is tender and soup is thickened. Add tomatoes and cook for an additional 2 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

Cream the butter and sugars in the mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and brandy and continue beating until well blended. Sift in the flour and baking soda and mix on low speed until just combined. Fold in the chips and craisins with a spoon or spatula. Chill dough in the refrigerator for one hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Line baking sheets with parchment paper or spray with cooking spray and place in the oven to preheat while the dough is chilling. When the oven is preheated, scoop the cookie dough by the teaspoonful and place on the prepared baking sheets about two inches apart. Bake for about ten minutes or until the edges are lightly golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool on wire racks.

Preheat the oven to 350°F. Cut the almonds into thin slices with a knife or scissors. In a medium bowl combine the almonds with the butter, fresh rosemary, brown sugar, salt, and ground red pepper. Mix well. Spread the mixture out onto two baking sheets that have been lined with parchment paper or foil. Bake the almonds until lightly toasted, about 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from the oven, let cool, and serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In large bowl, combine potatoes, onion and carrot. In small bowl, combine remaining ingredients and mix well. Add to potato mixture and toss to coat evenly. Spread in shallow baking dish. Bake uncovered 1-1/4 hours or until potatoes are tender. Stirring occasionally

To prepare the marinade, combine the wine, onion and spices in a blender. Puree until smooth. Pour marinade into a large zip lock bag and place steaks in the marinade. Close bag and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Remove steaks from marinade and grill for 10 minutes on each side. Serve with the marinade on the side.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or foil.Wash and dry sweet potatoes. Pierce sweet potatoes with a fork in several places, and place on the baking sheet..Drizzle sweet potatoes with olive oil, and sprinkle with sugar and chili powder..Place in the oven and bake 40 minutes, until the sweet potatoes are golden brown and softened..Remove from the oven and let cool slightly..Serve sweet potatoes warm or at room temperature..

Slice jalapeno pepper lengthwise leaving stem intact. Remove seeds and white membranes from inside of pepper. Place pepper in small bowl with cream cheese. Fold in green onions. Fill pepper halves with cheese mixture. Place stuffed peppers in casserole dish, alternating layers of peppers with pimento strips. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown on top. Serve with sour cream or guacamole, if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a heavy bottomed pot heat butter over medium heat. When butter foams, add blackberries and sugar. Cook for 5 minutes stirring frequently. Add cold water and stir until all sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat. In a medium bowl mix together pinhead oats, pecans, demerara sugar and vanilla essence. Add oat mixture to pot with berries. In an oven proof dish layer the fudge oats and blueberries until you have used up the oats. Bake for 20 minutes until oats are crispy. Serve warm.

Grate zucchini. Cut onion into small pieces. Combine with zucchini in a large bowl. Add Bisquick, eggs, garlic powder, parsley and pepper. Stir well. Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Using a small cookie scoop or heaping tablespoon, place mixture in the skillet to form a thin pancake. Flip once golden brown and cook second side. Drain on paper towel. Repeat for remaining mixture. Serve with warm marinara sauce.

In a medium sized mixing bowl, pour 1/2 cup of grape gelatin into boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add blueberry pie filling, crushed pineapple, cream cheese and sour cream. Blend until smooth. Add sugar, vanilla extract and walnuts. Pour into glass bowl or any other container you want to serve it out of. Let cool to room temperature. Chill for several hours. Serve cold.

Cream butter and cocoa. Stir in condensed milk. Add vanilla. Beat until smooth. Add rum. Pour into buttered 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Spread with melted marshmallows. Cool completely before cutting into squares. Store covered in fridge.
Place cabbage, sauerkraut, onions, tomatoes in slow cooker. Add the remaining ingredients. Cover and cook on high for 8 hours.

Combine dill pickles, onions and cider vinegar in a large bowl. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate until serving time. About one hour before serving, stir in remaining ingredients until blended. Serve with favorite hot dog or sandwich recipe. Makes about 4 cups. Yields about 6 servings.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Butter one baking dish. Blend sweet peas with flour and salt and pepper to taste. Put in baking dish. Melt 2 tbsp. butter in saucepan over low heat. Stir in 1/2 cup milk until smooth. Stir in 1/4 cup cheese until melted. Pour over sweet peas. Bake 15 minutes or until heated through.
Cook potatoes in water with vinegar until tender. Drain. Add dressing. Add onion. Add sauerkraut. Mix well. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve on lettuce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch strips. In a bowl combine oil, thyme and oregano. Toss potatoes in the mixture. Season to taste. Place in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Turn potatoes over half way through the cook time. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Cook the noodles according to package directions. Butter a 9x13" baking dish. Cook the scallions and garlic cloves in the butter until tender. Stir together the brown sugar, soy sauce and cornstarch. Add the scallion mixture to the sugar mixture and stir until combined. Pour over the noodles and toss until well-coated. Bake uncovered at 350 for 40 minutes or until noodles are tender.

Mash up the peanut butter in a small bowl with a fork. Add the scallions, cayenne and soy sauce. Add a splash of lemon juice and mash more. Add more lemon if needed. Add the garlic and mash more. Add the mayonnaise and mash until well blended. Spread a thin layer on white bread. Top with bacon. Cut in small squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans. In a large bowl, beat butter on medium speed for 30 seconds. Add sugarbeat until combined. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Stir together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Beat flour mixture into the egg mixture alternately with the milk on low speed until smooth. Divide the batter evenly among the pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pans. Cool completely on wire racks. Prepare frosting. In a large bowl, beat together the butter, sugar, vanilla, and salt until light and fluffy. Add the powdered sugarbeat until fluffy. Spread between layers and over the sides of the cake. Decorate with the strawberries. Makes 2 cakes.

Slice the scallions lengthwise into thin strips. Thinly slice the jalapeno and remove seeds and membranes (for a little more heat). Dice the garlic and add the butter, mayonnaise and cheese into a large mixing bowl. Mix well and set aside. Pre-heat the oven to 425 degrees F. Unroll the loaf of bread and separate into slices (I get about 20 slices). Butter each slice and lay it in the baking dish. Spread with the cheese mixture and sprinkle with the scallion strips and jalapeno slices. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the cheese mixture is bubbly and the edges are golden brown. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Heat oven to 350. Grease and flour cookie sheets. Cream together the condensed milk and the butter. Add the vanilla and beat for 1 minute. Add the flour and mix until smooth. Add the nuts and chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoons onto greased cookie sheets. Bake 10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes 2 1/2 dozen cookies.

Dissolve soup mix in hot water. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Cut steak in 1/2 inch strips. Dip meat in soup mixture. Brown meat. Add bouillon cubes. Mix well. Pour in red wine. Cook for 1 minute. Add beef broth. Stir in fettuccine. Cook until pasta is tender. Add mushrooms. Season with pepper. Heat through. Serve hot.

Cream the butter and sugar in the bowl of an electric mixer. Add eggs and beat well. Blend in flour and baking soda. Stir in rolled oats and dried cranberries. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake at 350f for 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Melt the chocolate in the top of a double broiler. Dip the tops of the cookies in the melted white chocolate. Set on wire rack to cool.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce and water. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, add the sugar and water mixture and stir to combine. When the liquid begins to boil, add the ginger and garlic. Boil until the sugar dissolves. Add the drumsticks and cook until browned on all sides, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. Add the sesame oil and stir to combine. Add the pepper and cook for another minute or two. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds and serve hot.

In a large skillet, saute onion in oil until lightly browned. Combine ground beef, marinade and cooked onions. Form into four 1/2-inch thick patties. Grill burgers over medium heat about 4 minutes on each side. Serve on hamburger buns with shredded lettuce and sliced tomato. Top with shredded cheddar and french-fried onions. Makes 4 servings.

Combine graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and sugarpress into 9-inch pie plate. Beat milk with pudding mix for 2 minutes. Beat in peanut butter until well blended. Spread pudding mixture into pie crust. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Brown ground meat and cook until no longer pink. Drain. In a large bowl combine meat, onion, green bell pepper, mushrooms, and 1/2 cup water. Add the Velveeta cheese and milk. Mix well and heat through in the microwave. Serve on miniature party rye rounds. Garnish as desired. Serve warm. Makes 50 servings.

Melt oil in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in chili powder and cook 1 minute or until fragrant. Stir in broth, tomato sauce, sugar and cayenne pepper. Bring to a boil. Stir in cornstarch mixture until smooth. Reduce heat to low and cook 5 minutes or until slightly thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in cumin and oregano. Serve with chicken enchiladas or chicken tacos.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, whisk together brown sugar, black pepper, salt, eggs and oil until well combined. Add noodles, tossing to coat. Boil until noodles are just tender. Stir in parsley. Serve hot.

In a large bowl mix cake mix, pudding, and water. Beat well. Beat in the eggs and oil. Pour into greased 9x13 baking dish. Bake 25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely. In a small bowl combine powdered sugar and milk to make icing. Pour over cooled cake. Let sit for 15 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 15x10 inch jellyroll pan. Cream butter and sugar in electric mixer. Beat in eggs and vanilla. In separate bowl combine flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt. Combine flour mixture with wet ingredients. Beat well. Spread batter in jellyroll pan. Bake 20-25 minutes. Cool. Spread with frosting. Frosting: Cream butter and cocoa. Beat in powdered sugar and milk. Spread on cake.

In a large bowl, combine natural bran and boiling water. Let stand 10 minutes. In a large bowl, combine sugar, eggs, buttermilk, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add bran mixture. Add all-bran cereal. Spoon batter into greased muffin cups. Bake at 375 for 25-30 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Remove from pancool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

In a medium bowl combine the butter with the sugar. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Beat in the cocoa. In another bowl combine the flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon. Stir into the butter mixture until blended. Stir in the oats. Drop the dough by the rounded tablespoonful onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven. Cool for 1 minute on the baking sheets. Remove from the sheets. Cool completely on wire racks. Makes 3 dozen cookies.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Add applesauce and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold in corn muffin mix and blueberries. Spoon into muffin cups and bake for 18 minutes or until tops are golden brown and a knife comes out cleanly from center of muffins. Makes 12 muffins.

Mix mustard powder with 1/4 teaspoon of water to make smooth paste. Whisk together flour and remaining water to make smooth paste. Cook and stir together sugar, vinegar and remaining water until thick. Add raisins and mustard paste, cook and stir until thick. Remove from heatstir in butter and remaining water until smooth. Serve warm or cool over meats and vegetables.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the corn and cook for 3-4 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Drain again. Cut the kernels off the cob by slicing lengthwise down the cob with a sharp knife then cutting across the cob at right angles to the lengthwise slices. In a large bowl combine corn, red onion, roasted red pepper, apple cider vinegar, olive oil, salt, black pepper and fresh basil leafs. Stir and serve at room temperature or chill in refrigerator for 2-3 hours before serving.

In a large bowl, combine eggs with yogurt. Beat in flour. Add onion, tomatoes, salt and pepper. Stir in basil. Spoon mixture into pastry shells. Top with cheese. Bake at 375 f for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 f for 15 minutes longer. Let stand 5 minutes. Yields 1 quiche per serving.

Heat olive oil and butter in a large frying pan or risotto pan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft and translucent, 3-5 minutes. Stir in bacon and cook until crisp, about 2-3 minutes. Stir in rice and cook, stirring frequently, until it has absorbed the fat and is coated with the bacon fat, 1-2 minutes. Stir in 1 cup of the stock and cook until the rice absorbs the liquid, stirring frequently, 2-3 minutes. Stir in the remaining stock and continue to stir until the rice has absorbed the liquid and is creamy and tender, 10-15 minutes. Stir in the peas and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Mix brown sugar, oatmeal and salt. Cut in butter with a pastry blender till crumbly. Mix in baking powder. Press onto bottom of greased 9-inch square pan. Bake at 350f for 8-10 minutes. Cool. Beat 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 3/4 cup brown sugar, 1 egg, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, 2 tablespoons melted butter. Spread over cooled crust. Cool. Melt 1/2 cup butter and 1/4 cup chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir until smooth. Drizzle over cooled bars. Cool. Cut into squares.

Mix garlic, oil, wine, oregano, thyme, parsley, green onions, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Slice lamb into 16 strips and place each strip flat on cutting board. Spread marinade mixture over each strip, turning once to coat both sides. Place each strip in a zipper-top baggie. Set in refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator about an hour before cooking. Prepare grill or broiler. Place lamb on hot grill or broiler pan. Cook for about 2 minutes on each side or until done. Garnish with lemon slices.
In small bowl mix cucumbers, vinegar, onion & sugar. Cover & refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.

Peel and grate carrots and place in large bowl. Add evaporated milk. Combine eggs and sugar and add to carrots. Beat well. Add salt and spices. Pour into unbaked pie shells and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on rack and serve at room temperature or cold.
Mix together milk and peanut butter. Bring mixture to a boil. Turn off heat. Add powdered chocolate milk mix. Stir well. Top with whipped cream and a few more peanuts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking dish. Mix together eggs and milk. In another bowl mix together the remaining ingredients. Add the egg mixture into the dry ingredient mixture. Stir until evenly combined. Pour into the baking dish. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve immediately.

Cook the bacon, then crumble and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the green pepper and onion in the butter until tender. Stir in the crumbled bacon. Season with garlic and parsley. Spoon the mixture into the wells of the biscuits. Bake for 10 minutes or until the biscuits are golden brown. Serve hot.
Chop cucumber, then toss with vinegar. Stir in chives. Add chopped tomato and season to taste. Serve with any meal.

Slice pears crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Put in a large bowl and pour in the wine. Add the sugar and lemon juice. Mix gently. Let stand 10 minutes. Spread each baguette slice with the cheese. Top with pears. Sprinkle with the nuts. Yield: 6 servings.

In a small bowl, crush the garlic cloves and ginger with the flat side of a knife. Stir in the soy sauce and rice vinegar. Add the sugar and sesame oil and stir to dissolve the sugar. Reserve 1/2 cup of the marinade for basting the skewers. Cut the steak into 1-inch cubes. Thread the meat onto the skewers. Combine the remaining marinade with the reserved 1/2 cup and pour over the meat. Cover and refrigerate for 2 to 24 hours. Prepare the glaze. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the water with the honey and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the honey mixture is thickened. Stir in the soy sauce and rice vinegar. Brush the glaze over the meat. Grill the meat over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove the meat from the heat and brush with the glaze. Garnish with the green onions. Serve immediately.

Mix the mayo with the cheddar cheese, green onion and garlic until creamy. Spread half on the bottom of a loaf of french bread. Spread the remaining half on top of the cheese. Bake at 375 until lightly browned. Sprinkle with paprika.

Grease an 8 inch by 8 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs and sugar until thick and creamy. Add the heavy cream and cinnamon and whisk until incorporated. Set aside. In the same bowl, melt the butter and whisk it into the egg mixture. Then, add the bread cubes and stir until the bread is completely moistened. Pour the mixture into the baking dish and bake in the center of the oven for about 1 hour or until set. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

Cook potatoes until tender. Drain and mash. Mix hamburger, onion, celery and soup. Bake in shallow pan at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Mash potatoes and stir into meat mixture. Bake 20 minutes longer. Serves 4.

Melt butter in a large saucepan. Add onions and garliccook until tender. Add flour and stir. Add beer gradually. Stir in tomatoes and chilies. Cook for 15 minutes or until thick and bubbly. Stir in cheese. Remove from heat and add beans. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and garlic. Cook 1 minute. Add curry powder and broth. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 2 minutes. Add shrimp and cook until opaque throughout and curry sauce has thickened, 2-3 minutes. Remove shrimp from skillet and set aside. Stir lime juice into sauce and return shrimp. Simmer until heated through. Serve over rice. Sprinkle with cilantro and serve.
Slice tomatoes and cucumbers. Chop green onion. Mix with italian dressing. Add basil. Add vinegar, salt, pepper, and garlic salt. Refridgerate.
Combine all ingredients into a blender until smooth. Refrigerate for 2 hours or longer. Serve chilled.

Strain tomato juice through cheesecloth. Boil the juice with the pectin and bring to a rolling boil. Add the sugar and lemon rind and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add the tabasco and the clove and cinnamon sticks. Boil rapidly until jelly stage, 210 to 220 degrees F. Remove cinnamon sticks and pour into sterilized jars and seal with hot water bath method.

Run 4 large lime wedges and 2 tablespoons of coarse salt through a handheld blender or food processor until the wedges are crushed and the salt is evenly dispersed. Freeze the mixture for 20 minutes. Fill 4 tall glasses three-quarters full of ice cubes. Add 2 ounces of water to each glass and stir. Divide the frozen limeade concentrate and frozen orange juice concentrate evenly between the glasses. Divide the lime juice evenly between the glasses and stir until well mixed. Pour the margarita mixture evenly between the glasses and top each glass with lime slice.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Spread margarine in 9x5x3-inch pan. Layer bread cubes in pan. Sprinkle with broccoli. Top with cheese. In small bowl, combine the dry milk powder and water until smooth. Beat in egg. Pour over bread. Bake uncovered 15 minutes. Sprinkle with Tabasco sauce. Bake 2 minutes more. Top with onion. Bake 5 minutes. Cut into 4 squares.

Peel potatoes and cut into chunks. Boil in water until tender. Drain. Add milk and cream cheese and blend thoroughly. Mash and add cheese and crackers. Add margarine and blend until smooth. Add garlic powder. Serve immediately.

Combine ground beef, onion, egg and parsley flakes in a mixing bowl. Season with soy sauce and garlic. Mix well and let sit for about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Take about a tablespoon of beef mixture and place in center of each wonton wrapper. Moisten edges with water and fold into triangles. Press edges together firmly to seal. Add wontons in batches to oil. Fry until golden brown and drain on paper towels. Place wontons in a large bowl and fill with rice. Add water and season with soy sauce. Serve with garnish.

Boil potatoes until cooked through (test with fork). Cool potatoes slightly. Slice potatoes in half lengthwise (so you have a potato "boat"). Fill each potato half with bacon, onions, and red bell peppers. Sprinkle with olives. Add a small amount of sour cream on each potato half. Top with shredded cheese. Bake in the oven at 375 for about 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately. This is best served when it is still warm.

Place a deep dish pie plate on a baking sheet. Combine flour and butter in a bowl. With fingertips, rub together until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until dough is smooth and easy to handle. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface and place it into a 9 inch pie plate. Trim edges and flute. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 15 minutes or until edges are lightly golden. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine sugar and egg yolks. Add salt and lemon juice. Whisk until smooth. Add egg whites and beat until whites are stiff but not dry. Fold in rind. Pour filling into crust. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for about 45 minutes or until center is set. Allow to cool completely before cutting.

Heat oil in skillet. Sauté vegetables and garlic until tender. Add mushrooms. Combine all with parsley and salt and pepper to taste. Mix in tomato sauce. Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Serve over cooked pasta. Garnish with Parmesan cheese.

Prepare dark rye bread by rubbing one side of each slice with butter. Prepare corned beef by heating in microwave or frying in skillet until heated through. On rye bread, place corned beef, sauerkraut and swiss cheese. Top each sandwich with a thin layer of stone ground mustard and serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour a tube pan or a bundt pan.In a large bowl, cream together sugar and margarine. Beat in the vanilla extract. Gradually add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. In a small bowl, sift the flour with the baking powder and saltstir into the batter until smooth. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 1 1/2 hours or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.Cool the cake in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Drizzle with evaporated milk or serve as is. Makes 10 to 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small frying pan, toast cumin seeds, coriander seeds and sesame seeds over medium heat until fragrant. Remove from pan and let cool. In the bowl of a food processor, pulse hazelnuts until they begin to break down. Add toasted seeds, sea salt and toasted sesame seeds. Pulse to combine. Place carrots in a bowl. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with Dukkah. Roast carrots in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, sprinkle with additional Dukkah and serve.

To make topping, blend first 3 ingredients until well combined. Refrigerate 15 minutes or until slightly thickened. To assemble fruit salad, layer fruit in parfait glasses. Top each serving with 1/4 cup topping and 2 tablespoons whipped cream. Garnish with strawberry. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly grease 8x8 baking dish. Line bottom and sides of pan with spinach. Cut fillets into 1 inch cubes. In small bowl mix tomatoes, lemon pepper and water. Pour tomato mixture over spinach. Spread evenly. Sprinkle with corn and croutons. Cut cheese into cubes. Top with cheese. In small bowl beat together egg and milk. Pour over mixture. Bake uncovered 30 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.

In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except nuts and cereal. Stir well. Spread mixture in a greased 9x13 baking pan. Bake in 275f oven for 30 minutes. Mix nuts and cereal in a separate bowl and combine. Spread over hot mixture and bake for another 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Cool in pan. Store in airtight container.

Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add the thyme and cook 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes with their juice and simmer 10 minutes. In a small bowl mix together the flour and sugar. Add to the tomato mixture and stir constantly until the mixture thickens. Add the chicken stock, tomato paste and fresh basil. Bring to a boil. Simmer 10 minutes. Blend with an immersion blender. Ladle into individual bowls. Top with plain low-fat yogurt. Garnish with fresh basil.

Place fish in a lightly oiled baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Mix together lime juice, sour cream, and parsley. Spread over the fish. Sprinkle with lime rind. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve with rice or potatoes.
Bring water to boil in pot. Add scallions, tofu and soy sauce. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Add mushrooms and simmer for 5 more minutes. Add miso and stir until dissolved.

Preheat oven to 350. Break up peanut butter cookie dough into small balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Press 3-5 flakes of wheat flakes cereal into each ball of dough. Sprinkle with peanuts and sugar. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool and enjoy!

Boil the water in a pot. Crush the green cardamom pods slightly with a spoon and drop into the pot. Add the saffron threads and sugar. When the water comes to a boil again, remove from heat. Stir in the rose water and a pinch of salt. Strain the tea into a glass and serve.

Melt butter in a saucepan, add fillets, brown on both sides. Set aside. Stir flour into butter, gradually add beef stock, stirring until smooth. Stir in whiskey, lemon juice, mustard and salt. Cook over low heat for 1 minute until thick. Stir in cream and heat through. Pour over fillets. Garnish with fresh chopped chives.
Mix all ingredients together with the crescent rolls. Spread out on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Broil for 3 minutes or until brown.

Place 2 tbsp shredded coconut in a small skillet over low heat. Stir often until coconut has begun to toast, 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Cook beef and garlic in another small skillet over medium-high heat until beef is evenly browned and crumbled. Drain off any fatdiscard fat in skillet. Stir in soy sauce and lemon juice. Cook and stir until liquid is almost evaporated. Add cornstarch and water in a small bowl. Stir until smooth and pour into beef mixturebring to a boil and cook and stir for 1 minute or until thickened. Remove from heat. Add pineapple chunks and mandarin orangesgarnish with cashew nuts. Serve over coconut-toasted rice in bowls or over rice in a serving dish. Serves 4.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Cook the beef until browned. Add the onion and green peppercook and stir until tender. Add the soup mix and water. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add the beans and tomatoessimmer until heated through. Stir in the parsley and basil. Makes 4 servings. Serve with cooked pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In medium bowl combine cream cheese and ham. Blend well. Shape into ball and place on waxed paper. Roll in cracker crumbs. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until cheese is lightly browned and bubbly. Serve with crackers.

Melt marshmallows and butter in large microwave safe bowl until smooth. Add rice krispies cereal and stir until well blended. Pour mixture into greased 13 x 9 pan. Cool slightly then add white chocolate chips. Press gently with spoon until chips are slightly melted. Refrigerate until hardened. Place candy sprinkles on stick ends of each lollipop before serving.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add potatoes to boiling water. Cook about 5 minutes until potatoes are softened but firm to the touch. Drain potatoes and set aside. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add oil to skillet. Add onion and garlic. Cook until softened. Add chopped tomatoes. Cook until liquid has reduced and tomatoes have thickened. Remove from heat. Peel and dice habanero. Add to cooked tomato mixture. Set aside. In a casserole dish combine potatoes and tomato mixture. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Top with mozzarella cheese. Pour cream over cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until cheese has melted.

In a heavy stockpot saute bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towel. In the drippings saute onion until tender. Add bacon, flour, nutmeg, broth, tomatoes with juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered 10 minutes. Add cream, salt, pepper. Heat through. Serve. Makes 16 servings.
In slow cooker combine ribs, barbecue sauce, onion, garlic and honey. Cover and cook on low setting for about 8 hours. (or high for about 4 hours) Add salt and pepper to taste.

In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add margarine and margarine. Cook until butter is melted. Add tomato juice to the skillet. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the green beans, potatoes, parsley, mint leaves, and seasonings. Continue to cook over medium heat until the potatoes are done. Remove from heat and serve.

In a small saucepan over high heat, add eggs, cover and bring to simmering point. Turn off heat, let stand about 10 minutes then chop coarsely. In medium bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, mustard and thai chili paste until smooth. Add eggs, jalapenos, scallions, cilantro and salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate for at least one hour before serving. Serve with pickled ginger.
Place green beans into a pan with enough chicken broth to cover them. Bring to a boil. Add bacon, chicken broth, and onion powder. Simmer until done.

Rinse chicken livers under cold water. Pat dry. Cut into 1/4 inch slices. In a skillet, fry livers in chicken fat over medium heat until brown on both sides. Remove livers. Stir together onion powder, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Add onion to fat. Fry until onion is tender. Add livers. Serve on rye toast.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Mix flour, sugar and baking powder together. Add cinnamon to taste. Mix well and add butter and eggs. Mix well. In a 13 x 9 inch baking dish, layer peaches and raspberries in baking dish. Pour the batter over top of fruit filling. Bake 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water and set aside. In a large non-stick skillet saute garlic and green pepper in olive oil until tender. Add tomatoes and oregano. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in spaghetti and cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan boil potatoes in lightly salted water for about 25 minutes or until potatoes are fork-tender. Drain the potatoes in a colander and run cold water over them for a minute or so to stop the cooking process. Drain again and allow them to cool. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saute for about 30 seconds. Add the potatoes and toss with the garlic and butter until the potatoes are coated thoroughly. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Peel the avocados, cut in half. Remove the seed. Dice. Place in a bowl. Add the lime juice. Add the salt. Mash with a fork. Taste. Add more lime juice or salt if necessary. Set aside. In a bowl combine the salsa with the sour cream. Chill. Serve with chips.

Soak lentils overnight. Pressure cook or boil lentils till they are tender, then set aside till cool. Heat oil in a frying pan and fry onions till translucent. Add tomatoes, coriander, green chili pepper, cumin seed and salt to taste. Fry till tomatoes are cooked and oil separates from the mixture. Add lentils to tomato mixture. Fry for a minute or so more till the mixture is blended. Serve as a side dish with rotis or chapatis or with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Sift together the flour, baking powder and ginger. In a large mixing bowl cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the egg and beat well. Add the flour mixture and stir just until combined. Stir in the lemon juice and zest and buttermilk. Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups. Sprinkle each muffin with about 1/4 of the ginger. Bake until the muffins are golden brown and pull away from the sides of the pan. About 35 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Spread the top of each muffin with the mango puree. Dust with powdered sugar.

Separate egg whites from yolks. Beat whites and cottage cheese with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper just until blended. Beat yolks and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper until smooth. Add cottage cheese mixturebeat until blended. Pour into 10-inch pie plate coated with cooking spraysprinkle with chives. Bake at 400 for 15-18 minutes or until set. Cut into wedges. Serve with tomatoes and bell pepper.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, bring butter to boil, stirring constantly. When butter is boiling, add chili peppers, garlic, chives, cayenne and lemon juice and stir well. Let boil for one minute. Remove from heat and let cool. Store in covered container in refrigerator for up to one week.

Combine first four ingredients in large bowlbeat well with mixer until blended. Stir in dates and nuts. Add bananas and orangesstir until blended. Pour into greased and floured 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Bake at 375f for 1 hour or until golden brown and set in center. Serve with whipped cream.

Heat oil in a large saucepan. Saute the onion, garlic clove, green pepper and chopped tomatoes for 5 minutes. Stir in paprika. Season fish with salt and pepper. Add fish to saucepan. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in orange juice. Cover saucepan. Simmer for 3 minutes. Remove fish. Stir in parsley. Sprinkle fish with parsley. Serve with rice or pasta.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, mix the molasses and butter together. In another bowl, stir together the flour, baking soda, and ginger. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the molasses mixture and stir to combine. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Drop batter by rounded teaspoonfuls onto baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the cookies are golden brown. Remove from baking sheets to wire racks.
Brown bacon in skillet. Add rice and stir well. Add egg and cook well. Add green onions. Add soy sauce, salt and pepper. Cook well. Serve hot.

Cut imitation lobster into cubes. Melt butter with paprika and saute meat for 3 minutes. Add cream and sherry, simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add whipping cream and egg yolks. Cook over low heat for 2-3 minutes until thickened. Serve on toast or crackers.
Chop cucumbers fine. In a medium bowl, combine yogurt, cucumber, cumin and cayenne pepper. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve as a side dish for Indian meals.

Cut the cauliflower florets from the head and break them up to fit in your food processor. You can do this with a knife as well, but the food processor will make it easier. Run them through the food processor and set aside to use later on. Heat the olive oil in a saute pan over medium high heat. Once heated, add the garlic and green onion and saute until they turn translucent and fragrant. Then add the cauliflower to the pan and cook until it is golden brown, about 5 minutes. Next add the dried basil and the salt and pepper to taste and turn the heat off. Put the cauliflower and the sauce in a bowl and cover it with the Italian seasoned breadcrumbs and the parmesan cheese and mix them together well. Transfer the cauliflower to a baking sheet and bake it at 350 degrees until it is golden brown and crisp, about 15 to 20 minutes. Serve while it is still hot and enjoy!

Combine sour cream, cream cheese, and brie cheese in a bowl. Stir until well blended. Add brandy and brandy to taste. Stir until well blended. Add brandy to taste. Stir until well blended. Fold in prosciutto, green onions, and red pepper flakes. Serve with crackers or vegetables. Serves 4-6 as an appetizer or 2-3 as a side dish.

Lightly grease an oven-safe pan or baking dish with butter and set aside. Combine the parsley, garlic cloves and dried oregano and place this mixture on a large plate or platter and set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice and olive oil and pour it over the salmon fillets. Sprinkle each fillet with the parsley/garlic/oregano mixture and place the fillets in the prepared baking pan or dish. Bake the salmon at 400 degrees until the salmon is firm and slightly pink inside (about 12-15 minutes). Serve the salmon with lemon wedges on the side.

Mix sugar and egg. Add banana, applesauce and yogurt. Fold in chocolate chips. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in medium bowl. Add banana mixture. Stir just until moistened. Fill each cup 2/3 full. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan for 5 minutes. Remove to wire racks and cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

Wash beans, put in pot with 4 cups water. Bring to boil, then reduce heat, cover and simmer for 2 hours. Meanwhile, in a separate saucepan, saute the celery in olive oil until soft. Add carrot, celery leaves and tomatoes. Saute for about 5 minutes. Add onions. Saute another 2 minutes. Add beans, cover pot, simmer for about 15 minutes. Season with salt. Serve with crusty bread.
In a bowl combine cottage cheese, apples, raisins, lemon juice and honey. Fold in sunflower seeds and serve at room temperature or chill overnight for even better flavor.

Using a food processor or blender, puree the garlic cloves until it becomes a paste. Mix the cream cheese, butter, lemon juice, garlic paste, oregano, parsley, cayenne pepper and salt until smooth. Chill for at least 3 hours before serving. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Remove steaks from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking to bring to room temperature. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in large frying pan over medium-high heat until hot. Lightly salt and pepper both sides of steaks and add to pan. Cook 4 minutes per side for medium rare. Remove steaks from pan and keep warm. Reduce heat to medium-low and add remaining oil and crushed red pepper flakes to pan. Stir until flakes are evenly distributed and sauteed, about 1 minute. Add onion and cook 1 minute more until tender. Return steaks to pan and stir to coat evenly with sauce. Top each steak with a slice of mozzarella cheese. Divide steaks among 4 plates and serve immediately.

Rub the steak with the butter and season the steak all over with salt and pepper. Let the steak sit at room temperature for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add the steak and cook until browned and crusty all over. Put the steak in the oven and roast for 7 minutes for medium-rare. Remove the steak from the oven and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice the steak and serve.

Mix the first 3 ingredients in large bowl. Cut in the butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add the oats and mix well. Press the mixture into bottom and up sides of 9-inch square baking dish. Bake at 375° for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the 1/2 cup blueberries and the next 6 ingredients (through water) in a small bowl. Stir until smooth. Spread the mixture evenly over the baked crust. Sprinkle the remaining 1 1/2 cups blueberries over the top. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes more or until the filling is bubbly. Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Fry bacon in skillet over medium heat. Remove bacon and place on paper towels. Add onion and garlic and saute 5 minutes. Add green and red peppers. Saute 10 minutes. Add tomatoes and water. Cover and cook 10 minutes or until tomatoes are tender. Cook pasta according to package directions. Add bacon and pasta to skillet. Heat through.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. In a large bowl mix together all the dry ingredients. Stir in yogurt and sour cream until well blended. Add the egg and mix well. Pour batter into a greased 9 inch square baking pan and bake for 40 to 45 minutes, until golden brown and a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan to a rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.Halve eggs lengthwise. Remove yolks. Add sour cream and mustard to yolksmix well. Fold in onions and salt. Melt butter in saucepanadd flour and cook over medium heat for 1 minute. Stir in milkbring to a boil. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Stir in soupheat through. Spoon about 2 tbsp. sour cream mixture into egg whitestop with about 1 tsp. of mushroom sauce. Sprinkle with cheese and paprika. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until tops are golden. Serve immediately.

Trim any excess fat from roast. In a small bowl, combine onion and next four ingredients. Rub mixture over roast and place in a slow cooker. Cover and cook on low heat setting for 5-6 hours or until beef is very tender. Remove roastkeep warm. Discard vegetables and drippings. In a small bowl, whisk milk and flour until smooth. Gradually add milk mixture to crock pot, stirring constantly until sauce thickens and bubbles. Stir in parsley. Serve roast with sauce. Yield: 4 servings. Per serving: 277 calories, 14g fat (4g sat. fat), 45mg chol., 337mg sodium, 4g carbohydrate, 4g fiber, 40g pro.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a baking dish with olive oil. Blend parmesan cheese with thyme leaves and chili flakes. In a bowl, beat ricotta cheese until smooth. Add salt and black pepper to taste. Fold in parmesan mixture. Spread into baking dish. Bake until set, about 30 minutes. Cut into squares and serve with french bread.

Bring the chicken to room temperature by removing from the refrigerator 1 hour before you plan to cook it. Cook noodles according to package directions. Cook the chicken in a skillet with oil over medium heat until browned on both sides. Remove the chicken from the skillet. Add the frozen broccoli. Cover and cook until tender crisp. Stir in the sauce. Add the noodles and toss gently. Stir in the chicken. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rinse shrimp and pat dry. In large bowl combine the seafood seasoning and salt. Dust the shrimp lightly with flour, dip in egg wash then coat with bread crumbs. Place shrimp on lightly greased baking sheet and bake until shrimp are opaque.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In large bowl, lightly beat eggs. Combine bread crumbs, mustard and egg. Press mixture evenly and firmly over meat. Bake at 400 degrees F for about 10 minutes or until meat is no longer pink and crumbs are browned. Serve over rice or noodles. Garnish with mushrooms. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Pour all but 1/2 cup of blueberry muffin mix into 9-inch pie pan or baking dish. In separate bowl, combine reserved 1/2 cup blueberry muffin mix with peaches. Spoon peach mixture evenly over blueberry muffin batter. In separate bowl, combine 1/4 cup milk and egg. Brush evenly over peach mixture. Bake uncovered for 35 to 45 minutes until golden brown. Makes 6 servings.

Whisk egg in large shallow dish. Combine panko crumbs and sesame seeds in another shallow dish. Dip chicken in eggcoat with crumb mixture. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heatcook chicken in batches until golden brown and cooked through (about 4 minutes on each side).
Combine cream cheese and ranch dressing until smooth. Add milk and dill. Blend well. Spread on lettuce leaves. Top with chopped green onions. Serve with cucumber.

In a bowl combine the whiskey, soy sauce and sugar and mix well. Place the steaks in a shallow dish and pour the whiskey mixture over the steaks. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from fridge and preheat the oven to 180C/350F. Heat a frying pan until very hot then add the steaks. Brown on both sides and then transfer to the oven. Cook for 10-15 minutes. Serve with potatoes and salad.
Peel hard boiled eggs. Break into small pieces. Combine egg yolk with olive oil and wine vinegar. Mash in garlic and parsley. Add soft breadcrumbs and salt. Mix well. Serve with hard boiled egg.

Drain tuna and place in a mixing bowl with the creamed corn, onion and flour. Beat in the eggs. Add the cheese and parsleymix well. Drop by tablespoonfuls into hot fatfry until golden brown, turning once. Drain on paper towels.

Place frozen cauliflower in a microwave-safe bowl. Add water to cover. Cover bowl with a plate. Microwave on high for 4 minutes. Add frozen green peas. Continue cooking for 3 minutes. Remove from microwave and drain. Let cool for a few minutes. Place cauliflower-pea mixture in a blender. Add ranch dressing and sour cream. Puree. Stir in dill. Serve immediately or cover and chill for up to 24 hours. Makes 4 servings.

In a medium bowl combine carrots, green onions and mirin. Stir until the vegetables are well coated. In a large frying pan heat the sesame oil. Add the tofu and stir fry over high heat until the tofu is lightly browned. Remove the tofu and vegetables to a plate. Add the soy sauce to the frying pan. Cook over high heat until the soy sauce is reduced to a thick glaze. Stir the vegetables and tofu into the glaze. Serve immediately over rice.

Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add chicken breasts and cook about 4 minutes on each side. Remove chicken from skillet. Heat butter in same skillet. Add flour and stir until lightly browned. Add wine and stir until smooth. Add chicken broth and return chicken to skillet. Add sage leaves. Simmer until sauce thickens. Place half a slice of country ham on each chicken breast. Lay a piece of sliced Jarlsberg on top of ham. Spoon sauce over ham. Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for 20 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve with mashed potatoes or pasta.

Combine sugar and cream in a heavy saucepan. Cook over low heat until sugar dissolves. Stir frequently. Add walnuts and white chocolate. Stir until the chocolate is melted. Remove from heat. Add the marshmallow cream. Beat well until light and fluffy. Pour into a buttered 8x8x2 pan. Let cool. Cut into squares and enjoy.
Spread cream cheese onto crackers. Place olives onto crackers. Sprinkle with pimento stuffing. Dust with paprika, pepper and garlic powder.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, blanch rutabagas and carrots until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain and return vegetables to pot and mash them throughly with a potato masher. In a small skillet over medium heat, sauté shallot in butter until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in cream and milk and heat until hot. Add vegetable mixture and season with salt and pepper. Stir in cheese and transfer mixture to a medium casserole dish. Bake until gratin is golden brown and bubbly, about 30 minutes. Cool for about 10 minutes before serving.

Crush 24 cookies in food processor or blender. Mix crumbs with melted butterpress onto bottom of 9-inch springform pan. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Beat in sugar and vanilla until well blendedbeat in eggs 1 at a time. Stir in chocolate chipsspread evenly over crust. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until center is set. Cool on rack 15 minutesrun knife around edge to loosencool 1 hour longer. Run knife around edge to loosenremove side of pan. Refrigerate up to 24 hours. Garnish with whipped cream and remaining cookies before serving.

Prepare the tomatoes by cutting out a circle in the top and removing the pulp from inside the tomato leaving a shell. In a bowl combine the raisins, garlic and sweet red pepper. Stir in the coconut and the oil and toss well. Divide the mixture evenly among the tomatoes filling each one. Garnish with the green onion and sprinkle with salt and pepper if desired. Bake uncovered for 15-20 minutes or until the tomatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Makes about 25 stuffed tomatoes.

Preheat grill to high. Place chicken in a resealable plastic bag and add the jerk rub. Close bag and toss to coat. Grill the chicken for 5 minutes per side. Brush with the mayonnaise and top with the cayenne and peppers. Toast the hamburger buns and top with the chicken and cheese.

In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat, add the onion, ginger and cinnamon. Saute for about 3 minutes stirring constantly. Add the curry powder, cumin and tomatoes. Stir for 1 minute. Add the coconut milk and the peas. Simmer for 10 minutes or until the peas are tender and the liquid is almost all gone. Serve over rice or noodles. Garnish with chopped cilantro if desired.

Preheat oven to 350f. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add hash browns and cook until crisp and lightly browned. In a large bowl combine ham, eggs, milk and cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Pour mixture evenly into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Top with cooked hash browns and sprinkle with red peppers. Bake for 35 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Serve warm.

In a large skillet cook the onion in butter over medium heat until softened. Add beef base and stir to combine with onions. Add beef stew meat and stir to coat with sauce. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add 1 cup water or broth and stir to combine. Cook over medium heat until liquid is evaporated. Add tomatoes, rosemary and 1/4 cup water or broth. Cover skillet with lid. Simmer over low heat for 30 minutes or until beef is tender. Meanwhile, cook noodles as directed on package. Drain noodles well in colander. Stir in beef mixture and serve with parmesan cheese.

Combine the french onion soup mix with the consomme. Set aside. Cut the roast beef into 1/2 inch slices. Spread the mayonnaise on the inside of the hoagie rolls. Heat the au jus to a simmer in a small sauce pan. Put the beef on the hoagie rolls. Pour the au jus over the beef. Top with the provolone and serve immediately.

Cream butter and sugar together. Add vanilla essence and instant coffee powder. Beat well until fluffy. Sift flour and baking powder together. Add to creamed mixture and mix to a soft dough. Place in fridge for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 180 c. Roll out dough on a lightly floured board. Cut with cookie cutters. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool and roll in icing sugar. Decorate with chocolate.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Spread 1/3 cup of the tomato salsa evenly over the bottom of the dish. Unroll 10 tortillasspread each tortilla evenly with 2 tablespoons of the tomato salsa. Top each tortilla with 1/4 cup of the mexican cheese and 4 pieces of bacon. Roll up each tortilla tightly and place seam side down in the baking dish. Brush each tortilla with the melted butter. Sprinkle each tortilla evenly with the sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the tortillas are golden. Garnish with the remaining 1/3 cup of tomato salsa.

Prepare a 139 inch x 9 inch x 2 inch baking pan with 1/2 cup of water. Lay fish in pan. Combine cream of shrimp soup, sherry wine, salt, white pepper and basil in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until mixture is thickened. Spread over fish in pan. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the biscuits on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. In a small bowl, mix together the pizza sauce and cheddar cheese. Spread the mixture evenly over the biscuits. Sprinkle the pepperoni over the biscuits. Bake for 5 more minutes. Let cool for a few minutes. Cut into wedges. Serve.

Wash and trim the ends off of the carrots. Heat butter and add carrots to pan. Stir and cover. Cook until carrots are soft and tender about 15 minutes. Add beef broth and dill and mix. Remove carrots from stove and add champagne. Stir and cook for 1 minute longer. Serve warm.

Heat stuffing mix according to package directions. Add water, pesto basil and butter. Stir until completely blended. Stuff into artichokes. Top each artichoke with a slice of pine nuts. Place in baking dish. Mix together pasta-style chunky tomatoes and pasta-style chunky tomatoes in a bowl. Pour over stuffed artichokes. Bake uncovered in a preheated oven at 350 degrees f, for about 10 to 15 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Serve immediately. Ser

Combine all the ingredients in a small bowl to make a rub. Pat each tenderloin steak on both sides with a paper towel to remove moisture. Rub the steaks with the spice mixture. Let stand at room temperature for 20 minutes. Place in a pan large enough to hold them comfortably in a single layer. Place in a preheated oven at 350 for about 45 minutes or until an instant read thermometer inserted into the thickest portion of the meat registers between 135-140 degrees for medium rare. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In a large bowl combine the chickpeas with the juice of the lemon, the ginger, the garlic, the cayenne and the ground black pepper and mix well. Add the squid rings and mix well to coat the rings with the chickpea mixture. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes or longer to marinate the squid and to allow the chickpea mixture to soak into the squid. Preheat the grill to high heat or prepare a charcoal grill. Thread the squid rings onto skewers and place on the grill and cook for 5 minutes on each side or until the squid is cooked through and grill marks are visible. Remove from the grill and serve sprinkled with the fresh coriander and fresh flat-leaf parsley.

In medium bowl combine strawberries jell-o gelatin dessert and water. Microwave on high for 4 minutes. Stir until gelatin is dissolved. Add vanilla pudding mix and stir. Cool 5 minutes. Fold in cool whip. Pour into pie shell. Refrigerate. Makes 2 pies.

Heat 1 T olive oil in non stick skillet over medium heat. Add bell peppers and onion, cook about 3 minutes or until tender. Add potato and cook another 5 minutes. Add egg substitute and season with salt and pepper. Cook until egg mixture is set. Sprinkle with parsley and serve. Serve with 1 cup fruit and 1/2 cup fat free milk.

In a saucepan, combine butter, honey, water, orange juice, ginger, and nutmeg. Bring to a boil. Remove from the heat. Add carrots. Cover. Let stand until carrots are crisp-tender, 5 to 8 minutes. Serve garnished with parsley.

Toss tomatoes and onions in a bowl with the vinegar and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and pepper. Set aside for 10 minutes. Mince the basil and mix it with the remaining salt and pepper. Toss with the tomatoes and onions. Taste and adjust seasoning. Drizzle with the olive oil. Serve immediately.

Brown ground beef and drain fat. Add onion and cook until soft. Add green pepper and garlic. Cook 1-2 minutes. Add black beans and kidney beans. Stir. Add chili powder, cumin and crushed tomatoes. Simmer 15 minutes. Heat tortillas and fill with beef mixture. Top with cheese and roll up. Can also be baked in casserole dish. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Soak the anchos for 15 minutes in hot water. In a small saucepot over low heat, mash the anchos with a fork and add the apricot preserves and lime juice. Continue to cook until the mixture thickens slightly. Add the sugar and salt and continue cooking until it thickens enough to coat a spoon. Remove from heat and let cool. When cool, strain through a fine mesh strainer to remove the seeds and stems. Pour into a jar with a lid, cool completely, then refrigerate for up to 3 months.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (163 degrees C). Butter a 13-inch x 9-inch baking dish. Dice the bread and place in a large bowl. Pour milk over bread and let stand for about 10 minutes. Stir in the cheese and seasonings. Whisk together the eggs and egg whites and stir into the cheese mixture. Pour mixture into baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven or until set. Sprinkle with parsley before serving if desired. Serves 12-16.

Bring broth to a boil. Add rice, stirring constantly until it is all blended. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until tender about 30 minutes. Stir in lemon juice. Beat the eggs and stir them into the rice mixture. Cook until it begins to thicken. Add the pepper. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to package directions and drain well. Cut pepperoni in cubes. Cook tortellini according to package directions and drain well. Toss cooked pasta, pepperoni, tomatoes and olives in a large bowl. Add italian dressing and salad seasoning and mix well. Chill for an hour before serving. Serve over a bed of romaine lettuce if desired.

Combine the graham cracker crumbs and butter until well combined and crumbly. Press the mixture into a pie plate and bake in a preheated 350 degree over for about 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool. Meanwhile, beat the condensed milk and key lime juice until well combined. Pour the mixture into the crust and return to the oven for about 10 minutes or until the filling has set. Cool completely on a wire rack and then cover with a layer of whipped cream and sprinkle with sour cream and lime zest for garnish. Serves 8.

In a large bowl, whisk together lemon juice and olive oil and let stand for 10 minutes. Whisk in rosemary and season with salt and pepper. Add corn kernels and let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in black beans and ham. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight and serve cold.

Cut beef lengthwise in half and then cut each half into three pieces. Place beef in a resealable plastic bag and add marinade ingredients. Toss and seal bag. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Remove steak from marinade and discard marinade. Grill beef over medium heat until desired doneness is reached.

Prepare the pie crust. Preheat oven to 375. In a large mixing bowl, combine the corn syrup, brown sugar, eggs, butter, and salt. Add vanilla and beat well. Add pecans. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 50-60 minutes. Cool.

In a 4-quart crock pot place chicken breasts. Add soup, onion, garlic, celery and pepper. Cover. Cook on low for 6 to 7 hours. Remove chicken from broth. Shred chicken with 2 forks. Stir rice into broth. Cover. Cook for 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in chicken. Serve in soup bowls. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 400. Combine salmon with mushroom soup and set aside. Mix the egg and milk together. Mix the egg mixture with the salmon mixture and stir in the cornflakes and parsley. Pour the mixture into a greased 9"x13" pan. Bake for 15-20 minutes.

Soak the garbanzo beans in cold water overnight. Drain and rinse them. Place the beans in a food processor and pulse until they are coarsely pureed. Add tahini and pulse until the mixture is smooth. Add 1/4 cup warm water and the juice of the lemon. Puree until the hummus is smooth and spreadable. Add the garlic and 1/4 teaspoon each of the chili oil and salt. Pulse until combined. Add more hot chili oil and salt if you prefer your hummus spicier. Serve with toasted pita bread.

Mix flour, salt and baking powder together. Add milk and egg and mix to a dough. Roll out thin and cut into rounds. Stew meat in stock with vegetables until tender. Lift out meat. Add dumplings. Boil for 10 minutes or until dumplings are firm. Serve with meat.

Cook the eggs by placing them in boiling water for 8 minutes. Remove and cool under running water. Peel and slice in half. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, dijon mustard and lemon juice. In a small bowl, mix together the shallots and tarragon. Sprinkle the mixture over the bottom halves of the eggs. Place 1 teaspoon of the capers on each. Cover with the other half of the eggs. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Prepare pie crust as directed on package. Spray 9-inch pie pan with baking spray and roll out dough. Place dough in prepared pan. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool completely. Beat eggs and sugar in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Beat in corn syrups and butter. Stir in vanilla. Stir in pecans. Pour filling into crust. Bake 1 hour and 10 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely.

Peel the garlic cloves, then mince them very finely or place them in a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Wash the scallops in cold water, pat them dry and sprinkle lightly with coarse salt. Heat 2 tablespoons of the butter with the garlic in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat until the garlic is golden brown but not burned. Add the scallops to the garlic and continue cooking, stirring frequently so that the scallops do not touch the bottom of the pan or stick together. Cook until they are opaque throughout and firm to the touch, about 2 minutesthen transfer the scallops to a warm serving plate or platter. Pour the remaining butter into the skillet. Add the parsley and cook, stirring, until the parsley is brightly colored and fragrant, about 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle the butter sauce over the scallops. Serve immediately.

Cream butter and sugars. Add egg, vanilla, baking soda. Mix together. Add cinnamon and craisin. Chill dough for at least 1 hour. Roll into balls. Dip balls into sugar mixture. Place balls onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish. In a large bowl, whisk together melted butter, eggs, sugars, kosher salt and vanilla. Stir flour, baking soda and baking powder into the wet ingredients until just combined. Fold Nutella into batter until just combined. Spread evenly into prepared baking dish. Bake until blondies are set and lightly golden brown, 35-40 minutes. Let cool completely before cutting. Serve and enjoy.

Heat olive oil in large non-stick skillet over medium high heat. Spread both sides of each bread with russian salad dressing. Place beef slices on one half of bread and cheese slices on other half of bread. Layer with tomatoes, lettuce & sprouts (optional). Place sandwiches in hot skillet & cook over medium high heat for about 3 minutes or until cheese is melted & bread is toasted & crispy on outside. Serve immediately.
