Add water if necessary to thin to desired consistency. Stir in cheese. Season to taste with white pepper. Serve warm over pasta or vegetables or use as a dip for vegetables.

Heat oil in medium skillet. Cook chicken tenders in hot oil in batches for about 4 minutes or until tender. Do not overcrowd pan. Place chicken tenders in shallow dish. In same skillet combine broth, balsamic vinegar, garlic and honey. Bring mixture to a boil and pour over chicken tenders. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Remove chicken tenders from marinade and place on broiler rack in oven. Broil 4 inches from heating element for about 3 minutes on each side or until browned. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Mix together the chutney and coriander and spread evenly over the chicken breasts. Broil chicken under a preheated broiler until cooked through (approximately 4-6 minutes per side). Cut chicken into small pieces and serve with lime wedges and the remaining chutney mixture.

Chop cucumber into small chunks or coarsely grate them with a cheese grater. Chop tomatoes into small chunks or coarsely grate them with cheese grater. Finely chop parsley. Place all ingredients in a large salad bowl and gently stir to combine. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Add a bit of lemon juice if desired. Serves 4-6 persons.

In large skillet heat olive oil over med high heat. Season ribs generously with salt and pepper. Add to skillet and cook until browned on all sides. Remove ribs from skillet and set aside. Add garlic clove and cook until golden. Add tomatoes and mushrooms. Cook until tomatoes are soft. Add ribs, marsala wine and flour. Cook until wine is reduced by half. Add beef broth and italian seasoning. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cover skillet and simmer for 2 hours. Add tortellini and simmer for 15 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and beat until combined. Add the milk and vanilla extract. In a separate bowl, combine the all-bran cereal, flour, baking powder and salt. Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and mix until combined. Fold in the figs. Drop the dough by the heaping tablespoonful onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cookies cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans. Makes 12-18 cookies.

Preheat broiler. Cut bacon slices in half crosswise. Cut each fillet lengthwise into two pieces. Press each piece to a 4-inch square and top each square with a bacon slice. Broil 4 inches from heat source until salmon is opaque in the center and bacon is crisp. Meanwhile in a small bowl stir together vinegar and 1 tsp water. Place salmon on a platter. Drizzle vinegar mixture evenly over salmon. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees. Place whole pecans in shallow bowl. Stir together sugar and spices in another shallow bowl. Dip pecans in sugar mixture 1 at a time. Place on wax paper covered cookie sheet. Bake 1 hour stirring every 15 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. Store in tightly covered jar or container.

Place the water in a small saucepan over medium high heat. Bring the water to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low and add the saffron threads to the water. Let the water simmer for about three minutes. Turn off the heat and let the water steep for ten minutes. Strain the saffron water through a fine mesh strainer into a liquid measuring cup or small bowl to remove the threads. Rinse the couscous in a fine mesh strainer or colander under running water for a few minutes to remove excess starches and impurities. Place the couscous in a medium bowl and pour in the saffron water. Stir well. Set the couscous aside to soak for ten minutes. Drain the raisins and reserve for serving. Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium high heat. When the oil is hot add the couscous. Cook the couscous for three to four minutes, stirring continuously, to toast the grains lightly. Add the water to the couscous. Bring the liquid to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat

Chop broccoli and carrots into small pieces. In a medium saute pan, add oil. Saute garlic and ginger in oil for 30 seconds. Add broccoli and carrots. Stir in OJ and chicken broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and cover. Simmer for approximately 5 minutes. Stir in sesame oil and pepper. Serve over rice.

Steam broccoli coleslaw mix until crisp tender. Add red pepper, yellow pepper, scallions, slivered almonds, sunflower seeds, ramen noodles. Add balsamic vinegar and sugar to taste. Add oil to taste. Toss all well and serve cold.

Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles and place in a large serving bowl. Drain tuna into the same bowl and add the onion, hard-boiled eggs, mayonnaise, season salt, pepper and dill relish to the egg noodles and tuna mixture. Chill. Add celery before serving.

Dissolve yeast in warm water. In a large bowl add the self-rising flour. Add the egg. Stir in the yeast mixture and the melted butter. Add the sugar and knead until smooth. Roll out on a lightly floured surface. Cut into strips. Twist and form a roll. Place on a greased cookie sheet and let rise until doubled. Bake at 350 degrees until lightly browned.

Beat 3 egg yolks in small bowl. Add 1/3 cup sugar and 1 tablespoon cold water and beat until smooth. Stir in 1/4 cup chopped walnuts. Sift together 1/3 cup soft breadcrumbs and 2 teaspoons baking powder and stir into egg yolk mixture. Set aside. Beat 1 egg white until stiff and fold into yolk mixture. Spread in a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Makes 12 servings.

In a large skillet bring to a boil the water, sugar and ginger for 5 minutes. Peel and cut up the peaches and jalapenos. Add to skillet and cook until tender for 10 minutes or until the peaches are a light golden color. Stir in the lemon juice and cinnamon and simmer for another 5 minutes until the liquid is syrupy. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Serve warm over chicken or pork or cool over ice cream.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add flour and cook until golden. Whisk in milk, half-and-half, lemon juice, Old Bay seasoning. Add onions and cook until soft. Add crabmeat and cook for 5 minutes. Add cream and parsley. Salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in parsley. Serve hot.

Wash the potato. Cut a slice off the top. Scrape out the potato from inside and mash the potato. Put back the top of the potato. Melt the butter in a frying pan. Sprinkle the potato with cheddar cheese and bacon. Fry until the potato is browned. Remove the potato and sprinkle with sour cream and top with the green onion. Serve hot.

Clean and pick over cranberries. Combine cranberries with water in large pot. Bring to boil over medium heat and boil gently for 20 minutes or until cranberries are very soft. Stir occasionally while boiling. Add sugar, cinnamon and pectin. Bring mixture back to a boil and boil for one minute or until mixture is thickened slightly. Remove from heat. Ladle mixture into hot jars leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Remove air bubbles. Wipe rim of jar with clean paper towel. Center hot lid on jar. Screw band down until fingertip tight. Place jars in boiling water canner. Boil jars for 10 minutes. Remove from canner. Let cool on wire rack. Check seals after 24 hours. Makes about 6 half pint jars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Boil potatoes until just tender. Cool. In large mixing bowl combine all ingredients and season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon into 1-1/2-quart casserole dish. Bake uncovered 30 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with foil. Place chicken breasts and sage leaves on a cutting board and chop both together into 1/4 inch pieces. Combine chicken and sage in a bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Lay the prosciutto over the breasts and roll them up. Place the chicken breasts seam side down on the baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Turn the breasts over and bake for 20 to 25 minutes more. Transfer the chicken breasts to a serving plate and drizzle with sherry. Sprinkle with more sage leaves and serve immediately. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 325 f. Place ribs on roasting pan. In a small bowl, combine garlic cloves and rosemary. Add olive oil and toss to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Spread mixture over ribs and roast until ribs are tender, about 3 hours. Meanwhile, in small bowl, combine hot pepper flakes and lemon juice and stir to blend. Pour 3 tablespoons mixture over ribs. Return to oven and roast 15 minutes longer, basting occasionally with pan drippings. Discard garlic and rosemary before serving.

Place the oil and mayonnaise in a bowl and mix well. Add the buttermilk and blend well. Add the Romano Cheese and Parmesan Cheese and blend well. Add basil and blend well. Add the garlic powder and hot pepper sauce and blend well. Add paprika and blend well. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Roughly chop the greens. Divide the greens between two plates. Top the greens with the walnuts. Slice the steak and top the salad with it. Sprinkle the cheese and toss. Drizzle with the balsamic vinaigrette.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add plantains, cinnamon sticks, hot pepper sauce, brown sugar and whole cloves. Cook for 10 minutes or until plantains are softened. Remove plantains from skillet with a slotted spoon to a serving dish. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a shallow 1-1/2 quart casserole. Mix squash and onion with salt and pepper to taste. Add milk and eggs and beat well. Add cheese and mix lightly. Pour into baking dish and sprinkle with crumbs. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until set. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the grill or broiler, and brush the corn with a little of the oil. Place the corn on the grill and cook about 10 minutes, turning once or twice. Remove from the grill and cut the kernels off the cobs, placing them in a bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients and toss gently but thoroughly. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9 inch pie pan with a prepared pie crust. In a large bowl, combine cream cheese and sugar. Beat until well blended. Add cornstarch. Beat until smooth. Add water. Beat until smooth. Add gelatin. Stir until well blended. Add strawberries. Stir until blended. Pour into prepared pie shell. Bake for 40 minutes. Cool before serving. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all the ingredients in a 5 quart slow cooker. Stir well. Cover and cook 4 hours on high. Or, if you would like to brown the sprouts slightly, cook for 3 hours on high. Serve alone or as a side to meat.

Beat shortening and sugars at medium speed with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla and eggs at low speed until blended. Combine flour and next 4 ingredients at low speed until blendedadd to creamed mixture at low speed until blended. Stir in pineapple. Cover and chill at least 1 hour.Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Drop rounded teaspoonfuls of dough about 1 1/2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Remove from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Store tightly covered at room temperature.
In a large saucepan, combine rice, milk and salt. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 45 minutes. Add sugar and spices. Serve warm.
Fill 2/3 glass with ice. Add orange juice, apple juice and hawaiian punch. Fill glass with carbonated lemon-lime beverage. Stir gently. Garnish with a slice of orange. Makes 1 serving.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Add pork and brown on all sides. Add cider vinegar and simmer for 3-5 minutes. Add the apricot preserves and chicken broth. Simmer 25 minutes. Add green peppers, pineapple chunks and cornstarch. Stir until thickened and well blended. Serve over rice.

Cook beans in broth until tender but firm, about 20 minutes. Drain and return beans to pan. Add ham and ham broth and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Stir in potatoes and thyme and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes more. Remove pan from heat. Stir in garlic and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large mixing bowl combine flour, salt, sugar. Add baking powder. Mix well. Add milk all at once to the dry ingredients. Beat hard for 30 seconds. Stir in butter. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown.
Cook bacon until crisp. Cut each slice in half. Crumble over salad. Sprinkle with cheese. Mix mayonnaise and lemon juicedrizzle over salad. Wrap in tortillas. Cut in half for serving.
In a small bowl, combine shrimp, grapes, lemon juice and olive oil. Chill at least 1 hour. Split rolls and fill each half with 1/2 cup of the shrimp mixture. Garnish with chives.

Prepare banana cream pudding according to package directions using low-fat milk and 1/3 cup rum extractset aside to cool slightly. Add raisins and 1/4 cup rum extract. Spread evenly into 8-inch square pan coated with cooking spray. Refrigerate 3 hours or until set. Top with banana slices and graham wafers. Drizzle with cinnamon. Store in refrigerator. Makes 6 servings (1-1/2 cups).

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine oil, chili powder and cumin. Slowly cook for 5 minutes. Add orange juice and lime juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in honey. Serve warm or cool. Makes 1 1/3 cup sauce.

Peel and devein the shrimps. Soak shrimps with lemon juice for about 10 minutes. Mix the other ingredients together. Deep fry the shrimps until cooked. Drain and set aside. Heat oil. Saute onions. Add the garlic. Stir and saute for a while. Then add the shrimps and soy sauce. Stir until the shrimps are cooked. Add tomatoes. Serve hot.

Heat oil in wok or frying pan over medium heat. Add beans and stir-fry for 1 minute or until crisp-tender. Remove from pan and keep warm. In the same pan, stir together the remaining ingredients. Stir over medium heat until liquid thickens and glazes. Return beans to pan and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Line a cookie sheet with aluminum foil. Peel potatoes and cut them in half lengthwise. Put them on cookie sheet and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with italian seasoning and parmesan. Bake for about an hour. Toss occasionally.

In a large skillet brown ground beef and drain excess fat. Stir in salt and pork and beans. Spoon into a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. In a small bowl combine barbecue sauce and onion. Spoon over meat. Bake at 375 for 1 hour or until bubbly. Combine milk and baking soda in a bowl and stir into the biscuits. Press over meat and bake for 10 more minutes or until biscuits are golden brown. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Place apples and ginger in the cloth and tie securely. In a large saucepan, combine apple cider and spices. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until spices are fragrant and apples are tender, about 1 hour. Serve warm. Makes 8 to 10 cups.

Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease muffin cups or use paper liners. Mix flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt in a bowl. Whisk eggs and milk in another bowl until smooth. Add oil and beat to mix. Pour over dry ingredients and add half of the crunchy peanut butter. Mix just until dry ingredients are moistened. Scoop into prepared muffin cups. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown and firm in the center. Let cool in pan for 5 minutes. Brush tops with the remaining crunchy peanut butter.

In a skillet over medium heat, melt butter and add the celery and onion. Cook until tender. Add the sausage and cook until no longer pink. Pour the chicken broth into the sausage mixture and stir. In a mixing bowl, add the sausage mixture and the celery and onion mixture and toss together. In a small bowl, combine the asiago cheese croutons and the pork sausage mixture and stir until cheese is evenly distributed. Serve warm.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowlstir well. In a small skillet over medium-low heat, warm olive oil. Add crabmeatcook 2 minutes or until heated through, stirring constantly. Stir in vinegar mixturecook 1 minute or until liquid is almost evaporated. Sprinkle with chivesserve with toasts.

Cut carrots into very thin slices. Put into a bowl, add butter and honey and toss to mix. Add lemon juice and season with pepper and nutmeg to taste. Cook in a saucepan over moderate heat until carrots are tender. Serve warm or cold.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add mushrooms and saute until just tender. Set aside. Preheat broiler. In a large bowl, beat together eggs and baking powder. Stir in mushrooms and cheese. Add milk, a little at a time, until mixture is smooth. Pour into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees f for about 25 minutes. Reduce heat to broil. Sprinkle with cheese. Broil about 5 minutes or until puffed and golden. Serve immediately.
Soften cream cheese. Mix with strawberry jam. Spread on crackers. Sprinkle with orange peel and pecans. Serve chilled.

Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium heat. Add onions and saute until golden. Add carrots and potatoes and cook until tender. Add milk and water and season to taste. Bring to a boil and cook over low heat for about 10 minutes. Add thyme and bay leaf and remove from heat. Remove bay leaf and serve hot. Add sour cream and dried parsley to garnish. Serves 6.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion, cook until softened and translucent. Add garlic cloves, stirring for a minute or two. Add the fennel seeds, stirring for a minute or two. Add the cabbage to the pot. Season with salt and pepper. Add water to just cover cabbage. Bring to a boil, lower heat to a simmer and cook covered until tender. Stir in balsamic vinegar. Serve.

Combine tuna, wheat germ, and eggs. Add the remaining ingredients. Mix well. Shape into 4 oz. patties. Dip into a mixture of egg and milk. Roll in breadcrumbs. Fry in hot cooking oil until golden brown. Drain well. Serve warm. Serves 4.

Heat 1 Tbsp olive oil in a skillet over medium heat until hot. Add chops and brown on both sides. Add remaining olive oil, sage, black & red pepper blend and rosemary to skillet and stir to combine. Cook for about 2 to 3 minutes. Turn chops over and cook for about 2 minutes until done to your liking. Salt to taste. Serve with rice or noodles.

In a large pitcher, combine pomegranate juice, papaya nectar, orange juice and sugar. Stir well. Chill for 3 hours. Stir before serving. Place strawberries and kiwis in a large glass container. Pour pomegranate juice mixture over fruit and stir well. Garnish each glass with a strawberry and a kiwi and serve.

Place a heavy skillet over medium high heat. Add olive oil and saute garlic until just white. Add all vegetables and saute until tender crisp. Add balsamic vinegar, water and tomato paste. Simmer uncovered, stirring occasionally until most of the liquid is evaporated. Stir in sardines. Cook about 5 minutes longer. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over hot cooked pasta.

In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook sweet potatoes until they are tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain and allow to cool. When potatoes are cool, combine in a large bowl with the shallots, parsley, garlic powder, salt and black pepper. Add the olive oil and combine. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. These were delicious! I loved the addition of the parsley. I made them for a friend who was trying to get healthier and she really enjoyed them. She said she would definitely make them again. The parsley added a nice freshness to the dish.
Marinate pork tenderloin for 30 minutes in a mixture of soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, and honey. Season the pork with brown sugar and sesame seeds. Broil for 12 minutes. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large skillet, heat oil. Season chicken with pepper. Brown over medium heat about 2 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to a baking pan. In a large bowl, combine onion, thyme leaves, garlic cloves, apple cider vinegar, chicken broth, and 3 tablespoons of butter. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Pour over chicken. Bake until a thermometer reads 170 degrees f. Remove chicken from pan. Pour pan juices into a small bowl. Add remaining butter, whisk until melted. Serve with chicken.

Boil potatoes in a large pot of lightly salted water until tender when pierced with a sharp knife, about 15 minutes. Drain potatoes and allow to cool slightly. Meanwhile, whisk together mustards, vinegars and shallots in a large bowl. Whisk in oil in a slow steady stream until combined. Season with salt and pepper. When potatoes are cool enough to handle, cut into 2-inch pieces and add to dressing. Toss well to coat. Top with parsley, season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve at room temperature or slightly chilled. Serves 6 to 8.

Place orange juice, honey and 2 tablespoons of water in a saucepan. Stir over high heat until boiling and the sugar has dissolved. Lower heat and simmer for 1 minute. Turn off heat and let cool. Pour mixture over the fruits and mint leaves and toss to coat well. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.
Heat grill to high heat. Cook corn for 10-15 minutes turning frequently. Brush with butter and season with salt and herbs.

Cook the pasta according to the directions on the package. Preheat oven to 375F. Mix together the cottage cheese, eggs and parmesan cheese. In a 13x9x2-inch baking dish, spread half of the pasta. Sprinkle with half of the cheese mixture. Repeat with the remaining pasta and cheese mixture. Sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until heated through and the cheese is bubbly. Serve hot with a side salad. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 325. Grease a 9x13 baking dish. In a medium bowl combine eggs and water. In a large bowl combine oats, onion and spices. Add beef and mix well. Add ketchup and mix well. Add egg mixture. Mix well. Press mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour. Serve with ketchup or your favorite pasta sauce.

Pound chicken to 1/4 thickness between plastic wrap. Sprinkle both sides with seasoned flour. Beat the eggs and milk together. Dip chicken into egg mixture then into flour again. Next dip into fine bread crumbs and press to adhere. Saute chicken for 2 minutes per side in butter over high heat. Add the prosciutto and saute for 1 more minute then add the cream and cognac and simmer 1 minute or until thickened. Top with grated gruyere and serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over high heat and saute salmon fillets in hot oil until browned and crispy, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer to an ovenproof dish and sprinkle with coarse salt and fresh ground black pepper. Drizzle salmon with extra virgin olive oil and squeeze with lemon juice. Roast in the oven for 8-10 minutes until just opaque in center and heated through.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lay out bacon slices on paper towels. Cover bacon slices with more paper towels and place on top of chicken to help keep them flat. Spread 1 tablespoon pasta sauce on each chicken breast. Sprinkle cheese on top and then sprinkle bacon over the cheese. Top with another tablespoon of pasta sauce. Bake 25 minutes. Meanwhile cook the linguine. Drain and add ragu pasta sauce to the cooking water. Stir and add chicken broth. Add cooked linguine and stir. Serve chicken on top of the pasta and sprinkle with parsley if desired.

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the diced shallot and stir for a minute or so till translucent. Add the salmon fillets and cook for about 2 mins each side and then transfer them to a plate and keep warm. Add the white wine and boil till reduced by half. Then add the fish stock, dill and cook for a minute or so till reduced by half again. Add the pasta and toss for about a minute or so till the sauce clings to the pasta. Add the shrimp and cook for another minute or so and then add the cream and stir for another minute or so till the sauce thickens slightly. Serve immediately with the salmon fillets on top. Garnish with chopped parsley or dill if desired.

Place apricot preserves and Kahlua in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until mixture has thickened slightly and is reduced to about half its original volume. Cool the glaze. Pat the turkey dry with paper towels. Truss the turkey with kitchen twine. In a small bowl combine the apricot glaze and the unsalted butter. Rub the turkey all over with the glaze mixture. Place the turkey on a roasting rack in a large roasting pan. Roast the turkey for 45 minutes. Remove the turkey from the oven and brush the turkey with the remaining glaze mixture. Continue roasting the turkey until the meat thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the thigh reaches 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) or the turkey is browned.

Preheat oven to 180c. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Cook shallots until translucent. Add chicken stock and tarragon vinegar. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cut breasts into 1/2 inch slices. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add breasts and cook for 4-5 minutes or until lightly browned. Drain excess fat. Stir in shallot mixture and cook until chicken is cooked through. In a small saucepan combine cream and cornstarch. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes or until sauce thickens. Stir in mustard and dried tarragon. Stir chicken and sauce into a serving dish. Garnish with tarragon sprigs. Serves 4.

Put frozen raspberries in a large saucepan and cover with boiling water and sugar. Let stand for 20 minutes or until berries are softened and the syrup is cool. Strain through a colander over a large bowl or pail (use a non-metal strainer). Squeeze the pulp over the syrup to get as much syrup as possible and discard the pulp. Chill in the fridge for a couple of hours or overnight. To serve, put a few raspberries in each glass and top them up with the cordial. Add a wedge of lemon or a sprig of mint for garnish.

Cut the top off the head of garlic. Remove the garlic cloves from the papery skin. Mince the garlic cloves. In a small bowl combine the garlic cloves with the olive oil. Let stand for 2 hours. Add the tomatoes, lemon juice, scallions, vinegar, and basil. Cover the bowl and refrigerate. Serve over fresh tomato slices.
In a food processor, add all the ingredients and pulse until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Serve with crackers. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Place the chickens in a roasting pan. Cover the chickens with the new potatoes. Season with the butter, salt, and pepper. Place in the oven and roast for 1 hour. After an hour, add the asparagus. Continue roasting for an additional 30 minutes. Remove the chickens from the oven. Discard the skin. Place the chickens on serving plates. Pour the juices from the pan over the chicken. Serve with the new potatoes and the asparagus. Squeeze the juice of 1 lemon over the chicken. Drizzle with fresh thyme. Makes 4 servings.

Toss green beans with radishes, prosciutto and sherry wine. In a small bowl combine dijon mustard and fresh chives. In another small bowl combine oil and parmesan cheese. Add to the radish mixture and toss to coat evenly. Serve at once.

In a large bowl combine the soy sauce, honey, canola oil and prepared horseradish to make a glaze. In a small bowl combine steak seasoning and garlic powder. Sprinkle the seasoning mixture over the chicken breasts. Thread the meat, sweet peppers and onions alternately onto metal skewers. Place the kabobs in the bowl with the glaze and turn to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Heat grill to medium-high heat. Grill the kabobs 10 minutes turning once or until the meat is done to preference. Serve with the sauce.

In a saucepan, combine white wine, cod fish and saltine crackers. Simmer over medium heat for 30 minutes. Drain and reserve 2 cups of the stock. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add garlic powder and paprika and cook for 1 minute. Stir in reserved stock and bring to a boil. Add the codfish mixture and simmer for 10 minutes or until heated through. Serve over rice with grated Parmesan cheese.

In a large bowl add the tomatoes, mushrooms, zucchini & pepperoni. Combine the dressing and pour over the vegetables. Chill for 1 hour. Sprinkle the salad with parmesan cheese. Serve with crusty french bread.

Wash mushrooms and trim off stems. Clean green chilies and cut into small pieces. Make a thick paste of green chilies and tasty cheese by grinding in a mixer. Take a bowl and add mushrooms and green chili paste in it. Mix well and stuff each mushroom with this mixture. Take a tray and arrange mushrooms on it in a single layer. Sprinkle salt on top of mushrooms and bake for about 10-15 minutes or until the mushrooms are browned and cooked well. Serve hot with green chutney or tomato sauce.

In a double boiler or microwave-safe bowl combine chocolate chips with milk. Stir constantly until completely melted and smooth. Remove from heat. Add extract and coloring. Pour into 6 mugs. Top with whipped cream and nonpareils.

Bring brown sugar, salt and evaporated milk to a boil in a saucepan. Cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in butter. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Let set until firm. Roll in chopped nuts.

Combine cabbage, onion, mushrooms, beef, 1 tablespoon of the butter, 1/2 cup of the sour cream, the sherry, and the Worcestershire sauce in a large skillet. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes or until cabbage is crisp-tender. Remove from the heat. Combine the cabbage mixture, sour cream and the remaining butter in a medium bowlset aside. Roll out the pastry on a lightly floured surface to a 12-inch circle. Fit the pastry into a 9-inch pie plate. Add the cabbage mixturetop with the remaining 1/2 cup sour cream. Sprinkle with the bacon. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Let cool slightly before serving.

Bring 4 cups water to boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat, stir in 4 tea bags. Let stand 5 minutes. Remove tea bagsstir in 2 cups cold water. Refrigerate 2 hours or until well chilled. Pour tea through a fine strainer over ice cubes in a 2-quart pitcherstir in sugar and lemon juice. Makes 10 servings.

Cream together butter, brown sugar. Mix in eggs. Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to mixture. Combine. Add rolled oats. Add boiling water. Chill dough at least 2 hours. Shape dough into 1 inch balls. Place balls 2 inches apart on lightly greased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 minutes. Makes about 2 1/2 dozen.

Place chicken breasts in a baking dish. In a small bowl combine the oil, chicken stock and marmalademix well. Pour marinade over chicken. Sprinkle chicken with thyme leaves. Cover dish and refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 425F. Bake chicken for 10 minutes or until done. Remove from oven and baste with marinade. Return chicken to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until browned.

Combine boiling water and chocolate syrup in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir until melted and smooth. Add milk and stir until heated through. Pour into 2 mugs and top with a dollop of whipped cream. Add a dash of kahlua.

Marinate steaks in soy sauce overnight. Thread steaks onto skewers alternating with catsup and lemon slices. Grill over medium heat, turning several times until done about 5 minutes per side. Garnish with fresh parsley and lemon slices and serve with garlic bread.

Dissolve bouillon in boiling water. Add turkey and cook 2 minutes. Add tomatoes with juice. Bring to a boil. Add celery, carrots and onion. Cook 1 minute. Add rice and spices. Cook 5 minutes more. Makes 6 servings.

Heat butter in medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not browned. Add onion and cook until tender but not brown. Add corn, increase heat to high, and cook for 1 minute. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook 1 minute longer, stirring frequently. Beat eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and oregano together. Pour over onion-corn mixture, and cook for 3 minutes or until eggs begin to set. Sprinkle with tomatoes and green peppercover, cook 2 minutes or until eggs are set on bottom. Sprinkle with cheesecover, cook just until eggs are set on top. Serve immediately.

Cream butter & sugar together add egg yolks & vanilla. Combine flour & baking powder. Add flour mixture alternately with milk to creamed mixture. Shape into 1" balls. Place 2" apart on greased cookie sheets. Bake 8-10 min or until light golden brown. Cool 1-2 min. Remove from cookie sheets & cool completely on wire racks. Store in airtight containers. Makes 72 cookies.

Bring 3 cups water to boil. Stir in rice and boil for 10-12 minutes until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Drain rice and let cool to room temperature. Whisk together sour cream and eggs until smooth. Add sour cream mixture to rice and stir well. Stir in onions and season with salt and pepper to taste. Chill 8 hours or overnight. Serve chilled garnished with green onions. Makes 4-6 servings.

Pour the cider into a pot. Add the lemon slices, whole cloves, cinnamon sticks, and molasses. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove the whole spices. Add the lemon juice. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve in mugs.

In a heavy skillet over medium-high heat, saute onions and garlic in oil until onions are tender. Add rice and stir-fry for 1 minute. Stir in wine. Cook until liquid is absorbed. Add 2 cups stock and lemon rind. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add mushrooms. Cover. Cook for 10 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in remaining 2 cups stock. Stir in spinach and cook for 2 minutes. Season with thyme. Serve immediately.
Brown the chicken in olive oil and drain. Add to a large pan with potatoes, carrots, tomatoes, pork, onion. Cook for 30 minutes. Add spices. Cook for another 30 minutes.

In a bowl toss the chick-peas with olive oil cooking spray until they are all coated well. In a bowl mix the spices together then sprinkle the mixture over the chick-peas. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Spread the chick-peas out onto the sheet in a single layer so they are not touching. Bake at 375 for about 20-25 minutes or until they are a nice golden brown color. You may also add a little more seasoning after they have been cooked if desired. Let them cool down before serving or eating.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over medium high heat. Add potatoes and boil for about 10 minutes until potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife or fork. Remove from pot and run under cold water. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl combine potatoes, beans, onions and sour cream and gently mix. Add lemon juice and season with pepper and salt to taste. Fold in the mayonnaise and chives. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed. Serve immediately or chill for later.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat oil in nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add onion and ham. Cook 2-3 minutes or until onion is softened and ham is heated through. Stir in mushrooms and mustardcook 2-3 minutes or until mushrooms are heated through and liquid is evaporated. Drain pasta and toss with ham mixture and cream. Season with salt and pepper if desired. Sprinkle with parmesan before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Butter a shallow baking dish.Place the mashed potatoes in a large bowl. Add the butter, eggs, salt and pepper. Stir well. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated over or until puffed and golden brown. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 450f. In a small bowl, combine tarragon, garlic clove, salt and pepper to taste. Place mushrooms in a baking dish, pour tarragon mixture over top and stir to coat evenly. Bake for 15 minutes, stirring once or twice while cooking. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan of boiling water, cook spinach until wilteddrain in a colander set in the sink. Gently stir in mushrooms. Combine oil, vinegar, tarragon and garlic in a small jar. Shake to blend well. Pour dressing over mushroom-spinach mixture and toss to coat evenly. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Lightly beat eggs, milk and pumpkin puree together in a shallow dish. In another dish, combine brown sugar, vanilla, and pumpkin pie spicemix well. Dip each slice of bread in egg mixturethen in pumpkin mixture, coating both sides. Place in a single layer in a greased 13x9 inch baking dishsprinkle with nuts. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 6 servings.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are browned, stirring occasionally. Add the soy sauce, sugar, and lemon juice. Cook for another 5 minutes until the liquid evaporates. Serve the mushrooms warm. Serves 4

Season the roast with the salt and pepper. Place the roast in the slow cooker. Add the broth. Cover and cook on high for 3 hours. Add the soup and beer. Cover and cook for 1 more hour. Slice the roast across the grain to serve. To serve the sandwiches, spread the butter on the top of the french roll. Place the sliced roast on the french roll. Serve with the soup.

Melt margarine in a large saucepan over med. Heat. Add peanut butterstir to combine. Add honeycook, stirring frequently, until mixture is well blended. Add vanillastir to blend. Add oatmeal and cerealmix well. Spread onto a cookie sheet. Bake for 45 minutes or till golden brown. Stir occasionally while baking. Remove from ovenstir in chocolate chips. Spread evenly on a waxed paper lined cookie sheet. Cool completelybreak into clusters. Store in airtight container for up to 1 week or freeze up to 1 month. Makes about 15 servings (2-3/4 cups).

Melt margarine in a frying pan with a few drops of white wine. When it starts to sizzle add the apples. Cook gently until apples are tender. Sprinkle with the sugar and cinnamon. Pour in the wine and lemon juice. Cook for another 10 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Peel potatoes. Dice potatoes. Boil potatoes for 10 minutes. Drain water from potatoes. Grind potatoes in a grinder. Add red chili powder, mango powder, green chilies, mint and coriander. Make a mixture of potatoes. Heat oil. Make balls from the potato mixture. Deep fry in oil. Make a sauce by heating tomato ketchup, salt, red chili powder in a pan. Add potato kebabs into sauce. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve hot.

In a large bowl or pot (I like to use my 4-cup Pyrex measuring cup) stir together the cocoa powder, fructevia, cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg, salt. Add the milk gradually to achieve a thick but pourable consistency. Stir in the hot water. Serve with a drizzle of vanilla extract. This is one of the most delicious cocoa recipes I've ever had! It is also a great way to use up the fructevia that you may have left over from a holiday gift basket.

Mix cake mix as directed on box. Add egg and milk. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and cool for about an hour. Frost with chocolate frosting. Bake for one hour at 350 degrees. When done remove from oven. Using a knife poke holes all over cake. Pour pudding over the top of the cake. Let it sit for about one hour. Put the cake in the fridge overnight. Serves 12.

In a bowl combine paprika, thyme and salt. Sprinkle shrimp and toss. In a large skillet heat olive oil. Add shrimp and cook 3 minutes on each side or until shrimp turn pink. Remove from pan and set aside. Cut papayas into chunks and place in a bowl. Add scallions. Drain shrimp and add to bowl. Add lime juice and toss. Serve immediately.
Pour all the margarita mix ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour over ice in a rocks glass. Garnish with a lime wedge. Add salt if desired.

Slice onion and place on platter. Chop cucumber and watercress and place on platter. Slice Bibb lettuce and arrange on platter. Combine vinegar, Worcestershire sauce and sugar. Whisk in oil until mixture is well-blended. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle over salad.

Preheat oven to 400. Place potatoes in a large bowl and drizzle with olive oil. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with garlic salt and paprika. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake 45 minutes or until tender.
In blender combine ice cubes, grenadine and orange juice. Blend till smooth. Serve in glasses with garnish of orange slices and cherries.

Mix first 7 ingredients until crumbly. Press onto bottom and up sides of 10 inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes. Cool on rack 15 minutes. Spread pineapple on bottom crust. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook 5 minutes or until tender. Add garliccook 1 minute longer. Stir in remaining 4 ingredients until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heatcool slightly. Pour over pineapple layer. Top with steakcover with top crust. Press edges to seal. Crimp decoratively. Cut slits in top crust for steam to escape. Place in baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 1 hour or until golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting to serve. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Place piloncillo cones in a large saucepan. Add water just to cover. Add cinnamon sticks. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove cinnamon sticks. Add green onions. Simmer uncovered until syrup reduces to 1/2 cup, about 5 minutes. Slice french bread lengthwise. Spread each slice with soft margarine. Sprinkle with raisins and pecans. Top with cheese. Cover each slice with a piece of foil. Arrange slices in a single layer in a baking dish. Pour syrup over bread. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Brown sausage with flour until sausage is cooked. Remove sausage from pan. Add milk to pan. Bring to boil. Add flour. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add buttermilk. Cook until thick. Add salt and black pepper. Serve over biscuits.
Pour orange juice and orange blossom water into a shallow serving dish. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add strawberries and serve chilled or at room temperature.

Season beef with garlic. Brown beef in olive oil and then set aside. Sauté garlic in same pan. Deglaze pan with Marsala wine. Add chicken stock, cream of mushroom soup, mushrooms. Bring to a simmer. Add beef and simmer until done. Serve over pasta or rice.

Heat oven to 350. Coat 2 baking sheets with cooking spray. Cut tomatoes in halfplace cut sides down on baking sheets. Bake until skins start to blister and wrinkle. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook until translucent. Add the pumpkin and stir. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the broth. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the sherry and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 more minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the cream and tarragon. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line two baking sheets with aluminum foil. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine butter and hazelnuts. Cook, stirring frequently until butter is foamy and nuts are toasted and fragrant. Pour in 1/2 cup water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer, stirring frequently until butter is light golden brown and the water is evaporated. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Cut brussels sprouts in half lengthwise and remove the core. Place in the baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and bake until lightly browned and crisp tender. Top with the nut brown butter. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450f. Pierce each russet potato 4-5 times with a fork. Place in a small bowl. Add 1/4 cup water and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Toss to coat. Place in a single layer on a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake 35-45 minutes or until soft. In a small bowl combine remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon coriander and 1 tablespoon chili powder. Place in a small bowl. Drizzle with olive oil. Gently rub all over the potatoes. Cut into wedges. Arrange in a single layer. Sprinkle with fresh chives. Serve with sour cream.

In a blender or food processor, combine lime juice, garlic and salt. Blend until smooth. Rub mixture over pork shoulder. Place on grill and cook until done. Serve with salsa on the side and sliced cucumbers on the top.

Mix together the cheese with the herbs and parsley and set aside for 15 minutes. Meanwhile beat the eggs with the wine. Mix in the potato and season with salt and pepper. Mix in the cheese and herb mixture. Shape into small balls and roll in sesame seeds. Bake for 30 minutes in moderate to hot oven.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix sugar cookie mix and egg. Add flour and almond extract. Mix well. Roll out onto floured surface until 1/4 thick. Cut into desired shapes. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 8 - 10 minutes or until golden brown around edges and set in center. Cool on cooling racks. When cool decorate with colored sugar sprinkles.

Cut the pineapple in half and remove the core and the eyes. Cut each half into quarters lengthwise and then crosswise. Remove and discard the seeds and chop the pineapple finely. In a large bowl, toss together the pineapple, onion, jalapeno peppers and cilantro and set aside. Season the tuna steaks generously with the kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper and set them aside to come to room temperature. Preheat the grill over medium heat and lightly oil the grate. Cook the tuna steaks for about 5 minutes on each side for rare and let them rest for about 5 minutes before serving. Serve with a generous amount of the pineapple salsa and some lime wedges for squeezing over the tuna.

Cook bacon in a medium skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon and drain off drippings. Add cabbage and cook over medium heat until tender, 6 to 8 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and cook 1 minute more. Remove from heat.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9x13 dish with cooking spray. Place half of the chicken breasts on bottom of dish and top with half of the green beans and sliced mushrooms. Top with remaining chicken breasts and green beans and mushrooms. In saucepan over medium heat, combine soup, mayonnaise and lemon juicemix well. Pour over chicken breasts. Combine the biscuit mix and butter until crumblyspread over the top of the casserole. Sprinkle with cheese and seasoned croutonsbake 35-40 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown and chicken is tender. Serve hot with salad or vegetable.

Peel radishes. Cut radishes crosswise into 1/2-inch-wide slices and transfer to medium bowl. Add scallions and stir to mix. Add creme fraiche and season with sugar and salt. Toss to combine. Serve at once.

Sauté onion and leek in olive oil until translucent and softened. Add apples and cook until softened (about 5-10 minutes). Add chicken broth and bay leaf. Bring to a simmer and cook until potatoes are tender (about 10-15 minutes). Add salt and thyme. Remove bay leaf and puree in a blender or with an immersion blender. Return to heat and stir in evaporated milk and brie until smooth and heated through (about 3-5 minutes). Season with additional salt if desired and serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine the flour and salt. Using the tips of your fingers, mix the flour and salt together until it resembles course meal. Add egg and yolks and mix well. Add the water gradually and mix until dough forms. Knead on floured surface until smooth and elastic. Wrap dough in plastic and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. When ready to cook, heat the vegetable oil in a large pot until it reaches 360 degrees fahrenheit. Divide dough into 1/4 portions and shape into large balls. Cut each ball into 4 strips using a sharp knife. Working one at a time, drop strips into the hot oil. Cook until golden brown and crisp. Transfer to paper towels and repeat with remaining dough. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees centigrade. Grease a 20cm tin. Cream butter and sugar. Beat egg yolks with baking powder. Fold in flour. Beat egg whites to stiff peaks. Fold in the butter mixture. Add cinnamon. Pour into the tin. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve with jam and milk.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees farenheit. In a bowl combine the flour with the salt and the black pepper. Cut in the butter until it resembles coarse crumbs. Mix in the milk with a fork just until a ball forms that holds together when pressed lightly with a finger. On a lightly floured surface roll the dough out to 12-inch round. Line a 9 inch pie pan with the dough. Prick the bottom with a fork and bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. In a large skillet cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp, stirring occasionally. Remove the bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon. Add the broccoli florets to the bacon drippings in the skillet. Cook over medium heat until lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat. In a large bowl beat together the eggs, milk and onion until well blended. Stir in the bacon, broccoli, cheese, salt and pepper. Pour into the prepared pie shell. Bake in the preheated oven

Grease 1-1/2 quart casserole with butter. Crush bread in bowlstir in milk. Add ham, broccoli, cheese, salt & mustardbeat til moistened. Pour into casseroledot with butter. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or till set. Serves 4.

Soak bread in milk overnight or for at least 4 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. Cream butter and sugaradd eggs and mix well. Blend in milk, then add bread. Spoon mixture into prepared casserole dish and bake 40 minutes or until done. Combine brown sugar, nutmeg, vanilla extract, and cinnamonsprinkle over bread pudding. Bake 5 minutes or until topping is bubbly. Sprinkle with pecans. Serve warm.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Cook the pasta according to the package directions, stirring occasionally until al dentedrain well. Meanwhile, in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, warm the butter with the shallot and crushed red pepper flakes. Add the broccoli florets and cook until tender crisp, about 2 minutes. Stir in the half-and-half and Parmesan cheesecook until the mixture has thickened slightly, about 2 minutes more. Season with pepper. Toss the pasta with the broccoli saucegarnish with the basil before serving.

Cook rice according to package directions. Meanwhile in a skillet, brown beef with onion until no pink remains. Add crushed tomatoes and simmer about 10 minutes. Stuff bell peppers with beef mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 30 minutes.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle with flour and stir until bubbly. Stir in whole milk, salt and pepper. Cook 3 to 4 minutes, stirring constantly until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat and beat in eggs. Return to heat and cook 1 minute or until mixture coats the back of a spoon. Stir in parsley. Makes 1-1/2 cups.

Pierce the pumpkin skin with a sharp knife, then cook in a covered pan with about 1 and 1/2 cup of water. Cooking time is about 30 minutes or until the pumpkin is soft. Cool slightly and remove the skin. Cut into pieces. Add sugar and soy sauce. Bring to a boil over medium heat and simmer for about 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Brown ground beef and drain fat. In a large saucepan combine the meat, water, ketchup, mustard, macaroni and cheese mix and 3 cups of water. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook until the macaroni is tender about 10 minutes. Add frozen corn, peas and cheese and continue cooking until the cheese is melted stirring occasionally. Serve with your favorite toppings.
Peel and shred cabbage. Rinse and drain well. Combine all other ingredients except for lettuce. Toss to combine. Fold in lettuce and serve.

In a large ziploc bag or container combine the first five ingredients. Add the chicken breasts and toss to coat. Cover tightly and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Place the chicken on a broiling pan or in a baking dish. Bake for 20-30 minutes or until cooked through.
Season chicken with garlic salt and pepper and brown in crockpot. Add onion and cook until tender. Add mushroom soup. Stir in rice and green chilies and cook until rice is tender. Makes 4 servings.

Wash the fish thoroughly and remove the gills. Pat the fish dry with paper towels and place on the bottom of the pan with the skin side down. Add the carrots and zucchini around the fish and sprinkle the lemon juice and dried parsley flakes on top. Cover and steam until the fish is just done, about 10 minutes. Serve sprinkled with the dill weed and lemon pepper seasoning.

Melt the butter in a pan, add the onion, and fry until soft but not coloured. Add the flour and stir for 2-3 minutes. Gradually add the milk, stirring all the time until it thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Add the cod and parsley, and heat through. Serve with toast or crusty bread.

Prepare the batter. Cut the fillets into strips and trim away any unwanted fat. Squeeze the juice from half the lemons and set aside for later. Peel and finely slice the onion and spring onions. Remove the seeds from the Scotch Bonnet Peppers. Peel and finely slice the coriander. Preheat the oil in a deep frying pan. Blend together the flour, remaining half of the lemon juice and seasoning to make a batter. Add 100ml of water and whisk to a smooth mixture. Dip the fish in the batter and fry until golden brown. Drain on kitchen paper and keep warm. Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan. Add the onion and spring onion and cook for 3 minutes until softened. Stir in the peppers and coriander and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the remaining lemon juice and serve at once with the fish.

Cook pasta in a pot of boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a bowl mix Italian dressing with diced tomatoes and olives. Pour over the pasta and toss. Top with parmesan cheese and serve.

Put a little bit of oil in the bottom of a skillet. Add a small amount of rice. Stir it around. Then add about 1/2 cup of water. Stir it around. The rice should be spread out evenly. Then add a little bit of water. Stir it around. Then add a little bit more water. Stir it around. The rice should be spread out evenly. Add a little bit of water. Stir it around. Repeat until you run out of water. Then turn the heat off. Let it sit for about 20 minutes. Fluff up the rice with a fork. Add some salt. Then eat.

Place the roast into a slow cooker and add enough cold water to cover it completely. Add the rest of the ingredients except the french rolls and cook on low all day until the meat is falling apart. When done, pull the meat out of the slow cooker and place it back into the pan with the sauce. Place the french rolls into the sauce and cook until the sauce is absorbed into the bread. Serve with the roast on the side.

Preheat the broiler. In a small bowl combine the butter and seasonings until well blended. Rub the butter mixture over the turkey breast and sprinkle with the turkey broth. Roast for 1 hour in the preheated broiler or until the internal temperature of the turkey reaches 165 degrees fahrenheit. Baste every 10 minutes with pan juices.

Sauté ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in spaghetti sauce and water. Cook, covered, for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to pan. Add ground beef mixturetoss. Spoon half of the pasta mixture into a 2-quart baking dishset aside. In a bowl, mix eggs and ricotta cheese. Stir in half the parmesan cheese. Spread over pasta in baking dish. Top with remaining pasta mixture. Combine mozzarella cheese and parsley. Sprinkle over top. Cover. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes or until heated through. Uncoversprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Let stand for 10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Combine cream cheese and blue cheese in a small bowlspread on rye bread slices. Place bacon slices on each slice of bread and top with salad dressing. Broil until cheese is melted and bacon is crisp. Cut in half and serve hot.

Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the chicken thighs and saute until golden brown on all sides. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add the remaining olive oil to the skillet and then the broccoli. Cook until tender. Add the rotini and parmesan to the skillet and stir to combine. Return the chicken to the skillet and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Slice the top off the onions, leaving enough to secure the top back onto the onion. Remove the inner bulb from the onions. Melt the butter in a pan and saute the hash browns until golden brown. Add the beef bouillon, pepper and parsley. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs and add the milk and potato mixture. Stuff the onions with this mixture. Sprinkle the tops of the onions with some bread crumbs and bake in the oven for 30 minutes.

In a small saucepan combine the butter, lemon zest and juice, heavy cream, salt and pepper and bring to a simmer over moderate heat. In another saucepan of boiling salted water, cook the fettuccine until just al dente. Drain the pasta well and transfer to the lemon cream sauce. Toss well to combine and serve with more Parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together apples, flour, brown sugar, cinnamon. In a separate bowl combine butter, powdered sugar, milk and caramel flavoring. Roll out bottom crust and place in 13x9 inch baking pan. Spread caramel mixture on bottom crust. Spread apple mixture evenly over caramel. Roll out top crust. Brush with a little water and place over apples. Trim edges. Make several slits in top crust to let steam escape. Bake 35-40 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with nuts.

First i melt the cheese in a skillet while the oven is preheating to 325 degrees. Place the eggs on top of the cheese, making sure eggs are coated well. Sprinkle salt and pepper on top. Cover and bake for about a half hour or until eggs are cooked through.

Cut the eggplant into 1 inch thick circles. Beat the egg with the water and then dip the eggplant into the egg mixture. Place on a plate with the parmesan cheese and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Fry the eggplant in the pan until cooked. Add the mayonnaise and thyme and mix. Toast the bread. Assemble the sandwich with the eggplant and tomatoes and serve.

Thaw trout fillet. Remove the skin from the trout and discard. Break the fish into smaller pieces and place into blender or food processor with the butter, lemon juice, creamed horseradish, cayenne pepper and nutmeg. Blend until smooth. Place the smoked trout into the container of your food processor or blender, blend until smooth again. Chill for 1 hour. Serve on crackers or thin slices of bread. Garnish with chives or other herbs of choice.

Cut cauliflower into florets. Combine Bisquick, egg and water to form dough. Mix in pesto sauce and Italian seasoning. Form into balls about the size of a walnut. Heat oil. Fry until golden brown, turning once. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve with marinara sauce if desired.

Cream together sugar, brown sugar, margarine. Beat in vanilla. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350f for 10 to 12 minutes. Do not overbake. Remove from baking sheets to wire racks to cool. Makes about 2-1/2 dozen.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. Toss noodles with cabbage. In a small bowl combine vinegar, sugar, olive oil and salt. Pour over noodles. Sprinkle with green onion. Serve topped with sesame seeds and slivered almonds.

Cut the zucchini into chunks about an inch long. In a small bowl, combine the garlic with the thyme and rosemary. Put the zucchini pieces into a bowl with the garlic mixture and toss. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the canola oil. When hot, add the zucchini mixture. Cook for 10 minutes or until the zucchini is tender. Add the pasta and cook for 2 more minutes. Add the lemon juice and parmesan cheese and toss. Serve hot.

Preheat the over to 400 degrees. Wash the potatoes. Cut into wedges. In a small bowl, combine the flour, paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, salt and pepper. In a large bowl or plastic bag, add the potatoes. Add the flour mixture to the potatoes and mix thoroughly. In a large pan or baking dish, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the potatoes. Cook for about 5 minutes or until crispy. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate. Serve.

In a small bowl combine all of the marinade ingredients. Place chicken in a large resealable plastic bag. Add marinade. Seal and refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove chicken from marinade and discard marinade. Working in batches, add chicken to hot oil and cook until golden brown and cooked through. Serve with cooking sherry.

Preheat oven to 350. Melt butter in large frying pan over medium heat. Add leeks to the pan and saute until the leeks are softened. Remove the leeks from the pan, reserving the butter in the pan. Mix leeks into the filling. Pour filling into unbaked pie shell. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the filling is firm. Sprinkle the top of the pie with the cheese. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease and pepper pork chops. Place pork chops in bottom of a baking dish, top each pork chop with an apple slice. Combine apple juice, butter, sugar and cinnamon in a saucepan over medium-high heatbring to a boil and cook until the butter is melted and the sauce is thick and syrupy, about 10 minutes. Pour over pork chops and bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Turn chops and bake another 10 minutes or until cooked through and the apples are tender and slightly browned on the edges. Remove from the oven and top each pork chop with a slice of licor 43.

In a medium saucepan boil water with sugar and cinnamon sticks. Continue to cook for about 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Add almonds. Cool. Drain the almonds and pat dry. Store in an airtight container.

In a bowl combine cumin, 1/2 of the onion and the bell pepper with the pineapple and mandarin orange. Add the fish. Add the rest of the onion and the garlic. Toss to blend. Add the oil. Add the white wine. Bring to a boil. Add the cilantro. Simmer over low heat for 10 minutes. Serve at once with rice.

Beat margarine, sugar, egg and vanilla until creamy. Beat in cinnamon. Stir together flour, baking powder and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Stir in oats. Stir in chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for 12 minutes. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from sheet. Makes about 60 cookies.

Melt butter in large saucepan. Add onions and saute till soft. Add grits, chicken stock and salt. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat to low. Simmer covered for 30 minutes or until grits are tender. Add half-and-half cream. Stir in cream cheese. Add white pepper. Top with parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with chopped fresh green onion. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat cook sausage until no longer pinkdrain and return to skillet. Add onion and saute until tender. Add celery and carrot and saute until crisp tender. Drain and set aside. In a 1 1/2 quart casserole combine sausage mixture with rice. In a medium bowl combine soup and broth. Stir in ranch dressing mix and heat through. Pour over sausage mixture. Bake uncovered at 350f for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish. Peel carrots and boil until tender. Drain. Place carrots in casserole dish. Beat eggs together in a bowl until smooth. Stir in breadcrumbs, minced onion and seasonings. Pour egg mixture over the carrots. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes.

Place 1 teaspoon dried basil, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, 2 bay leaves in 1 quart of cold waterstir. Place 1 pound of dried navy or pinto beans in the pot. Add 1 can of diced tomatostir. Coverheat to boiling. Reduce heatsimmer 1 hour or until beans are tender. Add 2 pounds smoked turkey sausagesimmer 30 minutes or until sausage is cooked. Serve with crackers.

Puree the tofu in a blender until very smooth. Add the strawberries and banana. Blend until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Add the superfine sugar. Mix until combined. Freeze for 2 hours. Serve immediately or transfer to a container and freeze until ready to use.

In a medium sized bowl combine the milk, coconut, vanilla extract and salt. Mix well. Shape into 1-inch balls. Place balls onto a plate or cookie sheet. Place in refrigerator for 2 hours or until firm. Makes 30 to 40 coconut candies.

Combine the flour and baking powder. In a separate bowl mix together the eggs and milk and add to the flour mixture. Add the butter and mix well. Bake at 350F for 15-20 minutes or until done. Melt 1/2 c. butter and 1/2 c. brown sugar together. When rolls are cool, spread the butter/sugar mixture over the top. Rolls can be frozen.
Mix all ingredients together to make a stiff dough. Roll out thinly. Cut with a floured 3-inch cookie cutter or a glass. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine margarine and brown sugar in a large bowlbeat until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Combine the vanilla, flour, baking soda, and saltstir into the margarine mixture. Stir in the quick oats, 1 cup at a time, mixing well after each addition. Fold in the chocolate chips. Drop the dough by tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Let cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a small bowl, combine garlic and mustard. Rub the ham with the garlic mixture. In a small saucepan, heat the brown sugar. Combine with the orange juice. Pour the glaze over the ham. Bake the ham 30 minutes. Combine the chutney and orange juice in a small bowl. Brush the ham with the glaze every 10 minutes during the last 15 minutes of baking. Serve the ham warm with the remaining glaze.

Boil the potatoes in lightly salted water until tender. Drain and set aside to cool. Peel the potatoes and cut them into 1 cm dice. In a bowl combine the potatoes with the sugar, paprika, cumin and cayenne. Pour the dressing over the potatoes and toss well. Add the olives and mix gently. To serve 4 to 6. Tunisia on my plate.

Cut chicken into small bite-sized pieces. Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Coat the chicken pieces with the mixture. Set aside for at least half an hour. Heat the oil in the wok or large skillet. Add the ginger and stir fry for about half a minute. Add the chicken pieces. Stir fry for a minute. Add the dried chilies. Stir fry for another minute. Add the light soy sauce. Stir fry for another minute. Add the vinegar. Stir fry for another minute. Serve with cooked rice.

Mix pasta sauce and salsa. Dip the tortillas in the mixture for a few seconds on each side. Grill or broil the tortillas about a minute or two per side. Slice the chicken into strips. Place the tortillas in the bottom of a baking dish and place the chicken strips in the center. Top with cheese. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with sour cream.

Heat oil in heavy skillet over moderate heat. Add sea scallops and brown on both sides. Remove from skillet with slotted spoon and set aside. Add pepper and onion to skillet and cook and stir 2 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in wine and cook 1 minute. Stir in broth and cook over moderate heat until slightly thickened. Add milk and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in scallops and sprinkle with parsley. Serve with rice.

Season steaks with salt & pepper. Heat butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add steaks and cook until browned. Remove steaks. Add onions & garlic to skillet and cook until onions are tender. Stir in mushrooms and cook until they begin to brown. Add beef stock and Worcestershire. Bring to a boil. Add flour and cook stirring until thickened. Add steaks back into pan. Simmer uncovered for about 2 minutes. Serves 4.
Combine ground beef through italian seasoning. Form into 1 1/2" balls. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes on each side or until no longer pink. Drain well. Serve hot.

In a saucepan over high heat, bring a large amount of salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl, combine spaghetti, oil and garlic. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add cherry tomatoes, capers and chili. Stir until combined. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Prepare crescent rolls as directed on package. Spread apples with butter and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Place on crescent roll dough and roll into a ball. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes until crescent roll dough is golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 8-inch round cake pans with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder and the Ener-G in a bowl. In another bowl, mix the water and oil. Whisk the vanilla and the water mixture into the dry ingredients until smooth. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans. Bake for about 35 minutes, or until the tops spring back when lightly pressed and the edges of the cake pull away from the sides of the pan. Cool in the pans on racks for at least 30 minutes. Run a knife around the edges of the cakes to loosen and invert onto wire racks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Cream sugar and butter. Beat in egg and vanilla. Combine flour, baking powder and cocoastir into creamed mixture. Stir in water. Pour into pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Spread with Miracle Whip. Sprinkle with nuts. Drizzle with melted chocolate. Cool. Cut into bars. Yield: 36.

Melt the butter in a skillet. Stir in the beef and cook over high heat until browned. Stir in the egg yolks. Add the cream and cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over the potatoes, garnish with the beets and onions. Sprinkle with the capers.

Pour one cup of regular grind coffee into a filter. Add one teaspoon of sugar and one teaspoon of cream. Slowly add cold water until the filter is full. Place the filter over a cup and let it drip into the cup. The longer the coffee drips the stronger it will be. If you like it more diluted you can use hot water instead of cold water.

Prepare cake mix as directed on box. Pour 1/2 batter into greased 13x9 pan. Pour 1 can crushed pineapple into batter and stir to mix. Pour remaining batter over crushed pineapple mixture. Bake according to box directions. Cool completely. For frosting, stir together cream of coconut, condensed milk, and 1 can crushed pineapplemix well. Pour over cake and top with whipped topping and shredded coconut.

Melt butter in sauce pan and saute onion and garlic until golden brown. Cut chicken livers in half and add to sauce pan. Brown livers. Add lemon juice. Remove from heat and set aside. Add eggs to butter mixture and stir until eggs are cooked. Season with salt and pepper. Add livers and cognac and mix well. Place in serving dish. Decorate with parsley. Serve with crackers.

Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick frying pan over medium heat until the oil is hot but not smoking. Add the squash cut sides down, sprinkle with salt, pepper and the garlic. Cover and cook for about 10 minutes until the squash is very soft. Add the water and the basil. Simmer for about another 10 minutes uncovered. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Heat 1 tbsp of the olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. In a small bowl mix together the flour and the salt and pepper. Dredge each chicken breast in the flour mixture and shake off the excess. Add to the skillet and cook for about 4 minutes per side. Remove from the skillet and set aside. Add the remaining olive oil and mushrooms to the skillet. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add the marsala wine and chicken stock and cook until the liquid is almost completely evaporated. Add the butter and stir until melted. Add the chicken and any accumulated juices and stir gently until heated through. Transfer the chicken and sauce to a 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with freshly grated Parmesan cheese before serving.

Season beef with salt and pepper. Dip steak in flour and set aside. In a large skillet melt margarine and saute onion and garlic until tender. Add tomatoes and simmer for about 5 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat. Place meat in crockpot with tomatoes and onion mixture. Add soup and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and bake on high for 3 hours or until beef is tender. Remove from heat and sprinkle mozzarella cheese evenly over beef and return to low for about 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve on hamburger buns or rolls. Serves 4-6.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add vinegar and honey and cook for 1 minute. Add orange zest and pistachios and toss until nuts are lightly toasted. Arrange spinach and green onions evenly on a platter. Drizzle with dressing and sprinkle with feta cheese.

Wash the rhubarb. Chop into small pieces. Put in sauce pan with just enough water to cover the rhubarb. Add sugar and bring to a boil. Turn down heat to simmer for 20 minutes. Add lemon juice to taste. Chill until cold. Add chopped strawberries and puree in a blender. Chill until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Cook pasta according to package directions and drain. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Whisk eggs and cream together in a large bowl. Add pasta, cheese, and any desired herbs to the egg mixture. Stir to combine. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before cutting into squares and serving.
Mix together ground beef, egg, bread crumbs, onion powder, garlic powder. Spread evenly in a 9 x 13 baking pan. Pour catalina dressing over. Bake at 350 for 1 hour.

In a medium bowl combine 2 tablespoons of maple syrup with 1 tablespoon of soy sauce. Add the salmon fillets, coating evenly on all sides with the glaze mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 10 minutes. Meanwhile preheat oven to 350. Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium high heat until hot. Add salmon fillets and cook until the glaze begins to bubble on the bottom of the pan, about 1 minute per side. Turn the salmon over, coating with more glaze if necessary. Bake until the salmon is cooked through, about 8 minutes more. Transfer the salmon to a plate and drizzle with any remaining glaze. Serve the salmon immediately with your favorite sides.

Blend cheese and flour. Add butter and mix well. Add red pepper. Chill dough for 30 minutes. Divide dough into 4 equal portions. On a lightly floured surface roll 1 portion into a 7x12-inch rectangle. Cut into 12 equal squares. Place a pecan half in each square. Spoon date filling into center of each square. Bring dough edges together over filling. Press edges firmly together. Place seam side down on baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough. Bake for 12-14 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine almonds with chocolate frosting, adding more frosting if necessary until well blended. Press almond mixture onto bottom of 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 5 minutes in 350 degree oven. While almond crust is baking prepare the chocolate frosting by combining frosting with butter. Blend in graham cracker crumbs and almond extract. Spread chocolate frosting over almond crust. Place kisses on top of frosting, pressing lightly in place. Chill until frosting is firm. Cut into bars and store in refrigerator. Makes 48 servings.

Place sliced mushrooms in bottom of crock pot. Place beef roast on top of mushrooms. In a small bowl combine hoisin sauce and garlic. Pour over beef roast. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour in beef broth until top of beef is covered. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours or until meat is tender. Remove roast and cool slightly. Remove meat from bone and shred with two forks. Stir cornstarch into 1/4 cup cold water. Add to liquid in crock pot stirring constantly until mixture boils and thickens. Stir in shredded beef and scallions. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In an 11-in. x 7-in. baking pan, combine the breadcrumbs, flour, salt, pepper, thyme, rosemary and marjoram. Set aside. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Brown the chicken in the hot butter about 5 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the pan and place in the baking pan with the crumb mixture. Bake for 45 minutes. Turn once during cooking. Serve warm.

Heat oil in a medium sized pot. Add the onion and cook until translucent. Add the rice and stir until evenly coated in the oil. Add the broth and salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cover with a lid. Simmer for 20-25 minutes until all the liquid has been absorbed and the rice is cooked. Remove from heat and stir in the parsley. Let sit for a few minutes before serving.

Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until it is tender but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally. Drain pasta and return it to the pot. Add the bacon and cook over low heat until crisp. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towelsset aside. Increase heat to medium-high and add the onion and garliccook and stir until onion is translucent, about 4 minutes. Add the bacon drippings, cream, and cooked chickencook and stir until thoroughly heated through and well blended, about 2 minutes. Stir in the cheese and bacon. Cook and stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is thickened slightly, about 2 minutes more. Season pasta with salt and pepper to taste. Toss with the sauce and top with the reserved bacon. Serve immediately.

Bring 2 1/2 cups of water to a boil in a large pot. Add 1 teaspoon salt. Stir in the pasta and cook for 8 minutes. Stir in 3/4 cup of the sharp Cheddar cheese until the cheese is completely melted. In a small bowl, mix the margarine, 1/4 cup of the sharp Cheddar cheese, and 1/4 cup of the heavy cream. Stir the mixture into the pot and add the paprika and cayenne. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup of sharp Cheddar cheese.

Mash bananas in a bowl with a fork. Add the water, instant banana pudding and mix well. In a separate bowl combine the cake mix, eggs and oil. Add to the banana mixture. Grease and flour a 10 cup bundt pan. Pour the batter into the pan. Bake at 325 for 50-60 minutes. Cool in pan for 15 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack. To make the glaze, combine the powdered sugar, butter, vanilla and milk in a small bowl. Drizzle over the cake. Sprinkle with the pecans.
