Preheat oven to 350f. Line a cookie sheet with wax paper. In a large bowl mix together all ingredients. Spread cereal mixture onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Spread out to cool and break into pieces. Store in an air-tight container.

Cut squash into 1/4-in-thick slices. Toss with oil and vinegar. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and basil. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until lightly browned and tender. Sprinkle with cheese and serve with crackers or breadsticks.

In a large skillet, saute the red and green onions and red pepper until just soft. In a mixing bowl, combine crab meat, onions and red peppers. Add the Swiss and cheddar cheeses and seasonings. Stir until combined. Add half and half and beat until smooth. Pour into a greased 9-inch pie plate. In another mixing bowl, combine bread crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle over crab mixture. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, until golden. Cut into wedges to serve.

In a food processor puree the grapefruit juice, soy sauce, grapefruit and garlic. Add chicken and olive oil and process until chicken is coated in marinade. Cover and marinate overnight in refrigerator. Thread chicken onto skewers. Grill for 5-6 minutes on each side or until done. Serve with salad.

Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and saute until softened. Stir in ginger. Add red curry paste to saucepan and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. Add sweet potato and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in coconut cream and coriander leaves. Season with sugar to taste. Serve immediately. Serves 4
Cut melon into small cubes (about 1 inch). Toss with remaining ingredients. Chill for 1 hour before serving. Serve with grilled fish or poultry.

Make an overnight marinade of the chicken in a mixture of salt, pepper, garlic, lemon grass, lemon juice and lime juice with the annatto seeds for coloring. Place in the refrigerator overnight, turning the chicken occasionally to ensure an even coat of marinade on the chicken. Remove the chicken from the marinade. Pat the chicken dry with paper towels and rub with a mixture of garlic butter and chili pepper flakes. Cook the chicken on an outdoor grill or under the broiler until the skin is crisp and the chicken is done through.

Combine soup and crushed pineapple in medium saucepan. Cook over low heat 15 minutes or until heated through. Stir in root beer. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Add brown sugar. Stir well. Add the onion and ham. Serve in hamburger buns.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown beef. Add the onions, celery and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in tomatoes with their liquid, water, noodles and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 12 minutes or until noodles are tender. Stir in cheesecover for 5 minutes more or until cheese melts. Serve with shredded parsley if desired. Serves 6.

Toss together apples and sugar in a large bowl and set aside. Combine oats, flour and nutmeg in a separate bowl and mix well. Add butter and cut in with a pastry blender until crumbly. Spread crumbs over apples in a greased baking dish and bake for 25 minutes. In a small bowl combine coconut and milk until well mixed and spread over top of apples. Return to oven for about 5 minutes or until topping is bubbly. Serve with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream if desired.

Boil rice in a large pot with hot water, cinnamon pods and cardamom pods. Once done add butter. Mix well. In a separate pan, add butter to almonds and raisins. Add to the rice mixture. Add peas. Season to taste with salt.
Cook orzo in boiling water 12 minutes. Drain. Combine orzo with vinegar and remaining ingredients. Refrigerate 4 hours. Yield 4 servings.

Place beef in slow cooker. Top with mexican-style tomatoes. Sprinkle with chipotle chiles and cover with water. Cook on low for 8-10 hours. About 15 minutes before serving, mix cornstarch and water in a small bowl. Stir into crock pot. Cook until slightly thickened. Serve with tortillas and any of your favorite mexican-style toppings. I like a dollop of sour cream. This can also be served over white rice.

In microwave safe bowl, melt butter. Add marshmallows. Stir until completely melted. Add vanilla. Stir well. Stir in peanut butter chips. Spread into 13 by 9-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cereal. Let stand until set. Cut into bars. Makes about 3 dozen.

Melt butter in a dutch oven or large pot over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until softened, about 3 minutes. Add chicken and rosemarycook until browned, about 5 minutes more. Add broth, water, celery, and pepperbring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes or until chicken is done. Remove chicken and allow broth mixture to cool slightlydiscard rosemary stems and remove chicken from bones and shred or dice. Return chicken and basil to broth mixtureheat through. Serve in bowls with noodles and additional basil sprinkled on top if desired.
Place all of the ingredients in a 4-quart slow cooker. Stir to combine. Cook on low for 5 hours. Serve biscuits hot. Serves 4 to 6.
Add the gin and vodka to a pitcher and stir. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the lemon juice and sparkling wine and stir again. Add ice cubes and serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press mixture into a 12x18 inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until crust is lightly browned and set. Cool on a wire rack. In a small bowl, combine brown sugar and butterstir in vanilla and pecans. Spread over cooled crust and cool in the refrigerator for 1 hour or until set. Cut into bars and store in an air-tight container in the refrigerator. Makes about 12 bars.

Cook tortellini according to package directions in salted boiling water. Drain and reserve 1/4 cup of the pasta cooking liquid. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and cook 1 minute or until tender. Add cream and whipping cream to skillet and cook until heated through, stirring constantly. Add reserved pasta cooking liquid. Stir until mixture is slightly thickened. Add tortellini and cheese and toss to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Add prosciutto and artichoke hearts and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9×13 inch pan. Bake for 22-25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely before cutting into bars. In a small saucepan, melt margarine over low heatstir in chocolate chips until melted. Cool completely before drizzling over bars. Drizzle with sweetened condensed milk before serving if desired.

Melt oil in large skillet over medium heat, add onion and cook, stirring, 3-4 minutes or until softened. Add sweet potato and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, 5-7 minutes or until softened. Add milk, salt and pepper and bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, 10-15 minutes or until thickened. Add butter, stirring until melted. Serve hot with roast meats or fish or as a side dish with braised meats such as lamb shanks or pork shoulder.

Mix lemon juice, garlic, scallions and rosemary. Rub pork chops and sprinkle black pepper on both sides. Place on baking pan and bake for 45 minutes at 325 degrees fahrenheit. Let chops rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Butter two shallow dishes. Rinse and dry shrimp. Dip in beaten egg and then coat with unseasoned breadcrumbs. Place in prepared dishes and bake at 425 degrees for 12 minutes. Turn over and bake for 10 minutes more or until breadcrumbs are lightly browned. Sprinkle with garlic salt and parsley before serving. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9-inch square baking pan. Combine pears, cashews, flour, sugar, margarine and syrup in a large bowl. Mix well until combined and starting to come together. Press mixture firmly and evenly in prepared pan with lightly floured hands. Bake for 20-25 minutes until lightly golden brown on top. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before slicing into squares. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled.

Heat the marinara sauce in a medium saucepan over medium high heat. Heat the vodka in a small saucepan over low heat until almost evaporated. Add the dill and cream to the saucepan. Add the smoked salmon, pasta and peas. Cook until heated through. Serve hot.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook spinach for 3 minutes or until wilted. Drain and rinse well under cold water. Drain again and squeeze out excess water. In a small bowl, combine spinach and remaining ingredients. Toss and serve.
Cook ground beef and drain. Add soup, catsup, and salt to ground beef. Heat through. Serve on hamburger buns.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add cinnamon. Stir in raisins. Cook noodles in milk until tender. Stir in sugar, salt and almond extract. Cool slightly. Stir in eggs. Pour into greased 1-quart casserole. Bake in 350 oven for 40 to 50 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. In medium bowl, combine milk, butter, egg substitute and sugar. Stir to blend. In small bowl, combine flour and baking powder. Mix well. Add to milk mixture and stir to blend. Spray 9x13-inch baking pan with nonstick spray. Pour batter into pan. Bake at 400f degrees for 20-25 minutes or until done. Cut into squares and serve.

In a large pot cook the butter, leeks and potatoes for 10 minutes or until tender. Add the cooking onion and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Pour in the wine and reduce by half. Add the hummus and stir well. Add the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with pepper. Serve hot.
Combine the rice, beans, cooked chicken and cilantro in a bowl. Top with salsa and banana slices. Garnish with onion slices and serve.

Slice the garlic cloves in half. In a crock pot combine the beef, garlic, and seasonings. Cook, covered, for 2-3 hours. Add the beans and tomatoes and simmer for another hour. Stir in the sweet onions and serve.

Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt in a bowl. Cut in mayonnaise with a pastry cutter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk to form a soft dough that holds together well. Turn onto floured surfaceknead lightly 6-8 times. Pat or roll out dough 1/2-inch thick. Using 2 1/2-inch fluted cookie cutter or glass dipped in flour, cut out roundsplace 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake in 400 degree oven 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 1 minuteremove from cookie sheets. Makes 2 dozen muffins.

Cook green beans in boiling salted water for 5 minutes. Drain beans and place in serving dish. In a separate bowl, combine the sour cream, cheese and onions. In a third bowl, combine the soup, water and margarine. Add to the onion mixture and stir until well blended. Pour over the beans. Sprinkle with the cracker crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serves 6.

Melt butter and chocolate together. Add eggs and vanilla and beat until fluffy. Add flour and salt and mix well. Pour into a 2 quart souffle dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

In medium saucepan heat butter over medium high heat. Add hearts of palm. Cook 2 to 3 minutes stirring occasionally. Add flour and cook 1 minute. Stir in stock. Cook until slightly thickened. Stir in milk and cream. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 to 10 minutes. Stir in white pepper. Serve hot. Serves 4.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute lardons in oil until lightly browned. Remove lardons with slotted spoon. Saute onions in the same skillet in the remaining lardons fat until soft and translucent. Add potatoes and saute 5 minutes stirring often. Stir in wine and simmer 5 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese and top with lardons and onion mixture.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease loaf pans. Beat eggnog until frothy. Add flour, baking powder, salt and walnuts. Beat until smooth. Beat in butter. Beat in egg until blended. Add sugar gradually. Stir in nutmeg. Divide into two loaf pans. Bake 55-60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes. Remove from pans to wire racks. Drizzle with eggnog. Dust with candied fruit.

In a small saucepan stir together vinegar, soy sauce, ginger, salt, pepper and garlic powder. Bring just to a boil. Cook about 1 minute or until hot and slightly thickened. Stir in peaches and cook for another minute. Cool slightly. In a large salad bowl combine greens, turkey, oranges, broccoli florets and cauliflower florets. Toss with enough dressing to moisten evenly. Sprinkle with almonds.
Mix all the dry ingredients together. Add the water and mix in the oil. Pour onto hot griddle and cook each side until light brown. Serve with your favorite toppings.

In a skillet over medium heat, saute the garlic and shrimp for about 4 minutes or until shrimp turns opaque. Add red pepper flakes to taste. Add lemon zest, lemon juice and parsley. Serve over your favorite pasta or rice.
Heat oil in skillet. Add spinach leaves. Sprinkle on basil. Add cider vinegar, dijon mustard, honey. Stir well. Cover and cook 1-2 minutes. Add milk. Cook 1 more minute. Season to taste.
In a large bowl, toss the capsicums and tomatoes with the lemon juice. Add the ground cumin and extra virgin olive oil and mix well. Add the parsley and season with salt and pepper.

Heat oven to 375f. Spray 4-quart casserole with nonstick cooking spray. Stir together first 5 ingredients in large bowl. Add mushroomstoss to coat. Spoon into casserole. Bake 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheesesbake 15 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Makes 6 servings.
In large bowl combine pasta, yogurt, tuna, dressing. Add celery and carrots. Spoon mixture onto salad plates. Sprinkle with cheese and herbes de provence. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Heat the milk in a small pot over low heat. Add the butter and sugar, and stir until the butter melts. Add the cocoa, and stir until smooth. Cook for about 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Pour the syrup through a strainer into a glass jar or bottle. Store at room temperature in a sealed container. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Preheat oven to 400 f degrees. In a bowl whisk together 1 1/2 cups of flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. In another bowl whisk together beer and butter. Pour butter mixture into flour mixture, stirring just until combined. Turn out dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 1 minute to form a smooth dough. Roll out dough into a rectangle 10 x 12 inches. Use a pizza cutter to cut dough into 8 equal pieces. Place pieces on ungreased baking sheet. Brush tops of each piece with 1 tbsp melted butter. Bake for 10 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes on baking sheet before transferring to wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Saute onion in butter in large skillet until transparent. Add mushrooms and carrot, saute until mushrooms are soft. Remove from heat. Add breadcrumbs, salt and pepper. Mix well. Combine turkey, onion mixture, mustard, syrup, parsley. Add egg. Mix well. Add mixture to lightly buttered 8x8-inch pan. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 1 hour. Slice. Makes 2 servings. Serve with cranberry sauce.

Combine condensed milk and lemon juice in a large bowl. Stir until smooth. Cover and refrigerate at least 24 hours. Meanwhile, whisk yogurt in another bowl until smooth. Divide yogurt among four bowls. Top each bowl evenly with about 1/3 cup of condensed milk mixture and then garnish each serving with one of the following toppings. 1/4 cup of the chopped fruit 1/4 cup of the marshmallows 1/4 cup of the pecans 1/4 cup of the whole berries

In a food processor, combine the tomatoes, chili peppers, green onions, cilantro, cumin and garlic. Process until smooth. Add the salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips. Can be made up to two hours ahead. Makes about 2 cups.

Slice garlic. In large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic, saute until lightly browned. Add tomatoes and crush with potato masher. Add oregano, salt and pepper. Simmer for one hour.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat, add garlic and saute for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add tomatoes, celery, thyme and water. Bring to boil. Stir in macaroni. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Stir in frozen peas. Simmer until peas are tender, about 2 minutes more. Remove thyme stems and sprinkle with cheese before serving if desired. Serve with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350 deg. Lightly grease a 9x5 loaf pan. In a food processor or blender, combine pecans and fresh breadcrumbs. Process until fine and crumbly. Add butter and continue to process until smooth. Stir in onion and carrot. Add cottage cheese and process until smooth. Add eggs one at a time and mix well. Stir in dried oregano and mix thoroughly. Turn mixture into prepared loaf pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Cool in pan for 20 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely. Serve with lettuce and tomato. Serves 4-6.

In a large saucepan over medium heat saute onion and celery until soft. In a bowl combine parsley flakes, poultry seasoning, salt and pepper. Add to onion mixture. Stir to blend. Add stale bread cubes and mix well. Add chicken broth. Cook, stirring occasionally until heated through. Serves 8.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the broccoli rabe and stir. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the red pepper flakes and cook for another minute. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with the cheese. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large skillet, brown round steaks in oil for about 5 minutes per side. Remove meat to a plate. In same skillet, add onions, green pepper, celery and carrot. Saute for 3 minutes. Add soup, water, salt and pepper. Bring to boil over medium heat for 1 minute. Return meat to pan, cover tightly and place in oven for 1 hour or until meat is very tender. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles. Serves about 6.
In a skillet melt butter. Add asparagus. Stir fry until tender. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve warm. Drizzle with lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch cubes. Season with salt and pepper. Dip chicken in flour. Heat butter in large skillet until butter is foaming. Brown chicken. Remove chicken from skillet. Add garlic, thyme and sage to pan. Cook until garlic is golden. Stir in white wine and cook until wine is evaporated. Add broth and chicken to skillet. Cover and place in oven. Bake 45 minutes until chicken is done.
Heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, celery, chickpeas, and broth. Simmer for 25 minutes. Add mint. Puree. Stir tahini into soup. Season to taste with pepper. Serve with toasted pita wedges.

Heat oil in a medium heavy-bottom pan over medium-high heat. Add mustard seeds and let splutter for 30 seconds. Add turmeric and cook for 1 minute more. Add onion and saut 5 to 6 minutes more until golden brown. Add garlic cloves and chilies and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds more. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes more until lightly toasted. Add 4 cups of water and cook until rice is tender and all water is absorbed. Add lemon juice and kosher salt and stir. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes more. Fluff with fork before serving. Top with roasted cashews and cilantro.
Combine all ingredients (except banana) in a blender or food processor. Puree until smooth. Add banana and process until smooth. Serve immediately or refrigerate and serve later.

Remove the greens from the baby beets and boil the beets until cooked through. Drain and cut into quarters. Mix the rocket with the pine nuts and pine nuts and then arrange the beets and the rocket mixture in a bowl and garnish with the goats cheese and the onion rings. Dress with the lemon juice and olive oil and then sprinkle with the sugar and some salt and freshly ground pepper. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine cake mix & diet soda. Beat at high speed 1 minute or until well blended & smooth. Beat until smooth 2 more minutes at high speed. Fold in 1/2 of the instant pudding mix until well blended. Fold in 1/2 of the cool whip free. Spoon into two 9-inch round baking pans sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool. Fold remaining cool whip free into remaining instant pudding mix. Spread over cake. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c). Grease 2 large baking sheets. Place peppers on one baking sheet and asparagus on another. Drizzle both with olive oil. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes, garlic powder and salt and pepper. Roast until peppers are tender and asparagus is bright green and crisp tender about 35 minutes. Serve at once or store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

Drain and rinse cannellini beans. Place artichoke hearts and roasted red peppers in food processor and process until chunky. Add beans and remaining ingredients and process until smooth. Spoon into a bowl and top with basil. Serve with crackers.

Place potatoes in a large bowl and cover with cold waterlet stand for 15 minutes. Drain potatoes. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the hamburger until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in the sloppy joe sauce. Combine the potatoes and the sauce mixture. Transfer to a shallow 2-quart baking dish. Combine the cream of potato soup and the milkstir well. Pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until heated through.

Place the instant espresso in the bottom of a small bowl and slowly add the boiling water. Stir until smooth. In a larger bowl combine the heavy cream, light corn syrup, and dark chocolate. Melt the mixture over a double boiler. Remove from heat and pour into the bowl with the espresso mixture. Stir until smooth. Let cool to room temperature. Pour into a small bowl for a quick treat or into a container for a longer shelf life. Refrigerate for at least an hour or until set. If desired, dip strawberries into ganache or top with toffee bits.

Heat olive oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add shrimp and cook until just firm but still pink in center (about 1 minute). Remove from skillet. Add water or low-sodium chicken broth (about a 1/4 cup) and bring to boil over medium high heat. Add shrimp back into pan and reduce heat to low. Add lemon juice, salt-free seasoning, table salt and pepper. Cook until shrimp are heated through (about a minute). Add fresh parsley right before serving. Serve over pasta or on a bed of greens for a delicious meal!

Peel onions and cut into 1/4-inch slices. Melt butter in heavy saucepan over medium-low heat. Add onionscook 5 minutes, stirring often. Add chilies, sugar, garlic powder and soy saucecook 10 minutes, stirring often. Cool slightlytransfer mixture to jar with tight-fitting lid. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate until cold. Makes 1 cup jam.

Beat the egg. Add the pancake mix and 7-up to the egg. Heat a frying pan over medium heat and add 1/4 cup of the batter to the pan. Cook the pancake for about 3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Makes 4 pancakes.
Mix butter, sugar, vanilla and egg. Add flour, mix well. Add cocoa, mix. Pour into 9x13 pan greased with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Place raisin bran and sugar in bowl. Pour boiling water over the cereal mixture. Set aside to cool. In separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and fine salt. Beat in the canola oil, egg, and buttermilk. Stir the blueberries into the bran mixture. Stir into the batter just until blended. Spoon into greased muffin pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pans for 5 minutes, then turn out onto wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Slice the cauliflower and broccoli into small florets and chop the onions. Mix together the Miracle Whip, sugar, red wine vinegar, and water. Add the cauliflower, broccoli, and onions to the dressing. Put in the fridge for one hour to let the dressing soak into the vegetables. Add the sunflower seeds and raisins and serve.

Cut squash in half lengthwise. Slice off ends and seeds. Brush cut sides with olive oil. Place on grill and cook until just tender. Turn once. Remove from grill and brush cut side with butter. Sprinkle with garlic and season with pepper. Serve.

Cut chicken breasts into long strips. In a bowl, combine egg and buttermilk with a fork. In a shallow bowl or dish, combine flour with garlic powder, baking powder and salt. In another shallow bowl or dish, combine bread crumbs and seasoned salt. Dip each chicken strip into flour mixture then into egg mixture, then into bread crumb mixture. In a frying pan, heat oil over medium heat until a few drops of oil bubble up when you put a piece of breading into it. Fry chicken strips about 3-4 minutes on each side. Serve with ketchup or honey mustard.

Melt butter in a 8-10 inch non stick pan. Add eggs and season with salt and pepper. Stir in apple. Cook until set. Sprinkle with brie cheese. Broil in oven until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with a glass of chilled white wine and a nice bread or baguette.

Preheat oven to 350F. Brush both sides of bread slices lightly with butter. Toast until golden. In a medium skillet over medium heat, whisk together 1 egg and 1/4 cup water. Season with salt. Cook eggs until almost set. In a small bowl, mash egg yolk and hot pepper sauce. Spread 1 slice of bread with pesto and top with goat cheese. Arrange tomato halves over goat cheese. Place egg on top. Drizzle with pesto. Sprinkle with basil and serve on remaining bread.

Beat cream cheese and sugar until well combined. Add sour cream and beat until well combined. Add vanilla and beat until well combined. Pour into crust. Sprinkle with the chopped nuts if desired. Refrigerate at least 3 hours. Top with Cool Whip.

In a medium bowl, combine mustard and vinegar and mix well. Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Rub the chicken with margarine. Combine thyme and cayenne. Sprinkle the chicken inside and out with the thyme mixture, rubbing it in. Roast for 45 minutes or until done (170 degrees F). Combine breadcrumbs with butter and spread over the corn on the cob and place on a foil-lined cookie sheet. Roast alongside the chicken for the last 45 minutes or until the corn is done and the breadcrumbs are golden brown. Serve the chicken with the corn on the cob and drizzle with the mustard-vinegar sauce.
Combine coconut oil and powdered sugar. Add vanilla and mix well. Add coconut milk. Mix well. Add cherry preserves and mix well. Spread on your favorite cupcake. Decorate with cherries.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute for 4 to 5 minutes, until onion is softened. Add garlic and stir for 1 minute. Whisk in flour and cook for 3 minutes. Whisk in chicken broth. Add potato and carrots and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until potato is tender. Stir in chicken and cook for 2 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with basil and cheese.

Bring cream to a simmer over low heat. Add garlic cloves and gently stir for about 30 seconds. Add tomatoes and sun-dried tomatoes. Heat through for about 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking and burning. Add olives and gnocchi and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the baby spinach and stir gently until wilted. Add pine nuts and toss gently until mixed and warm through. Serve immediately with extra pine nuts for garnish and serve with a sprinkling of Parmesan cheese.
In a small bowl combine the green beans, garlic, vinegar, 1/4 teaspoon each of the salt and pepper, and the basil leaves. Toss to coat. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Garnish with scallions.

Heat butter in a 6 to 8 inch non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add the mushrooms. Cook for a few minutes. Add the onions and cook for a few more minutes. Add the egg mixture. Cook for a few minutes until the edges are cooked. Fold the egg mixture in half. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes until the center is set. Season with the salt, white pepper and mustard powder. Serve immediately.

Peel rutabaga and chop into small dice. Place in pot with enough water to cover half way. Simmer until tender. Drain rutabaga and mash until smooth. Add breadcrumbs, salt, butter, milk, sugar and egg. Cook in small sauce pan until thick. Serve warm or cold with whipped cream on top.

Mix beef, flour and oil in skillet and brown on medium heat. Drain excess fat from pan and stir in soup and mushrooms. Mix well and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes until liquid is absorbed. Add sherry and onion soup mix and cook for another 5 minutes or until beef is tender. Serve over rice.

Heat 2 tablespoons of bacon drippings in skillet. Add pork tenderloin and brown well. Add soy sauce, ground ginger and garlic salt. Pour 1/4 cup of water into skillet. Cook until pork is tender. In a saucepan combine remaining 2 tablespoons of bacon drippings with red wine vinegar and brown sugar. Bring to a boil. Add tomato sauce. Boil and stir until thickened. Add pineapple tidbits. Cook and stir until heated through. Serve over cooked rice.

Combine yeast with warm water and sugar. Let stand until foamy -- about 5 minutes. In a separate bowl, combine the remaining water with milk. Add salt to yeast mixture. Gradually add flour and mix well. Knead on floured board until smooth. Place in oiled bowl. Cover. Let rise until doubled -- about 45-60 minutes. Prepare pizza topping. Divide dough into 4 portions. Roll or pat into 8-inch circles. Add toppings. Bake at 400 degrees until done -- about 25 minutes. Makes 4 personal size pizzas.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add zucchini and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a plate. Add garlic to skillet and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in chopped herbs and 2 teaspoons watercook 30 seconds more. Return zucchini to skilletsprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes more. Stir in crumbled fetacook until zucchini is tender and golden brown, about 1 minute. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Toss potatoes with olive oil, shallots, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, salt, pepper, rosemary, and thyme. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until potatoes are very tender.

Place ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown beef, drain fat. Add catsup, mustard and cooked macaroni. Spoon mixture into each biscuit shell. Sprinkle cheese over the top. Bake at 350 F for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve with french fries. Serves 6.

Cut breast into long strips about 1/2-inch thick and 6 inches long. Thread strips onto skewers. Mix remaining ingredients together in a small saucepan over medium heatbring to a boil, lower heat, and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heatpour sauce over skewers and toss gently to coat well. Let marinate in the refrigerator for at least an hour, or up to overnight. Grill skewers over medium-hot coals for about 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Serve warm.
Mix lemon juice, anchovy fillets, dijon mustard, fresh garlic, worcestershire sauce, olive oil, black pepper and salt together and add parmesan cheese and sugar and mix again. Chill for 2 hours.

Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and onioncook and stir until tender. Stir in turkey and cook until no longer pinkdrain excess fat. Stir in tomato sauce and oregano. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 15 minutes or until thickened. Mix together turkey mixture, cabbage and Parmesan cheese in a large bowl. Transfer to a 2-quart baking dish. Combine soup and milkstir well. Pour over cabbage mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 for 35 to 45 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet cook beef over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in rice, fajita seasoning mix, tomatoes and cilantro. Cook 2-3 minutes or until rice is heated through. Serve with tortillas, avocado, cheese and lettuce.

Cut round steak into 1-inch cubes. Brown steak over medium heat. Add carrots and celerycook until vegetables are tender. Add crushed tomatoes and tapiocastir to mix. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer until tapioca is tender and stew is thickened. Season to taste with pepper and onion. Serve over hot rice or noodles.

Cut apple into small cubes. Combine horseradish, lemon juice, sugar and apple cubes in food processor until smooth puree forms. With the machine running slowly pour in the creams to create the desired thickness. Season with salt to taste.

Combine rice and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover tightly. Reduce heat and cook for 18-20 minutes or until all water is absorbed. Cool. In a small bowl combine tuna, mayonnaise, onion, sweet pickle relish and celery. Season with salt and black pepper. Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo rolling mat. Spread a thin layer of rice lengthwise on the bamboo mat. Place about a tbsp of tuna mixture lengthwise down center of the rice. Lift up mat and roll up rice. Wet sides of roll with water. Continue until all rice is used. Cut into 1-inch slices. Serve with wasabi. Makes 4-6 servings.
Saute the chicken breasts in the butter. Add mushrooms, onion, bacon and cook until tender. Add the soup, milk, cheese and cook until heated through. Serve over noodles.

Cook pasta according to directions. Drain and return pasta to the pan. Add pesto and mix well. In a saucepan combine alfredo and milk. Add tuna and heat through. Pour over pasta mixture. Sprinkle cheese over top. Bake in 350 preheated oven for 30 minutes.

Heat the oil in a wok over medium-high heat and stir-fry the vegetables in batches for about 4 minutes each until just tender-crisp. Remove from the wok and set aside. Add the teriyaki marinade and stir-fry until boiling for 30 seconds. Add the vegetables and stir-fry until heated through for another 30 seconds. Season to taste with the salt and pepper and serve immediately.

1. In a pitcher, combine sugar, orange juice, tea bags and mint leaves. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Let steep for 30 minutes. 2. Remove tea bags and stir in lemon juice. Add water and ice to taste. Serve over ice.

Combine cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla in a bowl. Mix until smooth. Fold in whipped topping. Fold in strawberries. Chill for 2 hours. Serve cold in 2-inch-diameter ramekins or small parfait glasses.

Combine all dressing ingredients in small bowl. Peel and chop onion and cucumber into bite-size pieces. Mix together cucumber and onion. Fold in shrimp and dill. Spread dressing over bread. Top with shrimp mixture.

Preheat oven to 400. Lightly grease a cookie sheet. Combine almonds, oil, cheese, garlic salt. Mix well. Spread evenly onto prepared baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool 10 minutes. Stir and serve.

Mix all ingredients except for the bread and cheese together in a large bowl. Divide the mixture into 8 balls and flatten them out into patties. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Add sauce to the bottom of the bread. Add the meatballs on top of the sauce and sprinkle with cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Combine melted butter and garlic powder. Spread mixture over pita rounds. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake in oven for 4-6 minutes. Serve warm with dipping sauce such as ranch dressing or sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine the brown sugar, eggs, vanilla and butterbeat until smooth. Stir together the flour and saltgradually beat into the brown sugar mixture. Press onto a greased baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack. In a small bowl, melt chocolate chips and shorteningcool slightly. Beat in powdered sugar until smooth. Drizzle over the brownies. Sprinkle with pecans. Cut into squares.
Mix together the flour and sugar in a bowl. Cut in the butter. Add cranberry sauce and mix thoroughly. Place in a greased 9x13 pan and bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve warm with ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease 9" square baking pan. Peel pears, cut into chunks and add to baking pan with gingerroot. Mix sugar and flour together and sprinkle over pears. Dot with butter. Bake for 30 minutes or until pears are tender. Spread mangoes over crumble topping. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake for another 15-20 minutes or until mangoes are cooked through and topping is golden. Serve hot or cold with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat oven broiler. Line a baking sheet with foil. Combine milk and cornstarch in a medium bowl. Add cream cheese. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in mushrooms and scallions. Spread mixture on baking sheet. Broil until golden brown. Cook fettuccine according to directions on package. Drain. Toss fettuccine with Alfredo sauce. Serves 4.

Cook rice according to package directions. Add cauliflower to pot with rice and cook until tender. In a large skillet cook mushrooms and onion with olive oil over medium heat for about 7 minutes or until tender. Add tomatoes, pepper, salt and pepper to taste and cook for 1 minute. Add cooked rice mixture to skillet with mushrooms. Stir to combine. Add cooked eggs and mix well to combine. Transfer to casserole dish and sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve warm.

Peel and shred the potatoes by hand. In a medium bowl, mix the shredded potatoes with the onion. Add the salt and pepper and mix well. Add the egg, egg white and flour and mix to incorporate. Let the mixture rest for 30 minutes. Heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the canola oil to the pan. Working in batches, form the potato mixture into patties by hand and carefully place in the pan. Do not overcrowd the pan. Fry the latkes until golden brown and crisp on both sides. Remove the latkes from the pan and place on paper towels to absorb any excess oil. Repeat with remaining potato mixture. Serve hot.
In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, sugar and milk. Add vinegar to taste. Place lettuce on plates. Top with onion, pomegranate seeds, poppy seeds and dressing.
Grease a loaf pan. Combine all ingredients. Pour into pan and bake in a 375 degree oven for about 1 hour. Cool and serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Coat a 13x9x2 inch baking pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine fish fillets, butter, garlic and lemon juice. Spread in the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle with parsley. Yield 12 servings

Heat oil in wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add green beans and cook 2-3 minutes or until bright green. Add soy sauce to pan. Cook 1 minute or until hot. Add vinegar and sesame oil. Cook 3-4 minutes or until hot. Serves 2.

Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in almond extract. Add eggs one at a time beating after each. Beat in the flour baking soda and salt. Stir in white baking chocolate until combined. Add in almonds. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake for 9 to 11 minutes. Remove from oven and cool on wire rack. Makes 36 cookies.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil or parchment paper. Using a vegetable peeler, slice zucchini into 1/8-inch-thick strips. Combine Italian style breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, seasoning salt and garlic powder in a bowltoss with zucchini strips until coated thoroughly. Spray a wire rack with nonstick cooking spray, and place on another baking sheetset aside. Dip zucchini strips into egg mixture, one at a timedrain excess egg onto paper towels. Place zucchini strips on wire rack, and bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until crisp. Serve immediately.

Add vinegar and orange peel to a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and simmer for 2 minutes. Add cranberries and cook for 5 minutes. Add sugar, orange juice and cinnamon. Cook for another 5 minutes.

Pour vodka, gin and tequila into shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well for 30 seconds or until chilled, strain into highball glass filled with ice cubes, add the orange juice, stir gently, add the orange slice as a garnish, and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease pizza pan with cooking spray. Roll out crust thinly on lightly floured surface into rectangle about 10 inches by 16 inches. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake until crust is light golden brown (about 8-10 minutes). Remove from oven and top with onion and garlic. Sprinkle with oregano. Return pan to oven. Bake until cheese is golden brown (about 10 minutes). Cool slightly before slicing into wedges with a pizza cutter. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place sugar snap peas on a baking sheet. Roast peas for 15 minutes. In a medium skillet cook bacon until crisp. Transfer bacon to paper towel lined plate. Add shallots to skillet. Cook until softened and starting to brown, about 5 minutes. Add peas to skillet and toss to combine. Remove from oven and toss again until peas are coated with shallots and bacon fat. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Peel and core the apples. Put in a large pan and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook for 20 minutes or until the apples are tender but still hold their shape. Remove from the pan and when cool enough to handle, cut into thick slices and discard the cooking water. Put the apples in a saucepan with the mint and just enough water to cover the apples and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Add the sugar and vinegar and simmer for 5 minutes or until the apples are tender and translucent. Transfer to a blender and puree until smooth. Add the redcurrant jelly and puree again. Season to taste and return to the pan to keep warm while you prepare the salmon.

Melt butter in large skillet. Saut onion until tender. Add eggs and cook until eggs begin to set. Add artichoke hearts, olives and cheese. Cook until cheese has melted. Serve immediately or refrigerate overnight. To serve, place one slice of toast on each plate. Top each with 1/2 cup of egg mixture. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Prepare chicken according to package directions. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine pecans and spices in a small bowl. Dip chicken in milkdredge in nut mixture and place in greased 9-inch square pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until done and golden brown. Serve hot or at room temperature with your favorite side dishes. Serves 6.
Melt butter in large saucepan. Add garlic cloves and saute until slightly browned. Add herbes de provence to taste. Stir in popcorn. Serve in shallow bowl.

Heat oil in heavy-duty 12-inch skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add leek and zucchinicook 4 minutes or until tender-stirring frequently. Add capsicumcook 1 minute. Add frozen spinachcook 1 minute. Remove vegetables from skillet. Increase heat to highadd oil to skillet. Add eggscook 1 minute or until just set. Remove from heat. Add vegetablestoss to combine. Add feta and next 5 ingredients. Toss to combine. Divide vegetable mixture evenly among 12 paper-lined muffin cups. Bake at 180 degrees celsius for 30 minutes. Cool in pans 5 minutes. Remove from panscool completely on wire racks. Store in refrigerator. Yields 12 servings.

In food processor fitted with steel blade, pulse flaked coconut until fine. Transfer to large bowl. Add dried coconut. In small bowl, combine condensed milk, butter and salt. Microwave on high until very hot (mixture will bubble), about 3 minutes. Add to flaked coconut mixture. Stir until well coated. Add chocolate. Stir until well coated. Drop by tablespoons onto wax paper. Refrigerate. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9×5-inch loaf pans. In a large bowl, mash bananas with a potato masher until smooth. Add applesauce and mix well. Beat in eggs and water until smooth. In another bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder and baking sodastir into banana mixture just until moistened. Stir in vanilla and cinnamon. Pour into prepared pans. Bake 50 to 60 minutes in the preheated oven, until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Peel potatoes and cut into cubes. Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add potatoes and green peppers and cook until the potatoes are almost done. Add broth and bring to a boil. Cook for about 10 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed and the potatoes are tender. Add beer and sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the liquid has evaporated. Add beef broth to moisten if desired. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cut spaghetti squash in half lengthwise, and remove seeds. Place halves face down in a 9x13 inch baking dish, and bake for 45 minutes, or until squash is very tender when pierced with a knife. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes. In a medium frying pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add tomatoes and zucchini, and saut until lightly browned. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Remove seeds from spaghetti squash, scoop flesh into a serving bowl, and top with tomato mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Cook the asparagus in boiling water for 1-2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and plunge into ice water to stop the cooking. Drain again and squeeze dry. In a large bowl combine the soup, cheese, and asparagus. Spoon the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Melt butter and sprinkle over the top. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and the sauce is bubbly.

Clean and peel potatoes and cut into wedges. Place potato wedges in a bowl and sprinkle with garlic salt and seasoning salt. Coat the wedges with the seasonings and toss to coat evenly. Place potatoes in a single layer on a greased baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes. Stir once during baking time and continue baking for another 15 minutes. Melt butter and stir in paprika. Remove potatoes from oven and sprinkle with butter and paprika mixture. Return potatoes to oven and bake for 10 minutes longer or until potatoes are crisp and brown. Serve immediately with ketchup or other desired dips.

Cut beef into 1/4 inch slices. In a large non-stick skillet, heat oil. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds or until browned. Add tomatoes and beef. Cook and stir until meat is browned. Add oregano and seasonings. Cook and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley and serve over pasta or with a baguette.

In a skillet, saute the shallots and garlic in olive oil until soft and translucent. Add the spinach and tomatoes and tomato paste and cumin and cook for about 2-3 minutes until heated through. Remove from heat and fold in the fish.

In medium bowl, combine eggs, lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste. In another medium bowl, toss lettuce with olive oil and season to taste. Place lettuce salad on a plate and spoon egg salad on top. Sprinkle with dill and onion, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare cornbread mix according to package directions, using milk instead of wateradd eggs in last 2 minutes of cooking. Cool for 10 minutes in pan before cutting into 1 inch cubesset aside. In a large bowl combine the cornbread cubes with celery, onion, bell pepper, mayonnaise, and tomatoestoss to coat. Serve on a bed of lettuce garnished with celery leaves and tomato wedges. Serve immediately or refrigerate 1 hour before serving. Makes 6 servings.
Mix all ingredients and chill at least 1 hour before serving. Top with sliced tomatoes and green onions. Serve with pita wedges.

In small bowl combine orange juice and soy sauce. Add garlic and green peppermix well. Place scallops in a shallow dish and pour soy mixture over scallops. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour or overnight. Remove scallops from soy mixture and pat dry with paper towels. In hot skillet with oil over medium-high heat brown scallops about 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove scallops from pan and keep warm. Add rice and almonds to soy mixture in skillet and cook until rice is heated through and almonds are golden brown. Place scallops on serving plates and top with rice and almond mixture. Garnish with orange zest and fresh orange slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In medium bowl combine flour and baking soda. In another bowl combine sugar and butter and mix together. Then add the eggs and vanilla extract and mix well. Slowly add the flour mixture and mix well. Roll dough out 1/4 inch thick and cut into 12 cookies. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until the edges begin to brown. Makes 12 cookies.

Beat together butter and extract until blended. Gradually beat in confectioners' sugar. Add food coloring if desired. Divide the dough into 3 parts and wrap in wax paper. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. On wax paper, roll each part into a 12 inch rope. Cut into 1 inch pieces. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 30 minutes or until dry and crisp. Cool on wire racks. Store in tightly covered container in refrigerator. Makes 3 pounds.

Cut bread into slices, about 1 inch thick, and arrange on a baking sheet. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, lemon juice and garlic. Pour over the bread and toss gently until the bread is thoroughly coated. Spread the bread in a single layer on the baking sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes, turning once or twice, until lightly browned and crisp on the edges. Sprinkle with the herbs and serve.

Place bagels in a greased skillet over medium heat and cook until they are a nice golden color on both sides. While bagels are cooking in the skillet, cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until it is crisp. Remove bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon and drain the fat from the skillet. Cut the bacon in half crosswise and place it on the bagel halves. Spread a little fat-free cream cheese over the top of the bagel halves. Slice the tomatoes and place them over the top of the bagels.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a baking sheet. In a large bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Add salt, sugar, and cinnamon. Beat until thick. Stir in nuts. Spread on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden. Cool completely. Makes about 5 dozen.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Slice cherry tomatoes in half. On a rimmed baking sheet toss with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until skins are wrinkled and browned, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, cook chorizo in a skillet over medium heat until browned and crispy. Drain and let cool. Drain beans and rinse under cold water. In a large bowl combine chorizo and beans. Add red onion and toss to combine. In a small bowl combine vinegar, honey and sherry. Pour over bean mixture. Toss to combine. Serve salad over mixed greens. Garnish with roasted tomatoes and drizzle with a little olive oil.

Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl. Add the cucumbers and onion and toss gently. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving. I prefer to allow the pickles to marinate overnight. The longer the pickles marinate the crisper they become. Serves 6

Preheat oven to 375. Cut each cracker into 2 triangles. In a bowl, combine 2 cups of the crackers and 1/2 cup of the melted butter. Press onto bottom and sides of a 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake for 8 minutes or until golden brown. In a small bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups of the remaining crackers, the sugar and the vanillaset aside. In a large bowl combine the remaining melted butter and the remaining crackersmix until well combined. Press onto bottom and sides of the baking pan. Bake for 8 minutes or until golden brown. Combine the powdered sugar and remaining 2 tablespoons butterblend well. Spread over cooled brownies. Sprinkle with the pecans and white and dark chocolate chips. Cut into bars. Makes 36 bars.

Boil the potatoes until tender. Cut them into cubes and place them in a large bowl. Add the eggs and onion and mix well. In another bowl combine the mustard and mayonnaise. Blend well. Pour over the potatoes and eggs. Add the sweet pickle and mix well. Chill at least one hour before serving. Add the salad dressing. Mix well. Refrigerate until serving time.
Dissolve jello in boiling water. Cool 10 minutes. Add cold water. Fold in ice cubes. Spoon into pie crust. Refrigerate overnight. Top with fat-free cool whip.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Brown meat and onion in 10-inch skillet over medium heat until no longer pink, stirring to crumble. Stir in remaining ingredients except macaroni. Bring to boilcover and bake for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, cook macaroni as package directsdrain. Stir macaroni into chili. Bake uncovered 15 more minutes. Serve immediately. Serves 4-6.

In a large stockpot over medium heat, melt butter and add onions. Sweat onion until translucent. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add flour and cook for 1 minute. Whisk in broth. Add broccoli and corn. Simmer until tender. Remove from heat. Whisk in half-and-half and season to taste. Serve in bowls. Garnish with grated Parmesan.

Prepare the green tea according to package instructions. Cool and place in the refrigerator to chill. Remove the tea bags and discard. Combine the cranberry juice concentrate and water in a large pitcher or bowl and stir until the concentrate dissolves. Add the green tea and the club soda and stir gently to combine. Serve over ice.

In a large pot, place the cubes of bouillon in the water. Add the bay leaf and the pork chops. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remove the chops from the pot. Let cool slightly. Remove the bay leaf. Remove the fat from the water and discard. In a medium pot, add the flour to the water. Stir until it is completely mixed. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Add the potatoes and onion. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the pork chops. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine butter, olive oil, garlic, shallot and dry red pepper flakes. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Set aside 1/4 of the butter mixture for the garnish. Place the crabs in a shallow ovenproof dish or baking pan. Pour the remaining butter mixture over crabs. Bake for 15 minutes or until crabs turn bright red or just slightly opaque. Sprinkle with thyme and parsley. Drizzle with blood orange juice and serve immediately.
Cook ground beef and drain. Combine with spaghetti sauce and heat through. Pour over cooked macaroni noodles and sprinkle with cheese.

In a large skillet, brown sausage until cooked through. Remove to a bowl. Add onion to drippings left in the skillet. Cook until softened. In a large bowl combine eggs, sugar, milk, vegetable oil and melted sausage. Stir in cornmeal mix. Add cheddar cheese and sausage mixture. Mix well. Pour batter into a greased 9 inch square pan. Bake at 350 for 30 to 35 minutes or until done. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together first 6 ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Cut in cold butter with pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in egg and vanilla. Spread mixture into a greased and floured 9-inch pie pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Garnish with chocolate chips and nuts if desired. Cut into wedges and serve.

In a bowl, combine the flour and green bean juice. Add 1/4 cup of the green beans and cook for 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in remaining green beans and 1/4 cup cheese until melted. Spread onto baked tortillas. Top with remaining cheese and bake at 425 for 8 to 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with a garnish of green onions if desired.

Line a 13x9 inch baking dish with foil. Mix graham cracker crumbs with butter until moistened. Press into prepared panbake at 350 degrees f for 10 minutes. Remove from ovenset aside. In a medium saucepan, combine sweetened condensed milk, chocolate chips and white chocolate chipsheat until melted. Remove from heatstir in walnuts and coconut. Pour over hot crustspread to form a thick layer. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into barssprinkle with chopped walnuts.

Spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. Lay the taquitos in a single layer over the bottom. Pour the enchilada sauce over the top. Pour the evaporated milk over the top. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the sauce is bubbly. Serve with sour cream. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place chicken breasts between 2 pieces of plastic wrap and pound to 1/4-inches thick. Beat together yogurt and stuffing cubes until well combinedspread onto chicken breasts. Roll up and place in a baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Meanwhile, mix peaches with cinnamon and sugar in a separate baking dish coated with cooking spray and bake at 350f for 15 minutes or until tender. Serve chicken and fruit together.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour a 12 cup bundt pan or two round 9 inch cake pans. Prepare cake according to box directions and pour into bundt pan. Bake about 35 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely. Meanwhile combine frozen whipped topping with the pudding mix and chill until ready to use. Slice cake horizontally into two layers. Place one layer on a cake plate. Spread half of the pudding mixture over the cake layer. Top with half of the mandarin oranges and half of the whipped topping. Top with the second layer of cake and spread the remaining pudding mixture over the cake layer. Top with the remaining mandarin oranges and the remaining whipped topping. Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving.
Cut muffin in half. Place egg and cheese on one half. On the other half place bacon. Fold and eat.

In a large skillet over medium heat brown the ground turkey and onion and garlic until no longer pink. Drain any excess fat and add the green beans and the frozen tater tots and cook until heated through. Pour the soup over the top and bake uncovered for 10-15 minutes at 350 degrees or until cheese is melted. Serve with a salad and fruit.

Preheat oven to 375. Press pastry into 10-inch pie plate. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Combine egg yolks, sugar, gelatin, water, cream and liqueur. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 25 to 35 minutes or until set. Cool. Stir rum into chocolate. Spoon over filling. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Makes 8 servings.

Wash tomatoes and cut tops off. With a sharp knife cut a circle out of the flesh of each tomato leaving a thick wall of flesh around the inside of each tomato. Scoop out pulp and seeds from each tomato and place in a bowl. Add cottage cheese, season with pepper and sprinkle with chervil. Spoon back into tomatoes and replace tops. Sprinkle with seafood cocktail sauce. Serves 4.

Combine flour, sugar & butter in a large bowl. Use a pastry blender or two knives to cut mixture until it forms fine crumbs. Stir in milk until a dough forms. Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness. Spread with jam, then roll up. Cut into 1/4 inch thickness. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter 2 large cookie sheets. In large bowl beat together butter, sugars and vanilla until creamy. Beat in instant pudding mix until blended. Beat in eggs one at a time until blended. Beat in flour, baking soda and salt. Stir in white chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned around edges. Cool 1 minute on cookie sheets. Remove from cookie sheets and cool completely. Store in air-tight container. Yields 3 dozen cookies.

In a large frying pan or wok, heat the olive oil and saute the onion for 3 minutes until soft. Add the pork and continue cooking for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the vinegar and the Worcestershire sauce. Cook for 2 minutes until the sauce thickens. Add the sugar and the roasted garlic. Toss to combine. Add the salad and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Heat a large saucepan over medium heat. Add olive oil. Add onion and garlic. Cook until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add rice. Cook 1 minute. Add chicken broth. Cook until all liquid is absorbed. Repeat until rice is cooked. Add asparagus. Cook until tender. Add lemon peel. Add cream cheese spread. Cook until melted. Stir in lemon juice. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Cook bacon in frying pan until crisp. Pour off fatset aside. In skillet, brown onion in bacon fat. Add flour and stir constantly for 2 minutes. Add water, mushrooms, peas and seasoning. Heat through. Stir in sour cream. Bake uncovered in casserole dish at 350F for 30 minutes. Bake uncovered in casserole dish at 350F for 30 minutes.

Pour the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, chili-garlic sauce, garlic cloves and dark sesame oil in a bowl or pan. Marinate the steaks in the mixture for 30 minutes to 2 hours in the refrigerator (or overnight). Remove steaks from the marinade mixture and grill to desired degree of doneness. Serve with toasted sesame seeds sprinkled on top.

In a 9x13 pan, combine rhubarb, sugar-free strawberry gelatin, brown sugar, and flour. Mix well. Melt butter. Stir in white chocolate chips. Drop evenly over rhubarb mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until topping is lightly browned. Serve warm with ice cream.
Stir tomatoes, onion, garlic and jalapeno together. Let stand 10 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and hot pepper sauce. Chop cilantro and toss with salsa. Cover and chill. Makes 3 cups.

Melt butter in medium saucepan. Add sugar and stir over low heat until melted. Add milk and vanilla. Stir until well blended. Stir in rolled oats and cocoa. Cook until mixture thickens. Pour mixture into greased 2 qt casserole. Top with coconut. Bake at 350f for about 35 minutes or until lightly browned.

Saute garlic and onion in olive oil until tender. Add clam juice and crushed red pepper flakes and boil for about 1 minute. Add clams and margarine. Cook for 1 minute longer then add milk and parsley. Stir and serve immediately over hot pasta.

Clean your mushrooms and remove stems. In a bowl combine all of your stuffing ingredients and mix well. Place each mushroom cap stuffing into each mushroom. Sprinkle each mushroom with breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15-20 minutes. Serve hot.

Butter both sides of each slice of bread. Place turkey in large skillet over medium heat, and add carrot, onion and celerystirring occasionally until turkey is no longer pink and vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Add thyme, salt and pepper. Add turkey gravy and stir until heated through. Place slices of turkey in each slice of bread and top with gravy mixture.

Bring water and sugar to a boil. Stir well. Add cherries and currants. Cook over low heat about 25 minutes or until thick. Spread in a hot jar. Seal and process in boiling water for 20 minutes. Makes about 2 pints.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add vegetarian ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Add onion and cook until browned. Stir in beans and next 8 ingredients (through chili powder). Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to lowcover and simmer 30 minutes. Transfer to a 3-quart baking dishtop with cheddar. Bake 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with corn chips or tortilla chips. Makes 8 servings.

Pound each chicken breast half to 1/4 inch thick. Combine salt and pepper and sprinkle over both sides of the chicken breasts. Heat butter in skillet and brown chicken breasts 2 minutes per side. Remove from pan and set aside. Add mozzarella cheese to the skillet and stir over heat until melted. Add mushrooms and saute 3 minutes. Add the soup, chilies and tomatoes and heat through. Add the rice and heat through. Place chicken breasts in the bottom of a 2 quart casserole. Top with the soup mixture and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Serves 4.

In large mixing bowl combine eggs, egg whites, milk, honey and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Pour mixture into casserole dish or 9x13 baking dish. Top with bread cubes. Bake for 40 minutes at 350. Cut into squares. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.

Combine artichokes with all ingredients in a small bowl. Chop the baguette into 1 inch cubes and place them into a medium bowl. Pour dressing over the cubed bread and toss to coat. Spread onto a large serving platter. Sprinkle with romano cheese. Serve with a side of artichoke bruschetta.

Pour caramel topping into a 12-ounce glass. Add dark chocolate and stir to melt. Add butterscotch schnapps and Baileys Irish Cream. Top with ice cubes. Stir to cool. Add cream and stir until blended. Serve with straws.

Cook macaroni in boiling water until al dente. Drain and add to a casserole dish with the rest of the ingredients. Stir and bake uncovered at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Sprinkle with paprika just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Season fish fillets with flour, salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown fillets in hot oilturn and brown other side. Place fillets in a shallow 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Stir together couscous and chicken broth in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in salsa and olives. Pour over fish in dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Combine soymilk and margarine in a heavy bottom saucepan over medium-low heat. Bring to a simmer and cook until the mixture has reduced to 1-1/2 cups and is thick and syrupy -- stirring constantly with a wire whisk. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the sugar and salt. The condensed milk will continue to thicken as it cools. Refrigerate until thickened. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat the oven to 180°C (fan-forced). Sift the flour and baking powder into a large bowl. Add the lemon myrtle. Use a pastry blender or two knives to cut the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles fine breadcrumbs. In a small bowl, combine the milk and honey until well blended. Add the milk mixture to the flour mixture and stir until a soft dough forms. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Divide the dough in half and shape each half into a round disc. Place on a tray lined with baking paper and flatten into a circle approximately 3mm thick. Scatter the figs and coconut on top and gently press into the dough. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. To make the icing, beat the lemon myrtle and honey until thickened. Spread over the biscuits and serve.
Combine all ingredients in sauce pan on medium heat and simmer for 15 minutes, or until apricots are soft and mixture is thick. Cool slightly before spreading on cakes or rolls.

Peel and seed butternut squash. Cube squash and place in a microwaveable bowl with 2 Tablespoons of margarine. Microwave for 10 minutes. Add sour cream and cook for another 10 minutes. Season to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, cream sugar and butter. Add egg. Add 1/2 c. of flour, baking soda and salt. Add vanilla and sour milk. Blend. Fold in blueberries. Pour into a well-greased 8-inch square baking pan. Bake for 1 hour. Cool. Makes 8 servings.

Boil milk and sugar over medium-high heat. Add egg yolks one by one and keep stirring. Add dry sherry and stir. Add ground cinnamon and nutmeg. Stir and boil for 1 minute. Pour into 12 individual serving cups. Chill for 4 hours. Beat egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff. Add sugar and keep beating until stiff. Spread over pudding. Sprinkle with blanched almonds. Garnish with whipped cream.

Slice eggplant into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Dip in egg and fry in olive oil in a nonstick skillet until golden brown. Remove and set aside. In a small bowl combine garlic clove, lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Add eggplant and toss until coated. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with feta cheese and basil pesto. Garnish with tomatoes and fresh thyme. Serve with rice.
In medium bowl, mix all the ingredients together. Top burgers with this mixture.

Mix butter and sugars until creamy. Beat in vanilla and egg. Stir in flour, soda and salt. Stir in white chocolate chips. Stir in a few drops of red food coloring. Stir in crushed candy cane. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 3 dozen.

Whisk together soy sauce, lime juice and ginger. In a small bowl, combine lime juice, garlic, thyme and pepperplace in a large zip-top plastic bag. Add salmon to bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Heat broiler. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Remove salmon from bagdiscard marinade. Broil salmon 4 inches from heat until just cooked through, about 4 minutes per side. Serve with lime wedges.
In a medium bowl toss together lettuce and bacon. Add vinegar, sugar and onion. Toss well and serve immediately.

Brown beef in skillet over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add onion soup mixture, salt and pepper to taste and cook until onions are tender. Mix potatoes in with beef mixture and add mushrooms. Pour into 9 inch pie plate and bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Top with swiss cheese and return to oven for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Heat oil over medium-low heat in a heavy saucepan. Saute the onions and the garlic for 10 minutes. Add the beans. Pour over molasses and soy sauce. Stir well. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the mustard. Makes 4 servings.

BASIC WHITE FROSTING Makes about 3 cups (17 oz.) 1. Place egg whites in a large bowl or in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. 2. Beat on high until frothy. 3. Gradually add sugar, about 1/4 cup at a time, beating on high until stiff peaks form. 4. Add water, 1 teaspoon at a time, until frosting reaches spreading consistency. 5. Add vanillamix well. 6. Beat on high for 2 minutes. 7. Frosting is done when it is shiny and can be spread easily between two fingers. PEANUT BUTTER FROSTING Makes about 3 cups (17 oz.) 1. Place egg whites in a large bowl or in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. 2. Beat on high until frothy. 3. Gradually add sugar, about 1/4 cup at a time, beating on high until stiff peaks form. 4. Add water,

Prepare pasta according to package directions. Drainrinse under cold water. Drain again. Add basil pesto dressing, water and oil. Toss to coat. Add cooked chicken, tomatoes, cucumber and olives. Toss gently to mix. Refrigerate until serving. Serve with feta cheese. Serves 4.

Heat olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Brush both sides of each bread slice with oil and place in pan. Cook until browned on both sides and crisp, about 1 minute per side. Transfer to paper towels and sprinkle with lime zest and chili flakes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375f. Peel potatoes and cut into 1 inch cubes. Toss with olive oil and place in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake 30-40 minutes or until potatoes are tender and lightly golden brown, stirring halfway through baking time. Mix together remaining ingredients and toss with potatoes. Serve immediately or bake another 10 minutes or longer for a crispier potato. Serve with bread or salted peanuts.

Soak red beans and lotus seeds separately in separate bowls of water overnight. Drain beans and seeds and add to pot with vanilla pod, pearl tapioca, sugar and water. Simmer for 4 hours or until beans are tender. Strain soup through a sieve and serve with rice balls and/or ginger syrup. Serves 6

In a bowl combine cookie crumbs, melted butter and cream cheese. Press onto a 13x9x2 inch baking pan lined with foil. Bake for 20 minutes at 350f. In a microwave safe bowl combine the chocolate chips, creamy peanut butter and milk until smooth. Spread onto crust. Top with chocolate chips and nuts. Refrigerate until firm. Break into bars to serve.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cook the kielbasa in a large skillet over medium heat until browned. Drain the pasta. Pour the pizza sauce into a 9x13 baking dish. Layer the pasta over the sauce. Top with the kielbasa and the baby spinach. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the pasta is heated through. Serve warm.

In a saucepan over low heat, combine milk with honey. When it starts to simmer, remove from heat. In a bowl, combine yolks with milk mixture. Let cool. In a chilled bowl, whip whipping cream until stiff. In another bowl combine banana with walnuts. Fold in whipped cream into yolk mixture. Fold in banana/walnut mixture. Pour into ice cream maker. Freeze for 20 minutes. Makes 12 servings.

Combine all of the marinade ingredients in a bowl and whisk together. Place chicken breasts in a resealable bag. Pour marinade into bag with chicken breasts. Seal bag and place in refrigerator for 3-4 hours. Remove chicken from marinade. Grill for 4-5 minutes per side or until no longer pink. Serve with extra ranch dressing.

In a food processor, combine cilantro, garlic, lime zest and juice, jalapeno pepper, soy sauce and olive oilseason with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl and stir in the halibut. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Grill fish for about 6 minutes on each side or until just cooked through. Serve with potatoes and pesto mixture.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine lemon juice, zucchini, yellow squash, tomatoes, olives, and basil in a large bowl. Divide tomato mixture evenly among four 10-inch nonstick ovenproof skillets. Lay salmon fillets on top of each tomato mixture. Pour oil over salmon fillets. Bake uncovered in the middle of oven until salmon flakes with a fork. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serves 4.

In a shallow dish combine the mustard, brown sugar and oil. Add the salmon and turn to coat. Marinate for about 30 minutes. Preheat the broiler. Arrange salmon on a foil-lined baking sheet and sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Broil for 10 to 12 minutes until just cooked through. Serve with potato chips and fresh dill.

Heat oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook until translucent and lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Stir occasionally to keep from sticking. Add fresh thyme and cook until onions are soft and very lightly browned and thyme is crisp, about 10 minutes more.

Heat the olive oil in a heavy dutch oven over medium heat. Add the veal and beef and season with 1 teaspoon of the kosher salt and the pepper. Cook until the meat is browned on the outside and no longer pink in the center. Transfer the meat to a plate and add the onion. Cook until softened and lightly browned. Return the meat to the pan and add the wine. Bring to a boil and cook until almost completely reduced. Add the tomatoes and the sausage. Bring to a boil again and cook for 2 minutes. Add the hot pepper flakes and season with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 30 minutes. Taste and season with more pepper and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt. Serve over your favorite pasta.
Cook pasta according to directions. Drain. Place pasta in serving bowl. Add cucumber, green peppers. Sprinkle with cheese. Pour dressing over pasta mixture. Serve immediately.

In a skillet, combine chicken breast with the water. Cook over low heat until the liquid evaporates and chicken is fully cooked. Cut into cubes. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook chopped onion in 3 tbsp butter until soft and translucent. Add 4 tbsp of fettuccine and toss. Add garlic, red pepper flakes, basil and parmesan cheese. Cook for another 3 minutes. Add cooked chicken cubes. Add 2 tbsp of water. Cook until cheese melts. Add cooked spinach. Cook until heated. Serve hot. Serves 3.

Preheat grill. Lightly oil one side of each piece of bread and place on grill. Grill until the bread begins to brown and toast the olive oil. Remove from grill and turn the bread over. Spread the bread with scamorza cheese. Place spinach leaves on the cheese. Top with strips of bacon. Return to grill and toast the bread and the cheese until the cheese is melted and the bread is crispy. Serve hot.

First, let's prep our potatoes. Using a mandoline slicer, slice them thinly. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Add the potatoes and cook until they start to get crispy on the edges. Once they are crispy on the edges add the peppers and the garlic cloves. Cook for one more minute and then add the ras el hanout and the coriander. Cook until the potatoes are browned. Add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and the dried chilies. Add a splash of water and bring the whole thing up to a boil. Then add the flaked sea salt. Cook until the water has evaporated. Then add the lemon juice and zest. Taste and adjust the seasoning with sea salt and flaked sea salt. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Sprinkle the duck breasts with salt and pepper. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, or until cooked through. Meanwhile combine raspberries and water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and let boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cinnamon and vinegar. Serve duck breasts with raspberry sauce.

Mix the yeast with the warm water in a small bowl. Set aside for 10 minutes. Sift the flour with the salt in a large bowl. Add the pepper and the yeast mixture. Add the oil. Bring together with your hands, kneading the dough for about 5 minutes or until it is smooth. Place in a large bowl. Cover with a cloth. Let rise for 2 hours in a warm place. Divide the risen dough into 4 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a ball. Place on a lightly floured surface. Flatten the balls into thick circles. Place one of the circles on a lightly floured surface. Using a pastry wheel or knife, cut the circle in half. Starting at one end, cut thin strips about 1 1/2 inches long. Gather the ends of each strip together. Pinch them together. Turn the strip over. Pinch the ends together. Place the biscotti on a lightly floured baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining dough. Brush the biscotti with the beaten egg. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Bake for 2

In a casserole dish, layer half the green beans and half the cream of mushroom soup. Sprinkle with half the french-fried onions and half the velveeta cheese. Layer the remaining green beans, cream of mushroom soup, french-fried onions and velveeta cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let sit for 5 minutes. Stir in 2 tablespoons milk and salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Prepare crust by mixing first 4 ingredients and pressing onto bottom and up sides of 13x9 inch baking pan. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until set. Remove from oven.
