Cool 5 minutes. Sprinkle chicken with 1/4 teaspoon of the onion powder and 1/8 teaspoon of the black pepper. Place in single layer in baking pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 35-40 minutes or until done. Drain. Spoon 3/4 cup of the sugar and 2 tablespoons of the butter over the crust. Spoon 1/3 cup of the ketchup over chicken. Sprinkle with remaining 1/8 teaspoon of the black pepper. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Yield 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spread butter on bread. Sprinkle with lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic salt. Top with crabmeat and chives. Sprinkle with more chives and more cheddar cheese. Bake 10-12 minutes or until cheese is melted and bread is crisp. Serve with ketchup if desired.

Mix cream cheese, sugar and milk in small bowl until blended. Add coconut. Spread into a graham cracker crust. Freeze. Top with cool whip. Add almond extract. Top with more coconut and more cool whip if desired. Cover with foil if not serving right away. Return to freezer until ready to serve.

Peel eggplants and slice 1/2 inch thick. Slice red onions into 1/2 inch thick rings. Put eggplants and onions in a bowl. Add yogurt. Sprinkle with basil. Mix. Let stand. Add lemon juice to taste. Sprinkle with olives. Serve at room temperature.

Place capers in a small food processor and pulse until coarsely chopped. Add cucumbers and pulse until finely chopped. Transfer to a medium bowl and add mayonnaise. Fold in mustard and chives and season to taste with lemon juice and salt. Add more mayonnaise or sour cream until the mixture is smooth and thick. Cover and chill for 1 hour.

Melt butter in frying pan. Brown the meat in butter on both sides, then remove the meat from pan and set aside. Saute the onion and mushroom in butter until mushrooms are tender. Stir in the onion soup mix and add water. Heat and stir until the mixture thickens. Return the meat and any drippings in the frying pan to the pan and add the soup mix and water. Heat through. Serve over cooked egg noodles sprinkled with the parsley and chopped mushrooms on top.

Cook the lasagna noodles according to package directions. Spray a 9x13 baking dish with non-stick spray. Combine the alfredo sauce and parmesan cheese in a bowl. Combine the spaghetti sauce and 1/2 cup of the parmesan cheese in a bowl. In a bowl combine the ricotta cheese, 2/3 cup parmesan cheese and the egg. Layer the baking dish starting with the noodles, alfredo sauce and parmesan cheese mixture, spaghetti sauce and parmesan cheese mixture and ricotta cheese mixture. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until the edges are bubbly. Sprinkle the top with the remaining parmesan cheese and the parsley. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Combine all the vegetables with the seasonings in a large mixing bowl. Stir in 1/2 cup of the melted butter. Spread the mixture evenly into a 13x9x2in baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter with the flour, and stir with a wire whisk until smooth. Gradually stir in the milk. Bring mixture just to a boilcook and stir for 1 minute or until thickened. Stir the sauce into the vegetable mixture, and bake for 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Cool slightly before serving.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Drizzle over meat and bake as directed.

Preheat oven to 350f. Drain beans well and place in a bowl with garlic cloves, onion and parsley. In a small bowl whisk together vinegar, olive oil and salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over beanstoss well to coat. Spread beans on baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes, stirring once or twice. Let cool completely. Stir in corn before serving. Serve with tortilla chips or vegetable sticks.

Combine pork chops and creole seasoning in a ziplock bag. Let marinate for at least an hour. Heat oil in a skillet. Drain the marinade from the pork chops. Coat the pork chops with the flour. Fry in the skillet until browned on both sides. Add the onions and water and continue cooking until the onions are tender. Serve over hot cooked rice. Serves 4.
Cook asparagus until tender. Drain. Melt butter. Toss asparagus with melted butter. Add parmesan cheese. Add egg and toss. Sprinkle with lemon juice.

Cube onion, heat butter in pan until melted. Add onions, brown sugar, and flour to the pan stirring frequently until onions begin to brown, about 45 minutes. Add stock to pan stirring occasionally until onions are tender about an hour more. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with french baguette and parmesan cheese with parsley.

Combine dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Beat egg substitute with applesauce. Stir egg mixture into the dry mixture. Stir in zucchini. Spoon into two greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pans. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the middle of the loaves. Cool for 10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely.

Cut the steaks into 1 1/2-inch cubes. In a bowl, whisk together the miso, sake, sugar, soy sauce, mirin, oil and sesame seeds. Add the beef cubes and turn to coat with the marinade. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Thread the beef cubes onto the skewers. Light the grill and brush the grate with oil. Grill the kabobs over direct high heat for 5 minutes per side, turning once, or until the beef is cooked through but still tender. Serve the kabobs with lemon wedges and steamed rice or noodles.

Melt butter. Add 2 oz chocolate and stir until chocolate melts completely. Spread evenly on the cut side of each banana. Roll each banana in the chocolate mixture and place on cookie sheet. Put 1 tsp rum on each banana and top with the remaining 1 oz of semisweet chocolate. Chill 15 to 20 minutes.

In a medium saucepan combine sugar, cornstarch, salt, milk, half-and-half, peanut butter, vanilla extract, and whisk until smooth. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until mixture thickens and boils, stirring constantly until thickened and boiling. Remove from heat. Cool slightly. Pour into 6 small dessert dishes. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until firm. Top with whipped cream and garnish with chocolate curls. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 475. Roll out pizza dough and place on baking sheet. Brush with oil and sprinkle with salt & pepper. Top with mozzarella, pineapple and onion. Bake for 12 minutes. Remove from oven and top with prosciutto and frisee. Bake for an additional 3-4 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Mix together the turkey & beef. Add the onion and the egg yolk, mixing well. Add the breadcrumbs and mix gently until well blended. Divide the mixture into 8 portions. Take a small handful of the meat mixture and make into a ball about 1" in diameter. Take another handful of meat mixture and make a ball slightly larger than the first one. Roll the first ball into the second ball and continue rolling all the way through to make a continuous sausage shape. If the meat mixture is too wet to roll, add more breadcrumbs to make a drier mixture. Place the kebabs on a plate and chill in the refrigerator for 10 minutes. In the meantime heat the grill to medium heat. Lightly brush the grill with olive oil or vegetable spray. Place the kebabs on the grill, cover the grill and cook for 4 to 5 minutes on each side until the meat is done. Remove the kebabs from the grill and serve with your choice of side dish and sauce.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Meanwhile combine cream of mushroom soup and milk and heat through. Drain macaroni and add to soup mixture. Mix well. Add tuna and cheddar cheese and mix well. Pour into a greased baking dish. Combine bread crumbs and melted butter and sprinkle over top of macaroni and tuna mixture. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Peel& core& slice apples. Add brown sugar& cook in sauce pan till soft. Mix brown sugar& spices& add to apples. Mix the rest with milk& eggs& add to apple& sugar mixture. Pour into a greased pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Let it cool. Mix a can of frosting& spread over the top. Sprinkle with coconut & chill.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large mixing bowl, mix together the butter, potatoes and saltset aside. Heat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large mixing bowl, mix together the butter, potatoes and saltset aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the onion, bell peppers and garlic in butter until softened. Stir in the potatoes and seasoningspour into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes then turn the potatoes over and bake an additional 15 minutes more or until tender when pierced with a fork. Garnish with chives before serving.

Cut the tops off the peppers and remove the seeds and ribs. Put the peppers in a 1-quart container and cover with boiling water. Let stand 10 minutes. Drain and dry the peppers. Combine the cream cheese, sausage, green onions and mayonnaise in a small bowl and spread the mixture in the peppers. In a small bowl, combine the parsley and jalapenos. Place the stuffed peppers on the platter and sprinkle with the parsley mixture. Makes 16 stuffed peppers.

Combine coleslaw mix and green onions in a large bowl. In another bowl, combine ramen noodles with butter. Spread noodle mixture over coleslaw mixture. In a small saucepan, combine almonds, sunflower seeds, 1/4 cup of the oil, soy sauce, sugar and vinegar. Bring to a boil. Boil 1 minute or until mixture is thickened. Pour over coleslaw mixture. Chill before serving.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F. Grease a 20cm round cake tin. Beat the margarine with the caster sugar until creamy. Add the vanilla essence and eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Fold in the yogurt. Sift the polenta into the mixture and fold in. Fold in the coconut. Pour the mixture into the cake tin and bake in the oven for about 30 minutes, or until the cake springs back when pressed lightly in the centre. Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack. When cake is cold sprinkle the rind and juice over the top. Serve sliced with fresh fruit.
Heat oil over medium heat. Add shrimp. Cook about 4 minutes until pink. Add lime juice and seasonings. Cook one minute more. Serve over cooked rice.
In a small bowl, whisk together tahini paste, miso, soy sauce and water until smooth. Pour dressing over salad and toss to mix well. Serve immediately.

Prepare brown sugar pudding mix according to package instructions using 1 can milk. Cool for 2 minutes. Cut dough into 12 pieces. Roll each piece into a ball and place each ball into a muffin cup. Add 1 teaspoon of pecans to each ball and pour the pudding over the tops of the balls. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook egg noodles until tender. Drain. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well. Pour into buttered baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

In a pot, combine all the ingredients. Let it boil. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove the pineapple tidbits. Stir the pineapple syrup. Add the pineapple tidbits. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve the chicken adobo aloha with rice.

Preheat the oven to 350F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Mash bananas with vanilla in a large mixing bowl until smooth. Mix in the coconut oil, oats, almond meal, coconut, cinnamon and sea salt. Mix in the baking powder. Finally add the dark chocolate bars. Spoon the dough in mounds onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow the cookies to cool completely before serving.

Heat olive oil in large Dutch oven over medium heat. Saute cauliflower, potatoes, curry powder, turmeric and red pepper flakes until tender, about 7 to 8 minutes. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 10 minutes. Add chicken to soupcook 4 to 5 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Remove chicken to a cutting board and shred with 2 forks. Stir into soup along with rice. Stir in scallions. Serve with naan bread and cilantro if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cut top and bottom off the garlic bulbsave for another use. Put the cut-off top and bottom on the flat side of the garlic bulb. Mash the garlic with the flat side of a knife. Remove the mashed garlic from the bulb. Beat together the garlic, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, and the pepper. Place the salmon fillets in a shallow baking dish. Pour the garlic mixture over the fish. Bake for 20 minutes. Turn the fish over, sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt, and bake for another 5 minutes. Serve immediately with fresh lemon juice squeezed over the fish and fresh parsley sprinkled on top.

Cut avocados in half. Remove pits and scoop out avocado. Mash avocado in a bowl. Add cottage cheese. Mix in lemon juice and garlic salt. Spoon into each half of the tortilla. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Top with the taco sauce. Add the tomatoes. Fold over. Serve immediately.

In a skillet melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add the onion and saute until tender about 5 minutes. Add the dried basil and saute an additional minute or so. Add the sugar snap peas and carrots and cook until brightly colored and crisp-tender, about 3-5 minutes depending on the size of the veggies. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and the orange juice. Cook another minute or two until the glaze thickens and the vegetables are coated. Garnish with parsley and the zest strips.

Heat the oil in a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the chile pepper jam and lime juice and stir-fry for 1 minute or until jam has dissolved. Stir in the fish sauce, stock and palm sugar, then add the pumpkin. Cook for 10 minutes or until pumpkin is tender. Stir in the prawns and spinach, then divide among serving plates. Garnish with the red onion and serve immediately.

Boil the turnips until tender. Peel and mash. Add the milk and yogurt. In a mixing bowl, combine the turnip mixture with the bread crumbs. Add the onions, parsley, pepper, and salt. Form into patties. Place in a shallow dish. Mix the egg with the vegetable oil. Place the turnip patties in the egg mixture. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Fry in hot oil until golden brown on both sides. Serve hot. Makes 12 servings.

Cut the bread in half lengthwise. Mix the mayonnaise and herbs together and spread on one half of the bread. Sprinkle cheese on top of the mayonnaise and put the other half of the bread on top to make a sandwich. Butter the outside of the bread and bake at 400 degrees for 5-10 mins or until brown.

Combine flour and sugar in a medium bowl. Stir in tapioca. Add vinegar and watermix until smooth. Add 2 cups of the crushed pineapple and apples. Spread in a 2-quart casserole. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until set. Cool slightly. Stir in remaining pineapple and apples. Spoon into dessert dishes. Top with topping. Garnish with nuts.

Cook potatoes in their skins in boiling water until tender when pierced with a knife. Drain them in a colander and let them cool enough to handle. Rub skins off potatoes (discard skins) and place potatoes in a bowl. Stir in olive oil, harissa and salt. Let stand 1 hour at room temperature. Toss potatoes in cumin-cilantro mixture before serving.

Rinse corned beef brisket well. Place the brisket in a 6 quart pot. Add the brown sugar, water, Guinness Stout, garlic, bay leaf, cloves, allspice, rosemary, thyme, onion and potato. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 2 1/2 to 3 hours. Remove the brisket from the liquid. Shred the brisket. Add the carrots to the broth. Simmer for an additional 10 minutes. Serve over mashed potatoes. Serves 6 to 8.

Mix ground beef, onions, and seasonings until well combined. Heat skillet over medium high heat and brown the beef mixture until it is thoroughly cooked and no longer pink in color. Stir in the sour cream and worcestershire sauce and heat through. Lay the french bread slices on a cookie sheet. Spread a thin layer of the stroganoff mixture on each slice and top with cheese and tomatoes and green bell pepper slices. Broil until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the bread is toasted on the edges. Serve immediately.

Wash and trim zucchini. Cut lengthwise into thin slices. Wash squash blossoms. Place zucchini slices in a colander to drain. Wash squash blossoms. In a large bowl combine squash slices, chickpea flour, coriander, salt, garam masala, chili powder, curry powder. Stir to combine. Heat oil in large non-stick skillet over medium-low heat. Spoon about 1/4 cup batter into hot skillet for each pancake. Cook 1-2 minutes per side or until browned. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve with yogurt.

Bake angel food cake according to package directions. Cool completely. Combine cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Spread over top of cake. Top with frozen whipped topping and pie filling. Refrigerate until serving time.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a shallow baking dish, combine soy sauce, sherry, sesame oil, ginger and cilantro leaves. Place the trout into the baking dish with the marinade, turning so that the fish is completely coated. Bake in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork, 15 to 20 minutes. To serve, garnish with green onions.

In a large mixing bowl with a hand mixer, beat egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Add coffee and beat until the egg whites are thoroughly combined. Add cream of tartar, salt and sugar and beat until thoroughly combined. Add the cocoa and beat until the egg whites are thoroughly combined. Gently fold in the coconut and form the mixture into 1 1/2 inch balls. Place the balls on wax paper and allow them to dry in a cool dry place for 12 hours. Makes about 120 cookies.
In blender, combine sugar, water and raspberries. Blend until smooth. Pour into bowl or other freezable container. Freeze until firm. Stir before serving. Serve with kirsch to taste. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Place pork chops in skillet and cook 3 minutes on each side or until brown on both sides. Transfer pork chops to baking dish and sprinkle garlic over top of chops. Add apples to skillet along with wine. Reduce heat to low, cover skillet and simmer 15 minutes or until apples are tender. Remove garlic from pan and discard. Spoon liquid over pork chops and serve.
Shred cabbage. In a bowl combine sugar, salt, vinegar, mustard seeds, and celery seeds. Add cabbage and toss. Add carrots and bell peppers and toss again. Add celery and toss again. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a bowl whisk together the gluten-free flour, buckwheat flour, gluten free baking powder, salt and sugar. In a separate bowl whisk together the egg whites and milk. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. Add the wet ingredients, canola oil and vanilla. Stir until just combined. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool on wire rack. Makes 1 loaf.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions and sausagecook 10 minutes or until sausage is lightly browned and onions are translucent. Add celery, garlic, thyme, lentils, and stock. Bring to a boilcook 5 minutes. Reduce heat to lowcover and cook 25 minutes or until lentils are tender. Stir in vinegar and season with salt and pepper, if desired.

Stir together sugar and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir in lemon and zest. Remove from heat. Cool completely. Put passion fruit and kiwi fruit into a blender and puree. Stir the puree into the cooled lemon mixture. Freeze in an ice cream maker according to manufacturers instructions. Serve in small glasses or bowls.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium bowl combine the butter, sugar, honey and vanilla extract until smooth. In a separate bowl combine the flour and baking soda, mix well. Stir the dry mixture into the butter mixture until well blended. Roll into about 2 tablespoons size balls. Place on ungreased baking sheet about one inch apart. Bake for about 10 minutes or until lightly golden brown. Let cool for a few minutes before removing from pans. Roll cookies in powdered sugar just before serving.

Beat the hazelnuts into the apple. Stir the honey into the melted butter and mix well. Add the beaten eggs. Sift the flour and soda together. Add the dry mixture alternately with the butter mixture in small batches. Pour into a greased 9×13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about one hour.

Heat tortillas in microwave for 10 seconds, flip and repeat. Heat 1 tbs refried beans in microwave for 30 seconds. In a large bowl combine refried beans with 2 tbs water and cumin, garlic powder, and chili powder. Heat in microwave for 20 seconds. Spread 2 tbs of beans down the center of each tortilla. Top with 1/2 tsp of cheddar cheese. Fold over the sides of the tortilla so it is tightly packed, then roll up to make a burrito. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. Serve with salsa or sour cream if desired.

In a large mixing bowl combine the flour, oil, yogurt, sugar, cinnamon, baking powder. Mix well. Fold in the almonds. Pour into two loaf pans. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 15 minutes before removing from pans to cool completely.

In a wok or skillet cook the garlic, ginger, pork, broth, water and soy sauce until the meat is tender. Add noodles, carrot, red bell pepper and spinach. Stir-fry until noodles are tender and serve immediately.

Melt butter in heavy skillet over medium heat. Add onions, and saute until soft, about 15 minutes. Add mushrooms, salt, pepper, and saute until softened and liquid evaporates, about 15 more minutes. Stir in half-and-half, sherry, and sour cream. Simmer until heated through. Serve over roast beef or steaks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Place dinner rolls on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown.Heat 1/2 cup butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until foaming. Add onions and garlic and saute until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add parsley and 1 tsp garlic salt and saute for 1 minute longer.Combine onion mixture with bread cubes, tossing well to coat.Sprinkle with remaining garlic salt. Transfer to a greased 13x9x2 inch baking dish.Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown.

Mix wine, worcestershire sauce, tomato paste, vinegar, and horseradish in small bowl. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour and up to 2 hours. Place steaks on broiler pan 3 inches from heat and broil 10 minutes for medium-rare. Turn steaks over and brush with wine mixturebroil 5 minutes more for medium-rare. Top with thyme and garlic cloves and broil until charred and steaks are desired donenessbrush steaks lightly with remaining wine mixture. Let steaks rest 5 minutes. Cut into 1/2-inch slicesserve drizzled with oil.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Brush the top of each biscuit with dressing. Sprinkle the top of the biscuits evenly with parmesan cheese and poppy seeds. Bake for 20 minutes or until biscuits are browned on top.

Preheat oven to 350f. In medium bowl beat shortening and sugar until creamy. Add banana and beat. Add active starter and mix well. Add eggs and beat. In another bowl combine flour, soda, powder and salt. Stir into banana mixture. Stir in nuts. Bake in greased loaf pan at 350f for 1 hour. Makes 1 loaf.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Cut eggplants in half lengthwise. Brush with olive oil. Sprinkle with black pepper, garlic powder and paprika. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes until eggplant is tender. Cool before slicing into strips for use in pastas or as a topping for pizzas.
Preheat crock pot to high. Combine beef, onion and green pepper. Add tomatoes and wine. Cook on high for 5 hours. Slice and serve with rice.

Place peanuts in food processor along with garlic and onion. Pulse until smooth. Add red curry paste, fish sauce and coconut milk. Pulse until smooth. Add lime juice, palm sugar and chicken stock. Blend until smooth.

In a large bowl combine flour, oats, baking powder, and salt. Mix well. In another bowl combine water, beer, melted butter, sugar, and vanilla. Stir into dry mix until moistened. Pour into greased bread pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Makes 1 loaf.

Toast fruit and glace fruit in a pan over low heat until hot and dried out. Dissolve port wine in hot water and add to fruit mixture. Blend all together in a blender until smooth and well blended. Cool in refrigerator for 1 hour. Roll in portions of cream cheese and cheddar cheese. Dust with poppy seeds and chill again. Serve with crackers or toast triangles.

Combine salt, beer, lemon juice, honey, and mustard. Place ribs in a shallow dish and pour marinade over them. Cover and refrigerate 24 hours. When ready to grill ribs, preheat the grill to medium. Remove ribs from the marinade and place them on the grill rack. Grill for 30 minutes and turn ribs over. Grill for an additional 30 minutes. Serve hot.
Lightly crumbed each fish fillet. Place into greased dish. Spoon over pasta sauce. Sprinkle over the parmesan. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve with salad.

Wash and trim beans. Blanch green beans in boiling water for 2 minutes or until bright green but still crisp. Immediately plunge them into cold water and drain. Combine green beans with feta cheese, dill, sweet onion, lemon zest, and pepper in a medium bowl. Whisk lemon juice with olive oil. Drizzle over saladtoss. Cover and refrigerate.

Heat olive oil in skillet. Add chicken and cook 2 minutes on each side. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside. Add onion, mushrooms and bell pepper to skillet. Cook until onions are tender and vegetables are browned. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds more. Add chicken back to skillet and pour in dijon mustard and 1 tablespoon of sour cream. Cook until heated through. Top with remaining sour cream and parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, 4 to 5 minutes. Add butter and stir until melted. Stir in kosher salt, corn, rosemary, and turmeric and cook for 1 minute more. Add 1 cup water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until corn is tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Cut the kernels from the cobs and return to the pan. Add cornmeal and remaining 1/2 cup water. Cover and cook until thickened, 10 to 15 minutes more. Stir in cream and season to taste with black pepper.
Combine all ingredients in a food processor and blend to a paste. Spread on fish fillets and broil in a preheated oven until done. Serve with rice.

Cook pasta noodles according to package instructions. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in soup mix and mustard. Stir well to combine. Add chicken to pan. Cook until no longer pink in center. Stir in broccoli and red bell pepper. Simmer for 3 to 5 minutes. Drain pasta. Serve hot over chicken mixture. Sprinkle with parsley, if desired.

Marinate chicken in buttermilk for 24 hours. Dip chicken in egg substitute, then in hot sauce. Add 1/2 cup corn flakes and 1/4 cup parmesan to chicken. Roll in mixture and place in greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Baste every 15 minutes. Sprinkle with oregano.

Peel sweet potatoes and cut in half lengthwise. Place cut side down in a 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake at 400 degrees 25-30 minutes or until potatoes are tender. When cooked, mash potatoes with a potato masher. Add pie filling and mix well. Spread onto potatoes. Combine cranberry sauce and apricot preserves. Spoon over sweet potato mixture. Bake at 400 degrees 5-10 minutes longer or until heated through. Serve with orange marmalade.

Cook pasta according to directions. While pasta is cooking, saute onion and garlic in olive oil until soft. Add tuna and cook until thoroughly heated. In a 9×13 baking dish, layer spaghetti noodles, tuna mixture and cheddar cheese. Top with parmesan and bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Uncover and bake for 5 more minutes to brown topping. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serves 4.

In a medium bowl, mix the dry ingredients together and set aside. In a small bowl, mix the eggnog and rum. Heat the butter in a small saucepan over low heat and melt completely. Add the eggnog mixture and bring to a boil. Cook and stir until the mixture is thickened. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Fold the rum-eggnog mixture into the dry mixture just until combined. Fold in the egg just until combined. Spoon the batter into paper lined muffin cups and bake for 18-20 minutes in a preheated 400f oven. Let cool for a few minutes in the muffin tins and then remove from the cups. Dust with nutmeg and serve warm or at room temperature.
Toss berries in liqueur and let stand for 15 minutes. Melt chocolate and cream over low heat until smooth. Add strawberries and serve.

In a small bowl combine all the salsa ingredients and set aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the olive oil and swirl to coat. Season the mahi mahi fillets with salt and pepper and place the fillets into the skillet. Cook the mahi mahi fillets for 3 minutes on each side. The fillets should be cooked through and slightly brown on the outside. Serve the mahi mahi fillets topped with the blood orange avocado and red onion salsa.

Combine flour, baking soda and salt. Set aside. Cream butter and sugar together. Add eggs and vanilla. Add flour mixture. Add walnuts and mix. Form into 1" balls. Roll in granulated sugar. Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 8 minutes.

Slice cabbage. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add cabbage and onion. Cook 5 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender. Add vinegar. Stir until liquid is almost absorbed by cabbage mixture. Stir in sugar, clove, and red wine. Add flour and water. Cook and stir until mixture thickens and boils. Cook and stir for about 1 minute more. Stir in parsley.

Puree strawberries in food processor. In medium bowl beat yogurt with sugar until smooth. Add strawberry puree and orange juicewhisk to combine. Beat whipping cream until stiff peaks form. Fold into yogurt mixturefold in cointreau. Chill. Garnish with strawberry.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease bottom and sides of 9×13 inch pan.In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla extract until smooth. In another bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually add to the creamed mixture and beat until well blended. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and sprinkle the cereal over the hot cake. Press down with the back of a spoon and spread evenly. Sprinkle the chocolate chips on top. Bake for an additional 15 minutes in the preheated oven until the edges are lightly browned and the cereal is golden brown. Remove from the oven and let cool for about 2 hours in the pan before cutting into squares and serving.

In a medium bowl, beat together cream cheese and onions until well blended. Stir in pineapple and pecans and remaining ingredients until blended. Shape into ball and refrigerate several hours or overnight. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In medium bowl combine flour and cocoa powder. Set aside. In large bowl combine sugar and corn syrup with an electric mixer at medium speed for 2 minutes. Add egg whites and beat at high speed for 2 minutes. Reduce mixer speed to low and add flour mixture in 3 additions alternately with the milk in 2 additions, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Spoon dough by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheet. Flatten each spoonful with your thumb and make an indentation with your finger. Bake for 10 minutes or until set. Cool for 1 minute and remove to wire rack. Let cool completely. Makes about 48 cookies.
Place all ingredients into blender and blend until slushy. Serve with a straw and enjoy!

In skillet, heat oil over medium heatsauté onion 5 minutes or until softened and golden, stirring often. In large nonaluminum saucepan or Dutch oven, combine all remaining ingredients except sausage. Bring to a boilcover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 20 minutes or until sauce thickens. Cool completely. Cut kielbasa into 1/2-inch-thick slicesplace half of slices in prepared pan. Pour half of sauce over slicescover with remaining slices and remaining sauce. Bake uncovered at 350° for 1 hour or until kielbasa is no longer pink. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Mix pumpkin, milk, sugar and salt. Beat in eggs. Spread in greased 13x9 pan. Sprinkle with pecans. Mix cake mix with margarine. Spread over pecans. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Spread with whipped topping. Sprinkle with pecans. Serves 12.

Peel and core the cabbage. Cut it in quarters and slice very thin. Combine cabbage, carrots, and green onions in bowl. Stir in vinegar and sugar. Taste and add more vinegar and sugar to your liking. Chill. Stir in the Miracle Whip and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 2-quart casserole, combine chicken, butter, mixed vegetables and seasonings. Pour half of soup over chicken mixture. In a large bowl, combine pasta shells, remaining soup and 1 cup of milk. Pour half of pasta mixture over chicken mixture. Top with french fried onions. Pour remaining milk over onions. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until pasta is tender.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Wash and poke potatoes all over with a fork. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour, or until potatoes are tender. Allow to cool for 5 minutes. Cut open and top with ranch dressing, sour cream, bacon bits and cheese. Sprinkle with green onions.

Mix strawberry preserves and cream cheese. Unroll crescent rolls. Spread cream cheese mixture on bottom half. Top with top half of crescent roll. Brush with melted butter. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Combine confectioners' sugar and water and drizzle over roll ups.

Lightly grease a skillet. Cut bread slices in half horizontally and toast. Mash banana in small bowl. Beat egg, milk and butter together in a saucepan until foamy. Cook over medium heat until mixture begins to bubble and coats the spoon. Dip each toast half in sauce, then turn and coat other side. Sprinkle with salt. Drizzle with syrup.

To prepare dressing, combine the first three ingredients in a small bowl and mix wellset aside. To prepare salad, combine mandarin oranges, pineapple, oranges and apples in a large bowltoss gently. Stir in dressing mixture and toss gently. Fold in yogurt and coconut. Spoon into a trifle bowl or a large serving bowlsprinkle with marshmallows. Cover and chill at least one hour or until ready to serve. Garnish with marshmallows and mint sprigs if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Heat the oven to 375. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper. Sift the flour, sugar, cranberries, and chocolate chips into a large bowl. Stir in the baking powder and salt. In a small bowl, mix the vegetable oil, vanilla, and almond extract. Stir into the dry ingredients until moistened. Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth. Roll the dough into a log about 12 inches long and 2 inches in diameter. Place the log on the baking sheet. Bake until lightly golden on top, about 20 minutes. Reduce the heat to 325. Turn the log cut side down on the baking sheet and bake until lightly golden, about 12 minutes. Transfer the baking sheets to wire racks. When the biscotti are completely cooled, cut into slices. Bake the slices on a baking sheet in a 300 degree oven until lightly golden, about 10 minutes.
In blender combine all ingredients and blend until smooth. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Mix pork with 1/4 cup barbecue sauce in a non stick skillet over medium heat till heated through. Serve pork mixture with tortillas, cheese, cilantro, green onion and butter. Place quesadillas in oven and broil till cheese is melted. Top with sour cream. Sprinkle with green onions.

Trim stems from artichoke hearts. Place in a bowl and add water to cover. Set aside for 30 minutes or longer to allow artichoke hearts to soften and become more pliable to the touch. Drain artichoke hearts and pat dry with paper towels. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium high heat. Add garlic and saute for a minute or so until garlic is golden brown. Add artichoke hearts and saute until artichoke hearts are slightly browned and softened to desired texture. Add wine, lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Add parsley and toss lightly to combine. Serve immediately over pasta or rice. Serves 4.

Cook rotini pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and place in a large bowl. Add italian salad dressing. Stir until well coated. Add onion and green pepper. Stir. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Add turkey pepperoni and parmesan cheese. Stir. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Add italian seasoning just before serving. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 f. Cook sausage in skillet until browned and crumbleddrain on paper towels. Spray 6 (6-ounce) ramekins with cooking spray. In each ramekin, layer 2 slices bread, 2 tablespoons sausage, 1 slice cheddar cheese, and 1 egg. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon mustard. Bake 20 minutes or until egg is set. Let stand 1 minute before serving. Makes 6 servings.
Combine 1 1/2 cups water and 2 1/2 cups sugar in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add figs and lemon juiceboil 5 minutes or until figs are tender. Remove from heatcool. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 425. Cut squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Rub cut sides with olive oil. Place face down in a baking pan. Roast for 20 minutes. Slice sausages in half lengthwise. Place face down around squash. Add garlic and rosemary to pan. Drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil. Bake for 15 minutes or until sausages are cooked through and squash is tender. Stir before serving. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar.

Boil beer in large stockpot for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add bacon, sliced into small pieces. Cook for 10 minutes. Add hot dogs and cook until done (about 10 minutes). Remove dogs from stockpot and slice in half lengthwise. Put dogs and bacon back in stockpot and add mustard and peppers. Warm for 5 minutes. Place in hot dog buns and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl, combine onions and 1 tablespoon oil and toss to coat. Season with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Spread onions out on 1 baking sheet. Bake 40 to 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until onions are golden brown and caramelized. In another large bowl, combine plums, dates and next 4 ingredients (through chile). Let stand 15 minutes. Spread onions out on 1 baking sheet. Bake 40 to 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until onions are golden brown and caramelized. In another large bowl, combine plums, dates and next 4 ingredients (through chile). Let stand 15 minutes. Transfer plums mixture to a food processor, add juice of 2 limes, and process until smooth. Transfer mixture to a large saucepan, add onions and remaining 1/4 cup oil. Cook over medium

Heat the butter in a frying pan, add the onions and fry gently until lightly golden. Add the beans and tomatoes and cook gently for about two minutes. Stir in the stock and garlic clove. Season with pepper and salt and add the parsley leaves. Serve immediately.

Brown 1 lb of bulk sausage in a large frying pan. Cube 6 boneless chicken breast halves into 1" pieces and brown in same frying pan with sausage. Stir in 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup1 can of cream of chicken soup1 can of cream of celery soup1 can of milk1 tsp nutmeg1/2 tsp black pepper1/2 tsp garlic powder1/2 tsp onion powder1/2 tsp each of basil, sage, marjoram1/2 tsp parsley flakes1/2 tsp oregano1/2 tsp paprika1/2 tsp rosemary1/2 tsp thyme1/2 tsp each of lemon juice and orange juice1/2 tsp salt1/2 tsp white pepper1/2 tsp curry powder1 tsp cornstarch1/2

Place chicken pieces in a bowl or plastic bag along with lemon slices, lemon juice and garlic. Let marinade for 20 to 30 minutes or longer if you have the time. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Remove chicken from lemon juice mixture. Place chicken pieces in a shallow roasting pan or baking dish, skin side down. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with lemon-pepper seasoning. Bake for 1 hour or until the chicken is done. Serve hot with your favorite side dish.

In a large skillet saute bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet and set aside. Add onions and garlic and saute until tender and translucent. Add sprouts and chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes. Add butter and bacon and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. In small bowl combine egg, yogurt, bananas and maple syrup. Add to flour mixturestir just until moist. Fold in walnuts. Spoon into muffin cups coated with cooking spray. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack.

Mix together soy sauce, sugar, vinegar, oil and garlic. Set aside. Cut up chicken into bite-sized pieces. Heat vegetable oil and brown chicken. Add soy mixture. Add rice. Cook until done. Serve with coleslaw.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Remove seeds and membrane from peppers. Divide tuna into 8 equal portions and fill peppers with tuna. Dot with onion and parsley. Sprinkle with green olives and drizzle with 1 tablespoon sherry wine vinegar. Bake for 20 minutes. In a small bowl combine remaining 3 tablespoons sherry wine vinegar, garlic and paprika. Drizzle tuna with vinegar and serve.

Melt butter in a sauce pan. Add the flour and stir until smooth. Stir in the milk and sherry. Cook over low heat, stirring until thick. Remove from the heat. Stir in the paprika, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Place the fish in a baking dish. Pour the sauce over it. Cover the dish with aluminum foil. Bake in a preheated 350 degree fahrenheit oven for 15 minutes. Top with the grated cheese. Bake until fish is flakey and the sauce is bubbly.

Heat grill to medium high heat. Combine shallot, tomato paste, molasses, garlic, fresh rosemary, fresh oregano, and 2 tablespoons olive oil together in a small bowl and rub all over the chicken breasts. Season with salt and pepper. Grill chicken until lightly browned on both sides and cooked through. Meanwhile, combine lemon juice and zest with remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a small bowl and set aside. When chicken is cooked through, transfer to a platter and spoon lemon dressing over chicken breasts to serve.

Slice the lemon into thin strips. Remove the seeds. Place the strips in 3 cups water. Allow to sit for at least 1 hour or overnight. After 1 hour or overnight, remove the lemon slices from the water. Bring the water to a boil. Add the dates. Remove from the heat and let sit for 15 minutes. Strain the water through a colander. Return the water to the pot and add the honey. Mix well. Chill the water before serving. Serve cold with ice cubes.

In a food processor or blender blitz the sun-dried tomato, garlic and pine nuts until smooth. Add rocket and basil and blitz again. Pour in a little olive oil and blend for a few seconds until you have a thick paste. Season with salt and pepper to taste and a grating of parmesan. Serve with cooked pasta.

Peel and cube potatoes. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook potatoes until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. Drain again. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes with the mayonnaise and mustard. Add the garlic and season with the salt and pepper. Stir in the hot dogs. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat butter over medium heat in a pan. Add eggs and stir for about a minute and then turn heat down to low and cover with a lid. Cook for about 10 minutes or until eggs are done to your liking. Be careful not to over cook them. Add salt and pepper and stir. Serve as an accompaniment to a meal or just eat alone for a quick meal or snack.

Add the water and herbal tea bags to a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Stir in the couscous and return to the boil. Remove from the heat and cover. Let stand for 5 minutes. Remove the tea bags. Add the olive oil, salt and pepper. Fluff the couscous lightly. Stir in the raisins and almonds. Top with fresh mint leaves. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the yogurt with the mayonnaise, garlic, salt, pepper, and olive oil. Mix thoroughly. Let stand for 1 hour. Combine the yogurt mixture with the pasta. Add the tomatoes and blue cheese. Stir to mix well. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Serve cold. Serves 4.

Place egg whites in large bowl of electric mixer. Beat until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in corn syrup. Continue beating until glossy. Stir in salt and vanilla. Spread over cooled cake layers. Makes 1 cup frosting.

Cook broth in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add tortellini, cannellini beans, tomato, basil and balsamic vinegarstir occasionally. Cook until tortellini is tender (about 12 minutes). Remove 2 cups of soup and reserve. Add cheese to remaining soupstir until melted. Ladle soup into bowlstop with parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings. 6 points each.

Place milk in saucepan. Add brown sugar, salt and oil. Heat over medium heat until warm. Add yeast and mix thoroughly. Add water, eggs and flour. Mix well. Add cinnamon and nutmeg and mix thoroughly. Pour into greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Makes 8-10 pancakes. Serve with syrup.

Put 3/4 cup warm water into a large mixing bowl. Add 1 tsp sugar. Add 1/2 tsp yeast. Add 1/2 tsp salt. Add 2 1/2 cups flour. Stir well. Dust a work surface with flour. Turn the dough out onto the surface. Knead until smooth (about 5 minutes). Cover the dough with a damp towel. Let the dough rise for 1 hour. Divide the dough into 4 pieces. Roll each piece into a 12" long rope. Cut the ropes into 1" sections. Place the dough sections on a baking sheet. Let the dough rise for 10 minutes. Preheat oven to 400. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 16 breadsticks.

Cut pork in half crosswise. Cut each half lengthwise in half. Cut each half of the pork into 2 slices. Heat the oil in a 12 inch skillet over high heat until very hot. Add the pork slicescook, turning once until browned all over. Add the red pepper, broccoli florets and green onions. Cook for about 2 minutes. Add water. Cover the skillet and simmer the pork for 5 minutes or until the pork is cooked through. Drain the ramen noodles. Cut each bundle in half. Stir the noodles into the skillet along with the soy sauce. Add the parsley. Serve immediately.

In a medium heavy saucepan combine water, sugar and salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Remove the pan from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Add the grape juice concentrate and lemon juice to the sugar solution. Stir to combine. Chill the mixture completely. Once the mixture has chilled thoroughly, add the egg whites and whisk until the mixture is foamy. Transfer the mixture to the ice cream maker. Process according to manufacturers directions. Transfer to an airtight container and freeze for at least two hours.

In a large pot combine all the ingredients except green beans. Bring mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Add green beans, reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 5 minutes, or until green beans are crisp-tender. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease 12x8-inch baking dish. Heat butter or margarine in saucepan over medium heat. Add carrots, salt and peppercook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain. Add sugarmix well. Combine baking powder with flouradd to carrots mixturemix well. Beat eggs in separate bowl until foamy. Add to carrot mixturemix well. Pour into baking dishbake for 40 to 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with powdered sugar or whipped topping. Serves 6 to 8.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium high heat. Add snow peas, almonds, mint leaves, and season with salt and pepper. Saute until the snow peas are bright green. Drizzle with a little more butter if desired.

Divide dough in half. Roll each half into 10-inch round. Place 1/4 pound meat in center. Brush edges with water. Top with pesto sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Fold over dough edges to form half-moon shape. Crimp edges with fork. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. Makes 2 calzones.

In a large bowl, combine bread cubes and ground beef. Add remaining ingredients. Blend well. Bake in a greased 9 x 13 pan at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in parsley. Serve with a salad. Makes 8 servings.

Place the butter in a large heatproof bowl and place the bowl on top of a pot of simmering water. Cook the butter until it melts and turns a light golden color, about 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove the bowl from the heat and continue stirring until the mixture is brown and smooth. Add the powdered sugar, milk and vanilla and beat with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until the frosting is thick and smooth. If the frosting is too thick add more milk and beat until it reaches the desired consistency. Serve immediately or chill for later use.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl combine 1 1/2 cups cheerios, 3/4 cup brown sugar, 2 tablespoons baking powder and 1 tablespoon baking soda. Set aside. In a small bowl combine 1 banana, 1 large egg white, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1/2 cup nonfat milk. Stir to combine well. Stir banana mixture into cheerios mixture until well combined. Add 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon and 1/2 teaspoon ground gingerstir just until combined. Fill 24 greased or paper lined muffin cups half full. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350. Line two cookie sheets with parchment paper. Combine oil and banana in a large mixing bowl. Add eggs and cardamom. Beat well. In a small bowl combine the dry ingredients. Slowly add to the banana mixture. Stir until combined. Add chocolate chips. Stir. Drop by spoonfuls on cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes 1 dozen.

Mix 2 eggs, 2 Tbsp milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp cinnamon in a shallow dish. Soak bread slices in mixture for 10-30 seconds per side. Heat 2-4 tsp butter in nonstick pan over medium-low heat. Add bread slices in pan. Flip when browned on first side. Cook until brown on second side. Serve warm with syrup.

Cook pasta according to directions. In the last couple of minutes of cooking time add the butter, parmesan and blue cheese. When pasta is done drain and add the walnuts. Mix together. Serve hot or cold.

Boil macaroni and cheese mix in a large pot of boiling water as directed on the box. While it is cooking, cook ground beef in a large skillet on medium-high heat until browned and drain the fat from the meat. In another large skillet, sauté onions in butter until soft and slightly browned. Pour half of the macaroni and cheese into the bottom of a 9 x 13 pan. Top with meat and onions, then the rest of the macaroni and cheese and the cream of mushroom soup. Bake in a 350 degree oven until the sauce is bubbly.

Slice the potato and kumara into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Place into a large bowl and add salt and pepper. Toss in olive oil. Lay onto a non-stick pan or line with parchment paper. Bake at 200 C for 40 minutes. Turn potatoes over and bake for another 10 minutes. Serve hot with a nice green salad.

Heat the olive oil in a nonstick frying pan. Add the garlic cloves and fry for 1 minute. Add the olives and fry for 2 minutes. Season and allow to cool. Blend the garlic and olives in a food processor. Add the mayonnaise, parsley and lemon juice and process until smooth. Season and stir in a little of the olive oil to make the mayonnaise glossy. Add a little more if necessary. Store the mayonnaise in a covered jar in the refrigerator for up to 4 days. Serve chilled.
Hard-cook eggs and peel. Cut into halves or quarters. Mix sweet pickle relish and mayonnaise. Add mustard and pickle juice. Add salt. Add potato and eggs. Garnish with chives.

In large pot over medium heat combine butter, chicken bouillon granules, salt and pepper. Add couscous and stir. Add 2 cups boiling water. Stir. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Add remaining 2 cups boiling water. Cover and cook 10 minutes. Fluff with fork. Stir in mushroom stems and pieces. Cover. Cook 5 minutes longer. Makes 8 servings.

Heat the butter in a large nonstick skillet. Add the onion, carrot, and mushrooms. Cook over medium heat 5 minutes. Stir in the stock and bring to a boil. Add the soy sauce and mustard. Stir in the cornstarch mixture, reduce heat, and simmer for 5 minutes or until thick. Add the potatoes. Toss until the potatoes are coated with the sauce. Serve immediately. Garnish with parsley.

Place yogurt in a bowl. Mix in honey and spices. Add in the chopped cilantro. Mix well. Place chicken breasts in a large plastic bag or a container with a tight-fitting lid. Add the marinade. Turn the bag to coat the chicken. Let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight. Thread the chicken breasts on skewers. Heat the grill until hot. Place the skewers on the grill and cook for about 8 minutes on each side. Serve warm.

Place potatoes in an ungreased casserole dish and toss with the olive oil. Sprinkle with the seasoning salt, garlic powder and paprika. Bake for 45 minutes at 400 degrees F. Remove from oven and sprinkle with fresh grated parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a 12 inch nonstick frying pan over medium-low heat. Place chops in pan and cook about 4 minutes per side or until cooked through. Set aside. In same pan, combine jam and vinegar and heat through. Add Dijon and cook 1 minute longer. Add orange zest and season with salt and pepper. Spoon glaze over chops and serve. Serves 4.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Saute garlic in oil for about 1 minute. Add shrimp and scallops. Cook until opaque and just firm. Add wine. Stir in pasta. Add butter. Sprinkle with parmesan. Serve immediately.

Put orange juice, white sugar, and ice cubes in a pitcher and stir. Add the club soda just before serving. Place one scoop of vanilla ice cream in each glass. Pour the orange juice mixture over the ice cream. Top with another scoop of vanilla ice cream. Garnish with an orange slice.

In a large skillet or saute pan, cook leeks and mushrooms with a little butter until they are soft and all liquid has evaporated. Add mustard and wine and cook for a few minutes more. Transfer mixture into a bowl and let cool. Preheat oven to 425F. Line a baking pan with parchment paper and sprinkle lightly with breadcrumbs. Beat the eggs in a large bowl and whisk in the leek/mushroom mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Spread mixture evenly in the baking pan and bake for about 20 minutes until lightly browned on top. Let cool and serve warm or at room temperature.

Cut avocadoes into quarters and remove pits. Place in medium bowl. Add lemon juice and mash with potato masher until chunky. Add garlic and jalapeno and mash until smooth. Add tomato and onion and stir until blended. Stir in salt. Serve with tortilla chips. Makes 6 servings.

In a large nonstick skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add pork chops and cook for 6 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in the center. Remove from skillet and keep warm. Add carrots and snow peas to skillet and cook and stir until crisp-tender. Return pork chops to skillet and cook until heated through. Stir in broth and cook until thickened and bubbly. Stir in flour, lemon juice and pepperheat through. Serve over rice if desired.

Combine 1 1/2 teaspoons sherry and 1 teaspoon cornstarch in a shallow bowl. Dip pork into mixturepress pork into sherry mixture to coat. Combine cumin, garlic, and seasoning salt in a small bowl. Rub all over pork. Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add porkcook 4 minutes on each side or until done. Remove pork from skilletkeep warm. Add 1 teaspoon cornstarch to skilletcook 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in green pepper and onioncook 1 minute or until crisp-tender. Add tomatoescook 1 minute. Stir in pork. Serve over rice.
Brown beef in canola oil. Add water and soy sauce. Bring to boil. Add broccoli, water chestnuts and maggi seasoning. Cook until tender. Serve over rice and garnish with green onion.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook about 1 minute or until fragrant. Add tomatoes and cook about 3 minutes or until the tomatoes are very soft. Stir in the chili-ready tomatoes. Add the cayenne pepper and garlic salt. Bring the mixture to a boil. Stir in the tuna fish. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Add the beans. Cook 5 minutes or until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Cream together butter and Splenda with a hand mixer. Add in the eggs one at a time mixing well after each addition. Add the vanilla flavoring and mix well. In a medium bowl sift together the almond flour and baking soda. Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture alternately with the milk, beginning with the flour mixture and ending with the flour mixture. Stir in the mini chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto a non-stick or parchment-lined baking sheet 2 inches apart. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Remove from the oven and allow the cookies to cool for a few minutes before removing from the cookie sheet. Store in an air tight container.

Salt and pepper the chicken breasts and place them into the crockpot. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir together well. Cook on low for 6 hours or high for 3 hours. Remove chicken breasts from the crockpot and place them into a bowl. Add 1/3 cup of the cooking liquid from the crockpot to the bowl with the chicken and mix together well. Serve over rice with guacamole.

In a large skillet cook the ground beef and onion until brown. Drain. Stir in oregano and chili powder. Add the tomatoes and beans and salt and simmer until tender. Add the ravioli. Cover and cook until tender. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Grease and flour 8-inch loaf pan. Cream together margarine and sugar. Beat in egg. Combine flour and baking powderadd to creamed mixture alternately with milk. Stir in bananas. Pour into pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Remove from pan and cool.

Cook the noodles according to the package instructions. Cook sausage in medium-sized skillet until done. Strain excess fat from skillet. Add onion and saute until onion is tender. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add spinach. Drain well. Blend soup with tarragon and marjoram. Combine all ingredients and pour into a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with Ricotta Cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.

Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F. Wash and trim the beets. Cut them into wedges and place them in a baking pan. Pour the vinegar over the beets and cover the pan. Bake the beets for 45 minutes. Add the vinegar and sugar and stir well. Add the spices and mix well. Store in a sealed jar.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. With a sharp knife, cut a small circle from the bottom of the peppers and remove the stem and seeds. Place peppers on a baking sheet and roast for 30 minutes or until the peppers are soft and the skin is blackened. Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly. Gently remove the peppers from their skins and chop into small pieces. In a large bowl combine the chopped red peppers, garlic, oil, vinegar, salt and pepper. Toss well and then transfer to a serving platter and sprinkle with the capers and basil before serving. Serves 4 as a side dish or 2 as an appetizer.

In a small bowl combine the bread crumbs, almonds, garlic powder and seasoning. In a separate bowl whisk together the egg whites and water and place in a shallow bowl. In a third shallow bowl add the soy sauce and dijon mustard. Dip each pork tenderloin in the egg whites, then the almond crumbs, then in the soy sauce/dijon mixture and place in a baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes or until the internal temperature is 145 degrees fahrenheit. While the pork is baking, make the sauce by placing the honey in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Add the soy sauce and dijon mustard and whisk until completely combined. Serve the pork over a bed of rice and drizzle the honey dijon sauce over the top of the pork.

Preheat oven to 400. In a shallow dish, combine sour cream and Tabasco Sauce. Sprinkle with celery salt and pepper. Place chicken in a greased 15x10x1-in. baking dish. Spoon about 1/4 cup sauce over each breast. Bake 30-35 minutes or until no pink remains in thickest part of chicken. Yield 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Heat a heavy nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Place the pork chops in a single layer in the pan. Cook until browned on both sides. Combine all the remaining ingredients except the lime. Spoon the chili mixture over the pork chops. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Squeeze the lime juice over the pork chops to taste. Serve warm. Serving.

In large mixing bowl cream together margarine, shortening and sugar till smooth. Beat in milk and vanilla extract. Beat until smooth. Add flour 1 cup at a time and mix until smooth. Spread between layers and on top and sides of cake. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a loaf pan or line with parchment paper. In a large bowl, beat butter until creamy. Beat in the banana slices with the sugar and eggsblend well. In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to banana mixtureblend well. Stir in buttermilk until smooth. Fold in walnuts. Pour batter into prepared loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 60 minutes, or until a skewer inserted in the center of the loaf comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Cut baguettes in half. Spread olive oil on cut side. Sprinkle on fig jam. Spread neufchatel on other half. Place prosciutto on top of jam. Sprinkle fresh ground pepper on top. Serve.

Mix yeast, 1/4 cup water and apple sauce. Let stand 5 minutes. Mix in 1 cup water and remaining ingredients. Knead until smooth. Place in greased bowl. Cover. Let rise in warm place until double in bulk. Roll into four loaves. Place in greased 8 by 8 by 2-inch pans. Cover. Let rise until doubled. Bake at 375f for 25 minutes. Makes four loaves.

In a large bowl, combine ham, cheddar cheese, green onions and apple. Stir together milk and eggs. Pour over ham mixture. Stir together Bisquick and pepper. Sprinkle over ham mixture. Dot with butter. Bake at 350f for 30-35 minutes or until center is set. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.

Dice green chilies and combine with cream of mushroom soup and sour cream. Place in a baking dish and arrange the chicken breasts over the top. Sprinkle with cheese and bake at 350 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes. Serve over rice and garnish with cheese.

Preheat grill to 400 degrees. Brush chicken with oil. Grill chicken 3 minutes. Flip over and cook 3 minutes more. Brush with oil again and grill until done. Cut into 1/2-inch strips. Toss lettuce, cheese and nuts in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk vinegar with salt and pepper. Add oil in a slow stream. Add basil and whisk until dressing is smooth. Toss with chicken. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Mix cottage cheese, beef, egg and seasonings until well blended. Form into a loaf and roll in minced onion. Place in a greased 8x4x3 loaf pan and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Topping: Mix remaining ingredients until smooth. Pour over meatloaf. Bake an additional 15 minutes. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Serve.
Peel and boil potatoes. Remove from heat and add margarine and skim milk. Mash. Season with salt and pepper. Add parsley, scallions and thyme.

Combine all the filling ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat until chocolate is melted. Remove from heat and let cool 10 minutes. Pour half of the mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch pie dish and place cherry pie filling in the center, spreading it out to form a ring (see photo). Pour the remaining filling over the top of the cherry ring and spread to form a smooth surface. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator to set for 30 minutes or until firm. Just before serving, whip the cool whip to stiff peak form and spread over the top of the filling to decorate the top of the pie. Decorate with a maraschino cherry if desired. Serve cold.

Beat cream cheese with butter and sour cream until smooth. Blend in vanilla. Gradually stir in powdered sugar until well blended. Add golden raisins and nuts if desired. Chill until serving time. Makes 4 cups. Serve with sliced bread, or as a dip with crudités, pita chips or vegetables.

Combine all ingredients in a large sauce pan. Cook over medium heat until it comes to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring constantly for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Pour into 9 inch pie pan. Cool. Refrigerate. Serve cold.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add chops. Brown on both sides about 4 minutes per side. Remove chops from skillet. Add onions, bouillon cube and water to the skillet, bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low add chops, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over rice.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add flour and salt and stir until a roux forms. Slowly stir in milk to make a smooth sauce. Add cream cheese and stir until melted. Add swiss cheese. Mix well. Spray a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray. Layer half of potatoes in dish. Cover with half the sauce. Top with half the broccoli. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake another 15 minutes. Serve.
Mix all ingredients and form meatballs. Fry in 2 inches of hot oil. Drain and serve with greek yogurt and tomato sauce.

Combine ground beef with the mushrooms, bacon and green onionsmix well. Season with Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce and salt and pepper. Divide beef into 4 equal portions and shape into patties. Cook on a grill or on an ungreased grill pan for about 3 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Place beef patties on the hamburger buns. Top each with cheese slice and serve.

Mix the crust ingredients together and press into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Beat the filling ingredients together and pour into the crust. Bake for 30-40 minutes at 350 degrees F. Remove from oven and cool. Cut and serve.

Preheat the broiler and line a large baking sheet with foil. In a small saucepan combine the jam, vinegar, soy sauce and 1/4 cup water. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until the mixture thickens enough to coat a spoon, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool completely. Meanwhile, cut the chicken into 1-inch chunks. Thread the chicken, plums, onion slices and almonds onto skewers and place on the baking sheet. Brush with the marinade and broil the kebabs for 4-5 minutes on each side until the chicken is cooked through, turning once. Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter with the remaining oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the couscous and cook, stirring constantly, until golden brown and lightly toasted, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of the butter to the pan along with the lemon juice. Cook for 1 minute or until the sauce is heated through. Toss with the

In a large bowl combine almonds, walnuts, baking powder, and salt. Stir in xylitol sweetener. In a separate bowl beat eggs and butter. Add xylitol mixture and stir. Fold in blueberries. Pour batter into paper lined muffin tins. Bake at 375 for 15-20 minutes or until a knife comes out clean. Cool on wire racks. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a large baking sheet with waxed paper. Put marshmallow cream into a microwave safe bowl and microwave for about 2 minutes or until melted and smooth. Stir in the peanut butter until smooth and well blended. Spread the mixture onto the Ritz crackers until they are covered. Bake for about 8 minutes or until the mixture is puffed and the edges are slightly browned. Remove from the oven and immediately sprinkle with the chocolate chips and the flaked coconut. Cool on the baking sheet until firm, about 30 minutes. Store in an airtight container at room temperature. Makes about 4 dozen

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Peel and slice potatoes 1/8-inch thick. Soak in ice water for 1 minute. Dry and place in a single layer on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with seasoning. Roast for 25 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. Mix together parsley, parmesan and garlic and sprinkle over fries. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. Butter muffin cups or line muffin tins with paper baking cups. In a large bowl, cream butter with brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg until well mixed. Stir in oatmeal. Combine flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamonstir well. Stir into oatmeal mixture just until combined. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups filling each cup 2/3 full. Bake for 18-20 minutes, until toothpick inserted into center of muffin comes out clean. Cool on racks for 5 minutes before removing from pan to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

Melt Velveeta with milk and cayenne pepper in microwave until smooth. Add paprika and stir well. Slice lobster tails and add them to the sauce. Add in chopped sweet red pepper and fresh parsley. Serve with french bread and enjoy!

Combine sake, soy and mirin in saucepan and heat until boiling. Add ginger and spring onions. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add chicken wings and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove and cool. To make glaze: combine mirin and soy and heat until boiling. Add chicken wings and coat well. Allow to cool. Serve with steamed rice and lemon.

Peel and core apples. Cut into 1/2 inch wedges. Combine apples and water in a large saucepan. Heat to boiling over medium heat. Reduce heat. Simmer 1 hour. Cool. Combine sugar, molasses, apple juice and spices in a small bowl. Add to apples and stir until well blended. Return to saucepan. Cook over medium heat to desired thickness. Pour into hot sterilized jars. Seal. Makes about 4 cups.

Melt butter in medium saucepan over low heat. Add sugar, stirring until butter is melted and sugar is dissolved. Increase heat to medium and continue cooking, stirring constantly for 2 minutes or until mixture starts to boil and turns amber in color. Add almonds and stir constantly for 1 minute or until almonds are coated in caramel and turn a light golden brown color. Remove from heat and stir in sesame seeds. Let caramel mixture cool to room temperature and spread evenly over 12-inch square baking pan or any pan lined with foil or parchment paper. Melt chocolate in microwave for about 2 minutes or until smooth and shiny, stirring every 30 seconds. Spread evenly over caramel. Let stand at room temperature until chocolate is firm. Cut into squares with a sharp knife or break apart with your hands.

Beat the cream cheese in a stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment until smooth and creamy. Add in eggs and beat for 2 minutes until light and fluffy. Add in vanilla and honey and mix well. Add in flour and mix just until combined. In a separate bowl combine milk and baking powder and mix well. Add milk mixture to cream cheese mixture and beat for 2 more minutes until smooth. Pour into a greased 9-inch square pan. Bake in a preheated oven to 350f for about 35 minutes or until puffed and golden brown. Cool before cutting into squares and dusting with powdered sugar.

Cut celery into 2 inch pieces. Combine celery with 3 cups water and 2 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan. Bring to a boilcover and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from the heat. Puree in a blender or food processor until smooth. Return the mixture to the pan. Combine the flour and milk with the 1/2 cup remaining butter and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until the mixture thickens and boils. Reduce heat and simmer 1 minute. Add the celery mixture and 1/2 teaspoon peppercook and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with peanut butter.

Preheat the oven to 350. In a large skillet over medium heat, add the olive oil. Add the onion and cook until it is soft. Add the carrot and cook until soft. Add the dry sherry and let evaporate. Add the tomato. Add the veal chops and brown on both sides. Add the mushrooms and green pepper. Cook until the veal is done and the vegetables are tender. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Serves 4.

Mix soy sauce with ginger, cornstarch, sugar, vinegar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add mustard and ginger root and boil 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Pour half of this mixture into crock pot. Put ribs into crockpot. Add remaining marinade to crockpot. Cover. Cook 6-8 hours or until ribs are tender. Remove ribs to platter. Stir up liquid. Return ribs to crockpot to keep warm. Serve with rice.

Place a large skillet over medium heat. Place chicken breasts in skillet. Cook chicken breasts for about 5 minutes per side. Turn chicken breasts over and cook for another 5 to 8 minutes. Turn chicken breasts over. Cook for another 5 minutes per side. Remove chicken breasts from heat. Sprinkle with paprika and season with salt and cinnamon. Set aside. In medium bowl combine syrup, mustard, and butter. Brush mixture over chicken breasts. Place chicken breasts back on heat. Cook over medium heat until mixture forms a glaze. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease baking sheet. In a mixing bowl, combine molasses, brown sugar, cider vinegar, and eggs. Beat well. Combine dry ingredients. Add to molasses mixture. Stir well. Drop by teaspoons onto greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool.

Melt butter in a small skillet over medium high heat. Add steak seasoning and stir until evenly coated. Remove from heat and add dried parsley flakes and dried thyme. Cut fillets into serving-size pieces and coat with seasoned butter. Arrange fillets on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 375f for 10 minutes. Flip and bake an additional 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet brown ground beef and onion over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Add garlic and barbecue saucestir to combine. Drain cooked macaronistir into beef mixture. Pour into 1-1/2-quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Sprinkle with pepper and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Makes 4 servings.
Brown cube steaks in hot butter. Add black pepper. Deglaze with water. Add lemon juice and worcestershire sauce. Bring to boil. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Preheat oven to 400f. Remove stem end from brussels sprouts then halve each. In a large bowl combine sprouts, thyme, oregano and 1/2 teaspoon of each pepper. Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add pine nuts and saute 2 minutes. Spread nuts out on a plate. Add sprouts to skillet and saute 2 minutes. Transfer sprouts to a large baking dish. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle nuts over sprouts. Bake for 25-30 minutes until sprouts are tender. Drizzle with additional oil if desired.

Heat the coconut milk in a large non stick pan. Add the green curry paste & cook for about 2 minutes. Add the chicken breast and cook until just cooked through. Add the eggplant and cook for a few minutes more. Add the kaffir lime leaves, fish sauce, sugar, sweet basil & hot chili. Stir well. Taste & adjust seasoning with more sugar if you want it sweeter. Serve over steamed jasmine rice.

Combine all dry ingredients except raisins and peanut butter in large mixing bowl. Pour honey over dry ingredients and stir until well coated and mixture begins to clump. Add raisins and peanut butter and stir again until well blended. Put into wax paper lined pan and pat into desired shape, pressing firmly to shape well. Refrigerate for one hour and then cut into desired size nuggets.

Slice pineapple into bite size pieces. Mix together honey and passion fruit. Pour over pineapple and stir until coated well. Chill and serve cold. Top with dark rum. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, beat together peanut butter and butter until smooth and creamy. Stir in brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla until well blended. Sift together flour, baking powder and saltstir into peanut butter mixture until just mixed. Spread into prepared baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle chocolate chips evenly over the top of the unbaked brownie batter. Return brownie batter to the oven and bake until chips are melted and the top is light golden brown, about 15 minutes. Let cool before cutting into bars. Store in an airtight container.

Soak the casings in water for 30 minutes. In a large mixing bowl combine the cheddar cheese, buttermilk and sage. In a separate bowl combine the ground pork with the remaining ingredients and mix until well blended. Add the sage and cheese mixture and blend. Stuff into casings and twist off. Refrigerate overnight. In a large skillet heat the olive oil until hot and add the sausage links. Cook until brown and then flip and brown the other side. Serve with mustard and sauerkraut.

Peel the sweet potatoes and parsnips. Cut into 1-inch cubes. Place in a pot of boiling salted water. Cook until tender. Drain. Mash in a bowl with butter, milk and nutmeg. Add chives. Season to taste.

Prepare a large pot of boiling water. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine carrots and watercook 30 minutes or until carrots are tender. Drain wellreserve 3 cups of cooking liquid. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine carrots, water, raisins, butter, brown sugar, cayenne pepper and saltbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer, uncovered, 5 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Stir in reserved liquid. Remove from heatstir in nutmeg. Serve warm.

In small bowl combine cream cheese and sugars until smooth. Stir in crushed pineapple, yogurt, nuts and milk or water. Chill until ready to serve. For individual servings, pour mixture into lined muffin tins. Freeze for about two hours, or until set. Garnish with additional pecans, if desired.

Heat butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add the leeks and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally until leeks are wilted and lightly browned. Stir in the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the heavy cream. Heat until just bubbling. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with a little more grated cheese and serve.
