Grease 9x13 pan. Line with bread cubes. Beat cream cheese, eggs and half and half. Stir in maple syrup and spices. Pour over bread and bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve with fruit.

Cut the tomato in half and scoop out the seeds and juice into a large bowl. Add the onion and basil. Slice the tomato into wedges. Toss the tomatoes, onion and basil with the olive oil, vinegar and salt and pepper. Arrange the slices of goat cheese on a serving plate. Top with the salad and serve.

Drain ground beef of fat. Mix in remaining ingredients except cheese and peppers. Form into four hamburger patties. Grill hamburgers over medium heat until done to taste. Top each hamburger with a slice of roasted red pepper and portabella mushroom. Top with blue cheese. Serve on buns with lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, red onion, honey mustard or ketchup if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Combine Bisquick mix and low-fat buttermilk in a large bowl. Stir until a soft dough forms. Turn the mixture out onto a lightly floured surface, knead the mixture until smooth and pliable. Divide the mixture into 20 balls, roll each ball into a 3 inch round, then flatten slightly into a 2-inch round. Place 4 biscuit rounds in each of 4 greased muffin cups. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Let cool 15 minutes before serving. Serves 4.

Steam brussels sprouts and set aside. In a large skillet or wok heat oil and onions. Cook onions until tender. Add soy sauce and fresh ginger and cook for about a minute. Add the brussels sprouts and sesame oil. Toss to coat and cook for another minute. Serve hot. Serves 2 as a side dish.

Heat oil in medium pot over medium-high heat. Add onions and garlic and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add orzo and cook according to package directions. When pasta is about done add parmigiano and stir until combined. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and serve with grated parmigiano sprinkled over top.

Combine all ingredients except for the lemon juice. Place the seasoned chicken breast halves in the skillet. Cook for 30 to 40 minutes or until the chicken is browned and tender. Add lemon juice. Stir and remove from heat. Serve over cooked rice or pasta.

Cook broccoli in boiling water to cover 10 minutes or until tender crisp. Drainplace broccoli in a large bowl. Combine broccoli with remaining ingredientstoss gently. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate. Makes 4 servings.

Blend egg yolks with sugar until light and fluffy. Add cocoa, cornstarch and salt. Stir together. Add milk gradually while stirring constantly. Stir in vanilla. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Pour into prepared pie shell. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool completely before topping. Melt chocolate chips with butter. Spread over top and sides of pie. Cool before serving. Serve with whipped topping or vanilla ice cream.

In a large skillet, cook onion in butter over medium heat until onion is softened. Stir in sauerkraut and 3/4 cup water. Cover and cook over medium heat for 10 to 12 minutes. Uncover and add remaining 1/2 cup water and apples. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 20 to 30 minutes or until apples are tender. Remove from heat and stir in wine. Return to heat and simmer until liquid is almost evaporated. Stir in stock and brown sugar and simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and garnish with celery seed. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425f. Wash red peppers and cut into halves lengthwise, removing seeds and veins, and placing face down on a cookie sheet coated with cooking spray. Roast red peppers until blackened and softened, about 25-40 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool. Place the red peppers in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Peel the skins off the peppers and then dice them up into small pieces. Place the red peppers in a medium size saucepan and add in the whipping cream and italian dressing and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened, about 15 minutes or so. Stir in the fresh basil and season with salt and pepper to taste. Drain and rinse the fettuccine. Put the fettuccine in a medium size saucepan with about a tablespoon of water. Cover and cook for about 2 minutes until al dente. Drain the fettuccine and place in a large serving bowl. Add in the roasted red pepper sauce and toss

Mix together graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press firmly into an ungreased 8x8x2-inch baking pan. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Melt chocolate chips. Stir in butterscotch chips. Spread over baked crust. Sprinkle with walnuts. Cool completely. Cut into bars.

Mix together jiffy mix, milk, and egg until well blended. Divide mixture into paper-lined muffin tins. Bake at 375 for 18 minutes or until muffins are lightly browned and center is set. Remove from tins and set on cooling rack. Spread top of muffin with mustard and sprinkle with swiss cheese and ham. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 12.

Bake cookies according to package directions. Cool. Cream together frosting and water until blended. Dip tops of cookies into frosting mixture. Sprinkle with nuts and chocolate chips. Refrigerate until set.

Trim ends off zucchini. Cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch slices. Place zucchini slices in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine olive oil, garlic, salt & pepper. Pour dressing over zucchinitoss to coat. Divide zucchini among four plates. Top each serving with a slice of ham. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Add golden syrup and egg yolk and mix well. Beat egg white until stiff and fold into mixture. Stir in flour and ground ginger and mix until smooth. Roll out dough and cut into rounds and place on prepared cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for about 15-20 minutes.

In large bowl combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Using pastry blender or fork cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in cheese and cream cheese. Gradually add milk, stirring until soft dough forms. Turn onto lightly floured surface and knead about 1 minute or until dough is smooth. Roll dough into ball and place on lightly floured surface. Roll out dough about 1/2-inch thick. Cut into circles with 2-inch round cutter. Place about 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 425 degrees for 12-14 minutes or until golden brown and done in center. Yields about 18 biscuits.

Cut butternut squash into 1/4-inch thick slices and place them in a large pot with the butter and onion. Cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until onion is soft and golden brown. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add cream and thyme leaves and bring just to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes or until squash is very tender and the cream has reduced and thickened slightly. Serve hot.

In a heavy saucepan combine sugar, milk and cream. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil over medium high heat. Add zest and cook for one minute longer. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes. Add lemon juice and salt to milk mixture. Cover container with plastic wrap or a lid and refrigerate overnight. Freeze for 6 hours or overnight. Serve with additional lemon zest for garnish.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Unroll pastry crust. Roll out to fit a 9 inch pie pan. Prick crust with a fork. Bake for 12 minutes. Cool completely. Spread blueberry ice cream in pie crust. Spoon strawberry ice cream over blueberry ice cream. Top with strawberries. Top with blueberries. Top with sweetened whipped cream. Makes 6 servings.

In a food processor or blender, combine all ingredients except bread. Puree until smooth. Cut bread into 4-inch diagonal slices. Spread each slice with a quarter of cream cheese mixture. Top with sliced radishes and serve at once. Makes 4 sandwiches.
Pour vodka, triple sec and melon liqueur into a highball glass. Fill with ice. Top with limeade. Stir. Garnish with a lime slice.

Put all but the raspberries in a large stockpot. Cook over medium heat until hot. Add the raspberries. Let simmer for 20 minutes. Strain and cool. Add brandy to taste. Serve in large punch bowl or individual punch glasses. Garnish with fresh ginger or sliced apples.

Steam asparagus for about 3 to 5 minutes, or until tender. Cut off tough ends of asparagus. Chop into 1-inch pieces. In a large pot, saute asparagus in onion and garlic for about 5 minutes. Add vegetable broth. Bring to a boil. In a small bowl, whisk together flour and soy milk. Add to soup and stir until thickened. Add soy sauce. Add basil. Taste for seasoning. Serves 6.

In a 9 X 13-inch casserole dish or baking pan, melt the butter. Add the onions and brown sugar. Cook for 5 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Add meatballs to the pan. Pour the mushroom beef gravy over the meatballs. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Mix cream cheese, mayonnaise and green chilies in a medium bowl with a fork until smooth. Fold in jalapeno peppers and 3 cups of the Mexican blend cheese and mozzarella cheese. In small bowl combine the Panko breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheesespoon over cream cheese mixture and stir until well combined and thoroughly coated. Spread into a 8-inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray and sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup of the Mexican blend cheese and the parmesan cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until lightly golden and the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips.

Peel the shrimp and cut into bite size pieces. Add the red onion, garlic cloves, fresh mint, lime juice, salt, and pepper to the shrimp and toss to combine well. Refrigerate for about 30 minutes to blend the flavors. Cut the baguettes into 1/2 inch slices and serve with the mojito ceviche on the side for dipping. Dip the baguette slices into the mojito ceviche mixture. Drizzle the extra virgin olive oil on top to serve.

In a large plastic bag combine buttermilk, mustard, honey, rosemary, thyme and sage. Add chicken breasts and turn to coat. Refrigerate overnight or at least 4 hours. Remove chicken from marinade and grill or bake. Serve with salad, or as a sandwich. Makes 4 servings.

Place butter pound cake cubes in the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate. Layer with sliced bananas. Follow with the fresh sliced strawberries. In a small bowl combine the pudding mix with low-fat milk. Mix well until smooth and thick. Pour over banana and strawberry mixture. Refrigerate for one hour. Spread with sugar-free cool whip. Garnish with additional sliced strawberries or fresh banana slices.

In a large saucepan, combine sugar, light brown sugar and salt and bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir constantly and cook until sugar is amber colored (about 7 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in corn syrup and evaporated milk. Return to medium heat and cook until mixture bubbles and comes to a boil again. Add butter and vanilla and stir until butter is melted. Continue cooking until mixture comes to a boil and reaches 240 degrees on a candy thermometer (about 10 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in nuts. Let mixture stand until cool enough to handle (about 10 minutes). Drop pralines by spoonfuls onto wax paper and let stand until cool and firm (about 1 hour). Store in an airtight container at room temperature.

Soak black beans overnight. Drain. Put beans, garbanzo beans, green onion, tomatoes, parsley & lemon juice & puree into large salad bowl. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt & fresh ground pepper. Mix well. Chill at least 1 hour before serving. Yields 4-6 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine pancake mix with sugar. Blend in milk and stir until smooth. Spread half of batter in greased 7x11-in. Pan. Top with apples. Spread remaining batter over apples. Bake 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into bars.

Remove corn husks and silks and rinse thoroughly. Place corn in a large pot of rapidly boiling water. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until the corn is tender but still crisp. Drain and let cool. In a small bowl combine the lime zest, juice, cayenne pepper and salt. In a small bowl combine the lime zest, juice, cayenne pepper and salt. Brush corn with the mixture. Broil 6 inches from the heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until the corn is nicely browned. Remove from the oven and serve.

Cut jalapeno peppers into 1/2 -inch pieces. Heat large skillet over medium heat. Place 1 jalapeno half into each piece of sourdough bread and spread with about 1/2 teaspoon of cream cheese. Sprinkle 1/2 of the colby-monterey jack cheese over the jalapeno pieces. Top each sandwich with remaining pieces of sourdough bread. Butter the outsides of the sandwichesgrill sandwiches 3 - 4 minutes per side or until toasted and the cheese is melted. Cut the sandwiches into 4 pieces each. Serve sandwiches topped with tortilla chips and a drizzle of salsa.
Saute carrots in butter until crisp tender. Remove from heat. Add garlic chives. Drizzle with apple juice. Garnish with toasted almonds.

Heat the stock and add the lavender and cook for a few minutes. Poach the chicken breasts in this stock for about 8 minutes. Remove and shred the chicken with your fingers. Melt the butter in a saucepan and add the shallot and cornflour. Cook until the mixture thickens. Add the stock, creme fraiche and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Add the shredded chicken and heat through. Add a sprig of lavender. Garnish with the flower. Serve with rice.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium high heat. Add almonds and saute for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly until almonds are lightly browned and coated with butter mixture. Add Cajun seasoning and sea salt and stir to combine. Remove from heat and cool completely. Stir in dried cranberries. Spread on a foil lined cookie sheet and chill until firm and crisp, about an hour. Break into pieces and serve or store in an airtight container for up to a week.

Mix together flour, salt and stevia in a large bowl. Cream together butter and vanilla extract. Beat in egg. Gradually beat into flour mixture. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes. Makes 4 dozen 2-inch cookies.

Bring the oatmeal to the boil with the water or milk and honey. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the oatmeal has softened but not disintegrated. Meanwhile, place the raspberries in the bowl with the sugar and stir to mix thoroughly. Cool the oatmeal to room temperature before stirring into the raspberry mixture, mixing well to combine the two. Stir in the double cream and the scotch whisky to taste. Serve very cold with cream or custard.

Melt margarine in a 3-quart casserole. Blend in soup. Stir in milk. Cook over low heat until heated through. Add wine and mix. Remove from heat. Arrange the bread cubes in the bottom of the casserole. Top with the chicken. Sprinkle with almonds. Pour the cream of mushroom mixture over all. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes.

Combine avocado, cucumber, yogurt, lime juice and salt in food processor until smooth. Chill until ready to serve. Divide shrimp between 4 bowls, top each with 2 Tbsp of soup and a sprinkling of green onions.
Preheat oven to 425f. Spray shallow baking pan with cooking spray. Toss garlic with asparagus in oil and sprinkle with thyme. Roast 10 minutes.

Combine all ingredients except oil and breadcrumbs in a large bowl. Mix well with hands until just combined. Form into 4 patties (about 3/4 inch thick). Coat patties with cooking spray and place on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes per side or until golden brown and firm to the touch. Serve on toasted hamburger buns with lettuce tomato and tartar sauce. Serve with french fries.

Wash blueberries. Crush about one-third of the berries in a large stainless-steel bowl. Stir in sugar and lemon juice. Stir in lemon juice. Pour mixture back into stainless-steel bowl. Set aside. Stir in lemon juice. Pour mixture back into stainless-steel bowl. Set aside. Pour mixture back into stainless-steel bowl. Set aside. Add lemon juice. Stir in lemon juice. Pour mixture back into stainless-steel bowl. Set aside. Add lemon juice. Stir in lemon juice. Pour mixture back into stainless-steel bowl. Set aside. Add liquid pectin. Stir in liquid pectin. Pour mixture back into stainless-steel bowl. Set aside. Add lemon juice. Stir in lemon juice. Pour mixture back into stainless-steel bowl. Set aside. Add lemon juice. Stir in lemon juice. Pour mixture back into stainless-steel bowl. Set aside. Add lemon ju

Heat oven to 400f. Melt 1 tbsp. butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and saute until caramelized and golden brown. Add teriyaki sauce. Stir until heated through. Place 3 slices french bread in each of 6 shallow 2-cup serving bowls. Top with onion mixture. Sprinkle each serving with 1/3 cup swiss cheese and 1/3 cup provolone cheese and 1/3 muenster cheese. Pour 1 can beef broth over each serving. Bake uncovered 5 minutes or until golden and bubbly.

In a large saucepan cook onion in butter until tender. Stir in mushroom soup and water. Bring just to a boil. Add broccoli and cook 3-4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain, reserving liquid. In a medium skillet cook chestnuts in butter until golden. Set aside. In a large bowl combine broccoli and chestnuts. Stir in cheese. In a small saucepan combine broccoli liquid and ricecook on low heat until tender. Stir in cheese and chestnuts. In a shallow dish combine crumbs and butter. Spread mixture over top of broccoli mixture. Bake at 325 degrees for about 20 minutes or until hot and crumbs are lightly browned. Let stand for 10 minutes. Makes 6 servings. Serve with your favorite salad.

Preheat oven to 350F. Mix soy sauce and honey in small bowl. Place chicken in large resealable plastic bag or glass dish. Add soy mixture and marinate in refrigerator 30 minutes. Heat oven to 450F. Remove chicken from marinade and place chicken in single layer in 15X10X1 inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 450 for 20 minutes or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced with knife in thickest part. Meanwhile combine lime juice and next 4 ingredients in small bowl stirring with whisk until smooth. Serve chicken with lime glaze

Mix dry ingredients together first (flour, sugar, baking powder, salt). Cream together bananas with sugar and add eggs, melted butter, and vanilla. Stir in dry ingredients until thoroughly mixed. Fold in walnuts lastly. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit in a loaf pan for about 60 - 70 minutes or until golden brown on top and toothpick inserted comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a bundt pan. Mix together cake mix, pudding mix, oil, sherry, eggs, nutmeg, and cinnamon until smooth (batter will be thin). Pour into bundt pan. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until toothpick comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. In a small bowl, mix powdered sugar with milk until smooth (dip or drizzle). Drizzle over cake. Yields 8-10 servings.
Puree yogurt, vanilla bean, and 2 cups sugar in a blender until very smooth. Place yogurt in a large bowl. Add melon, berries, dates, and chocolate chips. Serve cold.

In a large skillet, add olive oil and 1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt. Add broccoli florets and saute for 1-2 minutes or until lightly golden brown. Add 1/2 cup of water and cover. Cook until broccoli is tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Place salmon fillets skin side down on a clean piece of aluminum foil. Sprinkle with cajun seasoning. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 10 minutes or until the fish is cooked through. Serve with broccoli and lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl until blended well. Pour into a greased 8 or 9 inch square baking pan. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Serve at room temperature with butter or whipped topping.

In a food processor combine the sausage meat, spring onions, minced meat and pineapple. Season with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Add the herbs and pulse to combine. Form into 8 sausage patties. Heat oil in a frying pan. Add patties and cook for about 3 minutes each side until browned and cooked through. Remove from pan and drain on paper towel. Serve in a sandwich or on toast.

Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt into a large mixing bowl. Beat together the eggs with the milk and lard. Make a well in the center of the flour mixture. Add the lard mixture. Mix gently until all of the dry ingredients are moistened. Add the melted butter. Beat vigorously until the batter is smooth and well blended. Bake in a preheated waffle iron. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serves 4.

Mix lemon gelatin and boiling water until dissolved. Add sugar-free drink mix and beat until well-blended. Fold in whipped toppingpour into crust-lined pan. Refrigerate until firm. Spread whipped topping on top of pie. Garnish with sugar-free raspberry gelatin and whipped topping. Refrigerate for at least one hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a large bowl toss carrots with butter, orange juice concentrate and parsley. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and orange juice concentrate. Spoon over carrots. Bake for 15 minutes or until tender. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line muffin cups with paper baking cups. Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Cut in the shortening with a pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse meal. Combine maple syrup and egg in small bowl. Stir the syrup mixture into the dry ingredients until just combined. Stir in the raisins. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 20 to 22 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Combine confectioners' sugar and milk in small bowl. Spoon over muffins and serve warm.

In a small bowl combine creamy peanut butter, sugar and egg with a fork until well combined. Mix in vanilla. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes in a 375f oven. Cool for a minute before removing to wire rack to cool. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Brew a cup of very strong coffee. Add a shot of Kahlua and a shot of Vanilla Vodka. Fill a glass with ice. Add 1/2 milk and 1/2 heavy cream. Add a few drops of Coco for color. Serve with a straw and stir.

In a bowl, combine shrimp, lemon juice, wine, garlic, pepper, and steak sauce. Thread shrimp onto skewers. Spray grill rack with cooking spray. Grill 4-5 minutes on each side or until shrimp turn pink, basting frequently with sauce. Serve immediately. Makes 12 kebabs (3/4 inch thick).

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and onions. Cook until potatoes are tender and onions are clear. Add tomatoes and peppers and cook for about two minutes. Season with basil garlic oregano salt pepper and parsley. Serve.

Heat the oil in a saucepan and gently fry the onions for 2 minutes, add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the anchovies and stir until the onions are tender and lightly caramelised. Take off the heat and spread on the base of a 20cm tart tin. Arrange the tomato slices on top. Drain the olives and scatter over the tart. Make the pastry. Brush the edges with a little beaten egg. Roll out the pastry and place over the top. Brush the top with the beaten egg and sprinkle with the breadcrumbs. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 C/ Gas 4 for 40-50 minutes until golden and crisp.

Preheat oven to 350F. Line two 20x30cm trays with baking paper. Combine caster sugar and butter. Mix eggs into mixture. Fold in flour and chocolate. Pour mixture into trays and bake for 20-25 minutes. Cool and cut into squares. Melt baking chocolate over low heat. Spread chocolate over top of cake. Sprinkle with chocolate chips.
Combine oil, Worcestershire, garlic and herbs in a blender or food processor. Process until smooth. Pour mixture over meat. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before grilling.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. Arrange pork chops in single layer on baking sheet. In a small bowl combine black pepper and onion. Rub onto chops. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add chopscook for 2 minutes or until browned on one side. Turn chops and cook for 1 minute on other side. Remove chops from skillet. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil to skilletheat over medium-high heat. Add onion mixturecook and stir for 1 minute or until onion is crisp-tender. Add rice noodlesstir-fry for 1 minute or until noodles are coated. Return chops to skilletstir-fry for 1 minute or until thoroughly heated. Remove from heat. Divide noodles among four serving platestop evenly with chops. Garnish with green onions if desired. Serve immediately with cabbage, soy sauce and egg on the side.
Toast the english muffins lightly. Spread the muffins with miracle whip light, then add the bacon crumbles, red onions, tomato, fresh basil and sea salt to taste. Garnish with fresh basil

Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Sprinkle flank steak with salt and pepper. Sear flank steak about 2 minutes per side until browned. Remove to plate. Add garlic to skillet and cook 1 minute. Stir in vinegar, dry mustard, worcestershire sauce, cayenne and tabasco sauce. Stir until mixture thickens. Return steak to skillet. Add liquid to sides of skillet. Cook 1 more minute until liquid is reduced. Slice steak across the grain. Serve. Serve with hot cooked rice.

Sprinkle pork chops with pepper and salt. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook for about three minutes on each side, or until browned. Remove pork from the pan and set aside. Add carrots and onion to the pan and saute for three minutes. Add garlic and saute for about one minute. Add wine and scrape the pan bottom. Add broth and tomatoes and bring the liquid to a boil. Return the pork chops to the pan. Add mushrooms and simmer for three minutes. Add celery ribs and cook for one minute longer. Serve hot.

In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over high heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the broccoli and cook for about 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Add the cauliflower and cook for 1 minute or until crisp-tender. Add the mushrooms and cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Brown onion and bell pepper. Add cream of mushroom and celery soups. Add rotel and shrimp. Cook until thickened. Serve over white rice.

Preheat oven to 350f. Melt the butter in a 1 1/2-quart casserole over low heatstir in onion and cook for 30 seconds. Add tomatoes with liquid, chilies with their liquid, spinach (do not drain), and 1 1/2 cups of the cheesemix well. Bake uncovered for 10 minutesstir in half-and-half, vinegar, and remaining 1/2 cup of cheese. Bake 10 more minutes until lightly browned on top. Serve with chips or raw vegetables.

Put the blueberries, sugar, lemon slices, and cinnamon stick into a small saucepan. Cover with cold water and let stand 1 hour. Heat over medium-high heat until blueberries break upcrush any remaining whole berries with a potato masher. Bring to a boilreduce heat to low and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in the lemon juicecook for 1 minute longer. Ladle soup into 6 bowlsadd a lemon wedge and a dollop of yogurt to each serving.

Bring 8 cups water to boil in large Dutch oven. Add potatoes. Reduce heat to mediumcover. Cook until tender, 10-15 minutes. Drain well. Place potatoes in bowl. Beat with mixer until smooth. Beat in cream cheese, milk, sour cream, butter, salt. Beat until smooth.

Cut bread in half and spread with cream cheese. Spread with salsa and sprinkle with bacon. Cover with American cheese. Put slices together and grill for about 3 minutes per side until cheese is melted.
Mix together hot cocoa powder, peanut butter and milk. Top with marshmallow creme. Serve with chocolate graham crackers.
Soak beans overnight. In saucepan, boil beans in water with the pork for 1 hour. Add the onion, garlic, paste & seasonings. Cover and simmer over low heat for 1 hour. Serve with rice or corn bread.

Dice the plum tomatoes. Slice the shallots. Chop the basil. Squeeze lemon juice into bowl. Add in the tomatoes, shallots, basil, garlic and extra virgin olive oil. Stir well. Season with salt and pepper. Spread a thick layer on the bread round. Sprinkle with chopped basil. Serves 4.
Chop up all of the veggies and marinade the steak in the marinade for 2 hrs. Cut the steak and veggies up and grill and enjoy.

Heat the margarine in a pan and add the onion. Cook until soft. Add the rice and stir. Add the curry powder and the turmeric. Add the lemon zest and the stock. Bring to the boil and simmer for 15 minutes or until the rice is cooked. Stir in the chives and serve. Serve with any curry dish.

Wash, dry and cut the red, green and yellow bell peppers into fine strips. In a small saucepan combine the vinegar, sugar, celery seeds and 1/4 tsp salt. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Add the bell pepper strips, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the onions. Simmer another 5 minutes. Cool. Drain and discard the liquid. Mix in the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Cover and refrigerate until serving time.
Grill broccoli over medium heat. Brush with olive oil. Salt and sugar to taste.

Brown ground beef in large skillet over medium-high heat until no longer pink. Add green and sweet red peppers. Cook 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in salsa. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in cornheat through. Place 1 corn tortilla in each of 12 small bowls. Spoon beef mixture over tortilla. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon nonfat sour cream and 1 tablespoon reduced-fat cheddar cheese. Bake 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Lightly oil the grill grate. Preheat grill to medium-high. Grill the mushroom caps for 2-3 minutes per side. Brush mushroom caps with oil. Spread the inside of the mushroom caps with the garlic and herb spread. Add the sliced Vidalia onion and salt and pepper to taste. Top with the swiss cheese. Grill the mushroom caps for 2 more minutes. Serve in sandwich buns.

Cook asparagus in boiling water until tender crisp. Drain. Cut each spear lengthwise into 4 equal pieces. In a medium skillet over medium heat melt the butter. Stir in the flour and cook until lightly browned. Gradually stir in the milk. Cook until thickened. Add mustard, ham, asparagus and salt. Blend well. Stir in cheese. Spread about 1/4 cup of the mixture in each of 4 bread slices. Roll up. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Top with the remaining cheese. Bake at 350 for 10 to 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and bread is toasted. Garnish with green onion. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic and ground turkey. Cook 5 to 7 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally. Stir in beans, tomatoes with their juice, broth, cinnamon and cumin. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 10 minutes. Stir in Tabasco. Makes 10 servings.

Combine vegetable shortening and soy margarine in a 1-quart measuring cup. Microwave on high 30 seconds or until melted. Stir in baking powder and salt until well blended. Stir in boiling water until dough forms. Add additional flour a few tablespoons at a time if dough is too sticky. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide in half. Shape each half into a disk. Wrap each disk in plastic wrap. Refrigerate 30 minutes or until easy to handle. Roll out between two pieces of plastic wrap. For a 9-inch pie, roll out dough to 8 inches in diameter. For a 9-inch deep-dish pie, roll out dough to a 12-inch circle. For a 10-inch pie, roll out dough to a 13-inch circle. Remove top piece of plastic wrap. Peel off plastic wrap from top of dough. Place dough in pie plate. For a 9-inch deep-dish pie, roll dough around the rolling pin. Place in

Bring water and tea bags to a boil and steep for 10 minutes. Strain. Add sugar to taste and stir until dissolved. Add lemon juice and orange juice. Tie cinnamon stick and whole cloves in a piece of cheesecloth and add. Serve with honey on the side.

Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and brush with olive oil. Cut the eggplant crosswise into rounds 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick and grill cut sides down, turning once, until browned and tender, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, whisk together miso and water until smooth, then whisk in vinegar and gingerroot. Add lime juice and scallions and stir well. Divide eggplant among plates and serve with miso sauce on the side.

Combine miso, rice vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar & pepper in medium bowlmix well. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heatadd fish, skin side down & sprinkle with salt & pepper. Cook about 5 minutes or until bottoms are crisp & fish flakes easily with fork. Turn fishadd miso mixturebring to simmer. Cover & cook 2 minutes or until fish is done. Transfer fish to platesspoon miso mixture over fish & sprinkle with chopped scallions. Serve with riceif desired. Makes 2 servings.

Spread 1 side of each slice with mustard. Layer slices with sauerkraut, turkey, cheese, tomato slices and dressing. Cut in half lengthwise. Wrap in waxed paper or foil to freeze. To use, defrost sandwiches in refrigerator. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add sandwiches, turn once to brown both sides. Serve immediately.

Bring water, tea bag, cinnamon stick and whole cloves to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about five minutes. Remove tea bag and cloves and allow liquid to cool until room temperature. In a large punch bowl combine fruit juices and sugar and stir until dissolved. Add tea liquid and stir well. Add ice cubes and punch until chilled. Serve with ginger ale on top.

Wash strawberries. Hull and cut berries in half. Combine milk with pudding mix in a medium bowlbeat at medium speed with an electric mixer 2 minutes or until well blended. Spoon pudding mixture into strawberry halves. Garnish with whipped topping and chopped almonds if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Whisk 3 large eggs, 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper. Pour egg mixture into skillet. Cook, stirring, until eggs are almost set. Sprinkle evenly with 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese and 1/4 cup shredded monterey jack pepper cheese. Fold omelette in half. Remove from heat. Place tortilla on a microwave-safe plate. Microwave tortilla for 15 seconds. Set omelette on tortilla. Fold sides of tortilla over omelette. Serve immediately.

Cut up salt pork into small pieces, place into 3 quarts water and slowly bring to a boil. Simmer for 2 hours or until tender. Remove from heat and drain pork from liquid and reserve pork for later use. Strain liquid through cheesecloth into a 2-quart pitcher or bowl. Add flour and stir until smooth. Gradually stir in milk and water. Cook over low heat until thickened. Add pork and season with salt and pepper. Serve over biscuits or other bread.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and oregano. Saut for 1 minute. Add cabbage. Saut for 5 minutes. Add water. Cover. Cook 30 minutes or till cabbage is tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Place the nuts on a baking sheet and place in the oven. Roast until they are golden and fragrant, about 10 minutes. Remove the nuts from the oven and set aside to cool. Once cool, place the nuts in the bowl of a food processor. Pulse until the nuts are finely ground. Add the cocoa powder and pulse until a paste forms. Add the agave nectar and vanilla and process until smooth. If the mixture is too dry, add more agave nectar, 1 tsp. at a time. Add the hazelnut oil and process until smooth. Add the sea salt and process until combined. Transfer the mixture to a glass jar or other storage container and store in the refrigerator. The nutella can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. It can also be frozen for up to 2 months. To use, place the nutella in the microwave for 15 seconds at a time until it is warm and spreadable.

Place the chicken breasts in the bottom of the crock pot. Sprinkle the cream of mushroom and cream of chicken soup evenly over the chicken breasts and top with the sour cream and seasonings. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or until the chicken is cooked through and tender. Serve over new potatoes and sprinkle the green onions over the top for garnish. Serve warm and enjoy!

Slice provolone cheese thin. Grill bread. Spread with marinara sauce. Grill until toasted. Spread with butter. Top with turkey. Top with provolone cheese. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Cook until cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Toss brussels sprouts with olive oil, garlic and lemon juice in a large bowl. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes and salt. Spread brussels sprouts on the baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes. Add balsamic vinegar and toss. Continue to roast for 5 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. In a bowl combine the corn, milk and butter and set aside. In a large baking dish add the corn mixture. Bake for 40 minutes or until the milk is soaked in and the corn is tender. Remove the corn from the oven and add salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In a large nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat, saute butter and sugar until melted. Add ginger and salt. Continue cooking until mixture is a thick syrup. Add berries to glaze. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in almonds to coat. Spread almonds onto 2 large baking sheets coated with cooking spray. Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Stir every 5 minutes to prevent burning. Remove from oven. Cool completely on baking sheet. Store in airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.
Combine all liquid ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Shake well for 30 seconds. Pour into a martini glass or cocktail glass. Garnish with pear slices or pear wedges.

Peel, stem and seed the chilies. Cut into 1/2-inch pieces. In a saucepan combine the red and green chilies, shallots, lemon juice, and 2 teaspoons of the sugar over medium-high heat and simmer until the shallots are transparent and the chilies are very soft, about 10 minutes. Stir in the remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons sugar and let the mixture cool. Stir in the remaining ingredients and let the mixture cool completely before serving. Serve with grilled meats or vegetables, or as a dip for tortilla chips and vegetables.

Season both sides of the steaks with salt and pepper. In a heavy skillet brown steaks on both sides in the hot oil. Remove and set aside. In the same skillet saute onions and garlic until onions are golden brown. Add barbecue sauce and soy sauce. Bring to a boil and pour over the steaks. Bake in a 350 degree oven for about 30 minutes until meat is cooked through. Serve on your favorite bun.

Season the wings with the salt, pepper, ginger, and cornstarch. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the wings in batches and cook, stirring occasionally, until the wings are well browned, about 6 minutes for medium wings. Transfer the wings to a plate and set aside. Add the lemon juice to the skillet along with the soy sauce and the brown sugar. Cook over medium heat until the liquid thickens, about 3 minutes. Return the wings to the skillet and toss well to coat with the glaze. Transfer the wings back to the plate and sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce if desired.

Peel 2 pounds of sweet potatoes. Cube the potatoes into 1 inch cubes. Place in a pot of water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add 2 cups of granny smith apples, 1 cup of dried cranberries. Cook until potatoes are fork tender. Drain potatoes. Add 3 tablespoons of butter. Mash with potato masher. Add 3 tablespoons of brown sugar. Add 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon. Add more cinnamon to taste. Serve.

Prepare brownie mix according to package directions in a greased 9x13 pan. Let cool slightly before spreading with a layer of marshmallow creme. Melt chocolate chips in microwave and drizzle over marshmallow layer. Top with a layer of rice krispies and peanut butter. Return to oven for 3-5 minutes or until peanut butter is heated through. Cool before cutting. Serves 2-4 depending on size of squares.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion and garlic, and cook until onion is soft. Stir in frozen spinach. Cook until spinach is thawed. Stir in eggs and cottage cheese. Add flour. Stir until well combined. Place in a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375° F for about 30 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook ground beef until no longer pink. Drain and return to skillet. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add tomatoes, pasta sauce, basil and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Lay lasagna noodles flat in bottom of 13x9-inch baking dish. Spread 1 cup of ricotta cheese on top of noodles. Top with half of beef mixture. Repeat layering with noodles, ricotta cheese and beef mixture. Top with mozzarella cheese and parmesan cheese. Bake 350 for 45 minutes.

Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add ginger and garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add shrimp and cook until just opaque in the center. Add the peppers and lemon juice. Cook until the peppers are tender and the shrimp is cooked through. Add lime juice, salt and chili oil. Transfer to a serving plate and garnish with chives. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line 2 baking sheets with heavy duty foil. Cut sweet potato into 1/4 inch slices. Place in a large bowl. Add the maple syrup and butter. Toss until potatoes are evenly coated. Arrange the potato slices on the baking sheets. Roast for 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove from oven and drizzle with the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.

Dust the snapper fillets with flour. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the fish fillets and cook for 2 minutes on each side. Add the butter to the pan. Turn the fish over. Cook for another minute or two until the fish is done. Pour the lemon juice over the fish. Sprinkle with the chopped parsley. Serve immediately.
Combine flour and salt. Rub feta into mixture. Mix in honey. Knead for 2 minutes. Divide into 12 portions and roll into balls. Cook on a lightly greased griddle until golden brown.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and onions. Cook and stir until tender. In a large bowl combine egg substitute and water. Add the mushrooms and onions. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Place a tortilla in the center of the pan. Spoon about 1/3 cup of the egg mixture in the center of the tortilla. Sprinkle with ham and top with tomatoes. Top with mozzarella and cheddar cheeses. Cook until the egg is set. Top with salsa and serve.

Roll out one half of pastry to fit 9-inch pie plate. Put into pie plate. Combine blackberries, sugar, cornstarch, lemon rind, and 1 tablespoon butter in a bowl and cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Pour into crust. Top with remaining pastry and seal edges. Cut slits in top for steam to escape. Bake 45 to 50 minutes, or until crust is brown. Cool. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350f. Arrange bacon strips in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake until crisp, about 15 minutes. In a large bowl, toss brussels sprouts with thyme and 1 tsp. salt. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 15-20 minutes. Serve topped with crispy bacon and additional thyme.

In a heavy bottom pan combine the white chocolate and heavy cream. Cook on low heat and stir until melted. Remove from heat and stir in the dark rum. Add the coconut and nuts. Chill and form into 1 inch balls and roll in the coconut. Serve with a drizzle of chocolate or rum sauce.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray 8x10 glass baking dish with cooking spray. Cook and stir onion and green chilies until onion is tender. Stir in egg substitute. Spoon into baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes. In small bowl combine hot sauce, salsa and pepper. Spread on warm tortillas. Cut burritos in half. Spoon filling into burrito halves. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Toss cherry tomatoes with the garlic and 1 tablespoon of the oil in a medium bowl and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a rimmed baking sheet and roast for about 25 minutes, or until tomatoes are soft and brown in spots. Meanwhile, season fish with salt and pepper and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of oil and lemon wedges. Roast for about 15 minutes, or until fish is cooked through. Divide tomatoes between 2 plates. Top with fish and drizzle with pesto and remaining oil and lemon wedges.

Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti according to package directions for al dentedrain and rinse with cold water. Cook chicken in same saucepan with garlic until no longer pinkremove and set aside. In same saucepan, stir together soup and sour cream until smoothstir in mushrooms and cook 2 to 3 minutes or until heated through. Stir in chicken and spaghettiheat through. Top with cheese and serve immediately.

Prepare the marinade. In a bowl, combine the lemon juice, fresh dill, garlic cloves, sugar and paprika. Stir until well blended. Place the salmon steaks in a zip-lock bag and pour the marinade over them. Close the bag and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or overnight. Preheat the grill. Remove the steaks from the bag and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill the steaks for about 3 minutes per side. Serve with a wedge of lemon. Serves 2.

In a large pot, heat the butter. Add the flour and seasonings. Add the milk and water and stir until smooth. Add the cheese and ham. Bring to a boil. Add the potatoes and reduce heat to medium. Cook for about 20 minutes, until the potatoes are tender. Place half the potato mixture in a 2 qt. casserole. Sprinkle with the breadcrumbs. Add the rest of the potato mixture. Cover with foil and bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Remove the foil and continue baking until the top is golden brown.

In a bowl, combine vinegar and waterset aside. In a skillet over medium heat, mix pork chops with vinegar mixture and brown sugar. Cover skillet and cook 5 minutes. Add ginger and pepper and continue cooking 5 minutes longer or until a thermometer reads 160 degrees f and pork is no longer pink. In a bowl, mix cornstarch and water until smoothstir into skillet with pork chops. Cook 1 minute longer or until sauce thickens. Garnish with dried apricots and dried prune.
Mix together the hamburger, tomato paste, water, mustard, chili powder, garlic, and onion. Cook over low heat, stirring often.

Prepare the marinade: In a food processor or blender, combine the yogurt and next 4 ingredients. Add the chickencover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to overnight. Preheat the broiler with the rack set 5 inches from the heat. Place the marinated chicken on a broiler panbroil for about 7 minutes per side. Serve with saffron rice and cucumber salad or a side salad of your choice.

Place tomatoes in boiling water for about 1 minute, then remove from heat and plunge into ice bath for about 1 minute. Remove from ice bath and pat dry. Place in baking dish and drizzle with butter and sprinkle with basil and salt and pepper and sugar and cook in preheated oven for about 10 minutes or until the tomatoes begin to melt and blister.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a medium bowl mix the potatoes, onion and soup until well combined. Spread the mixture in the baking dish. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with the bacon bits and cheddar cheese. Mix the ranch dressing and sour cream together. Spread evenly over the potatoes. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serves 6-8.

In a large pot combine water, split peas, and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover pot and simmer until split peas are tender and liquid is thick, about 2 hours. Add onion, carrots, butter, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 more minutes. Makes 6 servings.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Use on salads, dips or sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut the rolls in half lengthwise. Lay half of each roll on baking sheetbutter tops of rolls. Place ham slices on 8 of the rollstop with cheese slices. Top with remaining roll halves, buttered sides down. Bake 8 minutes or until cheese is melted and rolls are browned on bottoms. Remove rolls from ovenbrush tops with half of the worcestershire sauce mixture. Top rolls with remaining worcestershire sauce mixturesprinkle with poppy seeds. Bake an additional 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes 8 appetizer sandwiches.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add water and corn syrup. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until mixture is thick and bubbly. Remove from heat and stir in pecans. Spread in a single layer onto a baking sheet. Cool completely before serving. Store in an airtight container.

Cut pumpkin in half and remove seeds and guts. Bring chicken stock to boil. Add pumpkin and cook over moderate heat until tender, about 40 minutes. Remove pumpkin with slotted spoon and set aside. In a small bowl, combine garlic, gingerroot and green onions. In a wok over high heat, add oil and heat until almost smoking. Add garlic mixture and stir until fragrant. Add fish sauce and sugar and stir until sugar has dissolved. Add pumpkin and stir until well coated. Season with pepper and add preserves. Toss until sauce has thickened and pumpkin is evenly coated. Serve over steamed rice.

Mix together cayenne pepper, lemon pepper and garlic powder in shallow dish. Add catfish fillets and turn to coat fish thoroughly. Place in refrigerator for 2 hours. Pre-heat the grill and spray with non-stick cooking spray. Grill catfish on both sides for about 2 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Remove fish and place on plate. Add butter and Italian salad dressing to the plate and place catfish on top. Serve with rice, potatoes and/or green vegetables.
Cook the chicken until tender. Mix the remaining ingredients. Add the cooked chicken and mix well. Bake at 375f for about 20 minutes.
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl, pour into greased bread pan. Bake 60 minutes at 350 degrees. Makes one large loaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat butter at medium speed until creamy. Add sugar, one cup at a time, beating well after each addition. Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Add vanilla. Beat well. Combine flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda and sour cream. Gradually add to butter mixture. Beat at medium speed until combined. Refrigerate dough 1 hour or until easy to handle. On lightly floured surface, roll dough to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into 2 inch round shapes. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 1 minute before removing from pans to wire racks. Cool completely. Beat together creme filling. Spread 1 tablespoon of filling onto bottom of half of cookies. Top with other half of cookie. Makes 4 dozen cookies.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add snow peas and orange peel. Stir-fry 2 minutes. Stir in cashew nuts. Remove from heat. Stir well. Serve warm.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat and saute onions for 2-3 minutes or until softened. Remove onions and add chives and cook for a minute longer. Add cod and cook for 2 minutes on each side or until opaque and flaky. In a small bowl combine white wine and lemon juice and pour over fish. Serve immediately on a plate garnished with onions and chives.
Preheat grill to medium high. In a bowl combine teriyaki and mustard. Stir in chicken. Place on grill and cook for 20-25 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve hot with your favorite vegetable.
Mix wine, oil, herbs and seasonings. Marinate meat in this mixture for at least an hour. Reserve some of the marinade to brush on the meat while grilling.

In large bowl mix flour and baking soda. In mixer bowl beat butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add pudding and mix well. Add vanilla and eggs. Beat well. Stir in dry ingredients. Chill for at least an hour or up to one day. Roll into balls and place on cookie sheets. Bake at 400 for about 10 minutes. Let cool for at least 10 minutes.
Drain tofu and mash well. Add remaining ingredients and mix thoroughly. Refrigerate for 3 hours before spreading on bread. Serve on wheat bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Peel and core apples and cut into quarters or eighths. In bowl combine 2 tablespoons cinnamon and 1/4 cup water. Dip apples in cinnamon water and arrange in 10x14x3-inch baking dish. Combine 1/2 cup flour, 3/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup brown sugar and 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon. Cut in 4 tablespoons chilled butter and mix with fingers or pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs with some larger pieces of butter remaining. Sprinkle over apples and bake for 30-35 minutes in preheated oven. Serve warm with whipped cream and ice cream topping if desired.
Combine mayonnaise, sugar, champagne, vinegar and pepper in a small bowl. Toss with chicken. Fold in apple, pear and feta. Serve on lettuce.

Melt chocolate with butter in saucepan over low heat. Mix in peanut butter until smooth and blended. Add rice krispies and stir until all are coated and mixed well. Put in a bowl and press in peanut butter cups and peanut butter cups. Chill in freezer or refrigerator until set.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut butter into small pieces and place it into a bowl with the crisco. Heat oil and flour in heavy skillet until brown and crisp. Remove from heat and add salt and pepper. Dip chicken breasts into the flour mixture and then dip into the hot oil mixture. Place breasts onto an ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 30 minutes. Turn over and bake for 30 more minutes, or until done. Remove from oven and serve hot. Serve with honey mustard sauce or malt vinegar for dipping.

Heat olive oil in a pot, and add onion. Stir fry till they turn slightly golden in color. Now add tomatoes, tomato puree, chili powder, turmeric powder and salt. Stir fry for 2 minutes on medium heat. Now break eggs and put it on the tomato mixture. Let it cook on low heat till egg whites are set and egg yolk is runny. Serve it hot.

Rinse potatoes and cut into 1/4 inch cubes. Peel and slice the onions. Place potatoes and onions in the bottom of slow cooker and add the garlic, salt and pepper. Cut the pork into 1 inch cubes and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place the pork in the slow cooker on top of the potatoes. Pour the sauerkraut and its juice over all. Add the caraway seeds. Cover and cook on high for 6 hours or on low for 9 hours. Check occasionally and add more water if necessary. Serves 4-5

Wash tomatillos well and remove papery outer husk. Cut in half and remove seeds with the tip of a knife. Combine all the above ingredients in a blender or food processor. Blend well. Serve with tortilla chips, on tacos, in enchiladas or any other Mexican dish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In an electric mixer cream butter and sugar until light. Beat in vanilla. Add enough water to make it spreadable. Spread in an even layer on an ungreased baking sheet. Sprinkle with oats. Bake until set. Cool slightly. Break into pieces. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Chop the chocolate into small pieces and place in a heatproof bowl over a pan of simmering water (making sure the bottom of the bowl doesn't touch the water). When the chocolate is melted stir in the cream, hazelnut spread and vanilla extract until smooth. In a separate bowl, melt the milk and dark chocolate over a pan of simmering water. Stir until smooth and allow to cool until thick enough to roll into balls. Spread the melted milk and dark chocolate onto a baking tray lined with baking parchment and allow to cool in the refrigerator. When cooled enough to handle take a teaspoon of the melted milk and dark chocolate and place a teaspoon of the cream and hazelnut mixture in the centre of the milk and dark chocolate mixture and roll into a ball using the palms of your hands. Roll the ball in the slivered almonds and place in the fridge until set. Repeat with the rest of the mixture and serve in a box with a ribbon and bow or in a beautiful bowl

In crock pot add chicken, onion, green pepper and celery. Add remaining ingredients and rice. Cook on high for 3 hours or low for 6 hours. Remove chicken and cut into bite size pieces. Stir back into the soup. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Arrange asparagus in a baking dish. Toss with the garlic, salt and white pepper. Drizzle with the mustard and lemon juice. Bake for about 15 minutes. Remove from oven and toss with the sesame oil. Serve immediately.
Puree all ingredients in a blender. Serve cold.

Spread the mayonnaise evenly on the focaccia bread. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese on the mayonnaise. Place the tomatoes on top of the cheese. Sprinkle on the pesto sauce. Top with the second piece of focaccia bread. Cut the sandwich into small squares and serve.

Heat the olive oil and fry the onion and garlic for 3 minutes. Add the boiling water and chicken stock cubes and leave to simmer until reduced by half. Blend in the zucchini and simmer for another 3 minutes. Blend until smooth and season with fresh basil and salt and pepper. Whisk in the evaporated milk and pour into serving bowls. Serve immediately garnished with fresh basil

Cream together shortening and honey. Add beaten egg and mix well. Add orange rind and blend thoroughly. Sift together flour, baking powder and baking soda. Add to creamed mixture and mix until well blended. Stir in orange juice and nuts. Pour into greased and floured loaf pan and bake at 325 for one hour. Makes two loaves.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onions and garlic. Cook, stirring constantly, 5-7 minutes or until tender. Add basil and bay leaves. Stir in red wine and cook 1 minute. In medium bowl stir together gravy mix and water until smooth. Stir into pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Add mushrooms. Heat through. Spoon over meatballs. Serve with noodles or rice.

In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and cream of tartar. Beat well. Combine flour, baking soda and salt in a small bowl. Add to butter mixture and mix well. Divide dough into two balls. Roll one ball between parchment paper to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut dough into 1/2 inch rounds and place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake in a 350 degree F. oven for 12-14 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 1 minute on the sheets and transfer to wire racks to cool. Repeat with remaining dough ball. In a small bowl, combine confectioners sugar, rum extract and brandy extract. Beat until smooth. Dip cooled cookies in icing and place on wire rack to set. Makes about 1 dozen cookies.

Cut steak into bite-sized chunks. In a heavy skillet, melt butter. Brown chunks of beef on all sides. Remove from skillet and place in crock-pot. In skillet, saute onion and green pepper. Stir in flour and cook for a few minutes until flour is light brown in color. Stir in tomatoes, beef broth, garlic, tomato paste and cumin. Cook 3 minutes. Pour into crock-pot. Add beef. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Season to taste.

Roll out dough into a rectangular shape. Spread soup in center of dough. Top with ham and mixed vegetables. Sprinkle with cheese. Fold edges over filling to cover completely. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until done. Cut into wedges. Serve immediately. Variations use spinach or pesto instead of mushroom soup. Add black olives or pepperoni. Substitute mozzarella for cheddar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine flour, oats, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt. In another bowl, combine soymilk and apple. Add to dry mixture and mix until just blended. Stir in raisins. Lightly spray a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto cookie sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm.

Combine butter and wasabi powder in small mixing bowl. Using electric mixer, beat until combined. Add chives and black pepper and mix. Use immediately or store in refrigerator up to 1 week. Makes about 1 cup.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add green beanscook until tender crisp, about 10 minutes. Drain green beans and place in a serving bowl. Add warm bacon vinaigrettetoss. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a wok or heavy based frying pan. Add the curry paste and cook for 30 seconds. Add the coconut cream and simmer for 30 seconds. Add the salmon and cook for 2 minutes on each side. Remove from pan and set aside. Heat the stock in a saucepan. Bring the stock to a simmer and add the green beans. Cover and simmer for 3 minutes. Add the rice, and stir. Cover and simmer for a further 5 minutes. Spoon into bowls. Top with salmon and sprinkle with cilantro.

Prepare crust: Combine crumbs & sugar in small bowl. Add margarine. Press evenly into 9 inch pie pan. Bake in 350 degree oven for 10 minutes. Cool.Prepare filling: Beat cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth. Add flour & next 4 ingredients. Beat at medium speed until smooth. Stir in vanilla. Pour into crust. Bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Let cool.Prepare topping: Combine all topping ingredients in a small bowl. Spoon over filling. Refrigerate overnight. Garnish with strawberries. Serves 8.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Pour the olive oil into the bottom of an ovenproof dish. Peel the pears and place them cut side up in the dish. Pour the milk into a jug and add the vanilla and nutmeg. Pour the mixture over the pears. Bake the pears for 30-40 minutes or until the custard is set. Remove from the oven and cool for 5-10 minutes. Serve the pears warm or at room temperature. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel and cube beets and toss in olive oil. Spread on rimmed baking sheet and roast in preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Cool completely. Combine lemon juice and olive oil in small bowl and whisk until emulsified. Season with pepper and pour over beets. Toss to coat. Divide arugula and frisee among plates and top with roasted beets and chives. Serve.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook ground chicken until no longer pink. Drain. Add mushrooms, zucchini and bell peppers. Cook and stir 5 minutes. Add onion and cook and stir 2 minutes. Stir in hot salsa. Place tortillas on microwave plate. Microwave 30 seconds to soften. Place 1/4 cup chicken mixture and 2 tbsp cheese on each tortilla. Fold over and place seam side down. Microwave 45 seconds to 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Combine first four ingredients. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Make a well in center of mixtureadd remaining ingredients. Beat with a mixer at low speed just until combined (batter will be thick). Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Place the white chocolate in a bowl and set over a saucepan of barely simmering water. Stir constantly until just melted. Remove from the heat and cool for about 15 minutes. Beat the egg yolks and sugar together in a large bowl until thick and pale yellow in colour. Place the bowl over the saucepan of barely simmering water and stir constantly with a wooden spoon for about 10 minutes. Remove the bowl from the heat and beat in the white chocolate and thickened cream until smooth. Pour into a large dish and chill in the refrigerator for a couple of hours. To serve, spoon into glasses, add a teaspoon of liqueur and garnish with strawberries.

Heat mustard and water in a small saucepan over medium-low heat until the mustard is smooth and bubbly. Cool. Add remaining ingredients and stir well. Store in a closed container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks. Makes about 1 cup of barbecue sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Slice the baguette in 1/2 inch thick slices. Place on a baking sheet and brush with olive oil. Bake for about 10 minutes or until crisp. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Slice tomato and mozzarella cheese into 1/2 inch thick slices. Place 4 pieces of tomato on each slice of baguette. Top with a slice of cheese and 1 basil leaf. Bake again for about 5 minutes. Remove and sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 2-quart casserole dish, combine the broccoli with 1/2 of the soup (about 10 ounces) and 1 cup water and stir until evenly coated. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup shredded cheese and bake, uncovered, until the broccoli is tender and the mixture is thick, about 35 minutes. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, combine the remaining soup with 1/2 cup water and the butter. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Add the rice and cook until tender but firm, about 15 minutes. Remove the rice from the heat and stir in the chicken and cheese crackers until the crackers are evenly distributed. Sprinkle the rice with the remaining 1/2 cup cheese and bake until the cheese is melted and the rice is heated through, 5 to 10 minutes. Serve topped with the broccoli and more cheese if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut asparagus into 1 inch pieces. Place asparagus in a baking dish with pine nuts. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle with lemon juice and garlic. Bake for 10 minutes or until asparagus is tender. Sprinkle with sugar, oregano and basil. Toss well. Serve hot or cold.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute the garlic until fragrant but not brown (about 1 minute). Stir in the soymilk and flour until thickened. Reduce heat to low and add the oregano, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until thickened. Serve over pasta of choice and top with parmesan cheese, if desired.
Spray a 9 inch pie plate with non stick cooking spray. Lay doritos in the bottom of the plate. Top with lettuce, tomatoes, onion, ground beef, cheese and beans. Drizzle with dressing. Serves 4.

Lightly toast the bread. Spread the mayo on one side. Layer the tomatoes, then the basil. Top with the turkey. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place the cheese on top. Melt the butter in a skillet. Place the sandwich in the skillet and place in the broiler for 2 minutes. Spread the chutney on the other side of the bread and serve.

Cook cabbage and carrots in a medium saucepan with water and vinegar for 2 minutes until tender. Drain. Cool. In a medium bowl, combine apple juice drink mix, mayonnaise and mustardmix well. Cut each slice of bread into 3 pieces and place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Top each bread slice with 1/3 cup cabbage mixture, 1 slice corned beef and 1 tablespoon cheese. Broil 10 inches from the heat for 2 minutes on each side or until cheese is melted. Serve on whole wheat buns with remaining cabbage mixture, corned beef and cheese. Makes 4 sandwiches.

In a punch bowl, combine the orange juice and cranberry juice cocktail. Stir in the club soda and fruit punch. Add the fresh lime juice. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours. When ready to serve, add the ice. Slice the oranges and limes and arrange them in the punch bowl. Serve cold. Makes 12 servings.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet and add shallot. Add pork chops and cook over medium heat until brown. Add dijon mustard and cream. Let boil. Add lemon juice and capers. Add water to cover. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 325. Mix the ground beef, ground sausage, celery, onion and saltines together in a large bowl. Mix in the eggs. Add the remaining ingredients and mix until combined. Pour into an ungreased 9x13 casserole dish. Bake 1 hour 15 minutes. Cool slightly before slicing and serving.

Whisk together egg substitute and milk. Add cinnamon and vanilla. Heat a nonstick skillet to medium high. Melt a small pat of margarine in pan. Dip one side of bread into egg mixture. Cook for 1-2 minutes per side until golden brown. Serve with syrup.

Drain the tuna in a colander and rinse under cold water. Drain well. In a large skillet, cook the onion in oil over medium heat until soft. Add the tuna, corn, green chilies, and olives and mix well. Spread the mixture into a 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with half of the cheese. Place a tortilla over the top. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Repeat the layers twice. Pour the enchilada sauce over the top. Cover and bake for 25 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with lettuce and serve.

Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Saute onion until tender. Add garlic cloves& cook 1 minute longer. Stir in broth, cauliflower& vanilla pod. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low& simmer covered for 10 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat& stir in heavy cream. Purée soup& return to pot. Season with salt& pepper to taste. Serve warm. Garnish with additional vanilla pod & freshly chopped chives.

In large bowl with fork, mix together cake mix, applesauce, egg substitute, water and oil until crumbly dough forms. Press dough evenly in bottom of greased 9-in round cake pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. In small bowl with fork or whisk combine sugar and cinnamon. In small saucepan bring to boil applesauce, cinnamon and brown sugar. Pour over top of cake while baking. Bake for 35 minutes until golden brown. Cool 15 minutes. Top with sour cream just before serving.

Preheat the grill to high. Lightly oil the grill rack. Thread the fish, vegetables, and mushrooms onto the skewers alternating each type of vegetable. Brush the monkfish kabobs with olive oil and sprinkle with cumin. Grill the kabobs for 5 - 6 minutes per side until the fish is firm. Sprinkle with fresh lemon juice before serving.

In a large bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. In a medium bowl combine shortening and brown sugar. Beat until crumbly. Add water and vanilla. Beat well. Add egg yolks one at a time. Beat well after each addition. Add milk and beat well. Add flour mixture to shortening mixture and stir well. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into batter. Fold in marshmallows. Pour into greased and floured tube pan. Bake at 350F for 1 hour. Cool before removing from pan. Drizzle with butterscotch frosting.

Preheat broiler. Sprinkle fillets with oregano, cayenne, thyme and Tabasco. Broil 8 inches from heat for 3 to 4 minutes per inch thickness on each side. Remove from broiler. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 10-inch bundt pan. Combine cake mix and eggs in a large mixing bowl. Add in 1/2 cup orange juice and 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Beat for two minutes. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes. In a small bowl, combine remaining juice and 1/4 cup olive oil. Brush over cake. Sprinkle with almonds. Cool for 1 hour. Drizzle with powdered sugar. Serve with whipped cream, if desired.

Boil baby carrots until tender (about 10 minutes). Drain carrots and place on paper towel to dry. Heat olive oil and butter in skillet over medium heat and sautÃ© onion until soft (about 5 minutes). Stir in carrots and cook for 2 minutes, then add the velveeta cheese and stir to combine. Continue to cook for 2 minutes more, then add the cracker crumbs and stir to combine.

Preheat oven to 375F. Coat a 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish with cooking spray. Season fillets with lemon juice, salt, pepper and Italian seasoning. Arrange fillets in dish. Cover with foil. Bake 20 minutes. Uncoversprinkle with parsley. Bake 5 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually beat in sugar until stiff peaks form. Add lemon juice, vanilla, honey and potato starch. Fold in coconut. Form into 1 inch balls, place on greased cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes in preheated oven (180c)

In a medium bowl combine clams and juice. Mash potatoes. Add egg, green onions, salt, pepper and fine breadcrumbs. Add clams. Form into small croquettes. Heat oil in a skillet. Brown croquettes. Serve with tartar sauce.

In a small saucepan, combine the potatoes, water, vinegar, sugar, and salt until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in the green onion and allow to cool to room temperature. Combine the potatoes with the eggs, mayonnaise, and celery seed. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Butter one side of the bread. Spread with peanut butter and then sprinkle with sugar. Press down on bread to make sandwich. Heat in microwave for 30 seconds or until melted.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Roll out the puff pastry sheets to about a 1/2 inch thickness. Place the salmon pieces in the center of each sheet. Sprinkle with the sliced almonds. Spread the pesto sauce over the top. Roll the pastry around the fish like a jelly roll. Place seam side down on a baking sheet. Bake for 25 minutes. Cut into 1 inch slices. Garnish with the sliced tomatoes.

Bring water and tomatoes to a boil in a large saucepan. Boil for 3 minutes. Add ravioli and cook until heated through and tender, about 4 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Drain and set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine garlic, sugar and vinegar. Cook until sugar is dissolved and mixture is bubbly and slightly thickened. Remove from heat and add tomatoes and spinach. Return to heat and cook until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in cheese. Serve ravioli over sauce and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Heat margarine in a saucepan. Add tomatoes and onions. Cook until soft and tender. Add flour and stir until well mixed. Gradually add water and tomato juice. Bring to boil and then simmer for 5 minutes. Beat the eggs in a bowl. Add to the tomato mixture. Return to boil. Pour into a ovenproof dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until set.

Brush salmon fillets lightly with olive oil and then roll in breadcrumbs and gingerroot. In a bowl combine breadcrumb mixture with horseradish. Press breadcrumb mixture onto salmon fillets and place in oven at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until done. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a small bowl combine paprika, garlic powder, thyme and pepper. Drizzle fish with olive oil and sprinkle with spice mixture. Place fish in a 9×13 baking dish. Bake 10-15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve with lemon wedge.

Boil eggs for 13 minutes. Remove from pot and immediately run under cold water until cold. Peel shells and slice eggs lengthwise in half. Place egg yolks in a bowl. Mash yolks until smooth. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well. Spoon yolk mixture into egg white halves. Chill for 3 hours before serving. Serve on a bed of lettuce or as a sandwich.
Spread cream cheese over croissants. Top with turkey. Top with marmalade. Sprinkle with pecans. Top with lettuce leaf.

In a small skillet over med-high heat, saute the onion and mushrooms in the butter. Transfer to a bowl. In another skillet over med-high heat, brown the steaks in the seasoning salt. Turn the steaks over. Add the onion/mushroom mixture. Pour in the mushroom soup and water. Heat thoroughly. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 24 mini muffin cups. In a medium bowl, combine cake mix and cream until smooth. Spoon cake mixture into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow to cool completely. Meanwhile, beat cream in a large bowl until soft peaks form. Beat in confectioners sugar and vanilla until stiff peaks form. Divide cream among 24 mini muffin cups. Sprinkle with cherry pie filling and drizzle with almond extract. Garnish with almonds and chocolate curls.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a large bowl, mix together cornmeal, soy flour, oat flour, salt and baking powder. In another bowl, mix together Splenda, cream cheese and milkstir until creamy. Pour wet mixture into dry mixture and stir just until moistened. Pour batter into greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake for 30 minutes longer. Turn out onto wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9×13 inch baking pan. In a medium bowl, cream together margarine and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and saltstir into margarine mixture. Fold in chocolate chips. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Let cool completely before cutting into squares.

In a large pitcher, combine hot water and sugar. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add ginger. Let cool. Remove ginger. In a glass, muddle cucumber with basil leaves. Add ice. Pour ginger syrup over ice. Top with gin. Stir. Add lime juice.
Bring the sugar and water to a boil. Add the butter. Boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the brown sugar. Stir in the pecans. Pour onto wax paper. Let cool. Break into pieces.
Season the breasts with the soup mix and a little dill weed. Melt the butter and saute the breasts until browned on both sides. Add the broth and cook until the breasts are done. Top with sour cream.

Heat oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion, stirring occasionally, until softened and beginning to brown. Add zucchini and yellow squash. Cook until tender. Add thyme and cook for 1 minute. Drizzle vegetables evenly with the balsamic vinegar. Place skillet in oven and broil until vegetables are golden brown and glazed. Drizzle with olive oil and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Prepare raspberries and strawberries. Add to large pot. Add water. Add apple juice. Add pectin. Add artificial sweetener. Stir well. Heat over medium heat until mixture reaches full rolling boil. Remove from heat and pour into sterile jars. Place in refrigerator for 12 hours.
Dissolve meat in milk. Add mustard and creole seasoning, mix well, dip alligator bits in mixture, fry in hot cooking oil until golden brown.
Mix together mayonnaise and cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in the artichoke hearts and asparagus. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
Preheat grill. Split franks and place on grill. Spoon apricot preserves and orange marmalade onto each split frank. Cook 8 minutes. Spread mustard on hot dog buns. Serve franks in buns.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a baking dish with butter. Peel and slice potatoes 1/2 inch thick. Toss potatoes with melted butter in the baking dish, then sprinkle with brown sugar, orange zest and vanilla. Drizzle with 1/4 cup water and sprinkle with spices. Cover tightly with foil and bake for 1 hour, stirring halfway through and adding water if necessary. Uncover and continue baking for 1 hour or until potatoes are tender and caramelized. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. Lightly spray 12 muffin cups with non-stick spray and set aside. In a large bowl combine the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Stir in the ginger and margarine and mix well.
