In another bowl combine the milk and egg and beat well. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Fold in peaches. Fill paper-lined muffin cups two-thirds full. Sprinkle each muffin with cinnamon. Bake at 375f for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack.

Grease and flour 12-cup bundt pan. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine cake mix and sour creammix until smooth. Beat together eggs and oilstir into cake batter just until combined. Spoon batter into prepared pan. Bake 50 minutes in the preheated oven. Let cake cool in pan for 15 minutes before removing it from pan. Combine powdered sugar and 1 tablespoon poppy seedssprinkle over cake. Store in refrigerator or freezer. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream if desired.

Heat oil in a pan. Sauté onions and garlic for 1 minute. Add vodka and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add tomato puree. Cook until thickened. Add cream. Add ham and cook until heated through. Add parsley, parmesan cheese and tabasco to taste. Toss with cooked pasta. Serve in a pasta bowl.

Slice zucchini lengthwise into thin rounds about 3 inches long. Lay them out flat in an ungreased baking pan. Drizzle each slice with the olive oil and sprinkle with the italian seasoning. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. Bake at 425 degrees until they begin to brown around the edges and are crisp, about 25-30 minutes depending on how thinly you slice them. They should still have some crunch to the crust but not so much that they are hard in the middle.

Heat oil over medium heat in a large pan or wok. Cook chicken breasts for about 5 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Remove from pan and set aside. Add onion to pan, along with the curry paste and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add the rice, cooking spray and curry powder to the pan and cook for about 2 minutes until fragrant. Stir in the chicken broth, water, tomatoes, and almonds. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cover the pan. Simmer for about 20 minutes or until the rice is cooked through. Season the rice mixture with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with natural yoghurt.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small bowl, mix teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, garlic, sesame seeds, garlic powder, onion powder, red pepper flakes. Place wings in a 9x13 pan. Pour sauce over wings. Bake for 35-45 minutes. Turn wings once. Remove wings from oven, drizzle with maple syrup. Bake for another 5 minutes. Serve warm.
In a medium saucepan over medium heat bring sugar, butter and cornstarch to a boil. Stir in carrots and pineapple, simmer until carrots are tender. Stir in cinnamon. Cook until heated through.

Melt butter in microwave-safe bowl at high for 40 seconds or until butter is melted. Add graham cracker crumbs, coconut & chipsstir until combined. Press into 8x8-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 10 minutes. Cool completely on wire rack. In small microwave-safe bowl, microwave milk on high for 3 minutes or until very hot & bubbly. Add chipsstir until completely melted & smooth. Pour over crustsprinkle with nuts. Chill until firm, about 2 hours. Cut into 16 bars. Store at room temperature for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 2 months.

Preheat grill to high. Rub each mushroom with 1 tsp olive oil. Place mushrooms on grill. Grill until cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. Turn mushrooms over. Continue grilling until cooked through. Remove mushrooms from grill. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Spoon 1 tsp garlic onto each mushroom. Drizzle with sherry. Serve with toasted breadcrumbs. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

In a bowl, mix together cream cheese, lemon juice, onion and prepared horseradish. Add green peppers and cucumber. Shape into a ball. Wrap with aluminum foil. Bake at 350 degrees F. for about 20 minutes. Serve with fresh parsley.

Peel potatoes and cut in half. Place in a baking dish with enough cold water to cover by 1-2 inches. Bake for 1-1/2 hours or until tender. Drain, reserving 1 cup liquid. Place potatoes in a large bowl and add reserved liquid, oil, salt, pepper, garlic cloves, scallion, parsley and worcestershire sauce. Mash or puree with an electric mixer until smooth.

Combine milk and lemonade concentrate in a large bowl and stir until well mixed. Add in frozen whipped topping and stir until thoroughly combined. Pour into crust and freeze until ready to serve. Top with poppy seed and yellow food coloring just before serving.

Saute onion in butter until tender, then stir in flour. Add milk gradually. When boiling stir in cheese until melted. Remove from heat and add sherry. Stir in ham and tomatoes. Season to taste. Sprinkle with parsley just before serving.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees. Grease a 20cm x 30cm slice tin. Cream together the butter and sugars. Add the honey, egg and vanilla. Sift in the flour and baking powder. Mix to a firm dough. Press into the base of the tin. Sprinkle the oats and walnuts over the top. Melt the chocolate and spread over the top of the slice. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Cool before cutting.

Cook bacon until crisp in a 12 inch skillet over medium heatdrain on paper towels. In same skillet, saute garlic in bacon drippings until golden. Add pasta, tomatoes, and bacontoss well. Add spinachstir until wilted. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Combine all but dried fruit in saucepan over medium heat until thick, stirring often. Turn off heat and add vanilla whey protein powder. Stir to combine thoroughly. Pour into 8x8 square baking dish and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool. Cut into bars or squares. Top each bar with dried fruit and a piece of chocolate.

In a large bowl, combine eggs, brown sugar and salt. Beat until smooth. Add baking soda and vanilla and mix until fluffy. Add flour and oatmeal and mix well. Pour batter into a greased 13x9x2in baking pan and bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until golden brown and firm to the touch. Sprinkle chocolate chips and coconut over top and bake an additional 5 minutes or until chocolate is melted and coconut is lightly browned. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add chicken tenders and saute until tender and no longer pink inside. Season with salt and pepper. Remove chicken from skillet. Pour off excess oil and fat from pan. Heat olive oil over medium heat and saute mushrooms until tender. Add lemon juice and chicken broth. Whisk together flour and marsala wine and pour over mushroom mixture. Simmer over low heat until thickened, about 5 minutes. Return chicken to pan. Heat through and serve.
Separate eggs. Beat yolks until thickened. Stir in bologna, relish and dressing. Fold in egg whites. Spread on bread. Slice tomato. Top sandwich. Cut into triangles.

In a saucepan over medium heat, bring milk just to a boil. Gradually add the egg yolks, stirring constantly until smooth. Season with salt, black pepper and parsley. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon. Transfer to a bowl and stir in cheeses until melted. Do not let boil or overcook or eggs will curdle. To serve, place a slice of tomato on top of each muffin. Top with a dollop of cheese mixture. Place 4 bacon slices on each muffin. Broil for a few minutes until cheese is melted and bacon is crisp.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken thighs in a roasting pan and season with salt and pepper. Place the chicken in a roasting pan and season with the salt and pepper. In a heavy skillet or saucepan, heat the olive oil. Add the onions and garlic and cook over moderate heat until the onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the red wine and bring to a boil. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in the ginger root and the cumin and chili powder and cook for 1 minute longer. Pour the mixture over the chicken and cover the roasting pan tightly with foil. Bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes. Uncover the pan and cook for 10 to 15 minutes longer. Stir in the parsley and serve hot.

In a saucepan over low heat, melt butter. Add mushrooms and saute until tender. Stir in flour until well blended. Remove from heat and slowly add mushroom liquid. Return to heat and stir until thickened. Add red wine and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer until reduced by one third. Season with salt and black pepper. Set aside and keep warm. In a small skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Dip filet mignon into flour and then into egg. Fry in hot oil until golden brown on both sides. Place filet mignon in center of each plate and top with sauce. Serve with sliced tomatoes.
In a medium bowl combine cabbage, vinegar, apple cider vinegar, sugar substitute, celery seed and black pepper. Coverrefrigerate at least 30 minutes. Stir well. Serve. Yields 4 servings.

Place tea bags in a glass container and pour boiling water over tea bags. Allow tea to steep for five minutes. Strain tea and add mint leaves. Add splenda granular and stir. Place ice cube in glasses, then add mango juice and top with tea.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over moderate heat. Add flour, stirring constantly, and saute for a few minutes. Slowly add water and stir until a smooth gravy is formed. Add salt and cayenne. Cook for a few minutes more. Add sweet potato and pecan pieces. Stir gently and cook just until potato is tender. Serve immediately over any meat.

Cook beans in boiling water until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. Peel potatoes and cut into cubes. Place in a large bowl. Add beans and dressing. Mix well. Serve with lettuce leaves. Top with olives, capers and tomatoes. Dressing: combine all ingredients in a jar or bowl. Shake. Taste. Add more of any ingredient to your liking. Chill.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9-inch pie plate with cooking spray. Mix cake mix, 1 stick butter and 1 egg with fork in large bowl. Press mixture onto bottom of prepared pie plate. Bake 12 min. Spread pumpkin pie filling over cake mixturesprinkle with 1/4 cup chopped walnuts. Bake 5-7 min. or until filling is set. Meanwhile, beat remaining 1 stick butter and remaining 1/2 cup sugar in small bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. Add 1 tsp cinnamon and beat 1 min. more or until well blended. Spread over pie and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup chopped walnuts. Serve immediately or chill.

Cut zucchini into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Heat oil in skillet over med high heat until hot. Add zucchini to pan and cook until tender and lightly browned, about 4 minutes. Remove pan from heat and add pepper flakes to taste. Stir in mint.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cut chicken into 1/2-inch strips. Melt butter in 9-inch-square baking dishsprinkle with dressing mix and Parmesan cheese. Arrange chicken over dressing mix. Sprinkle with cornflakes. Bake uncovered 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center and juices run clear, stirring once during baking. Yield 4 servings.

Butter a baking tin 20cm square. Sift the demerara sugar into it. Add the golden syrup. Heat the porridge oats gently in a small pan with the milk. Add to the syrup mixture. Mix well. Turn into the prepared tin. Bake at 350 for 40-50 minutes. Cut into squares when cool. Dust with demerara sugar to serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl, beat together margarine and sugar. Beat in eggs and vanilla. In a small bowl, combine flour, salt and baking soda. Beat into sugar mixture. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Shape into 1 inch balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10-12 mins or until very light brown around edges. Cool 1 minuteremove from pans to wire racks. Cool completely.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl until well mixed. Serve in sandwiches.
In microwave safe mug, combine milk and peanut butter. Microwave 1 minute at a time. Once melted and combined, add sugar and cocoa powder. Stir well. Top with marshmallows and dark chocolate chips.

Bring a large pot of water to boil and add pasta. Cook for 8-10 minutes or until al dente. Drain pasta and set aside. In a skillet, melt butter and saute green onions for 2 minutes. Stir in soy sauce and ginger and continue to cook for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Stir in pasta and toss to combine. Season to taste with garlic powder. Serve immediately.

Place one tortilla on each of two plates, spreading about 1 tablespoon cheese onto the tortilla. Spread a thin layer of hummus over the cheese. Sprinkle each tortilla with about 1 cup caponata. Top each tortilla with baby spinach and sliced mushrooms. Roll up each tortilla and serve immediately.

Grease 13x9x2-inch pan or 12-cup fluted tube pan with shortening or cooking spray. In a large bowl, stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and nutmeg. In a small bowl, stir together oil, eggs, vanilla, walnuts and lemon juice. Add to flour mixturestir just until moistened. Stir in apples. Pour batter into pan. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 30-35 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

Cut bacon into small pieces and fry in large skillet until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Sauté onion in bacon fat until onion is transparent. Add potatoes. Pour in enough chicken broth to cover potatoes. Add mushrooms. Simmer until potatoes are done. Blend soup with milk. Add to pot. Heat through. Serve hot. Garnish with parsley. Makes 6 servings.

Prepare the loaf pan by covering the bottom and sides of the pan with foil. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute for 5 minutes or until soft. Add the garlic and saute for 30 seconds. Stir the onion and garlic mixture into the ground pork and ground beef. Add the ketchup, egg and breadcrumbs to the meat mixture and mix well. Form the meat mixture into a loaf and place it into the foiled pan. Bake for 1 1/2 hours or until the meat is cooked through. Remove the loaf from the pan and place it on a serving plate. Remove the foil from the pan and pour the pan juices over the top of the meatloaf. Sprinkle the top of the meatloaf with the parmesan cheese. Bake the meatloaf for an additional 5 minutes.

Boil pasta in a large pot of water in a large pot of boiling water for 10-12 minutes or until tender. Drain well in a colander or strainer. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken in the pan for 3-4 minutes per side or until cooked through. Transfer chicken to a plate. Add green beans to pancook 1 minute or until crisp-tender. Add red pepper to pancook 1 minute or until crisp-tender. Return chicken to pan. Stir in broth, teriyaki sauce, and green onionscook 1 minute or until heated through. Add linguinetoss to combine. Serve immediately. Makes 2 servings (6 cups). Nutritional Information Per Serving Calories 535 Fat 15g (20%) Saturated Fat 5g (20%) Carbohydrates 61g (21%) Dietary Fiber 4g (15%) Sugars 7g Protein 37g Sodium 1413mg

Grate ginger and garlic into a food processor. Add sugar and salt. Process until smooth and add vinegar. Slowly add oil and process until dressing is thick and smooth. Pour dressing over tomatoes and onion and top with fresh coriander leaves. Serve immediately.

Peel and cut eggplant into small cubes. Dissolve salt into the water and place eggplant in the water and let it soak for 10 minutes. Remove eggplant and squeeze out the water. Mash eggplant into a bowl with the tahini and garlic and add salt and pepper to taste. Slowly add the stock and blend with the lemon juice. Place a few tablespoons of eggplant mixture into each bowl, top with a dollop of yogurt and sprinkle with parsley.

Heat grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Spread margarine on one side of bread and lay flat on grill until margarine melts and bread begins to brown, about 1 minute. Turn bread over and sprinkle with garlic and drizzle with oil. Top bread with spinach and brie cheese slices. Grill until spinach is wilted and cheese is melted and browned on the edges, about 1 minute per side. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Melt butter in a soup pot over medium high heat. Add the onions and saut until tender. Add the carrots and celery and saute until softened and the onion is translucent. Add the saffron threads and broth and bring the mixture to a boil. Add the frozen corn and reduce heat to a simmer. Simmer for about 10-15 minutes until the corn is tender. Add the parsley and the noodles and simmer until the noodles are tender. Serve hot and garnish with fresh parsley and a pinch of saffron threads. Makes about 4-6 servings.
Fry bacon and brown onions. Drain bacon and onions. Add beans to onions and bacon. Mix together remaining ingredients and pour over beans and onions. Bake uncovered 2 hours. Serve with hot cornbread.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine the brussels sprouts with minced garlic, ginger, onion, red pepper flakes, and soy sauce. Cover and bake for 30 to 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender. Uncoverstir in sesame oil. Serve.

Heat the oil in a pan or wok until it is hot. Add the curry paste and stir fry for a minute or so. Add the pork and stir fry for 3 or 4 minutes. Add the coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Simmer gently for 15 minutes, stirring from time to time. Add the corn kernels and the fresh or frozen peas. Cook for a further 10 minutes or so. Remove from the heat and stir in the lime juice and rind, then the fish sauce and the brown sugar. Season with a little more fish sauce and sugar if necessary. Sprinkle with the Thai basil leaves and serve.

Bake pie shell according to directions. In large mixing bowl, combine whipping cream, cheese, eggs, ranch salad dressing mix. Add bacon. Spread mixture into pie shell. Bake 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Sprinkle with paprika. Cool 15 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

Combine all salami loaf ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Mix until thoroughly combined. Divide mixture into six equal portions. Form each portion into a loaf shape and place in a greased 9"x5" loaf pan. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree oven for 30-35 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 165 degrees. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before slicing and serving.

Sift together flour and baking powder. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add Splenda, eggs, and water. Beat until smooth. Let stand 5 minutes. Drop from 1/2 cup measure onto hot waffle iron. Cook until done. Makes 12 4" waffles.

Combine chili powder, brown sugar, cumin, garlic powder and cayenne pepper. Rub into both sides of the meat. Set aside 10 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together vinegar and next 5 ingredients. Add meat to the bowl and turn to coat both sides. Place meat in a shallow roasting pan and roast 1 1/2 hours in a 350 degrees F oven. Turn steak once and continue roasting 30 minutes. Remove from the roasting pan. Place meat on a cutting board. Cover with foil and let stand for 5 minutes. Cut into 1/2-inch slices against the grain. Sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a 9 by 13-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Place chicken breasts in pan. In a small bowl, combine oil, garlic and pepper. Brush over chicken. Bake uncovered 40 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl combine wine and tomatoes. Remove chicken from oven and pour tomato mixture over it. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until chicken is tender. Serve with rice.

Halve eggs lengthwise. Scoop yolks into bowl. Mash yolks lightly with fork. Add all remaining ingredients except shrimp. Stir well until smooth. Fold in shrimp. Spoon into egg white halves. Garnish with additional dill if desired. Serves 4.

Combine the first three ingredients. Combine the next three ingredients. Beat together the first and second mixtures. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Sprinkle cheese over the top during the last 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly butter a madeleine pan with butter or pan spray. In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, sugar, vanilla and orange extract until well combined. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder and salt. Add flour mixture to the wet mixture in batches, whisking just until incorporated (do not overmix). Fold in butter until it is fully incorporated. Pour batter into the prepared pan. Bake for about 15 minutes or until edges are light brown and toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to finish cooling. Dust lightly with powdered sugar before serving.

Mix the ground almonds and breadcrumbs together, add the walnuts and mix well. Melt the butter in a medium pan, then add the sugar and stir well. Cook for a few minutes on medium heat, then add the egg yolk. Cook for a minute more, then take off the heat. Mix the walnut mixture with the egg butter mixture and combine well. Arrange the apricots in a greased pie dish. Spoon the walnut mixture over the apricots. Bake for 15 minutes at 325F / 165C / Gas 3. Remove from the oven, cool down and serve cold or at room temperature.

Bring water to a boil. Add spinach and cook for 2-3 minutes or until wilted. Drain. Heat olive oil in skillet. Add garlic and saute for a minute or so. Add spinach and salt and pepper to taste. Cook until heated through. Garnish with tomatoes and parmesan cheese if desired. Serve immediately.

Butter 2 9-inch pie plates. Combine garlic and parsley in a small bowl. Crumble 1 biscuit into each pie plate. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and parsley. Saute until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add 1/4 cup Parmesan and stir until melted. Drizzle over biscuit mixture. Repeat with remaining biscuits and Parmesan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine the wild rice, onion and seasonings in the slow cookerstir well. Add the broth, water, mushrooms, thyme leaves and bay leavesstir well. Cover and cook on HIGH for 3-4 hours or on LOW for 6-8 hours or until rice is tender. Remove bay leaves before serving. Serve with roasted chicken or other meats.

In a food processor, combine cheeses and ale. Process until smooth. Add mustard and cayenne pepper. Process until blended. Transfer to a serving bowl. Sprinkle with parsley and pecans. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine first 4 ingredients. Add wings and toss. Place in single layer in a shallow baking dish. Bake for 40 minutes, stirring once. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Brush over wings and bake for 10 minutes more or until wings are browned and crisp. Serve with the remaining sauce.

Beat eggs and milk together in a bowl. Add cheese and chilies and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add bacon bits and cook until crisp. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon to paper towels and set aside. Pour egg mixture into skillet and cook over low heat until it begins to thicken and is no longer runny. Remove from heat and sprinkle with bacon bits and hot sauce. Spoon onto sour cream topped tostadas and serve.

Peel the apples and cut in half crosswise. Remove the core and slice each half in half again, making quarters of the apples. Toss in a large bowl with the grapes, mandarin oranges and marshmallows. In another bowl, combine the yogurt, lime juice and zest, and pour over the fruit salad. Garnish with nuts and serve immediately or cover and refrigerate overnight.

Bring water to boil over medium-high heat in a large saucepan. Add green beans and cook 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and rinse under cold waterdrain again. Toss with vinegar and oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with cherry tomatoes, basil and red onion. Crumble feta over top and serve.

In a large saucepan, bring the milk to a boil. Peel the potatoes and cut them in half. Add the potatoes to the milk. Simmer for 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. While the potatoes are cooking, heat the butter in a medium frying pan. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent. Add the kale and cook for another minute. In a large bowl, mash the potatoes until smooth. Add the butter from the frying pan, the milk from the saucepan, the sour cream, kale, onions and the salt and pepper. Stir well to combine.

Place fillets in a non stick skillet. Add mirin and miso. Cook for 4 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Meanwhile combine the remaining ingredients in a saucepan. Heat to a boil. Cook until thickened. Pour sauce over fish. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter two 8-inch rounds cake pans. In a saucepan combine chocolate chips, butter, granulated sugar, eggs and vanilla. Stir over low heat until mixture is smooth. Divide mixture evenly between cake pans. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until tops are firm. Remove from oven. Top each cake with a few marshmallows. Return to oven. Bake for 1 minute or until marshmallows are puffed. Remove from oven. Spread a layer of melted semi-sweet chocolate on top of each cake. Spread a layer of powdered sugar on top of each cake.

In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, oil, milk and salt. Stir well. Add sausages. Heat a frying pan with oil. Flatten sausages with your hands. Fry the sausages until golden brown. Pour tomato sauce on top. Serve immediately.

Cook the macaroni in boiling salted water for 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain well. Add bacon, milk, onion and peas to the macaroni mixture and mix well. Add cheddar cheese and mix well until melted. Pour mixture into a 9 by 13 inch baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees F.

Melt the chocolate and butter in a small saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until smooth. Remove from heat and whisk in evaporated milk, then stir in sugar and vanilla until well blended. Serve warm.

In a small bowl combine sugar, lime juice and cornstarch. Set aside. Heat stock in a medium saucepan over medium high heat. Add the ginger and salmon and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the bok choy and cook for another minute. Add the chili and cook until soft and tender. Stir in the cornstarch mixture and stir constantly until it thickens. Remove from heat and stir in the soy sauce. Ladle into soup bowls and garnish with the coriander. Serve with extra lime wedges.

Saute the onion in the oil and butter until translucent. Add scallions and gingerroot and saute one minute longer. Stir in the rice and saute for 1 minute. Pour in the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the liquid is absorbed. Add the snow peas and cook until crisp tender. Stir in the sesame seeds.

Cook broccoli in a mixture of 2 tablespoons butter, 1 teaspoon onion, 1/2 teaspoon tabasco and 1/4 teaspoon salt until tender, about 8 minutes. Combine remaining 1/2 teaspoon butter and 1/2 teaspoon onion with 1/4 cup mayonnaise in a bowl and stir in 2 eggs until blended. Add broccoli and half of the cheddar cheesemix well. Spoon into 13x9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spraysprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with the herbed breadcrumbsbake an additional 5 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Cut the stems off the mushroom caps, then slice them into quarters. In a medium saucepan combine cream cheese, ricotta cheese, garlic powder, pepper, and saltheat over low heat until cheese meltsstir until well blended and smooth. Spoon cheese mixture into the mushroom caps. Sprinkle with cheese and bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 5 minutestop with tomato sauce and bake for an additional 5 minutes or until the mushrooms are heated through and the cheese is bubbly.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c).Line a baking sheet with foil. In a shallow dish combine breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, romano cheese, seasonings, parsley, paprika, and garlicstir to blend. In a small saucepan melt butter over low heatremove from heat. Dip each chicken breast into melted butter, then into breadcrumb mixture to coat evenly. Place on prepared baking sheetbake at 400 degrees f (200 degrees c) for 15 to 20 minutes or until done. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

To marinate shrimps, combine lime juice, honey, soy sauce and vegetable oil in a shallow bowl. Add Jamaican jerk spice and hot pepper sauce to taste. Stir well. Add prawns, coat well. Refrigerate for about 1 hour. Soak wooden skewers in water for 15 minutes. Thread prawns onto soaked wooden skewers. Grill or broil skewers on high heat for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until prawns are firm.

Combine bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, oregano, lemon zest, salt & pepper in a small bowl. On a plate, combine flour & lemon juice. Dip flounder fillets in flour, then in egg mixture. Next dip in bread crumb mixture. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté fish in oil until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Serve hot.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook shrimp just until pink, about 2 minutes. Drain and cool in ice water. In a food processor, combine tomatoes, 2 tbs lime juice and 1 tbs fish sauce, pureeing until smooth. Transfer soup to a large saucepanstir in shrimp, mushrooms, 2 tbs lime juice, 1 tbs fish sauce, the kaffir lime leaves, lemongrass and red chili peppers. Heat soup over medium-low heat until just simmering. Taste soup and season with more fish sauce if desired. Ladle soup into bowls and garnish with cilantro and chili paste.

Preheat oven to 400. Shape beef into burgers. Heat oil in pan over medium heat and cook burgers 3-5 minutes on each side or until no longer pink inside. Remove from heat and set aside. Combine crumbs, onion, seasoning salt, pepper and garlic and mix well. Spread inside of burger with cheese and crumb mixture and bake for 5-7 minutes or until cheese is melted and crumbs are golden brown. Melt Worcestershire sauce and egg together and brush on top of burgers during the last 3 minutes of cooking. Makes 4 burgers.

Place broccoli in a large saucepan of boiling water for 1 minutedrain and transfer broccoli to an ice bath. Drain well, then arrange on a platter. In a small saucepan, combine garlic, vinegar, and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heatremove pan from heat and let cool. In a large bowl, whisk together mustard and oiladd vinegar mixture and season with salt and pepper. Pour vinaigrette over broccoli and toss gently.

Prepare the pork roast as per recipe instructions (remove fat and add spices) and cook in oven. When cooked, remove from bone and set aside. Strain the cooking liquid through a sieve into another saucepan. Bring to the boil, add the gravy granules, sweet potatoes, diced tomatoes, bell peppers, frozen peas and bay leaf. Cook for 10 minutes or until the sweet potatoes are tender. Season to taste with thyme and hot sauce. Place pork roast into the saucepan and cook for 10 more minutes until piping hot. Serve with cooked rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Grease 13 x 9 inch pan. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except chocolate chips. Mix until combined. Press into prepared pan. Bake 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Sprinkle chocolate chips over hot bars. Let stand 2 minutes until melted. Spread chocolate evenly over bars. Cool completely. Cut into bars.

In a large nonreactive saucepan bring the peaches, lemon juice, and sugar to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring frequently, until the peaches are very soft and the mixture is thickened and reduced by about half, about 1 hour, 10 minutes. Stir in the nutmeg and remove from the heat. Let cool slightly then spoon into sterilized jars and seal. Makes about 4 cups.

Cut the pears into 1/4-inch slices. Arrange them on a platter. Mix the honey with the pineapple juice. Drizzle the honey mixture over the pear slices. Sprinkle with the fruit fresh. Serve immediately.
Place all ingredients in a small baking dish. Bake at 375 for about an hour or until rice is tender and crust is golden brown. Serve with chicken or fish.

Preheat oven to 375F. In a large bowl combine brown sugar, eggs and vanilla. Add melted butter. Mix well. Add flour, a little at a time until you have a dough that you can roll into a ball. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool on wire rack. Dust with confectioners sugar if desired.
Place all ingredients into a 4-6 quart slow cooker. Cook on low for 8-10 hours. Serve in bowls and garnish with shredded carrots.
Combine in skillet onion and mushrooms with butter and sugar. Cook till tender and remove to plate. Add frozen peas and heat through. Salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat grill to medium. Combine apple juice concentrate and mustardwhisk in vinegar, paprika and 1/2 teaspoon each pepper and salt. Thread trout with apple slices and secure with wooden skewer. Grill 5-7 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Makes 4 servings.

Beat egg white until foamy. Add egg and blend well. Stir in pumpkin, evaporated milk, sugar substitute, cinnamon, vanilla and salt. Pour into greased 1-quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees 30 minutes or until set. Serve hot or cold. Serves 4.

Combine egg and salsa in a bowl. In another bowl mix ground beef, mexican seasoning, and breadcrumbs. Form into patties. Dip patties in egg mixture. Top each patty with a slice of cheese. Fry in hot oil for 1 to 2 minutes per side. Serve on buns.
Boil water. Remove from heat. Stir in milk. Add coffee. Stir in brown sugar to taste. Stir in strawberry milk mix and blend until smooth. Serve over ice with whipped cream if desired.

Combine ground sirloin, onion and tomato sauce in a large pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until meat is tender. Add diced tomatoes and continue to simmer. Add kidney beans and chili powder. Cook until heated. Serve over cooked spaghetti and top with grated cheese and sour cream. Serving size is 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 F. In a shallow roasting pan (11 x 15 x 2-inch), place steaks in one layer. Sprinkle each steak generously with coarse salt and black pepper. Drizzle steaks with 1 Tbsp. of the oil and rub evenly over both sides. Sprinkle with oregano and thyme. Bake steaks about 25 minutes until browned and cooked through (135 F when tested with an instant-read thermometer). Remove steaks from roasting pan and set aside. In the same pan over medium heat, combine 2 Tbsp. of the oil with the garlic and crushed red pepper. Saute 1 minute. Stir in tomato paste and cook 1 minute. Stir in the whole tomatoes and the juice from 1 lemon. Stir in the remaining 2 Tbsp. of olive oil. Simmer sauce about 10 minutes or until thickened. Slice steaks across grain into 1/2-inch thick slices. Serve steaks with sauce.

Combine the first two ice creams in a freezer-safe container and freeze for at least two hours. Spread the fruit and pine nuts on top of the ice cream. Serve immediately or return to freezer until ready to serve.

Combine first 7 ingredients in a large pot. Add brothbring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer until beans are tender, about 1 hour. Stir in kale. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes more. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Top each serving with Parmesan.

Brown steaks in butter on both sides, then remove from pan. Place steaks in casserole dish. Add roquefort cheese and brandy, then pour cream over steaks. Salt and pepper to taste, then cover tightly with foil. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with rice and steamed asparagus.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large roasting pan with 1/2 inch sides or a large baking sheet, toss asparagus with olive oil and parmesan cheese. Roast for 8 minutes or until asparagus is crisp-tender. Remove from oven. Add butter and toss gently until melted. Sprinkle with fresh chives and serve at once with lemon wedges for squeezing over and fresh radishes on the side if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan with butter. In a large bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir in the milk and egg. Stir in the butter and milk until well mixed. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle over the top of the warm bread. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Remove the seeds and fibers from the spaghetti squash using a spoon. Then place the squash on a baking sheet and add the extra virgin olive oil, yellow sweet onion, garlic clove and season with sea salt and cracked black pepper. Bake the squash for about 30 minutes or until the squash is cooked through. In the meantime combine the chopped tomatoes with the feta cheese and the chopped olives. Remove the squash from the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes. Use a fork to scrape the spaghetti squash into strands and add the chopped tomatoes and feta cheese and mix well. Add the chopped basil and serve warm.

Sprinkle chuck with taco seasoning. Heat oil in a large skillet. Brown chuck in hot oil. Drain. Add onion to skilletcook and stir until tender. Stir in tomato sauce. Transfer mixture to a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Mix baking mix with milk. Stir in eggs. Pour over chuck mixture. Sprinkle with corn and cheese. Bake in 350f oven 30-40 minutes.

Cream butter with sugar. Add egg and vanilla. Mix. Slowly add flour. Roll into balls. Roll in colored sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 7 minutes. Let cool. Decorate as desired. Makes about 2 dozen cookies.
Combine all ingredients into a blender and puree for 30 seconds. Serves 2.

Drain the peppers and onions and chop coarsely. Heat oil in a Dutch oven or large skillet over medium heat and add the bell peppers and onions. Cook and stir until the vegetables are crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and tomato paste and mix well. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about an hour. Stir frequently so the tomatoes dont burn. Add the hamburger and mix well. Simmer over low heat until the hamburger is cooked through and the sauce is thickened, about an hour and a half longer.

Heat canola oil in saut pan over medium-high heat. Add garlic, reduce heat to medium-low heat and saut garlic, stirring constantly, for about 2 minutes or until golden. Add the lime juice and zest and cook for about 2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper. Pour over chicken or fish just before serving.
Mix dry ingredients together and add water. Dip fish into mixture and fry until golden brown on both sides. Serve with tartar sauce and lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 9x13-inch cake pan. In a medium-sized bowl, cream together the butter, sugar, and eggs. Beat in the eggnog, vanilla extract, and cinnamon until well blended. In a separate small bowl, mix together the flour and baking powderstir into batter. Fold in the pecans. Spread the mixture into the prepared cake panbake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven.

In a small saucepan over low heat melt the chips with the extract. Add the sugar a little bit at a time to avoid clumping until the sauce is the consistency you like. Pour into a small serving dish and let cool completely. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 10-12 minutes or until pasta is al dente. Drain and transfer pasta to a large bowl. Toss pasta with broccolini. Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add ricotta cheese and cook, stirring constantly, until cheese is smooth and bubbly. Add thyme and cook for 30 seconds. Remove from heat. Stir in 2 tablespoons of the lemon zest and season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour cheese mixture over pasta and toss to coat. Transfer to a serving platter. Garnish with remaining lemon zest.

In a heavy medium saucepan melt butter and add lemon juice. Add fresh basil, cayenne pepper, fresh oregano, garlic, bay leaf, black pepper and salt. Cook until boiling. Add shrimp to the saucepan. Cook until shrimp is pink, about 3 to 4 minutes. Serve with pasta, rice or bread.
Grate the gingerroot and garlic into a bowl. Add the white wine and canola oil. Beat until smooth. Add wasabi powder. Stir well. Makes about 1 cup.

Combine 2 1/2 cups rhubarb and 1 cup sugar in 1-quart saucepan. Cook over low heat until rhubarb is soft. Stir in 1/2 cup of crushed pineapple. Cool. In a 9x9x3-inch pan combine rhubarb mixture and 1/4 cup sugar. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Combine 1/2 cup pineapple with 1 tablespoon sugar in small bowl. Set aside. Place 1 tablespoon pineapple mixture and 1/2 cup chopped strawberry in each of 6 3-ounce molds. Top with 1 tablespoon pineapple mixture. Spoon 2 tablespoons rhubarb mixture on top. Repeat layers 1 time. Top with 1 tablespoon pineapple mixture. Cover each mold with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. To unmold, run a knife around edge of each mold and invert onto serving plates. Garnish with 1 maraschino cherry.

Cut cabbage into small pieces and mix with carrot. In small bowl combine milk, mayonnaise and buttermilk. Beat until well mixed. Add vinegar and lemon juice and mix well. Pour over cabbage and carrots and refrigerate until serving time. Serve on lettuce or cabbage leaves with salt and pepper to taste.

In a large bowl, mix together the flour, cheese, paprika, milk & salt. Knead together on a lightly floured surface until the dough holds together. Cut the dough into small rounds & press into scones. Place on a lightly greased baking tray. Bake in a moderate oven for about 25 minutes or until lightly browned.
Combine gelatin & water. Mix well. Add the berries. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Refrigerate overnight. Slice. Makes 16 bars.

Mix turkey with thyme, garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Divide into six patties. In a separate bowl mix goat cheese and eggs. Lay out one burger patty and place a portion of the goat cheese on top. Press down firmly to spread. Top with another patty and seal the edges. Repeat with remaining burgers. Grill or pan fry. Serve on hamburger buns.

Cut chicken breast into thin strips. Add seasoning mix. In a large skillet, brown chicken in butter. Drain. In a crock pot, add chicken, salsa, peppers, corn, onion and flour. Cook on low 6 to 8 hours. Stir occasionally. Serve with sour cream and guacamole.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the fettuccine until al dente. Drain the pasta and set aside. In a large skillet heat the butter. Add the green onions and saute over medium heat for 1-2 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are brown. Add the salt and pepper and mix well. Add the cooked fettuccine and stir over medium heat until the fettuccine is well coated. Add the whipping cream and toss. Add the frozen peas and ham and toss until the peas are heated through. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Boil sweet potatoes until very tender. Drain and mash with sugar and butter. Add eggs and vanilla and mix well. Sift together flour and nutmeg and add gradually to the potato mixture while stirring constantly until a smooth batter forms. Pour into a greased and floured 10-inch tube pan and bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for one hour and twenty minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the top with brown sugar and pecans. Bake uncovered in the oven for another half hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let the casserole cool for about five minutes before removing from the pan and serving.

Preheat oven to 375. Grease bundt pan. Beat together margarine sugar and eggs. Add pudding mix. In another bowl combine bread cubes nuts cinnamon and margarine. Pour bread mixture over pudding mixture. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes.

Boil potatoes for 30 minutes in water. Drain and let cool. Chop celery and add to potatoes. Peel and de-shell shrimp. Add to celery and potatoes. Add pickle relish, hardboiled egg, salt and black pepper. Fold in sour cream and mayonnaise. Sprinkle with italian salad dressing mix. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Place all the ingredients for the bread into the bread pan of the machine in the order recommended by the manufacturer and set on dough cycle. When cycle is complete, remove dough from pan and shape into a loaf. Place on a greased baking sheet and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 220 degrees Celsius for about 40 minutes or until loaf is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom. Remove loaf from pan and cool on rack. Slice and serve warm.

In a large bowl, combine buttermilk, garlic, hot sauce, salt. Marinate the chicken in the mixture for at least one hour. Preheat oil to 350 degrees. In another bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, cornstarch. Drain the chicken breasts. Dip the chicken in the flour mixture, then shake off the excess. Fry the chicken until the coating is brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Slice brownie in half. Scoop out the middle and fill with vanilla ice cream. Replace the brownie top on the ice cream. Cover in whipped cream and caramel sauce. Drizzle hot fudge over top of dessert. Sprinkle with rainbow sprinkles.

Soften butter and combine with peanut butter. Cream together with granulated and brown sugars. Add egg and beat well. Combine with dry mix and mix well. Divide dough into 36 equal portions and place 1 toffee piece in each. Roll into ball and place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 11 to 13 minutes. Melt the chocolate hazelnut spread and pour over warm blossoms. Drizzle with powdered sugar. Let cool slightly before removing from pan. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Line a 9 inch square pan with aluminum foil, letting the foil extend over the sides of the pan. In a large bowl stir together the flour, brown sugar and baking powder. Add the butter and stir until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the eggs. Spread half of the batter evenly in the bottom of the prepared pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until light golden. Remove from oven. Sprinkle chocolate chips and nuts over the top of the crust. Spread remaining batter evenly over the top. Bake for 15 minutes or until topping is golden brown. Cool bars in the pan on a wire rack. Using the foil handles lift the bars from the pan. Cut into bars. Makes about 2 dozen bars.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. In a small bowl, combine banana, nectarine and honey. Melt butter in skillet. Place a tortilla in skillet. Top with 2 tablespoons banana mixture. Sprinkle with pecans. Fold in half. Cook 1 minute per side or until golden brown. Repeat with remaining tortillas. Serve with syrup.

In a skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Cut the apple into 1/2" slices. Spread the creamy peanut butter on one slice of bread. Spread the apple slices on the other slice of bread. Arrange the apple slices on one slice of bread. Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon cayenne on the apple. Spread the bacon over the apple. Spread the preserves on the bacon. Top the bacon with the second slice of bread. Spread the butter on the outside of the sandwich. Cook in a skillet over medium heat until golden brown on both sides. Cut in half. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl whisk together egg whites and water. In a shallow dish combine almonds and cornmeal. In another shallow dish combine flour and lemon pepper. Dredge fish in flour mixture. Dip in egg mixture. Dredge in almond mixture. Place in a single layer on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Turn fish. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Drain beans. Stir in seasoning mix. Spread beans in bottom of greased 2 quart casserole. Place breasts in single layer over beans. Sprinkle with ginger. Mix lime juice, mango and garlic. Spoon over chicken. Bake uncovered 30 to 35 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink (165 degrees f. ) Stir green onions into rice. Spoon over rice. Serve with chicken.
Place all the ingredients in a food processor and process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Combine raisins and orange juice in medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring often until liquid evaporates and raisins begin to plump. Stir in sugar and vinegarcontinue to cook until most liquid evaporates and raisins are plump. Stir in cranberries and orange zest. Cook until cranberries pop and mixture is thick. Let cool. Stir in ginger and walnuts. Chill overnight or longer before serving. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Serve over turkey or roast beef. Makes 2 cups.

In a chilled martini glass, pour the swiss almond chocolate liqueur. Float the cherry schnapps over the liqueur. Add coffee liqueur. Add coffee. Add white sugar. Stir well. Top the coffee with whipped cream. Sprinkle the almonds over top. Garnish with chocolate shavings. Serve.

In a small bowl, sprinkle gelatin over 2 cups cold water. Let stand until softened, about 2 minutes. In a small saucepan, bring remaining 1 cup water to a boil. Add gelatin mixture, stirring until gelatin is dissolved. Remove from heat. Stir in coffee. Let stand until cool. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese spread and sugar until smooth. Beat in dissolved gelatin mixture. Stir in whipping cream. Beat until smooth. In another bowl, beat eggs until frothy. Add 1/4 cup of the coffee mixture. Continue beating until smooth. Stir into cream cheese mixture. Beat until smooth. Pour into a 9x13-in. Dish. Garnish with coffee beans. Chill until firm.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour 2 loaf pans.Sift together the flour, baking powder and baking soda. Whisk the nonfat sour cream into the egg whites until smooth. Beat the vanilla extract into the egg mixture and then fold in the flour mixture. Divide the batter evenly between the two pans. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pans and cooling completely on wire racks.

Melt margarine in large saucepan. Add flour and evaporated milk. Cook and stir until thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in milk, sugar and vanilla. Beat eggs in small bowl. Stir into mixture until blended. Pour into greased 9x13x2-inch baking dish. Bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes or until set. Cool slightly. Sprinkle with nuts. Cut into squares and place in bottom of each serving dish. Layer with cookies and banana slices. Top with whipped cream if desired. Makes 16 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Wash potatoes and dry thoroughly. Drizzle potatoes with oil and season with salt and pepper. Place garlic cloves, sage and thyme on bottom of roasting pan. Lay potatoes on top of garlic and herbs. Roast for 1 hour, turning potatoes at least once. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Dip chicken pieces in flour and fry in hot fat until golden brown. Remove and place in baking dish. Add honey and soy sauce and cook until heated through. Sprinkle with chopped garlic.

Beat eggs with milk. Place breadcrumbs in a shallow dish. Heat oil in a skillet. Dip chicken breast halves in the egg mixture. Dip in breadcrumbs. Fry chicken halves on both sides in oil. Cook tomato in butter in a small saucepan for a few minutes. Spread cheese evenly over each chicken breast half. Place chicken breast halves on top of tomato. Broil for about 2 minutes or until cheese melts.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook garlic in oil for 1 minute. Add beef and cook until brown, stirring often. Stir in green beans, salt and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in walnuts. Serve over noodles.
Cook rice in water according to package directions, omitting salt. Fluff with fork. Stir in green onions, pepper, chili powder, oregano, lime juice, cilantro & salt. Serve with lime wedges & butter.

Boil asparagus in lightly salted water for 4 minutes or until crisp-tenderdrain and rinse with cold water. Meanwhile, whisk together soy sauce, oil, vinegar, sugar, and ginger in a small bowlset aside. Toss asparagus with sesame seedspour dressing over, tossing gently. Sprinkle with ground cumin and serve warm or chilled. Serving info is approximate.

Soak wheat berries in water overnight. Drain water. Add poppy seed and honey. Mix well. Bring to a boil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium low and cook for 20 to 30 minutes stirring often to prevent sticking to the bottom of the pot. Add nuts when the mixture has thickened. Cook for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat. Cool slightly and serve.

Spread one side of each slice of bread with cream cheese spread. Layer with tomato and turkey. Repeat on other half of each slice of bread. Cut each half of the sandwich in half to make 4 equal parts. Place each checkerboard on a serving platter. Serve with sour cream and sweet pickle relish. Makes 4 servings.

Bring water in pot to a boil for the brussels sprouts. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until sprouts are tender. Drain and set aside. Melt the butter in a large skillet. Sauté the onion in the melted butter until tender. Add the flour and stir constantly until browned. Add the stock and seasonings and bring to a boil. Add the sprouts and stir. Serve sprouts with the sauce spooned over the top.

Line bottom of 9-inch spring form pan with parchment paper. Melt chocolate and butter together in a double boiler. Cool slightly. Add sugar and eggs. Mix until well blended. Fold in flour. Spread batter in spring form pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Dust with confectioners sugar.

Preheat oven to 350. Bake ham 30 minutes per pound. Brush with glaze while ham is baking. Cook ham until a meat thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the ham reads 130 degrees. Makes 8-10 servings.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Brown chuck, drain fat from skillet. Add chopped onions, cook about 10 minutes. Add chili powder, tomato sauce, water, salt and black pepper. Cook about 1 hour or until tender. Mix garlic powder, cayenne powder and cornmeal. Combine with meat mixture and mix thoroughly. Place mixture in tamale pans or large baking dish (use a little water if mixture sticks). Place in 350 degree oven for about an hour or until heated through.

Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Season pork with salt and pepper. Add chicken broth, pineapple and mustard. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer until pork is cooked through, about 20 minutes. Stir in the remaining ingredients and cook until thickened. Spoon over pork.

Whisk together the lemon juice, mustard and olive oil in a large bowl until emulsified. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Toss the arugula, grapes & goat cheese with the dressing until combined. Top the salad with capers and serve immediately.

Cut mushrooms into small pieces. In medium skillet heat butter over medium heat, add mushrooms and saute till tender, add pepper and salt. Sprinkle flour over mushrooms and stir until thickened. Stir in milk and cook till thick and smooth. Serve over noodles or rice.

Mix cereal with boiling water in large bowl. Stir until cereal is well coated and liquid is absorbed. Stir in 1 cup coconut. Press into 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake at 350f for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from ovencool completely on wire rack. Combine milk and remaining 1/2 cup coconut in small bowlset aside. Melt butterscotch chips and chocolate chips togetherspread over cooled crust. Drizzle with the milk and coconut mixture. Sprinkle with nuts if desired. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into bars

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. In a medium skillet over medium-low heat, warm oil. Add onion and cook for about 5 minutes, or until very soft and translucent. In the meantime, combine eggs with hot sauce in a medium bowl. Cook eggs slowly over medium-low heat for about 5 minutes or until the egg is very thick and no liquid is visible. Remove skillet from heat and add egg mixture to the pan with the onions. Stir slowly with a rubber spatula for about 5 minutes or until the eggs are thickened and no liquid is visible. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Divide the egg mixture into two small bowls. Roll out the turkey slices to about 1/8 of an inch thick with a rolling pin or the bottom of a glass or wine bottle. Spread each slice of turkey with egg mixture. Top each with provolone cheese slices. Spread the tops of bagels with cream cheese or with margarine and top with the egg mixture/turkey sandwiches. Place bagels on a baking sheet and bake for about

Combine the coffee, condensed milk, and vanilla in a medium saucepan. Heat over medium heat until the mixture boils. Reduce the heat and simmer until the mixture is thickened, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool for about 10 minutes. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper or wax paper. Combine the coconut and almonds in a medium bowl. Add the condensed milk mixturemix well. Drop the mixture by the teaspoonful onto the prepared cookie sheet. Place a few slivered almonds on each macaroon. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Remove from the oven and cool. Store in an airtight container.
Pour cider into large pitcher. Add lemon juice and sugar. Stir well. Refrigerate several hours or overnight. Remove apple slices from pitcher before serving. Serve with ginger ale.

Preheat oven to 350F. Line baking sheet with waxed paper. Combine first four ingredients. Beat in peanut butter. Add milk. Beat until smooth. Stir in oats and vanilla. Add instant chocolate drink mix. Stir well. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto prepared baking sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until light golden. Cool on wire rack.

Dust chicken breasts with flour mixture, shaking off excess. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium high heat. Brown chicken breasts on both sides. Remove chicken from pan, and set aside. Add mushrooms and saute until they are tender. Add chicken stock, wine and lemon juice, and simmer until liquid is reduced by half. Add chicken back in the pan, cover and cook for 2 minutes. Serve over rice or pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 13 x 9 inch baking pan. In medium bowl, stir together first 4 ingredients. Spread in baking pan. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely in pan. In medium bowl, whisk together condensed milk, heavy whipping cream, vanilla, powdered sugar and pecansspread over cooled cake. Serve immediately or store covered in refrigerator. Serves 12.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a baking sheet with foil and grease with non stick cooking spray. Season tilapia with salt and pepper to taste. Lay on baking sheet and drizzle with butter. Sprinkle with dill and press into fish. Bake for 10 minutes on each side or until fish is golden brown and cooked through.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar, corn syrup and water. Bring to a boil. Cook without stirring until the mixture becomes thick. Remove from heat. Whisk in the heavy cream, butter and vanilla. Transfer to fondue pot. Keep warm over low heat. Serve with cake cubes, apple slices or other fruits. For a chocolate fondue, replace sugar mixture with 6 ounces semisweet chocolate. Melt chocolate in a double boiler or in the microwave. Whisk until smooth.

Heat the oven to 400 degrees. Drain the mushrooms well and pat them dry with paper towels. In a medium saut pan over medium heat add the olive oil and shallot and saut for 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and saut for 15 minutes, until they are browned and cooked through. In a 10-inch skillet, heat the olive oil and saut the shallot for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saut for 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes and wine and cook for 3 minutes. Add the basil and spinach and cook for 1 minute. Add the cooked mushrooms and the cheese and cook for 1 minute. Serve over the fettuccine and garnish with extra basil.

Cook pasta according to directions on package. While it is cooking, combine chicken with taco seasoning and stir well to coat with seasoning. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat until hot. Add garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add chicken mixture to skillet. Stir well to combine with oil and cook until heated through. Add heavy whipping cream to skillet and continue cooking for a few more minutes until cream is hot and well combined with the chicken mixture. Remove from heat and stir well to combine everything. Add cooked pasta to chicken mixture and stir well to combine with pasta and chicken mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese to serve.

In a large bowl combine eggs, sugar and butter. Blend until smooth. In another bowl, combine flour, salt and baking powder. Add flour mixture to the blender pie mixture. Stir until well combined. Stir in milk. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes. Cool completely before adding whipped topping and coconut.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Remove the tough inner ribs from the cabbage. Cut the cabbage into wedges. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until golden, about 1 to 2 minutes. Add the cabbage and sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Saute until tender and well browned, about 10 minutes. Transfer the cabbage to a baking dish and roast for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325f. Grease a 10-inch springform pan or line with parchment paper. In a large mixing bowl using an electric mixer beat together the butter and sugar until light. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Beat in the coffee and vanilla extract. Add the cocoa powder and flour beating until the batter is smooth. Pour batter into springform pan. Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes until the top of the cake is dry. Allow the cake to cool in the pan. When cake is cool remove from pan and transfer to serving plate. Dust with powdered sugar.

Brown ground chuck in a large skillet. Drain grease and set aside. Mix together chuck and diced tomatoes in a large bowl. Cook spaghetti noodles according to package directions and add to meat mixture. Stir in parsley and Italian seasoning and combine well. Spray 9x13 baking pan with cooking spray and spoon meat mixture into pan. Sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for one hour and then uncover and bake for additional hour or until top is lightly browned. Serve with freshly grated parmesan cheese and crusty Italian bread.
In blender combine all ingredients and blend well. Serve immediately in ice filled glasses.
Microwave chocolate and milk for one minute on high power until chocolate is melted. Stir in salt and raisins. Stir in peanuts. Spread on wax paper to cool and harden. Cut into squares.
In a large bowl combine lettuce and cucumber. Add lemon juice, olive oil, and black olives. Toss well. Add feta cheese. Toss lightly.

Preheat oven to 325f. Line a 9x9x2 inch baking dish with foil. Butter and flour foil. Pour brownie batter into dish. Bake 20 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out with crumbs attached. Cool. Beat cream cheese and sugar together. Add eggs, one at a time. Mix well. Beat in vanilla and sour cream. Spread filling over brownie layer. Bake 45 to 55 minutes or until edges are set. Cool. Refrigerate 4 hours. Run a knife along edge of foil. Lift and cool completely. Refrigerate.
Drain and rinse one 14.5 ounce can of garbanzo beans. Combine avocado, tofu, garlic, garbanzo beans, olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line 36 muffin cups with paper baking cups. In a large bowl, beat flour, baking powder and salt. In another bowl, beat granulated sugar, unsalted butter and egg until smooth. Beat in flour mixture alternately with yogurt. Divide batter among prepared muffin cups. Bake until cakes test done in center, 18-22 minutes. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Remove cakes from pan. Cool completely on wire racks. In a small bowl, beat confectioners' sugar, lemon zest and lemon juice until smooth. Drizzle over cakes. Makes 36.

Place all the ingredients into the crockpot. (Note: I use about 4 lbs. of beef bones with marrow to get enough stock for 4 large pots of soup.) Turn the crockpot to high and let it cook for 3-4 hours. Strain the stock into a large pot. You may need to add more cold water to the crockpot to get all the liquid out. Add the water to the stock in the pot. Turn the pot up to high and boil the stock until it is reduced by half. Skim the scum from the top. Let the stock cool to room temperature. Place the stock into jars, leaving 1/2 inch at the top for the stock to expand in the freezer. Remove the air bubbles from the jars. Freeze the stock. You can also make this stock on the stove top. Place the ingredients into the pot. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 3-4 hours. Strain the stock into a large pot. You may need to add more cold water to the crockpot to get all the liquid out. Add the water to the stock in the pot.

Boil sweet potato with skin on in a large pot of water for 30 minutes or until fork tender. Peel potato and mash with fork in bowl. Add garlic cloves and ginger and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. On a lightly floured surface, place one wonton wrapper in front of you with one corner pointing toward you. Place 1 t. of filling in center of wrapper and fold diagonally into triangle. Press edges together with finger tips and press tightly to seal. Place on baking sheet lined with parchment paper and repeat with remaining wrappers and filling. Lightly spray potstickers with cooking spray and bake for 15 - 20 minutes. Serve with sauce of your choice.

In a large bowl mix the onion with dried thyme leaves. In a small bowl mix the sugar, salt, and ground nutmeg. Dip chicken in butter and then into the sugar mixture and then into the thyme mixture. In a skillet heat the butter and the oil together over medium heat. Saute the chicken for about 3 minutes per side or until cooked through. Serve immediately with tabasco sauce on the side.

In a large saucepan, stir together the cornstarch and water. Whisk in the rhubarb and cook until the mixture thickens and boils. Add the wine and bring the mixture back to a boil. Reduce the heat and cook until the rhubarb is tender. Stir in the lemon slices. Whisk together the cornstarch and waterstir into the soup. Add the cinnamon and nutmeg and simmer until the soup is thick. Remove the cinnamon sticks and lemon slices. Stir in the cream and serve.

In a large pot over medium heat add oil and onion. Cook until soft. Add rice and celery. Cook for a few minutes. Add white wine. Cook until wine has evaporated. Add chicken stock cubes. Cover with boiling water. Cover pot with a lid. Simmer for 30-35 minutes. Add peas. Cook for a further 3-4 minutes. Stir in butter and parmesan cheese. Season to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place oysters and water in a heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for five minutes. Drain oysters in a colander and rinse with cold water to remove sand. Place drained oysters in a large bowl. In a small saucepan, combine margarine, flour, pepper and paprika. Cook and stir over medium heat for one minute or until thick and bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in milk. Stir into oysters. Pour into a large shallow baking pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Garnish with parsley and serve with crackers.

Mix turkey with vegetables. Spread 1/2 cup of the mixture on each tortilla. Sprinkle with cheese. Roll up. Put in 8x8 dish. Bake in 400f. oven for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with more cheese. Bake another 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Toss mushrooms and tofu with miso and water. Bring to boil and simmer 2 minutes. Add scallions and heat through. Serve with rice or toasted bread.

Whisk together the mayonnaise, oil, lemon juice, garlic and paprika. Season with salt and cumin and set aside. Heat the grill to medium-high heat. Meanwhile, place the asparagus in a large bowl and drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with a bit more salt and a few cumin seeds. Grill for 4-5 minutes per side, until tender but still crisp. Transfer to a platter and toss with the dressing.

Boil spinach until wilted, drain. Mix spinach with parmesan cheese, olive oil, bread crumbs, onion and garlic cloves. Season with salt, pepper, nutmeg and parsley. Line a greased pan with tomato slices. Pour the mixture over top, cover with more tomato slices. Bake at 350 for 30-40 min or until bubbly and light brown. Serve warm with a tossed salad.

In a large pot of boiling water, blanch carrots for 2 minutes or until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water to stop cooking process. In a large skillet, saute onion in butter until tender. Add carrots and cook until coated in butter. In a small bowl, combine flour and chicken broth. Add to skillet and stir until smooth. Add salt and pepper and continue stirring until thickened. Add dill and remove from heat. Stir in light cream and pour over cooked carrots and onions. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes and enjoy!

Mix together cream cheese and heavy cream in small bowl until smooth. Add onion and horseradish and mix well. Spread mixture evenly in the bottom of a greased baking dish or pie plate. Combine old bay and cheddar cheeses and mix well. Sprinkle over cream cheese mixture. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned. Sprinkle with chives and serve with crackers. Serves 10 as an appetizer.

In a small bowl combine garlic, dried hot red chili peppers and 1 tablespoon soy sauce. Heat 2 inches oil in a deep fryer or wok to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dip chicken in batter and fry until golden brown, turning once. Remove chicken from oil and drain on paper towels. Combine remaining soy sauce with honey and distilled white vinegardrizzle over chicken. Top with chopped green onions and serve.

Mix flour and ground pecans together in a large bowl. Beat butter and sugars together in another large bowl. Add flour mixture and mix well. Divide dough into one inch balls. Roll balls in superfine sugar. Place balls 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees F for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Store in an airtight container.

Heat oil in skillet. Add carrots and onion and cook until just tender. Add sausage and cook until brown. Add sauerkraut and cook 3 more minutes. Add wine and cook until just about evaporated. Add mustard and brown sugar and cook 5 more minutes. Stir in caraway seed and serve.

Boil the eggs for 10 minutes then cool under running water. Peel the eggs then cut in half. Remove the yolks and mix with the spinach and herb salad dressing. Spoon the filling back into the eggs. Put the yolks in a bowl and beat with the sherry wine, yoghurt, olive oil and herb salad dressing. Place the yolk filling into the eggs. Sprinkle with french mustard. Serve with crisp salad leaves.

Cook bacon in a large saucepan over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon and crumble into small pieces. Drain bacon fat and set aside. Cook onion and celery in the same pan until tender. Sprinkle with flour and stir until well blended. Add half-and-half, stirring constantly until thickened and smooth. Add clams, bacon and seasonings. Bring to a boil then simmer until heated through. Sprinkle with paprika and serve immediately with oyster crackers or bread.

Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees f. In a large bowl combine the corn, rice and egg. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon mixture into a greased casserole dish. Bake for about 25 minutes or until lightly browned.

In a large pot heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions, garlic, tomatoes, chili beans, black beans, small white beans and chicken broth. Bring the soup to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add the tortillas. Serve with shredded cheddar cheese.

Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a medium saute pan over medium high heat. Add shrimp and stir until lightly browned on both sides. Remove shrimp from pan, set aside. Add remaining butter, bourbon, cream, and tomato paste to pan. Stir over low heat until thickened and slightly reduced. Add shrimp back to pan along with lemon juice and chives. Stir until well mixed. Remove from heat, add pecans, stir well to combine and serve immediately.

Toast the roasted peanuts in a dry skillet for about 5 minutes until they're aromatic and slightly darkened. Heat the oil in a small saucepan over medium heat and saut? the onions and garlic until soft and golden, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in the chili paste and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the broth and tomato paste and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the peanuts and cook for 5 minutes more until thickened and smooth. Let cool completely before using.

Spray crock pot bowl well. Combine dry mixes as directed for cake. Stir in sour cream. Beat in eggs. Add water, vegetable oil, vanilla and mix well. Pour into crock pot. Bake for 3 hours or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve warm or at room temp. Top each slice with whipped cream. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Serve warm or at room temp. Top each slice with whipped cream. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Serve warm or at room temp. Top each slice with whipped cream. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Serve warm or at room temp. Top each slice with whipped cream. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Serve warm or at room temp. Top each slice with whipped cream. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Serve warm or at room temp. Top each slice with whipped cream. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Serve warm or at room temp. Top each slice with whipped cream. Sprinkle with chocolate ch

Cut eggplant into small cubes. Lightly coat a large skillet with oil. Add eggplant cubes and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Saute until eggplant is browned and tender. Dice tomatoes in small pieces. Put eggplant cubes in bottom of a large serving bowl. Spoon diced tomatoes on top of the eggplant cubes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley, fresh basil and garlic powder. Boil pasta according to directions on package. Drain pasta and add to tomato/eggplant mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve warm.

Mix together the corn, black beans and nonfat yogurt in a bowl. Set aside. Prepare brown rice according to package directions. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper and place them in the baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center. Meanwhile, prepare the sauce in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring constantly. The sauce will thicken as it cooks. To serve, place the rice in the center of the plate, top with the chicken and then spoon the sauce over the top. Garnish with cilantro and serve immediately.

Saute onion and mushroom pieces in margarine until onion is clear. Add remaining ingredients, except for cornstarch, stirring constantly until mixture is hot. Remove from heat. Mix cornstarch with water until smoothstir into hot mixture. Bring to boilingcook until thickened. Serve over roast or chicken pieces.

In small bowl, mix 1 tsp each of garlic powder, ginger, paprika, cinnamon, chili powder and onion salt. Drizzle steaks with 2 tablespoons of the vegetable oil and sprinkle with the seasoning mixture. Let marinate for at least 1 hour at room temperature or in the refrigerator overnight. Prepare the sauce by combining the remaining 2 tablespoons of the vegetable oil with the lemon juice in a small bowl. Heat the peanuts in the microwave for about 3 minutes or until crisp. Remove the steaks from the marinadediscard marinade. Heat remaining oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add the steaks and cook for 2 minutes per side or until browned and cooked to desired doneness. Serve with the lemon-peanut sauce, lettuce leaves and any other desired garnishes.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a shallow dish combine the flour, paprika, and saltstir until well blended. Dip the fillets into the egg and milk mixture, then into the flour mixtureplace in a baking dish. Melt the butter in a skilletpour the butter over the fillets. Bake uncovered in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until golden brown and bubbly.

Toast pecans in oven at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Mix remaining ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a boil for one minute. Remove from heat and quickly stir in toasted pecans until evenly coated. Spread pecans onto a large cookie sheet lined with parchment paper or waxed paper to cool. Cool completely before storing in an airtight container. These will keep for up to two weeks.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Drain chicken and cut into small pieces. Mix together chicken, cream cheese, ranch dressing, and hot sauce in a bowl. Place in a greased casserole dish and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 degrees f for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with fritos scoops.

Cook potatoes in water until tender. Mash potatoes with sour cream, salt & pepper. Stir in butter. Add milk to desired consistency. Chop spinach. Stir into potatoes. Add cheddar cheese. Sprinkle with dill seed & chives. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes.

In a large wok or large saute pan, heat the olive oil over high heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the cauliflower and saute for 2 minutes. Add the cabbage and saute for 2 minutes. Add the snow peas and saute for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes and saute for 1 minute. Add the imitation crabmeat and toss until evenly coated. Add the soy sauce and ginger and toss until evenly coated. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil and cook the bacon until crispy. Cut into small pieces. Clean and slice the tomato. Cut the avocado into small cubes. Clean the red onion and cut into small slices. Combine the garlic, olive oil, balsamic vinegar and dijon mustard. Drizzle the dressing over the salad. Mix the salad together and garnish with bacon pieces and fresh parsley.

Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a medium skillet. Add chicken. Cook for about 5 minutes or until no longer pink inside. Set aside. Heat remaining 1 teaspoon oil in a small skillet. Add water chestnuts and saute for about 1 minute. Place 1 lettuce leaf on each of 4 plates. Top each with about 2 tablespoons chicken and 1 tablespoon water chestnuts. Serve with lime wedges. Makes 4 servings.

Boil potatoes until fork tender. Drain and mash with butter. In a large sauce pan heat butter and add onion. Cook until the onion is translucent. Add the milk and heavy cream and let come to a boil. Add the mashed potatoes and peas to the saucepan. Season with pepper and a little bit of salt. Taste to see if you need any more of any of the seasonings. Serve with Boston lettuce.

Peel the parsnips and rutabaga. Cut the potato, carrot and onion into large pieces. Wash the beans well. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft. Add the parsnips, rutabaga, carrots, potato and thyme. Stir until the vegetables are well coated with the onions. Add the red beans. Add the vegetable broth. Bring the soup to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 1 hour. Season with salt. Serve hot.
