Prepare the chicken by washing the outside with boiling water. Cut off the backbone and cut the chicken into thin strips. Mix with the celery and leek. Add soy sauce to taste.

In a skillet saute garlic, thyme and bay leaf in oil for 1 minute. Add chicken tenders and saute until just browned on both sides. Remove from pan and set aside. In a bowl combine remaining ingredients. Return chicken tenders to skillet, cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Uncover and cook for 5 minutes or until liquid is evaporated and chicken is golden brown. Cool slightly before serving.

Cook couscous according to package directions. Meanwhile, add the red pepper to the tomatoes and onion and set aside until couscous is done. Remove from heat and stir in couscous, lemon juice, olive oil and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper and toss well to combine. Allow to cool slightly before serving.
Place the fish in a baking dish and cover with the onion. Mix the remaining ingredients except for the paprika. Pour over the fish and onion. Bake for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with the paprika and serve.

Melt sugar, honey and salt together until bubbling. Stir in roasted peanuts. Add water to thin to desired consistency. Pour into a greased shallow baking dish and bake at 300f for 1 hour. Stir occasionally. Remove from oven and sprinkle with oil. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Place fish fillets in dish. In a small bowl combine sour cream and parmesan cheese. Pour mixture over the fillets. Add the butter to the top. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with seasoning. Serve hot.

In a skillet over medium-high heat, saute onions in butter for 5 minutes. Stir in tuna and cook for 1-2 minutes. Stir in milk and eggs. Heat until very warm. In a baking dish, layer bisquick mix and cheese in alternating layers. Top with tuna mixture and remaining bisquick mix. Bake at 425 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned and crisp. Cut into wedges and serve. Serves 6-8.

Slice avocadoes in half. Remove seeds by safely lodging a knife in the seed and twisting to remove. Remove from skins using a spoon. Place all ingredients in a bowl. Using a fork or potato masher, mash all ingredients, leaving a few pea-sized chunks. Mix well and chill for at least 30 minutes. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Saute sausage in a large skillet until brown. Drain fat. Add onions, peppers and garlic. Cook and stir until vegetables are tender. Stir in tomato sauce mix. Add milk, bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 15 minutes. Combine with pasta. Top with parmesan cheese and parsley.

Heat waffles according to packet directions. Cut each waffle into three pieces and place in a single layer in a baking dish. Break up chocolate into a large saucepan. Add sugar and milk. Cook over a low heat until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in buttermilk and vanilla essence. Allow mixture to cool a little. Pour evenly over waffles. Place baking dish in freezer for at least 1 hour. Scoop ice cream into serving bowls. Remove chocolate pudding from freezer. Spoon chocolate pudding over ice cream. Drizzle with caramel sauce. Sprinkle with icing sugar and serve.

In a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed, beat together eggs, butter, molasses, sugar, ginger, cinnamon and cloves until creamy. Add flour and beat until thoroughly mixed. Roll dough into 1-inch balls. Place 1-inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 7-10 minutes or until edges begin to brown. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from sheets to wire racks. Yields 5 dozen 2-inch cookies.

Cream the butter and sugar together. Add the egg and mix well. Sift together the flour and cream of tartar. Add the baking soda and mix. Add the dry ingredients to the butter/sugar mixture and mix well. Roll into balls and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes.
In medium bowl, combine yogurt, mustard, celery salt and pepper. Spread pita with yogurt mixture. Top with celery, green onions, tuna, tomatoes and lettuce. Roll up pita. Cut in half and serve.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a large bowl mix together oats, shredded coconut, nuts, cinnamon, salt. In another bowl mix together oil, honey, maple syrup. Add dry mixture to wet mixture. Mix well. Pour mixture onto a greased baking sheet. Spread mixture evenly. Bake in oven about 20 minutes. Stir mixture and bake another 20 minutes. Stir mixture again. Continue baking about every 5 minutes until mixture is browned to your liking. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine flour, baking powder, sugar, black pepper, salt and garlic powder. Cut in butter with pastry blender or fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. In medium bowl, combine milk and mustard. Stir into crumb mixture until just moistened. Turn out dough on lightly floured surface. Knead gently 2-3 times. Roll dough to 3/4 inch thickness. Cut with floured 2-1/2 inch biscuit cutter. Place 1-1/4 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Brush tops with melted butter if desired. Serve warm.

In a 1 cup microwave safe bowl, combine the beans and salsa. Stir. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and microwave on high for 4 minutes. Stir in the scallions and cheese. Microwave uncovered on high for 1 minute. Serve with tortilla chips.

Combine wheat berries with 3 cups of cold water in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to medium low, cover and cook for about 45 minutes or until berries are tender. Meanwhile in a medium soup pot saute mushrooms in olive oil over medium heat until just brown about 7 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and cook until fragrant about 2 more minutes. Pour in wine and cook until reduced by half about 5 to 6 minutes. Add broth, water and cooked wheat berries to mushroom mixture and bring to a boil over high heat. Stir in kale and reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and cook for about 5 to 6 more minutes or until kale is tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Puree the strawberries with sugar until smooth. Strain through sieve into large bowl. Refrigerate until cool. Stir in the lemon juice and salt. Whisk heavy cream until stiff peaks form. Fold into the strawberry mixture gently but thoroughly. Spoon into ice pop molds or paper cups with lids and freeze until firm. To unmold: dip briefly into hot water. Makes 6 ice pops or 8 cups ice cream.

Place potatoes in a large pot of cold water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heatcover and cook for 20 to 25 minutes or until potatoes are tenderdrain and cool to room temperature. In a bowl combine eggs, Miracle Whip, mustard, sugar, and peppermix well. Add potatoestoss to coat. Serve at room temperature or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with paprika and bacon bits, if desired.

Heat olive oil in large stockpot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in chicken broth and bring to boil. Stir in spaghetti and cook until tender. Stir in pepper to taste. Add meatballs and cook until heated through. Stir in baby spinach and cook until wilted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Rub the steak with the rosemary, salt and pepper. Place steak in a roasting pan. Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the garlic and saute until golden, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat and brush all over the steak. Roast until desired doneness. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add olive oil. Add ground sirloin and season with chili powder, salt & fresh ground pepper. Cook until brown. Transfer the meat to a bowl. Add the ketchup and mustard to the skillet. Add the beef stock. Bring the mixture to a boil. Add the macaroni. Reduce heat to low. Simmer until the macaroni is done. Transfer the macaroni to a large bowl. Add the cheese & stir until melted. Add the meat. Season with salt & fresh ground pepper. Serve immediately.

Place garbanzos in large bowlcover with water 2 inches above beanssoak 6 to 8 hours or overnight. Drain beansplace in saucepan. Add water to cover beans by 2 inchesbring to boilreduce heat. Simmer 1 hour or until tenderdrain. Add leeks to beansadd water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to boilreduce heatsimmer 30 minutes or until leeks are tender. Stir in spinachcook 5 minutes or until spinach is tenderstir in garliccook 2 minutes. Remove from heatstir in herbsseason with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowlsdrizzle with olive oiltop with crouton. Makes 4 servings (serving size: 1 cup)

In a large bowl combine the eggs, milk, flour and sugar. Whisk until smooth. Add the vanilla and cinnamon. Heat a frying pan over medium heat. Melt the butter in the pan. Using a ladle, drop the batter onto the pan. The batter will bubble and puff up like a pancake. Cook until golden brown. Flip and brown the other side. Serve immediately.
Put everything in blender and blend until smooth. Add more ice if needed. Garnish with whipped cream, nutmeg or cinnamon. Serve in a martini glass.

Cut boneless skinless chicken breasts into bite sized pieces. Season with salt and pepper and brown in butter. Add diced onion and green bell pepper cook until tender. Add cream of chicken soup and water stirring until smooth. Add spaghetti cook until al dente drain. Add to chicken mixture and stir until well blended. Spoon into 9x13 inch baking dish sprinkle with mushrooms. Mix together velveeta cheese and sharp cheddar cheese add to mixture stirring until well blended. Bake in preheated 350f oven for 45 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with green onions
In a glass container, combine all ingredients and mix thoroughly. Refrigerate for several hours. Strain before serving. Serve over ice.

Cream margarine and peanut butter. Add powdered sugar and beat until smooth. Stir in chocolate chips. Place 3 graham cracker squares on wax paper. Spread with peanut butter mixture. Top with one chocolate chip. Repeat. Place in refrigerator for about one hour. Cut into squares. Store in refrigerator.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and celery. Cook 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in broth and water. Heat to boiling. Stir in rice. Cover and simmer 30 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in raisins and pecans. Fluff with fork.

Combine milk and banana in a saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat until heated through but not boiling. Stir in oatmeal and wheat germ. Reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes until thickened and creamy. Stir in berries and honey. Serve hot.

Melt chocolate in a small bowl over a pot of boiling water. Add chili powder and nuts. Mix until smooth. Add milk and vanilla. Stir until mixture is smooth. Pour mixture into a buttered 8x8 inch pan. Refrigerate until set. Slice into 1 inch squares.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Prepare chicken by cutting it into 1-inch strips. In a shallow dish, combine the buttermilk and 1 teaspoon of the oregano. Place the panko crumbs and garlic powder and the remaining oregano and pepper into another shallow dish. Coat the chicken with the buttermilk mixture and then dredge it in the crumb mixture. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat and fry the chicken until it is golden brown and cooked through-about 5 minutes per side. Place the chicken on an ovenproof baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes more or until crisp and heated through. Serve with the dipping sauce of your choice.
Mix spinach, egg whites, egg, oregano, salt, feta cheese in a bowl. Cook in a frying pan with olive oil.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel away the outer leaves of the sprouts to expose the inner leaves. Wash and dry the sprouts thoroughly. Place sprouts in a large mixing bowl and cover with cold water. Add salt, let sit for 10 minutes then drain. Place the sprouts in a large mixing bowl and add the butter and the stout. Toss to coat the sprouts evenly with the butter and stout mixture. Spread out the sprouts on the baking sheet, making sure they are spread evenly apart from one another. Sprinkle with the parsley if desired. Bake for 45 minutes or until the sprouts are crisp. Remove from the oven and let the sprouts cool on the baking sheet for about 5 minutes. Transfer to a plate and serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add cornmeal and cook until brown, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Brush pizza crust with olive oil. Bake for 5 minutes at 450 degrees F or until lightly browned. Spread with marinara sauce. Sprinkle with cornmeal mix, sour cream, bacon pieces, mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Bake for 10 minutes at 450 degrees F or until scallops are done and top is lightly browned.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add raisins. Remove from heat and let stand 10 minutes. Drain raisins and place in a bowl of ice water. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Add baby spinach and cook until wilted. Drain raisins and pat dry with paper towels. Add raisins and pine nuts to skillet with spinach. Season with 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Cook until raisins are plump and heated through. Drain pasta and rinse under cold water. Toss pasta with spinach mixture and 2 tablespoons of parmesan cheese. Season with additional salt and pepper. Top with remaining parmesan cheese and prosciutto. Makes 4 servings.

Beat egg whites at medium-high speed until foamy. Add vanilla and salt. Gradually add sugar and beat until egg whites form stiff peaks. Fold in dates and nuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls on baking sheets. Bake in 250f oven for 2 hours. Turn off oven and allow meringues to cool in oven until ready to serve.

Wash blueberries and drain. Measure into a 4-6 quart nonreactive pot. Add the sugar and cinnamon. Bring to a boil over high heat and stir. Once the mixture is boiling, stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add the liquid pectin and stir well. Return to the stove and bring to a full rolling boil over high heat, stirring constantly. Boil hard for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and skim foam and fruit off the top. Ladle jam into sterilized jars and seal. Makes approximately 3 pints of jam.

Rinse strawberries and hull. Drain in colander. Set aside. In a medium saucepan, combine gelatin, 1/4 cup cold water, and 1/2 cup sugar. Stir until dissolved. Add strawberries, marshmallows, and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Stir until marshmallows are covered. Pour into a 9 inch x 13 inch pan. Refrigerate until set. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 inch x 13 inch pan. In a large bowl combine the cake mix, 1 1/2 cups water, 1/2 cup oil, 1 egg, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat at medium speed until smooth. Spread half of the batter on top of the gelatin mixture. Spread remaining batter over the top. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve warm.

Melt butter in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion and carrotcook and stir 5 minutes. Stir in corn, noodles and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in Velveeta cheese. Remove from heatstir until cheese melts. Pour into a 2-quart casserole. Combine bread crumbs and parmesan cheesesprinkle over casserole. Bake uncovered 20 minutes or until crumbs are golden. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a large pot, saute the onion in a little oil until tender. Add beef, chicken and sausage. Brown the meat and drain. Stir in tomatoes, red beans, seasoning mix and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce. Simmer another 30 minutes. Serve with shredded cheese.

Pre-heat the oven to 180 degrees C. In a medium saucepan melt the butter over low heat. Add the flour and stir well for about two minutes until the mixture is smooth and free from lumps. Gradually pour in the chicken stock while stirring well and bring the mixture to a boil. In a large bowl combine the potatoes with the zucchini and the tomato paste and toss well. Add the egg and the milk and mix well until smooth. Add the potato and zucchini mixture to the chicken stock mixture and mix well. Season with pepper and salt if necessary. Pour the vegetable mixture into a casserole and sprinkle the cheese over the top. Place the casserole into the pre-heated oven and bake for about 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the center is firm and cooked through. Serve hot as a side dish with chicken or fish or with rice or potatoes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a large baking pan with foil. Cut each chicken breast in half. Place chicken halves in foil packets, seasoned with paprika. Place in baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Mix together green beans and potatoes in a bowl. Divide in half. Place half of the vegetables in each packet with the chicken. Cover the baking pan with foil and bake for another 20 minutes. Dot with margarine and serve.

In a small bowl, combine the onion and thyme. Place in a large mixing bowl. Combine the vinegar and oil in a separate bowl and pour over the onion mixture. Add the apples, pecans, and salt and pepper and toss gently until well blended.

In a large pot of boiling water cook ramen noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking process. Place noodles on a large platter and top with broccoli florets and peanuts. In a small bowl combine lemon juice, honey, pepper and salt and stir well to blend. Drizzle dressing over noodles and vegetables and toss until well coated. Serves 6.

In a medium bowl combine mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, vinegar, sour cream, parsley, mustard, herbes de provence, salt & pepper and mix well. Add the oil and mix thoroughly until you have a smooth dressing. Season to taste with more salt and pepper if necessary and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to give the flavors time to marry together. Serve chilled. Makes approximately 1 1/2 cups. Serve with crisp fresh vegetables or salad as a dip or dressing for your favorite sandwiches.

Mix together oranges, pineapple chunks, coconut, mint leaves and lime juice in large bowl. Blend until smoothfold in ginger. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for 24 hours before serving. Garnish with mint sprig. Serve chilled. Serving suggestions: Serve with vanilla wafers or graham crackers.

Preheat oven to 400. Prepare loaf pan by lining with parchment paper or spraying with cooking spray. Combine breadcrumbs and buffalo wing sauce in large bowl and set aside. In another bowl combine the chicken with carrot, green chilies and garlic powder. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the egg and mix until fully incorporated. Add the breadcrumb mixture and mix until just combined. Pour the mixture into the prepared loaf pan and bake for 45 minutes. In the last 10 minutes of baking time, turn the oven up to 450 and place the blue cheese on top of the meatloaf. Bake for 10 minutes more until the top is golden brown. Allow to rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with ranch dressing.

In a small bowl combine cornstarch and unsweetened apple juiceset aside. In a medium skillet over medium-low heat, heat 1 tablespoon of butter. Add onion slices. Cook about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Increase heat to medium-high. Add ham steakbrown. Stir cornstarch mixture. Add to skillet. Bring to a boilcook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining butter. Pour over apple slices. Serve with Apple Butter.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In 13 x 9 baking dish, combine potato mixture, brown sugar, and butter. Beat together flour and sugar. Add pecans. Spread over potato mixture. Bake for 40 minutes. Let stand 15 minutes. Mix sour cream and vanilla. Spread over top of pie. Bake 3 minutes more. Let stand 15 minutes before cutting.

Combine the tomatoes, garlic, basil and salt in a skillet. Stir over low heat until hot. Brush the bread slices with olive oil. Top each slice with a generous amount of the tomato mixture. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the tops. Bake on a baking sheet until the cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Place chicken tenders in resealable plastic bag set in shallow dish. In a small bowl combine the salt, pepper and 1 teaspoon wateradd to bag and turn to coat. Place in refrigerator for at least 1 hour or preferably overnight to marinate. Heat 1/4 inch of oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken to skilletcook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Remove from skillet with slotted spoon to platecover to keep warm. Add onion to skilletcook until tender, about 6 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add brothcook 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Add chicken with any accumulated juicessimmer 2 minutes. Remove from heatstir in marmalade, lemon peel and lemon juice. Spoon over chicken. Sprinkle with chives. Serve immediately.

Season chicken with creole seasoning. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches of four, add chicken and brown on both sidestransfer to a plate. Add onion and pepper to skillet and saute until tender. Stir in soup and water, and bring to a boilcook until slightly thickened and chicken is no longer pink in center when cut with a fork, about 3 minutes. Stir in lime juicereturn chicken and any juices on the plate to the skilletstir. Serve with sour cream.

Place sugar and corn syrup in a heavy bottomed sauce pan. Bring to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add cocoa and butter. Stir until smooth. Add vanilla and let cool. Cut into 1x1 squares.

Peel and core apples. Heat a saucepan of water and add the apples. Boil for a few minutes and remove from the heat with a slotted spoon. Mix the butter, sugar and maple syrup together and heat gently until the butter melts and the mixture bubbles. Add the apples and cinnamon and toss together. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings

In a large skillet, cook sausage over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain. Combine the biscuit mix, milk, eggs, caraway seeds, and salt. Stir together. In a 9x13 baking dish, spread sausage over the bottom. Pour the biscuit batter over the sausage. Bake uncovered at 425 for about 25 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown. Spread the sausage mixture over the top of the biscuits. Top with sour cream and paprika. Bake 5 more minutes. Serve hot.
Heat oil in large skillet over med. Heat. Saute garlic till crisp, add vegetables and cook till tender. Salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Place all the ingredients in a crock pot and cook on low for 8 hours. Serve over rice or tostadas. Serves 6.

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add rhubarb & sugar. Simmer uncovered until rhubarb is tender. Stir in strawberries and vanilla. Remove from heat. Chill. To serve, ladle into a bowl and top with a dollop of vanilla yogurt. Garnish with fresh strawberries if desired.

Combine olive oil, onion & garlic cloves in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, drain olives and mix with tomatoes and chopped celery. Combine celery mixture with onion mixture & simmer for 10 minutes. Add cumin seed & celery salt and cook 1 minute more. Cool slightly. Puree mixture in food processor. Chill for 1 hour to blend flavors. Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with black olives & parsley. Serve pate with crackers or bread cubes or raw vegetables. Serves 6-8.

Soften cheeses in a microwave or double boiler. Mix together and add the rest of the ingredients. Roll out onto a platter and shape into a ball. Roll in parsley. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat an 8 x 8-inch square baking pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine oats, oat bran, brown sugar, sunflower oil, honey, and salt. Spread mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cocoa nibs. Return to oven for 5 more minutes. Remove from oven. Cool completely on wire rack. Cut into 16 bars. Store covered at room temperature.

Prepare cake mix according to box directions. Bake in an 9 x 13 pan. Cool completely. In a bowl whisk together instant pudding mix and milk for 2 minutes. Pour over cake. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Crumble cookies and sprinkle over top. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or until ready to serve.
Combine all the ingredients into a mixing bowl. Form into burgers. Cook until desired doneness. Serve with toppings of choice.

Grease 2 loaf pans. Sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In large bowl, combine flour mixture, banana, butter, eggs and milk. Beat at medium speed until moistened. Spoon batter into prepared loaf pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans. Cool completely on wire racks. Stir together walnuts and powdered sugar. Spread over cooled bread.

In a small saucepan over medium heat melt the butter and add the sour cream and the parmesan cheese, cooking just until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth. Season with cracked pepper and red pepper flakes. Serve over pasta of your choice.
Place in pan according to manual directions. Select whole wheat cycle and begin. When done, remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack before slicing.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle the pork with salt and pepper. Add the pork chops to the skillet and cook for 1 minute per side. Remove the pork chops from the skillet and set aside. Place the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the skillet. Add the garlic and cook until lightly browned. Add the soy sauce and chicken broth. Stir in the brown sugar. Bring to a boil and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the chili flakes and remove from the heat. Pour the mixture into a 2 1/2-quart slow cooker. Place the chops in the slow cooker and cook on high for 2 hours or until tender. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the cornstarch and cold water. Stir into the slow cooker mixture. Stir constantly until the mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Garnish with the green onions and serve.

Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in leeks and carrots and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in squash and brothbring to boil, reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until squash is tender. Stir in ginger and cream. Heat until warmed through (do not boil). Season with salt and white pepper to taste. Serve warm.

In a medium bowl combine tomatoes and pesto. Spread pesto mixture onto one side of each pita bread half. Top with onion and cheese. Broil for about 1 minute or until the cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve. Makes 4 servings. Enjoy.

Mix together salad dressing and ramen noodles. Cook noodles in boiling water for 3 minutes. Drain. Cool. Mix with remaining salad dressing ingredients. Chill. Toss with cabbage, green onion, sesame seeds, almonds, and garlic cloves. Serve over greens.
Prepare puddings as directed on box. Let cool. Fold in gelatin. Chill. Top with mandarin oranges and whipped topping. Serves 12.

Line 3 cookie sheets with wax paper. Break the crackers into pieces and place into a large bowl. Place the crackers in a large ziplock bag. Put 1/2 cup of brown sugar in with them. Place in a microwave safe bowl with 1/2 cup of water. Microwave for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir. Microwave for 2 more minutes. Add butter and almond extract. Stir. Add more brown sugar, if needed. Pour onto cookie sheet. Cool. Dip into chocolate. Top with sprinkles.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Butter a baking dish with 1 tablespoon butter and set aside. Sprinkle remaining tablespoon of butter over the chicken breasts and season with salt and pepper. Place chicken in the prepared baking dish and bake for 15-18 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and reaches an internal temperature of 165 degrees f. Sprinkle the chicken with the mushrooms and shallots and bake for 5-8 minutes or until the mushrooms and shallots are softened and slightly browned. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and place under the broiler until cheese is golden and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare pizza crust as directed on package. Spread mozzarella cheese over crust. Top with pepperoni, red potatoes and dried oregano. Spread garlic salt evenly over top. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until potatoes are done.

Preheat oven to 350F. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. In a large bowl combine the shredded coconut, almond extract, salt and sweetened condensed milk. Mix well until all ingredients are incorporated. Add the egg whites and mix until fully incorporated. Mix in the cream of tartar. Using a tablespoon, drop the mixture onto the lined cookie sheet. Place in the oven. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool.

Soak bread in water until softened. Place in food processor. Add ham, pork, breadcrumbs, milk, brown sugar, vinegar, water and mustardprocess until well blended. Shape into 6 loaves 1-inch thick, 3-inches long and 1-1/2 inches wide. Place in shallow pan. Combine remaining ingredients and brush loaves with mixture. Bake 30 minutes at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Turn and bake 15 minutes longer or until browned and crusty on top. Cool 5 minutes before slicing.
In saucepan combine all ingredients. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until mixture thickens. Serve hot. Great on ham sandwiches or as a dipping sauce.

Cut chicken breasts lengthwise in half and pound to about ½ thickness. Place in a shallow dish and mix with evaporated milk, taco seasoning mix and soup mixes. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour or up to overnight. Heat olive oil on medium heat and cook chicken breasts for 4 minutes on each side until no longer pink inside. Remove from pan and place on a plate topped with a layer of chips and cheese and a dollop of guacamole. Garnish with tomato and avocado slices and a lime wedge if desired. Serve with corn chips for dipping.

Trim the ends from the brussels sprouts. Cut in half and add them to a skillet. Add butter and olive oil. Saute on medium heat until sprouts are lightly browned. Sprinkle with onion soup mix and water. Cover and cook for 20 minutes or until sprouts are tender. Add salt and pepper before serving.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.In a small bowl combine brown sugar, mustard and liquid smoke. Brush ham generously with mustard mixture. Place ham in a shallow baking pan.In a small bowl combine cider and honey. Pour half the liquid over ham. Bake ham uncovered 1-1/2 hours or until a meat thermometer registers 145 degrees F. Remove ham from oven. Baste ham with remaining liquid. Bake ham 15-20 minutes longer or until thermometer registers 160 degrees F. Remove ham from oven and brush with remaining glaze. Let stand 15 minutes. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 325F. In a bowl combine oats, flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger and salt. Stir in butter and mix until crumbly. Add apple and honey, and mix until combined. Turn mixture out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead lightly 2 or 3 times to combine. On a lightly floured surface or a Silpat mat roll into a 12 inch by 2 inch log. Cut into 1/2 inch slices. Place cut side down on a baking sheet. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned and the centers are set. Cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease 8x8 baking dish. Cook sausage in skillet until no longer pink. Remove to bowl and drain. Add potatoes to skillet with onion and garlic. Cook and stir until potatoes are done. Stir in sausage. Sprinkle with soup and milk. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with green onion.

Combine milk and flour in heavy saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until mixture is thickened and smooth. Add the cheese and mayonnaise. Heat over low heat until mixture is smooth and well blended. Stir in the cream cheese. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Prepare cake mix according to directions. Bake in greased tube pan for 35-40 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool cake in pan on wire rack 1 hour. Prepare instant vanilla pudding according to directions. Add 1-1/2 cups frozen strawberries. In small bowl, combine 1/2 cup of the strawberry gelatin with 1/2 cup boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add the vanilla pudding. Let mixture cool for 10 minutes. Fold in remaining strawberries. Spread pudding mixture over top of cake. Refrigerate overnight. Spread remaining strawberry gelatin over top of pudding. Refrigerate 2-3 hours or overnight. Serve cake topped with whipped topping. Makes 10-12 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 f. In a large bowl combine the broccoli florets with the garlic and black pepper. Spread the florets out on a baking sheet. In a small bowl combine the oregano and balsamic vinegar, and pour the mixture over the broccoli florets. Toss gently until all of the florets are coated with the vinegar mixture and the broccoli is well blended. Transfer the broccoli mixture to a 9×13 inch baking dish and bake until tender, about 15 minutes. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese before serving.

Place sugar and butter into a large microwave-safe bowl. Melt the butter in the microwave. Stir the mixture until it is smooth. Add the cocoa powder and the vanilla extract. Stir again until smooth. Add the milk and the salt. Stir well. Pour into an 8x8 square pan. Sprinkle the top with the pecans. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until completely firm. Slice into 20 equal pieces.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a loaf pan.In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and salt. In another bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the mashed bananas. Add the dry ingredients to the banana mixture alternately with the buttermilk. Beat just until combined.Pour the batter into the prepared pan.Bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.Wrap and store overnight.

Dip chicken in flour. Brown in oil in a large skillet over medium heat until no longer pink in center and cooked through. Remove from heat. Stir in crushed pineapple and barbecue sauce in skillet. Pour into baking dish and cover with foil. Bake in pre-heated oven for 1 hour, or until bubbly. Meanwhile, combine cornstarch with water and ginger. When dish is baked, remove from oven and sprinkle with cornstarch mixture. Return to oven for an additional 10 minutes or until sauce thickens. Serve over rice with chopped green onions garnish.

Peel potatoes, cut into cubes and place into a pot with water to cover by 1. 5 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for about 10 minutes or until potatoes are soft. Drain and return to the pot. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher or ricer, stirring in butter, blue cheese, chives, garlic salt and pepper to taste. Mash until smooth and fluffy. Serve immediately.

In large skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and pepper and cook for one minute more. Add tomatoes and thyme and cook for 3 minutes more. Stir in okra and cook until softened and mixture is thickened, about 8 minutes more. Stir in parsley and cayenne pepper and salt and pepper to taste and cook one minute more. Serve at room temperature. Serves 4 to 6.

Combine sour cream and garlic. In a large skillet over medium heat, add the tomatoes and cook until warm. Place the cucumber slices in a bowl and top with the sour cream mixture. Combine the lettuce with the cucumber mixture. Spread each pita bread with about a teaspoon of sour cream mixture. Layer the bottom half of each pita with lettuce mixture. Add a burger patty and top with tomatoes and feta cheese. Fold the top half of the pita over the filling. Makes two burgers.

Soak the bread in water to soften. Drain the water. Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl combine the softened bread with the beef, parsley, salt and pepper. Add the garlic and onions and stir. Add the beaten egg and the dried oregano. Mix well. Roll into balls. Place the meatballs onto a greased baking tray. Bake for about 45 minutes. Add the tomato juice to the pan. Cook for another 15 minutes. Serve over spaghetti noodles. Makes about 20 meatballs. Serves about 5.

Rinse fish fillets and pat dry. Sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper. In a shallow dish combine pesto sauce with diced tomatoes. Place 1/3 of tilapia fillets into pan coated with cooking spray. Place 1/3 of mozzarella cheese on top of fish. Top with 1/3 of pesto sauce mixture. Repeat layers. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Serve over rice.

Cut sandwich bread into small squares or triangles. Beat together eggs and milk. Dip bread in milk mixture. Coat in breadcrumbs. Deep fry in oil at 375 degrees for 2 minutes. Remove from oil, drain on paper towel. Add mushrooms to skillet with olive oil and sage, cook over medium heat for 1 minute, stirring often. Add marinara sauce, toss well. Place cheese sticks in skillet, toss to coat. Serve warm.

Heat the oil over medium-high heat in a 3 1/2 quart Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot. Add the chuck roast and brown it on all sides. Add the chopped garlic and saute until aromatic. Add the parsley, bay leaf, thyme, tomatoes with juice and tomato paste. Stir to mix. Add the water, reduce heat to low and cover. Cook for 3 1/2 hours. Remove the chuck roast and set aside. Pour the sauce through a sieve set over a bowl to remove any solids. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Skim the fat from the top of the sauce. Slice the meat against the grain. Serve with the sauce.

Cut the chicken into small pieces and put in a bowl. Add egg and seasoning. Mix well and leave for 10 minutes to set. Heat about 2 inches of oil in a frying pan or wok and fry a few small balls at a time until golden brown. Serve with dips or sauce of choice.

Fry sausage until cooked through. Add chopped onion and cook until onion is transparent. Add flour and mustard and stir to mix well with the sausage. Add the stock and potatoes and simmer until potatoes are tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper and grate the cheese on top. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and golden brown.

Combine dry ingredients. Combine butter and honey. Combine dry ingredients with wet ingredients and mix thoroughly. Roll into balls, then roll in cinnamon sugar mixture. Bake at 350f for 7 to 9 minutes.

Prepare pizza dough. Roll out to 12 inches. Spread with alfredo sauce. Top with crabmeat. Add green onion and sliced mushrooms. Top with bacon. Sprinkle with old bay. Top with cheddar and mozzarella cheese. Bake at 400f until crust is done. Let cool. Cut into small squares for an appetizer.

Peel and core pears. Cut into 1/2 inch cubes. In a large saute pan, saute pears until tender crisp. Toss with lettuce leaves. In a small bowl, combine vinegar, mustard, sugar, salt, and pepper. Pour over pears. Toss well. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray 12-cup muffin pan with olive oil flavored cooking spray. In small bowl, combine cream cheese, low-fat cheddar cheese & fat-free mayo. Stir until well blended. Divide mixture among jalapeno halves. Sprinkle evenly with egg substitute. Press into cheese mixture. Bake uncovered 15 minutes. Sprinkle with cornflake crumbs. Return to oven to bake 5 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 12 jalapeno poppers.

Combine peanut butter and cream cheese in a medium bowl. Beat until smooth. Beat in milk and powdered sugar until smooth. Refrigerate at least one hour or until firm enough to roll. Roll into small balls. Place in freezer about 1 hour or until firm. Unmold and roll in chopped peanuts. Serve with whipped topping or chocolate sauce.

In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add the black mustard seeds. When the seeds pop add the green chilies. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the red chili powder, turmeric powder and salt. Cook for 1 minute. Add the fish pieces and stir to coat. Cook for 1 minute. Add the sugar. Pour in 2 cups of water. Cover the skillet with a lid. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the fish is cooked. Serve hot with rice.

Cut fish into pieces about 3 inches long. Place fish in a medium bowl with lime juice, chili powder, celery ribs, onion, cilantro, 1/2 cup oil and 1/4 teaspoon saltmarinate for 20 minutes. Drain fishdiscard marinade. Combine fish with shrimp in a large bowlmix well. Heat remaining 1/4 cup oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute fish mixture until shrimp turn pinkadd cilantro and cook 1 minute longer. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and serve immediately with tortilla chips.

Season ribs with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a pressure cooker on medium-high until shimmering. Add half of ribs. Cook until browned on both sides, 3-4 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining ribsset aside. Add remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to pressure cooker. Add onions and cook until golden, about 2 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook 1 minute more. Stir in beer. Add water, ribs, and barbecue sauce to pressure cookerseason with salt and pepper. Cover and bring to a boil on high. Reduce heat to low and cook until ribs are tender, about 45 minutes. Transfer ribs to a platediscard sauce. Bring sauce to a simmer on medium-highcook until slightly thickened, 1 minute. Return ribs to pressure cookertoss with sauce to coat. Cook until sauce is thickened, 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a plattergarnish with cilantro. Ser

Brown ground beef in skilletdrain. Add onion, green pepper and tomato saucecook until tender. Add seasoning salt and pepper. Spread cottage cheese on bottom of casserole dish. Lay noodles on top of cottage cheese. Spread cream cheese over noodles. Pour beef mixture over cream cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve with salad.

Mix soup with water in saucepan and heat on low heat for 1 minute. Heat oil in skillet and cook chops until browned on each side. Place chops in casserole dish, place onion rings around chops and pour soup mixture over. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour at 350f. Uncover and pour brown sugar over top and cook for an additional 15 minutes. Serve with rice and vegetable.

In a shallow bowl or dish, beat the eggs. In a separate bowl, combine the italian breadcrumbs and parmesan. Dip the chicken in the eggs and then the breadcrumbs. Set aside. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the breaded chicken and cook for 5 minutes each side. In a small bowl, stir together the mustard and honey. Drizzle over the chicken. Top with mozzarella. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serves 4.

Combine all salad ingredients except olive oil in a large salad bowl. Stir to combine all ingredients thoroughly. Drizzle with olive oil to taste. Sprinkle with chopped parsley, cilantro, and dill to taste. Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. In a small bowl, combine the oil, garlic, cracker crumbs and cheese, mixing well. Divide the mixture in half and shape each half into a small flat patty. Place one patty on the bottom of each of 4 large baking dishes. Add 3 or 4 oysters to each patty, overlapping if necessary to fit them in the dish. Spoon 1/4 cup of the sherry over the oysters in each dish. Top each dish with the other patty of the cracker mixture. Bake the dishes for 20 minutes or until the cheese is golden brown. Serve immediately with crackers and lemon wedges.

In a small bowl, combine mushrooms with onion and garlic. In another small bowl, combine breadcrumbs, cheese and parsley. Add to mushrooms and mix well. In a large skillet melt butter over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms. Cook and stir until liquid evaporates. Stir in basil and pepper. Spread 1 teaspoon on each mushroom cap. Sprinkle with remaining breadcrumb mixture. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Garnish with parsley. Makes 6 servings.

Mix the cream of chicken soup, half-and-half cream, dried tarragon, pepper. Spoon this mixture over the linguine. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake uncovered for 1 hour. In a large bowl combine the chicken, the cream of mushroom soup and the tarragon. Spread half the mixture evenly over the linguine. Top with the remaining mixture. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with the paprika. Bake 10 minutes longer. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, add the butter and olive oil. Add the onion and saute until caramelized (about 20 minutes). Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Cut the rye bread in half. Place one half of the bread in the bottom of a shallow dish. Cover with a layer of gruyere cheese, then add caramelized onion. Place the other half of the rye bread on top of the onion. In a small bowl combine the milk and the egg and beat together. Brush the top of the sandwich with the egg mixture and sprinkle with additional salt and pepper. Broil until golden brown and bubbly. Serve immediately.
Place pork in crock pot. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour over pork. Cover. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve with potatoes and green beans.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Melt the butter and the bacon grease in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the onion and garlic until the onion is translucent, but do not brown the mixture. Remove from heat, and set aside to cool.In a shallow roasting pan, combine the onion/bacon mixture with the quail. Season with salt and pepper, then add the mushrooms and bay leaves. Bake for 30 minutes at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).While the quail is baking, melt the butter in a separate pan over medium heat. Stir in the flour and cook until lightly browned, stirring constantly. Slowly stir in the ale and the waterbring to a boil. Cook and stir until mixture thickens and turns opaque. Add the hazelnuts and the bread cubes. Remove from heat, and set aside to cool.Remove the quail from the oven, and sprinkle the hazelnut/bread mixture over the birds. Return to the oven and b
Lay out tortilla chips on baking sheet. Top with beans. Add cheese. Sprinkle with salsa. Bake in 350 oven until cheese is melted.
Heat butter in frying pan and saute onion until soft. Add rice and sour cream and stir until heated through. Stir in cottage cheese. Fold in green chilies and cheddar cheese. Makes 2-3 servings.

Marinade the chicken pieces in the marinade for 20 minutes or longer. Then remove the chicken from the marinade and drain off the excess marinade and set the pieces aside. In a large bowl stir together the ginger, clove and soy sauce and set aside. In a small saucepan combine the sake, pepper and potato starch and cook over medium heat until it thickens and looks clear. Pour the hot sauce into the bowl with the ginger, clove and soy sauce and stir until combined well and the mixture turns a dark brown color. In a large frying pan or wok heat the vegetable oil to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or until a small piece of bread browns quickly when added to the oil. One at a time, coat the chicken pieces with the starch and fry them until golden brown and crisp on both sides. Remove the pieces from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve immediately with the ginger-soy sauce mixture or store the pieces in an airtight container and refrigerate for several hours before serving with the

Preheat oven to 350. In a large skillet cook bacon over med-high heat until crisp. Drain bacon fat and set aside. Cut each chicken breast into 3 slices. In a large plastic bag combine seasoning salt, pepper, and 1 cup chicken brothadd chicken. Seal bag. Turn to coat chickenrefrigerate for 30 minutes. In a 3-qt. crock pot heat remaining broth to boiling. Add chicken mixturecover. Cook on high 20 minutes. Stir in remaining broth, soup, cheese, bacon, mushrooms, and onion. Covercook on high 15 minutes. Uncovercook until cheese is melted and sauce is thickened, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with biscuits.

Add boiling water to lime gelatin and stir until completely dissolved. Pour into an 8 x 8 inch dish and add ice cubes to the top of the gelatin mixture. Refrigerate for several hours or until set. Top with yogurt and lime wedges or fruit of your choice. Serve with yogurt.

Clean and separate the spinach leaves into individual leaves. In a wok, stir fry the spinach leaves for about 1-2 minutes until the leaves become soft but not wilted. Remove from heat. In a large bowl combine soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, sesame seeds and green onion. Add spinach leaves into the bowl and toss well until the leaves are coated with the sauce mixture. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add onion and sausage. Saute until the sausage is browned and the onions are translucent. Add the corn. Reduce heat and simmer for 3-4 minutes. Stir in the milk. Add the tortillas. Simmer until the tortillas are soft. Remove from heat. Beat the eggs. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir the eggs into the tortilla mixture. Spoon into a greased 13 x 9 baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Garnish with scallions.

Peel the chayotes and cut them into chunks. Boil them in water for 10 minutes. Drain and mash them. Add butter and seasonings and mix well. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add a small amount of butter. Saute the onions for about 2 minutes or until they are soft. Pour into a bowl and add the eggs, beating well. Add a bit more butter and pour this mixture over the chayotes and mix well. Then add some american cheese and mix well. Put into a buttered baking dish and bake for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve with a green salad.

Mix the flour, sugar and baking powder together. Add the milk and mix well with a fork. Add the cinnamon and mix again with a fork. Using a pastry blender or two knives cut the butter into the flour mixture until you have a course meal. Add the egg and milk and mix well with a fork. Form the dough into a ball and then flatten it out to about 1/2" thick and about 12" round. Take a rolling pin and roll it out until it is about 1/4" thick. Place the dough in a pie dish and refrigerate while making the filling. Mix the cherry pie filling and the mandarin orange sections together and put into a pie dish and refrigerate. Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Bake the dough at 375 degrees F. for about 12 minutes or until lightly browned and remove to a wire rack to cool. Pour the cherry mixture into the pie shell and bake at 375 degrees F for about an hour or till it is bubbling around the edge and the top is lightly brow

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the shrimp and saute for 2 to 3 minutes on each side, until the shrimp is pink and opaque in the center. Pour in the lemon juice. Season with the tabasco sauce, black pepper, and the worcestershire sauce. Squeeze in some lemon juice over the shrimp. Serve immediately.

Mix flour, sugar, baking soda and powder in a large bowlcombine egg and buttermilk in a separate bowlstir in buttermake a well in the center of the dry mixture and pour in the wet mixturestir just until combined. Pour into a greased 9-inch square pan and bake at 400 for 30 minutes or until the top is golden browncool slightly and cut into squaresdust with powdered sugar.

Heat milk to scalding in a saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar and cinnamon to milk. Butter toast on one side only. Dip toast into milk mixture. Sprinkle with more cinnamon and sugar. Serve immediately.

Spread soup over bottom of a casserole dish. Top with paprika and pepper. Layer the potato slices on top of that. Sprinkle on cheese, top with bacon and then the remaining soup. Bake at 375 for about an hour.

Preheat oven to 425. Spread tortilla chips on a baking sheet. Top with salsa and scallion. Bake until edges begin to crisp. Sprinkle with cheese and kidney beans. Return to oven until cheese is melted. Serve with guacamole.

Cream sugar & eggs. Add bananas and beat well. Add mashed bananas & vanilla. Sift flour, soda & powder together. Add to banana mixture & mix well. Stir in nuts. Pour into greased & floured bread pan (I use 9x5). Bake at 350* for 50 min or until done (toothpick test). Makes one 9x5 loaf. I usually make 4 loaves at once with this recipe & freeze them.
In a medium bowl mix together beans, tuna, oil, vinegar, garlic, red onion, and parsley. Add salt and pepper to taste. Let sit for at least one hour before serving.

Brown chicken breast in olive oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle with garlic and cook about 3 minutes. Add orzo pasta and stir. Add chicken broth and water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Stir in zucchini and pepper. Cook for another 5 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with rosemary. Serve.

In a large pot, saute bacon until crisp and remove bacon from pan and set aside. Add onion and saute until golden brown. Add green beans and saute until they are just tender crisp. Add vinegar and sugar and cook over medium heat until sauce is thickened and beans are glazed. Stir in bacon and serve hot.

In a small bowl combine the flour, garlic salt and pepper. In a shallow dish combine the honey and vegetable oil. Dip the chicken into the flour mixture and then into the honey mixture and fry until golden brown in a deep fryer or heavy skillet at 375 degrees F for 5-7 minutes. Drain on paper towels and serve with hot sauce and dipping sauces if desired. Makes 4-6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with butter or cooking spray.Place chicken breasts in prepared baking dish. In a large bowl, combine cream of chicken soup and stuffing mix. Spread mixture over top of chicken breasts. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink in center and stuffing is browned on top.

Mix 1/2 cup of margarine, sugar and 2 tablespoons of boiling water in a mixing bowl. Mix 1 cup of flour and 1 teaspoon of salt. Add molasses and enough hot water to make a soft dough. Knead until smooth. Shape into a round loaf. Cut a small slit in the top of the loaf. Combine the remaining 1/2 cup margarine and 3 tablespoons flour. Sprinkle the mixture on the top of the loaf. Bake for 40-45 minutes at 350.

Place all ingredients except marshmallows into a large saucepot over low heat. Bring to a simmer and gently cook for 30 minutes. Whisk constantly until mixture thickens into the consistency of warm pudding. Serve with whipped cream or marshmallows. Serves 4.

Prepare graham cracker crusts according to package directions. Combine gelatin, water and 1/3 cup brandy in a bowl. Let stand 2 minutes. Beat cream until stiff peaks form. Fold in 1/2 cup of brandy and 2/3 cup sugar. Fold in whipped cream mixture to gelatin mixture. Spoon into crusts. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Before serving, mix 1/3 cup brandy and 1/4 cup sugar in a saucepan. Heat until boiling. Drizzle over pie. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

In a large bowl combine pork and next 5 ingredients and mix well. Form into 4-inch patties. In a small bowl combine crumbs and parsley and sprinkle over both sides of patties. In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil until almost smoking. Add patties and cook 5 minutes per side or until golden brown and cooked through. Serve warm.

Mix ground beef with dry breadcrumbs. Add eggs and seasonings. Form patties. Saute onion in frying pan until golden brown. Add water and stir. Add in mushrooms and beef broth. Stir and cook for 3-4 minutes. Mix in cornstarch and water. Pour over patties and bake in oven for 10 minutes. Cook on the grill to your desired doneness. Serve on a bun and top with your favorite condiments.

Season both sides of pork chops with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large frying pan. Add onion and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until onion is soft. Add wine and orange zest and cook until wine has evaporated. Add orange juice. Simmer for about 2 minutes. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add mushroom soup and simmer for 10 more minutes. Add cream and heat for about a minute. Serve over chops.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and clove. Set aside. In a bowl, beat eggs and sugar until light. Blend in the oil. Beat in the pumpkin. Add the flour mixture. Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Sprinkle evenly with walnuts. Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool. Cut into bars.

Combine orange juice, olive oil, Dijon mustard, and salt to taste in a small bowl. Mix well and set aside. In a large bowl, toss the romaine lettuce with the scallions and avocado. Add the dressing and toss gently until well coated.
Mix together in a bowl and microwave for about 5 minutes. I added more water and then cooked it longer to get more of a sauce. I also added more soy sauce and ginger.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook for about 10 minutes or until onion is soft and slightly caramelized. Add cabbage and cook for another 5 minutes or until it is soft and starting to brown. Add the remaining ingredients and cook for about 10 minutes. Serve with naan.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened but not browned. Add mushrooms and cook until browned and lightly crisp. Add wine and cook until evaporated. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add sage and cook for 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

In a large skillet cook onion and bacon over medium heat 5 minutes or until crisp. Drain on paper towels and set aside. Drain beans and rinse in strainer. In a Dutch oven combine beans, onion mixture, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, mustard and molassescover and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Stir occasionally.
Tear the spinach and basil leaves into small pieces. Blend all the above ingredients in blender or food processor until smooth. Refrigerate for up to 2 weeks. Makes about 1 1/3 cups.

In a skillet combine shallots and garlic cloves in butter and cook until shallots are soft and fragrant, 2-3 minutes. Add mushrooms and saute for 2 minutes. Add beans and broth. Cook until liquid is nearly evaporated and beans are bright green and tender, 5-8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

In large pot, heat sausage over medium heat, about 5 minutes. Add onion and cook until soft and golden. Add collards and cook until they just start to wilt. Add stock and beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 1 1/2 hours. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and add vinegar. Serve with crusty bread.

Heat a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot. Add bacon and cook until crisp, about 3 minutes. With a slotted spoon, transfer bacon to paper towels. Add onion to drippings in skillet and cook over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 10 minutes. Add cream and boil over high heat until reduced to 1/2 cup, about 4 minutes. Add eggs in a slow stream, beating with a whisk. Add parsley, basil and parmesan. Stir over moderately low heat until cheese is melted. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with bacon. Serve with scallions.

Peel and dice celeriac and white onion. Heat olive oil in large saucepan over low heat and saute celeriac and white onion for about 10 minutes or until soft. Add garlic and cook for about 3 minutes or until garlic is golden brown. Add vegetable stock and cumin and stir well to combine. Season and bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes or until celeriac is very tender and soup is thick and rich in flavour. Add butter beans and cook for about 5 minutes or until heated through.

Dissolve yeast in warm water with sugar and set aside for 10 minutes. In large bowl combine flour, salt, and rosemary. Make well in center of flour mixture and add yeast mixture, oil, and enough remaining water to form a soft dough. Turn dough out onto floured surface, and knead dough about 5 minutes or until dough is smooth and elastic. Place dough in greased bowl, turning once to grease top of dough. Cover with plastic wrap, and let rise in warm place about 1 hour or until dough doubles in size. Punch dough downdivide into 24 pieces. Roll each piece of dough into a ball and place on greased baking sheet. Let rise about 1/2 hour or until doubled in size. Heat oven to 350F. Bake bread for 10-15 minutes or until light brown. Serve with butter.
In large saucepan combine all ingredients over low heat. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Cook for 25 minutes or until thickened. Serve over spaghetti or your favourite pasta.

Split the muffins in half. Lay 1 piece of cheese on the bottom half of the muffins. Break an egg and put it on top of cheese. Sprinkle some pepper and put a small dollop of feta cheese on top. Place the top of the muffins over the egg and cook in a skillet. Add butter to the skillet and place the sandwich in the skillet. Cook for 1-2 minutes until egg is set. Serve immediately.

Remove heads and shell of prawns. Keep the tails on. Peel and discard the green chilli pepper. Finely dice the ginger root. Grind the garlic. Heat oil in a pan. Add the diced ginger root, diced green chilli pepper, turmeric powder and red chilli powder. Fry them well. Add the prawns. Fry well. Add the salt and pepper. Cook on a slow fire until the prawns are done. Remove them and keep them aside. Heat the remaining oil. Add the lemon juice, onion slices and curry leaves. Fry them well. Serve the prawns topped with the lemon-onion gravy.

In a bowl combine the corn flake crumbs, garlic powder and salt and pepper. Dip each piece of chicken in the oil and then dredge in the crumbs. Place in a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until browned and crispy.
Mix all ingredients well. Pour into greased 9x13 inch cake pan. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cut into squares or bars. Serve with chili.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease an 8 1/2 x 11 inch baking pan. In a blender, combine the beans, eggs, butter, vanilla and prune baby food. Blend until smooth. In a large bowl combine the sugar, flour and cocoa. Stir in the bean mixture. Spread evenly in the prepared pan. Bake for 30-45 minutes or until the top is set. Cool in the pan on a wire rack. Serve warm or cold. Makes 12 brownies.

Beat eggs with sugar, salt, nutmeg, and vanilla in a bowl. Beat in milk. Place bread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Dip bread into egg mixture to coat completely. Place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, and place in freezer for 30 minutes. Remove from freezer. Whisk together egg yolks and milk in a bowlbeat until smooth. Dip bread into egg mixture to coat completely. Place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Remove from ovencool on baking sheet on a wire rack.

Cook tortellini according to package directions, drain and chill. Combine cream, mayonnaise, crabmeat, lemon juice, garlic powder and cayenne in a medium bowl. Add tortellinitoss well to coat. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 6 servings.

Grind almonds into powder in a food processor. In a mixing bowl, combine sugar, almonds and lemon juice. Beat until smooth. Add egg yolks and beat until mixture is smooth. Add brandy and vanilla and beat until smooth. Add food coloring. Beat until smooth. Roll into balls and decorate.

Combine the sugar, salt, paprika, cayenne, and pepper. Rub the mixture all over the ribs. Grill the ribs over indirect heat for 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 30 minutes. The ribs should be tender and fall off the bone.

Cut the tops off the bread slices. Slice each piece of bread in half. Put the bread into 4 cups. Melt the butter in a small bowl. Put the bread into the cups. Put some of the bacon into each cup. Crack one egg into each cup. Salt and pepper the eggs. Pour the maple syrup over the eggs. Bake at 350 until the eggs are cooked the way you like them. Serve warm.

Combine 1 cup whole wheat flour and 1/3 cup all-purpose flour. Mix and add 3 tbsp. oil. Add 3 tbsp. warm water. Mix until dough comes together. Knead for about 10 minutes or until dough is smooth and elastic. Cut dough into 4 balls and roll each out to 8-inch round. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the flatbread 3 minutes per side. Serve with salsa or pesto.

Melt butter and water together in saucepan over medium heat. Add salt and pepper and cook until butter begins to brown. Add garlic, cayenne pepper and brown sugar. Stir until brown sugar has dissolved. Add carrots and cook until tender, about 30 minutes. Add maple syrup and thyme and cook for 5 minutes longer. Toss until carrots are well coated.

In a saucepan combine prunes and water. Bring to boilingreduce heat. Coversimmer for 30 minutes or until tender. Add grape juice, lemon peel and saltheat through. Add raisins and cinnamon. Cook until tapioca is tender. Serve hot.

Pour water into large saucepan. Sprinkle gelatin over top. Let stand 5 minutes. Heat over medium heat. Stir constantly until gelatin is dissolved. Add sugar, corn syrup, and vanilla. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook until syrup reaches 238 degrees f on candy thermometer. Remove from heat. Stir in salt. Pour into 9" x 13" baking dish. Cool to room temperature. Once cooled, spoon icing sugar on top. Serve in small glasses. Makes 36 servings.

Cut pork tenderloins in to 1 inch cubes. In a medium bowl combine the bourbon, honey, mustard and tarragon. Pour over the pork and marinate for 2 hours or up to 24 hours. Preheat the grill. Thread the pork onto the skewers. Grill for 5 minutes per side. Grill the peaches and sweet potatoes until tender and lightly browned. Serve the kabobs on a bed of lettuce and top with the grilled vegetables and a sprinkling of cheese.
Saute the meat with a bit of water, add the soup and beans. Simmer until heated through. Ladle into bowls and top with salsa. Garnish with green onion and a dollop of sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. In small bowl combine bread crumbs, parmesan cheese and romano cheese. In another small bowl combine garlic powder, salt and parsley. Lightly brush roughy with butter. Place in baking dish. Sprinkle with garlic salt mixture. Sprinkle with bread crumb mixture. Bake 45 minutes.
Cook frozen okra in boiling water for about 10 minutes. Drain and cool. Arrange lettuce on plate. Layer with okra and onion. Sprinkle with walnuts. Toss with dressing just before serving.

In a medium mixing bowl beat the creamed corn and the egg together with a fork. Add the bisquick and the cheese. Stir in the milk. Dip a fork in the oil and sprinkle in the corn mixture to make a round fritter. Fry in the hot oil for 4-5 minutes on each side until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with ketchup or salsa.

Melt butter in a medium sauce pan over medium heat. Stir in mustard and brown sugar. Add the onion and cook until tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the Worcestershire sauce and ketchup. Stir in the salt, garlic powder and cayenne pepper. Bring mixture to a boil and then reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Serve warm over steak or chicken.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans. In a large bowl, mix cake mix, sugar, milk and vanilla. In a small bowl, combine cocoa and oil. Pour into egg mixture and stir until well blended. Stir in butter and cheese. Spoon evenly into prepared pans. Bake 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutesremove from pans. Cool on a wire rack. Frost with frosting.

Beat together the butter and sugar with a hand mixer until well blended. Add the eggs one at a time, beating after each. In a separate bowl mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add the flour mixture to the batter alternating with the bananas. Fold in the frozen cranberries. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch loaf pan. Bake for 55-60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a cooling rack.

Combine all of the ingredients in a food processor and puree until smooth. Transfer to a serving bowl and sprinkle the top with the chives. Serve with crackers and/or pretzels. You can also use a blender or mixer. If using a mixer or blender, you must use a spatula to stir the mixture during processing. Serves 4.

Cream together the butter, cream cheese and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the almond extract and vanilla. Beat well. Gradually add the flour and mix until a soft dough forms. Cover the dough and refrigerate for 2 hours. Preheat oven to 350F. Shape the chilled dough into 1-inch balls. Roll the balls in the reserved almonds. Place on ungreased cookie sheets 2 inches apart. Bake for 10 minutes or until light golden brown around the edges. Cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 375°. Combine flour, soda, salt. Cream butter and sugars. Add egg, vanilla. Beat until combined. Stir in flour mixture. Fold in pecans. Roll into 1-inch balls. Roll balls in white chocolate. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until set. Cool for 1 minute before removing from baking sheet to wire racks. Cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Wash potatoes thoroughly. Slice potatoes 1/8 thick. In a large bowl toss together the potatoes, olive oil, curry powder, pepper, allspice, onion powder, lemon juice and dill. Spread potatoes onto a greased baking sheet. Bake 20-30 minutes until potatoes are tender. Turn potatoes over halfway through baking. Remove from oven, sprinkle with salt to taste. Cool. Serve at room temperature.

Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add chicken and stir-fry until lightly browned. Stir in eggplant and bamboo shoots. Add coconut milk, curry paste, fish sauce, sugar and lime leaves. Bring to a simmer. Add basil and chilies. Cook 1 minute. Serve over rice.

Heat a large frying pan over a medium heat. Peel the aubergines and slice into 1/4-inch slices. Dust each slice in seasoned flour on both sides, shaking off the excess. Gently slide them into the hot oil. Fry for 4-5 minutes on each side until golden brown, turning frequently with tongs so they do not stick together. Drain on kitchen paper and sprinkle with salt while still hot.

Cook the rice in 1 1/2 cups stock according to package directions. Drain rice. Place in an ungreased 1 1/2 quart casserole dish. Stir in the rest of the stock, curry powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the tomato slices. Mix the buttered bread crumbs with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, the parsley and cheese. Sprinkle over the tomato slices. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

Wash and cut potatoes in quarters. Add to a large pot and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. Drain and return to pot. Add milk and butter. Mash with potato masher until smooth. Add seasonings and blend in cream cheese. Stir in chives and onion. Serve warm. Makes 8 servings.
Peel and devein shrimp. Combine the shrimp, garlic and oregano in a large bowl. Add the oil and lime juice. Toss to coat. Toss in the pasta. Add the cheese and toss. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until the garlic is very fragrant but not brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the onions and cook until soft but not brown, 6 to 7 minutes. Add the salt and pepper. Stir gently. Add the eggs and stir until well mixed. Reduce the heat to low and cook until the eggs are just set but still moist on top. Sprinkle with the chili powder.

Mix together Old Bay Seasoning and spices. Form into a patty and grill or fry. Cut onion in half and place on top of burger and grill until desired doneness. Toast the buns and place the burgers on top of the buns. Add pretzels and top with pickles. Serve with ketchup and mustard.

Cut white bread into 1 inch cubes. Add to a bowl with egg whites and 1 tsp of milk. Mix and let stand for 10 minutes. Divide the cubes into 20 equal portions. Add 1 tsp of flour to each portion and roll into balls. Place into a greased 9 x 5 inch dish. Bake in preheated oven at 180C for 30 minutes or until golden. Mix together the remaining milk and cheese. Dip the bread balls into the mixture and return to the oven for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

In a large bowl mix the cream cheese with butter. In a separate bowl combine the eggs with vanilla sugar and light cream. Add the cream cheese mixture to the egg mixture and mix well. Add the farmer cheese. Mix until combined. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the noodles and cook for 12 minutes or until al dente. Drain the noodles and immediately rinse them under cold running water to stop the cooking process. Add the noodles to the filling mixture. Toss until well coated. Add the cinnamon. Mix to combine. Spread the filling in a 9x13 baking dish. Place in the preheated oven and bake for 50 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes then serve.
Boil water. Pour into 2 cups. Add 2 tea bags and steep for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Stir in sugar and lemon juice. Serve over ice. Makes 2 servings.

In a large dutch oven saute onions in olive oil until tender. Add potatoes and saute until brown. Add stock and milk. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes. When potatoes are tender, mash them lightly with a potato masher and add butter and season with salt and pepper.

Combine olive oil, lemon juice, thyme leaves and caster sugar in a large bowl. Add mushrooms and stir to coat well. Roast for 10 minutes, or until tender. Drizzle with extra oil if needed, season with pepper and leave to cool slightly. Toss together mushrooms, green beans and tomatoes in a large bowl. Divide between plates. Top with spinach leaves, parmesan cheese and drizzle with extra oil, if liked.

Heat a skillet and add oil. Sauté onions and peppers until tender. Add ground beef and continue sautéing until completely browned. Add remaining ingredients and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes. Serve in hamburger buns.

Heat oven to 450 degrees. On a sheet pan, toss potatoes with garlic cloves, pepper and salt. Roast for 20 minutes. Add thyme and savory and continue roasting for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and add olive oil. Return to the oven for 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl combine soup, sour cream and margarine. Add squash and onions. Stir in the chicken stuffing. Place in a 2-quart casserole. Bake for 1 hour or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In large bowl, stir together milk, eggs, honey and cinnamon. Stir in squash. Pour mixture into unbaked pie shells. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack. Serve warm or chilled. Yield: 2 pies.

Combine all ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Chill thoroughly. Pour into ice pop molds and freeze overnight. To remove from molds run molds under warm water for 2 to 3 minutes.

Cut fillet into 8 pieces about 1 inch thick. Roll in flour and shake off excess. Brown onion and mushrooms in butteradd parsley, pepper and salt. Add cider to cover meat and cook until tenderabout 30 minutes. Serve with apple slices.

Preheat oven to 400. Wash beets well and place them in a shallow baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake for about 30 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Cool slightly and wrap in foil. Slice thinly. In a large bowl combine the greens with the walnuts. In another bowl combine the dressing with the fresh basil. Toss the greens with the dressing. Arrange the greens on a serving plate. Add the beets and cheese. Drizzle with extra dressing.

In a medium bowl combine butter and corn syrup. Add the sugar and peanut butter and beat well. Add the cornflakes and mix well. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto parchment paper. Bake for 7 minutes and cool. Makes 12 chews.

Peel yams and cut into cubes about 1 inch. Place cubes in a casserole dish. In a small bowl combine the melted butter, chili powder, cinnamon, and cayenne. Pour the seasoned butter over the yams and toss to coat well. Sprinkle the salt over the top. Bake, uncovered at 400 degrees for 30-40 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 220°C. Grease 12x4-inch rectangular cake pan with butter. In a large bowl combine the flour and ground almonds and set aside. In another bowl beat together the butter and icing sugar until creamy and combined well. Add the egg whites and beat well until smooth and creamy. Add the lemon rind and beat until just combined and mixture is thick and creamy. Add the flour mixture and beat until combined. Spoon into prepared cake pan and smooth out with the back of the spoon. Bake until the top is golden and the friand feels firm when you press the middle of the friand with your finger, about 20-25 minutes. Transfer pan to wire rack and let cool completely before slicing. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

Pre-heat oven to 450 degrees. In a small bowl combine oil & old bay seasoning. Slice 4 large baking potatoes 1/2 - inch thick. Sprinkle with salt. Pour oil mixture on top. Bake on cookie sheet for 25 minutes or until crisp. Serve hot.
Place fruit in bottom of pie shell. Blend together sugar and flour. Sprinkle over fruit. Bake at 400 for 30-35 minutes. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.
Cook potatoes and onion in 6 cups water, 2 tablespoons oil and seasonings. Add tomatoes. Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender. Makes 4 servings.

Place onions and roast beef in crock pot. Add potatoes and onion soup mix. Mix cornstarch with enough water to make a thin sauce. Add to crock pot and stir well. Pour in dry red wine and stir. Cover and cook on low setting for 7-8 hours. Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.

Wash potatoes well. Boil potatoes in salted water for about 30 minutes or until done. Drain. Cut potatoes lengthwise. Beat cream cheese with nonfat milk, onion salt and pepper. Spoon mixture into potatoes. Melt butter and sprinkle with paprika. Place potatoes on a baking sheet. Bake in 375 degree oven for 20 minutes or until potatoes are heated through.

In a medium saucepan bring sausage drippings, bouillon and pepper to a simmer over medium heat. Remove from heat and pour into blender with cream and whipping cream. Process until smooth. Return to saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Whisk Wondra into milk mixture and continue to heat until gravy thickens and comes to a boil. Boil until thickened, stirring constantly. Season with butter, salt and pepper. Serve over biscuits.
