Peel garlic clovesplace in a single layer on a baking sheetdrizzle lightly with olive oiland roast in a preheated 350 regular oven or 325 convection oven about 25 minutes until tender --. Squeeze garlic cloves into the mayonnaise in a medium bowl --. Stir in the sour cream and olive oil --. Stir in the salt and pepper --. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 2 days in an airtight container --. Makes about 1 cup.

Melt butter in skillet. Sauté onion and zucchini. Cook bacon. Drain. Add to skillet. Beat eggs in bowl. Add flour to eggs. Add cheese. Combine. Spread into greased baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes.

Place salmon fillets in an aluminum foil packet and pour the mustard and honey over them. Place in the oven and bake for about 15 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, in a small skillet, cook the pecans in the butter and honey until lightly browned and crispy. Sprinkle the pecans over the salmon fillets and serve with lemon slices. Makes 4 servings.
Soften cream cheese in microwave for 1 minute. Add sour cream. Melt velveeta in microwave and add to cream cheese. Add hormel chili to taste.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut each refrigerated pie crust into 4 triangles. Fill each triangle with 1 tbsp. of salsa. Place 1 tsp. of chicken in the center of each triangle. Fold each triangle to enclose the filling. Place 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle each triangle with 1/4 tsp. of cheese. Bake for 5 minutes more or until crust is golden brown. Remove from oven and top each triangle with 1 tsp. of salsa. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bring a pot of water to boil and cook artichoke hearts 10 minutes or until tender. Cool slightly. Squeeze lemon juice over artichokes and then drain artichokes. In a bowl combine lemon juice, olive oil and red pepper flakes. In another bowl combine bread crumbs with parmigiano, parsley and garlic. Toss with artichokes and lemon juice mixture. Spread in a 2-quart shallow baking dish. Top with additional bread crumb mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until browned.
In a large bowl combine refried beans, sour cream and green chilies. Drain and crumble tamales into bowl. Fold in cheese until all are combined. Serve with tortilla chips and salsa for dipping.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In large dutch oven or large stock pot over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add shallots and garlic, saute for about 2 minutes. Add mussels and saute 3 minutes or until they begin to open. Add wine and cook for 5 minutes. Add herbs and cook for 3 more minutes. Remove from heat and add butter. Serve with crusty bread.

Separate eggs. Beat yolks slightlyset aside. Beat egg whites with clean dry beaters until soft peaks formfold in yolks and mustard. Stir in pepper and salt to taste. Combine vinegar and oil in small bowlwhisk in mustard mixture until blended. Place lettuce on serving plates and drizzle dressing over top. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve.
Add pineapple juice to blender. Add rum to taste. Add pina colada mix. Add chunk pineapple. Add strawberry puree. Blend well. Serve in a hollowed out pineapple.

Preheat oven to 400. Cut kumara in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Place on baking sheet. Rub cut side of kumara with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Season with sea salt and pepper. Place in oven and roast until tender, about 45 minutes. Turn once during roasting. In large bowl combine romaine lettuce, tomatoes, radishes, feta, pine nuts. In small bowl whisk remaining 1 tablespoon of oil with vinegar. Pour over salad and toss. Season to taste. Serve with roasted kumara.

In a medium saucepan bring 3 cups chicken broth to a boil. Add the grits and return to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in cheese. Stir in 2 cups whipping cream and stir until the cheese is melted and the mixture is well blended. Preheat oven to 350. In a bowl beat 2 eggs until smooth. Add 1 tablespoon hot sauce, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper and 1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper. Stir until well blended. Pour the egg mixture over the grits. Spread into a greased 2 quart baking dish. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce and 2 tablespoons hot sauce. Bake 10 minutes longer. Let cool for 10 minutes. Serve warm. Serves 6.
Blend all ingredients together. Serve with seafood.

Rinse the collard greens and remove stems and any thick ribs. Chop the greens into 1 inch pieces and set aside. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until melted. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add the collard greens and cook until tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the rice and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 30 to 40 minutes or until the rice is tender. Stir in the milk and cream cheese. Cook and stir until the cream cheese is melted. Stir in the garlic and season to taste with the salt and pepper. Serve the collard greens and rice mixture over cooked rice.

In a large bowl combine cream cheese and sour cream. Mix in mayonnaise, worcestershire sauce and kielbasa. Add in milk and mix well. Pour into a 9x13 baking dish. Top with parmesan cheese and green onion. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve with crackers or sliced baguette.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Press crushed cookies into bottom and up the sides of 12 paper-lined muffin cups or tart pans. Beat cream cheese and sugar in a mixer until smooth. Beat in the egg, lime juice and zest until smooth. Spoon into cups or tarts. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until set but still jiggly in the center. Cool on a wire rack for 20 minutes before filling with whipped cream. Refrigerate to firm up the cream and set completely. Garnish with a slice of lime.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place 1 phyllo packet on a baking sheet. In a small bowl combine turkey, stuffing mix, potatoes, green beans, butter and gravy. Spread mixture in center of phyllo packet. Brush edges of phyllo with melted butter. Fold phyllo over mixture to form a packet. Cut packet into 6 wedges. Repeat with remaining packets. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until phyllo is golden brown. Let cool 2 minutes before serving. Serve with additional gravy if desired. Makes 6 servings.

In a large pitcher combine concentrate, tequila and triple sec. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Just before serving combine the concentrate mixture, lime juice, and salt. Serve over ice. Makes 2 quarts.

In a large skillet, saute the onions in the olive oil until translucent. Add the garlic, then cook for 30 seconds. Add the macaroni and tomato sauce and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Stir in the lentils and rice. Season to taste with crushed red pepper. Serve.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the goat meat and stir to cook in the oil for a couple of minutes. Add the onion and cook for about 3 minutes. Stir in cumin, red chili powder and flour. Cook for a minute more. Stir in the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes until the mixture has thickened. Season with salt and pepper.

Place the barley in a large pot of water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for 40 minutes or until the barley is tender. Drain the barley and combine with the beans and green onion. Toss to combine. Make the dressing by combining the oil and honey mustard in a small bowl and stirring until the oil is completely emulsified. Toss the salad with the dressing and serve.

Slice red peppers into 1/2 inch slices. Drain in a strainer. In a large pot add the red wine vinegar. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Add the sugar and cook 2-3 minutes. Add the slices of red peppers and cook for 3 minutes. Add the hot pepper sauce and cook for 1 more minute. Cool and store in a covered container. Makes 2-3 cups.

Drain can of garbanzo beans. In a food processor, combine beans, toasted sesame seeds, lemon juice, garlic powder, and salt. Pulse until smooth. With motor running slowly add the olive oil. Pulse until smooth. Add hot sauce if desired. Chill until ready to serve. Serves 4. Screamingly good food.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Rinse salmon fillets and pat dry with paper towels. Mix together ricotta, feta cheeses, ground pepper and spinach in a small bowl. Stuff salmon with cheese mixture. Brush salmon with olive oil or spray with cooking spray. Sprinkle with lemon pepper seasoning. Bake for about 10 minutes, until salmon flakes easily with a fork. Top with lemon slices and serve with miracle whip mixed with lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift together flour, ginger, baking soda, allspice, and salt. Stir in applesauce and molasses. Add butter or margarine to the mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. Knead the dough into a ball. Roll out the dough into balls about the size of walnuts. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges begin to brown. Allow the cookies to cool slightly on the cookie sheet before transferring them to wire racks to cool completely.

Mix rhubarb, gelatin and sugar in bowl until rhubarb is tender. Pour into greased 9 inch square baking pan. In bowl mix cake mix, water, eggs, oil and cinnamon until blended. Pour over rhubarb mixture. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until done. Cool. Frost with whipped topping, decorate with more strawberries.

Mince garlic. Place chicken fillets in a bowl. Add flour and mince garlic. Coat each fillet lightly with the mixture. Heat oil in a pan. Add chicken fillets. Fry on both sides. Remove chicken from pan and set aside. Pour white wine into pan and scrape the bottom. Add mushrooms and let them simmer for 3 minutes. Add heavy cream and butter. Bring to a boil. Add chicken fillets and stir. Cook until the sauce thickens. Serve the chicken fillets with the sauce.

Combine all of the cabbage, peppers, carrot and onion in a large bowl. Combine the lemon juice, apple cider vinegar and sugar in a small bowl. Add the pepper and salt to taste. Toss the cabbage mixture with the vinaigrette until well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium high heat. Spread one side of each slice with tomato paste and sprinkle with chiles. Place a slice of bread, tomato paste side down, in the skillet. Spread the other side with a bit of molasses and then sprinkle the top with sharp cheddar cheese and a couple of slices of tomato. Add the other slice of bread and press gently. Cook until the bread is browned and the cheese is melted. While the grilled cheese is cooking, combine the red onion and cilantro in a small bowl. Taste and adjust the seasoning with a bit more molasses and salt if needed. Serve the sandwiches on toast or buttered bread. Serve with the salsa.

Cook penne according to package directions. Drain pasta. Drain bell peppers and olives reserving juice. Combine pasta, bell peppers, olives and juice and cheddar cheese. Refrigerate. Stir together mayonnaise, dill and salt. Add to pasta mixture and stir well. Serve chilled. Serves four to six as a side dish. Serves eight to ten as an entree salad.

Mix eggs, sugar, cinnamon, vanilla and milk. Dip bread into egg mixture. Coat both sides of each slice. Spray an 8x8x2 pan. Place bread slices in pan. Spray lightly again. Freeze. To serve: Warm oven to 375f. Bake for 20 minutes. Cut into 3x3 squares. Serve with syrup.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Grease a 10-inch springform pan. In a medium bowl, beat the eggs and egg yolks. Gradually add the half-and-half and continue beating until smooth. Stir in the vanilla. Add the raisins. Cut the croissants into cubes. Pour the custard into the pan. Add the cubes of croissants and raisins and spread evenly. Bake for 45 minutes or until the custard is set and the top is golden. Cool for 10 minutes before loosening the sides of the pan. Cool completely. Unmold. Serves 12. Screamingly good food.

In a small saucepan over low heat combine cream cheese, onion juice, baking powder and salt. Heat until cheese melts. Beat egg yolk into cream cheese mixture until smooth. Fold in ham. Place bread rounds on cookie sheets. Spoon a rounded teaspoon of cream cheese mixture on each round. Bake at 375 degrees F for 10 minutes. Cool. Cut into 1/2 inch rounds. Yields 2 dozen.

Start with a cup of ground coffee. Add water to the pot and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat and add the vanilla. Allow to steep for 10 minutes. Strain the coffee and discard the grounds. Add the sweetened condensed milk. Place in the fridge for at least 12 hours. Stir well before serving.
Place seeds and remaining ingredients in blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Store in tightly covered container. Makes about 3 cups.
Cook rice-a-roni according to package directions. Add butter and stir in. Add the corn. Stir in the salt, pepper, paprika and red cayenne pepper. Serve hot.
Place apple juice into glass. Add lemon juice. Add salt. Stir. Pour tequila and triple sec over the back of spoon into glass. Stir. Add ice cubes. Garnish with lemon slice.

Preheat oven to 400. Line a baking pan with foil and spray with cooking spray. Place fish fillets on pan. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salsa. Bake for 12 minutes. Serve with fresh squeezed lime wedges and chopped fresh cilantro.
Mix together one cup of dry milk powder and two egg whites. Add the oil and one-quarter teaspoon of vegetable food coloring. Refrigerate before using. It will keep for three days.
In large bowl combine cream cheese, miracle whip, cheddar cheese, and scallions. Stir in bacon. Spread mixture on crackers.

Pour milk into a large bowl. Add the egg and beat until blended. Stir in butter. Combine the sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl. Add a few tablespoons of milk to make a smooth paste. Stir into milk mixture. Add 3 cups of cubed bread. Place in a greased 2-quart baking dish. Beat egg whites until stiff. Sprinkle over top of bread. Bake at 350 degrees f for 45 minutes or until topping is golden brown and center is set.
Cube potatoes. Pour broth into crock pot. Add potatoes, half-and-half, and allspice. Cook on high 3-4 hours. If desired, add sugar substitute and cook an additional 30 minutes. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Combine maple syrup, canola oil, soymilk, whole wheat flour, cornmeal, baking powder, kosher salt and baking soda in a large bowl. Stir until smooth. Pour batter into prepared baking pan. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting.
Boil pasta in salted water until al dente. Drain. Toss with chicken and pesto sauce. Top with roasted red pepper and olives. Sprinkle with cheese.

Wash the strawberries. Cut strawberries into small pieces. Put strawberries into blender. Add cream cheese. Add ice cream. Add skim milk. Add powdered sugar. Blend to desired consistency. Serve in a tall glass with a straw.

Combine stuffing mix and water in a 2-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in chicken and mushroom soup. Spoon into a 13x9x2 inch glass baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 8.
In a small microwave-safe bowl or mug, combine the cocoa, milk and sugar. Stir until well blended. Heat 30 seconds or until hot. Stir in marshmallows.

Combine milk and sugar in a medium saucepan over low heat. Stir until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture comes to a simmer. Remove from heat and stir in pumpkin. Cool to room temperature. Add cinnamon, allspice and vanilla. Stir in margarine. Pour into an 8-inch square baking pan. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes or until bubbly. Let cool. Cut into 12 squares. Store in a tightly covered container.
Mix all ingredients except for chicken in a crockpot. Cut chicken breasts into 3/4 inch cubes. Place in crockpot. Cook covered for 6-8 hours. Serve over mashed potatoes.
Combine cream cheese and deviled ham. Add onion and pepper. Spread on crescent roll dough. Roll up and cut into squares. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine flour, cinnamon, baking powder and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla and beat with mixer on low speed until blended. Add milk and oilbeat on medium speed 2 minutes. Pour 1/2 cup batter into hot waffle iron and bake 3 minutes. Makes 4 waffles.

Roll prepared pizza crust into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface and place into a greased pie plate. Spread cream cheese over pizza crust and dot with soft goat cheese and garlic clove. Sprinkle with ground black pepper and spread plum tomatoes evenly over the top. Top with slices of yellow sweet peppers and fresh basil leaves. Bake in a 400 degree oven for approximately 15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Serve hot with a green salad and garlic bread.

Cut the chicken breasts into bite sized pieces. Add the chicken and the bell pepper to the frying pan. Cook until the chicken is done and the bell pepper is softened. Add the soup mix and stir it into the chicken. Add the sliced mushrooms and the tomatoes. Add the brown sugar and the orange juice. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer on low for 30 minutes. Serve over pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease and flour 10 inch tube pan, or use non stick spray. Beat cake mix, oil, eggs and sugar with electric mixer until fluffy. Spread into pan. Bake 25 to 30 minutes. In small saucepan, combine sugar and water. Cook until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil over medium high heat, and boil until mixture is reduced to 1/2 cup (about 10 minutes). Cool slightly. Pour over warm cake. Sprinkle with pecans. Let stand 30 minutes before removing from pan. Cool completely before serving. Yield : 10 servings

Place tomatoes in bowl. Add butter, bread cubes and onion. Mix well. Add sugar, salt, pepper and Tabasco Sauce. Add basil and cheese. Add bacon bits. Pour into baking dish. Place crackers on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Serve with lettuce leaves.

Bring nonfat milk to a simmer in a small pot. Whisk in cinnamon and couscous. Stir in pear and cook over low heat 1 minute. Remove from heatlet stand 5 minutes or until couscous is tender. Fluff with a fork. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk. Set aside. Preheat oven to 375F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper or silpats. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the prosciutto until crisp. Transfer to paper towel and set aside. Add the spinach to the same skillet and cook until wilted. Drain off any excess liquid. Place the flour in the bowl with the eggs and stir together well. Add the prosciutto and spinach and stir well. Add the cheese and stir until combined. On each sheet, place four 4 inch round circles of parchment paper or silpats. Spoon 2 to 3 tablespoons of the spinach and egg mixture on each circle. Place another round circle on top and press down. Transfer to the oven and bake until the egg pies are set. Remove from the oven and carefully remove the top parchment. Top each egg pie with 1 to 2 cherry tomatoes. Garnish each with one slice of prosciutto. Serve immediately.

Melt almond butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add coconut milk, chicken stock, tomato paste, diced tomatoes, unsweetened applesauce, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, fish sauce, soy sauce, brown sugar. Stir. Add shrimp and cook for 2 minutes until shrimp are no longer pink. Serve with cooked rice or pasta.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch cake pan. Sift together the flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, and cinnamonset aside. In a separate bowl, combine the buttermilk, eggs, olive oil, orange juice, and vanilla extractmix well. Add the dry ingredients to the egg mixture, stirring until just combined. Stir in the fruit and nuts. Spread the batter into the prepared cake pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool the cake in the pan on a wire rack before removing it. Store in an airtight container at room temperature.
Fry the bacon and leeks in the butter until soft. Add the cream and simmer for 3-4 minutes. Add cooked pasta and parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper.

In a large pot or dutch oven cook the carrots, onion and celery in the butter. Add flour. Stirring constantly cook for 1 minute. Add chicken broth. Stirring constantly cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the cooked chicken breasts. Add the cooked rice. Stir. Add the cream. Add pepper. Heat through. Serve.

In a crock pot combine roast, white wine, tomato sauce, garlic, salt & fresh ground pepper. Cook on low for 7 to 8 hours. Remove roast from the crock pot and shred the meat. Return shredded meat to the crock pot. Add green onion. Cook on high for 30 to 45 minutes. Serve on tostadas, soft tacos, or with tortilla chips.
Mix all ingredients together. Serve on bread.

Whisk flour, garlic powder and paprika in a shallow dish. Whisk egg and beer in a measuring cup. Place fish in egg mixture and coat on both sides. Drain fish and place in flour mixture and coat on both sides. Place in hot oil and fry until browned and crispy and fish flakes easily with a fork, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. Drain and serve with lemon wedges and tartar sauce.

In a mixing bowl combine the egg whites, sugar and vanilla and beat until soft peaks form. Place the Ritz Crackers in a food processor and pulse until the crackers are crumbled into fine crumbs. Remove the crumbs from the processor and set aside. Fold the cracker crumbs into the egg whites. Press the mixture into a 9-inch pie pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until the crust is set. Remove the crust from the oven and set aside to cool while you make the filling. Place a piece of wax paper over the top of the crust and gently tap it down with a rolling pin until the crust is even and flat. In a large mixing bowl combine the pecans and brown sugar. Beat the brown sugar and pecans until well combined then add the vanilla and beat until combined. Pour the pecan mixture into the cooled pie crust and spread evenly over the bottom crust. Bake in a preheated 350 degrees F oven for 30-35 minutes or until the filling is set and golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool completely. In a mixing bow

In a cocktail shaker combine vodka, banana liqueur and cream. Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass. Squeeze the juice of the maraschino cherry over the drink. Garnish with a cherry and a mint sprig.
Blend all ingredients together. Fill sticks to desired level and freeze for one hour or until frozen solid.

Pour tomato paste into a medium bowl and stir in the paprika and oregano. Rub the roast all over with the tomato paste mixture and season with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in the crock pot and brown the roast on all sides. Add onions and garlic and saute until the onion is tender. Add tomato paste mixture, red wine and water. Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours. Remove the roast from the crock pot and shred. Return the shredded meat to the sauce. Cook until the sauce is heated through. Serve on hamburger buns.
Cut okra into 1 inch pieces and toss with butter and lemon juice. Add salt to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f (165 degrees c). Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. Combine macadamia nuts, pineapple chunks, flaked coconut, sugar, baking powder, flour, salt and vanilla extract in a large bowladd in eggs and stir until thoroughly mixed. Spoon mixture into prepared loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into center of the loaf comes out clean, about 1 hour. Let cool in pan for 15 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or cold.

In small bowl, combine apples, walnuts, lemon juice and lemon zest. Toss gently. In small bowl or jar with lid, combine mayonnaise and honey. Shake well. Fold dressing into apple mixture just until combined. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours. Serve over lettuce. Garnish with mint and serve immediately.

Mix crumbs and butter. Press into bottom and up the sides of 9-inch pie plate. Chill. Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add sugar and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Beat in milk. Fold in whipped topping. Spread over crust. Refrigerate 4 hours. Top with more whipped topping and peppermint candies. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter and flour 2 (8-inch) round cake pans or line pans with parchment paperset aside. Melt chocolate in double boiler over simmering water or in microwave oven. Cool slightly. In large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Beat in vanilla. Blend in cooled chocolate and orange rind. Stir in flour just until blended. Divide batter between pans and bake until toothpick inserted in center of cake comes out clean, about 35 minutes. Cool 10 minutesremove cakes from pans. Place one layer of cake on serving platter. Top with 1/3 cup orange juice and 2 tablespoons Cognacspread evenly. Top with remaining cake layer and sprinkle with 1 1/2 tablespoons Cognac and 1 tablespoon orange juice. Garnish with sliced orange and serve immediately.
In a large bowl combine all ingredients except for tortilla chips. Cover and refrigerate overnight or for at least two hours. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a medium skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add in garlic, ginger, cook for 30 seconds. Add in cooked rice. Cook stirring for about 2 minutes. Add in soy sauce. Stir until combined. Add in pineapple and green onion. Serve immediately.

In saucepan melt butter. Stir in flour and dry mustard. Gradually stir in milk and stir constantly until sauce thickens and boils. Add ham and egg and heat through, stirring occasionally. Serve over hot toast or biscuits.

In a large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar. Mix well. Beat in sour cream and vanilla. Add Cool Whip. Beat until well blended. Pour into graham cracker crust. Cover with plastic wrap. Chill for 8 hours or overnight. Top with sliced strawberries.

Heat a skillet over medium heat. Place bread in pan and butter. Spread butter evenly over the bread. Top with swiss cheese. Spread mustard and mayo over the cheese. Layer pickles and pastrami. Heat until cheese is melted and sandwich is crisp. Serve warm.

Mix together margarine and powdered sugar until smooth. Mix flour with cereal until thoroughly blended. Add mixture to margarine mixture and mix well. Press into 13 x 9 pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Combine caramels and milk and bring to a boil. Pour over crust and bake at 350 for 18 minutes. Cool for one hour. Melt chocolate chips with shortening until smooth. Pour over cooled crust and spread evenly with spatula. Let cool for an hour and cut into bars. Makes 36 bars.
Shred cabbage. Combine with all other ingredients in a bowl. Marinate at least 15 minutes. Drain before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line two cookie sheets with parchment paper. In the bowl of an electric mixer, combine peanut butter and sugar and beat until smooth. Add egg and beat until thoroughly blended. Stir in flour until it forms into dough. Divide dough into 12 equal portions. Roll into balls and place on prepared cookie sheets. Press with the back of a spoon to flatten each ball. Bake for about 15 minutes. Cool for about 10 minutes. Store in an air-tight container.

Slice cheese into 1 inch thick slices. Heat 1 inch of oil in a deep fryer or deep pot to 360 degrees. Dip cheese slices in milk then into seasoned bread crumbs. Fry for 30 seconds or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with salsa.

Snap off asparagus spears and blanch in boiling water for 1 minutedrain and set aside. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add butter and flourcook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Whisk in chicken stock and winecook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add asparagus spearscook for about 5 minutes or until asparagus spears are tender-crisp. Season with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine sour cream and sageset aside. Spray a large baking sheet with cooking sprayplace turkey fillets on pan and bake in a 350-degree oven for about 15 minutes or until turkey is no longer pink in the center of the thickest partseason turkey fillets with salt and pepper. Serve turkey fillets and vegetable sauce over ricegarnish with sour cream and sage mixture. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Beat oil and granulated sugar together. Add egg. Beat until fluffy. Add mincemeat. Stir well. Add almond extract. Set aside. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir well. Blend into mincemeat mixture. Stir in cherries. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 6 dozen cookies.

Brown meat in skillet and drain. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in taco sauce, beans, and soup. Cook and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with taco seasoning. Remove from heat and stir in velveeta cheese. Spread mixture evenly in 13x9 inch baking dish. Top with tortilla chips. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Top with sour cream and serve.
Thinly slice cucumbers with a sharp knife. Place in a bowl. Stir together the sugar, vinegar, parsley, salt, black pepper, & caraway seed. Pour over cucumbers. Toss lightly. Chill.

Cut off the woody ends of the asparagus and toss with the olive oil and garlic. Arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast for about 12 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in the tomatoes and basil. Divide the asparagus among the pita rounds. Top each with a little cheese and a sprinkle of the crushed red pepper flakes. Serve immediately.
Combine whiskey, lemon juice, sugar and water in a shaker with ice. Shake well to combine. Strain into a glass with ice. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a maraschino cherry juice.

Place onions on the bottom of a 3 quart crock pot. Place the pork on top of the onions. Sprinkle with the cloves, onion soup mix, 1/2 cup barbecue sauce, tabasco sauce and the water. Cover and cook on low 8 to 10 hours or on high 4 to 5 hours. Remove pork from crock pot. Skim fat off of the top of the liquid. Place pork back in the crock pot on top of the remaining liquid. Cook on low 30 minutes or until heated through. Remove pork from crock pot. Shred the pork with a fork or in a food processor or blender. Stir the remaining barbecue sauce into the liquid. Spoon the pork over the onions. Serve with hot sauce if desired. Serves 4 to 6.

Melt the margarine and marshmallow in a large saucepan. Remove from heat and add the vanilla. Add the rice krispies and stir until well coated. Spread in a greased 13 x 9 inch pan. Sprinkle with the nuts and raisins. Melt the chocolate chips and spread over the top. Chill. Cut into bars.
In a large saute pan over medium heat add butter and mushrooms. Saute until mushrooms are tender. Add spinach and cook until tender. Season with salt and pepper.
Brown beef and drain. Stir in tomatoes with juice. Add onion and garlic. Cook until onions are clear. Stir in parmesan. Spoon over cooked macaroni and sprinkle with additional parmesan.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease and flour a 9 by 13 pan. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and saltwhisk until well blended. Make a well in the center of mixture. Add eggs, milk, applesauce, and vanillabeat with a spoon or fork just until mixed. Pour into the prepared panbake for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted 1-inch from the edge comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack.In a small bowl, combine powdered sugar and light brown sugaradd a little water to make a glaze. Spread over top of cake. Sprinkle with toasted chopped pecans. Cut into 2-inch squares. Makes about 32 squares.

Slice bananas into 1/2 inch rounds. Slice strawberries in half lengthwise. In a bowl, combine banana and strawberry slices, and sprinkle with 1/4 cup sugar. Serve over shortcakes. Top with whipped cream, if desired.

Combine cream cheese, milk and honey. Stir until smooth. Stir in pecans and sugar. Refrigerate until ready to use. Mix together all salad ingredients just before serving. Toss with dressing and serve on lettuce leaves.

Preheat grill or broiler. Cut kernels off of cob and mix with melted butter. Sprinkle with salt and sugar. Place mixture into center of corn cob and wrap with aluminum foil. Grill until tender. Serve.

Cut ribs in 2-inch slices. Bring water to boil. Add celery and bouillon. Cook 15 minutes or until tender. Melt margarine and sprinkle with cheese and parsley. Pour over celery and mix well. Serve on lettuce leaves.

Prepare pie crusts as directed on packagereserve.In large mixing bowl, combine sugar, butter, corn syrup and eggsblend well. Stir in caramel topping. Pour into pie shells. Bake 40-45 min. Cool completely. Top with chopped pecans.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, saute onion and garlic in olive oil until onion is translucent and garlic is golden. Add mussels, tomatoes and wine. Cover with lid and let cook over high heat until mussels open, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and discard any unopened mussels. Stir in anisette and fish stock. Serve in large shallow bowls with toasted bread to sop up the sauce.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until tender but firm to the bite (al dente), 10 to 12 minutes. Drain the pasta in a colander, reserving the cooking water. While the pasta cooks, in a large skillet or saucepan heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds more. Add the red pepper flakes, oregano, and basil sprigs. Cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds more. Add the pasta, diced tomatoes with juice and cooked vegetable broth. Season with the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil, the parmesan cheese, and salt and pepper to taste. Toss until everything is well combined and the pasta is well coated with the sauce. Serve hot with additional parmesan cheese for topping, if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat oil in 10-inch skillet over medium heat until hot. Add onion& saute until tender& translucent. Add bacon& cook until crisp. Add mushrooms& saute for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes& cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Place egg, milk, pepper& salt in blender& blend until smooth. Pour over vegetables& bacon. Bake 10 minutes or until centre is set. Let cool 5 minutes. Slice& serve.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the diced carrots and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until carrots are softened. Stir in the green onions and ham. Add the broth, bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the parsley. In a small bowl, combine the sour cream with the flour. Stir in the sour cream mixture into the carrot mixture and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Season with pepper. Serve immediately.
Toast bagel. Spread cream cheese on bagel. Top with a layer of blueberry preserves. Fold over. Add crumbled bacon.

In small bowl whisk together soy sauce, worcestershire sauce and garlic cloves. Combine pork tenderloin and soy sauce mixture in resealable plastic bag and marinate at least 2 hours or overnight in refrigerator. Remove tenderloin from marinadereserve marinade. Preheat oven to 425f. Heat 1 tsp. vegetable oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add tenderloin and saute until browned on all sides, about 8 minutes. Transfer tenderloin to rimmed baking sheet and bake about 12 minutes or until desired doneness. Remove from oven. Combine reserved marinade and lemon juice in small bowl and stir until smooth. Brush mixture over tenderloin and return to oven until glazed, about 2 minutes.

Season chicken breasts with garlic salt and pepper. Dip chicken in flour, then in egg and finally in breadcrumbs. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat, add chicken and brown on both sides. Add chicken broth and continue cooking until chicken is done. Melt butter in another skillet and add sliced avocado and saute until tender. Place avocado mixture on plate and place chicken on top. Top chicken with tomatoes, deli ham and swiss cheese. May serve in tortilla shells or on a salad.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Spray 1-quart casserole with cooking spray. Lay the fish fillets in the casserole and season with the salt and pepper. Cover with chicken stock and lemon juice. Sprinkle the margarine on top of the fish. Bake the fish for 20 minutes or until the fish flakes easily. Remove the fish from the casserole and set aside. In a medium-sized bowl, stir together the flour and low-fat milk to make a smooth paste. Set aside. In the same casserole, heat the margarine over medium heat and cook the onions until they are soft and golden brown. Stir in the grape juice concentrate and the reserved fish stock and cook for 5 minutes. Pour the milk-flour paste into the casserole and stir constantly until the paste thickens and boils. Reduce the heat to low and pour the mixture over the fish fillets. Sprinkle the fish with the parsley and serve.

Wash and core the apples. Chop them up. Put them into a heavy saucepan with a little water. Cook over medium heat until the apples are tender. Add the sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add the lemon juice, lemon rind and the spices. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 10 minutes. Let cool. Puree the apples in a food processor or blender. Makes 4 cups.

In a large mixing bowl combine the warm water, yeast, sugar, and salt. Allow to sit for 5 minutes. In a separate bowl mix the warm milk and butter. In a small bowl combine the flour. Add to the yeast mixture. Stir to combine. Add the egg. Stir to combine. Turn out on to floured surface. Knead for 5 minutes. Place in greased bowl. Cover tightly and allow to rise in warm place for 1 hour. Punch down. Roll out into a rectangle. Spread with melted butter. Sprinkle with desired topping. Roll up. Pinch seams. Cut into 1 inch pieces. Place on greased baking sheet. Cover loosely. Allow to rise for 45 minutes in warm place. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.Cut the cauliflower into florets and place on baking sheet.Drizzle lightly with olive oil.Sprinkle with salt and pepper.Roast for 15 minutes.Remove from the oven and set aside.In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients.Pour over the cauliflower.Toss gently to coat.Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cream the butter and sugar together until well blended. Add the egg and mix well. Stir in the lemonade mix, lemon extract, and vanilla extract. Combine the flour and baking soda and stir into the mixture until combined. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees F for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. Remove from the oven and cool on wire racks. Roll in confectioners' sugar while still warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Toss the almonds with the oil in a small bowl. Spread on a baking sheet. Roast for 5 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until lightly browned. Remove from oven, and sprinkle with fleur de sel. Cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease an 11 x 7-inch baking dish with butter or margarine and set aside. Cook the noodles according to package directions and drain. In medium bowl, combine noodles and remaining ingredients. Spoon into prepared dish and bake 30 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with additional cottage cheese if desired.

Boil peas in salted water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool. In a saucepan, combine milk and eggs. Cook over medium heat until just boiling. Stir in peas, onion and parsleycook for 5 minutes longer or until set. Remove from heatcool. Butter 12-cup muffin cups or 24-cup mini muffin cupsdivide mixture evenly among cups. Bake at 375 f for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Run a knife around edges to looseninvert onto serving plate. Serve warm with melted butter, if desired. Yields 24 servings (serving size 1 timbale).

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Beat sugar and shortening until smooth. Add egg and beat well. Stir in milk and extract. Combine flour, baking powder and corn flakes. Add to the sugar mixture and mix well. Stir in nuts. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto greased baking sheets. Bake for 8 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Mix dressing mix and water until well blended. Add chicken breasts and refrigerate for at least an hour or overnight. Turn chicken several times while refrigerating. Remove chicken from mixture and drain off liquid. Saute chicken breasts and add to crock pot. Add cream of chicken soup and mushroom stems and pieces to liquid and pour into crock pot. Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours until done. Mix together cream cheese and milk until well blended. Add salt and pepper and pour over chicken. Cook for an additional hour on low.
In a large bowl combine mayonnaise, oranges, apples, celery and cinnamon. Layer salad on lettuce leaf. Top with dried cranberries.

Season back ribs with caraway seed and onion. Add sauerkraut. Add tomatoes. Add sugar. Cover and bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees. Check for doneness. If ribs are not yet done, remove sauerkraut and caraway from the casserole and add 1 cup water. Return sauerkraut to casserole and cover again. Bake another hour.
Brew coffee as usual. Add honey and the spices and stir well. Pour into coffee cups and top with steamed milk. Add a little vanilla extract if desired.
Mix all ingredients in a large bowl. Serve immediately.

Brown chicken and cook for 3 - 4 minutes, add sour cream and cheese. Cook for 1 - 2 minutes longer, pour into 9"x13" baking dish. Scoop mixture onto tortillas and roll up. Place seam side down in baking dish. Top with salsa. Bake uncovered 20 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with salad and salsa.

Heat oil in a frying pan. Brown pork chops on all sides. Place onions in pan. Add apples. Cook for 5 minutes. Add apple juice. Cook for 5 minutes. Sprinkle in bouillon granules and thyme. Stir. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until apples are tender. Blend in cream. Heat thoroughly. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve over rice.

Cook the macaroni according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook the ground beef and onions. Drain the meat mixture. Add the tomato sauce. Add the green peppers and mushrooms. Add the water, salt, pepper and worcestershire sauce. Stir in the cooked macaroni and reheat to a simmer. Stir in remaining cheese. Remove from heat.

Heat oil in a large casserole dish. Add onion and cook 5 minutes. Add garlic and spices and cook 2 minutes more. Add lamb and cook 15 minutes or until browned on all sides. Add sweet potato, tomatoes and enough hot water to cover by 2 inches. Stir in coriander. Cover dish tightly with foil. Bake 4 hours at 325f, or until meat is fork-tender. Remove foil for last 30 minutes of baking. Serve with couscous and yogurt or raita.
Combine all in bowl. Place in greased 9-inch pie plate. Chill. Serve on crackers. Can be made several hours ahead. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap.
Mix beans, sugar, vinegar and ketchup. Add beef and onions. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve hot over rice.

Cut yams into slices about a third of an inch thick. Melt butter in pan until it starts to brown. Add yam slices and brown on one side for about 3-4 minutes then turn over to brown on the other side. Add pepper to taste. Remove from pan when brown. Mix in honey after pan has cooled down a little bit.
Form into 3 patties and grill. Melt american cheese on top of each patty and serve on buns.

In a small saucepan combine butter, sugar and cocoa. Cook over low heat stirring until butter is melted. Remove from heat and stir in coconut and vanilla. Press mixture in bottom of 8x12 inch baking pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool slightly. Beat egg until foamy add flour, baking powder and salt. Beat well. Stir in milk until smooth. Spread over crust. Sprinkle with icing sugar. Bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Cut into bars. Store in an airtight container.

Melt margarine in a large pan over low heat. Stir in vanilla wafer crumbs and mix until well coated. Press mixture onto the bottom and sides of an 8 inch square pan. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Combine chocolate chips and walnuts. Spread over top of crust. Bake for 5 more minutes. Combine flaked coconut and condensed milk. Spread over chocolate layer. Bake for another 5 minutes. Cool in pan. Cut into squares and enjoy!

In a small saucepan, combine the cranberries and water. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the orange juice. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Stir in the cinnamon sticks. Cool before serving.

Preheat oven broiler. In a small bowl combine vinegar, soy sauce and pepper. With a paring knife make several small cuts into the skin on both sides of each chicken breast and rub with the vinegar mixture. Season with salt. Place chicken on broiler pan coated with cooking spray, skin side down. Broil about 4 inches from heat until skin is golden brown on both sides. Turn once. Remove from oven and let stand about 3 minutes before serving. Serve with rice, if desired.

Preheat oven to 325f. Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, mix the flour and splenda. In a large bowl with an electric mixer, beat the pumpkin, applesauce and egg whites. In a separate bowl, combine the cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice and baking soda. Add to the pumpkin mixture and beat well. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool. Top with the topping. Store in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a shallow bowl, combine flour and soup mix, stirring until well blended. Dip each chicken piece in the mixture, coating evenly. Place in an ungreased 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake for 1 hour, turning once and basting with mushroom soup during the last 30 minutes of baking time.

In a large pot bring the water to a boil. Add the blackberries and simmer 10 minutes. Strain through a food mill into a bowl. In a small pot combine the tartaric acid and sugar. Stir to dissolve. Add to the strained blackberries. Skim off the foam. Ladle into hot sterile jars. Process in a water bath 20 minutes.

Wash mushrooms. Remove stems and slice. Blend breadcrumbs with margarine. Add lemon juice, parsley and dill weed and mix well. Add mushrooms and season with salt and pepper to taste. Beat eggs lightly. Spoon mixture into mushrooms, pressing lightly to fill. Sprinkle with cheese. Place in greased casserole dish. Dot with margarine and bake in a preheated oven at 350F for about 45 minutes. Serve hot or cold. Yield: 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cook rice mix according to package directions. Add celery ribs, onion and butter. Cook until tender. Stir in soup. Add mushroom stems and piecesheat through. Place hens in shallow roasting pan. Spoon rice mixture into hens. Bake uncovered for 1 hour. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with your favorite vegetables.

Brown the ground beef. Add taco seasoning. Add salsa and cook for one minute. Mix in salad dressing and colby-monterey jack cheese. Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Top with tortilla chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Top with tomato and lettuce.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Cut cauliflower into medium florets. In a large bowl, toss cauliflower florets in fat free mayonnaise. In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Mix well. Pour over cauliflower florets, and toss until all cauliflower is coated. Spread cauliflower into an ungreased 11x7 inch (28x18 cm) baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes in preheated oven. Stir gently. Bake another 10 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

Halve jalapenos. Remove seeds and stems. Place in a saucepan with water to cover and bring to a boil. Boil for 10 to 15 minutes until softened. Drain and cool. Stuff jalapenos with queso fresco. Garnish with mint and cilantro. Serve with guacamole.

Melt chocolate over double boiler. Add cream cheese and mix. Add vanilla and mix. Add powdered sugar and mix. Add extracts and mix. Roll into balls. Put in fridge for 1 hour. Roll balls in nuts. Place in fridge for 1 hour. Melt chocolate in microwave for 1 minute. Pour over truffles. Put in fridge for 1 hour.

Place sugar in a heavy bottom saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar completely. Add the strawberries and basil. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and allow mixture to cool slightly. Transfer to a serving dish and top with oranges and syrup. Chill until ready to serve. Serve over ice cream or cake.

Sift dry ingredients together. Cut in lard until crumbly. Add raisins and orange peel. Stir to mix. Add milk to make dough easy to handle. Knead dough 10 times. Roll out to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut into desired shapes and sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes.

Marinade: combine oil, vinegar, basil and salt in a large bowl. Add bocconcini and toss gently to combine. Leave to marinate for a few hours or overnight. Appetizers: arrange tomato halves on a plate. Add rocket and place the marinated cheese in the middle of the tomatoes. Serve with toothpicks. Cheers, doreen. Doreen randal, wanganui. New zealand.

Pour sake over cherries. Let sit at least 5 minutes. Stir gently. Strain cherry mixture into glasses. Fill each glass with ice. Add a splash of ginger ale to each glass. Stir gently. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve chilled.

In large skillet or pot, brown meat and drain. Add potatoes and carrots and water. Salt and pepper to taste. Bring to boil and then reduce heat and simmer till potatoes are tender. Add onion and ketchup. Add cabbage and cook 5 minutes. Serve over mashed potatoes or rice.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Line 2 large cookie sheets with wax paper. In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter with the sugar until well blended. Beat in the molasses. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine the flour, soda and spicesstir into the molasses mixture. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut with a floured 2-inch cookie cutter. Place 1 inch apart onto the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Yield: 2 1/2 dozen.

Place water and apple juice in a small saucepan. Stir in tea and bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from heat and add cinnamon stick, clove and ginger. Cover and let stand for 10 minutes. Strain and serve over ice.

Bring balsamic vinegar and sugar to a boil in a small saucepan. Remove from heat. Cool. Add walnuts and stir well. Refrigerate until ready to use. In a large bowl, combine greens and zucchini. Toss with dressing and serve topped with shrimp, strawberries, feta and hard-boiled eggs.
Marinade chicken in pineapple juice mixture in plastic bag or dish for 1 hour. Grill or bake chicken. Serve over rice.

Cut up chicken into bite-sized pieces. Place in a large bowl. Add the sugar, soy sauce and butter. Stir gently until the sugar is dissolved. Spread the chicken out onto a cookie sheet. Roast in a 375-degree oven for 25-35 minutes.

In a small bowl mix soy sauce, green onion, brown sugar, garlic cloves, ground ginger, pepper, salt. Mix well. Remove any fat from the surface of the steaks. Place each steak in a zip-lock bag and pour marinade over the steaks. Seal bag and refrigerate overnight. Remove steaks from bag. Place steaks on a hot grill. Grill until desired doneness. Serve.

Combine 1/2 cup water and beer in a Dutch oven. Bring to a boil. Add all remaining ingredients to beer mixture except ham. Stir well. Place ham in slow cooker. Pour liquid mixture over ham. Cover and cook on high for 4 hours. Reduce heat to low and cook for 2 more hours. Let stand for 10 minutes. Slice and serve.

Place 4 cups fresh or frozen cranberries in a saucepan with 1/4 cup water. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in 1/3 cup sugar. Continue to cook until mixture thickens and cranberries pop. Stir in 3/4 cup cranberry-grape juice. Cool. Cut 4 pears in half lengthwise. Remove seeds. Cut each half into 6 wedges. Arrange pears in a lightly-buttered baking dish. Cover with the sauce. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour, or until pears are tender. Stir in 1/2 cup dried cherries and 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon. Bake 15 minutes more. Serve warm. Makes 6 servings.

In an electric mixer combine graham cracker crumbs with sugar and butter. Press mixture onto bottom and up sides of an ungreased 10-inch pie plate. Bake at 350°F for 10 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack. In an electric mixer beat heavy whipping cream and milk until soft peaks form. Add brown sugar and cinnamon. Beat until stiff but not dry. Spread over crust. Refrigerate. In an electric mixer combine chocolate and 1 tablespoon butter. Beat until smooth. Add orange juice and zest. Beat until smooth. Spread over whipped cream layer. Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. Top with whipped cream and garnish with orange zest.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Grease 13"x9" baking pan with cooking spray, line with wax paper and grease again. In a mixing bowl, stir together the flour, baking soda and salt until evenly mixed. In another mixing bowl, cream together the margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the tofu and continue to beat until the mixture is light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time until they are fully incorporated into the mixture. Beat the vanilla into the mixture and then beat in the cocoa powder and flour mixture alternately with the milk until just blended and smooth. Spread the batter evenly into the pan and bake until the center is set and the edges begin to pull away from the pan. Cool on a wire rack for about 2 hours or until the brownies are completely cooled and set. Dust the brownies with chocolate shavings and serve immediately.

In a saute pan, heat olive oil. Add garlic and saute. Add onions and saute until tender. Add zucchini and saute until tender. Add string beans and saute until tender. Add tomatoes and cook until tomatoes are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Add okra and parsley. Serve with fresh lemon slices.

Wash the potatoes and cut into small cubes. In a pan heat oil and add mustard seeds. When it starts spluttering add hing and chili powder and turmeric and coriander powder and fry for 1 minute. Add the cut potatoes and fry for 2-3 minutes. Add salt and mix well. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve.

Prepare barbecue sauce by adding all ingredients to a saucepan and cooking over low heat for 10 minutes. Preheat your grill to high heat. Slice chicken breasts in half and season each side with 1 teaspoon seasoning salt and 1 teaspoon seasoning pepper. Place chicken and veggies in a large zip-top bag. Pour 2 cups barbecue sauce in bag. Seal bag and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Remove chicken and vegetables from bag. Place chicken in a 9-inch-square aluminum foil pan. Place vegetables in a 9-inch-square aluminum foil pan. Drizzle each chicken breast and each vegetable pan with barbecue sauce. Fold foil up and down over chicken and vegetables. Grill 25-30 minutes.

Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour, stirring until smooth. Whisk in the water gradually. Continue whisking until the gravy is smooth. Stir in the soy sauce, nutritional yeast, pepper and salt to taste. Serve on top of mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 375.In a mixing bowl combine flour, molasses, baking powder and salt. Beat together shortening and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and mix well. Stir in peach jam and raisins. Add to flour mixture and mix well. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove to wire rack to cool.

Mix together cottage cheese and lemon juice. Add dill. Blend until smooth. Add scallops. Chill in refrigerator for 1 hour. Fill pasta shells with scallop mixture. Place shells in shallow baking pan. Toss with dressing. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with fresh sliced tomatoes.

Chop onions. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and saute until they are translucent. Add water, green bell peppers, hot peppers, fresh tomatoes. Cover skillet. Simmer over low heat for 20 minutes. Add salt. Serve over noodles or rice.

Heat oil in skillet. Add onion and green pepper. Cook about 5 minutes stirring frequently until vegetables are soft but not browned. Add rice and continue to stir for 5 minutes. Add chicken broth and herbs and continue to stir for 3 minutes or until rice begins to look like it is cooking. Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes or until rice is tender and has absorbed all of the liquid. Let stand covered for 5 minutes before serving. Stir in parsley. Serve with your favorite vegetables.
Boil potatoes in salted water until just tender. Drain. Mash potatoes, stir in cream cheese until smooth. Mix in sour cream, parmesan cheese, green onion. Serve warm.

Heat up 1 to 2 inches of canola oil to 360-370 degrees. In a bowl combine powdered sugar, cinnamon and granulated sugar. Cut biscuits into quarters. Dip each quarter into sugar mixture and place on a paper towel until all quarters are dipped. Then place them into hot oil and cook until they are golden brown on both sides. Then place them into the sugar mixture until all doughnuts are coated.

Place shallot in bowl with sherry vinegar and red wine vinegar. Cover with plastic wrap. Let stand 10 minutes. Stir in oil, salt, and pepper. Reserve 1 tablespoon of dressing in separate bowl. Add tomato wedges to remaining dressing in bowl. Sprinkle with fresh basil leaves. Toss to coat. Arrange tomato salad on plate. Drizzle reserved dressing over top. Garnish with basil sprig.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Sift the dry ingredients into a bowl and add the butter and buttermilk. Mix together until it forms into a soft dough and knead lightly. Divide the mixture into 8 pieces and roll into balls. Place the balls onto a lightly greased baking tray and push them out slightly with the palm of the hand so that they are flat. Brush each with the beaten egg and then sprinkle the caster sugar on top. Bake the biscuits in the oven for about 10 minutes or until they are golden brown. Leave on the tray for 5 minutes before transferring them onto wire racks to cool completely. Serve with butter and honey or jam.

Preheat oven to 425 f. Combine shrimp and crabmeat in a bowl and set aside. In a large saute pan over medium heat, heat butter, garlic and green onions until garlic is golden. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in shrimp and crab meat and combine well. Spoon mixture onto a baking sheet. In a bowl, combine panko and Parmesan cheese, season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle over top of shrimp and crab mixture and bake for 5 minutes in a 425 f oven until shrimp is opaque and topping is golden brown.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Grease 2 cookie sheets.In a medium bowl, stir together the biscuit mix, milk, parmesan cheese, butter, parsley flakes, garlic powder and Italian seasonings.On the prepared cookie sheets, shape the dough into 1 inch strips. Place in the preheated oven. Bake in the preheated oven for 7 minutes. Cool slightly before serving.

Cream butter and sugar. Add egg and vanilla. Mix well. Add cornmeal. Sift together and add flour, baking powder and salt. Mix well. Chill dough 1 hour. Heat oven to 350. Drop dough by rounded tablespoon 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 1 minuteremove from pan. Cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour three 9-inch round baking pans. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking soda and salt. In another bowl, combine the milk, oil and vanilla. Stir the milk mixture into the flour mixture and stir until just moistened. Stir in the vinegar. Pour into the prepared pans. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden and a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool the cake on wire racks. When the cake is completely cool, ice the top. In a small bowl, combine the milk and vanilla and frosting. Spread over the top of the cooled cakes. Decorate with walnuts or pecans.

Cook fettuccine in boiling water for 6 minutes or until al dentedrain. In a small bowl toss butter with ham. Add fettuccine, 1/2 cup of the cream, limoncello, and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper. Transfer to a serving bowltop with parsley and remaining cream and sprinkle with Parmesan. Serve with the remaining pepper sprinkled over the top.

In a large pot, cover potatoes with cold water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-lowcook until potatoes are very tender when pierced with a fork, about 25 minutes. Drain potatoesreturn them to pot. Mash potatoes with a potato masher or the back of a wooden spoon until smooth. Beat in milk, butter and sour cream until smooth. Beat in garlic and cheese until blendedseason with salt and pepper. Transfer potatoes to a serving bowltop with scallions. Makes 4 servings.
Mix dressing ingredients in a medium bowl. Add greens to the bowl and toss to coat. Divide among four plates. Add snow peas and grapes to each plate. Sprinkle with feta cheese and serve.

In a small bowl, combine ham, bell pepper, onion, cheese and flourset aside.In a medium bowl combine eggs and half-and-halfmix well. Add ham mixturemix well.Pour into prepared pie crusts.Bake at 425 for 25 minutesreduce heat to 350 for 25 minutes more.Let stand for a few minutes before slicing into wedges.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Peel potatoes and cut into chunks. Place in a large baking pan, cover with olive oil and garlic cloves. Add dried oregano and sprinkle with salt and black pepper to taste. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour or until the potatoes are tender and soft. Add the beef stock and allow the potatoes to steam for another 10 minutes or so. Stir in the lemon juice and sprinkle with fresh oregano leaves. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Heat oven to 400 degrees. Toss red onions with oil and spread on a rimmed cookie sheet. Add the squash and peppers. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until tender and golden brown.

Melt butter in a saucepan and add the caster sugar. Stir until melted and amber in colour. Beat the egg and add to the mixture. Stir and continue heating for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Sift the self raising flour and add the milk. Stir and add the passionfruit syrup. Stir and add the boiling water. Pour the mixture into a 20cm round lined sponge tin and bake at 180 degrees C for 25 minutes. To make the sauce, combine the passionfruit syrup, butter and cream. Pour over the hot sponge.

Slice zucchini into half-inch rounds. Chop mushrooms. In a small skillet, melt butter and saut mushrooms and zucchini with the garlic for a few minutes. Add the soy sauce and continue cooking until mushrooms are tender. Serve over pasta or rice.
Mix all dry ingredients. Add the butter. Add the eggs and milk. Mix well. Heat the griddle. Pour batter. Cook until bubbles form in the middle. Flip. Serve. Serve with whipped cream and blueberries.

Slice avocados in half and remove seeds. Place one avocado half in the blender and process until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and process until desired consistency. Repeat with other half. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat oil in small saucepan over medium heat until oil is hot but not smoking. Add red chili pepper flakes, cumin seeds, snow peas, and red bell peppers. Cover saucepan. Cook 1 to 2 minutes or until snow peas are crisp-tender. Remove saucepan from heat. Stir snow peas mixture with spoon to mix with oil mixture. Serve immediately.

In large bowl combine first three ingredients. In small bowl combine flour, baking soda, salt. Add honey, butter, buttermilk. Beat until smooth. Pour into large bowl with oats. Stir until blended. Pour onto lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until light brown. Remove from baking sheet. Cool completely. Cut into squares or rectangles with pizza cutter. Makes about 6 dozen cookies.

Place pork chops in crock pot with all remaining ingredients. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Remove pork chops from sauce and shred meat with forks. Mix meat back into sauce. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes. Enjoy.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add bacon to skillet and cook until browned. Remove bacon from pan. Add olive oil. Cook potatoes in skillet until golden brown. Remove potatoes. In the same skillet cook the sliced mushrooms. Stir in cooked bacon. Heat through. Beat eggs in a bowl. Season the eggs with salt and pepper. Add chopped rosemary. Add cooked vegetables. Add the potatoes and bacon. Place pan into preheated oven. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes until egg is set. Garnish with fresh rosemary. Cut into wedges. Serve hot.

Cut tomatoes in half lengthwise and remove seeds and pulp. Sprinkle insides with salt and pepper. Spread with mayonnaise and top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Garnish with parsley.

Heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add the mushrooms and fry for 2-3 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside to cool slightly. Mix together the flour, baking powder and salt. In a bowl, beat the eggs with the buttermilk until combined. Add the flour mixture and the cooled mushrooms, then stir until just combined. Heat a frying pan over a medium heat with 1 tbsp olive oil. Using an ice cream scoop or 1/4 cup measure, drop the mixture onto the pan and fry for 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve hot with sour cream and chives.

Heat oil in large skillet on medium heat. Brown chicken in hot oil for 1 minute on each side. Add soup and milk. Bring to boil. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in parmesan cheese and basil. Pour into a serving dish. Serve over hot pasta.

Sift flour, baking soda and cinnamon together in a large mixing bowl. In a separate bowl, mix egg, molasses, buttermilk and melted butter. Stir molasses mixture into the sifted ingredients. Beat well until dough is smooth and moist. Roll out to 1/2 thickness on floured surface and cut into circles with a biscuit cutter or drinking glass. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes at 400 degrees. Cool on wire racks. Makes 2 dozen cookies.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a small bowl, stir together the chili powder, cumin, paprika, and oreganoset aside. Beat the sugar and egg together in a small bowl, and stir into the chili powder mixture until well blended. In another bowl, combine the flour, bread crumbs, and salt. Dip each fillet into the egg mixture and coat with the flour mixture. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Place fillets into the baking dishspray tops of fillets with cooking spray. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork and is cooked through. Meanwhile, cook the spinach according to package directions and drain. Serve the salmon topped with spinach and drizzle with the olive oil.

In a skillet heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Cook the onion in oil until translucent. Add garlic cloves and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Add red pepper flakes and chili-garlic sauce, cook until fragrant for 2-3 minutes. Add beef broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve on top of mashed potatoes garnished with sour cream.

Place the roast in the crock pot. Add the pickles and chili sauce. Add the garlic cloves. Sprinkle with the pepper. Pour in the water. Cover and cook on low for 10 to 12 hours. Shred the meat and serve on the bun. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spread bread cubes on baking sheet and bake 5 minutes or until dry and crisp. Remove from oven and stir. Bake 5-10 minutes more or until golden brown. Transfer to a bowl and mix in seasonings. Stir in parmesan cheese.

Preheat the oven to 450. Place the sweet potatoes in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest and salt and pepper to taste. Pour the oil mixture over the potatoes and toss until coated. Spread the potatoes onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Roast until soft and brown around the edges. Drizzle with melted butter and sprinkle with brown sugar. Roast for a couple minutes longer until the glaze is caramelized.

While marshmallows are toasting add heavy cream to the saucepan and heat over medium-high heat until it begins to boil. Add the semisweet and dark chocolate and let it melt into the cream mixture. Add the toasted marshmallows and stir until the marshmallows are melted and the mixture is completely smooth. Serve in mugs or in a bowl with graham cracker sticks or cookies for dipping.

Cook hot dogs and set aside. Fry the onions in butter until translucent and soft. Add the ketchup, mustard, relish, and chili and simmer until thick. Combine the hot dogs with the mixture and heat through. Serve in hot dog buns with a sprinkling of cheese and a pickle slice.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. In a large bowl, toss the beets with the butter, honey and ginger until everything is evenly coated with the butter mixture. Spread the beets evenly on a large baking pan and sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Roast the beets until tender when pierced with a knife or skewer, about 45 minutes. Serve warm with your favorite accompaniments, such as goat cheese and salad greens.

Line a 9x13 inch pan with waxed paper. Melt butter and cocoa in a large pot over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in honey and water until combined. Stir in rice bubbles until well coated. Pour into prepared pan and refrigerate for at least an hour until set. Cut into squares and store in an airtight container. These are really rich and chocolatey so you don't need a lot at a time. I also found if I didn't have waxed paper in the cupboard I used baking paper and they came out just fine.

Preheat oven to 375f. Coat a 9x13x2 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and garlic powder. Cook and stir until the potatoes are golden brown, 5 to 6 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and the remaining butter and garlic powder. In a small bowl, combine oil and salt and pepper. Drizzle over potatoes. Toss to coat. Transfer potatoes to the pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Stir the potatoes and bake for 10 to 15 minutes more or until the potatoes are crisp and brown.

Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, whisk together honey, cocoa and salt. Add coconut oil and milk. Whisk to combine. Fold in peanut butter and vanilla. Fold in oats. Form into 1 inch balls. Place on prepared sheets. Refrigerate until set. Makes 32 balls.

Beat eggs and sugar together for 5 minutes or until light and fluffy. Add oil and vanilla and beat well. Add flour, baking soda and salt. Mix well. Stir in oats and mandarin oranges. Pour into a greased loaf pan and bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees. After baking, mix together mandarin orange gelatin and boiling water and pour over bread. Refrigerate overnight and serve the next day. Great for Easter, Mother’s Day or any other time you want a delicious bread.

Pour all the ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Shake well for about 30 seconds or until the outside of the shaker is very cold. Pour into a cocktail glass and garnish with a lime slice.
In large bowl, combine all ingredients. Refrigerate 24 hours. Serve chilled.

Spread each slice of bread with butter and top each slice with 1 slice of cheese. Place on grill and cook 2-3 minutes on each side until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown. Assemble sandwiches using 1/2 of each sandwich, chicken, raisins, almonds and celery on one slice of bread and cheese on the other slice of bread. Spread mayonnaise on outside of bread and press together. Cut in half and enjoy.

Pour couscous into a large bowl. Add tea bag. Stir in water and chicken broth. Cover and let stand until liquid is absorbed and couscous is tender, about 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Stir in raisins and almonds. Sprinkle with cumin. Serve hot.

Preheat oven broiler. Slice bread into 1-inch slices. In small bowl combine cheese and seasonings. Spread each slice with cheese mixture. Top with red onion, olives, tomatoes and ham. Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Grease 9 x 13 pan. Crush graham crackers. Melt margarine. Add cake mix. Press into pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Combine buttermilk, eggs and vanilla. Pour over crust. Sprinkle with crackers. Bake 30 minutes. Cool. Spread with cream cheese. Dust with powdered sugar.

Cut pineapple into 1-inch slices. Brush with butter. Combine brown sugar and rum. Grill over medium heat until pineapple is tender and sugar begins to caramelize. Top with mint leaves and basil leaves. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Beat egg whites until stiff. Add vanilla. Set aside. Mix together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Add the sugar and egg yolks. Beat until smooth. Add the milk. Add the butter. Beat until smooth. Add the egg whites and mix lightly. Pour into a greased and floured 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes. When cool, spread frosting over top. Cut into squares. Frosting: Combine the butter, milk and sugar. Heat until the butter melts. Cool slightly. Beat in vanilla. Spread over the cooled cake.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Pound each chicken breast until it is 1/4 inch thick. In a mixing bowl combine the butter and white sugar. Add the onions and cook over medium heat. Add the parsley and cook for 3 more minutes. Sprinkle with lemon pepper. Spread the mixture over the chicken breasts and roll up. Place in a 9x13 pan. Mix together the lemon juice and garlic salt. Pour over the chicken breasts. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9-inch springform pan. In a medium bowl combine the splenda and cake flour. Stir in the salt. Add the egg whites and beat with an electric mixer until smooth and foamy. Gradually beat in the nonfat milk. Spread over bottom of springform pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Meanwhile, combine the fat free cream cheese and vanilla in a bowl. Stir until smooth. Spread over baked crust. Bake 15 to 20 minutes more or until set. Remove from oven and cool. Refrigerate. Remove sides of springform pan. Makes 8 servings.

Tear the toast into small pieces. Sprinkle with the shrimp and sprinkle with the cheese. Broil until the cheese is melted and the shrimp turn pink. Sprinkle with the onion rings and sesame seeds. Serves 2.
Combine all dressing ingredients in small bowl. Add onion. Toss to coat. Add greens. Toss to combine. Divide between 2 individual salad bowls. Garnish each with plum tomato. Serve immediately.

Clean the fish and cut in thin pieces. Heat oil in a fry pan. Add turmeric and red chili powders and ginger-garlic paste and stir for few seconds. Then add fish pieces and saute for few seconds. Now add black pepper and lemon juice and mix well. Close the lid of the fry pan and cook for 2-3 minutes on low heat. Serve hot with rice or chappathi.

Place honey in small saucepan. Stir in lemon juice. Bring to a boil over medium heatcook 1 minute. Stir in mustard, curry powder, onion. Reduce heatsimmer 3 to 5 minutes or until thickened slightly. Remove from heatstir in almonds. Combine with chicken. Place in baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 to 45 minutes. Serve hot.

Cut salmon into bite size chunks. Cut potatoes into bite size chunks. Melt butter in skillet. Add salmon. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add potatoes. Cook for about 10 minutes or until salmon and potatoes are brown. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with salad or vegetables of your choice.

Soak konbu and shiitake mushrooms in water for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, cut beef into 1/2 inch strips. Add water to pot and bring to a boil. Add beef and konbu mixture. Cover and cook for 1 minute. Add shiitake mixture, watercress, tofu, enoki mushrooms, and pasta. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve in bowls with dipping sauce.

Mix cheesecake mix and filling together in large bowl. Add 1/2 cup cherry pie filling to the mixture. Spread the mixture into 6 parfait glasses. Top with lemon rind and almonds. Store in the fridge until ready to serve. Chill thoroughly. Serve with the remaining cherry pie filling.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Season the pork on both sides with the salt and pepper. Add the pork to the pan and saute until browned on both sides. Add the potatoes to the pan, cook for 5 minutes or until the potatoes are soft. Pour the wine over the pork and potatoes, bring to a boil, cover and bake for 20 minutes or until pork is cooked through. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool for 5 minutes. In another skillet heat the butter over medium heat. Add the cabbage and saute until wilted. Add the cooked pork to the cabbage mixture and toss together.

In a shallow dish, combine the honey, mustards and lemon juice. Dip each chicken breast into the mixture and allow the excess to drip off. In a shallow bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and butter. Dip each breast in the crumbs to coat. Place the brie slices on the breast. Broil until the cheese is melted and the crumbs are golden.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a shallow dish, combine the breadcrumbs, cheddar cheese, ancho powder, garlic powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Whisk egg in another shallow dish. Dip each piece of chicken into the egg, then into the breadcrumb mixture to coat. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Turn over and bake for another 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium bowl, cream butter with brown sugar. Add oats and salt. Stir in baking powder. On a floured surface, roll dough into a 1/2 inch thick circle. Cut with a floured 2 inch biscuit cutter. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake until light brown around the edges. Cool on wire rack. Yields about 1 dozen.

Trim the lamb rack and remove any fat. Place the lamb on a plate and rub with the herbs. Season with a little salt and pepper. Warm the oven to gas mark 6/200c. Mix the mint jelly with the garlic and dried parsley. Heat the oil in a small frying pan. Add the lamb and cook for 2 minutes on each side until just browned. Spoon the mint mixture over the lamb and cook for a further 6-8 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, salt, Worcestershire sauce, oregano, and chipotle powder. Cook until the sugar is dissolved and the sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. In a large roasting pan or baking dish, place the ribs flat side down.
