Pour the sauce over the ribs and spread evenly. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the ribs are tender. Remove the ribs to a cutting board to cool slightly while you make the glaze. Whisk the ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, salt, Worcestershire sauce, oregano, and chipotle powder together until smooth. Brush the ribs with the glaze and allow to cool before serving.

Chop dandelions into large pieces and sautee with bacon and onions until tender and bacon is crisp, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with the dry mustard and stir well. Add the vinegar and sugar and stir well. Cook until liquid is almost gone and add the salt and pepper to taste. Stir well and serve immediately.

Place the bouillon cube and 1 1/2 cups water into a small saucepan. Bring to a boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the remaining ingredients. Let cool. This makes approximately 3 cups of vinaigrette. It can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 10 days. To serve, drizzle the dressing over salad greens.

Line 8x8 baking pan with foil, spray with cooking spray. Melt chocolate chips and condensed milk together over medium heat until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in walnuts and rice bubbles. Press mixture into the prepared pan. Top with oats and chocolate chips. Chill until set before cutting into bars.
Spread brie onto bottom of tart shells. Sprinkle pecans over cheese. Pour brown sugar over pecans. Top with whiskey. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until bubbling. Serve warm.

Saute beef, onion, mushrooms in oil until beef is brown. Add garlic. Stir. Add tomatoes with juices. Add italian seasoning. Add parmesan cheese. Add wine vinegar. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over no-salt-added spaghetti.

In a medium saucepan bring chicken broth to a boil. Add barley. Simmer over low heat until tender, about 45 minutes. Let cool completely. Cut vegetables to desired size. Mix in vegetables and dill. Stir in vinaigrette and pine nuts. Serve.

Heat water to boiling. Add lobster shells. Simmer 5 minutes. Drain. In a saucepan combine stock, lobster shells, onions, celery tops, parsley and bay leaf. Bring to a boil. Simmer 25-30 minutes. Strain. Discard solids. Yields 3 cups.

Blend the graham cracker crumbs with the melted butter in a medium bowl. Press the mixture into the bottom and 1/2 inch up the sides of a 9-inch pie plate. Blend the condensed milk and margarita mix in a small bowl with a hand mixer until well combined. Pour into the prepared crust and bake for 20 minutes or until the filling is set and the edges are lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack and chill for at least 2 hours before serving. Note: For a more traditional margarita pie flavor, prepare the crust with 1 tablespoon lime zest and 1 tablespoon lime juice mixed with the melted butter. Prepare the filling with 1/2 cup tequila and 1 tablespoon lime zest and 1 tablespoon lime juice blended with the sweetened condensed milk and margarita mix.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Heat olive oil and butter in a large frying pan over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until tender. Add tomatoes and cook until softened. Add wine, brandy and shrimp. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add feta cheese. Stir in lemon rind and season to taste. Place mixture in a buttered baking dish. Cover with breadcrumbs and bake for about 25 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly. Serve over rice.

Preheat grill to 350 f. Place cherry tomatoes in a single layer on the grill rack. Cook for 5 minutes turning once. Combine breadcrumbs and seasonings in a shallow bowl. Dip each tomato into the breadcrumb mixture. Place the tomatoes back on the grill and cook until browned. Sprinkle with fresh herbs. Serve immediately.

Prepare the marinade by combining the soy sauce, oil, garlic and ginger and mixing well. Cut the beef into 1 x 1/2 inch strips and add to the marinade. Cover and leave to marinate for 30 minutes. Thread the beef onto skewers and cook over a barbecue or under a grill for 4 minutes on each side. Meanwhile, prepare the sauce by combining all the ingredients. Serve the beef with the sauce.
Spread hummus on one slice of bread. Layer avocado, tomatoes, and hummus on top of bread slice. Sprinkle salt and pepper as desired. Add second slice of bread.

Drain shrimp and let cool. Break the ritz crackers into pieces. Mix shrimp and cracker pieces in large mixing bowl. Add garlic and old bay seasoning. Mix well. Stuff each shrimp. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Combine miracle whip and lemon juice. Pour over shrimp and bake another 5 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with rolls.

Toss asparagus with 1 tbsp oil and vinegar. Marinate in refrigerator 30 minutes-1 hour. Drain well and toss with the hearts of palm and tomatoes. Toss with remaining oil and vinegar. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste and serve.

Heat oven to 350f. Combine the shortening, brown sugar and eggbeat well. Sift together the flour, baking soda, cream of tartar and ginger. Blend into the sugar mixture. Mix well. Shape dough into a ballroll in granulated sugar. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Prepare breading. Cube steak, flour, salt and pepper. Shake off excess flour and fry steaks in hot oil until done. When cooked drain and set aside. Slice French bread and place in oven. Toast bread and set aside. Saute green peppers and onions and add meat, chili sauce, worcestershire sauce and lemon juice. Heat through and then add prepared mustard and mix well. Serve with toasted French bread.
Boil hot dogs and place in hot dog buns. Pour hot chili sauce and hot chili peppers on top of hot dogs. Add lettuce and shredded cheese. Roll up hot dogs and enjoy.

Soften cream cheese, stir in lemon juice & sweetened condensed milk. Fold in topping mixspoon into paper baking cups. Freeze 3 hours or until firm. Garnish with pecans, pineapple chunks & cherry pie filling.

Toast bread in panini maker or toaster oven until crispy on both sides. Spread with mayonnaise on both sides of bread. Spread american cheese on one slice of bread. Place second slice of bread with cheese side down on top of cheese. Grill sandwich until cheese melts on both sides. Remove sandwich from grill and slice into 2 triangles.

In a blender combine the vinegar, honey, poppy seed and dry mustard until smooth. Add the oil in a slow stream and blend. In a large bowl combine the spinach and fruit. Pour the dressing over and toss.

Heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the zucchini and cook until it is browned. Add the tomatoes and the garlic and cook for one minute. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the eggs and cook until set. Top with the basil and serve immediately.

Mix the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar in a bowl. Beat the egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the egg whites. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in buttermilk. Heat a 1/2-inch of canola oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Using a pastry bag fitted with a 2 1/2-inch star-shaped tip, pipe batter into hot oil. Fry until golden brown on the bottom. Turn to brown the other side. Drain on paper towels. Serve with jam and powdered sugar.

Heat olive oil in pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saute until onion is tender. Add tomatoes and fennel seed. Bring to boilthen reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Add green beans and simmer 3 -4 minutes. Add salt, pepper, sugar, and parsleysimmer for an additional 3 minutes. Serve hot.

Add fresh cranberries and sugar to a large saucepan. Stir in water and bring to a boil. Simmer uncovered, stirring often until mixture has thickened, about 30 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients and simmer until fruit is tender and flavors have blended. Remove from heat and cool. Makes about 4 cups.

Steam broccoli until tender-crisp. In a small bowl combine olive oil and garlic. Melt the garlic and olive oil over low heat for 30 seconds to a minute. Drain broccoli and pour over garlic-olive mixture and toss until coated with mixture. Sprinkle with dried cayenne pepper and add enough water to thin to your liking. Salt to taste. Serve with crackers or toast.

In a large bowl whisk together eggs, half-and-half, brown sugar and vanilla. In a 9 x 13 baking pan, layer french bread slices and butter. Spread half of the egg mixture over the bread. Sprinkle with half of the pecans. Repeat with remaining bread and topping. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with maple syrup.

Hard boil 6 large eggs. Peel them under cold running water. Cut them in half lengthwise. Remove the yolks to a small bowl. Mash the yolks with a fork until smooth. Add mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, salt, sugar, and paprika to taste. Stir to mix. Fill egg white halves with the yolk mixture. Sprinkle with paprika. Refrigerate for at least one hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large sauté pan over medium heat add the butter. When the butter has melted add the flour. Whisk constantly until the mixture turns golden brown. Add the milk gradually, whisking constantly. Remove from heat. In a separate bowl add the eggs one at a time. Stir in the cheese. Fold in the vegetables. Pour into the prepared pie pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes.

Peel and slice potatoes. In a large sauce pan, add water and butter. Bring to boiling. Add potatoes and return water to boiling. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Drain potatoes and place in a bowl. Add cheddar cheese and paprika and toss. Melt butter in a large skillet and add corn flakes. Toss and serve over potato mixture.
Beat together egg, water, rice cereal, garlic powder, salt and pepper in shallow dish. Dip each piece in mixtureplace in shallow dish. Bake uncovered at 350 for 15 min. or until thoroughly cooked.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease muffin pan or line with muffin cups. Peel and mash bananas. Beat together oil, sugar and eggs until smooth. Stir in bananas. Add dry ingredients. Fill muffin cups about 3/4 full. Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and cool on wire rack.

Combine margarine and sugars. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Combine flour, baking soda and saltadd to creamed mixture. Chill dough. Shape into 1-inch ballsroll in chocolate chips. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool on baking sheets. Makes 18-20 cookies.

Cook bacon over medium-low heat in a large pot. Stir occasionally until browned and crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Add the onion and celery ribs to the drippings and cook, stirring until tender. Sprinkle with the flour and cook, stirring until the mixture is golden and nutty-smelling. Add the chicken stock and cook until the mixture is thickened and the potato is tender, about 5 minutes. Add the potato, milk and corn and cook until the potato is tender and the corn is cooked through, about 5 minutes. Stir in the reserved bacon and cook just until heated through. Stir in the sour cream and heat through. Season with salt and pepper.

Place butter and sugar in a heavy saucepan. Cook over low heat until butter melts. Add water & bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add chocolate chips & walnuts. Drop by tablespoons onto waxed paper. Refrigerate until set. Remove & unmold. Store in an airtight container.

Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add the spinach and stir fry until it wilts. Add the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and sesame seeds. Serve hot.

Preheat broiler. Mix ginger, garlic powder, soy sauce, orange juice, honey and 1 teaspoon green onions in small bowl until smooth. Reserve 1/4 cup marinade for basting. Place fish in single layer in shallow baking dish. Spoon remaining marinade evenly over fish. Sprinkle fish with remaining green onion. Broil fish 5 inches from heat 4 minutes. Turn fish and baste with reserved marinade. Broil 3 to 4 minutes longer until fish flakes easily with fork. Sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving if desired. Serves 4.

Place the basmati rice in a medium heavy-bottomed pot and add 1-2 cups of water over the rice. Bring the water and rice to a boil, then cover and reduce the heat to low. Cook for approximately 18-22 minutes or until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed. Turn off the heat and fluff the rice with a fork or a wooden spoon. Serve with unsalted butter and a dash of salt.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, evaporated milk and butter. Heat to a boil. Boil for 6 minutes, stirring constantly. Add chocolate chips. Remove from heat. Stir until chocolate is smooth. Add marshmallow cream and vanilla. Stir until smooth. Add nuts. Pour into a buttered 9 x 13 pan. Cool for an hour. Cut into 48 squares. Store in refrigerator.
Blend together in a food processor until smooth and creamy. Serve with freshly baked scones or breads and spread thinly over fresh fruit as a gourmet fruit dip.

In a large bowl beat together shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Combine flour, baking powder and saltadd to the mixture alternately with the milk, mixing well after each addition. Pour batter into an ungreased 9 x 13 inch pan. Sprinkle with nuts and bake for 40 to 45 minutes in the preheated oven or until cake tests done. Cool in pan for 2 minutes before removing to rack to cool completely.

Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and cook for about 1 minute. Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes. Ladle into prepared jars leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Process for 5 minutes in a boiling water bath.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a shallow baking dish or roasting pan with the cooking spray. Add the shrimp to the baking dish or pan in a single layer. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, butter, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, lemon-pepper seasoning, red pepper flakes, and parsley. Spoon the mixture over the shrimp. Bake for 15 minutes. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Cut the asparagus into 2-inch lengths and place in a medium baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast in the oven for about 15 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with lemon juice and serve immediately.

In a medium bowl beat together eggs and sugar with a mixer until light and frothy. Beat in salt, cinnamon, vanilla and brandy until well blended. Gradually beat in milk and nutmeg until well blended. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Makes 3 cups.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 8 inch cake pans. In a large bowl, mix together the blanched almonds and the confectioners' sugar until well blended. Add the lemon zest and cinnamon, and mix well. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until foamy, then gradually beat in the granulated sugar until stiff peaks form. Fold the egg whites into the almond mixture until blended. Pour the batter into the prepared pans and bake in the preheated oven until the cake is golden and springs back when gently touched in the center (about 25 minutes). Cool the cakes in the pans on a wire rack for at least an hour before serving. You can also dust the cake with powdered sugar before serving if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut brie in half and remove the rind and any excess fat from the cheese. Place the brie rounds in an 8×8 inch baking dish. Combine the apricots, preserves, cranberries and almondsspread over the brie rounds. Bake until the cheese has melted and the cranberries have softened, 15 minutes. Serve with crackers or toasted bread.

Process basil, garlic, pine nuts, parmesan cheese, and olive oil in a food processor until smooth. Add lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Use immediately. You can store this in the refrigerator for 2 or 3 days in an airtight container. It will thicken after it is chilled. It will not freeze well. It can be used on pizza. It can also be used as a dip or spread. It goes well with pasta. It is very good with tomatoes and mozzarella. You can serve it as a dip for bread or crackers. It can also be served with fish or chicken.

Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add beefcook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in ketchup, brown sugar, mustard, and Southern Comfortcook 1 minute. Serve on buns or on a baking sheet lined with wax paper for a sloppy Joe sandwich. Serve with fresh sliced tomatoes, pickles, and chips. Makes 4 servings.
Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain potatoes. Put in a blender or food processor with onion. Add milk. Blend. Put in saucepan. Cook over low heat until heated through. Serve hot.

Combine turkey meat with poultry seasoning. Form into 4 patties. Brush lightly with olive oil. Cook in a non stick skillet over medium-high heat for about 4 minutes on each side. Divide blue cheese between the patties. Serve in hamburger buns.
Combine all ingredients in blender and blend until smooth. Serve immediately or freeze in individual containers for later use. Serves 1.

Preheat oven to 375 f. Remove mushroom gills and stems. Cut the mushrooms into 1/2-inch-wide slices. Combine butter with mushrooms and garlic in a skillet over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Roll crescent dough into a 12x8 rectangle. Spread evenly with the mushroom mixture. Sprinkle with brie cheese. Starting with the 8-inch side of the rectangle, roll up. Cut into six equal pieces. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Brush with egg and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake at 375 f for 12 to 14 minutes. Cool 2 minutes before serving. Makes 6.

Combine bread crumbs, cheeses, spices and salt in a bowl. Cut chicken into 3/4-inch cubes. Put in a bowl with enough buttermilk to cover. Let stand for 10 minutes. Remove chicken and pat dry. Dip in the seasoned bread crumb mixture. Place on a baking sheet. Bake in a 450 degree F oven for 10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Drain can of pork and beans. Brown the ground sirloin. Drain fat. Add onion soup mix, ketchup, karo syrup, brown sugar, and cumin. Cook for 15 minutes. Add pork and beans. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve on top of a bun with ketchup.
Brown ground beef and onion together in large skilletdrain and add tomato sauce. Stir in macaroni and remaining ingredientsheat throughserve with shredded cheddar cheese for topping.

Place roast in bottom of dutch oven or crock pot. Rub with cooking oil. Heat dutch oven or crock pot to 350f. Brown roast for about 1 hour. Remove roast and pour off all but 1/2 cup fat. Add tomatoes and green chilies, taco seasoning and beef bouillon. Stir in 1/2 cup water and 1/3 cup sugar. Return roast to pot and add water to cover. Cover pot tightly and cook on low for 10 to 12 hours. Remove roast and shred. Return meat to pot and stir to combine. Cook until heated through. Serve over rice with corn chips.

Prepare the rhubarb by washing and cutting into 1-inch pieces. Boil the rhubarb, water and sugar for 5-10 minutes until it thickens. Remove from heat and cool. Season the chicken quarters with salt and pepper and add the butter and spices. Add the rhubarb to the bottom of the pan and place the chicken on top of it. Place in oven at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked and no pink remains in the middle. Remove from the oven and serve on top of the rhubarb sauce.

Preheat oven to 350F. Beat eggs in large bowl until light and fluffy. Add milk, pumpkin and spices. Beat until well blended. Pour into pie shell. Bake 45 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean. Serve warm with whipped topping.

Peel 1 apple and core it. Cut into 1/2" cubes. In a small bowl combine 1/4 c. light margarine with 1/2 tsp. splenda. Mix 1/2 tsp. cinnamon with 1/4 tsp. nutmeg. Add to margarine mixture and blend well. Add 1 tsp. flour. Spread half of mixture over apple cubes in a 9" x 13" baking dish. Repeat with remaining apple cubes. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve hot.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add asparagus and cook until tender. Stir in chicken broth and soy sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Makes 4 servings.

Combine the dry ingredients and stir well. Blend in the margarine and honey. Add the sugar and egg and combine well. Add milk slowly and mix just until blended. Pour into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into 2x2 inch pieces and serve warm.

Peel and dice potatoes. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and garlic and saute until lightly browned. Sprinkle with potato starch and stir until well blended and smooth. Cook over medium-low heat until thickened and no liquid remains in the pan. Cool. Add eggs and mix well. Form into balls about 1 inch in diameter. Dip the balls in the egg mixture and then roll in the potato starch. Place on a baking sheet and lightly dust with paprika. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for about 20 minutes.

In a large bowl combine turkey, ginger and garlic. Add soy sauce and mix well. Divide meat mixture into 4 equal portions and shape into patties about 1/2 inch thick. In a small bowl combine hoisin sauce and sesame oil and mix well. Set aside. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Lightly grease the skillet. Cook patties until browned on the bottom. Turn and brown on other side. Place a slice of pineapple on each burger. Spread hoisin sauce mixture on the top bun and top with burger. Worlds best recipes.

Cut the top and bottom off each drumstick. Place the drumsticks on a baking tray lined with aluminum foil. Combine the garlic clove, thyme and orange juice in a bowl. Pour the mixture over the drumsticks. Sprinkle the marmalade over the top. Bake for 45 minutes.

Combine oil and soup in a crock pot. Stir in onion and seasonings. Place pork steaks in a shallow dish and pour soup mixture over them to cover. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Place pork steaks in crock pot and add potatoes and cabbage. Cover and cook on high for 6 hours or on low for 9 hours. Remove pork steaks and keep warm. Cover vegetables and cook for additional hour or until tender. Serve over pork steaks with light cream if desired.

In a medium saucepan combine vegetable stock, shallot, garlic, and artichoke hearts. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in milk and half & half, heat through. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Garnish with basil & serve with croutons.

Place 2 layers of biscuits on each of 2 serving plates. Top each with 1 tablespoon chocolate syrupsprinkle with 1 tablespoon chocolate chipstop with 2 scoops ice cream per platetop with mint leaf. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving time.

Peel and separate 5-6 cloves of garlic. Toss with 2 tablespoons olive oil and a pinch of salt. Roast garlic at 350 until tender, about 35 minutes. Slice garlic. Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch cubes. Cook in boiling water until tender. Mash with butter and milk. Fold in garlic and more olive oil to taste. Salt and pepper to taste.

In a medium skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add tomatoes, garlic, and pepper flakes. Cook until tomatoes are softened and the mixture is reduced to about 1/3 cup, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add spinach to skillet and stir until just wilted. Season to taste. Top fish with spinach mixture. Broil until fish is just cooked through, about 5 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine the brown sugar, cornstarch and white wine vinegar. In a non stick skillet over medium heat, combine the green peppers, onions and pineapple. Bring to a boil. Add the sauce mixture. Cook until thickened. Add the meatballs to the skillet. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over a bed of rice.

Bring broth to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the cucumbers. Reduce heat. Simmer until tender, about 5 minutes. Remove the cucumbers from the broth and cut them into thin strips. Return the cucumber strips to the broth. Add the mushrooms, vinegar and scallions. Season with ginger to taste. Sprinkle with sesame oil. Garnish with ginger.
Boil hot water. Add lemon juice, sugar, cinnamon stick, nutmeg, fresh ginger. Remove from heat. Add butter. Let cool. Then add rum. Serve with lemon zest.

Cook onion and tomato in hot oil for 5-7 minutes. Mix eggs and milk. Add salt and pepper. Stir in cabbage, tomato and onion mixture. Cook on low for about 10 minutes. Break up crab and add to mixture. Stir together. Cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes. Serve with ranch dressing. Warm corn tortillas.

In a blender add garbanzo beans, sauce, cilantro, oil, pepper, salt, lime juice, and water to blend until smooth. Transfer mixture into a bowl and let cool to room temperature. In the meantime preheat oven to 400 degrees F. When pasta is done drain well, put in a bowl, and pour sauce on top. Toss to coat. Transfer pasta to a baking dish, sprinkle with feta cheese, and bake for about 15 minutes. Serve with corn tortillas on the side to roll up the pasta in.

Beat together eggs and milk, and salt. Soak bread in egg mixture about 5 minutes on each side. Melt butter in fry pan over medium heat. Add bread. Cook about 4 minutes per side until golden brown. In the meantime, prepare caramel by combining sugar, water and corn syrup in a saucepan over medium heat and stirring until dissolved. Bring mixture to a boil and boil for 4 minutes or until dark amber in color. Stir in baking soda and water and stir until mixture is foamy and has thickened slightly. Pour caramel over french toast and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375° F. Grease a 9-inch square baking dish with butter and set aside. Peel and slice the pears into a large mixing bowl. Add cranberries and mix in cornstarch. In a small bowl, whisk together the sugar and flour. Sprinkle over the pears and toss with a fork until evenly coated with the flour mixture. In a separate bowl, stir together the butter, vanilla extract, and salt. Pour over the pear mixture and toss with a fork to combine. Pour into the prepared pan and spread into an even layer. In a small bowl, combine the oats, sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over the pear filling. Bake for 30 minutes, or until the filling is bubbling and the top is light golden brown.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until just golden, about 1 minute. Add peanuts and cook until golden brown and just crisp, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in chili powder and pepper flakes. Transfer to a plate and let cool completely.

Cook onion and potatoes in broth until tender. Add bacon. Beat together flour and water until smooth. Add to broth mixture. Cook and stir until thickened. Remove from heat and add cheese until melted. Add sour cream. Makes 6 servings.

Brown the sausage and onions. Add garlic and cook another minute or so. Add white wine and simmer until reduced by half. Add the broth and simmer for about 30 minutes. Add the beans and cook for another 20 minutes or until heated through. Stir in the dark meat and parsley just before serving. Serve with crusty bread.

Crack eggs into a bowl and add a few pinches of mixed herbs, a large pinch of salt and a large grinding of pepper. Beat until smooth with a fork. In a medium saute pan over medium-low heat, melt 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter. When melted, pour in the eggs and cook them slowly without stirring. They should be mostly set around the edges before you stir them. Cook for a minute or so longer, then fold in the mixed herbs. Remove from the heat and serve hot with baguette slices or muffins.

Melt butter in a large skillet. Add onions and cook until softened, about 12 minutes. Add beef broth, salt, and garlic powder. Cover and simmer until onions are very tender, about 30 minutes. Ladle into bowls, sprinkle with cheese, top with croutons and serve.

Boil eggs for 12 minutes. When cool, slice in half lengthwise. Remove yolks and put them in a bowl. Mash yolks with a fork. Add mayonnaise and mustard. Mix thoroughly. Season with garlic salt. Spoon yolks back into egg whites. Garnish with slivered almonds and parsley. Serve.
Combine frozen concentrate and sherbet in a large punch bowl. Add pineapple juice and lemon-lime beverage. Mix well. Serve over ice. Garnish with orange slices and cherries.
Combine lemon juice and water in a blender. Add ice cubes and sugar and blend until smooth. Pour into 4 glasses and garnish with orange wedges.

Brown the chicken in a little cooking spray. Drain the grease. Add seasoning and cooked black beans. Add hot water and cooking bouillon. Let cook for about 15 minutes. Stir in the rotel and cook for 5 more minutes. Then add the cheese and sour cream. Cook until cheese is melted and the soup is heated through. Serve with tortilla chips.
Place the ice into a blender. Add the milk. Add the chocolate syrup. Add the coffee. Blend until frothy. Serve immediately.
Marinate chicken breasts in italian dressing for about 24 hours. Grill or bake until cooked through. Top with parmesan cheese & parsley.

Cook cabbage in boiling water for 10 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and set aside. Saute ham in skillet with onion until brown and crisp-tender. Drain and set aside. In small bowl combine soup and milk. Heat to boilingstir until smooth. Stir in ham and cabbage. Spread mixture into 11-in. X 7-in. X 2-in. Baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Combine the topping ingredientssprinkle over ham mixture. Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes or until lightly browned and heated through.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Season chicken breasts with mixed herbs. Heat olive oil in heavy skillet over medium-high heat and cook chicken breasts about 12 minutes or until done. Remove chicken from heat and let it cool. Cut into pieces and set aside. Add shallot and garlic and cook until tender. Add chicken stock and white wine and simmer until liquid is reduced by half, about 10 minutes. Add heavy cream and chicken breasts and cook until heated through. Stir in pasta and parmesan cheese and toss.

Mix coconut, oats, whey protein powder and milk. Add chocolate pudding mix according to directions on box. Form into bars or balls using your hands. Wrap each bar individually with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1-2 hours. Serve cold.

Cut pears into 1/4-inch dice. In a large pot, combine pears with the onion, red and green peppers. Cook over medium heat until softened, about 10 minutes. Transfer mixture to a colander to drain. Combine the pear mixture with the sugar, salt, vinegar and allspice. Refrigerate overnight. Stir before serving.

Heat 2 Tbs. butter in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until tender. Add garlicsaute 1 minute longer. Stir in flour. Cook over medium-low heat 3-5 minutes or until flour is golden brown. Gradually add broth and milk. Add basil. Bring to a boilcook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in parmesan cheese until melted. Makes enough for 2 medium pizzas. Serves 12.
In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add sugar snap peas and cook until crisp tender. Add pecans and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving plate.

Butter one side of each slice of bread and spread with mustard. Layer the bread slices with Velveeta. Beat the eggs and milk together and pour over the Velveeta. Salt and pepper to taste. Bake at 350 degrees f until golden brown. Serves 4.

Cook macaroni in boiling water for 10-12 minutes or until done. Drain and set aside. In a large saucepan combine macaroni and Alfredo sauce. Stir over medium heat until heated through. Add 1 1/2 cups of cheese and stir until melted. Transfer to a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish. Combine bread crumbs and remaining 1/2 cup cheese in a small bowl. Sprinkle over macaroni. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes.
Slice tomatoes thinly. Add sliced onions to taste. Top with a thin slice of butter. Salt and pepper to taste. Top with fresh chives. Serve on white bread.

Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook for 30 minutes or until light golden brown. Add garlic clove and cook for 1 minute. Add rice. Cook, stirring constantly for 1 minute. Add vermouth. Cook for 1 minute or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in broth. Cook for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in cream. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in butter. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook, stirring occasionally, until thoroughly browned. Drain. Stir in the taco seasoning and cook over low heat for 1 minute. Stir in the milk and water. Cool slightly. Form into 1 1/4 inch meatballs. In a small bowl combine the egg and milk. Dip the meatballs in the egg mixture. In a shallow bowl combine the cheddar cheese and corn flakes. Roll meatballs in the cornflake mixture. Bake on a greased baking sheet for 20 minutes at 350. Serve on warm tortillas with lettuce and tomatoes.

Combine all ingredients except chives in medium bowl. Blend well. Divide mixture into 36 equal portions. Form each portion around one end of each cocktail frank. Shape to form ball. Place crab balls in greased microwave oven. Cook uncovered in medium power oven for 4 minutes. Turn crab balls and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Remove from oven. Arrange crab balls and garnish with chives. Serve with seafood cocktail sauce or tartar sauce.

In a bowl combine beer and flour and baking powder, add shrimp, season with salt and pepper. Cover and chill for at least 2 hours before frying. Heat oil to 375 degrees f., drop shrimp into hot oil. Fry shrimp for about 2 minutes or until they are golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with lemon wedges and cocktail sauce.

Heat oven to 375f. Sift flour and baking powder together in large bowl. Mix margarine and sugar in large bowl until crumbly. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Stir in flour mixture until moistened. Stir in chocolate and nuts. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets about 2 inches apart. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 6 dozen cookies.

Boil beans in water for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain beans reserving 1/2 cup of cooking liquid and set beans aside. Place the beans in the bowl of a food processor or blender and process until smooth. Add the lemon juice, salt, pepper, olive oil and garlic and process until smooth.

Melt chocolate chips in a microwave or double boiler. Stir until smooth. Add cereal and stir until well coated. Spread mixture on wax paper covered cookie sheets. Refrigerate until firm. When firm, cut into squares. Melt chips in a microwave or double boiler. Dip clusters in chocolate, allowing excess to drip off before placing on waxed paper. Refrigerate until firm. Makes about 2 dozen clusters

In a large saucepan over medium high heat, cover the baby red potatoes with cold water and bring to a boil. Boil for about 10 minutes or until tender but firm. Drain and set aside. In a medium bowl whisk together the milk, butter, salt and pepper. Add the potatoes and toss until well coated. Transfer the potatoes to a large baking dish. Sprinkle with the cheese and bake for about 20 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve hot.

Combine soy sauce and pineapple juice in a large zip lock bag. Add fish and refrigerate 4 hours. Remove fish from marinade and grill until done to your liking. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add bell peppers and stir until tender. Add curry powder and saute until fragrant. Add cinnamon and ginger and saute 1 minute more. Add mahi mahi and pineapple slices and simmer 3 minutes. Serve over rice. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel apples and remove core. Divide apples between 4 small bowls. In a small bowl combine oats, lemon juice, brown sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle over each apple. Add pecans and melted butter over all. Bake uncovered in preheated oven until apples are tender when pierced with a fork, about 25 to 30 minutes. Remove from oven and serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. In another bowl combine margarine, eggs and vanillastir with a mixer until fluffy. Add to dry mixturemix until smooth. Divide dough in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll each half to 1/4-inch thicknesscut with 3-inch biscuit cutter. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake in 400 degree F oven for 15 minutes or until edges are golden brown. In a small saucepan combine heavy cream and cornstarchcook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boilboil 1 minute. Stir in peachesheat through. Place 1 biscuit in each of 4 individual serving dishes. Top each with peachesdrizzle with glaze. Sprinkle with cinnamon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease two 9x5x3 inch loaf pans.In a large bowl beat together butter, shortening and sugar. Add eggs, one at a time. Beat in vanilla and almond extract. Add flour and salt. Stir until just blended. Pour batter into prepared pans.Bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pans on a wire rack.In a small bowl combine confectioners sugar and milk. Drizzle over cake. Store in an airtight container.

In a medium saucepan combine the sugar and cornstarch. Add enough cold water to make a slurry. Stirring constantly over medium heat, bring the mixture to a boil. Boil for about 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Add the orange juice, cherries and cinnamon stick. Pour into bowls and serve.

Cut the potatoes into 1/4″ thick slices, and place them in a large bowl. Add the canola oil and vinegar and toss gently until the potatoes are completely coated in oil and vinegar. Spread out the potatoes in a single layer on a large baking sheet, and season them with salt and pepper. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the chips are browned and cooked through.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a 8x8x1.5 inch pan, combine cherries with brownies, add water and stir. Add egg and oil. Mix well. Bake at 375 degrees for 40-50 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature with ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Peel and core pears. Cut each in half lengthwise. Cut each half into 4 slices. Toss with butter in small bowl. Place in shallow baking pan and bake until softened but still firm, about 30 minutes. In small bowl, whisk together vinegar and sugar. Add salt, pepper, 1/3 cup olive oil. Set aside. Whisk 1/4 cup olive oil with 1 teaspoon vinegar in medium bowl. Add arugula. Toss. On each plate, place 4 slices arugula salad. Top each with 1/2 cup sliced pear. Top with 1 teaspoon cheese. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon dressing. Garnish with 1/4 cup nuts.
Mix rice and water in a glass microwaveable container. Stir in the butter and salt. Microwave for 15 minutes. Remove the lid and stir for 1 minute. Fluff with a fork.
Place all ingredients in a small sauce pan over low heat, whisking until smooth. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Serve with assorted fruit and pound cake cubes.

Cut chicken breasts into strips about 1 inch wide by 1 inch thick. In a skillet melt butter, add garlic and cook until garlic is soft and butter is brown, about 1 minute. Add chicken and cook about 10 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink inside. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium-high heat, combine alfredo sauce and red roasted peppers and bring sauce to a boil, stirring constantly. Drain spaghetti and add to alfredo sauce. Add cooked chicken and basil, stirring well to mix. Serve immediately.

Steam green beans for 3 minutes. Chop onions fine and sauté in 2Tbs. oil until they are just translucent. Add cooked green beans and continue cooking until beans are tender crisp. Add salt & pepper to taste. Set aside until ready to serve. In another skillet heat oil for browning. Combine egg whites and walnut pieces and drop by teaspoon into hot oil. Brown quickly on each side and drain. Sprinkle with a little salt before serving. Serve over green beans.

Preheat oven to 375. Spray baking dish with cooking spray. Combine mustard and maple syrup in small bowl. Spread mixture on salmon. Bake for 15 minutes or until salmon flakes easily with fork. Serve with pasta.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Wash sweet potatoes with cold water and pat dry. Rub the inside with a little olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Wrap the sweet potatoes in foil. Roast the sweet potatoes until they are tender about 1 hour. Once tender, remove from the oven and cool slightly. Chop into 1/4 inch dice. In a small bowl whisk together honey, white wine vinegar, fresh rosemary, garlic, salt and fresh ground pepper. Slowly whisk in olive oil. Add the diced sweet potato to the dressing. Toss until coated. Serve warm or cold.

In a large pot, pour enough water to cover dandelion flowers, plus about 2 inches. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and remove from heat immediately. Allow to steep for 5 minutes. Strain and discard flowers and let liquid cool for 30 minutes or until room temperature. Once cool, add vanilla bean and lemon slices and allow to infuse for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Strain again and add sugar. Stir until sugar dissolves. Pour into sterilized jars or containers and store in refrigerator for up to 6 months. To use dandelion honey, simply take 1 teaspoon and add it to a cup of warm or hot tea and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350. In a small bowl, combine Dijon mustard and 1/4 teaspoon black pepperspread over tenderloin and then sprinkle with rosemary leaves and 1/8 teaspoon black pepper. Arrange garlic cloves and bacon slices around tenderloin and bake for 50 minutes, turning tenderloin once during cooking and basting with pan juices. Serve with your favorite rice.

Dice onion and cook in oil until lightly brown. Add roast and brown on all sides. In a saucepan bring light beer to boil. Combine with other liquid ingredients. Pour over roast. Sprinkle with prunes and apricots. Cover with lid or foil. Bake at 350 degrees until tender. Serve over mashed potatoes with green beans.

Prepare pudding according to directions. Fold in whipped topping. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Fill clear glasses with pudding. Decorate the edge of the glass with wafer cookies. Add berries and place a small dollop of whipped topping. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Season the chicken inside and out with salt and pepper. Heat the butter in a large ovenproof skillet or roasting pan over medium-high heat until foamy. Add the chicken breasts skin side down and brown on both sides, 3-5 minutes per side. Transfer to the oven and roast until the meat is cooked through, 10-15 minutes more. Transfer the chicken to a plate. Add the shallots to the pan with the lemon slices, season with salt and pepper and cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until the shallots are lightly browned, 1-2 minutes. Add the wine to the pan along with the pan drippings from the chicken and cook until the liquid is reduced by half, 2-3 minutes. Arrange the chicken on the plate. Spoon the shallot mixture over the chicken.
Prepare tea. Add sparkling cider. Pour into iced tea glasses. Garnish with lemon wedges.

Puree strawberries in a blender or food processor until smooth. Pour into a medium bowl. Add sugar. Add bananas. Mix well. Add orange juice and lemon juice. Stir well. Pour mixture into a metal loaf pan. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Freeze for 6 hours or overnight. Remove from freezer. Add milk. Mix well. Freeze for an additional 3 hours or until firm. Let stand 15 minutes. Spoon into chilled bowls. Garnish with fresh strawberries. Serves 4.

Heat olive oil over low heat. Add garlic cloves. Saute until garlic begins to brown. Remove garlic from oil with slotted spoon. Add crushed red pepper flakes to oil. Stir for 30 seconds. Add crushed tomatoes to oil and red pepper flakes mixture. Simmer, partially covered, for 20 minutes. Stir in dried oregano and salt. Simmer uncovered for an additional 30 minutes.

Dissolve yeast in the warm water. Stir in the sugar and eggs. Let stand 5 minutes or until foamy. Stir in the flour and salt. Beat until smooth, then cover and let rise 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Pour oil into a deep fryer or heavy pot to a depth of 4 inches. Heat the oil to 375f. Fry the doughnuts 3 or 4 at a time until golden brown, about 1 minute on each side. Remove doughnuts with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 8 doughnuts.

Bake cake in a 9×13 pan according to directions on box. Let cool. Dice strawberries into small pieces. Add half of the pudding mix to the strawberries. Fold in cool whip until smooth. Spread in pan. Layer peaches on top of strawberries. Spread remaining pudding mix on top of the peaches. Spread remaining cool whip over the top of the pudding mix. Sprinkle with slivered almonds for garnish. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Cook spinach according to the package directions. Drain. Rinse with cold water. Squeeze out excess water. Combine spinach with tomatoes. Mix in cottage cheese. In a mixing bowl, combine the eggs, cheese, spinach mixture, salt and pepper. Heat the canola oil over medium high heat. Pour the mixture into the skillet. Cook for 20-25 minutes. Cut into wedges. Serve hot. Makes 1 quiche. Serves 3-4.

Combine kidney beans with salsa, chili powder and cumin. Blend together. Add salt to taste. Stir in cheddar cheese. Spoon into a shallow 2-quart serving dish. Top with sour cream and chives. Microwave at high 3 to 4 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions and garlic cloves and cook 2 minutes or until onions are softened. Add black beans, cumin, salt, red pepper flakes and 4 cups of water to pot. Bring mixture to boil, reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered until beans are softened, about 1 hour. Cook time may vary depending on the age of the beans and if they are dried or canned. Mash beans with a potato masher until chunky. Serve hot or chilled.

Preheat oven to 350. Sprinkle roast with 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and garlic powder. In a large skillet, cook mushrooms and onion in butter until tender. Combine with remaining sauce. Pour into a shallow 2-quart baking dish. Cut roast into 1/2-inch slicesplace in baking dish. Cover with sauce. Bake 2-1/2 hours or until no longer pink (160f) when cut to the bone. Serve with pasta.

Rinse and drain the pearl tapioca. Pour 2 cups of water into a medium saucepan. Add the tapioca pearls and bring to a boil over medium heat. Turn the heat down to medium low and cook at a gentle simmer for about 10 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent the tapioca from sticking. When the pearls have expanded to about twice their original size and the mixture is very thick, add the sugar and whisk to combine. Add the milk and heavy cream. Cook for another 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool for about 10 minutes. Strain the pudding into a large bowl through a fine mesh sieve. Press the pearls to release all the milk and cream. Whisk in the egg yolk and salt. Divide the pudding between 4 bowls or 1/2 pint jars. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Serve cold. Garnish with lemon zest and serve cold.

Cook sausage in skillet until browned. In a separate pan cook broccoli florets until tender crisp. Mix sausage and broccoli together. Pour into unbaked pie shells. Whisk eggs and cream together. Add rosemary. Pour egg mixture over sausage and broccoli filling. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes. Let cool. Makes 2-4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Mix together all of the ingredients in a large bowl. Spread the mixture in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until the potatoes are tender. Garnish with parsley if desired.
Toss cabbage with vinegar, water, salt, pepper and oil. Allow to marinate for 1-2 hours. Drain well. Toss in pepper. Chill.

Preheat oven to 350f. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper and place in a large zip-top plastic bag. In a small bowl combine egg and water. Pour over chicken and let marinate for 5 minutes. In a large bowl combine flour and almonds. In a medium saucepan combine butter and lemon juice. Bring to boil and remove from heat. Add basil and season to taste with salt and pepper. Add chicken to almond mixture and toss to coat. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Place chicken in the pan and brown for 1-2 minutes per side. Pour basil butter over chicken. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 f. Line a baking pan with foil. Rinse fish in cold water. Dry fish with paper towels. Dust fish with salt and pepper. Spread 1/2 cup sour cream over fish fillets. Lay sage leaves on each fish fillet. Cut 1/2 inch strips of swiss cheese. Lay strips on fish. Place fish in pan. Cover pan. Bake 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Remove fish from pan. Sprinkle with more sage. Drizzle with sour cream. Serve fish with lemon wedges.

Slice bread into 1/2-inch-thick rounds. Mix together the other ingredients. Dip each round into the mixture. Let excess drip off. Place on a cookie sheet. Bake in a 400 degree F oven for 15 minutes. Makes about 2 dozen. Serve warm.

Cook noodles according to package directions, omitting salt and fat. Rinse with cold waterdrain. Add frozen vegetablesheat through. In a small bowl, combine dressing mix and butteradd half-and-half, stirring with a whisk until blended. Add chicken to pasta mixturestir in parmesan cheese and dressing mixture. Serve immediately with additional parmesan cheese if desired.

Cook macaroni according to instructions and set aside. Cut up the cooked chicken and broccoli. Combine everything but the almonds and lettuce and toss together. Dress with honey mustard dressing and sprinkle with almonds. Serve over a bed of lettuce.

Wash cabbage and shake to remove excess water. Cut into quarters and remove core. Slice each quarter into thin strips. In a medium skillet brown the apples and cook until soft. Add the cabbage and cook until tender. Mix apples and cabbage with sugar and butter. Melt butter in a small skillet. Add breadcrumbs and cinnamon. Remove from heat and sprinkle over the top.

In a large bowl combine all ingredients except chicken wings and butter. Add chicken wings and stir well to coat. Pour into a greased 9x12 baking dish and bake uncovered for 1 hour at 325f. Drizzle with butter and bake an additional 10 minutes or until wings are done. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Put a large saute pan on medium heat. Season beef with salt and pepper and place in pan with butter and oil. Brown meat on all sides, about 5 minutes per side. Add onion and garlic to pan, saute until softened about 5 minutes more. Add beer and bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer until liquid is reduced by half. Add mushrooms and stock, and simmer until meat is very tender. Makes about 4 cups. Roll out dough into a 12-inch pie shell and place in a 9-inch pie plate. Pour meat mixture into crust. Place a pie crust ring on top of meat and then put dough on top of ring to cover meat mixture. Brush top of pie with egg wash or milk and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cut 3 or 4 slits in top for steam to escape while baking. Bake for 35-45 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into 6 slices. Serve hot with a salad

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add tomatoes. Season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook until tomatoes are softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in olives. Season with remaining 1/2 teaspoon of each. Divide pasta among four bowls. Top with tomato mixture. Crumble goat cheese on top. Sprinkle with basil leaves.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Combine the turkey, breadcrumbs, onion, salad dressing, sour cream and horseradish. Divide into 6 equal portions. Form into loaves on baking sheets coated with cooking spray. Combine paprika and peppersprinkle over meat. Bake 20 minutes. Lower heat to 350 f and bake 30 minutes longer. Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place a 13 by 9 inch baking dish on the counter to warm up while you make the cake. Combine pumpkin, evaporated milk, eggs and sugars in large bowl of electric mixer. Beat at medium speed until smooth and well blended. Stir in pumpkin pie spice and salt until combined. Stir in cake mix until well combined. Spread in prepared pan. Bake 40 to 45 minutes or until lightly browned around edges and a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool 10 minutes. In small bowl, combine caramel topping and pecans. Spread over warm cake. Let cool 1 hour longer. Refrigerate until chilled before cutting.
Place carrots in a plastic bag and add butter, brown sugar and salt. Toss and place in the refrigerator overnight.

In a small bowl, combine flour, beef consomme, beef broth and steak seasoning. Dip the beef in mixture. Broil 4-5 minutes until lightly browned. To serve, place beef on a roll. Top with provolone cheese. Serve with au jus. Makes 4 servings.

Melt the butter and add the leeks. Sweat for 5 minutes and add the potatoes and onion. Add salt and pepper. Add the chicken stock. Simmer for 10 minutes. Blend with hand blender. Add the milk and cream. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve with fresh herbs and freshly baked bread.

Spread prosciutto over two slices of bread. Place the roasted red peppers and provolone on top. Spread a thin layer of olive oil over the top of the provolone. Spread the second slice of bread on top. Place on a hot griddle or panini maker and cook until the bread is browned and the cheese is melted. Serve with a salad or soup.

Preheat oven to 400f. In large bowl combine butter, sugar, egg and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Combine flour, spices, and baking powder. Add to butter mixture and mix until well blended. Roll into 1 inch balls. Place 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Cool for 1 minute on baking sheet then remove to wire rack to cool completely. Makes 3 dozen.

Cut sausage links into small pieces. Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large saute pan. Add sausage, onion, and roasted garlic to the pan. Cook until sausage is no longer pink. Add tortellini. Stir well. Add pasta sauce. Stir well. Add water. Bring to a boil. Reduce to simmer. Cover pan. Cook for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in half the Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Cook bacon until crisp and drain on paper towels. In a large skillet, saute potatoes in bacon fat over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add onions and saute until golden, about 3 minutes more. Remove from heat. Stir in cheddar cheese and season with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to an 11-inch by 7-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with a sprinkle of paprika on top. Serves 6.

In a medium bowl, stir together water, olive oil, sugar, and vanilla. In a blender or food processor, process oats until they resemble fine bread crumbs. Transfer to medium bowl. Add cornmeal and whole wheat flour. Add flour mixture to liquid mixture and stir until well combined. Cover and refrigerate batter at least 1 hour. Lightly spray waffle iron with cooking spray. Using 1/4 cup batter per waffle, cook waffles until golden and crisp. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve immediately. Yields 3 servings.

Place mushrooms in large bowl. Pour in the lemon juice and oil. Add the garlic powder, salt and white pepper. Toss to coat mushrooms evenly. Cover and refrigerate several hours. Just before serving add the sugar and sprinkle with the onion salt. Toss again. Serve over crisp lettuce leaves.

Preheat your oven to 350. Peel and devein the shrimp and place them in an oiled casserole dish and set aside. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the butter and olive oil and let them melt together. Once the mixture is melted and bubbly, add the garlic and mustard and let it cook for about a minute or two until the garlic is browned and the mustard is warm and fragrant. Whisk the mixture and then add the kosher salt and the red chili pepper flakes. Stir well and pour the mixture over the shrimp and stir well to coat. Then cover the casserole dish with aluminum foil and bake the shrimp for about 12 minutes or until the shrimp is fully cooked through. Remove the casserole dish from the oven and add the lemon slices and parsley. Let the dish cool for about 5 minutes and then serve.

Combine the chocolate and sugar in a heavy-bottomed 4-quart pot. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the mixture is melted. Stir in the yolks. Stir the mixture over low heat for a minute or so until it thickens a bit. Strain through a fine sieve into a large bowl. Whisk in the cream. Set the bowl over a double boiler over low heat, and stir the mixture constantly until it thickens into a custard. Remove from the heat. Let cool to room temperature. Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and process according to the manufacturer's instructions. Transfer to a container and freeze until firm. Serve with chopped almonds sprinkled on top.

Drain pineapple well, reserving 1/2 cup of juice. In a large, heavy pan stir together crushed pineapple, banana and sugar. Add reserved pineapple juice. Stir in pectin. Bring to a full rolling boil over high heat, stirring constantly. Boil hard for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Quickly skim off foam. Ladle hot jam into hot jars. Wipe rim. Center lid on jar. Screw band down until resistance is met, then increase to fingertip tight. Process in boiling water canner 5 minutes. Makes 10 half-pint jars.

Place warm water (110 degrees F), yeast and sugar in a mixing bowl and stir until yeast is dissolved. Let stand for 15 minutes. Add 1-1/2 cups flour and salt and stir well. Beat at low speed for 30 seconds. Beat at medium speed for 2 minutes. Add remaining flour 1 cup at a time, beating until a soft dough is formed. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl. Turn once to coat all sides. Cover bowl and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk (about 1-1/2 hours). Turn out onto a floured surface and knead gently. Roll dough out to a 15-inch square. Cut into 4 strips. Beginning at a short side roll up jelly-roll fashion. Pinch ends together and tuck into roll. Place seam side down on a greased baking sheet. Cover and let rise until almost doubled (about 45 minutes). Bake at 375 degrees F for 30 minutes or until golden

Peel potatoes and cut into quarters or sixths. Place in a saucepan. Add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until potatoes are tender enough to be pierced by a fork. Drain and return to saucepan. Mash potatoes well. Heat butter in a saucepan large enough to hold the potato mixture. Stir in flour and cook over medium heat for 1-2 minutes or until it is blended well and bubbly. Add the potatoes and stir to blend well. Gradually add the milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the sour cream, cheese and green onion. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Refrigerate 2 hours or more for the flavors to blend well. Heat thoroughly before serving. Makes 6-8 servings. I use about 1/4 cup bacon bits in mine, but it s your call how much to use.

Bring water to a boil in a medium pot. Place sausages into the boiling water. Cook until sausages are done. Remove sausages from the water. Cut sausages into pieces. In a large skillet brown the sausage pieces. In a large pot of boiling water cook the potatoes until done. Drain potatoes and place in a large bowl. Add the sausage pieces to the potatoes. Add the sweet peas. Add the butter. Add the chicken bouillon cube. Add the parsley, oregano, salt, and pepper. Toss until the potatoes are well coated.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the first five ingredients in a large bowl. Combine the remaining ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil then remove from heat. Add to the dry ingredients and stir. Spread evenly in a 13x9 baking pan. Bake for 1 hour. Let cool and store in an airtight container.

In a small bowl, mix together the nuts and the rosemary leaves and the cayenne and brown sugar and kosher salt and butter. Spread evenly onto a baking sheet and bake for about 20 minutes, tossing halfway through to make sure the nuts brown evenly. Stir well and serve.

Cut ribs into 3 or 4 inch pieces. In large skillet, saute onion and garlic in oil until tender. Add ribs. Cook over medium heat until browned on all sides. Pour in soup. Add apples. Stir to combine. Cover and cook over low heat for 30 minutes. Add cabbage and cook for another 10 minutes or until heated through. Serve with potatoes.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Peel potatoes and cut them into 1/2-inch pieces. Add to the boiling water. Cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain the potatoes in a colander and return to the pot. Mash them with a potato masher until smooth, or process them in a food processor until smooth. Meanwhile, fill a large bowl with ice cubes and water. Put the eggs in the ice water bath to cool them. When the eggs are cool, remove them from the water and peel them under cold running water to prevent the yolks from turning green. Grate the zest from the lemon into the potatoes. Cut the eggs into slices. Mix the potatoes, eggs, lemon juice, mayonnaise, and salt in a large bowl. When the mixture is completely blended, stir in the chicken and green peas. Refrigerate until serving time. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

Lamb should be at room temperature. Preheat oven to 425F. Brush oil on all sides of lamb. Rub with chili paste and black pepper. Place in roasting pan. Place mint leaves on lamb and roast for 40 minutes per pound. Remove mint leaves and serve with lamb.

Peel yams and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Melt butter in large saucepan. Sweat yam pieces in butter over low heat for 3 to 5 minutes. Add onion and garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add ginger and cinnamon and saute 1 minute longer. Add cinnamon and salt to taste. Add honey and cook 1 minute longer. Add broth and cook until yams are tender about 10 minutes. Serve with freshly ground white pepper.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise and place cut side down in a large baking pan. Melt butter in the microwave for 30 seconds, and pour over potatoes. Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with lemon juice and salt and pepper. Roast until potatoes are tender and golden brown, about 1 hour. Sprinkle with cinnamon before serving.

In a small bowl or cup, mash the butter together with the herbs. Use right away or refrigerate for 1 to 2 days. For longer storage, freeze. Allow 15 minutes for thawing. Use as a spread on fresh breads. Use as a marinade for chicken or fish. Adds flavor to vegetables. Use as a glaze for breaded chicken. Use as a glaze for fresh asparagus. Use as a spread on hot popcorn. Use as a spread on fresh corn on the cob. Use as a spread on fresh green beans. Use as a spread on fresh tomatoes. Use as a spread on fresh celery. Use as a spread on fresh cucumbers. Use as a spread on fresh carrots. Use as a spread on fresh broccoli. Use as a spread on fresh mushrooms. Use as a spread on fresh radishes. Use as a spread on fresh green peppers. Use as a spread on fresh potatoes. Use as a spread on fresh zucchini. Use as a spread on fresh onions. Use as a spread on fresh jicama. Use as a

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine cream and candy. Heat just until candy has dissolved. Remove from heat and chill. In a large bowl, combine cream, chocolate and cocoa. Beat until smooth. Stir in vanilla and coffee granules. In a separate bowl, beat heavy cream and powdered sugar until stiff peaks form. Gently fold into chocolate mixture. Top with additional chocolate syrup and sprinkles. Serve with candy canes.

Mix the graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, and condensed milk until well combined. Pour into a 9x13-inch pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the top is set. Do not over bake. Allow to cool before serving. Makes about 3 dozen brownies.
Combine the water, grits and salt in a large saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered until the grits are tender. Stir in the pecorino romano cheese and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine mustard and herbs. Spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. Press mixture onto salmon. Place on cookie sheet. Bake 10 minutes. Turn and bake another 5 minutes or until done. Serve with lemon wedges.
In a large pot, boil potatoes until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain potatoes and mash together with garlic, yogurt, oil, salt and pepper. Serve.

Bring 6 quarts of water to boil over high heat, add 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, and stir in 1 pound fettuccine pasta. Cook until al dente, about 9 minutes. Drain pasta and place it into a large serving bowl. Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons butter with 1/4 cup olive oil in large saucepan over medium heat, add 1 pound thinly sliced Cremini mushrooms and cook until soft, about 8 minutes. Add 2 cloves chopped garlic, 1 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/2 cup half-and-half, and 2 tablespoons pesto saucestir until smooth. Remove from heat, stir in 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese, and add to pastatoss to combine. Toss pasta with 2 tablespoons pesto sauce and serve immediately topped with 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese.

Cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add the ketchup, water, worcestershire sauce and chili powder. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add the remaining seasonings and simmer for 10 minutes. Divide the ground beef mixture evenly into 4 hot dog buns. Top with hot dogs and serve immediately.

Remove outer leaves from head of cabbage. Remove cores from cabbage leaves and discard. Cut cabbage into 1-inch squares or strips. Place cabbage into heavy-duty pot and add butter, croutons, dry mustard, and caraway seed. Mix thoroughly and cook over low heat for about 10 minutes or until tender-crisp. Season to taste with kosher salt and sugar. Serve hot as a side dish or as a main course with bread or crackers.

Wash, dry and trim lettuce hearts. Peel and slice hearts of palm. Slice artichoke hearts in half lengthwise. Arrange romaine hearts, artichoke hearts and hearts of palm in individual serving bowls. Sprinkle with almonds. In medium bowl combine marmalade, lemon juice, dijon mustard and olive oil. Blend well. Pour over salad. Top with almonds. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 4 servings.

In a small bowl, whisk together vinegar, mustard, garlic, lime juice, lemon juice, brown sugar, salt and pepper until smooth. Place chicken in a shallow dish and pour marinade over top. Turn chicken to coat. Marinate 2 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. Preheat oven to 375f. Place chicken in a greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in the middle. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).In a bowl, combine flour and sugarcut in the butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add baking powder and saltmix well. Reserve 2/3 cup topping mixture for topping.In another bowl, combine the milk and berries.Place berries evenly into ungreased pie plate. Top berries with 1/2 cup topping mixturedot with butter. Sprinkle with remaining topping mixture.Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add shrimp. Cook until pink. Add spaghetti and toss for about a minute. Add lemon juice and season with salt. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve at once.

Mix together all the ingredients except cucumbers in a medium bowl. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving. Peel cucumbers if desired. Cut into 2-inch pieces. Mix with sour cream mixture and chill before serving. Makes 4 servings.
Toss chicken with sake, soy sauce, mirin, sugar and spring onions and let marinate for 15 minutes. Thread chicken onto skewers, grill or broil on medium heat for 3 minutes on each side.

Peel the butternut squash and cut in half lengthwise. Remove seeds and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Peel carrots and cut into 1/4 inch slices. Cut celery ribs into 1/4 inch slices. Heat olive oil in a large heavy bottomed saucepan. Add onion and saute over medium heat until translucent. Add ginger and saute for 30 seconds. Stir in squash and carrots. Saut until squash is lightly browned. Add vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until squash is very tender and broth is reduced to 3/4 of its original volume. Using an immersion blender or regular blender puree soup until smooth. Season to taste with salt. Serve in bowls and garnish with a dollop of sour cream. Serve with garlic bread.

In a large skillet heat the oil. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the carrots and cook 3 minutes. Add the ground turkey and cook until browned. Stir in the thyme and season with ground pepper. Add the flour and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the chicken broth and tomato paste. Bring to a boil and cook until thickened. Mix the mashed potatoes and add to the turkey mixture. Spoon the mixture into a greased 2-quart casserole. Bake for 45 minutes.

Peel the red chicory and cut it in fine strips. Cut the calamari rings in 4 pieces each. Peel the yellow pepper, cut it in fine strips and cut it in fine strips. Place the calamari in a bowl with the pepper, the basil and the coriander. Add the garlic clove, the salt and pepper and mix everything well with your hands. Add the olive oil and the lime juice. Mix again carefully until the calamari is covered with the dressing. Serve in a salad bowl sprinkle some basil on top and drizzle some extra virgin olive oil over the salad.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook steak in oil until browned and cooked through. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook 2 to 4 minutes. Add peanut sauce and broccolicook 1 to 2 minutes more. Serve with egg noodles and chopped green onions.

Combine egg and milk in a shallow bowl. Dip fish in the milk mixture, then dip in the flour, coating both sides of fish with flour. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Fry fish until it is golden brown on both sides. Top with parmesan cheese. Cook in oven for about 3 minutes or until the fish is fully cooked.
Boil pasta in salted water for 5 minutes. Drain pasta, and put in a large bowl. Add butter, then tomatoes with their liquid. Salt and pepper. Sprinkle with sharp cheddar cheese. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).In a large skillet heat olive oil over high heat. Season steaks with salt and pepper. Sear steaks in hot oil until brown. Place steaks in a 9x13 inch baking dish.In a bowl combine vinegar and mustard. Pour over steaks. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In medium saucepan over medium heat, bring stock to a boil. Remove from heat. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and rosemary. Saute until garlic is lightly browned. Add onion. Saute until translucent. Add stock to skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until sauce is thick. Strain. Serve with meat.

Heat oil in large pot, add onion & cook until soft. Add garlic & cook a few more minutes. Add curry powder & cook a few minutes more. Add the chickpeas, cook a few minutes more. Add the rest of the vegetables & cook until they are soft. Add ketchup & tabasco sauce. Stir & add salt to taste. Serve with brown rice.
Heat olive oil and add red onions and celery, saute until softened. Add frozen peas and celery leaves and saute 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper before serving.

Cook macaroni according to package directions (omit salt). Stir chili into cooked macaroni and then add the rest of the ingredients. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 30 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 12 servings.

In a nonstick skillet saut the onion and zucchini in olive oil for 5 minutes or until crisp tender. Add the mushrooms, garlic and crushed red pepper and saut until mushrooms are tender. Stir in the pasta and spaghetti sauce. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat for 5 minutes or until pasta is tender. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and broil 3 inches from the heat for 2 to 4 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Peel and dice avocados. Mince garlic. Peel onions. Chop jalapeno pepper. Dice avocados. Mix all in a bowl. Add lime juice and salt. Mix well. Serve as a dip with chips or as a side for tacos, nachos or burritos.

Place florets in boiling salted water for 3 minutes or until bright green and crisp tender. Drain well and set aside to cool slightly. Combine garlic, pesto, broccoli florets, pine nuts, parmesan cheese and pepper. Serve immediately with olive oil drizzled on top.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine banana with egg and milk in small bowl. Combine dry ingredients in a larger bowl. Mix wet and dry ingredients together just until combined. Spoon batter into a lightly greased muffin tin. Top each muffin with a few blueberries. Bake for 12-14 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for a few minutes in pan then remove and cool completely on wire rack.

Spread mayonnaise on bread and place on lightly oiled grill. Broil until browned and top with tuna mixture. Add onion, lemon juice and old bay seasoning. Top with tomatoes and provolone cheese and broil until cheese is melted.

In a small saucepan cook butter and vinegar over medium heat until melted and reduced. Set aside to cool. Place asparagus spears on a baking sheet. Brush with butter mixture and sprinkle with soy sauce. Bake at 350 until just tender about 15 minutes. Cut spears into bite sized pieces. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Scrub carrots and pat dry with paper towels. Cut carrots in half lengthwise, then crosswise into 1/4-inch slices. Combine carrots in a bowl and toss them with 2 tablespoons olive oil and 1/4 teaspoon each cayenne and coarse salt. Spread carrot slices evenly on the prepared baking sheet and roast until tender, about 20 minutes. Toss carrots in a bowl with 1/4 cup olive oil and 1/4 teaspoon each cayenne and coarse salt. Add remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 cup honey. Toss to combine. Transfer carrots to a serving bowl and drizzle with any remaining dressing. Makes 4 servings.

Brown ground beef and drain off fat. In large saucepan combine beef, tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, rice, green peppers and tomatoes and green chilies. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer 30 minutes. Stir in beef bouillon cubes and brown sugar. Add salt and pepper to taste. Makes 6 servings.

Cook onion in skillet until tender. Drain. Add cabbage and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Mix ground beef, salt and pepper. Add cooked onion and cabbage mixture. In 9x13 inch pan spread 2 cups tomato soup. Spread beef mixture over top. Sprinkle with remaining soup. Bake 30 minutes. Serve with long-grain rice. Makes 8-10 servings.
Saute the corn and the butter in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly for about 1 minute. Remove from heat and add the cream cheesestir well and serve.

Dissolve yeast in water. Stir in 2 cups flour, sugar, salt and oil. Beat with electric mixer until smooth. Add 2 beaten eggs. Stir in enough remaining flour to make a soft dough. Knead until smooth and elastic, adding more flour as necessary. Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Punch dough down. Divide into 8 pieces. Knead each piece into a ball. Place balls in well-greased 9x13-inch baking pan. Coverlet rise in a warm place for 2 hours or until doubled in bulk. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Brush tops with melted buttersprinkle with garlic salt to taste. Serve warm with butter.

Combine all of the ingredients into a bowl and mix well. Transfer the mixture into an air-tight container or jar and store in a cool place for up to two weeks. You can use the nuts as an appetizer on their own or tossed with your favorite salad.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and saute until softened. Add curry paste and cook for 1 minute. Add potatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add fish sauce and coconut milk. Cook for 10 minutes. Add chicken and cook until just done. Season with brown sugar to taste. Serve with rice or noodles.
Place all in a blender and blend until smooth.

Pour boiling water over lemon and orange. Let steep until cool. Strain into a 2 cup glass. Combine cream of tartar and crystallized ginger. Add to glass. Add Tabasco and honey. Stir. Sprinkle with ground cloves. Serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl, mix the flour, baking soda and salt until blended. Beat the butter in a separate bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until smooth. Beat in the sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time on low speed until blended. Beat the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture on low speed until just blended. Stir in the vanilla. Stir in the chocolate chips until just blended. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake one sheet at a time for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned on the edges. Cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. The cookies will be very soft when removed from the oven. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Mix milk, sugar and cocoa in a medium saucepan. Stir until smooth. Add cornstarch, salt and egg yolk. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract. Cool. Chill at least 3 hours or overnight. Pour mixture into 8 paper cupcake liners. Freeze at least 8 hours or overnight. Remove liner. Serve immediately or wrap each in plastic wrap. Freeze for up to 1 week. To serve, microwave on high for 15 seconds. Unwrap and serve.

In large pot over medium heat combine cornmeal and water. Whisk constantly until thick and smooth. Remove from heat. Add butter. Stir until butter melts. Add scallions. Stir until butter melts. Stir until smooth. Stir in cheese. Stir until smooth. Add chipotles. Stir until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Cook broccoli in microwave according to package directions. Drain and let cool. In saucepan combine soup and butter. Heat until hot and bubbly. Stir in broccoli. In another pan cook potatoes until done. Add broccoli mixture to potatoes. Combine remaining ingredients and sprinkle over mixture. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Serve immediately.

melt butter. saute onion and garlic until tender. add celery. saute until crisp-tender. add broth. bring to a boil. add broccoli and cook for 5 minutes. stir in flour. cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. add milk. stir until heated through. stir in pepper. remove from heat. stir in velveeta until melted.

In large heavy pot over medium high heat brown chicken and garlic in olive oil. When chicken is lightly browned, add onions and cook until onions are soft and slightly browned.
