Cook for about an hour or so (or longer) until lamb is very tender. Remove from heat and stir in garlic. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve over rice or noodles with sour cream on top.

In a large saucepan or stock pot saute onion and bell peppers in oil until tender. Add garlic cloves and saute for 1 minute more. Add black beans and season with oregano, salt and pepper to taste. Stir in vinegar. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve hot with rice. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Heat oil in saucepan. Add onion and saute until translucent but not brown. Add zucchini, tomatoes, parsley, pepper, butter, salt, cover and cook for about 30 seconds. Add apples and cook for about 2 minutes. Serve hot as side dish.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Peel and cut potatoes and vegetables to desired shapes and sizes. Toss vegetables with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Drizzle with garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Place vegetables on foil-lined baking sheet and place on middle rack of oven. Roast vegetables for about 30 minutes or until vegetables are slightly charred and tender.

Shave zucchini into thin strips with a vegetable peeler. Add 2 tsp. of olive oil to a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook zucchini, stirring often, until lightly browned. Add onion and cook until softened. Add thyme. Cook for about a minute. Add tomatoes, season with salt and pepper. Cook until the sauce thickens. Serve over the pasta. Top with the parmesan cheese.

In a skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add pork chops. Cook until browned. Remove from skillet. In a bowl combine soup, milk, corn. Heat until boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in potatoes. Pour over pork. Bake 25 minutes.

Combine garlic and oil in bowlmix well. Place dough on pizza panroll dough out into rectangle about 1/4 inch thickspread with oil mixturesprinkle with onions and sprinkle with rosemary. Bake 10 minutessprinkle with salt and return to oven for 10 minutes or until brown and crisp. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Place the meatballs and frozen vegetables in a crock pot. Add the diced tomatoes, water, basil, and garlic powder. Stir well to combine. Cover the crock pot and cook on high for 3 hours. Add the corn, mushrooms, and cheese. Stir well to combine. Cook for 15 more minutes. Serve with crackers or bread.

In large skillet heat oil over medium high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add to skillet and brown about 3 minutes per side. Remove to plate. In same skillet add garlic and saute about 30 seconds stirring constantly. Stir in cashews and red bell pepper and saute until red bell pepper is crisp tender about 3 minutes. Stir in snow peas and chicken broth and bring to boil. Return chicken to skillet and reduce heat to medium low. Add sour cream and mustard and stir to combine. Cook about 3 minutes more or until heated through. Stir honey and serve over rice.

Pre-heat oven to 400F. Combine olive oil and onion in a large frying pan and cook over moderate heat until onions are lightly browned and tender, 6 to 7 minutes. Stir in chicken and cook 5 minutes more. Add baby spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes more. Remove from pan and set aside to cool. Meanwhile bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil and cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to pot with olive oil and chicken mixture. Add cream and parmesan cheese and stir until well combined. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a 2-quart baking dish and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and additional parmesan cheese. Bake until bubbly and golden brown, about 30 minutes. Serve immediately.

Crack the egg and beat with a fork in a shallow bowl. In a second shallow bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese. Season the beef with salt and pepper and dredge in the egg. Then dip the beef into the breadcrumb mixture and press on both sides to make sure the coating is even. In a large skillet, heat the butter and oil over medium heat. Add the beef and cook for 4 minutes on each side. Serve with mashed potatoes or pasta.

Peel carrots and cut into 2 1/2 inch lengths. Boil in a covered saucepan for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool. Combine raisins and gingerroot in a small bowl and cover with 1/4 cup boiling water. Set aside until cool. Mix the carrots with the sultanas and ginger in a bowl and sprinkle with the salt. Put the lemon juice, orange juice and honey in a small bowl and beat until smooth. Add the sour cream and beat well. Pour over the carrots and toss gently to coat. Garnish with nuts.
Saute onions in butter. Add beans and parsley. Pour vinegar over all. Add tomatoes and nutmeg. Simmer. Serve hot.

Mix water with bouillon cube until dissolved. Stir in TVP and let sit for 5 minutes to soften. Drain potato chips and crush them to crumbs. Preheat oven to 425. Mix together water, TVP, instant mashed potatoes, crushed potato chips, and spices until well combined. Drop by tablespoonfuls into your favorite vegetable oil fried chicken batter mixes will make 12 nuggets. Fry for 2 to 3 minutes per side until golden brown. Drain and serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

Cut pizza dough into 10" strips. Cut each strip into 3" lengths. Press a piece of pizza dough onto a sheet of aluminum foil. Top with pizza sauce and cheese. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes. Sprinkle with pepperoni. Bake 1-2 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Cool completely. Serve with pizza dipping sauce.

Boil water and add ginger root to pot, boil for 20 minutes. Remove ginger and let cool. Pour into a jug and add 1 tablespoon of artificial sweetener and 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne pepper. Drink one cup of this tea every 2 to 3 hours for up to 2 days. This tea will cure all kinds of stomach problems including morning sickness and food poisoning.

Place potatoes and carrots in a bowl and toss with olive oil and herb seasoning blend. Spread vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast for 40 to 45 minutes or until tender and caramelized. Sprinkle with garlic just before serving if desired. Serve hot or warm with freshly ground black pepper.

In a small bowl, mix together cookie mix, peanut butter and vanilla. Drop onto wax paper. Use a spoon to shape into stars. Bake at 375 for 8 to 10 minutes. Cool 2 minutes. Dip into melted chocolate. Allow to harden. Makes 2 dozen.
Place cinnamon stick in coffee mug and fill with hot coffee. Add cream and cocoa until desired strength. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate shavings if desired.

Brown sausage in a large skillet. Drain fat. Add onions. Cook over low heat until sausage is cooked through and onions are tender. In a small bowl, mix together milk and flour. Whisk into sausage mixture. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in sage, nutmeg, hot pepper sauce and ground seasonings. Serve over hot buttered biscuits.

Peel and cut potatoes and sweet potatoes into small pieces and put into large pot of boiling water. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Drain potatoes and return them to pot. Add milk and butter. Mash with potato masher. Add sour cream and cheddar cheese. Beat until smooth. Add salt and nutmeg. Mash until smooth. Stir in green onions. Serve with steak or salmon.

Bring 1 quart of water to a boil. Cut 1-inch sections from the bottom of the green tea bags. Add them to the boiling water, along with the ginger, lemon balm leaves and sugar. Simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Refrigerate 1 hour. Serve over ice. Garnish with lemon balm.

Sift together whole wheat pastry flour, flax seed meal, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl. In another bowl combine milk, sugar, egg whites, egg and butterbeat until just blended. Stir into dry ingredients just until combined. Heat a nonstick pan or griddle over medium heat. Lightly brush with melted butter. Using a 1/4 measuring cup pour batter onto the hot pan to form 3 inch pancakes. Cook for 2-3 minutes until tops begin to bubble. Flip pancakes over and cook until browned on the other side. Serve hot with syrup and your favorite toppings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Set aside. In a skillet over medium high heat cook bacon until crisp. Add apples and cook until apples are soft. Add the potatoes. Toss well. In a small bowl combine mustard, vinegar, salt and pepper. Add to potatoes mixture. Mix well. Transfer to a casserole dish. Bake uncovered 1 hour. Serve warm sprinkled with green onions.

Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan. Gradually add polenta, whisking constantly. Simmer until mixture thickens and pulls away from sides of pan. Remove from heat. Stir in herbs. Let cool to room temperature. Stir in margarine. Spread evenly into a 13x9 inch pan. Refrigerate overnight. Remove from pan using a large knife. Cut into 1 inch squares. Makes 24 squares.

In a medium saucepan, combine the rice and 1 cup boiling water. Return to a boil. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Meanwhile, combine the butter and herbs. Add the lemon and lime. Season with salt and pepper. Add the lime juice and serve.

Combine broth, milk, mustard and onion flakes in a bowl. Mix well. Place chicken in the bottom of a casserole dish. Pour broth mixture over the chicken. Sprinkle broccoli over the top of the chicken. Combine the cheese, cornflakes and parmesan cheese in a bowl. Sprinkle over the broccoli layer. Bake at 325 degrees for about 40-45 minutes or until the cornflakes are crisp and golden.

Prepare and bake a 10 inch (26cm) loose-based cake tin with 15cm deep. Grease base and sides of tin and line base with double thickness of baking parchment. Beat egg whites until stiff. Gradually add sugar, beating continuously. Beat in almond extract. Spread 2/3 of mixture over base. Bake in preheated oven for 3 minutes. Remove and cool slightly. Spread with jam. Beat remaining meringue with extract until stiff. Spread over top of jam. Bake for 3-4 minutes until set and golden. Remove from oven. Cool completely in tin. Cut into squares. Arrange 6 squares on 12 inch (30cm) baking parchment. Pipe 1 tablespoon jam between each square. Dust with icing sugar. Top with 6 pistachio nuts. Cut into portions. Drizzle with orange blossom water to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 10-inch springform pan. Cream together the butter and sugar. Add the eggs one at a time. Stir in the lemon zest. Add the milk, flour, baking powder and vanilla. Pour the batter into the pan. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes.

Heat oven to 375 f. Heat butter in 8-inch square baking dish in microwave for 30 seconds or until melted. Stir in lemon juice and 2 tablespoons artichoke hearts. In bowl combine seasoned stuffing mix with remaining artichokes. Place fish on top of artichokes in baking dish. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup crumb mixture. Bake 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork and crumb mixture is golden brown. Garnish with remaining crumb mixture.

In large pot or dutch oven, combine chicken broth and soups. Heat to a boil then add chilies and chicken. Heat through. Pour into 13 x 9 inch casserole dish. Top with tortillas, sprinkle with cheese. Bake 350 40 minutes or until hot.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add beans and saute for about 5 minutes until lightly browned. Add red pepper and onion. Cook another 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add lemon juice and zest. Remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Serves 2.

Pound out chicken breasts to 1/4-inch thickness between pieces of wax paper. Brush chicken with balsamic vinaigrette and sprinkle with pepper and salt to taste. Grill or pan-fry chicken breasts until just done (about 5 minutes per side). Top with pesto. Sandwich with focaccia bread filled with mixed salad greens, tomatoes and red onions. Spread with mayonnaise.
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend at medium-low speed for a few minutes, until well mixed and smooth. Pour into glasses with ice cubes and enjoy!

Cut roast into 4 pieces. Place in 4-quart crock pot. Pour over mustard. Sprinkle over brown sugar. Stir in onion and carrots. Pour in broth and wine. Sprinkle with kosher salt & ground black pepper. Cover& cook on high for 4-5 hours or on low for 8-10 hours.
In a mixing bowl, combine sour cream, artichokes, garlic, and seasonings. Serve with crackers.

Soak rice for at least an hour or overnight in water. Cook rice in water until tender. In a frying pan heat ghee or oil and add mushrooms and cook till they release their liquid. Add rice and stir for a minute or two. Add peppercorns, cumin, coriander and turmeric and stir for a minute. Add water as needed and cook till the water dries up. Add ginger powder and stir for a minute or two. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray muffin cups with cooking spray. Combine pork and beef in a large bowl. Add mashed potatoes, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Mix well. Form mixture into patties. Place patties in prepared muffin cups. Brush tops with egg white. Bake at 400f for 12 minutes or until patties are browned.

Brown beef with onion. Drain fat. Add Hamburger Helper beef pasta mix and water. Bring to a boil. Cook 8 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in basil, salt, pepper, diced tomatoes & Veg-All. Serve immediately. Garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.
Cut the mango into 1cm thick slices. Place in a large bowl and stir through lime juice and honey. Leave to stand for 1 hour. Stir through cold water. Add mint leaf to serve.

Heat the water in the microwave until lukewarm (approximately 100 degrees f). Add the flour to the water and stir quickly with a wooden spoon until all the flour is mixed into the water. Turn the mixture out onto a lightly floured work surface. Knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic. The dough should not be sticky. Knead the dough for approximately 5 minutes. Divide the dough into 4 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a 1/4 inch thick circle with a rolling pin. Brush the surface with olive oil. Sprinkle flax seeds on half the circles. Fold over the other half. Brush the dough with olive oil. Roll the dough into a 1/4 inch thick circle. Place on a baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining dough. Bake until golden brown 15-20 minutes. Cool on a rack. Cut into wedges.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9×5 inch loaf pan. Sift together the flour and salt into a medium bowl. Whisk together the butter and sugar in a medium bowl until smooth. Beat in the vanilla and anise seeds. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Beat in the sour cream. Stir the flour mixture into the butter mixture in 3 additions. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan. Bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add the garlicsaute 30 seconds. Add chickensaute 4 minutes. Remove from the heat. Stir in pasta, tomatoes, broccoli, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, italian dressing and basil. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp. Remove bacon to paper towels to cool. Drain all but 1 tablespoon bacon grease from skillet and place over medium heat. Add chicken broth, salt, quick-cooking grits and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes or until thickened. Stir in chiles, tomatoes and bacon. Stir in cheese and serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Season the fish with the salt and pepper and arrange in a lightly buttered baking dish. Drizzle with lemon juice and sprinkle with the tarragon and parsley. Bake until the fish is opaque throughout. Sprinkle with chives and serve with the sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Spread olive oil over baguette slices and sprinkle with oregano and garlic powder. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake about 8 minutes or until toasted and lightly browned. Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes. In the meantime, slice the provolone into thin slices and arrange on bread slices. Top with tomato slices and drizzle with olive oil. Serve hot. Serves 4 to 6 people.

Beat margarine in large mixer bowl until smooth. Add sugar gradually. Beat until light and fluffy. Add graham cracker crumbs and mix well. Press mixture firmly into a 13 x 9 baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Spread sweetened condensed milk over crust. Sprinkle with chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, nuts, shredded coconut and marshmallows. Bake for 5 minutes more. Cool completely before cutting into squares. Makes about 24 squares.

Mix sugar and blackberries together in a small bowl. Add the water and stir to combine. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. In a large bowl, beat cream until soft peaks form. Fold in half-and-half. Stir in blackberry mixture. Chill. To serve, pour into glasses. Garnish with blackberries.

Cut squash in half, scoop out seeds with spoon. Cut flesh into 1 inch cubes. In a soup pot over medium heat, saute onion with oil. Add garlic, season with salt and pepper. Add water to cover squash. Bring to a simmer. Add squash and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove 1-1/2 cups of soup from pot and puree with blender until smooth. Return puree to pot. Add spinach. Heat until spinach is wilted. Ladle into soup bowls. Top with sour cream. Serve with crusty bread.

Heat the olive oil in a skillet. Add the garlic and onions and saute until tender. Add the tomatoes, red and yellow peppers. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Serve with couscous.

Combine 2 teaspoons of balsamic vinegar, pineapple juice, honey, cornstarch, thyme and soy sauce in a bowl. Add pork chops and coat evenly with sauce. Let chops marinate in refrigerator at least 2 hours or overnight. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook pork chops for 3-4 minutes each side or until browned on both sides. Transfer skillet to oven and bake pork chops for 15 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 145f. Remove from heat and let rest 5 minutes before serving.

Puree beans with broth, half-and-half, scallions and cayenne in a blender or food processor. Stir in cumin and sherryseason with salt and pepper. Heat and serve in bowls garnished with sour cream and scallions.

Dissolve jello in boiling water. Add crushed pineapple. Add blueberries. Refrigerate. When set, cut into squares. Make glaze by melting the cream cheese and sour cream together with sugar and vanilla. Drizzle glaze over squares. Sprinkle with nuts.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine chicken, shallots, Dijon mustard, cayenne pepper, salt, and freshly ground pepper. Spread mixture onto 2 baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove chicken from oven, let cool, then chop into bite size pieces. In a bowl, combine chicken pieces with parsley and mayonnaise. Serve on sandwich rolls or lettuce leaves.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 13x9x2-inch pan. Combine cake mix, poppy seeds and oil. Stir in orange juice until crumbly. Spoon mixture into pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden. Cool 5 minutes. Drizzle with lemon glaze. To make glaze: Combine 1/4 cup of the juice, 1/4 cup of the oil, and 1 tablespoon of the lemon peel. Beat with a mixer at high speed until fluffy. Drizzle over bread. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 9x13 inch baking dish with aluminum foil. Spread the graham crackers in the bottom of the pan. In a small saucepan, melt the butter and sugar together. Pour the melted butter mixture evenly over the graham crackers. Sprinkle the nuts over the graham crackers. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Let the bars cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Lift the bars out of the pan by the aluminum foil. Break into bars.

Preheat oven to 350F. Butter a 9-inch round or square baking dish. Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Add pears and toss to coat. Increase heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, until the pears begin to soften. Add the cranberries and stir to combine. Remove from heat and set aside. Whisk the eggs and sugar in a large bowl until well-blended. Whisk in the flour and half-and-half. Stir in the pear mixture and cinnamon. Pour into prepared baking dish and bake in the centre of the oven for 30 to 40 minutes until the clafouti is puffed and golden. Let cool slightly and serve warm.

Prepare cake mix according to directions on package. Pour into greased and floured 9x13 inch pan. Bake according to package directions. Cool completely. In a large bowl, combine 1 can of the sweetened condensed milk and 1 can of the cream of coconut. Mix well. Spread over top of cake. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. To serve, spread with cherry pie filling and top with whipped topping.
Saute beef and onion until beef is browned. Stir in relish and remaining ingreds. Spoon mixture into crescent rolls. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375f 12-15 minutes or until rolls are golden.

Preheat griddle. Slice the eggplants lengthwise into 4-6 slices. Brush the cut sides with a little oil and griddle over a medium heat until tender. Cut into strips. In a bowl, combine the lemon juice, garlic, salt, pepper, feta cheese and parsley. Mix well. Toss the strips with the dressing. Garnish with the cilantro. Serve immediately.

In a bowl combine dressing, onion soup mix, and cranberry sauce. Toss together chicken and dressing mixture until chicken is well coated. Spray a 9 x 13 baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees f for 40-50 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve with hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, toss the peaches with the lemon juice, vanilla and arrowroot powder until well coated. Transfer the fruit into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Combine the almond flour, sea salt, and baking soda in a separate bowl. Add the oil and agave nectar and stir until well blended. Sprinkle the topping over the fruit and gently spread it out so that there are no gaps between the fruit and the top crust. Bake for about one hour until the fruit is soft and the top is slightly golden brown. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease an 8x8 square baking pan. Crush crackers into very small pieces. In a large bowl combine crackers, milk, sugar, eggs, vanilla and salt. Mix well. Stir in coconut. Spread into baking pan. Bake 40 minutes or until set. Cool. Refrigerate. Serves 6.

Place fritos in a large bowl. Pour in the corn syrup and sugar. Mix well. Spread the mixture out on 2 baking sheets and bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove from the oven and spread the mixture out again on the baking sheets. Spread the peanut butter evenly over the crispies. Bake for 10 minutes.
Place boiling water in large bowlstir in orange Jell-O and orange juice until dissolved. Stir in ice cream until melted. Refrigerate until thickenedstir before serving. Garnish with orange slices.

Combine yeast and water and let rest for 10 minutes. Add honey and oil and let sit another 10 minutes. Add eggs and salt and mix well. Add 2 1/2 cups whole wheat flour and knead for 5 minutes. Add remaining flour and continue kneading until dough is smooth and elastic and pulls away from sides of bowl. Place dough in greased bowl and turn to coat top of dough with oil. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise for 1 hour. Punch dough down and divide into 100 equal parts. Shape into balls and place into greased pan. Cover and let rise for 1 hour. Bake at 400 for 15-20 minutes until golden. Remove from pan to cool on racks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together cheese, sugar, and eggs. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add dry mixture to creamed mixture, and blend well. Stir in buttermilk until mixture is smooth. Fold in butter. Bake in greased loaf pan for 60-65 minutes, or until loaf is golden brown and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack. Makes one loaf.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Cut corn off cob, leaving kernels intact. Combine all other ingredients and whip well with an electric mixer until smooth. Chill. Butter corn cobs and grill over medium-high heat for 5-7 minutes per side or until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from grill and brush with lime butter mixture. Serve.

Sauté celery and green onion in margarine until tender. Mix crabmeat, breadcrumbs, cayenne pepper and salt to taste. Stuff bell peppers with mixture. Bake in a 350 degree oven until heated through. Serve with rice and salad.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat cook the onion and green chilies in oil until tender. Stir in the garlic and cook about one minute. Stir in the beans and cook about one minute. Stir in the corn and cook about one minute. Stir in the tomatoes and tomato sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Place chicken breasts in the skillet and cover. Cook over low heat until chicken is cooked through, about 8-10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oil in wok or large saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir-fry onion and garlic for 2 minutes or until onion is golden. Add curry paste and continue stir-frying for 1 minute. Add coconut milk and 1/4 cup water. Bring to boil and cook for 3 minutes. Add chicken, stir-fry for 1 minute. Add fish sauce and sugar. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until chicken is cooked. Add peanut butter, stir-fry until butter is melted. Stir in cornstarch mixture until sauce is thickened. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup water. Remove from heat. Add lime juice and season with salt. Serve with rice.
Beat cream cheese and cream until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla extract. Add in your choice of fresh fruit. Enjoy.

Place fresh corn kernels in a medium bowl, add the olive oil and seasonings. Mix well to coat the corn evenly with the seasonings. Heat the oil in a large fry pan over medium-high heat and add the corn and seasoning mixture. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently until the corn is golden brown. Add the red bell peppers and onions and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Stir in the garlic and cilantro and cook for an additional minute. Serve warm.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch thick pieces. Place in large pot with salted water. Bring to a boil. Cook until tender. Drain. Place potatoes in large bowl. Melt butter in frying pan over medium heat. Add rosemary. Saute until fragrant. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in 1/2 cup milk. Add rosemary mixture to potatoes. Mash potatoes until smooth. Serve topped with additional fresh rosemary.

Heat oven to 375f. Beat together butter and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs. Beat in flour, baking powder and baking soda until well blended. Stir in cherries and almonds. Drop by teaspoonful on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 30 cookies.

Combine lean ground beef, ketchup, oregano, breadcrumbs and milk in a large mixing bowl. Use your hands to work the mixture until it is well combined and no longer crumbly. Stuff broccoli and ham in the mixture and stir until well combined. Pour into 9x5 loaf pan and bake uncovered for 50 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 160 degrees fahrenheit. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Cut in 1 inch slices and serve with extra ketchup if desired.

Remove giblets from turkey. Pat dry. Place in large bag with salt, brown sugar & hot water. Tie bag & place in sink. Allow to brine for 4-6 hours. Remove from brine & rinse turkey. Place turkey in roasting pan. Pour ice cubes over turkey. Bake turkey at 450 degrees f for 15 minutes. Lower temp to 275 degrees f & cook for 2-2 1/2 hours. Remove turkey from oven & cover with maple syrup. Bake for additional 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven & allow to rest for 20-30 minutes. Slice turkey & drizzle with glaze.

Combine sugar and cornstarch in large saucepan. Add milk all at once. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in bittersweet chocolate until melted. Pour mixture into four small serving bowls. Cool to room temperature. Serve chilled. Makes 1 (1/2-cup) serving each.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 9 x 13 pan, mix cake mix, melted butter, water, egg and vanilla. Press into pan. Bake 10-12 minutes. In a medium bowl, mix together coconut, sugar, vanilla and margarine. Spread over warm cake. Top with chocolate chips. Cool. Cut into bars.

In a small saucepan, combine butter, flour and milk. Cook over medium heat until boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in pudding mix. Add eggs. Stir well. Pour into greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes or until set. Cool completely. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add 1 cup of the cooled whip. Spread over bottom of cake. Refrigerate for 1 hour. In a small bowl, combine chocolate syrup with remaining cool whip. Spread over top. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm. Cut into squares.

Place egg whites in a large glass or metal bowl. Using a wire whisk or a hand mixer fitted with wire whisk attachment, beat egg whites until soft peaks form when whisk is lifted from mixture. Add cream of tartar, extract, and Splendabeat until stiff peaks form when whisk is lifted from mixture. Gently fold in almonds. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. Remove from oven and let cookies stand in pan for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, savory and seasoning. Stir until fragrant. Remove from heat. Allow to cool for 5 minutes. Transfer butter mixture to a bowl. Refrigerate until solid. Use compound garlic butter as a spread for sandwiches or as a flavouring for steak and other meats.
To prepare tea, pour 1 cup of water over 3 tablespoons of leaves. Let stand for 30 minutes. Strain out the leaves and discard. Combine the tea with the sugar and lemon juice. Serve over ice.

In a medium bowl, combine the bananas with the cinnamon and the sugar. Heat oil to about 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place a wrapper on the palm of your hand, with the narrow end closest to you. Spread about a tablespoon of the banana mixture down the center of the wrapper. Fold in both sides and the top to seal. Heat the oil. Fry the lumpia until brown. Drain on paper towels.
Cook the pasta according to directions on package. Drain and toss with the olive oil, garlic, sugar, tomatoes and basil. Toss well and serve immediately. Top with cheese if desired.

Prepare and follow pudding package directions, using 2 cups cold milk. Add the fruit as directed on package. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until set. Stir well before serving. Makes 4 servings (2 cups per serving).

Marinate chicken breasts for at least an hour in olive oil, oregano and wine. Place chicken breast in pan over med-high heat for about 5 - 7 minutes per side. Remove chicken from pan and allow to cool slightly before cutting into bite size pieces. In pan used to cook chicken saute artichoke hearts in olive oil about 2 minutes or until tender. Add chicken broth and white wine to pan and reduce by half. Add chicken back into pan and add kalamata olives. Cook until heated through, about 2 more minutes. Cook pasta according to directions. Combine chicken mixture with cooked pasta and serve with feta cheese sprinkled on top.

In a large pot over medium heat, combine broth, celery, onions, garlic salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add Velveeta cheese and jalapeno. Cook until the cheese is melted. Pour into bowls. Top with sour cream and tortilla chips. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil and butter over medium heat. Add onions and saute until golden. Add garlic and saute until golden. Add ginger and saute until fragrant. Add berbere and saute for one minute. Add chicken stock. Add chicken pieces. Cover pan with a lid. Simmer over medium heat until the meat is tender (about an hour). Add lime juice. Serve with hard-boiled eggs.

Peel and slice plantain into 1/8 inch rounds. Heat oil in large skillet. Add sliced plantains. Fry for about 5 minutes or until golden brown. Remove and drain on paper towels. In a small bowl combine sugar, salt and black beans. Add plantains and toss until beans stick to plantains. Serve with sour cream.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the raspberry preserves, oil and vinegar. Whisk until smooth. Let cool to room temperature. In a medium bowl, whisk together the mustard and salt and pepper. Add the chicken and toss well. Transfer to plates and top with scallion and fresh raspberry. Serve with Bibb lettuce leaves.

Boil beets until tender. Cool and peel. Cut into small chunks and place into a bowl. Combine with onion and oil. Marinate for at least one hour or overnight. Whisk vinaigrette ingredients until blended and pour over beets and onion just before serving. Garnish with chives. Serves 4

Combine first 5 ingredients in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve molasses. Remove from heat. Rub steaks with garlic. Place in a 13-in. x 9-in. pan coated with cooking spray. Brush steaks with half the sauce. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes. Brush steaks with remaining saucebake an additional 5-10 minutes or until done. Serve with rice and green beans.

Mix cake mix, 1 egg, sour cream and 1/2 cup sugar according to package directions. Place 1/2 of the mixture into 12" square baking pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and immediately poke holes all over the top of the cake with a fork. Pour 1/2 of the can of milk over cake. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the chocolate chips. Repeat the same process with the rest of the cake mixture and the rest of the can of milk and chocolate chips. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes more or until firm to the touch. Cool thoroughly before cutting.
Boil potatoes in water until tender. Add potatoes to a blender or food processor. Add remaining ingredients. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately. Garnish with cheese.

Grease and line a loaf tin. In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients. Beat together for a few minutes. Tip into the tin and level the surface. Bake for approx. 1 1/2 hours. Leave to cool before turning out.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Rinse fish and pat dry with paper towels. Place fish in an ovenproof dish, add wine and lemon juice and marinate for 15 minutes, turning once or twice to coat both sides. Heat butter in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Add fish to skillet, turning once or twice until browned on both sides. Transfer to the oven and bake 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with almonds and parsley. Serve immediately. Serve with rice or potatoes if desired.

Season pork chops with ground sage. Add apple cider and apple slices to crock pot. Add pork chops to crock pot. Add rice to crock pot. Cook on high for 4-5 hours, or on low for 6-7 hours. Serve with parsley.

Cut the stems off of the lemongrass stalks and bruise them with the back of your knife. Put them in a plastic bag and crush them with a rolling pin. In a wok over medium high heat, pour in 1 teaspoon of oil and add the lemongrass and bird chiles. Stir fry for 30 seconds. Add the kaffir lime leaves and the peanut oil and stir fry for a minute. Add the coconut milk and bring to a boil. Add the tofu and the cabbage. Boil for 3 minutes or until the cabbage is cooked. Add the lime juice and the fish sauce. Serve over rice.

Place the pork roast, olive oil, garlic and seasonings into a roasting pan and bake uncovered until done. 2 hours for large roast. 2 hours 15 mins for medium roast. 3 hours for small roast. Let stand for 10 mins before carving. Serve with bread and wine.

Combine pumpkin puree, eggs, white sugar, cinnamon and cornstarch in a large bowl. Beat well. Fold in the half-and-half and rye whisky. Pour into prepared crust. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees f. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Let cool completely before slicing.
Mix cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Add key lime juice. Fold in cool whip. Spoon into pie crust. Top with whipped cream and slivered almonds.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. In small saucepan melt white chocolate wafers with shortening. Dip fresh strawberries into melted chocolate. Place on wax paper to cool. Melt semi-sweet chocolate chips. Dip each strawberry into the chocolate. Place on wax paper to cool. Sprinkle with nuts if desired. Chill before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Cut tomato in half and place cut side down in a baking dish with 1/2 inch water. Cover with foil and bake for 2 hours or untill soft and darkened in color. Combine olive oil, garlic and crushed red pepper in a small bowl and pour over tomatoes. Let stand for 15 minutes before serving. Remove basil leaves from stems and place in a blender with olive oil and vinegar until smooth. Stir in tomatoes and parmesan cheese and refrigerate until serving. To serve place a scoop of relish in a hollowed out tomato half and garnish with basil leaves.

Sauté ground beef with onion and garlic in non-stick frying pan until done. Remove from pan. Add spinach to pan and cook until wilted. Add carrots and cook until tender. Add drained tomatoes to pan and simmer for 2 minutes. Add pasta to tomato mixture, cover, and cook for 10 to 12 minutes or until pasta is tender. Remove from heat and stir in beef. Makes 3 to 4 servings.
In a small bowl combine the yogurt, ketchup, mayonnaise and green onions with the curry powder. Chill until ready to serve.

Preheat the oven to 350. Rub the rib roast with the oil and garlic. Bake for 15 minutes per pound, or until a meat thermometer reads an internal temperature of 125 degrees. Remove the roast from the oven and let it stand for at least 30 minutes. Meanwhile, place the potatoes in a baking pan and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook for about 15 minutes or until tender. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pan. Add the butter and the parsley and season with the salt and pepper. Toss the potatoes and place them in the oven to keep warm.

Mix together flour, baking soda and salt. Cut in shortening with a pastry blender. Add molasses. Add boiling water and stir until well blended. Pour into an unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Serves 8.
Bring cider and pineapple juice to a boil over medium heat. Add ginger, cloves, and cinnamon sticks. Simmer 1 minute. Stir in sugar and salt until dissolved. Stir in rum and serve.
Mix mayonnaise and mustard in a small bowl. Add basil. Spread mayonnaise mixture on tortilla. Layer with roast beef, tomatoes, lettuce. Roll up. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine elk and pesto sauce until well blended. Add parmesan cheese, egg and breadcrumbs and continue to blend until smooth. Stir in garlic powder, red pepper flakes and salt and pepper to taste. Form into balls about the size of a large marble and place on a baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes and then turn balls over and bake another 10 minutes. Serve with sauce for dipping and enjoy!

Prepare breadcrumb mixture by combining breadcrumbs, taco seasoning, egg, and butter. In a shallow dish, combine breadcrumb mixture with chicken pieces. Mix until well coated. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken pieces and cook until done. Add picante sauce and cook until well heated through. Serve immediately.

Place whole chicken in a large dutch oven. Add a bit of salt, spices and ghee. Turn the chicken over a few times in the pan to coat it all over. Cover the pan, bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer until the chicken is done. (25-30 minutes) In a small bowl combine the garlic cloves with the bouillon cubes. Pour hot water over the cubes and let them soften. After the chicken has been cooked for 25 minutes add the garlic, bouillon cubes mixture to the pan. Add water to the pan to cover the chicken. Add a bay leaf to the pan. Cover the pan and simmer for about 30 more minutes. When the chicken is ready to eat, remove from the pot, let cool a bit and then shred the chicken with a fork. Stir the shredded chicken back into the pan. Add the rice to the pan. Add the toasted almonds to the pan. Cover the pan and simmer for 10 more minutes.

In a large pot, combine the corn chex, rice chex and pretzels. In a small bowl combine the butter, light corn syrup, baking soda and water. Pour the mixture over the cereal. Stir to coat. Pour into a large roasting pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until crisp and lightly toasted. Remove from oven. Add the almonds, cranberries, raisins, peanuts and craisins. Stir to coat. Store in an air-tight container.

Cut onion in half. Heat pierogies in boiling water 5 minutes then drain. Melt butter in skillet. Saute onion in butter 2 minutes then add pierogies and saute 3 minutes. Pour water over pierogies, cover skillet and cook 5 minutes longer. Makes 8 servings.

Place berries in saucepan and sprinkle rind over them. Add lemon juice. Mix cornstarch with water. Add to blueberries and cook until mixture boils. Boil 3 minutes more, stirring constantly. Serve warm over ice cream or cake. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat margarine and sugar substitute until creamy. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Combine flour, baking powder and baking soda. Stir into mixture. Stir in crushed pineapple. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool for 2 minutes. Roll in powdered sugar.
In a large bowl, beat eggs until blended well. Beat in milk, corn and onion until mixed well. Pour into prepared pie shell and bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees f.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Cut acorn squash in half lengthwise with a sharp knife. Scoop out seeds, then place squash cut side down in a shallow baking pan. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes, or until squash is very tender when pierced with a fork.Remove from oven, then drizzle honey and butter over squash. Sprinkle with brown sugar and salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm as is or with your favorite meat.
Combine all the ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 1 minute until sauce begins to thicken. Remove from heat and cool. Serve over ice cream or fruit.
Boil beans, potatoes, carrots in lightly salted water until tender. Cool. Combine vegetables in large bowl with remaining ingredients. Chill. Serve cold.

Sprinkle gelatin over boiling water in small bowl, stirring with whisk. Cool 10 minutes. Stir in rum and sweet-and-sour mix until well blended. Pour into 6 shot glasses or small dessert dishes. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until firm. Garnish with strawberries. Store covered in the refrigerator. Serves 6.
Combine cabbage, onion, carrots and chicken in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine vinegar, lemon juice, fish sauce, and sugar. Pour over salad. Toss gently. Marinate for 30 minutes. Serve chilled.
Combine flour, sugar and baking powder. Cut in oleo. Add eggs and lemon juice. Pour into 9x9x2 pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Cool. Dissolve powdered sugar and water. Pour over cake. Chill.

In large saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Add green peas and cook, stirring constantly for about 5 minutes or until tender. Add broth and heat until boiling. Add corn and cook for about 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in sour cream. Cook for another minute or until thoroughly blended. Add salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with green onions and boston lettuce.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease 2 (12-cup) muffin tins or coat with cooking spray. Slice squash 1/2 inch thick. Place in a large bowlsprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. In a medium bowl combine flour, cinnamon, baking powder and soda. In another bowl, combine eggs, 1/4 cup sugar, oil and vanilla. Add egg mixture to dry ingredientsstir just until moistened (batter will be slightly lumpy). Stir in squash. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cupssprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely.

Cook bacon until crisp then drain the bacon fat into a jar. Chop bacon into small pieces and set aside. Cook garlic in the bacon fat until golden brown. Blend all ingredients together. Serve warm over salad or cold as a dipping sauce for veggies or bread sticks.
Prepare margarita mix according to package directions, adding tequila, triple sec, salt, ice, water and lime wedges. Serve over ice in a highball glass rimmed with salt.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets or line with parchment paper. In large bowl, mix together oil and sugar with an electric mixer. Beat in egg white, lemon juice and rindbeat in flour and oats. Stir in rice cereal. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto cookie sheets. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are firm and bottoms are golden brown. Allow to cool on sheets for 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Saute bacon. Add onion, garlic, zucchini, corn, red peppers. When vegetables are soft add a little water and simmer until water is reduced. Stir in parmesan cheese. Serve hot or cold. Makes 6 servings.
Cook elbow macaroni according to directions on package. Drain. Add green onions, pepper, mayonnaise, salt, and garlic. Stir in salsa. Chill.

Place 2 cups fresh or frozen cranberries and 1 cup sugar in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over low heat until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to simmer. Increase heat to medium-high. Cook until berries burst and mixture thickens to jam consistency, about 15 minutes. Stir occasionally during cooking. Cool slightly. Add 3 tablespoons fresh orange juice, 2 tablespoons water, 2 tablespoons lemon juice. Transfer to bowlstore covered in refrigerator up to 2 months.
Mix all the ingredients together and form into patties. Grill or broil until done to your liking.

Wash rice. In a large pot, combine water, saffron, salt and rice. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to simmer. Cover pot and cook until water is absorbed, approximately 30 minutes. Meanwhile, melt butter in a small pan over medium heat. Stir in pistachios and stir occasionally until nuts are lightly browned. Fluff rice with a fork and serve with the butter pistachios.

Heat oil in 10-inch skillet over high heat. Add onion and garlicsaute 1 minute. Add beef and garlicsaute until browned, 7 to 8 minutes, stirring to crumble. Stir in tomatoes and next 3 ingredients. Bring to boilreduce heat to low and simmer 10 minutes or until beans are heated through and liquid is absorbed, stirring occasionally. Stir in rice. Cover and remove from heatlet stand 5 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with cilantro and serve.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Combine first 4 ingredients in large bowl until well blended. Divide mixture into 4 patties. Grill patties 4-6 minutes per side or until cooked through. Serve patties on buns with lettuce and tomato. Serves 4.

Wash apples and cut off stem. Remove core and slice each apple into 4 quarters. In a bowl add cinnamon and caster sugar. Toss apple quarters to coat in mixture. In a deep sided pie plate place a layer of phyllo pastry and spray with olive oil flavored cooking spray. Place apples in the pie plate and sprinkle with a bit more caster sugar. Add another layer of phyllo and spray. Continue layering until you reach the top. Spray the top layer of phyllo and sprinkle with icing sugar. Bake in a 450 degree oven for 25 minutes. Allow to cool before slicing. Serve with whipped cream.

In a crock pot add all the ingredients. Cook low for 3-4 hours. Stir occasionally. When finished cooking pour into a jar and refrigerate. Can be kept up to 2 weeks. Great with pancakes or as a topping for ice cream.

Pour milk into a medium saucepan. Add water. Stir in nonfat dry milk powder. Cook and stir over medium heat until powder dissolves. Bring just to a boil. Remove from heat. Add chocolate chips and stir until melted. Stir in sugar. Stir in cornstarch until smooth. Return to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook and stir 1 minute. Cool slightly. Pour into individual serving glasses. Top each glass with a dollop of whipped topping. Sprinkle a few chocolate chips on top. Store in refrigerator. Makes about 1-1/2 quarts.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Heat olive oil in a 13x9-inch baking dish. Add chickencook for 4 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in the center. Remove from pan. Add tomatoes with their juice, mushrooms and garlic to pancook for 1 minute or until mushrooms are tender. Add soup mix to pancook for 1 minute. Return chicken to pansprinkle with 1/4 cup cheese. Bake 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Spoon noodles into center of chicken mixturesprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 2 minutes or until noodles are heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375. Cut sourdough bread into 1-inch cubes. Heat oil and butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, 30 seconds. Add cubes and toss to coat. Transfer to a rimmed baking sheet and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until golden brown and crisp, tossing occasionally. Serve immediately.

In a blender container, blend bread until smooth. In a 2 quart casserole, combine egg mixture with bread, milk, butter and cheese. Beat until smooth. In another bowl, combine broccoli florets and sugar. Add to bread mixture. Pour into greased 9x13x2 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Allow to cool 15 minutes before serving. Serves 4.

Sift together first five ingredients into a small bowl. In a medium saucepan bring milk just to a boil. Pour over cocoa mixture stirring until well blended. Return to medium heat. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cook and stir until a thin paste forms. Serve warm in mugs with whipped cream and a stick of cinnamon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Peel sweet potatoes. Grate into a large bowl. Beat eggs with milk, vanilla and sugar. Add potatoes. Blend well. Spread into baking dish. Bake 1 hour. In a small bowl combine butter, brown sugar, flour and nutmeg. Remove from oven. Spread topping over sweet potato mixture. Bake 10 minutes longer. Serves 12.
Mix all together. Spoon into greased 2 cup ramekin. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Makes 2 servings.

Prepare graham cracker crust as directed on box. Press into 9-inch pie plate. Bake as directed on box. Beat cream cheese, sugar, cocoa powder and almond extract until smooth. Beat in egg until smooth. Spread into crust. Refrigerate until firm. Top with cherry pie filling or whipped topping.

In a large saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and whisk it constantly until it is the consistency of a thick paste. Gradually pour in the milk. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens. Add chicken. Lower the heat to a simmer and cook for about 30 minutes. Stir often. Add potato. Continue to simmer for another 20 minutes. Add the vegetables. Season with salt and white cheddar cheese. Cook until vegetables are tender. Mash with a fork.

Cut up the chili peppers and put in a saucepan with the vinegar, sugar and ginger, boil for about 5 minutes. Pour into sterilized jars and add the sultanas and garlic cloves. Seal the jars and keep in the fridge for up to one year. You can also add onions and green beans for a more complex flavour and texture.

Prepare stuffing as directed and set aside. Pour broth in bottom of crock pot. Place pork roast in crock pot. Season with salt and pepper. Slice dried apricots into chunks and distribute evenly in top of roast. Place stuffing over top. Mix apricot jam and balsamic vinegar. Pour over top of stuffing. Cover and cook 4-6 hours on high. Slice into 1-inch pieces and serve.

Spread pizza crust with barbecue sauce. Place chicken breasts on sauce. Sprinkle peppers on top. Top with monterey jack cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden. Cool and cut into pieces.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, heat the oil. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the spinach and cook until just wilted. Remove from heat. Add the lemon zest and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve.

Spread the pesto sauce on each crust. Top with the cooked chicken breast, the sweet onions, and the green chili peppers. Sprinkle the blue cheese and Italian cheese blend evenly over all of the toppings. Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the crusts are golden brown and the cheese is melted. Remove from the oven, let cool for 2 minutes, cut into slices, and serve immediately. Serves 6-8.
Cut up watermelon into cubes. Add rest of ingredients. Blend until smooth. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken breasts in baking dish. Spritz with olive oil cooking spray and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes or until cooked through. Let rest for 5 minutes. Cool slightly. Chop chicken into bite-size pieces. Combine chicken, celery, onion, almonds, mustard and mayonnaise. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Makes 4 servings.

Sweat the onion and garlic. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Add the broth, chorizo sausage and clamato juice. Cook for 30 minutes. Add the collard greens and shrimp and cook for an additional 30 minutes. Serve with lime wedges.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Sift together cake flour, salt and baking powder. Cream together shortening and butter until light and fluffy. Beat in corn syrup and egg until well-blended. Beat in vanilla extract and food coloring until well-blended. Gradually beat in sifted flour mixture, beating well after each addition. Stir in chocolate chips until well distributed. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees F for 7-8 minutes or until edges are light brown. Remove cookies to wire racks to cool. Makes 5 dozen cookies.

Poach eggs. Mash garlic cloves with vinegar. Slowly add oil. Stir to combine. Add harissa. Season with sea salt. Gently spoon egg into egg white. Serve with warm toast and sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.

In a large pot, heat olive oil on low heat. Add onion and saute for 5 minutes. Add pumpkin and cook for 10 more minutes. Add the carrots and cook for a few minutes. Add the rosemary and stir for a minute. Pour in the stock and bay leaves and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove bay leaves and puree the soup using an electric blender. Add the milk powder and simmer for another 5 minutes. Season with freshly ground pepper and salt. Garnish with freshly chopped parsley and serve hot.

In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the butter and chocolate and stir until completely melted. Add the sugar and vanilla extract. Heat until the sugar dissolves and the mixture becomes smooth. Add the evaporated milk and whisk until well blended. Heat until simmering and continue to heat until the mixture is thickened and reduced to about 1-1/4 cups. Cool thoroughly before serving. Makes about 2 cups.

Preheat the oven to 425F. Scrub the potatoes and poke each one a few times with a fork. Drizzle them with a little oil and sprinkle with salt. Place them in the oven and let them bake for an hour. After an hour, remove the potatoes from the oven and slice them in half. Add a little more oil and sprinkle with more salt. Sprinkle with the herbs and cheese. Return the potatoes to the oven and let them brown for about ten minutes. Serve with a little sour cream or yogurt.

Season the roast and place in a roasting pan. Bake at 350f for 2 to 2-1/2 hours or until the roast reaches 155f. Remove from oven. Skim fat from drippings. Combine the gravy mixes and water in a saucepan. Stir and heat until bubbly. Pour over roast. Spoon vegetables around roast. Serve.

Season the pork with spicy brown mustard, salt and pepper. Dredge in the flour and shake off excess. Heat the butter in a large heavy skillet over moderately high heat. Add the pork, in batches if necessary, and brown well for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer the browned pork to a plate and set aside. Add the apple juice to the pan. Scrape the browned bits off the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Add the maple syrup, bring the liquid to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Return the pork to the pan. Turn the heat to low and cover. Cook for about 10 minutes more or until the meat is cooked through. Remove the chops to a warmed platter. Pour the syrup over the meat. Garnish with the pecans.
Place all ingredients in a saucepan. Heat to boiling, then reduce to simmer. Heat for 20 minutes. Strain. Cool, then refrigerate. Serve over ice.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Boil potatoes and cut up into small cubes. In skillet, heat oil and saute onion and garlic until onion is clear. Add potatoes and cook for 1 minute. Stir in hot dogs and spices. Add cheese. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Serve on hamburger buns. For a variation, add any of the following to the hash: sliced jalapeno peppers, mushrooms, chopped green beans, diced green peppers.
Mix all ingredients in a food processor or blender and puree until smooth. Refrigerate.

Brown the onion, ground beef and garlic salt on medium low heat until the onion is soft. Stir in the worcestershire sauce and the cooked rice. Stir until the rice is heated through. Put the mixture into a 8x8 baking dish. Top with tomatoes, cheese and cover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees until the cheese is melted and browned on top.
Combine all ingredients and mix well. Cook on medium heat until tender and thickened, stirring occasionally. Serve warm or cold.

Cut squash in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds. Place squash halves in a saucepan and add 1 inch of water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and cover. Cook for 15 minutes or until tender. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add butter. Slice the onion and cook until golden. Add squash to skillet and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl sift together the flour, cayenne pepper, and salt. In a small bowl combine the butter, cheese and dill. Cut the butter into the dry mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the pecans. Mix to distribute evenly throughout the mixture. Place on a cookie sheet and bake at 400 degrees F for 15-20 minutes or until the mixture is crisp and toasted. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes about 2 cups.

Prepare the meat by trimming away any visible fat and cut into 2 inch pieces. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and paprika, and allow to marinate for a couple of hours or overnight. Add onions and garlic and stir well. Add beef broth and chili sauce and stir well. Cover and cook on low for 10 hours or on high for 5 hours or until beef is tender. Remove from crock pot and serve.

Prepare and cook rice according to package directions. Cook sausage in a skillet over medium heat until no longer pink. Remove from heat. Drain. Cut sausage into bite-sized pieces. In a large saucepan, combine sausage, zucchini, tomatoes, green bell peppers, butter, onion soup mix, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Cook until mixture thickens and is hot. Spoon mixture into each rice paper wrapper. Fold over each wrapper and fasten with a toothpick. Serve.

Slice onions thinly, then cut into 1/4-inch strips. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onionssaute until they are tender and beginning to brown but not quite golden, about 10 minutes. Add the bay leafcook for 1 minute more. Add stockbring to a boil, then cover partially with a lid or foil and simmer over medium heat for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally to ensure onions don't stick to bottom of pan. Remove bay leaf before serving. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Slice baguette into thin slices. Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heatstir in minced garlic until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Brush slices of baguette on both sides with garlic butterplace on a baking sheet in a single layer. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. Sprinkle baguette slices with Parmesan

Melt butter in sauce pan and add brown sugar and bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute, remove from heat and stir in crackers until well coated. Pour onto wax paper and cool for 10 minutes. Once cool, break up into pieces and place in an airtight container. Melt chocolate in a double boiler and place crackers in a bowl and pour over chocolate until coated. Decorate with nuts and sprinkles if desired. Place back in airtight container and let set for 30 minutes or until chocolate hardens.

Wash tomatoes and pat dry with paper towel. Arrange tomato halves in a single layer on a microwave-safe plate. Sprinkle lightly with salt, garlic powder and seasoning salt. Cover with plastic wrap and microwave for 10 minutes. Turn tomatoes over and continue microwaving for another 5 minutes. Tomato halves should be dry and slightly wrinkled. Cool and store at room temperature.

In a large frying pan over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the pork fillets to the hot pan. Sprinkle with a little salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the oyster sauce and water. Reduce the heat to medium. Bring to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the bok choy. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the honey. Stir through. Cook for 2 minutes or until the bok choy is tender. Serve with the green onions and coriander.

Cook pasta as per package directions. In a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat, heat 1 tablespoon canola oil. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add chili powder, stir-fry vegetables, and water. Bring to a boil. Add barbecue sauce. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add creamy peanut butter. Cook until blended. Stir in roasted peanuts. Serve over cooked pasta. Sprinkle with additional chili powder, if desired.

In a large skillet over medium heat, warm canola oil. Add onions and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes. Add chard and saute until wilted. Add broth and simmer for 10 minutes or until chard is soft. Season with pepper and salt. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain and toss with sauce. Garnish with parmesan cheese and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a shallow baking dish. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. In a large skillet melt butter over medium heat. Add chicken breasts and brown on both sides. Transfer to baking dish. In a small bowl combine cream of chicken soup and sauterne. Pour over chicken. Top with water chestnuts and canned mushrooms. Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is cooked through and mushrooms are tender, about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with green peppers. Garnish with thyme.

Cook sausages in a large frying pan over medium-high heat for about 15 minutes or until browned and crispy on the outside and cooked through. Mash the potato with the milk and butter. Season with salt and pepper. Add the peas and sausages and mix well. Serve the mash and sausages in bowls. Top each serving with a drizzle of olive oil and a few shavings of Parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line baking sheet with wax paper. In medium bowl combine oil, cumin, garlic powder, chili powder, sea salt, ground black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Stir well. Add chickpeas. Pour onto baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut apples into 1/4 inch slices. Place into a bowl with bananas and sprinkle with sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Melt butter in a 9x13 baking dish. Pour the banana mixture into the dish. Layer bread cubes over the banana mixture. Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour. Remove foil and bake for 15 minutes longer, uncovered. Let cool for at least 15 minutes before serving.

Heat the broiler. Place the steaks in a single layer on a foil lined baking pan. Sprinkle the top of each steak with salt and pepper and drizzle with oil. Broil 4-5 inches from the heat source until the fish is opaque throughout and cooked to desired doneness. To serve, place 1/2 tomato slice on each steak and sprinkle with chopped fresh basil or parsley. Serve with the lemon wedge alongside.

Heat oven to 350f degrees. Grease and flour loaf pan. In large bowl, beat together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at time, then coconut milk. In separate bowl, mix together flour and baking soda. Stir into the creamed mixture. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until done. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely. In small bowl, combine sour cream and vanilla. Spread evenly over the top of the bread. Sprinkle with toasted walnuts.

Peel and slice potatoes and boil them for 20 minutes. Drain them and put them back in the pot. Melt butter in the microwave and pour it over the potatoes with heavy cream and salt and pepper. Mash with a potato masher and add more butter and cream if needed. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Butter 9-inch square pan. Roll out each cinnamon roll to 8 x 10 inches and place in pan overlapping one another. Spread with filling and sprinkle with pecans. Melt butter and mix with brown sugar and cinnamon until crumbly. Sprinkle over filling. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until crumble is golden brown and filling is heated through and puffy. Cool completely. Spread with frosting and serve warm or chilled.

Peel and pit 2 avocados. Blend the avocados, the 3 cloves of garlic, 1 tablespoon of fresh lemon juice, the red onion and the cherry tomatoes in a magic bullet. Add the fresh cilantro and jalapeno pepper. Add salt and pepper to taste and blend again. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cut cod fillets into four portions of equal size. Mix lemon juice and rind with capers, cherry tomatoes and pitted black olives. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Place fish on a baking tray, season with salt and pepper, top with tomato mixture and basil leaves, bake for about 15 minutes or until fish is cooked through and flakes easily. In a small saucepan heat extra virgin olive oil, add prosciutto slices to brown lightly. Serve on a platter with fish on top and sprinkle with prosciutto crumbles.

Combine paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, dried thyme, and salt in a small bowl. Remove any skin from the fillets. Rub the fillets on both sides with the lemon zest. Sprinkle both sides of the fillets with the spice mixture. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the filletscook until browned on both sides. Remove the fillets from the skillet. Pour lemon juice over the fillets. Sprinkle the fillets with chopped parsley. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine the flour, sugar, salt, and baking soda. Stir in the margarine until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the vanilla and mix to form a soft dough. Roll out the dough to 1/4" thickness on a lightly floured surface. Cut into 2" rounds. Place a dab of preserves in the middle of each round. Bring the dough up around the preserves to form a semi-circle shape. Pinch the edges together to seal. Bake at 375 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 36 cookies.

Bring margarita mix to boiling in medium saucepan. Stir in pudding until blended. Cool for 5 minutes. Combine cake mix and eggs. Beat well. Add 2 cups of margarita mixture. Mix well. Spread batter into greased 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Spread frosting over warm cake. Refrigerate for 2 hours. In large bowl with electric mixer, beat butter and sugar until blended. Beat in margarita mix and extracts. Beat until spreadable. Makes 20 servings.

Grill peppers over medium heat, turning once or until charred on all sides. When cool, remove seeds and membranes. Cut peppers into 1/2 inch strips. Place in a food processor or blender. Add oil and vinegar. Add salt substitute and process until smooth. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 2 weeks. Makes 2 cups.

In small saucepan over medium heat, combine strawberries, blueberries and raspberries with sugar. Bring to boil, stirring occasionally until berries break down. Stir in tapioca and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 minute. Pour into prepared pie shell. Bake at 425 degrees for 25 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees and continue baking for 30 to 40 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Shred cooked chicken. Add apples, raisins, curry powder and pepper to chicken in a bowl. Add mayonnaise to blend well.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Toss leeks in oil in a large baking dish. Bake 20 minutes. Sprinkle asparagus over leeks. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with gorgonzola. Top with sage. Bake another 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parmigiano-reggiano. Bake 5 minutes longer or until asparagus is tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small mixing bowl, combine lemon juice and rum. Set aside. Combine the yams, bananas, pineapple and butter in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook and stir 5 minutes or until the mixture is tender. Add the lemon juice mixture and brown sugar. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Pour into a 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Top with the macadamia nuts. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Cook pasta according to package directions, preferably al dente. Drainkeep warm. For sauce, melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms, sherry, water, green onion, parsley, ham, and ham juicecook for 3 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and liquid is gone. Remove from heat. Stir in whipping cream and pecanscook over low heat until heated through, stirring occasionally. Toss hot sauce with hot pasta. Serve immediately.
Toss broccoli florets and red sweet peppers with soy sauce, lemon juice and toasted sesame oil. Serve hot or cold.

Cook ravioli according to package directionsdrain well. Add broccoli florets. Combine italian dressing and vinegarpour over ravioli mixture. Chill for 2 hours. Spoon onto lettuce leavestop with tomatoes, onions, carrot and pea pods. Delicious & dependable slow cooker recipes. Created for canadas kitchens.

Core and chop apples into 1-inch chunks. Place in a 6-quart slow cooker with water, lemon juice, frozen apple juice concentrate, and cinnamon sticks. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or high for 3 hours. Remove cinnamon sticks and stir in pears. Cook for 1 hour longer or until tender. Remove 2 cups of sauceplace in a blender or food processor with nutmeg. Purée until smoothstir into applesauce. Cover and cook 30 minutes longer or until thickened. Makes 4 cups

Preheat oven to 350f. In small bowl, combine cream cheese, 1/2 cup sugar, almond extract and flourset aside. On lightly floured surface, roll each dough triangle into 8 inch square. Spoon 1/3 cup of the filling in center of each square. Fold each corner toward center, overlapping slightly. Seal edges. Place sealed sides down on ungreased 13x9 inch pan. In small bowl combine remaining sugar and butter. Brush over doughsprinkle with almonds. Bake 25 minutes or until golden. Cool 10 minutes. Cut into 3x4 inch bars. Makes 4 dozen bars.

Boil 1 cup of water in a 2 cup glass measuring cup (or a 1 cup measuring cup for 2 cups of liquid). While it is boiling, empty the frozen strawberries in a blender or food processor. Add 1 tablespoon of lemon juice (fresh is best), and 1/2 teaspoon of cornstarch to the frozen strawberries. Puree until smooth, adding a little more lemon juice if needed to get it smooth. Add 1/4 cup of liquid from boiling water to help puree. Transfer to a bowl. Measure 4 tablespoons of liquid from boiling water into your measuring cup or glass measuring cup (2 cups of liquid for 1 cup). Add 1 tablespoon of unflavored gelatin and stir to dissolve. Add to strawberry mixture and stir well. Pour into an 8 x 8 pan that is sprayed with nonstick cooking spray or has been greased with shortening or margarine. Let set in refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight. Cut with knife

Cut strawberries into quarters and put into a glass container with a lid or in a food processor. Add sugar and pour in boiling water. Let steep for 10 minutes and then strain out strawberries. Pour into pitcher and add tea bag and let steep for at least a couple of hours (overnight is better). Stir in frozen lemonade concentrate and pour over ice cube filled glasses. Top off with club soda and enjoy!

Combine oats, milk and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook 3 minutes or until thickened. Stir in cherries, cinnamon, vanilla extract, salt and sugar. Cook 3 minutes longer or until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in pecans. Serve warm with additional pecans or cinnamon.
Combine all in a bowl and toss together. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice, season with salt and pepper to taste and serve on greens or in pitas with lettuce and tomato.

In a bowl combine the onion, garlic, olive oil and capers. Saute the fish in the bowl over medium heat for about 2 minutes per side. Add the tomatoes, fresh dill and balsamic vinegar. Serve with rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees F (200 degrees C). Toss together olive oil and salt and pepper to taste. Spread the parsnip wedges in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until browned and tender, about 1 hour. Toss the hot wedges in the maple syrup and sprinkle with cinnamon to serve.

In a medium bowl combine vinegar, water, sugar and poppy seeds. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add the green onions and refrigerate until ready to serve. Cut watermelon into wedges. Cut cucumbers in half lengthwise, remove seeds with a spoon and slice. Arrange the fruit and vegetables on a large platter and pour the dressing over them. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Chill until ready to serve. Makes about 6 servings.

Mix 1/2 cup sugar and the fruit. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. In a bowl combine mascarpone cheese, 1 cup heavy whipping cream and vanilla extract. Whip until thick. In a shallow bowl combine powdered sugar and 1/4 cup heavy whipping cream. Beat until soft peak form. Spoon about 1/4 cup of mascarpone cream into each glass or bowl. Spoon a little of the fruit mixture into each glass and top with whipped cream and a sprig of mint. Serve immediately.

Place the flour in a medium sized saucepan over medium heat. Stir in milk gradually. Keep stirring until the mixture thickens. Add nutmeg, salt, pepper and Parmesan Cheese. Add the egg substitute. Stir until the sauce thickens. Remove from heat. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add vegetables of choice. Cook until crisp tender. Remove from heat. Pour white sauce over vegetables. Cook until heated through. Serve over pasta or rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cook the rice as directed on the package. Heat the butter over medium heat and add the onion and carrot. Cook for about 3 minutes. Add the uncooked rice and stir well. Pour in the water and seasonings and bring to a boil. Place the rice mixture into a large casserole dish and top with the peas and salsa. Cover the casserole dish with foil and bake for 15 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes. Uncover and bake for an additional 5 minutes. Let the casserole sit for about 5 minutes before serving.

Combine beef and pork with onion and salt and pepper and mix thoroughly. Add egg and breadcrumbs and mix until smooth and firm enough to form meatballs. Form into small balls and brown in skillet with oil. Serve with potatoes and lingonberry jam and a green salad or coleslaw.

Place a tortilla flat in the skillet. Spread with a thin layer of chicken. Spread with a thin layer of vegetables and hot sauce. Top with shredded cheese. Top with another tortilla. Cook until the tortilla is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Flip the quesadilla and continue cooking until the other side is golden brown. Cut into wedges and serve hot with more hot sauce.

Cut a piece of plastic wrap about two inches larger than the top of a small ovenproof dish (I used a square Pyrex baking dish). Cut a piece of wax paper the same size as the plastic wrap. Spread the cheese evenly over the bottom of the dish. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside. Melt the butter with the garlic over low heat in a medium skillet until the garlic is soft and fragrant. Remove garlic from the skillet and set aside. Stir the flour and cayenne pepper into the skillet and cook, stirring for one minute. Slowly add the milk and stir until thickened. Add the garlic and stir to mix. Add the olives and stir to mix. Spread the mixture over the cheese. Cover with the wax paper and then the plastic wrap and bake for 20 minutes. Uncover and bake for 5 more minutes to brown the top and let the cheese melt slightly. Serve warm with crackers or toast points.

In a wok or frying pan, heat peanut oil over high heat until hot but not smoking. Add the bitter melon and eggs, and stir for about 1 minute until eggs are just set. Remove to a plate or serving bowl with a slotted spoon, leaving the oil behind in the pan. Add the light soy sauce, sesame oil, white pepper, and sugar, stirring until the sauce is heated through and bubbly. Pour the sauce over the bitter melon and eggs. Serve immediately with rice.

In a medium saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in flourcook for 1 minute. Gradually stir in cream of chicken soup, milk and sour creambring to a boil. Add cheese and stir until melted. Remove from the heatstir in onion and cracker crumbs. Pour into a greased 9 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Boil cauliflower and potatoes until tender. In a large bowl, combine melted butter, eggs and cayenne pepper, mix well. Add cauliflower and potato mixture to egg mixture and mix well. Put mixture into a buttered casserole dish and sprinkle with gruyere cheese. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for about 35 minutes or until casserole is golden brown and center is set.

In a bowl combine flour, cornmeal, baking powder, sugar and salt. Beat eggs in a separate bowl. Combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs and cornmeal mixture well. In a separate bowl combine milk

Clean and dry chicken wings and marinate with honey and soy sauce overnight or for atleast three hours. Take out wings and dry them. Heat a non stick pan and add turmeric powder and chili powder and ginger root powder and saute for a minute or two. Add the wings and saute them till they are done and then sprinkle some salt and pepper and garnish with ginger and coriander leaves to serve.
