In large bowl combine flour, baking soda and saltset aside. Cream margarine and brown sugar together until fluffy. Add sugar and vanillamix well. Add eggs and mix well. Add flour mixturemix well. Stir in chips by hand until well combinedcover and refrigerate for at least two hours. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet, leaving room for spreadingbake at 375 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks.

Heat grill to medium-high heat. In a small bowl combine the chili powder and cayenne pepper. Rub the mixture over each corn cob, then brush on the butter. Grill the corn for 10 minutes or until the husks are brown and the kernels are tender. Transfer the corn to a plate lined with paper towels to drain the butter. Season the corn with salt before serving.
Mix all ingredients and pour into 9x13 baking dish. Bake at 350 for one hour.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes with the olive oil and season with the salt and pepper. Spread the potatoes in a single layer in a baking dish. Roast the potatoes until golden brown, about 20 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the oven. Drain the liquid from the baking dish into a small bowl. Add the wine and the thyme leaves. Use a spoon to scrape the potatoes off the bottom of the baking dish. Stir in the wine mixture and the potatoes. Bake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with the parmesan before serving. Serve at once.

In a large bowl, combine beer with 1 tsp. paprika and the flour and cream of wheat. Season with salt and pepper. Dip shrimp in batter and fry in hot oil until golden and crisp. Place on paper towels to drain. Serve with duck sauce for dipping.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a casserole dish with butterset aside. Slice squash into rounds. Cut onion into thin rings. Layer squash and onion in prepared dish. Season with salt and pepperdrizzle lightly with olive oil. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes or until tender. In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs and milk. Pour mixture over vegetables in baking dishbake an additional 5 minutes or until eggs are set. Sprinkle with cheesebake until cheese is melted. Top casserole with bacon before serving.
Place frozen raspberries in a large bowl and gently crush with a fork. Stir in olive oil, cream and vinegar and season with salt. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until thickened.

Combine sugar with vinegar in a medium saucepan. Bring to boil over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves. Simmer over low heat until mixture is thick enough to coat a spoon, about 5 minutes. Remove from heatstir in Grand Marnierset aside to cool. Cut clementines into wedges. In a small bowl, whisk together milk and yogurt until smooth. Pour into serving bowlplace in refrigerator until ready to serve. Spoon clementine wedges into bowlspoon sauce over fruit. Garnish with mint sprig if desired.

Preheat oven to 375F. In a large bowl combine eggs and flour. Add cheese. Add vegetables. Add enough flour to form a stiff dough. Roll out dough and cut into 4 equal portions. In a skillet heat butter. Saute pancakes until golden brown. Turn and brown other side. Cook until thoroughly done. Makes 4 servings. Serves 4.

Cook pasta in boiling water for 7 minutes. Drain pasta. Mix pasta with tuna, onion, pepper and garbanzo beans. In a small pan saute garlic in olive oil for 1 minute. Add tuna mixture to the pan. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Butter 1-1/2 quart shallow baking dish. Heat oil and butter in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat. Add shallotsaut until translucent. Add chickensaut until browned. Add tarragon, cream, and 3/4 cup cheese. Bring just to boil. Remove from heatstir in potatoes. Scrape mixture into baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake until potatoes are tender when pierced with fork and cheese is golden brown. About 30 minutes.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Rinse under cold water, drain again and place in large serving bowl. Combine rosemary with olive oildrizzle over pasta and toss until coated. Stir in the pesto sauce. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and olives. Toss with pasta. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

In a shallow bowl combine the breadcrumbs, egg and Dijon mustard. In another bowl combine the broth, lemon juice and parsley. Heat olive oil in a skillet. Dip chicken in breadcrumb mixturesaute in olive oil. Add broth mixture to the pan and cook over medium heat until the chicken is done. Serve over hot linguine.
Combine all ingredients except parsley in a large bowl. Blend thoroughly. Fold in parsley. Chill until ready to serve. Serve on pumpernickel or whole wheat bread.

Bring herring fillets, egg yolks, mustard and vinegar to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Add salt and white pepper. Add sugar. Cool to room temperature. Heat oil in a large pot. Add herring mixture and dill weed. Stir and serve.
Mix the chicken with the salt and the pepper. Heat the tortillas in the microwave for 20 seconds. Put the chicken on the tortilla. Add the cheese and the jalapeno. Top with the sour cream.

Sift flour and soda together in a large bowl. Cream butter in an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment until soft and fluffy. Add sugars and beat until well blended. Beat in egg and vanilla. Add flour mixture and mix just until blended. Stir in peanut butter. Drop by level tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350°F until set around edges, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool on wire racks.

In a large bowl, combine water, sourdough starter, salt, sugar and flour until well blended. Divide dough in half, form each half into a ball and flatten slightly with your palm. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let rise until doubled in bulk--about 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown--about 25 minutes.

Cut potatoes into 1/4 inch cubes. Dust with flour. Shake off excess. In a heavy skillet over medium heat, melt the butter with the garlic clove and bay leaf. Add the potatoes. Season with the thyme, marjoram, salt and pepper. Stir gently until browned. Transfer the potatoes to a bowl. Add the stock to the skillet. Bring to a boil. Pour the stock over the potatoes. Cover and cook over low heat for 15 minutes. Uncover and continue to cook until all the liquid is absorbed. Season with more salt and pepper. Serve.
Saute celery, onion and garlic in bacon fat until tender. Add celery salt to taste. Gently stir in diced tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in parmesan and serve over hot pasta.

Preheat grill. Brush bread with olive oil. Grill bread until browned. Remove from grill. Top bread with spinach, goat cheese, marinated artichoke hearts, tomatoes. Season to taste with pizza seasoning, salt and pepper. Return to grill for a few minutes to melt goat cheese and warm artichoke hearts.

Preheat oven to 350F. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then dredge them in flour. Heat 2 Tablespoons butter in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat until foaming. Add chicken breasts and cook, turning once, until browned on both sides, about 10 minutes total. Pour off all but 2 Tablespoons of the butterfat, leaving the browned bits behind. Add shallots and garlic to the pan and cook until softened. Pour off any excess butterfat. Add 2/3 cup white wine to deglaze the pan. Stir in white pepper and mustard until combined. Add chicken broth, scraping up browned bits. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until slightly thickened, about 10 minutes. Pour chicken broth over the chicken breastscover with foil and transfer the skillet to the oven. Cook until the chicken is just cooked through, 8 to 10 minutes. In the meantime, whisk

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Spray a 2-quart casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray. In a large saute pan over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons butter. Add shallots and cook for 3 minutes or until soft. Add mushrooms and cook for 10 minutes or until mushrooms are soft. In a large bowl combine quinoa, broth and milk. Add shallots and mushrooms. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to prepared casserole dish. Sprinkle with dill. Bake for 30 minutes.

1 can of celery (drained)1/2 cup cream cheese1 cup walnuts1 cup milk1/2 tsp salt1 tsp pepper1 tsp onion powder2 tsp lemon juice1/4 tsp garlic powder1 tsp dried parsley flakes1 tsp dried basil flakes1 tsp dried oregano flakesMix cream cheese and milk together in a bowl. Add nuts and remaining spices. Stir well. Spoon into celery and refrigerate overnight. Serve cold.

Saute onions and bacon until onions are translucent. Drain any excess fat. Add ground beef and cook until brown. Drain cocktail franks and add to the mixture. Cook until warmed through. Add cream and heat through. Remove from heat and add tomatoes and rice. Season with salt and pepper. Serves 4.

To prepare the graham cracker crust, combine the graham cracker crumbs and sugar. Add melted butter and stir until crumbs are moistened. Press crumbs into the bottom of the 9-inch spring form pan. Bake crust for 7-10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool crust completely. To prepare the filling, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add lemon pie filling and beat until smooth. Add strawberry jam and beat until combined. Add strawberries and beat until combined. Pour filling into crust and smooth the surface. Refrigerate for at least 6 hours or until set. Top with cool whip and strawberries before serving. Store any leftover cheesecake in the fridge for up to 3 days.

Cook spaghetti until it is done and drain it. Add olive oil and lemon juice in a large bowl and stir in the spaghetti. Add the black olives and stir in the avocado and garlic. Serve with pepper and parsley and salt.

Peel the shrimp and skewer them. Combine the mustard and beer. Combine the garlic powder and cayenne. Dip each shrimp in the mustard mixture and then in the garlic powder and cayenne mixture. Grill over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until shrimp turn pink.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In shallow bowl, combine mayonnaise, tarragon, lemon juice and pepper. Spread tarragon mayonnaise on both sides of cod steaks. Place cod in baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees F for 40 minutes. Meanwhile combine breadcrumbs and buttersprinkle over cod steaks. Bake for an additional 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges. Makes 4 servings.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the cider, stock and bay leaves. Bring just to a boil. Remove from heat. Add leeks and return to low heat for a few minutes. Pour the mixture into the crock pot. Add the vegetables. Cover and cook on low heat for about 8 hours. Turn off crock pot and let it sit overnight or until ready to serve. Remove bay leaves before serving. Serve with hot buttered crusty bread. Serves 8 to 10.

In a large skillet cook ground beef until browned. Drain. Add taco seasoning. In a large bowl combine soup, corn and tater tots. Add meat mixture. Pour into a greased 2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle cheese on top. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Mix together the sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and water in a large bowl. Add the apples and toss to coat. Pour the mixture into a deep-dish pie plate.In a saucepan, combine the butter, brown sugar, flour and lemon juicestir over medium heat until the sugar is dissolved. Pour the mixture over the apples in the pie plate. Sprinkle the top of the pie with the cinnamon-sugar mixture.Bake in the preheated oven until the apples are tender, about 45 minutes. Serve with whipped cream.

Heat butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute until tender and fragrant. Add ricotta cheese and cook for 2 minutes. Add cooked fettuccine and toss with sauce. Add tomato and basil and cook for another 2 minutes. Sprinkle with asiago cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet saute the ham hock, onion and garlic powder until the onion is transparent. Add the beans and potatoes, season with seasoning salt and pepper to taste. Cover and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove the ham hock from the skillet and chop it into bite size pieces. Add the ham hock back into the skillet and simmer until tender, about 30 minutes. Garnish with parsley.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine water and chicken broth. Cook and stir until boiling. Stir in onion and frozen broccoli. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Add mashed potatoes, butter and nutmeg. Cook and stir until mashed potatoes are heated through and mixture is smooth.

Heat a skillet over medium heat. Place the ham in the skillet and cook until the ham is evenly browned on both sides. Wash the coleslaw in cold water, drain and set aside. Place the ham on the buns and top with the coleslaw. Serve with heinz ketchup or worcestershire sauce.
Soak the oats in milk overnight in an airtight container in the fridge. In the morning, stir in yogurt and chia seeds and let sit another 10 minutes. Stir in jam and raspberries and enjoy!

Combine all the ingredients in a small bowl and stir well to combine. Use immediately or store up to one week covered in the refrigerator. Reheat on the stovetop if necessary and add more vinegar if the sauce has separated and become too thick.

Brown hamburger and drain. Add taco seasoning. Heat taco sauce. Mix together taco sauce and catalina dressing. In a serving bowl layer in the following order: hamburger, taco sauce mixture, and mexican cheese. Add doritos on top. Serve with lettuce, tomatoes and tortilla chips on the side.

In a large frying pan over medium-high heat, brown the onion in the olive oil. Add the garlic cloves and saut until tender. Mix in the mushrooms and cook until the mushrooms are soft. Place a small amount of mixture in each mushroom. Break an egg into each mushroom. Bake in a 350 degree F. oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until the eggs are set. Top each mushroom with parmesan cheese and parsley. Drizzle each mushroom with soy sauce. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375f. Split each biscuit and place in ungreased mini-muffin cups. In a bowl, combine celery, onion and butter. Cook and stir over medium heat until onion is tender and browned. Add mayonnaise and dry mustard. Stir until smooth. Stir in dill weed and tuna. Spoon mixture into biscuit cups. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake for 5-7 minutes.

Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler or in a bowl set over a pan of simmering water. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and salt. Add marshmallows and stir to combine. Drop marshmallows by teaspoonfuls onto a wax paper-lined pan. Sprinkle with nuts and let cool and set. Can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week. Yields 2 cups.

Mix cream cheese and milk in a large bowl with mixer until smooth. Stir in pudding mixes until blended. Refrigerate until ready to assemble. Cut ladyfingers in half lengthwise. Dip each half into coffee to soak. Arrange ladyfingers in bottom of dish. Spread cream cheese filling over ladyfingers. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Dip ladyfingers in coffee again and arrange over filling. Top with remaining filling and spread evenly with chocolate baking square. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.
In a large skillet, saut bacon until crisp. Add tomatoes, green peppers and garlic cloves. Sauté 2 minutes. Add shrimp and heat through. Serve on hamburger buns.

In a medium bowl, mix bread cubes and applesset aside. In a small bowl, combine sugar and cinnamonmix well and set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine milk and butter. Bring to a boilremove from the heat. In a large bowl, whisk the eggsadd the milk mixture, vanilla and cranberriesmix well. Add the bread mixture and stir just until combined. Transfer mixture to a 2-quart casserole dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle the sugar-cinnamon mixture over the topbake at 350 for 35 to 40 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Serve warm with whipped topping.

Preheat the oven to 400f (200c). Line a 9x5x3inch (22x13x7cm) loaf tin with greased baking parchment and dust with flour, tapping out the excess. Put the flour, sugar and butter into the bowl of a food processor and whiz until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.Add the egg and milk and whiz again until the dough just comes together (add a splash more milk if necessary).Spoon the mixture into the prepared tin and smooth over the top.Scatter the chocolate pieces evenly over the mixture and use the back of a spoon to swirl the mixture through the chocolate.Bake for 30-35 minutes until risen and golden brown.Cool in the tin for 5 minutes before turning out on to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line two cookie sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl, mix the flour, oats, and coconut. Set aside. In another bowl, mix the agave syrup, baking powder, and hot water. Stir until there are no lumps. Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and mix well. Mix in the coconut oil. Roll into balls and flatten to a cookie shape. Bake for about 20 minutes until they turn slightly golden. Let cool and store in an airtight container.
Bring nuts to boil in a small saucepan of water. Drain immediately. Toss nuts with spices. Cool completely. Store in a tightly sealed container.
Mix cranberry juice, brown sugar, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and white zinfandel wine in a large punch bowl. Pour into glasses.

In a blender combine 1 cup frozen lemonade concentrate, 1 cup ice cubes and 1/4 cup lime juice. Blend until smooth. Add 2 sliced limes to each glass. Fill glasses halfway with lemonade mixture. Top off each glass with carbonated lemonade. Garnish with a wedge of lemon.

Combine the cranberry sauce and cornstarch in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until smooth. Add the brown sugar and simmer 5 minutes until thick. Stir in the lemon juice. Add the condensed milk and simmer until mixture thickens. Beat the egg yolks and add to the mixture. Cook over low heat until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and let cool. Pour into pie shell. Refrigerate overnight before serving.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place hot dog buns cut side down on baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes or until toasted. Spread mayonnaise on bottom halves of buns. Place tuna on bottom halves of buns. Top with onions, cheese and pickles. Place on baking sheet on top halves of buns. Bake 4 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In large saucepan, brown meat with taco seasoning mix. Drain off fat. Stir in refried beans and salsa. Spread mixture in 13x9 inch baking dish. Top with cheese, cover with foil and bake at 350f for 20 min or until bubbly. Uncover, bake 5 min more or until cheese is lightly browned. Serve with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, or cilantro to taste.

Cook the carrots in the boiling water till tender, drain and cool slightly in the strainer. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the carrots and cook, stirring frequently till glazed and very tender. Add the sugar and cook another minute. Add the broth and ginger and cook till reduced by half. Add raisins and cook till gently heated through. Season with black pepper and salt and serve warm or at room temperature.

In small bowl combine soy sauce, gingerroot, honey and sherry wine. Heat in small saucepan over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. Cool to room temperature. Rub salmon steaks with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill or broil over high heat until salmon just begins to flake when tested with fork. Serve salmon with teriyaki glaze drizzled over the top. Serves 4 as main dish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Coat two slices of bread with margarine or spread on one side of bread. Lay slices on a baking sheet. Sprinkle cheese on top of mushrooms and bake for 20 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Meanwhile combine tomatoes, cottage cheese, parmesan cheese and basilmix well. Spread cheese mixture on both slices of bread to cover the margarine. Cut the two halves into 4 triangles each. Serve warm.

To prepare slaw, combine broccoli, celery, onion, mayonnaise, lime juice, cumin, chili powder and sugar in a large bowl. Toss to combine. Cover and chill. To prepare the dressing, combine lime juice, cumin, chili powder, sugar and salt in a small bowl. Stir in the golden raisins. Serve slaw mixture on platter. Spoon dressing over top and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Cut bread into bite-size pieces. In a bowl, combine bread cubes and the remaining ingredients and stir well until combined. Spoon dough into a well-greased jelly roll pan or an 8-inch round pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden and crisp on top. Cool and dust with icing sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line an Easy-Bake Oven with aluminum foil for easy clean-up. Top one side of the English muffin with tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, mushrooms, and olives if using. Close the Easy-Bake Oven door and bake for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.
Combine sweetened condensed milk and lime juice. Add red food coloring, if desired. Pour into crust. Chill until firm. Garnish with cool whip and fresh raspberries.

Beat together cottage cheese, egg white and cream until very smooth. Add sugar, vanilla, salt. Gently stir in frozen strawberries. Spoon into 4 glasses or bowls. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serves 4.

Peel the bananas and slice in half lengthwise. Place in an ovenproof dish. Combine the honey, butter, coconut, and lemon juice in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until it is boiling. Pour over the bananas. Bake uncovered in a preheated oven at 180 degrees for about 40 minutes.

Place tortillas on a baking sheet and broil until crisp and browned. Remove from oven. Cut each breast into 4 pieces. Spread each tortilla with a little of each of the soups. Top with a piece of chicken and a slice of cheese. Broil until cheese is melted. Top with black olives and salsa.

Cream butter, granulated sugar, and egg yolks. Add flour and mix well. Stir in chopped nuts. Chill dough for several hours. Roll out between wax paper to 1/4 inch thick. Cut with cookie cutters. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes. Cool. Spread with strawberry preserves. Roll in powdered sugar.

Saute onion and garlic in butter. Add flour and stir to combine. Add the tomato juice and stir to thicken. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add brussels sprouts and cook until crisp tender. Top with shredded cheddar cheese and bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Rinse potatoes under running water to remove excess starch and dirt. Cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place potatoes in a large bowl, drizzle with olive oil, then toss to coat evenly with oil. Sprinkle with oregano, mustard and salt and pepper to taste. Spread potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake 15 minutes, until they begin to brown on edges. Turn potatoes over and bake another 15 minutes.

In blender place tomatoes and celery rib. With cover on blender process until smooth. Add lemon slices and pulse again until smooth. Strain mixture through coarse sieve into bowl. Add lettuce leafs and tomato juice and process until smooth. Add olive oil and lemon juice and process until blended. Add celery salt and worcestershire sauce. Pulse just until blended. Taste and adjust seasoning. If too thick add more tomato juice. If too thin add more celery salt and worcestershire sauce. Pour mixture into glasses. Garnish each glass with celery ribs. Serve immediately.

Dip chicken in beaten egg and then in bread crumbs. In a skillet over med. Heat heat the oil. Add chicken and cook until done. Remove from skillet and place on baking sheet. Bake at 400 degf for 10 minutes or until browned. Meanwhile in the same pan add the green bell pepper and onion cooking until tender. Mix in the garlic powder and seasoning salt and pepper and paprika and cook for an additional minute. Remove from heat and stir in the sour cream. Place the chicken on platter and spoon the onion mixture on top. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and peppermix well. Place chicken in a roasting pan. Coat chicken with marinade, covering as much surface area as possible. Roast for 35 minutes or until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165 degrees F. Serve chicken sliced over salad or pasta dish.

Place noodles in a large pot with water to cover by about 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat. Boil 2-3 minutes then reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until noodles are tender. Drain noodles and set aside. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in flourcook for 1 minute or until bubbly. Gradually stir in milkcook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Remove from the heat. Stir in soup, peas, carrots, chicken, onion and pepper. Spoon mixture into a 13 x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line a 12-hole muffin tray with paper cases. Grate beetroot and squeeze out excess liquid. Transfer to a bowl along with flour, baking powder, egg, buttermilk and butter. Mix well to combine. Stir in parmesan and thyme. Fill paper cases 2/3 full with mixture and sprinkle each muffin with a little extra thyme. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until risen and golden. Cool on a wire rack. Serves 6.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Beat together flour and sour cream in a medium bowl until smooth. Stir in eggs and salt and pepper. Drop mixture by heaping tablespoons into hot oil. Fry until golden, 1 to 2 minutes. Drain on paper towels and keep warm. To serve, place 3 fried eggs on each plate and garnish with sour cream and chopped parsley.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Meanwhile, heat bacon over medium heat until crisp and transfer to paper towel to drain. Cook mushroom with garlic and 1/4 cup of the pasta water until tender, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a plate and reserve. Add remaining 1 1/2 cups pasta water to saucepan along with sunflower seeds, sun-dried tomatoes, basil, 1 teaspoon of the black pepper and parmesan cheese. Cook until sauce thickens slightly, 1 to 2 minutes. Add reserved mushrooms to sauce and toss to coat. Divide pasta among four plates. Top with bacon and sauce.

Dice the onion and celery fine. Cut the pepper and mushrooms in thin slices. In a skillet brown the steaks on both sides in the oil. Sprinkle the meat with the seasoning and add the onion, celery, pepper, mushrooms, and tomatoes to the skillet. Simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until meat is tender. Serve over rice. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place flour in a bowl. Beat the pumpkin, powdered milk, applesauce, pumpkin pie spice and Splenda in a blender until smooth. Stir the flour into the blender mixturepour into the pie pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Continue baking for 45 more minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl mix together oatmeal and brown sugar. Cut in butter with a pastry blender until mixture is crumbly. Press half the mixture into the bottom of a 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Arrange peaches over the crust. Sprinkle with the remaining crumb mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Combine crushed pineapple with 2 cups water in saucepan. Bring to boil. Add sugar. Return to boil. Stir in tomatoes, vinegar, onion, soy sauce, ginger. Blend cornstarch with water. Stir into sauce. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium. Cook for 5 minutes or until sauce is thickened. Cool. Serve as a dipping sauce or garnish for meat or vegetables.

Cut each mushroom in half through stem. Scoop out gills and stems with a spoon. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook onion and garlic in oil until tender. Add eggs and stir until set. Stir in spinach and stuffing mix. Add water. Cook and stir until heated through. Fill mushroom caps with spinach mixture. Sprinkle with feta. Bake uncovered at 375 for 30 minutes.

In a medium bowl combine 1 cup rice, 3 cups water, bouillon cube, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and chili powder. Place in a rice cooker or medium saucepan and cook as directed in rice cooker instructions.
Combine all ingredients in a food processor until smooth. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed. Transfer to a glass bottle for storage.

Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium high heat until very hot. Meanwhile, place bread on a microwave-safe plate and heat it in the microwave for 15 seconds to warm it up. Butter the outside of each slice of bread, then place one slice in the skillet. Top the bread with a slice of cheese and the other slice of bread. Cook the sandwich until the underside is golden brown, about 3-4 minutes. Using a large spatula or spoon, flip the sandwich over and cook until the other side is golden brown as well. Cook the second sandwich the same way.

Combine the bananas, vegetable oil, sugar and water into a blender. Blend until smooth. Add the vanilla. In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Add the banana mixture and stir just until incorporated. Spread into a greased 8x11 baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into 12 servings. Serve with whipped cream if you like.

Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add butter. When butter begins to foam, add shrimp. Cook for a minute or two on each side. When shrimp are almost cooked through, add white wine. Allow it to reduce by half. Add sweet pepper flakes. Stir well. Allow wine mixture to cook down. Serve immediately over hot rice.

Soak the fish in light soy sauce and white pepper for about an hour. Add the fish and the rest of the ingredients except the lettuce and simmer for about 30-40 minutes. Serve hot with lettuce and green onions as a garnish. Serves 6 people.

Place apricots in a shallow 3-quart casserole dish. In a separate bowl, combine the first five ingredientsadd the apricots and toss gently to coat. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes or until the apricots are tenderstir once or twice during the baking time. Stir together the topping ingredientssprinkle over the apricots. Return the casserole dish to the oven for another 30 minutes or until the crisp is golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Lightly oil an ovenproof plate or dish. Cut each zucchini lengthwise into four long strips. Discard the seeds and pulp. Arrange the strips on the plate. Melt the butter. Add the basil and cook for 2 to 3 minutes over medium-low heat. Remove from the heat. Sprinkle the zucchini strips with the basil butter and top with the cheese. Bake for about 20 minutes or until the zucchini is cooked through. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray a 9 x 13 baking dish with cooking spray. Spread frozen potatoes evenly over bottom of baking dish. Spread ham evenly over top of potatoes. Sprinkle monterey jack cheese over ham. Beat eggs well in a large bowl. Stir in milk, pepper, and salt until combined well. Pour egg mixture evenly over cheese. Sprinkle green onion over top of egg mixture. Bake uncovered for 45-50 minutes or until eggs are set. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting to serve. Serve hot.

Prepare the pudding according to the directions on the package, adding the banana slices after the pudding is done cooking and stirring well. Store the pudding mixture in the refrigerator. Before serving add the minute tapioca pearls and stir well. Serve warm.

Boil water and lingonberries. Stir in semolina and salt. Boil over medium-low heat until tender and porridge-like consistency. Whisk in the milk and cream. Stir until mixture thickens. Serve warm with more lingonberries and whipped cream.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add asparagus and cook for 3 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool under running water. Cut into 2-inch pieces and toss with mint, coriander and 1/2 teaspoon peanut oil. Set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, fish sauce and remaining 1/2 teaspoon peanut oil until smooth. Set dressing aside. Prepare lettuce leaves for serving by removing stems and placing on a large platter. Divide asparagus mixture among lettuce leaves and drizzle with dressing. Garnish with red pepper flakes and serve immediately.

Slice 1/3 of the bacon crosswise into 1/4-inch pieces and reserve. Slice the remaining bacon crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick strips and reserve. In a food processor fitted with a metal blade, combine the water chestnuts and brown sugar and process until coarsely chopped. Drain the water chestnuts and place in a bowl with the reserved bacon strips and the reserved bacon pieces and toss to combine. Spread the mayonnaise evenly onto the cut sides of the bread slices and sprinkle evenly with the chili sauce. Sprinkle evenly with the water chestnut mixture and roll up each slice of bread. Insert a toothpick in the center of each roll-up to secure. Arrange the roll-ups, seam side down, in a 13x9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400 for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Drizzle with the reserved sauce and sprinkle with the reserved bacon pieces before serving. Serves 6-8

To make the filling, combine the cheese, pesto and nuts in a small bowl. Sprinkle the flour over the chicken breasts and turn to coat all sides. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add the breasts and cook until browned on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Place the breasts in the pan and top each breast with 1/4 of the filling. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until the filling is melted and the chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with green onions before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Melt marshmallows. Add milk to melted marshmallows. Add graham cracker crumbs to mixture. Press mixture into pie pan. Put chocolate chips on top of the mixture. Put cool whip on top of chocolate chips. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350. Place flour in medium bowl. Add baking powder, salt and xanthan gum. Mix well. Add butter. Using pastry blender or your fingers, cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add soymilk, egg, egg whites and banana chips. Stir to blend. Spoon dough into 2 (6-inch) round mounds or 4 (4-inch) round mounds. Place dough mounds onto cookie sheet. Bake in oven 25-30 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Allow to cool 10 minutes. Makes 8-12.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch pie dish. In a food processor combine the pecans, coconut and butter until well ground together. Press mixture into pie dish and bake for 10 minutes. Cool completely. In a large bowl combine the cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk until well blended. Fold in the Cool Whip topping and spread on top of pecan crust. Refrigerate until serving time. Garnish with ice cream topping and caramel topping just before serving.

Combine all the dry rub ingredients in a small bowl. Mix well. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Heat 2 tablespoons of the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Season both sides of the chops with the rub. Cook for about 3 to 4 minutes per side or until the pork chops are browned. Pour the remaining vegetable oil in a shallow dish. Place the pork chops in the dish and turn to coat. Place the pork chops in a shallow roasting pan. Place the pan in the oven and cook for about 30 minutes or until the pork chops are cooked through.

Cut fennel into long strips or quarter and toss with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, garlic, salt and pepper. Grill for about five minutes until browned on both sides and tender. Serve hot or cold. Serves four as a side dish.

Combine yogurt, honey and cumin in a small bowl and mix well. Cut cucumber into 1/8 inch thick slices. Arrange in a single layer on a platter and drizzle with dressing. Garnish with coriander. Serve immediately.

Cream together butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla. Add dry ingredients. Stir in chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 8-10 minutes at 375. Cool 2 minutes. Remove from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Store in tightly covered containers. Makes about 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 inch bread pan or 3 8-inch square pans. Cream together 1/2 cup butter and sugar. Beat in egg. Add flour, baking soda and salt, mixing well. Stir in bananas. Blend in milk. Stir in walnuts if desired. Pour into pans and bake for 30 minutes. Cool in pan 10 minutes before removing from pan to finish cooling.
Add sour cream to fruit and stir to mix well. Add marshmallows to fruit salad and stir until well mixed. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 400f. Coat a large baking sheet with cooking spray. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cilantro and cook, stirring frequently, until the garlic is golden brown, about 1 minute. Add the fries and season with salt. Cook the fries, stirring frequently, until they are crisp. Transfer the fries to the baking sheet and bake until crisp again. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 13x9 pan, set aside. In a small bowl, combine 2 Tbsp. Butter, garlic powder and lime juice. In the prepared pan, place the fillets in a single layer. Pour the garlic/lime mixture over the fish, cover the pan tightly with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for another 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Cook hash browns in a skillet over medium heat in 1 tablespoon oil until browned. Break into bite-size pieces. Layer one half of hash browns and ham in a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with half of the cheese. Repeat the layering. In a large bowl combine milk, soup and mustardmix well. In a small bowl combine the egg substitute and pepper. Add to milk mixture. Pour over casserole. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 425f. Place potato wedges on foil lined sheet and season with salt, pepper, red pepper flakes. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 25 minutes or until crispy. Garnish with fresh flat leaf parsley.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a small bowl. Rub both sides of chicken with half of marinade. Reserve remaining marinade. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil to panswirl to coat. Add chicken to pancook 3 minutes on each side or until a thermometer registers 165 degrees in center of thickest piece. Transfer to a serving platter. Combine reserved marinade and hot sauce in a small bowldrizzle over chicken. Garnish with green onions. Serve.

Combine flour, baking powder and salt in a mixing bowl and set aside. Beat soymilk and peanut butter together and add to dry ingredients. Mash banana and add to mixture. Stir in brown sugar. Heat nonstick skillet over medium heat and spray with cooking spray. Pour about 1/4 cup batter onto skillet and make 4 3 inch rounds. Flip when the bubbles start to form. Serve warm.

Pulse cashews in a food processor until they are finely ground. Add the sugar and salt and pulse a few times more. Add the lemon zest and juice and pulse. Taste and add more salt or lemon as needed. Store in an airtight container. Will keep for up to 1 week.

Brown beef and drain. Add onion, bell pepper and garlic cloves. Saute until tender. Stir in tomatoes, whole kernel corn and tomato sauce. Simmer, stirring occasionally 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add macaroni, parsley, salt and pepperstir until macaroni is completely coated with sauce. Simmer until macaroni is tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Serve hot

Heat orange juice in a saucepan with cinnamon sticks. Remove cinnamon sticks and add pure vanilla extract. Cool mixture. Dip scoops of vanilla ice cream into mixture. Drizzle with orange juice. Serve immediately.

Remove giblets from the inside of the chickens. Rinse the chickens and pat dry inside and out. Make a few cuts in the skin of the chicken to allow fat to escape. Rub the chicken with olive oil, inside and out. Squeeze the juice of 1 lemon over each chicken. Add the chicken to a large roasting pan and sprinkle with the paprika and oregano. Rub the chicken with the lemon slices and drizzle the juice of 2 more lemons over the chicken. Stuff each chicken with 1/2 of the onion. Place the chicken in the oven and roast for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until the juices run clear.

Peel onions. Slice cucumbers into 1/4 inch rounds. Thinly slice onion. In saucepan over high heat combine water, vinegar and sugar. Bring to boil for 1 minute. Add onion and cucumbers. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Cool. Drain cucumbers and onion. Add dill to vinegar mixture. Pour into sterilized jars. Cap. Refrigerate. Serve. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------.

In a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat, combine the rice with the milk and stir well with a wooden spoon. Add the eggs and sugar and stir until the mixture thickens and coats the back of the spoon. Add the raisins and vanilla and stir well again. Transfer the mixture into a buttered baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the custard is firm. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the top with the nutmeg and serve with whipped cream if desired.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and garliccook 2 minutes or until onion is tender. Stir in vinegarcook 2 minutes or until liquid is evaporated. Stir in tomatoes and zucchinicook 4 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir in beanscook 1 minute or until heated through. Remove skillet from heatstir in breadcrumbscover.Let stand 10 minutes or until breadcrumbs are crisp. Spoon mixture onto crustsprinkle with cheese. Bake at 450 for 5 minutes or until heated through and crumb crust is golden.
In a medium bowl, stir together the yogurt, pudding mix, and water until smooth. Fold in the apple and raisins. Spoon mixture into ice cream cones. Top each serving with the granola cereal.

In a large bowl, combine the sugar, lemon juice, and mint. Toss the peaches in the mixture. Transfer the mixture to a 13x9x2 inch glass baking dish. In another large bowl, combine the cornstarch, orange juice, and margarine. Stir in the flour. Spread the topping over the fruit. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool slightly. Serve with vanilla ice cream.
Add all of the dry ingredients to the water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat for 15 minutes. Add tea and simmer for 15 minutes longer. Strain and add brown sugar and milk to taste.

Combine cream and egg yolks in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Whisk until the mixture thickens and reaches about 160 degrees F. Remove from heatstir in coffee and kahlua, then vanilla extract. Stir in chocolate chips until melted. Allow to cool to room temperature. Refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight. Remove from fridgestir and enjoy! You can make this with milk instead of cream and egg whites instead of yolks for a lower-fat mousse.
To each cup of orange juice add 1/2 cup of pineapple juice and 1 cup of cranberry juice. Add 1/3 cup of lemonade and 1 tsp of water. Stir well. Pour into a bottle and refrigerate until cold.

Melt butter in a medium-sized skillet over medium-low heat. Add flour. Stir and cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Slowly add beef broth and whisk to create a smooth roux. Add the mushrooms and stir to coat them with the roux. Add the cream and whisk to blend. Add the spices and stir. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the breadcrumbs and stir. Transfer the mushroom mixture to an 8-inch square baking pan. Top the mixture with the parmesan cheese. Bake until the top is golden and the cheese has melted and bubbly, 20-25 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

Place ground ham and ground pork in a large mixing bowl. Add breadcrumbs, eggs, milk, brown sugar and dry mustard. Beat until smooth. Stir in vinegar and water. Form mixture into balls and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve on toothpicks or with a dipping sauce. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a shallow dish, mix together the egg, mustard and seasonings. In a separate dish, combine the breadcrumbs and cheese. Dip pork chops into egg mixture and then coat with breadcrumbs. In a large frying pan or skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Cook pork chops about 3 minutes on each side until golden brown and cooked through. Place in an oven proof dish and bake for 10 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes, gravy or vegetables.

Cut the caramels in half or thirds. Melt the sweetened condensed milk and add the caramels. Stir until melted and combined well. Add in the butter and stir until incorporated and smooth. Add in the marshmallows and vanilla extract, stir until melted and combined well. Place the rice cereal in a bowl and pour the mixture over the rice cereal and stir until well coated. Pour into a baking dish and sprinkle the toasted rice cereal and flaked salt evenly over the top of the mixture in the baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until the mixture is bubbly and the rice cereal is golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into pieces with a knife dipped in hot water, then use the toasted rice cereal to push the pieces off the baking dish and onto parchment paper for cooling and serving.

Cook corn in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. Combine all remaining ingredients in a food processor and process until smooth. Gently stir in corn and olives. Chill until serving time. Serve with tortilla chips. Makes 10 cups.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl, mix the egg and banana. Stir in the sour cream. In a medium bowl, stir together the canola oil, vanilla and syrup. Combine the banana mixture and the wet mixture. In another bowl, combine the flour and the baking powder. Add to the banana mixture and mix just until combined. Fold in the chocolate chips and walnuts. Spoon the batter evenly into muffin cups. Bake for 16 to 18 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan. Makes 12 muffins.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion & saute until softened. Add okra & saute for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes, beans & peas. Stir & cover. Cook for 4-5 minutes or until vegetables are done. Season to taste with cajun seasoning, salt & pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. Grease the bottom and sides of the pan with shortening. Mix cake mix, applesauce and eggs. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for 15 minutes. In a large bowl mix mandarin oranges and pineapple. Mix instant pudding and milk together until well blended. Add to fruit mixture and stir until combined. Spread over cake. Let stand for 1 hour. Spread with Cool Whip. Serve.
Combine all wet ingredients. Add to dry ingredients. Mix until just combined. Pour into a 9-inch greased baking pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Cool on rack. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Preheat grill for high heat. Thread shrimp on skewers. Brush shrimp and pineapple slices with canola oil. Grill for 2 minutes on each side. Remove shrimp and pineapple slices. Grill bacon slices until crisp. Place one slice of bacon on each shrimp/pineapple skewer. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350F. Spray baking dish with nonstick spray and set aside. Rinse shrimp and pat dry with paper towel. Spread shrimp out on baking dish and sprinkle with seasonings. Mix parsley and lemon juice together and pour over shrimp. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or until shrimp are pink and curled. Serve with lemon wedges and garlic toast.

Place chicken in a baking dish and pat dry with a paper towel. Season the chicken with the butter, lemon juice, oregano, rosemary and sage. Rub mixture all over chicken. Season with salt and pepper. Cover dish with foil and bake for 45 minutes. Remove foil, baste chicken with pan drippings. Continue to bake for another 10 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve hot with potatoes or rice.

In a bowl, beat the creamy peanut butter until smooth. Mix together the honey, vanilla ice cream, and the creamy peanut butter until smooth. Spread the ice cream mixture into the pie crust, and smooth it out until it is even. Press the peanut butter cookie into the ice cream mixture. Chill the pie for 1 hour or until it is set. Before serving, drizzle the pie with the chocolate syrup and top with whipped cream.

Heat grapeseed oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and cook 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Add carrots and green onions and cook 3 minutes or until potatoes are tender-crisp. Stir in goat cheese and tomatoescook 2 minutes or until heated through, stirring frequently. Cook eggs in same skillet over medium heat until whites are setremove from skillet. Top hash brown mixture evenly with egg whites. Sprinkle with black pepper and serve immediately.

Blend cream cheese and tuna until smooth. Add onions and capers. Stir in worcestershire sauce. Add mayonnaise and mix well. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Add chopped nuts. Serve on miniature party rye rounds or seedless cucumber slices. Garnish with dill weed.
Slice cucumbers and onions. Combine all ingredients in a bowl and chill for several hours. Drain. Add more mayo to dressing and serve.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring the chicken broth to a boil. Add the spinach leaves and simmer for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and simmer for 1 minute. Divide the mixture among four bowls and sprinkle each serving with 1 teaspoon parmesan cheese.

In a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, tomatoes, capers, red pepper flakes, vinegar, and bread. Toast on each side until slightly brown. Spread the pesto sauce on both sides of the bread. Top each slice of bread with the tomato mixture. Sprinkle with the cheese. Place the sandwiches on the broiler pan and broil until the cheese is melted and slightly browned. Cut the sandwiches into four pieces. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375. Coat a 9-inch pie plate with cooking spray and line with aluminum foil. Combine peppers, garlic, vinegar and 1 tablespoon of the sugar in a food processor. Pulse until peppers are coarsely chopped. Transfer to prepared dish and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 tablespoon of sugar and raisins. Bake for 30 minutes. Stir in ginger. Bake for 10 minutes longer. Cool completely. Spread in a serving dish and cover. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Makes 3 cups.
Place peas in a large bowl. Add onions and curry powdertoss lightly. Chill for at least 1 hour. Garnish with almonds. Yields about 4 servings.

In a large heavy saucepan bring the potatoes and brown sugar to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the butter, bourbon and vanilla and cook over moderate heat until the potatoes are just tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in the nutmeg and cinnamon. Transfer the potatoes to a large shallow baking dish and bake for about 20 minutes, or until golden and crisp. Serve at room temperature.

In a small bowl, combine oil and vinegar. Cut bread into cubes. In a large bowl combine bread cubes and tomatoes. Toss together. Add cucumber, olives and feta cheese. Pour oil and vinegar mixture over top. Toss again. Chill. Just before serving, add basil. Toss again.
Blend all ingredients together in a small blender or food processor until smooth. Chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 9 x 13-inch baking dish combine spaghetti, cheeses, chicken broth, mushroom soup, tomatoes and garlic. Bake 20 minutes. Remove from oven. In a small bowl combine oil and onion. Toss with chicken. Top spaghetti mixture with chicken. Bake 20 minutes longer or until bubbly. Serve with lettuce.

Cook squash in boiling water until tender but not mushy, about 12 minutes. Drain and cool slightly. In a large skillet heat 2 tablespoons of the oil. Add shallot and saute until translucent but not brown, about 2 minutes. Add green beans and saute for 1 minute. Add sage and thyme and cook for 1 minute more. Add the rice and saute until lightly toasted and fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in the squash and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes more. Season with the salt and pepper and drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon of oil. Makes 4 servings.

In saucepan combine zucchini and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil and stir until mixture is reduced by half. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice. Stir in gelatin until dissolved. Chill until slightly thick. Stir in crushed pineapple. Transfer to container and store in refrigerator. Makes 4 cups.

In skillet over medium heat, saute the chops in oil and butter until browned. Add rosemary and pepper. Turn and brown other side, then add red wine vinegar and merlot. Cover and cook for 25 minutes over medium-low heat or until tender. Remove cover and turn up heat for 15 minutes until wine has reduced and is thick and syrupy. Serve over rice or noodles and garnish with parsley.
Drain canned artichoke hearts. Place drained artichokes in food processor. Pulse several times. Add mayonnaise, cheese, garlic, salt. Pepper. Pulse until smooth. Serve with crackers.

In a small mixing bowl combine milk and pudding. Blend well. Add water and mix until smooth. Chill for at least an hour. Beat with a mixer until creamy. Fold in whipped topping. Layer into serving dish with bananas and wafer cookies. Chill overnight for best flavor.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large heavy duty roasting pan or crockpot, place potatoes and onion. In medium bowl, combine flour, mustard and paprika. Dust roast with flour mixture. In separate bowl, combine beef broth, chili sauce and worcestershire. Place roast and marinade in crockpot. If roasting, pour marinade over roast. Bake for 2-3 hours or until roast is tender. If slow cooking, cover and cook on low for 8 hours or until roast is tender. Remove roast and keep warm. Stir potatoes and onion. Add vinegar and sugar and stir to combine. Pour gravy over roast and serve with potatoes and onion. Serves 6-8

Cook linguine according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, melt butter over medium heat. Add flour and cook for 30 seconds. Add evaporated milk, and cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in gorgonzola. Season to taste. Serve over pasta.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook pasta until al dente. Drain. In a large skillet cook the broccoli rabe and garlic in the oil until crisp-tender. Drain. Add the broth and cook 5 minutes. Add the pasta and cook 2 minutes. Add the sausage and cook 3 minutes. Add the butter and Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8×4 inch (2 liter) loaf pan. Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onioncook until softened and slightly browned, about 15 minutes. Set aside to cool while you prepare the bread dough. In a large bowl, mix together the plain flour, rye flour, yeast, and salt. In another bowl, combine milk and remaining butterheat over medium heat until butter is melted. Let mixture cool slightly before adding to flour mixture. Beat at medium speed until well mixed, adding egg yolks one at a time. Beat until dough is smoothabout 3 to 4 minutes. Beat in cheddar cheese until well blended. Cover the doughlet rise until doubled in size, about an hour. Punch down the doughdivide into two portions. Knead each portion into a ballflatten each into an approximate 5×9 inch (13×23 cm) rectangle. Place one portion of

Put 1 cup rice in a bowl. Add 1 1/2 cups water. Mix with a fork. Heat a medium saucepan over high heat. Add 1/2 teaspoon of oil. Swirl to coat bottom of pan. Add rice mixture. Turn heat down to medium and cover. Cook for 20 minutes. Remove lid and turn heat up. Continue to cook and stir until all water is absorbed. Turn off heat and let stand for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Tasty with any curry. Serve with grated carrot and cucumber.

Skewer pineapple with metal skewers and grill over a high heat until slightly charred on the outside and soft on the inside. Cut the pineapple in half to serve with maple syrup, brown sugar and cinnamon sprinkled over the top. Serve with whipped cream if desired.

In a small bowl, combine the orange zest and juice. Place the salmon in a shallow dish. Spread the orange mixture evenly over the salmon. Sprinkle with the sage. Add the butter. Crumble the garlic over the salmon. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 30 minutes or until the fish is cooked through.
Beat milk until frothy. Beat in pudding mix and vanilla. Serve cold with nutmeg sprinkled on top.

Place beans in a large saucepan. Add cold water to cover by about 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium low. Simmer until beans are very tender, about 3 hours. Drain beans, reserving liquid. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large Dutch oven or soup pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion and saute until translucent. Add garlic cloves and saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in beans, liquid, tomato sauce, sugar, smoked paprika, cinnamon, chipotle chiles, vinegar, soy sauce and cayenne pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and bake in oven until thickened. Serve in bowls. Yields about 6 servings.
Mix together cabbage and butter until tender and lightly browned in large skillet over medium heat. Mix in lemon juice and dill weed. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cut carrots in half lengthwise and boil in a saucepan of water for about 5 minutes or until tender. Drain in a colander and rinse under cold water. Place carrots in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine lemon juice, sugar, soy sauce and dark sesame oil. Pour over carrots and toss well. Sprinkle with parsley.

Combine cucumbers, onions and salt in a bowl and stir until well mixed. Place in a crock. Pour vinegar mixture over the cucumber mixture. Cover and let stand in a cool place for 24 hours, stirring every 3 hours. Drain liquid. Pour back over the cucumbers. Add sugar, turmeric, celery seeds and mustard seeds. Let stand in a cool place for about 1 week, stirring at least once a day. Drain and store in a glass jar. Yield: about 3 quarts.

Soak the leaves of the mint sprig in a glass or jar filled with sugar and water overnight. Add the tea bags, lemon, mint sprig, and bourbon to the jar or glass and stir well to combine. Allow to steep overnight. Pour over ice cubes in a tall glass, garnish with mint sprigs and serve.
Melt butter over low heat. Add tarragon, parsley and lemon rind. Cook until fragrant. Add asparagus and cook until just tender. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in the flour and cook until the mixture is slightly brown in color, about 2 minutes. Slowly add the milk while whisking constantly until smooth. Add the corn and all other ingredients and cook over medium heat until hot and bubbly, about 5-6 minutes. Serve warm with freshly ground pepper.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Drain fat and cut into small pieces. Dice venison steak into 1/4 inch cubes. Peel and dice onions. In 9x13 inches casserole dish, layer potatoes, onions, bacon pieces and venison pieces in that order. Sprinkle with seasoning salt and worcestershire sauce. Drizzle with cream-style corn. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. Remove from oven and stir lightly. Add sugar and return to oven for another 10 minutes, or until bacon is crisp. Serve with hot rolls.

Cut chicken into bite size pieces. Boil macaroni for 8 minutes. Drain. Cut pepper and onion into bite size pieces. Combine chicken, dressing mix, mayonnaise and macaroni. Add pepper and onion. Refrigerate until serving time.

Sprinkle chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Melt margarine in saucepan. Add chicken breasts. Saute in margarine until browned. Stir in soup and sherry. Heat until bubbling. Pour over chicken breasts. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve over hot rice.

Cook rice in water and salt for about 25 minutes or until all of the liquid is absorbed. Drain rice in a colander. Return rice to pan. Add milk, sugar and cinnamon. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until hot but not boiling. Serve warm as a side dish. 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12x8x2 inch pan. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. Beat butter and brown sugar until creamy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then beat in vanilla. Slowly beat in flour mixture. Spread mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle toffee pieces and pecans over mixture while still warm. Bake for 5 minutes more. Sprinkle with chocolate chips before serving.
Dice cucumber. Combine remaining ingredients in a blender. Process until smooth. Serve gyros on pita bread. Top with cucumber sauce.

In medium saucepan over medium heat, heat broth and red onion until heated through, about 2 minutes. Add beans and cocoa and stir until cocoa dissolves. Add remaining spices and stir until well mixed and heated through. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes about 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet, and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of butter. Roast for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and add tomatoes and sun-dried tomatoes. Sprinkle with remaining tablespoon of butter, then top with mozzarella cheese. Return to oven for 2-3 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Mix soup and water until smooth. Add milk and flour until smooth. Dip pork chops in batter and fry until browned. Put in crock pot and cover with soup mixture. Cook on high for 2 hours or low 4 hours. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. In medium bowl, beat cream cheese and almond extract with an electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Beat in granulated sugar and lemon juice until blended. Beat in egg and mix well. In large bowl combine blueberry muffin mix and buttermix well. Reserve 1 cup of mixture. Press remaining mixture firmly in bottom of prepared pan. Spread cheese mixture over top. Sprinkle with nuts. Combine reserved muffin mixture with cinnamonsprinkle evenly over cheese layer. Bake for 55 to 60 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 15 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack. Makes one loaf.

Peel the lemons and remove pips. Cut into slices and remove seeds. Cover lemons in water. Boil lemons for 30 mins. Squeeze out excess liquid. Chop lemons into small pieces. Mix all other ingredients together. Add lemons. Leave in fridge for 4 hours. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f in a medium bowl, combine flour, cocoa powder and baking soda. Mix thoroughly. Add honey and butter. Stir until mixture is smooth and begins to pull away from the side of the bowl. Add chocolate kisses and mix until combined. Place in refrigerator for 30 minutes to harden slightly. Scoop by the tablespoon with a cookie scoop and roll into a ball. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes, until edges are firm and tops are still slightly soft. Cool for 3 minutes on cookie sheet then transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Once cooled, roll in candy sprinkles. Store in an airtight container. Makes 12 cookies.

Add the meatballs and beef broth to the crockpot. Stir in the diced tomatoes and cook until the meatballs are cooked through and the mixture is thickened, about 2 hours. In a small bowl combine the potato and the frozen vegetables. Add them to the crockpot and stir gently to combine with the meatballs and broth. Cook for another hour or so until the vegetables are cooked through and the meatballs are warm. Serve hot with the parmesan cheese sprinkled on top.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a heavy saucepan melt sugar and butter over medium heat. Stir in 1/4 cup water and cook, stirring constantly until mixture comes to a boil and mixture begins to turn a light brown. Remove from heat. Arrange pears in a 1 quart baking dish. Pour sauce over pears. Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour or until pears are tender. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350. Line baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mat. In a large bowl combine flour, cocoa, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In a mixer bowl combine butter and both sugars. Add vanilla extract. Add eggs one at a time beating after each addition. On low speed gradually add the flour mixture until a dough forms. Fold in the semi-sweet chocolate chips. Roll into 1-inch balls and place on prepared baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 10-12 minutes. Cool for 1 minute on the baking sheet then transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 2 1/2 dozen.

Mix heavy cream and condensed milk in a pan on low heat for 10-15 minutes. Now add bread and mix well. Set it in freezer for 30 minutes. After this blend it in a blender with ice cubes and make a smooth mixture. Add badam powder and mix well. Now pour this mixture in serving glasses and freeze it for few hours before serving. Top it with badam and pista powder.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil, garlic and red pepper flakes until garlic is golden brown, about 2 minutes. Add couscous and cook for another minute, stirring constantly. Add capers and cook another minute. Add red wine and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cover. Cook for 10 minutes or until most of liquid has been absorbed. Stir in salt and pepper and serve.

In a small bowl dissolve jell-o in boiling water. Stir in cranberry sauce. Chill until partially set. Fold in crushed pineapple and juices. Pour into a 9x13x2 inch dish. Refrigerate until firm. Top with whipped topping and walnuts. To serve: Spread a small amount of whipped topping on a lettuce leaf. Top with salad. Roll up and serve.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Beat at medium speed with an electric mixer for 1 minute. Add fruitstir just until combined. Pour into an 8 inch square baking dish. Bake at 375 degrees f for 40 to 45 minutes until golden. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 220 degrees C/gas 7. Line 2 baking sheets with baking paper. Place the apple pie filling in a bowl and add the peaches and caster sugar, stirring to combine. Heat a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat, add the olive oil flavored cooking spray and swirl to coat the base of the pan. Add the apple peach mixture and spread evenly across the pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and leave to cool for 2-3 minutes. Lightly brush the bottom of a muffin case with the beaten egg and place the shortcrust pastry into the case. Spoon a tablespoon of apple peach mixture into the centre of each case. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown. Cool for a few minutes before serving with double cream.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pork, noodles, corn and pimiento. Stir to combine. Pour in soup and heat through. Transfer to 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes until hot and bubbly. Serve immediately. Serves 2.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the asparagus in the butter and oil until just tender. Remove from heat and set aside. In the same skillet, saute the onion in the remaining fat for about 1 minute. Add the ham and saute until heated through. Add the cooked pasta to the ham mixtureheat through. Add the asparagus, heavy cream, parsley, salt and pepper. Cook for about 1 minute longer, stirring constantly. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Spread both sides of bread with mayonnaise. Spread one side with prepared mustard. Lay down 2 slices bacon & 2 slices salami. Next layer with american cheese slices. Add a generous amount of lettuce & tomato slices & top off with the other bread slice & press down gently to hold together.

Mix butter and powdered sugar with mixer until light and fluffy. Add the creme de menthe and beat until light and creamy. Add the pecans and beat well. Chill. Roll in balls and roll in melted chocolate. Sprinkle with chopped nuts and allow to cool. Roll in powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place asparagus in a single layer in a glass 9×13 inch baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with seasoning salt and ground black pepper. Bake uncovered for 12 minutes, or until tender crisp. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and return to oven for 1 minute more. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Prepare the beans by rinsing them well in cold water. Place them in a large pot with the bacon. Pour in enough water to cover the beans by 3 inches. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 40 minutes. Skim the foam from the top as necessary. Add the carrot, celery and onion. Simmer for another 30 minutes or until the beans are tender. Add the mutton. Continue to simmer for another 30 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve the soup with hot crusty bread.

In a heavy skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add onion & cook until soft & translucent stirring often. Add garlic & cook another minute or two. Add apricots & raisins & cook until dried fruit is soft & plump stirring often. Remove from heat. Season with salt & pepper & sprinkle with cinnamon. Stir in broth & simmer for about 10 minutes. Add cooked rice & stir until heated through. Serve garnished with cilantro sprigs & lemon slices if desired.

In a large saucepan combine rice mix and 4 cups water. Cook 40 minutes, until tender. Combine cooked chicken, chicken broth, soy sauce, stuffing mix, butter, and 4 cups water. Stir well. Heat to boiling. Remove from heat. Combine rice mixture with sauce. Spread into a greased 9×13 casserole dish. Top with the rest of the stuffing mix. Bake 45 minutes at 350. Garnish with water chestnuts.

Mix together eggs, half-and-half, sugar and nutmeg in a large bowl. Refrigerate overnight. When ready to cook, preheat skillet over medium heat. Spray with cooking spray. Dip slices of french bread into egg mixture. Place in skillet. Cook 2-3 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Remove from skillet. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve with maple syrup.

In a large bowl, beat eggs until foamy. Gradually add sugar, salt and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Stir in corn syrup and melted butter. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 325 degrees. Bake for 1 hour. Sprinkle top of pie with pecans. Bake for an additional 15 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack.

Mix soup and milk together. Add frozen broccoli and mix thoroughly. In a greased 9 by 13 inch pan add half of the mixture. Spread cheddar cheese over the top of the broccoli. Add the remaining broccoli mixture and top with cheddar cheese. Combine remaining soup mix and water to make a thick paste. Spread over the casserole. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. In the last 3 minutes of cooking add water chestnuts. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a saucepan melt the butter. Add the celery and onion and saute until tender but not brown. Add the turkey and stir until heated through. Add the water and the turkey gravy mix and stir well. Heat through and stir occasionally until the mixture is thickened and bubbly. Add the milk and stir until thickened. Add the flour and salt and stir until the mixture is thickened and bubbly.

In a small saucepan heat the butter over medium heat until it melts. Stir in the flour and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat add cheese stirring constantly until melted. Transfer to a small bowl. Stir in the cayenne pepper. Add the rice krispies stirring until coated. Shape into small balls. Place on a wax paper covered cookie sheet. Refrigerate 30 minutes or until firm.

Combine all ingredients except peanut oil in large bowl. Mix well. Add water 1 tbsp at time, adding just enough to make a workable mixture that will stick to beef. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Heat peanut oil in deep fryer to 350 degrees f. Form beef strips into 1/4 inch thick steaks. Drop in hot oil for 3-5 minutes or until golden brown and crisp. Serve immediately with barbecue sauce.

Dry fish fillets with paper towel. Heat oil in nonstick skillet. Sprinkle flour on fishdredge both sides in flour, shaking off excess. Place fish in skillet and cook about 3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Remove fish from pan and drain well. Mix lemon rind with dried thymesprinkle fillets with mixture. Place fish on a baking sheetbrush both sides with lemon juice. Bake uncovered in 400-degree oven for 5 to 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork.

Spread each side of bread with mayonnaise. Top the bottom half of the bread with roast beef, pesto sauce, and roasted red peppers. Sprinkle a bit of the red pepper mixture over top of sandwich. Place lettuce and greens on top of the sandwich. Sprinkle feta cheese on top of the lettuce and greens. Add the top slice of bread and cut diagonally into 4 triangles. Serve immediately.

Mix wine, coriander seeds and bay leaf in a large glass dish. Add in meat in an even layer, then cover with plastic wrap. Marinate in refrigerator 24 hours. Remove meat from marinade, reserving marinade in a large saucepan. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook meat 3 to 5 minutes per side until lightly browned all over. Transfer to slow cooker and add reserved marinade. Cook on high 6 to 7 hours until meat is tender enough to be pulled apart using two forks. Serve in flour tortillas with fresh lime wedges if desired.

Prepare rice according to directions on package. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add green onions. Add garlic flakes, garlic salt and pepper to taste. Add rice to saucepan. Toss rice mixture. Remove from heat.

Preheat grill to medium high heat. Slice garlic clove and place on grill for 1-2 minutes. Grill salmon for about 4 minutes per side or until done to your liking. Once salmon is cooked through remove from grill and place on a plate. Slice a lime into wedges and squeeze over the cooked salmon. Place garlic on top of salmon. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mix 4 tbsp butter with 1 tbsp lime zest and 1 tbsp cilantro. Spread mixture over the salmon and serve with grilled asparagus and salad.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Drizzle salmon with olive oil and place in an oven safe dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until done and flake. Place baby spinach in a serving dish. Top with tomatoes, goat cheese and pecans. Drizzle with vinaigrette. Serve salmon over spinach and enjoy!

Heat milk and herbs in saucepan over medium heat until bubbly and steaming. Remove from heat and add flour a little at a time stirring until smooth and thickened. Add cheese and stir until melted. Pour into sauce boat and garnish with parsley. Serve with vegetables, pasta or bread.

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine olive oil and garlic in a large bowl. Add spaghetti and mix well. Spread spaghetti mixture on a foil-lined baking sheet. Sprinkle with cheese and bake 10-15 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Serves 8.

Place beef roast into slow cooker. Pour onion and vegetable juice over top of beef. Add gravy mix and garlic. Cook on low for 8-10 hours or on high for 6-7 hours. Add pepper and thyme and continue cooking for an additional hour. Carve beef into slices and serve.

In a Dutch oven, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and set aside. Add the yellow onion to bacon drippings in pan. Saute for 2 minutes or until the onions are tender. Stir in the black beans and chicken broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until the flavors blend. In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese and milk. Stir into the black bean mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle the soup into bowls. Top with the low-fat sour cream and the chives. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, mix 3 cups water and 1 cup sugar. Slowly stir in cream of tartar. Pour into a 2 quart greased baking dish. Set aside. Crush crackers in a blender. In a large bowl, combine crumb crumbs and 1/4 cup butter. Press crumb mixture over the top of the water mixture. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup water with the lemon juice and cinnamon. Pour over hot crust. Bake for an additional 5 minutes. Cool slightly and cut into slices. Top with whipped topping or ice cream. Makes 8 servings.
In a large skillet, melt butter with apple slices. Add honey and cook for 5 minutes. Add yogurt and cook over low heat for 2-3 minutes more. Serve warm.

Toast 2 slices of bread. Spread cream cheese on each slice. Top with 1/4 avocado and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle with 1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil and 1 tsp hot sauce. Melt in microwave until cheese is warm and avocado is soft. Serve immediately.

Place chicken thighs in a single layer on the bottom of a 5-quart slow cooker. In a small bowl combine lime juice and chicken broth. Add garlic cloves and thyme. Bring to boil. Pour over chicken. Cook on high for 3 hours. In another saucepan saute garlic and butter over medium heat. Stir constantly until garlic is golden. Spoon over chicken. Cook 2 hours longer on high. Add rice. Cook an additional 30 minutes. Serve with lime.

Cut up chicken breast into small cubes. Chop up bell pepper and onion. Heat barbecue sauce in a pan. Add chicken and bell pepper and onion. Add cooked rice. Heat until hot. Spread out a little bit on a tortilla. Sprinkle some cheddar cheese on top. Roll up and cut into small pieces. Serve hot.

In a bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press mixture into 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Meanwhile in a blender combine applesauce, sweetened condensed milk, eggs and lemon juice. Beat until smooth. Pour mixture over crust. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool. Chill.
Cook ground beef with taco seasoning and tomato sauce. Add egg noodles and heat through. Top with sharp cheddar cheese and bake until cheese is melted.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish, and sprinkle with the salt, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, oregano and thyme. Sprinkle with chili powder and pepper. Pour the chicken broth into the bottom of a roasting pan. Arrange the chicken breasts in the pan. Bake until the juices run clear when the meat is pierced with a fork, about 1 hour. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with rice and vegetables.

Rinse chicken quarters. Coat each quarter with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Combine rosemary, garlic, and lemon juice to make rub. Rub chicken quarters with rub. Place the quarters on a baking sheet. Bake 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine jam and mustard. Remove chicken from oven. Brush with glaze. Return to oven. Cook 15-20 minutes longer or until done. Serve with more glaze.
