Cool and dust with confectioners sugar.

Brown bacon and ground beef over medium heat in a Dutch oven. Add onion and cook until tender. Add remaining ingredients and simmer covered for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Bake uncovered for 1 hour at 350 degrees.

Heat butter in skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken and cook for 12-15 minutes or until chicken is browned on all sides and cooked through. Remove from skillet and chop into bite-size pieces. Combine chicken, celery, onions, and walnuts in bowl. Add yogurt and stir gently to combine. Add lemon juice and mango chutney to taste and mix well. Refrigerate for several hours before serving. Garnish with additional chopped walnuts if desired. Serve on toasted bread or crackers.

In a large bowl combine the whole wheat flour, baking powder and brown sugar. Stir until blended. Add the quick oats and oats. Mix until blended. In a small bowl combine the egg substitute and milk. Stir until blended. Add to flour mixture. Stir until just moistened. Fold in the dried apricot halves and sunflower seeds. Spray a 13" x 9" baking dish with vegetable cooking spray. Spread mixture in the dish. Bake at 350 for 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Cut into bars. Makes 16 servings.

Separate dough into 4 biscuits. Bake according to package directions. In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Split biscuits. Fill with cheese mixture. Bake 10 minutes or until browned. Serve warm.

Shave the carrots into thin slices. Heat the oil in a wok or frying pan. Add the mustard seeds and cilantro stems and saute for about 15 seconds until the mustard seeds begin to pop. Add the carrots and saute for about 30 seconds more, just until they are barely wilted. Add the red pepper strips and cashews, saute for another 15 seconds, add the salt, mix well, and serve immediately.

Remove seeds and slice cucumber lengthwise and thinly into 3 inch pieces. In a small bowl stir together vinegar, soy sauce and hot pepper sauce and set aside. In a large bowl whisk together oil and brown sugar until combined and set aside. In a large skillet heat vegetable oil until hot. Add carrots and radishes and stir-fry over high heat until crisp-tender. Drain on paper towels and set aside. Combine carrots and radishes with cucumber and onion in a large bowl. Pour oil mixture over vegetables and toss gently. Toss in sesame oil and soy mixture. Let stand 15 minutes or so before serving.

In a slow cooker combine beef and soy sauce. Add garlic and ginger. Stir together and cook for 8 hours on low heat or 4 hours on high heat. Add cornstarch dissolved in water and stir to combine. Stir in the sesame oil and let cook for 10 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Serve beef slices with rice.

Brown ground beef with onion and garlic salt. Drain. Add tomato soup and olives. Stir in oregano and sweet basil. Bake hoagie rolls in oven until crisp. Remove from oven and spoon meat mixture on top. Sprinkle with cheese. Return to oven for 10 minutes. Serves 6.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add beef to skillet and brown. Remove from skillet. Add onion and bell pepper to skillet and saut until tender-crisp. Add mushrooms, garlic, tomato paste and cook for 2 to 3 minutes stirring frequently. Add tomato sauce to skillet and mix well. Stir in chili sauce. Pour over cooked pasta in a large serving dish. Serve with Italian or French bread.

In a small skillet, saut the apples in 1/2 tbsp of the margarine over medium heat for 3-5 minutes or until browned. Drain the greens and place in a large skillet with remaining margarine. Saut over medium heat until greens are wilted. Stir in apples. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with wax paper. Unroll bacon and drape over wooden skewers. Bake for 15 minutes in preheated oven, or until crisp. In a double boiler over medium heat, combine chocolate chips and shortening and stir until smooth. Dip each piece of bacon into chocolate and place on prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with apple chips and nuts.

Combine soy sauce, sesame oil and sugar in a bowl. Add garlic and mix well. Add black pepper and green onions and mix well. Marinate beef in the mixture for at least one hour in the refrigerator. Thread beef onto skewers. Arrange on a broiling pan in a single layer. Broil on high heat for about 2 minutes on each side until meat is cooked through. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and serve.

Sift flour, baking powder and sugar together. Add butter and rub in with hands. Add egg and milk and mix to form a soft dough. Knead lightly, then shape into small balls. Cut each ball in half with a sharp knife. Heat a lightly greased frying pan until very hot, place balls into pan, flatten slightly with spoon. Cook until golden brown, turn and brown other side. Serve hot with butter or jam.

Season chicken breast with seasoning and place in hot oil in 10-inch skillet over med-high heatcook 3 minutes per side or until done. Remove from pan and allow to cool slightlycut into bite size pieces and set aside. In same skillet place mushrooms over med-low heatsaute 3 minutes or until they begin to release their liquid. Add chicken broth and cook 2 minutesadd cream cheesestir until melted and smoothadd chicken and mix welltop with muenster cheese and gently stir until meltedserve with sliced baguette and salad.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease one 12x8 inch baking pan. In a small bowl, combine the cheddar cheese and scallions. Beat the butter in a medium bowl until fluffy. Beat in the scallion mixture. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, kosher salt, and black pepper. Beat the flour mixture into the butter mixture. Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Cut into squares.

Beat butter and peanut butter together till smooth. Add vanilla. Gradually beat in powdered sugar till smooth. Stir in chocolate chips and roll into 1 inch balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Store in refrigerator.

Spread dressing onto both sides of bread slices. Arrange lettuce, red onion, peppers, ham, salami, provolone cheese, and pepperoncinis in layers on bottom half of each bread slice. Cover with other slice of bread. Cut sandwich into six wedges.

Mix cottage cheese and green chili in a bowl. Add egg yolk, salt and black pepper. Knead to make a soft dough. Divide dough into 6-7 equal parts. Roll each part into a ball, flatten it and then roll it into a small circle of 3-4 inches in diameter. Place a portion of the filling on each circle and bring the edges together from three sides, making triangular samosas. Heat oil in a frying pan, fry samosas for 4-5 minutes on each side or till golden brown. Serve hot with tomato sauce.

In bowl of bread maker, combine 2 cups flour, water, jalapeno cheddar cheese, smoked paprika, garlic clove, sugar and salt. Add active dry yeast to the center of the mixture. Do not stir. Select the basic setting on your bread machine. When machine is done, let bread rest for 10 minutes then remove from pan.

Saute bacon. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Add onion, green pepper and cook an additional 2 minutes. In a large bowl combine eggs, milk and seasonings. Pour over vegetables and stir just until well blended. Pour into greased 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean. Sprinkle with cheese. Makes 8 servings.

In a Dutch oven, saute the sofrito with the oil and ham over medium heat. Add the beans and sazon. Stir well. Add the tomato sauce, water and olives. Bring to a boil over high heat. Lower heat and simmer over low heat for 30 minutes.

Cut bread in half and spread with softened butter. Cover with breadcrumbs, then cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Melt butter in saucepan. Add shrimp and saute 2 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and saute 2 minutes. Spoon over toast.

In a large skillet, saute sausage and potatoes in oil until sausage is no longer pink. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat eggs with cheese, salt and pepper. Pour over sausage mixture. Cook in a preheated oven on broiler pan until lightly browned on top and eggs are set. Top with tomatoes and green onions. Serve immediately.

To make the crust, combine all crust ingredients and press into a 9-inch pie pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool completely. In a small saucepan, combine all filling ingredients and stir over low heat until thick and smooth. Pour filling into the prepared crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes or until set. Let cool. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before cutting. Garnish with chopped pecans.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Butter an 8-inch square baking dish. In a large bowl, whisk together buttermilk, mustard and salt and pepper. In a second large bowl, stir together potatoes and onion. Pour buttermilk mixture over potatoes and toss to coat evenly. Transfer mixture to prepared pan. Sprinkle cheese over the top and bake for 50 minutes. Serve hot.

Put 3 cups wine in a large pitcher. Add the rest of the ingredients except for the fruit slices. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Add fruit to pitcher just before serving. Makes 12-16 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Beat butter and granulated sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, salt and vanilla in a small bowl. Beat into the butter mixture. Stir in the chocolate chunks. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Let cool for 2 minutes before removing from the cookie sheets to cool completely.

Cook celery and onion in butter in large skillet until tender. Add rice and continue cooking until rice is golden and crisp. Stir in cornbread, bread cubes, and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 30 minutes. Stir in sage and thyme. Spoon into baking dish. Bake uncovered 15 minutes. Serves 8.

Cook noodles and drain well. In a large skillet, cook ground beef until no longer pinkdrain fat. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Spread into a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese and bake at 375 for 25 minutes or until noodles are tender and cheese is melted. Serve immediately. Makes 8 servings.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Spread on a greased cookie sheet and toast at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Stir after 15 minutes. Store in an airtight container.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat, add onion and cook until tender. Add ground beef and cook until thoroughly cooked and no longer pink. Drain fat and return beef mixture to skillet. Add flour and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add water, salt and pepper, and paprika and cook for several minutes or until mixture thickens and comes to a boil. Reduce heat and add soup. Simmer for several minutes or until heated through and thoroughly combined. Stir in sour cream and heat through. Serve over cooked egg noodles and top with sliced green onions.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine corn and cream in a 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with black pepper. Dot with the butter and crackers. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400. Peel the beetroots and cut into 1/4 inch slices. Toss with olive oil and bake for 20 to 30 minutes until just tender. In a small pan or skillet melt the butter. Add the fresh tarragon and cook for 1 minute or until butter is fragrant. Serve beets with butter. Makes 4 servings.

Combine frozen concentrate with water in a large saucepan. Stir in sugar, cranberries, marmalade, orange juice and orange zest. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until thick. Add allspice and simmer for one minute. Remove from heat. Let stand for 15 minutes. Refrigerate overnight. Yield: approx. 4 cups

Preheat oven to 350. Beat butter and sugar together. Add eggs, one at a time. Beat in vanilla. Add flour and beat until blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until light brown. Cool slightlyremove from pans to cool completely. Makes 3 dozen.

Prepare shirataki noodles according to package directions. Melt the butter in a skillet. Add the onion and pepper. Cook for a minute or two. Add the chicken. Cook until it is no longer pink. Remove from heat. Pour over the sauce. Mix well. Cook the noodles according to package directions. Serve with the chicken mixture over the noodles. Sprinkle with cheese if desired.

Heat water to a boil in a large pot. Add chicken and boil 2 minutes to remove fat. Add soup, bouillon granules, pepper and boil 1 minute. Stir in biscuits, cover and simmer 10 minutes or until biscuits are cooked through. Serve hot.
Peel eggs. Cut eggs into quarters. Place eggs in a medium bowl. Add mayonnaise, mustard, horseradish, salt and cayenne pepper. Mash until well blended. Makes 4 servings.

In a large mixing bowl combine crisp rice cereal and caramel squares. In a microwave safe bowl, melt caramel squares with condensed milk for 2 1/2 minutes. Add marshmallows to mixture of rice cereal and caramel squares. Stir in melted caramel and stir until completely mixed. Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Roll mixture into balls. Store in refrigerator in an air-tight container for up to 2 weeks.

In a large saucepot, combine rice, chicken broth, salsa, salt, pepper, and rice. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until rice is tender and mixture is thick. Add cheesestir until melted.

Melt chocolate over low heat or in microwave. Set aside to cool. In a large bowl, combine shell crumbs with 1/4 cup melted butter. Press onto bottom of pie plate. Bake 10 minutes or just til lightly browned. Cool 30 minutes on a wire rack. In a large bowl, beat eggs til thick and pale yellow. Gradually add remaining melted butter, sugar, corn syrup, vanilla, and salt. Beat well. Stir in chocolate til combined. Spread mixture evenly over crust. Sprinkle pecans over filling. Bake 30 minutes or til filling is set. Cool on wire rack before cutting to serve.

Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic cloves and cook until fragrant and just turning golden brown. Add spinach, chicken stock and beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add tortellini. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add salt and pepper and fresh nutmeg. Ladle into bowls and top with Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Cook chicken in boiling chicken broth for 10-15 minutes. Remove chicken from liquidallow to cool. Combine wild rice and chicken broth in large pot. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Add cornstarch. Stir until mixture thickens. Add half-and-half creamheat through. Add cheese. Stir until cheese is melted. Add chickenheat through. Serve garnished with parsley.

Combine egg beaters egg substitute with Splenda brown sugar blend. In separate bowl combine ginger, cinnamon, allspice, pepper, flour, salt and baking soda. Blend dry ingredients into egg mixture. Stir in nuts. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12-14 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan. Beat egg substitute with evaporated milk until well blended. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add cheddar cheese and stir until melted. Arrange frozen hash browns in the pan. Sprinkle with half the onions, then half the bell peppersprinkle with half the ham. Spread half the egg mixture evenly over all. Repeat layers with remaining ingredients. Cover with foil. Bake at 350F for 45 minutes. Uncoverbake 15 minutes longer or until browned. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

In a large pot over medium-high heat, heat the butter until it begins to brown. Stir in the flour and stir for about 1 minute. Gradually add the broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Simmer until thickened. Add broccoli to soup and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in milk and season with pepper to taste. Stir in cheese until it has melted. Serve immediately.

Bring 2 cups water to a boil. Add carrots, onion, bouillon powder. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in rice. Cook 15 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add broccoli. Cook 5 minutes. Drain salmon. Break apart into small pieces. Mix with soup. Pour over rice mixture. Sprinkle with paprika. Cook 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).Combine pumpkin, evaporated milk, Splenda, eggs, spices, and saltmix well. Pour into unbaked pie shell.Bake for 10 minutesreduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake for an additional 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until knife inserted into center comes out clean.Let cool completely before slicing.

Line three baking sheets with parchment paper or lightly spray with cooking spray. In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently stir in the cranberries and coconut. Spoon dough by teaspoonfuls onto prepared baking sheets. Bake at 300 degrees f for one hour or until golden brown. Remove from oven and cool completely on baking sheet. Store in an air-tight container.

Sift the flour, polenta & salt into a large bowl. Add the sugar & baking powder & mix well. Add the oil & water to make a soft dough. Knead on a lightly floured surface until smooth & elastic. Put the dough into an oiled bowl & cover with clingfilm. Leave to rise for 45 minutes to an hour. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface & knead again for a few minutes to knock out the air bubbles & smooth the surface. Cut the dough into two & roll each piece out into a sausage shape about 5cm wide. Place in a greased baking tray & flatten slightly with your hands. Cover with clingfilm & leave to rise for a further hour until nearly doubled in size. Preheat the oven to 190C/375F/Gas 5 & bake for 15 minutes until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack.

Combine the eggs, milk, flour, baking powder and salt in a bowl. Beat with an electric mixer at medium speed until smooth. Melt the butter and vanilla in a skillet over medium heat. Add the butter mixture to the pancake batter. Stir just until well blended. Cook over medium heat in a lightly greased skillet or waffle iron. Makes about 10 pancakes.

Prepare the batter by mixing the plain flour with the salt, egg and butter then add the milk gradually until you get the consistency of double cream. Coat the fish fillets with the batter then fry them in the hot oil for 2-3 minutes per side. Serve with a lemon wedge.
1. In a blender add ice cubes, lime juice and honeydew melon. 2. Blend until smooth. 3. Pour into glasses and top each with a splash of club soda. 4. Serve immediately.
Mix beef, root beer, garlic powder, lemon pepper. Blend cornstarch with water. Add to meat mixture. Cook on low heat for 8 hours. Add water if needed. Serve with mashed potatoes.

In large bowl with electric mixer, beat whole wheat flour, baking soda and salt until well blended. Beat in applesauce and Splenda. Add egg whites and beat until smooth. Stir in brown sugar and vanilla. Fold in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes. Cool for about one minute on cookie sheets. Remove to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 3 dozen.

In a large bowl mix together the flour, baking powder, brown sugar, milk, yogurt, oil, eggs, and vanilla extract until well mixed. Stir in the blackberries. Bake for 25-30 minutes in a preheated 375° oven until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool on wire rack. Serve warm or cold. Serves 12-16.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add tortellini and cook for 4 minutes or until tender. Drain pasta and add to sauce. Add pasta sauce and alfredo sauce to water. Bring to a boil. Serve over tortellini and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Place 1 cup of water in a small saucepan and bring to boil. Remove from heat and add chocolate. Stir until chocolate is melted. Add cocoa and mix well. Add nestle cream and beat with a whisk until frothy. Beat in 2 teaspoons gelatin. Stir in condensed milk and cocoa. Whisk until frothy. Fold in 1/2 cup of cream. Pour mixture into 6 individual 1/2 cup ramekins or 1 1/2 litre baking dish. Chill for 1-2 hours. To serve, beat 1/2 cup cream until stiff and top each dish with whipped cream. Sprinkle with walnuts.

Cook carrots in boiling water until just tender. Drain well. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Stir in sugar. Add carrots. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until coated and heated through. Stir in mustard. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Mix butter, crumbs and almonds in a bowl. Press mixture into a 9-inch square baking pan. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Sprinkle with ginger, coconut and chocolate chips. Bake 3 to 5 minutes more. Cool completely. Sprinkle sesame seeds over top.

Bring water to a boil in a pot, add peas. Cook 3 minutes, add carrot. Cook 1 minute longer. Drain. Melt butter in saucepan. Add carrot-pea mixture and cook until lightly browned, stirring often. Add dijon mustard and vinegar. Cook 1 minute more, then sprinkle with tarragon leaves. Serve immediately.

Peel and cut potatoes in half. Place in a large pot. Add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain. Return to pot. Mash with butter. Add the garlic and remaining ingredients. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Combine cherry pie filling and cake mix in a bowl. Spread the mixture into a 9x13x2-inch baking pan. Combine topping ingredients and spread over the cherry filling mixture. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until topping is golden brown. Cool before serving.

Combine butter and worcestershire sauce in a microwave safe bowl. Mix in seasoning salt and seasoning mix. Add cereals and peanuts. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir. Microwave for an additional 2 minutes. Remove from microwave and stir well. Cool for 1 hour before serving.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add cabbage, carrots, caraway seeds, garlic cloves and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cover and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes. Sprinkle with the sauerkraut and cook 2 minutes more. Serve hot.

Place the bread slices on a plate and spread onion paste on each slice and sprinkle spinach on them. In a small bowl, combine the chili and ginger paste and add some oil. Spread this on each slice and then sprinkle the lemon juice on top of it and cover it. Cover it and chill it for an hour. Now spread the paneer on each slice and sprinkle the tomatoes on top of it and cover it again. Refrigerate it for half an hour. Cut the slices into triangles and serve it as a snack.

Peel peaches and cut into slices. Put into a 2-quart baking dish. Beat margarine and sugar until fluffy. Beat in flour. Beat in milk. Beat in baking powder and salt. Spread batter over peaches. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the egg until the whites are set but the yolk is still runny. In a small bowl combine cheese with milk to make a thick liquid. Pour the cheese over the egg. Top with the tomatoes. Serve with toast.

Heat oven to 350f. In a small bowl, mix together melted butter and brown sugar. Stir until well blended. Add pecans and stir until well coated. Spread nuts evenly in an 8-inch square baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool. Place bananas in an 8-inch square baking pan. Top with brown sugar mixture and bake for 10 minutes or until bananas are golden. Remove from oven and sprinkle with bourbon. Cool slightly. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

In a saucepan cook stock and rice for 25 minutes. Add lemon juice. In a small bowl whisk together egg yolks and water. Temper egg mixture with stock mixture and cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in parsley, salt and pepper. Serve hot over chicken.

Cook turkey and drain fat from pan. Add onions and green chilies and cook until soft. Add Cream of Chicken Soup and corn tortillas and cook until tortillas are soft and soup is bubbly. Add milk and mix well. Add cheese and broth and mix well. Pour into a 9x13 baking dish and bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes. Serve immediately with sour cream and/or salsa.

Cook lentils in boiling water for 30 minutes until tender. Drain. Add sour cream, dijon mustard, milk, wine vinegar and thyme. Mix well and chill overnight. Combine lentil mixture with ham, celery and onion. Toss lightly and serve on bread or crackers.

In a large bowl combine cream cheese, swiss cheese and cheddar cheesemix well. Stir in bacon bits and club crackersmix well. Form into ballrefrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Wrap in plastic wrap. Serve with crackers.

1. In a large bowl combine flour with salt and pepper. 2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil and swirl to coat the pan. Working in small batches (I use 2 large frying pans), dip chicken into the flour mixture and then fry 3-4 minutes per side or until golden brown. Remove from pan and place in a 13 x 9-inch baking pan. 3. Add remaining tablespoon of vegetable oil to the skillet. Add the sugar, soy sauce and sesame seed oil. Cook and stir until the sugar dissolves. Pour over the chicken. Top with sesame seeds. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Remove the top 2 inches from the head of the garlic bulb. Place it in a small microwave safe dish with a few tablespoons of water. Cover with a vented plate and microwave for 2 minutes. Remove from microwave and let cool for 5 minutes. Remove the outer paper skin from the bulb. Squeeze the roasted garlic out of the skins into a small bowl. Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the shallots and saute until soft. Add the roasted garlic and cook for a few minutes. Add the white wine and deglaze the pan. Cook until the liquid has reduced by half. Add the cream and stir to combine. Cook for a few minutes. Whisk in the roasted garlic mixture. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Add the fresh herbs and stir well. Serve immediately.
Peel avocados and cut into chunks. Add to food processor along with the rest of the ingredients. Pulse until smooth. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with chopped walnuts. Serves 2 to 4.
Prepare vinaigrette by combining all the vinaigrette ingredients and whisking well. In a large bowl combine all the salad ingredients. Pour vinaigrette over salad and toss well. Serve immediately.
Pour boiling water into a glass teapot or tea pot. Add black tea. Steep for 2-3 minutes. Add milk and Splenda. Stir. Add spices. Heat through. Strain into mugs.

Mix graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch pie pan. In a mixing bowl beat cream cheese until light and fluffy. Add sweetener and vanilla. Add the cream and lemon juice and beat until fluffy. Spread over the crust. Chill 4 hours. Top with whipped cream and crushed pineapple. Chill.

Soften gelatin in cold water. Mix together mushroom soup and cream cheese. Blend in gelatin and mix thoroughly. Add mayonnaise and mix well. Chill and refrigerate at least 2 hours. Mix in shrimp and celery. Pour into mold. Chill several hours. Unmold and serve with crackers.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tender, and drain. Cut into bite-sized cubes and place in large bowl. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute 3 to 5 minutes or until crisp-tender. Sprinkle over potatoes and toss to blend. Sprinkle with sausage, feta cheese and parsley to taste and serve immediately.

Mix together all dry ingredients. Add the warm water. Mix well until combined but not over mixed. Heat skillet or griddle on medium heat with a light coating of oil or cooking spray. Drop mixture on pan by heaping teaspoons to form 4-inch round tortillas. Cook about 3 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Makes about 20 tortillas.

Cover beans in 6 quarts of cold water. Bring to a boil and boil for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse beans. Place in a crock pot. Cover with 8 cups of water. Add onion and garlic. Stir in cumin, chili powder, bay leaves, cilantro and sherry. Cook for 8 hours or overnight. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with sherry.
Spread cream cheese mixture evenly in a baking dish. Bake 30 minutes or until top is golden brown. Cool 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese before serving. Serve with crackers.
Make according to box directions. Omit icing and add orange rind when mixing ingredients together. Bake in 8×8 inch pan. Add mandarin oranges after cooling. Cut in squares and serve cold.

Combine all the ingredients except the lime juice in the bowl of the food processor and blend to a smooth paste. Rub the mixture all over the chicken. Heat the grill to medium. Place the chicken breasts on the grill and cook for 4 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Serve with the lime wedges.
In a bowl mix flour and cheese. In another bowl mix milk and egg. Add to flour and cheese. Pour into greased muffin pan. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes. Yield 12 muffins.

Bring 1 qt water to boil in saucepan over high heat. Add spinachcook 1 minute or until wilteddrain, pressing out water. Let cool slightly. Combine spinach, artichokes, 1/2 cup parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, 1 tbsp garlic powder, and 1/2 tsp garlic pepper in a large bowlmix well. Spread into 13x9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm with crackers or chips. Makes 16 servings.
Slice pita bread in half lengthwise. Spread each half with mustard. Layer with beef, lettuce, tomato, olives, onions and cheese. Serve on a plate with salad or chips.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened and slightly browned, 5 to 10 minutes. Add kale leaves and cook until wilted. Add tomatoes and their juices and water. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until greens are tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Cook pasta according to directions on packagedrain and set aside. Mix mayo, milk and soup together in medium bowl. Stir in peas. Stir in seafood and cheddar cheesemix well. Transfer to 2-quart baking dishsprinkle with dill. Bake at 375F for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Slice each chicken breast lengthwise into 2 piecescut each piece in half lengthwise again. Cut each half into 2 pieces widthwise. Combine flour, salt, and pepper in a shallow dish. Dip chicken in flour mixtureshake off excess. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heatbrown chicken on all sides. Arrange bacon in the bottom of a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Layer half of the chicken over bacon. Sprinkle with half of the cheese. Repeat layers. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until chicken is done. Meanwhile, combine ketchup and pickled jalapeno peppers in a medium bowlstir well. Drizzle ketchup mixture over chicken. Bake an additional 10 to 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Place 1/2 cup cooked turkey in center of each tortilla. Top with 1 tablespoon green chilies. Top with 1 tablespoon salsa. Top with 1/4 cup cooked beans and 2 teaspoons cheese. Fold up and place seam side down in a 9x13-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 5 more minutes or until cheese is melted and enchiladas are heated through. Serve with lettuce and sour cream if desired.

Heat 1/2 in oil in a large frying pan. Add chicken wings to hot oil, in small batches, and cook for 8 minutes or until lightly browned on both sides. Meanwhile combine soy sauce, water and honey in a bowl. Stir well to dissolve honey. Stir in sesame seeds. Add to frying pan. Bring to boil and stir to coat chicken wings. Reduce heat to low. Cover tightly and cook for 20 minutes or until chicken wings are tender. Serve with rice.

Bring 4 cups of water to boil in a pot with 2 tablespoons of salt and butter. Add the rice and simmer for 45 minutes, or until done. Add the mushrooms and cook for an additional 5 minutes. In a separate saucepan, bring the remaining water and salt to boil and cook the orzo until done (about 8 minutes). Drain and add to the mushroom/rice mixture along with the pecans and sage. Stir in the peas and cook for an additional minute. Remove from heat and serve immediately.

Lightly coat an ovenproof skillet with cooking oil. Break the egg into the skillet and cook until it is just set. Meanwhile, place two slices of bread on the counter. Spread one slice with yogurt and sprinkle it with salt. Layer the ham on the yogurt. Cover the ham with the swiss cheese slice. Sprinkle the cheese with powdered sugar. Top with the second slice of bread and the remaining yogurt. Cook the sandwich until the bread is golden and the cheese is melted. Cut the sandwich into wedges to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. Melt margarine in a large bowl over low heat. Remove from heat and add apple juice concentratemix well. Cool slightly. Beat eggs into mixture. Sift together flour, baking soda and saltstir into mixture just until moistened. Stir in bananas and milkbeat just until smooth. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bread comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing and cooling completely.

Put the seeds and wine into a non-metal pot (glass or ceramic) and bring to boiling. Reduce to a simmer for about 10 minutes until seeds are tender and dark brown. Stir in mustard and allspice and simmer about 20 minutes until thick and syrupy. Cool and strain the seeds out. Transfer to a nonmetal container and add vinegar and salt to taste. Refrigerate at least 2 weeks before using. Use it to make vinaigrettes for salads, glaze for roast pork or chicken or spread for sandwiches. Store in fridge up to 6 months.

Cut off woody ends of asparagus. Place spears in boiling water for 3 to 4 minutes or until tender. Drain and place in bowl. Add remaining ingredients. Toss to coat. Serve hot or chilled. Makes about 4 servings.

Melt the chocolate chips in a double boiler or in the microwave in 30 second intervals. Stir chips after each interval to prevent burning. Once chocolate is melted add vanilla. Spread on the crispy rice cereal in a single layer. Sprinkle with slivered almonds and dried cherries. Let cool and harden in the refrigerator. Cut into squares.

Combine cornstarch and water to make thick slurry. Set aside. Heat sesame oil and soy sauce until fragrant. Add egg and cook until scrambled. Add ramen noodles and continue to stir until they absorb soy sauce. Add slurry and mix until noodles are coated. Add cooked chicken and green onions. Serve immediately.

Spread 2 tablespoons of cream cheese on each tortilla. Add about 1/4 cup of the chopped carrots on each tortilla, then sprinkle on 1/4 cup of the cheese. Divide the roast beef among the tortillas and top with the lettuce leaves. Roll up the tortillas and wrap each one in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. Serve as wraps or cut into bite-sized pieces for appetizers.

Preheat oven to 375. Peel the potatoes and place in a large bowl. Add the butter, lemon juice, lemon zest, salt and nutmeg. Mix thoroughly. Spray a baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. Transfer potatoes to baking dish. Bake for 20-30 minutes or until potatoes are cooked through. Garnish with chopped chives and fresh parsley. Serve immediately.
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Shape into 4 patties and lightly brown in a hot pan with a little oil. Serve with rice and salad.
Mix soup, milk and water in saucepan. Add macaroni and tuna. Stir in onion and pepper. Put into casserole dish. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Serve with crackers or bread.

Pre-heat grill to 200 degrees C/ 400 degrees F. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Place on hot grill, cook until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the middle, about 10-12 minutes. Cut chicken into 1/4-inch slices. Spread ciabatta rolls with mayonnaise. Top with lettuce leaves. Place bacon on lettuce leaves. Top with chicken, mexican cheese, guacamole and adobo seasoning.

Mix dijon mustard with onion and breadcrumbs in small bowl. Press mixture onto chicken breast halvessprinkle with parsley. Thread chicken onto skewers. Place onto baking sheet. Bake for 45 minutes, turning once during cooking time.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine the blueberries and 2 tablespoons water. Bring to a simmer and cook until the blueberries are tender about 5 minutes. Transfer to a small bowl and stir in the remaining ingredients. Cool completely. To serve spoon the blueberries over the shortcake.

Place garlic in glass jar. Add vinegar and water. Heat to boiling and pour mixture into jar. Cover and let cool to room temperature. Add salt, sugar and spices to taste and refrigerate for up to 3 weeks before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl combine flour and salt. Work the butter in the flour with your fingers until the mixture is crumbly. In a small bowl beat the sugar and vanilla together. Add the sugar mixture to the flour mixture and work until well blended. With floured hands roll into balls the size of marbles. Place the balls on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Roll the cookies in the sugar crystals. Store in an airtight container.

Rinse soybeans and add to crockpot with ham hocks. Cover with water. Cook on low for 8 hours. Remove hocks, dice & return to crockpot. Add remaining ingredients & cook on high for 2 hours. Mash some of the beans & mix with the rest of the beans. Serve with corn bread or cornbread muffins.

Heat the oil in a skillet. Cook the tortillas until crisp. Spread each tortilla with the pepper jelly. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top. Top each with a slice of apple. Fold the tortillas over and cook until the cheese is hot and the apple is tender. Remove the quesadillas from the pan and cut into wedges. Serve warm.
Cut the onion and parsley finely. Add the sumac. Add the lemon juice. Add the olive oil. Toss. Serve as a side salad or add to chicken or fish.

Cut potato into 1/4 inch thick rounds. In a bowl, combine olive oil, salt, and pepper. Dip each potato round in the mixture. Place in a greased 13x9 inch pan. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle chives over the top of potatoes. In another bowl, combine wheat germ with paprika. Sprinkle over potatoes. Serve warm.

In a small saucepan over med-low heat, melt together almond butter and brown rice syrup. Stir constantly until melted. Add carob powder and mix well. Remove from heat. Add walnuts and mix until well combined. Press into a pan and let cool completely. Cut into squares and store in refrigerator.

In a small bowl, combine cream cheese and cream of shrimp soup. Blend well. Spread mixture in 8 inch pie plate. Top with shrimp. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with the garlic salt. Serve with crackers or toast points. Serves 4.

Preheat grill on high heat. Core and slice nectarines into 3 wedges each. Put prosciutto on a plate or cutting board. Wrap each nectarine wedge in a strip of prosciutto. Thread prosciutto-wrapped nectarines onto skewers, making 4 skewers total. Brush nectarines with butter. Grill on high heat for 3 minutes per side or until prosciutto is crispy and nectarines are heated through. Serve with lime wedges and sprigs of fresh mint.

Soak beans overnight. Drain. In large saucepan, combine beans, onion and water to cover. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer 2 hours or until beans are tender. Drain. Combine beans, mustard, savory, salt pork, pepper, chili powder and maple syrup. Place in baking dish. Bake at 375 for 1 hour. Serve hot.
In a large bowl, toss all the ingredients together. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve.

Cook potatoes in boiling salted water until tender. Peel potatoes and cut into 1/4-inch cubes. In medium bowl, combine potatoes, green beans, cucumber, onion and olives. In large bowl combine oil, vinegar and Old Bay. Toss potato mixture with dressing. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 3 days.
Prepare jello according to box directions. Chill until set. Scoop into 1/2 oz shot glasses. Pour 1/2 oz light rum over each glass.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees f. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Sift together flour, salt and baking soda into a large bowl. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl, beat together margarine and sugar. Add in eggs and vanilla, mixing until smooth. Stir in flour mixture. Stir in pecans and chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoons onto prepared baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 11 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Prepare the onions by peeling off the papery skins. Melt the butter in a skillet over low heat. Add the ground cloves and sugar. Add the onions and salt and pepper. Stir well. Turn up the heat and saut the onions until they are light brown, stirring occasionally. Add the water and boil for a minute or two. Serve at once or refrigerate in a tightly covered container for up to 2 days.

Mix all together and shape into steaks. Heat a bit of vegetable oil in skillet and brown steaks on both sides. Place in baking dish and cover with tomato sauce. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until done.

In small pan over medium heat, cook garlic in oil until light brown. Add ginger. Cook until golden. Add mushrooms. Stir-fry for 2 minutes. Stir in peas. Cook until vegetables are crisp-tender. In large skillet over medium heat, beat egg whites until foamy. Add egg whites to vegetable mixture. Cook, stirring constantly. Season with soy sauce. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread the pumpkin seeds on a baking sheet. Toss together the oil, garlic salt, onion powder and hot sauce. Pour the mixture over the seeds. Stir to coat the seeds. Bake for 10-15 minutes. Stir a few times while baking. Let cool completely before serving.
Prepare chili as directed on package, add sour cream and cheddar cheese and mix well. Serve with tomato and olives and garnish with green onion.

Heat oil in a pot over medium heat and saute the tomatoes until they start to fall apart. Add the onion and saute for 2 minutes. Add the jalapeno and saute another 2 minutes. Add the cilantro and cook for 1 minute. Add the stock and season with salt and pepper. Tear up the tortillas into small pieces and add them to the soup. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix yellow cake mix with one egg. Add one stick of butter (melted) and one can of cream cheese (softened). Mix until combined. Spread evenly into a 9x13 pan. Bake 45 minutes or until firm to touch. In a saucepan, combine 1/4 cup butter, 1/4 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup water and cook until melted and boiling. Remove from heat and stir in 2 cups of powdered sugar (more or less to taste) until well blended and smooth. Spread over warm cake. Cool completely before cutting.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a medium bowl, combine the crescent roll dough and the garlic powder. Roll the dough into 18 inch long strips and cut each strip into 12 triangles. Place the triangles onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned. Combine the green onions and cheese in a small bowl. Spread about 1 teaspoon of the cheese mixture onto each triangle. Bake for 3 minutes more in the preheated oven. Serve warm.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain. Mash potatoes. Cook cabbage until tender. Drain and add to mashed potatoes. Fry bacon. Drain on paper towels. Add to potato mixture. Add onion, parsley. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan.Beat butter and sugars together with a mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time until just mixed in.Fold in the bananas and lemon juice with a spatula.Sift together the flour and baking soda. Fold the dry ingredients into the batter just until incorporated.Spoon the batter into the prepared loaf pan and sprinkle with lemon zest. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean, about 50 minutes.Allow the loaf to cool in the pan for 5 minutes before turning out to cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, combine cake mix and milk. Beat with a spoon until smooth. Spread half the cake batter in the dish. Layer with half the ice cream. Spread the remaining cake batter over the ice cream. Freeze for at least 2 hours. Top with the remaining ice cream and the cherry. Freeze until firm. Remove from freezer 5 minutes before serving. Cut into slices with a sharp knife.

Slice white bread lengthwise. Spread one side with mayonnaise. Place ham on bottom slice. Top with cheese. Spread the other slice with mayonnaise. Place on top. Broil sandwich, 6 inches from heat source for 1-2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut diagonally. Top with horseradish sauce. Sprinkle with red onions. Spread the other side with butter. Serve.

Add first 5 ingredients to bread pan. Select dough cycle. Remove dough after first rise. Press 1/3 dough into a greased 9 x 5-inch loaf pan. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Press remaining dough evenly over top. Coverlet rise until almost doubled. Bake at 375 f for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Brush with butter.

Cook pasta according to package directions until tender but firm. Drain. Melt butter in a saucepan. Add broth and cook over medium heat until slightly reduced. Add pasta and toss. Season with salt and pepper. Top with parsley and serve.

Soak couscous in boiling water for about 5 minutes until tender and swollen. Drain and set aside. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and onions and cook, stirring for about 1-2 minutes or until the onion is soft. Add the mushrooms and cook for about 2 minutes or until they begin to brown. Add the stock and the chick-peas and simmer for about 1-2 minutes or until the chick-peas are heated through. Add the parsley, season with salt and pepper and mix through the couscous until well combined. Serve immediately.

Cut muffins into 4 equal pieces. Spray large nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Over medium-high heat, cook chicken strips 3-4 minutes per side until cooked through. Transfer chicken to paper towel-lined plate. Cut into small bite-sized pieces. Cut bacon into small pieces. In small bowl, combine chicken, bacon, mozzarella cheese and pesto. In same skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. In a shallow bowl or pie plate, stir together the eggs and milk. Place 1 muffin half on plate. Spoon about 1 tablespoon chicken mixture in center of muffin half. Sprinkle with a few drops of pesto. Fold muffin over to enclose filling. Repeat with remaining muffin halves and filling. Cook muffins 3-4 minutes per side over medium-high heat until crispy. Serve with salsa and sour cream. Makes 4 servings.
Grate sweet potato into a bowl. Add potatoes, tuna and curry and rice soup mix. Add egg and mix well. Heat oil in a pan. Add onion. When crispy, add sweet potato mixture. Fry until crispy. Serve.

Sprinkle ham with curry powder and brown sugar. Place ham in shallow baking dish. Bake uncovered in 375f oven for 25 minutes. Meanwhile, combine pineapple, apricots, pears and peaches in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine cornstarch and water until smoothpour over fruit mixture and toss to coat. Microwave on HIGH for 3 to 4 minutes until mixture thickens slightly. Serve with ham.

Prepare pastry as directed on box and roll out to fit deep-dish 9-inch pie pan. Roll out second half of pastry and set aside for top crust. In large bowl combine peaches, 1/2 cup sugar and flour. Beat with mixer until blended. Spread half of filling into pastry-lined pan. Dot with 1/2 teaspoon butter and 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg. Place top pastry over filling. Trim and seal top and bottom edges of pastry together or pinch to form decorative seal. Cut 3 to 4 slits in top pastry to allow steam to escape. Beat remaining 1/4 cup sugar and 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg in small bowl until blended. Mix with 2 tablespoons water until smooth. Brush over top and sides of pastry. Bake on center rack of oven at 400 for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake 50 minutes longer or until filling is bubbly and pastry is deep golden brown. Let stand

Line an 8x8 pan with foil with ends of foil extending over sides. Combine butter and sugar in a saucepan over low heat. Stir until melted and well mixed. Add syrup, water and salt. Stir until blended. Bring mixture to a boil and boil for 5 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Quickly pour into prepared pan and let cool. Lift foil out of pan and break into pieces. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x9 baking dish or spray with baking spray. In a small bowl, combine the cake mix with the orange juice, vegetable oil, eggs and waterbeat until well combined. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Bake for about 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack before frosting. To prepare the frosting, combine the powdered sugar with the butterbeat until creamy. Add the orange juicemix well to combine. Frost the top of the cake with the icing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8 inch square baking dish. Combine butter and cornflour in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir in rice flour, lemon rind and icing sugar. Cook and stir for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and press mixture into baking dish with fingers. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Cool in pan on wire rack.

Roll out dough to 12-inch round. Bake at 400 degrees until crust is lightly browned. Spread tomato sauce over crust. Top with cheese and basil. Bake 5 minutes. Arrange chicken over cheese. Sprinkle with parsley and pepper. Return to oven and bake 2 minutes more.

Put the fish in a flat baking dish and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover with the champagne and add the onion and tarragon sprigs. Bake for about 15 minutes. Transfer the fish to a platter and spoon the liquid over it. Sprinkle with the capers and serve with lemon wedges on the side.

Slice potato in half. Drizzle with butter and sprinkle with cajun seasoning. Place on baking sheet and bake at 375 for 1 hour. Cut potato in half and scoop out. Add garlic and wine. Drizzle with heavy cream and cajun seasoning. Drizzle with butter and sprinkle with green onion. Slice filet mignon into 3 slices. Lay potato on plate. Place filet on top. Place portabella mushroom on top of filet. Serve.

Boil 2 cups water. Add 1 cup tapioca. Boil 2 minutes. Stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 cup almond milk, 1 cup water and 2 tbsp turbinado sugar. Let stand 1 minute. Stir well and allow to thicken. Stir in 1 tsp ground flax seed, 1 tsp ground almonds, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract and 2 tsp amaretto. Pour into 4 serving dishes. Let cool. Refrigerate. Top with toasted almonds.

Melt butter in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Stirring occasionally. Add brown sugar and vanilla. Continue to cook and stir until the mixture reaches 240 degrees on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir in the baking soda and milk. Stirring constantly until mixture is smooth. Stir in the peanut butter and salt. Pour mixture into a greased 9 x 13 baking dish and spread evenly. Cool for 2 hours. Cut into squares and store in an airtight container.

Heat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Spray 2 baking sheets with cooking spray. Melt butter in medium skillet over medium heat. Add garliccook 1 minute or until fragrant. Add spinach and oreganocook until spinach wilts. Remove from heatcool. In a large bowl, mix together chicken, spinach mixture, feta, egg, pepper and 1/2 teaspoon of the seasoning. Divide mixture in halfshape each half into 3 patties. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in same skillet used to cook chicken over medium-high heat. Add pattiescook 4 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in center. Remove patties from panset aside. Heat remaining tablespoon oil in same skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook 1 minute or until softened. Add tomatoescook 3 minutes or until softened. Add remaining 1/2 teaspoon seasoningcook 1 minute or until fragrant. Spread 1/4 of onion mixture on each

In large skillet saute onion in butter until tender. Cool slightly. Beat together cornmeal, sugar, salt and baking powder. Add eggs and milkstir just until combined. Stir in onion mixture and baking soda. Spoon into greased 1-1/2-qt. Baking dish. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes or until top springs back when touched lightly and edges begin to brown. Cool slightly before serving. Serves 5-6.

In a blender, puree 2 cups brewed coffee and 2 cups ice cubes until smooth. Add 2 tablespoons sugar, 1 scoop coffee ice cream and 1 cup sweetened whipped cream. Blend until smooth. Pour into tall glasses. Top with 2 tablespoons sweetened whipped cream. Sprinkle with chocolate shavings. Serves 4.

Cook macaroni as per directions. In a large skillet combine ground beef and onion and brown. Drain and add tomatoes and water. Bring to a boil and add corn. Simmer 10 minutes. Add macaroni and barbecue sauce. Stir and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and let sit for 10 minutes. Serve.

In a saucepan, combine soy sauce, honey and water. Bring to a boil. Stir in the cinnamon and cook for 1 minute. Add chicken breasts. Cook about 3-4 minutes per side or until chicken is done. Remove from heat. Cut chicken in half and serve over rice with spinach and carrots on the side.

Place 4 cups milk in saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar and salt and bring to boil. Remove from heat. Add 4 Tablespoons butter and vanilla. Beat egg yolks in a bowl. Gradually add hot milk to yolks and stir constantly. Return to saucepan and cook over low heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in 2 cups rice. Cover and refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Add brandy and cinnamon. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into rice mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with lemon juice and additional cinnamon. Serves 8.

Combine all the ingredients except the eggs and soy sauce in a food processor and puree until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add the eggs and process until the mixture forms a dough. Transfer to a large bowl and knead the dough for 2 minutes. Divide the mixture into 6 equal portions and form each portion into a ball. Coat the balls lightly with flour and set aside for 20 minutes. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over medium-low heat. Working with one ball at a time, flatten the balls into 1/4-inch-thick patties, then place them in the skillet and cook for 2 minutes per side until golden brown. Remove the burgers and drain on paper towels. Repeat with the remaining balls of dough and olive oil as needed. Makes 6 burgers.

Mix sesame seeds with flour and 1/2 cup sugar. Cream butter and sugar in bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs. Stir in flour mixture alternately with milk, beating after each addition, until well blended. Stir in caraway seed and baking soda. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350F until very lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Dip bottoms of cookies in remaining sugar. Makes about 4 dozen.

Combine light corn syrup, light brown sugar and butter in heavy medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Add evaporated milk and whisk until smooth. Add baking soda and whisk until dissolved. Continue cooking until mixture thickens to desired consistency. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Cook onions until tender. Add ground beef, flour, milk, butter, garlic salt, and pepper. Cook until thickened. Stir in cheese, macaroni, and 1 cup cheddar cheese. Spread into a 2 quart baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees until top is lightly browned.
In a saute pan, heat olive oil until it shimmers. Add sauerkraut to saute pan and saute until slightly browned on bottom. Stir in creme fraiche. Cook for 30 seconds more. Garnish with chives.

Pork Tenderloin Cooking Time: 20 minutes. Season the tenderloin generously on all sides with salt and pepper and cinnamon and cumin and chili powder. Heat a grill or stove-top grill pan over high heat. When pan is hot and ready to sear, add the tenderloin and sear until well marked on one side. Turn and sear the other side. Reduce the heat to medium. Pour the oil into the pan and cook the tenderloin to desired temperature. Add the brown sugar and Tabasco and cook to glaze. Let it rest for five minutes. Cut into medallions. Serve with rice and vegetables.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Season chicken breast halves evenly on both sides with the seasoned flour, pressing lightly to adhere. Heat a large heavy skillet over high heat until very hot. Add the butter. When the butter foams, add the chicken breast halves in a single layer. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes per side, or until the chicken is golden brown. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside. Drain all but about 1 tablespoon of the fat from the pan. Add the wine and the broth. Boil for 2 minutes or until reduced by half. Reduce the heat to low. Add the cheddar cheese and stir until the cheese has completely melted. Arrange the chicken breast halves in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Spoon the sauce over the chicken. Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 15 minutes. Uncover the chicken. Bake for 5 minutes more. Sprinkle the oregano over the chicken. Serve hot.
Add sugar to water and heat until it dissolves. Add maple extract and vanilla. Cook until thickened.

Peel and devein shrimp, rinse and pat dry. Heat oil in large saut pan. Add shrimp and cook over medium-high heat until shrimp are pink and firm. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add wine and cook until reduced by half. Add tomatoes, feta cheese, parsley, kalamata olives and pepper. Simmer 15 to 20 minutes until shrimp are done to your liking. Serve over pasta of your choice or rice. Serves 4-6 people.

Cook ground beef in skillet over medium heat until brown. Drain excess grease. Stir in diced tomatoes with juice and bring to boil. Reduce heat and add ramen noodles and peas. Cook 2 minutes until heated through. Stir in sour cream, onion and hot sauce if desired. Serve over cooked egg noodles for a delicious meal the entire family will enjoy.

Place green beans in a large pot of boiling water. Cook for 2 minutes and remove from heat and drain. Place green beans in a large mixing bowl and add lemon juice and vegetable oil and toss until all green beans are evenly covered in lemon juice and oil. Pour green beans on a large serving platter and toss in dijon mustard and honey and toss until well combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes. In a large heavy-bottomed stockpot over medium heat, fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan using a slotted spoonset aside. Add the potatoes to the pan, and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 5 minutes. Add the onion to the pot, and cook until the potatoes are tender. Stir in the water, corn, milk, butter, salt and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boilreduce heat to a simmer. Cook until potatoes are tender. Remove the pot from the heat. Stir in the bacon. Garnish the soup with the reserved bacon. Serve immediately.

Combine graham crumbs, sugar, melted butter, and press onto bottom of 9-inch pie pan. Bake crust for 10 minutes. In a medium bowl, combine Snickers candy bars, peanut butter, half-and-half, and chocolate syrup. Pour into crust. Chill before serving. Garnish top of pie with whipped topping.

Heat oven to 350. Spray 13x9 inch baking dish. In large saucepan, bring broth to a boil. Add rice and carrot. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat and stir in zucchini. In medium bowl, combine butter and basil. Spread over rice mixture. Cover with foil. Bake 15 minutes. Uncover and bake 10 minutes longer or until brown. Makes 4 servings.

In a small saucepan combine all glaze ingredients. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Pour half of glaze into a small bowl for basting. Save remaining glaze for serving. Place pork in a shallow dish. In a small bowl combine 2 teaspoons brown sugar and the cayenne. Sprinkle pork with cayenne mixture. Combine 1/2 teaspoon brown sugar and 1/4 teaspoon cayenne. Rub over pork. Thread pork onto 4 skewers. In a small bowl combine remaining brown sugar and cayenne. Brush onto pork. Place pork on a lightly oiled grill rack coated with nonstick cooking spray. Grill 10 minutes. Brush pork with half the basting glaze. Grill 3 minutes. Brush with remaining basting glaze. Grill 3 minutes. Serve with remaining glaze and peaches.

Combine 3 1/2 cups flour, 1/2 cup sugar, 1 tsp. Salt, 1 tsp. Dry yeast and 1 cup sour cream. Add 1 beaten egg yolk. Add 1 cup warm milk to thin to a soft dough. Turn onto lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth. Roll out to a 15-inch circle. Spread with 3/4 cup softened butter. Fold over in thirds. Roll out again to a 12-inch circle. Spread with 3/4 cup softened butter. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup sugar. Fold over in thirds. Roll out again to a 10-inch circle. Spread with 3/4 cup softened butter. Fold over in thirds. Roll out again to a 7-inch circle. Spread with 3/4 cup softened butter. Fold over in thirds. Roll out again to a 5-inch circle. Spread with 3/4 cup softened butter. Fold over in thirds. Roll out again to a

Peel and slice cucumbers lengthwise. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and let stand to drain about 10 minutes. Combine cajun seasoning and breadcrumbs. Heat bacon drippings and dip cucumbers in egg and then bread crumb mixture and fry in hot drippings until golden brown, about 2 min per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm or cold.

Slice and dice the onion. Heat the butter over medium heat. Add the onions and saute until soft. Add the rice and saute until the rice is toasted. Add the water and the salt. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the broccoli and the cheez whiz and continue to simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the soup and add the cornflake crumbs. Pour the mixture into a 2 quart casserole dish and bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Remove from oven and serve.

Cream butter and shortening together. Add vanilla and almond extracts. Stir in flour. Add egg whites and mix well. Roll dough into 1-inch balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheet 2 inches apart. Bake at 400 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until light brown. Remove from cookie sheet and cool on wire rack. Dip cookies into melted white almond bark candy. Decorate with sprinkles while still warm. Cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. Butter and flour 2 (9-inch) round cake pans or a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Add the butter and cut it in using a pastry blender or fork. Beat the egg whites with the vanilla until foamy. Fold the whites into the butter mixture. Spoon the batter into the prepared pan(s). Sprinkle the blueberries over the batter. Bake until golden brown, about 35 to 40 minutes. Cool the cake(s) in the pans on a rack for 15 minutes. Loosen the sides of the cake(s) with a knife and turn them out onto the rack. Cool completely. Whip the yogurt with the lemon until frothy. Spread the yogurt over the top of the cake. Sprinkle with the fresh blueberries.

In a small bowl combine 1/3 cup cocoa powder and 1/2 cup hot water. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add 1/4 teaspoon sugar at a time and stir until mixture is smooth. Divide half-and-half into four cups. Stir in 2 teaspoons vanilla and 1/4 teaspoon almond extract to each cup of half-and-half. Top each serving with 1 teaspoon cocoa mixture. Serve in mugs with a dollop of whipped cream or sweetened whipped cream, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Cut up cabbage and combine in a large bowl with the vegetables, sugar and seasoning salt. Sprinkle in enough water to moisten mixture, add vinegar, mix well. Cover and chill at least one hour before serving. Makes enough for 4 servings.

Place chopped peaches in a medium size mixing bowl. Add sugar, ground cinnamon and stir together. Allow to sit for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Prepare a 10 inch round cake pan by brushing the sides with melted butter. In another bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. Cut in butter until crumbly. Stir in milk. Pour into prepared pan. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of sugar. Spoon fruit mixture over batter. Bake for 40 minutes or until golden. Remove from oven. Drizzle with vanilla glaze. Serve warm. Vanilla glaze: 2 tablespoons butter, 1 tablespoon milk, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Melt butter and mix with milk and vanilla extract. Drizzle over cobbler.

Cut cucumber into cubes. Cut tomato and green pepper into chunks and add to cucumber cubes with onion rings and lime juice. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to blend flavors. Just before serving, add red wine vinegar and dill weed. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve chilled.
Place 3 chops in a shallow dish. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over pork. Turn chops over and refrigerate at least 30 minutes. Grill as desired.

Combine 1 teaspoon each salt and lemon juice. Add 1 tablespoon seasoned rice vinegar. Toss with asparagus. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add asparaguscook until crisp-tender. Toss with sauce. Serve immediately.

Clean squid and cut into rings about 1/2 inch thick. Rinse and dry lettuce. Toss lettuce with olive oil, garlic and crushed red pepper flakes. Season to taste. Place lettuce in a shallow bowl. Place squid rings in a shallow bowl. Combine squid rings with tomatoes, lemon juice and capers and toss to combine. Divide lettuce and squid among plates. Drizzle with more olive oil and sprinkle with parsley.

Saute bacon until crisp. Remove from pan and drain on paper towel. Reserve 1 tablespoon of bacon drippings for the dough. Chop bacon into small pieces. Saute onion in reserved drippings until golden. Stir in corn kernels. Add the clams. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add clam chowder. Add chopped bacon, thyme, and a dash of Tabasco. Cook for a few minutes. Drain pasta. Add pasta to clam mixture. Add breadcrumbs to the top of pasta. Drizzle with butter. Sprinkle with Italian parsley. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Combine all of the salad ingredients in a large bowl and toss until well combined. Place a layer of salami on each bread slice and top with cheese slices. Spread the salad evenly over the bread and wrap in foil for packing or serving. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled. Makes 18 servings.
In a large skillet over medium heat, cook onion until soft. Add beef, ketchup, chili powder and yellow mustard. Cook until beef is done. Serve on buns.

Heat oil in a non-stick kadhai. Add the onion, garlic and saute till the onion turns pale pink. Add the turmeric powder, chilli powder and saute for a few seconds. Add the tomatoes, red capsicum and saute till the tomatoes turn pulpy. Add the rice, salt and cooked curds to the kadhai. Mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes or till the rice is heated through. Serve hot.

Heat oil in large saucepan. Add onion, celery and margarine. Cook, stirring occasionally until onion is tender. Stir in flour. Cook until flour is golden brown. Stir in curry powder. Stir in chicken broth and worcestershire sauce. Bring to boil. Add chicken. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until chicken is tender. Add tomato juice. Cook uncovered until thickened. Serve over hot rice. Garnish with green peas.

Cut the stems from the mushrooms. Mince the garlic. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saut until lightly browned. Add the mushrooms and tomatoes. Stir well. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the white wine. Cook until the mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes. Add the bay leaf, lemon juice, parsley, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes more. Serve warm.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add zucchini and cook 2 minutes or until tender-crisp. Add salt and pepper to taste. Place in a large bowladd raisins, nuts, mint, and lemon juice. Toss lightly. Makes 4 servings.

Cook shrimp and pepper in 1/4 cup boiling water for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Dice and combine shrimp and remaining ingredients except lettuce. Combine well. Lay romaine lettuce leaves on serving plates. Top with shrimp mixture. Garnish with chopped parsley.

In a large saucepan combine the water, sugar, brown sugar, maple extract, and butter. Bring mixture to a boil. Boil the mixture for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Strain the syrup through a fine strainer into a glass measuring cup or a pitcher. Use as a glaze for pancakes or waffles. Or use it to pour over ice cream or pound cake.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Spread salmon with a thin layer of mayonnaise and sprinkle with the pickling spices. Arrange the onion slices over the top and bake for 15 minutes. Sprinkle the salmon with the garlic and cook for another 10 minutes. Serve with the sliced pickle, lemon wedges and bread.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Spray 2 rimmed baking sheets with cooking spray. Place the cutlets in a single layer on the sheets and sprinkle both sides with lemon pepper. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice with the remaining ingredients and brush over the cutlets. Roast the cutlets for 12 minutes or until an instant-read thermometer registers 165 degrees in the center of the meat. Serve with the remaining lemon juice for drizzling and lemon wedges.
In a blender combine vodka and cream until smooth. Add ice and peach schnapps. Blend until smooth. Pour into a glass and top with a slice of peach.

Bring 1 1/2 cups water and 1 cup sugar to a boil in a small saucepan. Add 2 cups red wine. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Cool. Pour wine mixture over 4 cantaloupe wedges. Garnish with lemon rind and basil leaves. Serve with crackers or breadsticks. Makes 4 servings.

In a small bowl combine garlic, lemon juice and capers. In another bowl combine the sour cream and seasoning. Pre-heat the broiler. Drizzle the salmon with the oil. Season with the lemon-pepper and place under the broiler. Cook until the fish is brown and the edges start to crisp. Divide the salmon between two plates. Spoon the lemon-cream over the top. Garnish with capers.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Place french fries in a single layer on prepared baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until potatoes are golden brown. Cut hot dogs into 1/2-inch slices. Place in a single layer on another baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes or until hot dogs are browned. Spread the hot dog slices evenly over the fries. Spread the vegetarian chili over the hot dogs. Sprinkle cheese over the vegetarian chili. Bake 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 12 muffin cups. In a large bowl combine the flour, baking powder and saltset aside. In another bowl combine the egg, milk, vanilla and sugarstir well. Add the flour mixture all at oncestir just until moistened. Fold in the blackberries. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks. Cool completely. Yield: 12 muffins.

Combine soy sauce, mirin and ginger in small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat. Allow mixture to cool. Combine cornstarch and water in a small bowl. Remove excess fat from chicken. Dip each piece in water mixture, then in soy sauce mixture. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry chicken for about 5 minutes or until golden brown on each side. Drain chicken on paper towels. Serve with cucumber, pickled ginger.

Line glasses with graham cracker crumbs and granola cereal. In each glass combine 1/2 lemonade with 1/3 cup water- stir well. Top with vanilla ice cream and cool whip. Garnish with lemon slices or berries and serve immediately.

Crumble cornflakes in small bowl. Lightly beat egg with fork and place in another bowl. Combine cornflakes and seasonings. Dip chicken in egg. Roll in cornflake mixture. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Fry chicken until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm.

Combine beef, yellow onion and garlic salt in large skillet. Cook until beef is no longer pink. Stir in salsa. Heat through. In 1 1/2 qt. baking dish, layer refried beans, corn bread mix and beef mixture. Add water if needed. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 20 to 30 minutes until hot. Let set for 15 minutes before cutting. Yields 6 servings.

Dice the Spam into small cubes. In a large bowl mix the Spam with the mustard and sugar. Stir in the water. Mix the butter with the cloves and vinegar. Drizzle over the Spam mixture. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool. Store in the refrigerator. Cut into thin slices for sandwiches.

Peel 5 large ripe peaches. Slice 2 of the peaches. Set aside the remaining 3. Combine the sliced peaches and remaining 3 whole peaches in a blender. Add the milk, juice concentrate, sugar, vanilla and ice cubes. Process until smooth. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Season trout with salt and pepper. Dip fish into beaten egg and then into seasoned flour. Shake off excess flour. Melt butter in a shallow baking dish and place fish in pan. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until fish flakes with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges and toasted almonds.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Combine ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, provolone cheese and parmesan cheese in a medium bowl. Add parsley and breadcrumbsseason to taste with salt and pepper. Divide cheese mixture evenly between chicken breasts. Fold up sides of chicken to enclose mixture. Wrap each stuffed breast with a piece of baconsecure with wooden picks. Lay each stuffed breast on the prepared baking sheet. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken breasts in the skillet for 3 minutes on each side. Place in the oven and bake for 20 minutes, or until no longer pink inside. Serve immediately.

Grease 8 x 4-inch loaf pan with cooking spray. Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Beat butter on medium-low speed with an electric mixer for 1 minute. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the bananas. Add the flour mixture and beat on low speed until combined. Stir in the nuts and the candied fruit. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour or until golden brown. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool on wire rack. Drizzle with frosting.

Preheat oven to 350 f (175 c). In a large bowl, cream together butter, brown sugar, vanilla essence, caster sugar, egg until well blended. In a separate bowl combine flour and baking powder. Add to creamed mixture and beat until thoroughly blended. Fold in milk chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets, spacing 2 inches apart. Bake for 8 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Remove from oven and cool on wire racks for 5 minutes before removing to racks to cool completely. Makes 5 dozen cookies.

In a large skillet, brown pork chops in oil. Add water and rice blend. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in whole tomatoes, scallions and golden raisins. Cover and simmer until rice is tender. Makes 4 servings. Serve over rice.
Cook vegetables. Chop vegetables. Mix with remaining ingredients. Form into patties. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

Spread 1 side of each bread with a thin layer of pesto. Spread other side with mayonnaise. Top 1 bread slice with 3 slices turkey and top with cheese. Place the other bread slice, cheese side down, over the top of the sandwich. Place sandwiches in the skillet and cook over medium-low heat for 5 minutes per side. When cooking is complete, remove from skillet and slice in half. Place half of the sandwiches on each plate and top with tomatoes and onions. Serve immediately.

Combine rice with hot water in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to a simmer and cover pan. Cook until water is absorbed and rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Transfer rice to a bowl. Chop cucumber into small pieces. Mix cucumber with feta cheese, olives, rice, olive oil, vinegar, oregano, salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate salad until serving time.

In a saucepan over medium heat, saute the onions and green peppers until tender. Add the garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper to taste. Add ground beef and brown thoroughly. Add tomato paste and water. Add remaining ingredients except hamburger buns and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve on hamburger buns and garnish with pickles, if desired. Makes 4 servings.
In a slow cooker add the beans and 8 cups water. Mix in the remaining ingredients. Cover and cook on high for 6 to 8 hours. Serve with burritos, tortilla chips or rice. Serves 8 to 10.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cut cauliflower into florets. Mix with onion, garlic cloves, and 2 tablespoons water. Cook over medium heat until tender. Drain the liquid from cauliflower. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Toss the cauliflower with chili powder. Add codfish fillets. Toss well to coat. Add wine and cover. Bake for 10 minutes. Uncover. Cook for 10 minutes longer. Sprinkle with parsley.

Combine sugar, brown sugar, butter flavor shortening in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until sugar is melted. Bring to a boil. Boil without stirring until candy thermometer reads 300 degrees F. Remove from heat. Add eggnog stirring until well blended. Pour into a greased 13x9x2 inch pan. Let cool completely. Cut into 1 inch squares. Roll in powdered sugar. Makes 18 servings.

Heat oil in a large pot. Add escarole, garlic and red pepper flakes. Saute until escarole is tender. Add tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add beans and macaroni and cook until macaroni is done. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with pecorino romano cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease a 12 cup muffin pan. Mix milk and egg substitute. Combine wheat bran and remaining dry ingredients. Add sugar and baking powder to milk mixture. Add oil to dry mixture. Stir liquid into dry until just combined. Add raisins and stir until incorporated. Spoon batter into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes until tops are lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and cool in pan for 5 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, combine the biscuits and sugar. Cut the ice cream into 1-inch cubes and gently stir into the dry biscuit mixture. Pat the ice cream mixture into a 9-inch pie pan and spread the brown sugar over the top. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool for 30 minutes and cut into 12 squares.
