Dust with cinnamon and garnish with the raisins.

Cut avocado in half lengthwise and remove pit. Scoop out flesh and place in a bowl. Stir in sour cream and season with salt. Stir in roquefort cheese and jalapeno. Top with sliced scallions. Serve with blue corn tortilla chips and garnish with paprika.

Mix pineapple, soymilk, minute tapioca and vanilla in a sauce pan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer until tapioca is tender (about 5 minutes). Add berries. Makes 3 servings. Serve cold.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). In a small bowl, mix the cream cheese, chipotle chile in adobo sauce and cilantro until smooth. Fold in the green onions and garlic. Unroll the crescent roll dough onto a lightly floured surface. Use a rolling pin to roll out the dough into a 12x8 inch rectangle. Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over the dough, leaving about a 1/2 inch border on each long side of the dough. Roll the dough up tightly starting from one long side of the dough until the entire dough is rolled up. Pinch the seam of the roll shut to seal. Cut the dough into slices and place on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until the rolls are golden brown, about 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Mix together the first 3 ingredients in a medium saucepan. Heat over low heat until the butter melts. Stir until the mixture is smooth. Add the corn flakes and stir until coated. Remove from heat. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Cool. Store in a tightly covered container. Makes 3 dozen.

Combine milk, sugar, and salt in a large saucepan over medium heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture is boiling. Remove from heat and stir in cherry gelatin until dissolved. Pour into a 9-inch square pan. Spread to evenly cover bottom of pan. Chill until slightly set, about 1 hour. Meanwhile, combine butter and chocolate chips in a small microwaveable bowl. Microwave at 50 percent power until chips are melted, about 1 1/2 minutesstir until smooth. Spread mixture over chilled gelatin layer. Chill until set, about 2 hours. Drizzle with cherry syrupsprinkle with cherries and coconut flakes.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add the pecans and stir gently to coat. Cool in pan. Spread on waxed paper to cool completely. Store in an airtight container. Makes 4 cups.

Combine mustard, corn syrup, dry mustard, vinegar and cayenne pepper in a blender. Blend until smooth. Add mayonnaise and soy sauce. Blend again until smooth. Adjust seasonings with sugar, cayenne pepper or vinegar. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix flour, 1/2 cup of sugar and salt. Add 2 tablespoons of butter. Using pastry blender, blend until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add cold water in 1/2 cup increments, stirring between each addition, until mixture holds together when pressed with fingertips. Gather dough into ball and flatten into 1-inch thick disk on lightly floured surface. Roll dough in 12-inch circle to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Fold dough in half. Place in pie plate. Fold bottom half over top half in overlapping turns to form a double-crust edge. Pinch edges to seal. Place on baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes or until light golden brown. In large saucepan, combine rhubarb with 1 cup of water and 1/3 cup of sugar. Bring to boiling over medium-high heat. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered for 10 minutes or until rhubarb is tender. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon
Dissolve Italian dressing and French dressing in water. Add beef, onions and garlic. Heat to boiling. Add hot sauce. Simmer 3 hours. Chill and serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl combine beef, breadcrumbs, milk, egg, brown sugar, salt and pepper, and mix well. Divide beef mixture into four loaf pans, and form into loaf shapes. Bake 45-50 minutes until browned on top. Mix catsup with water, and pour over meatloaf. Bake another five minutes, and serve.

Preheat oven to 350. In a mixing bowl beat butter until creamy. Add brown sugar and beat until smooth. Add eggs one at a time mixing after each. Add vanilla. Beat until smooth. In a separate bowl sift together the flour and salt. Add to butter mixture. Stir until combined. Spray a 9 inch square pan with cooking spray. Press mixture into pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with chopped Skor bars. Bake for another 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Drizzle with caramel sauce. Cool completely before cutting into bars. Makes 16 bars.

Boil 1 cup water. Add coffee beans and boil for 5 minutes. Remove coffee beans and discard. Combine remaining ingredients and boil for 5 minutes. Strain liquid through cheesecloth. Cool. Serve chilled.

Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, reduce heat to low and cook potatoes until tender but still firm, about 10 minutesremove potatoes from water and set aside to cool for 5 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together pickle juice and mustard powderset aside. Place potatoes in a large bowl and add in the onion, fresh dill and picklestoss to coat. Add in the dressing and mayonnaisetoss to coat again. Season salad with kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste. Chill for 1 hour before serving.

Pour olive oil into a large jar with a tight-fitting lid. Add garlic and basil. Add orange and lemon zests. Add the olives and the vinegar. Add the crushed red-pepper flakes. Cover the jar and shake it to blend. Let stand for 1 hour. Remove olives with a slotted spoon and serve.

Heat a nonstick saute pan over medium-high heat until very hot. Add pancetta and shallot. Cook for about 5 minutes, until pancetta is crisp and brown and shallot is soft but not brown. Remove from heat, add green beans and toss to coat. Season to taste with coarse salt and ground black pepper and sprinkle with balsamic vinegar. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Wash potatoes well. Cut into quarters. Place in baking pan with enough water to come 1/2 way up sides of potatoes. Cover with lid or foil. Bake 20 minutes or until just tender. Heat skillet over medium heat. Add butter and onion, saute 1 minute. Add garlic and saute 1 minute more. Add sour cream. Stir to combine and heat through. Mash potatoes with mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

In skillet over medium heat, saute the onion and bell pepper until tender. Drain the gnocchi. Add flour to onion& bell peppers. Cook until roux is brown. Add chicken broth and half-and-half. Bring to boil. Add gnocchi. Cook until heated through. Add chicken. Stir until chicken is heated through. Season with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Garnish with green onions. Serve.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add chicken broth, taco seasoning mix, kidney beans and corn. Cook until corn is tender-crisp about 8-10 minutes. Set aside. Prepare chicken breasts by adding taco seasoning mix and cooking in olive oil until done. Add salsa to chicken breasts, then top each chicken breast with 2 tablespoons cheese. Place each breast on a tortilla. Fill the tortillas with some of the chicken, cheese and corn mixture. Roll up the tortillas around the filling and place in baking pan. Spray tortillas lightly with cooking spray. Bake at 350F for 10 minutes or until tortillas are crispy on top. Serve on a bed of lettuce with tomatoes and tortilla chips. Serve with ranch dressing.

Place pears in the bread machine pan. Add all remaining ingredients in the order recommended by your machine manufacturer. Select dough cyclestart machine. When cycle is complete, remove dough from pandivide into two equal portions. Shape each portion into a loafplace in greased 8-1/2 x 4-1/2 inch loaf pans. Coverlet rise in a warm place (85f) for 35 minutes or until double in bulk. Bake at 375f for 40 minutes or until loaves are well browned and sound hollow when tapped. Remove from panscool on wire racks. Wrap and store loaves at room temperature. Makes two loaves.

Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans. Beat the vegetable oil and butter with an electric mixer on medium speed until creamy. Gradually add the white sugar and continue beating until fluffy. Beat in the vanilla. Add the egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each addition. Sift the flour with the salt and baking powder. On low speed, add the flour mixture alternately with the half and half, beating until just blended. Divide the batter evenly between the pans. Bake until cakes are golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Cool the cakes in their pans for about 10 minutes and then turn out onto wire racks to cool completely.

Hard boil eggs. Cool and peel. Cut eggs in half lengthwise and remove yolks into medium bowl. Mash yolks well. Add blue cheese, mayonnaise, parsley, tabasco, and celery salt. Mix well. Stuff yolk mixture into egg halves. Sprinkle with celery rib for garnish. Serve chilled.

Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garliccook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, water and seasoning. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer uncovered for about 10 minutes until thickened. Stir in wine and salt to taste. Simmer 10 minutes longer, stirring occasionally. Serve over pasta of choice.

Mix the salad dressing with the spinach and spread it on half of the pizza crust. Top with the smoked salmon and walnut pieces. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and green onions. Drizzle with a little more salad dressing and top with a few capers. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes at 375 degrees F.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Unroll dough and separate into pieces about 1/2 inch thick. Twist each piece of dough into a letter of the alphabet and place on ungreased cookie sheets. Brush top of each twist with butter and sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Allow to cool slightly before removing from cookie sheets. Serve dunkers warm with peanut butter for dipping.

Boil apricots and sugar with enough water to cover them for 10 minutes. Stirring frequently to prevent burning. Turn off heat and leave to cool to room temperature. Whisk together gelatin and heavy cream and set aside to melt. Add apricot mixture to melted gelatin and stir to combine. Cool completely then churn as you would ice cream and transfer to a freezer safe container to freeze for 4-5 hours or overnight. Serve with a bit of demerara sugar on top.

Rinse chicken breasts and pat them dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepper. Dip each breast into flour and shake off the excess flour. Melt butter in large skillet over medium high heat. Saute the mushrooms for about 3 minutes. Add the chicken breasts and cook until lightly browned. Add the realemon juice. Bring to a boil and cook for about 10 minutes until the juice is thickened. Remove from heat and stir in the sugar. Serve over cooked rice with fresh mushrooms. Serves 4.

Cook the rice according to directions on package and let cool. Chop the onion. Rinse and dry Swiss chard leaves. Slice leaves from stems and discard stems. Wash and dry parsley. Cut parsley leaves from stems. In a large bowl whisk together eggs. Add rice, onion, Swiss chard leaves, parsley and herbs. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in Parmesan cheese. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Using a large spoon or ice cream scoop form small round balls of rice mixture. Drop rice balls in hot oil and fry until golden brown. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with salt.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Boil water. Add macaroni and cook according to package directions. While macaroni is cooking combine mayo with soup in a bowl. Remove macaroni from heat. Drain, rinse with cold water. Transfer to a buttered baking dish. Combine mayo mixture and cheddar cheese. Stir until smooth. Pour over macaroni. Sprinkle with pimiento. Top with buttered Ritz crackers. Bake for 30 minutes or until brown. Serve.

Slice and sautee onion in butter until transparent. Beat egg whites until stiff. Combine with crumbs, salt, thyme, paprika and pepper. Form into 1 inch rings. Place rings in baking dish. Add milk. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 f for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Butter and flour two loaf pans. Melt butter in a large bowl and whisk in brown sugar and eggs. Stir in flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Stir in buttermilk and vanilla extract until just combinedstir in berries until combined. Divide batter between prepared loaf pans. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool loaves in pan for 5 minutesremove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack.

Heat a large saute pan over medium heat. Add olive oil and onion and cook about 3 minutes until slightly softened. Add cherry tomatoes and cook 2 minutes or until soft. Season with salt & pepper. Remove from heat and set aside. Heat a medium fry pan over medium-high heat. Add oil and turkey and cook 2 minutes per side until browned and cooked through. Assemble each pita by adding the turkey, onion & tomato mixture, lettuce and basil. Season with balsamic and salt & pepper as desired. Drizzle with balsamic glaze or additional olive oil.

Mix together the chicken tenders and the creole seasoning. Heat the oil in a frying pan. Add the chicken and fry until done. Add the soup. Mix well. Add the chicken broth. Heat through. Serve with rice.
Mix together the first 5 ingredients and chill for at least 4 hours or overnight. Just before serving stir in the whipped topping. Serve with fruit of your choice or tortilla chips.

Beat egg yolks in a bowl. Combine the canola oil and vinegar in a separate container. Add 1/4 of the hot oil to the egg yolks a little at a time while beating. Add the remaining oil in the same manner. Add sugar, mustard powder, black pepper and egg. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add rice vinegar and mix well. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours or overnight.

In a pitcher combine 1 lemon sliced in half (with seeds removed), 1 teaspoon brown sugar, 1/2 cup water, 1/3 cup white sugar. Fill a 3/4-liter bottle 3/4 full of ice cubespour in lehmonade to fill. Shake wellpour into 4 glassesserve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Wash the spinach leaves thoroughly. Remove the stems and discard. Grind the leaves in a blender to a coarse paste. Heat 2 tbsp. oil in a pan. Add the onion and saute until golden brown. Add the red chili powder and saute for a minute. Add the ground spinach and cook for another minute. Remove from heat. Cool and blend well with yogurt. Add salt and black pepper to taste. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve as a side dish.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. In a small bowl, stir together butter, brown sugar, paprika, cumin, chili powder and cider vinegar. Place pecans in a large shallow bowl. Pour butter mixture over pecans. Toss to coat. Spread on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Cool. Store in a tightly covered container. Yields 2 cups.

Cream butter with sugar, add pure vanilla extract, add egg and beat again. In another bowl combine flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add to sugar mixture beating at low speed with mixer. Shape into 1 inch balls and roll in candy sprinkles. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 for 12-14 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 1 minute on baking sheet then remove to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit and line a baking sheet with foil. Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the soy sauce and the garlic and saute until the garlic begins to brown lightly, about 1 minute. Add the ginger and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the green beans and saute until the beans are bright green and tender, about 5 minutes. Remove the beans from the heat and stir in the walnuts. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with lime juice and cilantro. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350. Season salmon with salt and pepper. Heat 1 T. oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add salmon. Cook until just cooked through about 4-5 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate. Whisk together cornstarch, vinegar and 1/4 c. water in a small bowl. Whisk in remaining 1/4 c. water. Whisk in orange juice and brown sugar. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Boil 1 minute. Pour sauce over salmon. Bake uncovered 5 minutes. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350. Combine all ingredients in a ziploc bag. Place pork tenderloin in bag and marinate for 1-2 hours. Remove pork from bag. Place on a broiler pan. Broil in oven for 8-10 minutes per side. Let rest for a few minutes. Cut pork tenderloin into 1/4 inch slices.

In a large bowl whisk the eggs. In another bowl combine the parmesan, italian seasoning, and panko. Dip the tenderloins into the eggs then into the parmesan mixture. Place onto a cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until the breadcrumbs are golden brown. Enjoy!

Cook broccoli florets in a large pot of boiling water until just tender, about 2 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a medium bowl, combine broccoli with olive oil, 1 teaspoon of the cumin seeds, 1 teaspoon of the fennel seeds and 1 pod of the cardamom. Spread broccoli evenly in a shallow baking dish and sprinkle with salt. Roast for 20 minutes. In a blender, combine the yogurt with the remaining 1 teaspoon of the cumin seeds and the remaining 1 teaspoon of the fennel seeds and cardamom. Puree until smooth. Serve with broccoli.

Heat oven to 350. Grease 13x9-inch pan. Cut sweet bread into 1/2 inch cubes. Place in large bowl. Add milk, sugar, eggs and vanilla. Stir well. Add apple pie filling. Spoon half of mixture into pan. Layer with raisins. Spoon remaining bread mixture over raisins. Bake 40 to 50 minutes or until knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Cut into squares to serve.
In small bowl combine pineapple, carrot, cheddar cheese and mayonnaise. Toss to blend. Place on lettuce leaves. Garnish with additional pineapple and carrot.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute onion until tender. Add garlic, sugar and beef bouillon cubes. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add wine and cook until slightly reduced. Add mushrooms. Stir until mushrooms are lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and return it to the pot. Add the lemon juice and 1 tablespoon honey. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon honey in the microwave until very warm, about 45 seconds. Add the half-and-half and stir until heated through. Toss with the pasta. Serve warm or chilled, garnished with a few hazelnuts.

VARIATION I: Mix beef with stuffing mix. Pat into a round 1/4 cup loaf. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes.VARIATION II: Mix beef, stuffing mix, water, garlic powder. Shape into a small loaf. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes.VARIATION III: Mix beef with stuffing mix. Shape into a small loaf. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes. Spread top with barbecue sauce. Bake for another 10 minutes.

Heat a large sauce pan with the olive oil on medium heat. Add the onion to the pan and sauté until translucent. Add the garlic and sauté for another minute. Add the beans and boiling water to the pan and simmer for 1 hour or until the beans are soft. Add the pasta to the pan and stir to combine. Add the rosemary and sage and stir to combine again. Simmer for another 10 minutes or until the pasta is al dente. Sprinkle with bacon bits before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Line an 8x8 inch baking dish with foil. Spray with cooking sprayset aside. Combine the carrots, butter, 1 cup of the pecans, and the brown sugar in a large microwave safe dishmicrowave on high for 3 minutesstir in the milkmicrowave on high for an additional 4 minutes or until the carrots are tender and the liquid is absorbedstir in the flour and the saltcook and stir for 1 minute longer or until the mixture is smooth and thickened. Fold in the remaining 1/2 cup pecans and the eggspour the mixture into the prepared baking dishbake for 20 minutes or until the top is golden brownsprinkle the carrots with the orange rind and the nutmegserve.

Layer salad greens, black beans, frozen corn, and salsa on a large platter or individual serving plates. Top with monterey jack and cheddar cheese blend and ranch dressing. Garnish with tortilla chips and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Wash and dry potatoes. Pierce each potato 3-4 times with a sharp knife. Place potatoes on a foil lined cookie sheet. Bake for 1 hour. Let potatoes cool to room temperature. Cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out center of each potato. Place Boursin cheese in a bowl and mash. Add whipping cream and mash again. Season with salt and pepper. Stuff each potato with cheese mixture. Garnish with fresh parsley and red caviar.

Prepare a 9x13 baking dish by lining it with waxed paper. In a heavy saucepan combine the brown sugar, milk, butter, baking powder, salt and vanilla. Cook over medium heat until the butter has melted and the mixture thickens like thick custard (about 10 minutes). Remove from the heat and stir in the nuts. Pour into the prepared baking dish, smooth with a spoon and cover with waxed paper. Place the dish in the freezer until firm (about 4 hours). Remove the candy from the freezer and cut into squares with a sharp knife. Wrap each piece of candy with waxed paper. Store in the freezer until ready to serve. To serve, place a piece of candy on a serving plate and cover with a small amount of milk. Let the milk soften the candy for about 30 seconds before eating. To see your cooking time and temperature. Also sometimes the lower the temp-- and longer baking gives a chewy centre cookie--.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut cauliflower into bite-sized florets. Place florets in a bowl. Add cream cheese, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, chicken bouillon, pepper, and butter. Stir until well blended. Spread florets onto a baking sheet. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until florets are brown. Sprinkle with chives.

Combine the potatoes, artichokes, red peppers and green onions in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine the olive oil, lemon juice, vinegar and oregano. Toss with the vegetables. Season with salt and pepper. Chill. Garnish with additional chopped green onions.

Cover a large baking dish with foil. Place frozen broccoli in the baking dish and cover with foil. Bake for 2 hours. Drain the broccoli and discard the liquid. Mix with butter and garlic salt and pepper. Place in the same baking dish and cover with foil. Bake for 1 hour. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake until cheese is melted. Serves 4.
Process almonds until they are the consistency of almond flour. Add remaining ingredients and process until smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Combine the yogurt with the cardamom, ginger and salt to taste. Set aside. Heat the oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are lightly browned all over. Add the yogurt mixture and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked. Remove from the heat and serve garnished with the almonds.

Preheat the oven to 400F. In a small bowl mix together the garlic, sherry, bean paste, water, hoisin sauce and sugar. Put the ribs in a baking dish and pour in the sauce. Cover and bake for 40-45 minutes. Remove from oven. In a small bowl mix together soy sauce and sesame oil. Pour over ribs. Bake for 15 minutes more.
Peel and cut carrots. Melt butter in saucepan. Add carrots and sugar and cook until soft. Stir in whisky and simmer for 1 minute. Makes 3 to 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl combine the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, salt and garlic powder. In a separate bowl beat together the egg and buttermilk. Add the egg mixture to the dry mixture and stir to combine. Fold in the onion. Drop the batter by spoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes or until lightly golden brown. Serve hot. Makes 10-12 hush puppies.

Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla. Add the flour and baking soda. Mix well. Stir in nuts and raisins if using. Chill dough for one hour. Roll in balls and place on cookie sheet 2 inches apart. Bake for 10 minutes in a preheated 350 degree oven or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and allow to cool for a minute or two before removing from cookie sheet to cool completely. Makes about 6 dozen cookies
Place all ingredients in a sauce pan and cook over med heat until thickened. Serve hot.

In a medium bowl, combine the chocolate and butter. In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Remove from the heat. Add the coffee and stir to dissolve. Add the orange juice and sugar. Stir to dissolve. Add the egg yolks one at a time, stirring constantly. Return the mixture to the boil over medium heat. Cook for about 2 minutes or until thick. Strain into a bowl. Let cool slightly. Beat the egg whites with an electric mixer on medium speed until soft peaks form. Gradually add the sugar and beat on medium speed until stiff peaks form. Fold one-fourth of the whites into the chocolate mixture. Add the cream and vanilla. Fold the remaining whites into the mixture. Pour the mousse into a baking dish and refrigerate. Garnish with orange slices or berries. Serve cold. Serves 6.
Place all the ingredients in a bowl, mix well. Serve as a side dish with fish or meat.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saute until tender. Add sausage and saurkraut. Cook until hot. Serve with crusty bread.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cream together the shortening and sugars in a large bowl until well mixed. Add the eggs and beat until light and fluffy. Stir in vanilla and soda. Combine the flour and oatmeal and stir into the shortening mixture just until blended. Stir in the dates. Roll into 1-inch balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheet and cool on wire rack. Roll in powdered sugar if desired. Makes about 60 cookies.

Bring the barley and water to the boil in a saucepan, cover and cook for about 20 minutes until the barley is tender. Drain, rinse under cold water until cool. Meanwhile, place the pepper and corn in a bowl and toss with the parsley, oil and vinegar, cover and leave until ready to serve. Serve the barley in the bowl with the vegetables.

Soak couscous in chicken stock for about 20 minutes. In the meantime, mix yogurt with tahini. Combine all the veggies with the tuna, capers, lemon juice & tahini sauce. Drain the couscous & stir into the tuna mixture.

Combine butter and sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Beat in vanilla. In a separate bowl combine sour cream and cream of tartar. Slowly add sour cream mixture into butter mixture. Add flour alternately with sour cream. Bake for 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted into cake comes out clean. Cool on wire rack.

In a bowl toss together chicken, cherries& pecans. In another bowl mix mayonnaise, yogurt, lemon juice& black pepper. Add the dressing to the chicken mixture& toss to coat. Layer the salad evenly onto lettuce leaves. Serve with plain croissants.

Preheat oven to 350f. Butter a 1 quart casserole dish. Cut bread into cubes and arrange in the bottom of dish. Beat egg with coffee creamer. Pour over bread. Mix together caramels and pecans. Sprinkle over bread mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Serves 2. Serve with ice cream.

In large skillet over med heat saute onion in oil until tender. Add beef, brown thoroughly. Add tomato paste and water. Simmer uncovered until sauce is thickened stirring often. Add sugar, salt, black pepper & parsley to taste. Cook noodles according to directions. Drain. Top with cheese. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes until hot & bubbly.

Cook the macaroni according to the directions on the package. Drain and set aside. In a large mixing bowl, combine the macaroni, chicken, cream, eggs, and seasonings. Pour mixture into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese and bake 5 minutes longer. Serves 6 to 8.

Bring a large pan of water to the boil. Salt it well, then add pasta and cook according to instructions on packet. Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add bacon and fry until crisp. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until softened. Add cream to pan with sage leaf and bring to simmer. Add peas to pan and cook for 1 minute until heated through. Drain pasta and toss with pan contents. Sprinkle with Parmesan and serve immediately.

Mix together the corn flakes, flour, seasoning salt, pepper and poultry seasoning in a shallow dish. Beat the eggs in a shallow dish. Dip the chicken strips into the flour mixture and then into the egg. Place the chicken in a greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. In a small bowl mix the soup and milk. Pour the mixture over the chicken strips, cover tightly with foil or lid and bake for 1 hour at 400 degrees F. Uncover and bake for another 30 minutes or until cooked through. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Prepare pie shell as per recipe. Spread rhubarb in bottom of shell, sprinkle with sugar. Spread strawberries over rhubarb. Combine butter and brown sugar to melted butter consistency. Stir in egg yolks. Pour over strawberries and rhubarb in shell. Bake in preheated oven at 350 for 45 to 55 minutes or until custard is set. Cool before cutting.

Cook broccoli florets according to package directions. Combine broccoli and romaine lettuce in large bowl. Crumble cooked chicken over top and toss to coat. Top with apple slices, pecans and golden raisins. Toss again. Serve immediately with fat-free italian salad dressing.

Preheat oven to 350. Coat a 13-inch-by-9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a medium bowl combine the fish with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Spread the fish in an even layer in the baking dish. In a blender or food processor combine the tomatoes, breadcrumbs and nuts. Pulse until the mixture is finely ground. Add 1 tablespoon lemon juice and 1/4 teaspoon salt and pulse to combine. Sprinkle the mixture over the fish. Drizzle with butter. Bake until the fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork, 15 to 20 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Place potatoes in a saucepan of boiling water and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain, cool slightly then mash well with a fork. Mix milk and egg together with mashed potato until smooth. Add yoghurt, spring onions, ham, flour and salt to form a soft dough. Turn into a greased 12-hole muffin pan and bake at 180°C for 15-20 minutes until golden. Serve warm with a dollop of butter.

Bring the coffee to the boil in a small saucepan. Add the golden caster sugar and stir until the sugar dissolves and the liquid thickens slightly. Add the rum to taste. Leave to cool slightly before transferring to a jug or pitcher. Squeeze the lemon juice into the ricotta cheese to prevent it drying out. Mix the cheese with the double cream until smooth. Gently stir the ricotta cream into the coffee mixture to make the creams. Spoon into small glasses, then arrange the raisins on top of each cream. Dust with icing sugar before serving.
Cut fish into chunks. Combine fish with cream cheese and cream in a mixing bowl. Stir well and add lemon juice and garlic salt to taste. Add onion and chill before serving. Serve with crackers.

Combine sauerkraut with the spareribs, the paprika, beef bouillon cubes, and the caraway seeds. Add the pepper to taste. Bring the sauerkraut to a boil and then reduce the heat to medium. Add the flour and stir until the sauce thickens. Add the bacon and stir. Serve hot.

Marinate steaks in refrigerator for 1 hour. Preheat a grill to high heat. Brush steaks lightly with olive oil and cook, turning once, until an instant-read thermometer reads 135f for medium rare steak or 145f for medium steak. Let steaks rest for 10 minutes before slicing into 1-inch pieces. Place steak onto a serving platter. Drizzle steak with pan juices or cooking oil. Garnish with sliced onion rings and sprigs of fresh rosemary. Serve immediately.

Combine chicken, giardiniera, dressing, oregano and parsley in a small bowl. Spoon mixture evenly into pita pockets. Spray pita pockets with cooking spray before baking. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes or until crispy. Garnish with lettuce leaves.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Mix soup and sour cream. Add spinach. Heat until just boiling. Remove from heat. Add water chestnuts. Stir in onions. Refrigerate. Spread in tortillas. Roll up. Cut in 1/2 inch pieces. Place on baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes. Serve with crackers. Makes 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Combine all ingredients in crockpot. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. Remove from crockpot and let stand 10 minutes. Serve with sliced onions and horseradish sauce.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Butter a 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the eggs, cream cheese, butter, sugar, and vanilla extract. Beat until smooth. Add the salt to taste. Add the noodles and mix until combined. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until the kugel is golden brown and firm. Cool slightly and serve warm or at room temperature. Serve with pralines for garnish.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add beef and cook until browned and crumbled, about 5 minutes. Stir in green pepper and onioncook 5 minutes. Add pasta saucecook 3 to 5 minutes or until heated through. Cook pasta in boiling water 9 to 11 minutes or until al dentedrain. Spread pasta in 2-quart shallow baking dishtop with beef mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover with foilbake 15 minutes. Remove foilsprinkle with oreganobake 5 minutes more or until cheese is melted. Makes 6 servings.

Combine all ingredients in a heavy-bottomed sauce pan. Cook over low heat until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat. Beat until smooth. Pour into an ungreased 8x8 pan and refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares. Makes about 24 squares.
In a small bowl combine the cream cheese and mayonnaise. Spoon into 4 small glasses or plastic containers. Top with 1 tablespoon each chopped onion and salami. Serve with crackers.

In small bowl combine flour and sugar. Using pastry blender or two knives cut together shortening and flour mixture until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add water and blend with fingers until mixture comes together. Divide dough into two equal portions and form into two discs. Wrap discs with plastic wrap and chill 30 minutes or up to 2 days. (optional) To blind bake pie shell place pie dough into 9 inch pie plate and flute edges as desired. Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Bake 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees fahrenheit and bake an additional 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Place roast in oven. Combine salt, pepper and fresh herbs. Heat 1 tsp oil in skillet. Add onion. Cook over medium heat until golden brown. Serve roast beef with gravy, onions and herb mixture. Sprinkle with fresh herb. Serve on toasted bread.

In a skillet saute cub steaks and rinds in butter until lightly brown and crispy. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine heavy cream and water. Pour over meat. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 20-25 minutes until meat is tender. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Serve with rice.
Mix margarine and sugar. Add soymilk. Add cocoa powder and oats. Shape into balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Store in the refrigerator. Great for desserts and snacks.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add orzo and stir until coated. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until orzo is tender. Drain and stir in cheese. Serve hot.

Cream butter and sugars. Add egg and vanilla and beat well. Combine flour, baking soda and salt. Add to creamed mixture and mix well. Stir in oats. Roll dough into 1-inch balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten slightly. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Place chicken in slow cooker. Pour dressing mix over chicken. Add water and soup. Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours or on high for 4-5 hours. Shred chicken. Stir in cream cheese. Serve over cooked pasta or rice.

Preheat oven to 325. Remove giblets from turkey. Rinse turkey inside and out. Pat turkey dry with paper towels. Rub inside and out with butter. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with rubbed sage. Sprinkle with paprika. Place in roasting pan. Roast for 45 minutes per pound, basting every 30 minutes with pan juices. Internal temperature should be 165. Allow to rest 20 minutes before carving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss the carrots with butter and sugar. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 40 minutes or until tender and lightly browned. In a small bowl combine the remaining 2 tablespoons butter with the spiced rum and nutmeg. Drizzle over the carrots and bake an additional 10 minutes. Serve warm.

In a small sauce pan over medium heat saute garlic in olive oil until golden brown, about 4 minutes. Add shrimp and mushrooms and saute for an additional minute or two just until the shrimp begins to turn pink. Add tomato, artichoke, salt and pepper and cook for an additional minute or two. Add the pasta and toss in sauce and parsley just before serving.

In a medium bowl, stir together all the ingredients except the olives. Cover and chill until ready to serve. Before serving, layer yogurt mixture with olives and sprinkle with green onions. Serve with tortilla chips. Makes 2 1/2 cups.

Brown sausage and drain fat. Add corn and simmer 10 minutes. Cool. Add milk and egg. Season with salt and pepper. Butter 13x9x2 baking dish. Layer 1/4 of crackers then 1/4 of sausage mixture. Repeat. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Top with tater tots. Bake additional 10 to 15 minutes.

In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add the onions and saute until softened. Add the potatoes and cook for 3 minutes. Add the sauerkraut and caraway seeds. Cook for 3 minutes. Add water to cover. Stir in the vinegar. Cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Ladle the soup into bowls. Stir in the sour cream. Garnish with the kielbasa.

Cook broccoli in microwave with 1 cup of water for 4 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a bowl mix eggs, mayo, onion, garlic powder, salt, baking powder and flour until well mixed. Add broccoli to mixture. Spray a baking dish with non-stick cooking spray or use butter. Pour mixture into dish. Sprinkle with soup mixes. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until done. Let set for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly coat a 13x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, beat together eggs and milk with a whisk. Add peppers and onion. Stir in sausage. Pour mixture into baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until firm in center. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Place the chicken in a large zip lock bag and add the dressing. Seal the bag. Marinate the chicken in the refrigerator at least one hour or up to 6 hours, turning the bag occasionally so the chicken is evenly coated in the dressing mixture. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the chicken in a shallow baking pan, skin side up. Sprinkle with rosemary and season with salt and pepper. Bake the chicken uncovered until the meat is tender when pierced with a fork, about 40 minutes. Drain the chicken on paper towels and pat dry. Coat the chicken with the bread crumbs until evenly coated. Drizzle with a little more salad dressing if desired. Serve hot or cold.

Heat the butter in a saute pan and add the onions and ginger and cook until softened. Add the chilies and cook for another minute or two. Add the eggs and scramble until just done. Add the heavy cream and salt and stir in the fresh cilantro and serve immediately.

In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, cilantro, cumin, and salt. Add the peas and gently toss to combine. Divide among two serving plates and top with the avocado and red onion. Sprinkle with the jalapeno and serve with tortilla chips.

In a large skillet cook beef over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in ramen noodles. In a bowl stir together stir-fry sauce and water until blendedpour over beef mixtureheat through. Stir in cauliflower and broccoli floretsheat through. Garnish with peanuts if desired. Serve over rice if desired.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender but still firm to the bite. Drain and return to hot pot to dry out a bit. Cool completely. Combine all the salad ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Combine the first 6 ingredients and the cocoa powder in a large bowl. Stir in the coconut. Drop by teaspoonful onto a cookie sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes. Cool. Makes 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 450f. Slice bread in half lengthwise. Brush both sides of bread slices with olive oil. Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet. Bake 4 minutes or until bread begins to brown. Rub garlic cloves on cut side of bread. Set bread aside. In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, basil, and salt and pepper to taste. Spread tomato mixture onto bread. Makes 2 servings.
Beat together cream cheese and sugar until well blended. Add cool whip. Beat until fluffy. Spread into the crust. Chill. Top with pie filling.

Combine half-and-half and skim milk in a medium-sized saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir in sugar, vanilla and egg substitute until well blended. Place bowl in freezer for 3 to 4 hours or until mixture is frozen and hard to stir. Remove mixture from freezer and place in food processor. Add 1/2 cup of the chocolate chips and pulse until mixture is crumbly and small pieces of chips are visible. Pour ice cream mixture into freezer-safe container and freeze for an additional 2 to 3 hours until firm. Garnish with remaining chocolate chips and serve immediately or store up to 1 week in freezer.

Cook macaroni and elbow macaroni in separate pots of boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain pasta and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion and bell peppers and cook for 5 minutes. Add pasta and mix well. Add dry mustard and mix well. Add water and bring to a boil. Add cheese and stir well. Cook for 2 minutes. Add olives and red peppers. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 450f. Lightly spray a large casserole dish with cooking spray and add the ravioli. Sprinkle with cheese. Place in the oven and cook for 15 minutes or until the cheese melts and the edges of the ravioli begin to brown slightly. In a small bowl combine the tomatoes with the basil and season with salt and pepper. Divide the tomato sauce evenly among the plates and arrange the ravioli in the center of each plate. Top with basil and a sprinkle of mozzarella cheese. Bake for an additional 1-2 minutes or until the cheese melts. Drizzle with olive oil and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a shallow dish or ziploc bag combine salt, garlic powder and pepper. Add tenderloin to dish or bag and coat with seasoning mixture. In a skillet saute the onions and celery in 2 tablespoons olive oil until tender. Add red wine and simmer for 2 minutes. Mix in the brown gravy mix. In a small bowl stir together the remaining olive oil and flour to make a paste. Brush the pork with the paste. Place tenderloin in a shallow baking dish and top with the vegetable mixture. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until the meat is no longer pink inside. Let rest for 5 minutes. Cut into 1/2 inch slices and serve.

Drain tuna, flake with a fork, place in a bowl with bread cubes. Mix well. In another bowl beat egg, milk. Add flour & salt. Beat until smooth. Add to tuna mixture, stirring constantly. Spoon into a shallow pan, sprinkle with corn flake crumbs. Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes or until firm. Serve hot or cold.

In a large bowl combine romaine lettuce and next 6 ingredients. Toss to coat. Divide among 4 bowls or plates. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon cheese. Sprinkle with tortilla chips. Drizzle with salad dressing.

Spread the butter on both sides of each piece of bread and place in the toaster oven on low until toasted. Remove from the toaster and spread each piece of bread with the fig preserves. Layer one slice of brie on one of the bread slices and top with one slice of prosciutto and the second piece of brie and cover with the second piece of bread. Cut the sandwich in half and serve.

Grease a 9 x 13 pan with cooking spray. Combine all ingredients in the pan and mix together well. Spread into the pan and let set for at least 2 hours before cutting into squares. Makes around 3 dozen 1-inch squares.

Combine all ingredients except chicken thighs in a crock pot. Turn crock pot on high and cook for about 4 hours or until chicken is done. Chicken can be served over rice or with mashed potatoes. If you wish to add more sauce to your chicken you can pour off the juice and boil it until the sauce is thickened. Then add the sauce back to your chicken before serving.

Heat oil in large pan. Add onion, carrot and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add minced beef and cook until browned. Add potato, water and bouillon cube. Simmer for 30 minutes. Season to taste. Serve and enjoy.

Cut zucchini into 1/2-inch slices. Place in a colander and sprinkle with salt. Let stand 15 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine oil and pine nuts. In a roasting pan toss zucchini with oil mixture and lemon zest. Roast at 375 degrees for 15 minutes or until tender. Toss with parsley and lemon juice.

Cook lean ground beef in skillet over medium heat. Drain fat. Stir in onion and water. Cook 2 minutes or until beef is done. Stir in salsa. Heat through. Place rice in microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high 1 minute. Stir in corn and peas. Microwave on high 1 minute. Stir. Spread rice mixture over beef. Sprinkle with cheese. Microwave 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Combine the flour and parmesan cheese in a large bowl. Add the garlic and chives and mix well. Add the butter and rub into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Make a well in the centre of the mixture. Add the water and stir until a soft dough forms. Turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Divide the dough in half and roll each half into a 20 cm (8 in) long sausage shape and place on a greased baking tray. Use a sharp knife to cut the sausage rolls into rounds and place the rounds 2cm apart on the baking trays. Bake the rolls for about 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature with salad and a lightly dressed tomato or capsicum salad.

To make the guacamole, combine all the ingredients in a bowl and stir. Refrigerate until serving. Preheat oven to 250 degrees. Brush tortillas with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and top with guacamole and sprinkle with cumin. Serve with tortilla chips.

Combine flour, salt and pepper in a large resealable plastic bag or large dish. Add rabbit piecesseal or cover and shake to coat evenly. Heat lard in a large skillet over medium heatadd rabbit pieces in a single layer and brown lightly. Drain well. Add enough water to cover rabbit pieces by 1 inch. Cover skillet and bring to a boil over medium-high heatreduce heat and simmer for 1 hour. Uncover skilletadd egg and breadcrumbs. Simmer, uncovered, over medium heat for 10 minutes or until mixture is thickened. Serve over noodles.

Cook pasta in boiling water according to package directions. Drainrinse with cold water. In a large bowl combine the beef, onion, salt, pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, and cumin. Mix well. In a 2-quart casserole, combine beef mixture, pasta, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, salsa, green chilies, and half the cheddar cheese. Pour into a 2-quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes. Sprinkle remaining cheddar over top. Bake 2 minutes more or until cheese melts. Top with Tabasco sauce.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Spread evenly onto the baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Store in an airtight container. Makes 8 cups.

Bake chicken breasts in oven for 45 minutes at 375 degrees. In separate casserole bake broccoli florets for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. In medium bowl, combine cream of celery soup, cream of mushroom soup, mayonnaise and milk. Add cheese to mixture. Place broccoli and chicken in casserole. Pour cheese mixture over chicken and broccoli. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Top with french fried onion rings.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add vegetable broth, lemon juice and split peas. Bring to boil, reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Add cinnamon, cumin and seasoning. Cook for an additional 5 minutes or until rice is tender.

In a large saute pan over medium heat saute the mushrooms and shallots until tender and lightly browned. Add the butter and saute until lightly browned. Add the tomatoes and cook until the liquid evaporates. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add the dry white wine and bring to a boil. Add the beef broth and tarragon. Simmer for about 15 minutes. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch with the water. Add to the saucepan. Stir constantly until the sauce thickens. Stir in the water and continue cooking until the sauce thickens. Serve over chicken breast.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Spread 1 tsp butter on the outside of one slice of bread. Sprinkle with taco seasoning mix and top with the jalapeno jack cheese. Place the other slice on top of the cheese with the butter side down. Grill sandwiches 1 minute on each side or until cheese is melted. Spread salsa on the inside of the sandwiches to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 8x8 inch square baking pan with butter.In a large bowl, combine the cocoa powder and sugar. Beat in butter and egg until smooth. In another bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and milk. Stir into cocoa mixture just until dry ingredients are moistened. Spread batter evenly in prepared pan.Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 20 minutes, then turn cake out of pan and allow to cool completely before frosting.In a small bowl, combine butter, cocoa powder and confectioners' sugar until well blended. Spread over cooled cake. Sprinkle with toasted coconut and candy sprinkles before serving if desired.

Cook potatoes in the microwave for about 7 minutes until tender. In the crock pot combine onion, bacon, broth, soup, water, milk and pepper and bring to boil. Cut potatoes in cubes and add to soup mixture. Cook on low for about 4 hours or until potatoes are tender. Serve hot with toppings of choice. I like to use shredded cheddar cheese.

Toss red potatoes in olive oil and salt and pepper to taste. Cook 10-15 minutes in preheated 400f oven. Saute garlic in olive oil in large skillet. Add shrimp and cook 2-3 minutes until pink. Add lemon juice and parsley and toss well. Remove from heat and serve over potatoes. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners or grease cups. Combine flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the center. Stir together yogurt, water, flaxseed mixture, vanilla extract. Pour into well in center of flour mixture. Fold flour mixture into yogurt mixture until just moistened. Fold in blueberries. Divide batter evenly among muffin cups. Bake in preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until tops are golden. Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes before removing muffins from pan. Makes 12 muffins.

Beat cream cheese till fluffy. Add pineapple, bell pepper & onion. Stir until combined. Add lemon pepper, seasoning salt & pecans. Press into serving bowl or ball mold. Chill until serving. Serve with crackers or veggies. Serves 12-16.

In a small bowl combine the butter, salsa and lime juice and zest together. Season with cumin salt and pepper. Spread on both sides of the fish fillets. Cook fish for 4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve immediately with a squeeze of lime wedge.
Dice cucumbers and sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 30 minutes. Drain cucumber well and put in a bowl. Add sour cream. Add vinegar and dill. Chill for at least one hour.

In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the oil and onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is golden brown and begins to caramelize. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add the potatoes and cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, covered, for about 30 minutes. Add the sausage and cook for 2 minutes more. Add the kale and cook for 5 minutes more. Stir in the salt and pepper and serve.

Cut off the bottoms of the asparagus spears to make them stand straight. Cut the tips off the spears to make them look nicer. Break off the woody ends of the spears. Arrange the spears in an ovenproof dish. Sprinkle with the parmesan. Dot with the butter. Season with the salt and pepper. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the spears are tender. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c). Brush bread slices with olive oil. Spread pesto on each slice, leaving about 1/2 inch around the edges without pesto. Top with peppers and sprinkle with cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Serve hot or warm. Yield 2 servings.

Combine ground turkey with taco seasoning and brown lightly. Place 1/2 cup of turkey mixture on each tortilla. Top with shredded cheese and roll up. Place in 13 x 9 pan sprayed with cooking spray. Pour enchilada sauce over tortillas. Bake 30 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with sour cream and tomatoes. Serve with lettuce and tomatoes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle salmon fillets with garlic salt and black pepper. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Dip each fillet in the butter and transfer to a baking dish. Combine the breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese and sprinkle over the top. Bake for 20 minutes. Top with lemon peel and thyme leaves.

Peel carrot and daikon radish, then slice into julienne. Put carrot and daikon radish in a non-reactive container with salt. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. In another container, mix vinegar with soy sauce. Bring to boil. Pour the hot liquid over the vegetables and let cool completely. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. When ready to serve, add ginger and sugar. Stir well. Let sit for at least 30 minutes. Drain before serving.

Bring chicken broth and milk to a boil. Stir in broccoli. Cook until tender. Stir in condensed soup and cornstarch. Heat until thickened. Add cheese and cook until melted. Stir in carrot. Refrigerate leftovers.

Fill a large saucepan halfway with water and heat it to a gentle boil. Add cinnamon sticks, allspice berries, orange strips and apple brandy. Top off the water so that it is about an inch above the spices and fruit. Cover the pan and simmer for about 10 minutes. Stir in apple cider and heat through. Remove spices and orange strips before serving. Serve hot.

Soften cream cheese in microwave for about 30 seconds. Mix in condensed milk and pudding. Beat with hand mixer for about one minute. Add milk to thin it out. Add vanilla. Spoon into graham cracker crust. Top with bananas and whipped topping. Sprinkle with bananas and vanilla wafers. Let set in fridge for at least one hour.

Cream butter and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix together. Add dry ingredients to wet and combine. Fold in marshmallow cream and coconut. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls 1 inch apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake in 350 degree oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on baking sheets for 1 minute. Remove from sheets to cool completely on wire racks. Makes about 5 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 8x8x2 baking pan. In large bowl, cream butter and sugars together. Beat in eggs one at a time. Add vanilla. In another bowl mix together flour and baking powder. Stir flour mixture into creamed mixture. Spread into prepared pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool 15 minutes. Cut into bars. For frosting, in small bowl mix together confectioners’sugar and milk until smooth. Drizzle over bars.

Wash tomatillos and drain well. Trim off stems. Cut tomatillos into halves or thirds depending on size. Blend all ingredients except oil in blender or food processor. Heat oil over medium heat. Add salsa and heat through for 5 minutes.

Combine cornmeal, almonds, sugar, double-acting baking powder, and cornstarch in a large bowl. Combine the water and oil in a small bowl. Add the liquid mixture to the dry mixture. Stir well. Pour batter into a 9 inch square pan. Bake for 30 minutes, or until golden brown.

Slice pork chops into bite-sized strips. Mix together all remaining ingredients in a bowl. Put strips in bowl & toss to coat. Cover & marinate in refrigerator for 24 hours. Drain & place in crockette. Cook on high for 6 hours or on low for 8 hours.

Cook pasta in boiling water until al dente6 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned and no longer pink in center, about 3 minutes per side. In a small bowl stir together flour and milkset aside. In a medium saucepan bring milk and 1/4 teaspoon salt just to a boil over high heat. Add pastareturn to a boil. Add chicken brothcover and remove from heat. Let stand 10 minutes. Add flour mixture and remaining 1/4 teaspoon saltstir until thickened and smooth. Stir in chicken and cornheat through. Divide pasta mixture evenly among 4 shallow bowls. Top with cheese and salsa. Yield: 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400. In large bowl, mix 1/4 cup sugar and ranch dressing mix. Spray shallow baking pan with cooking spray. Add carrots to bowl and toss to coat. Spread in pan. Bake for 30 minutes stirring once. Remove from ovensprinkle with remaining sugar. Bake 5-10 minutes. Serves 4-6.

In a medium bowl, stir together the sour cream and the cream cheese until smooth. Stir in the salsa. Spread into a 1-quart baking dish. Bake until bubbly and golden brown, about 30 minutes. Crumble the cheddar cheese over the dip and return to the oven to melt, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with the lettuce. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook chicken and set aside to cool. In a medium saucepan cook broccoli over medium heat for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. Mix soup and mayonnaise with broccoli and chicken. In a medium bowl combine broccoli mixture with curry powder, lemon juice and pepper. Spoon broccoli mixture into a 2-quart casserole dish. Combine cheese and breadcrumbs and sprinkle evenly over broccoli mixture. Bake for 25 minutes or until cheese is melted and lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Peel and cut potatoes into 1-inch pieces. In a large sauce pan melt 4 tablespoons butter and saute onion and potatoes until onion is clear and potatoes are tender. Add broth and milk to potatoes and cook over medium heat until potatoes are very tender and broth is slightly thickened. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley and 4 green onions thinly sliced. Reheat and serve. Serve with crusty french bread.

In crock pot combine kielbasa and onions and saute till brown. Add sauerkraut and enough water to just cover the cabbage. Add brown sugar and apple cider. Cook on low 8-10 hours or high 4-5 hours or until meat is tender. Serve over noodles or rice.

Mix cake mix, egg and butter together. Spread into 13x9 pan. Bake 15 minutes. Cool. Melt chocolate chips and butter. Spread over cooled cake. Sprinkle with nuts or coconut. Drizzle with sweetened condensed milk. Refrigerate. Cut into squares.
In a tall glass filled with ice cubes, combine mint leaves, lemon juice and rum. Add ice cubes to fill glass. Top with ginger ale and stir gently. Garnish with a slice of blood orange.

In a bowl mix together sour cream, soups, margarine, celery seed, salt, pepper, onion powder. Mix well until creamy and blended. Layer in a baking dish as follows: 1/2 of the mixture over bottom of dish1/2 of chicken over toprepeat until done. Bake at 350 F for 30 minutes or until heated through.

Mix margarine or butter with sugar in a saucepan. Stir in vanilla and eggs. Slowly mix in flour. Add salt and baking powder. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips and rice krispies. Spread mixture onto greased pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. Cut into squares when cool.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the fettuccine and cook until it is al dente. Drain. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the wine and cook until reduced by half. Add the lemon juice, parsley, parmesan cheese, and almonds. Toss to combine. Add the fettuccine to the skillet. Add the chicken breasts. Heat until the chicken is cooked through. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray loaf pan with cooking spray. Combine all of the ingredients in bowl. Mix well. Place mixture into pan. Bake for 40 minutes. Let cool slightly before cutting. Serve with lettuce leaves or slices of tomatoes. Serves 6.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Heat oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Add leeks. Sauté 3 minutes. Add garlic. Sauté 1 minute. Add tomatoes. Cook 3 minutes. Add wine. Cook 1 minute. Place salmon in skillet. Cook 3 minutes per side. Sprinkle with salt, pepper. Pour wine into skillet. Bake 3 minutes. Garnish with fresh dill.

Place the cherry pie filling into a bowl and sprinkle with the lemon juice. Set aside. Roll out the dough and cut into circles about 3-4 inches across using a round cutter or a glass. Place one teaspoon of cherry pie filling into the center of each round. Fold over half of the circle, brush the edges with egg and press together. Place onto an ungreased baking sheet and bake at 375F for about 20 minutes until golden brown. Mix the ground cinnamon with the almonds and sprinkle over the baked packages. Let cool for a few minutes then serve warm.
Blend margarine, sugar and vanilla together until smooth. Add coconut and nuts. Stir to blend. Add milk to reach desired consistency.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In large bowl, mix together first four ingredients. Add butter and mix until moistened. Stir in raisins. Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake 50 to 60 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Loosen sides from pan and remove from pan. Cool completely. Makes one loaf.

Combine stuffing mix with hot water. Add pineapple and butter and stir till moistened. Stir in green onions and seasoning to taste. Spread in a 9x13x2 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 6.

Combine cranberries, sugar, currant, raisin and apricot. Cook in saucepan until mixture is thick. Stir in vinegar. Place mixture in glass jar. Cover tightly. Store in refrigerator. To serve, spoon mixture over chicken or turkey. Garnish with tangerines and pecans. Serve with crackers.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 2Combine the potatoes, peppers, onions, and olive oil in a baking dish. Season with salt and pepper. 3Place the sausages on top of the vegetable mixture. 4Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. 5If desired, sprinkle with cheese before serving.

In a small bowl combine the olive oil, garlic and the spices. Add the prawns and mix well. Spread the prawns out on a baking tray and bake for about 4 minutes. Turn and bake for a further 4 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the coriander. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat and add the oil. Swirl around the pan until the oil is hot but not smoking. Add the bell pepper and green onions and stir fry until tender crisp, about 5 minute. Add the garlic and stir fry until fragrant about 30 second. Add the baby bok choy and stir fry until wilted about 2 minute. Add the sesame oil and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
Steam broccoli until tender crisp. In small bowl combine olive oil and lemon juice. Add garlic and stir in well. Add salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add broccoli and toss well.

Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium heat. Add onion, garlic cloves and thyme leaves. Saut 10 minutes, stirring often. Add carrot and saute until softened, about 10 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes with their juice, diced tomatoes with their juice, oregano, sugar, Italian seasoning, sausage and wine. Simmer until thickened, about 1 hour. Season with salt.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare cake mix as directed on package, except substitute water for milk and add 1/2 cup cookie crumbs to batter. Bake in cupcake pans until toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool completely. Frost with chocolate icing and garnish with gummy worms.

Put steak in a non-reactive dish with thyme and garlic. Pour over olive oil and lemon juice, sprinkle with salt and freshly ground pepper. Cover and marinade for 2 hours or overnight. Heat oven to 180C/350F/gas mark 4. Remove steak from marinade and pat dry with paper towel. Heat oil and butter together until smoking hot in an oven proof frypan and sear steak for about 5 minutes per side or until done to your liking. Baste with juices and cook for another minute or two if you prefer your steak medium rare and remove to plate. Season with freshly ground pepper and place in oven for 10 minutes or until cooked to your liking.

Heat olive oil in 12 inch skillet over med-high heat. Dust pork chops with lemon pepper. Add to skillet and cook 4 minutes on each side or until done. Pour 1/2 cup cider vinegar into skillet. Bring to boil. Add remaining 1/4 cup cider vinegar and lemon peel. Cook over med heat 3 minutes. Stir in marmalade and simmer 1-2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Serve chops over rice. Spoon sauce over all.

Combine chili powder, brown sugar and cumin in a small bowl. Rub over both sides of pork chops and set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chops and cook, turning once, until no longer pink in the middle and juices run clear, about 4 minutes per side. Remove pork chops from pan and keep warm. Add green beans and cook until crisp-tender, about 6 minutes. Add juice and cook until slightly reduced and thickened, about 1 minute. Serve pork chops with green beans and lemon wedges.

Cube steak and pound with meat mallet or rolling pin until 1/4 inch thick. Cook bacon and crumble. Heat oil in skillet and brown meat cubes. Add the onion, bacon and pickles. Add dry mustard, salt and pepper and garlic powder and mix thoroughly. Cook for several minutes and add beef bouillon cubes. Mix well and remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Lay out meat and add mixture to each piece of meat and roll up. Place in a 13x9 inch baking dish and top with more beef bouillon cubes and water to cover and bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees. Serve with mashed potatoes and gravy and vegetable of choice. Serves 6-8 people.

In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk and salt. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Dip each slice of bread in egg mixture, letting excess drip off. Add to skillet in a single layer. Cook until light golden brown on first side, about 2 minutes. Flip slices over and top with slices of cheese. Cook until cheese is just melted and bread is golden brown on second side, about 2 minutes more. Serve with sour cream or syrup if desired.

Melt the unsweetened chocolate and sugar in the top of a double boiler over hot water. Stir constantly until smooth. Remove from the heat. Add the butter and stir until melted. Pour into bowl and add the cocoa powder and vanilla. Cool to room temperature. Whip the heavy cream and pour into the cooled chocolate mixture. Stir until well blended. Refrigerate until ready to use. Makes about 1 cup.

Combine onion, jalapenos, garlic and oil in a small saute pan. Cook over low-medium heat until the onions are tender. Add the soy sauce and vinegar to the pan and bring to a boil. Add the brown sugar and reduce by half. Remove from heat and stir in cornstarch to thicken. Store in a sealed container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare blueberry muffin mix according to package directions, using 1/2 can cranberry juice. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full and bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown and baked through. Cool 10 minutes before removing from muffin cups. Mix 1/2 cup granulated sugar and 1 tablespoon cinnamon togetherroll warm cakes in this mixture to coat. In small bowl combine 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 can cranberry juice concentrate, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extractadd 2 tablespoons water. Dip warm cakes into this mixture to coat. Place cakes on wire racksprinkle with 2 tablespoons shredded coconut.

Combine rice vinegar, canola oil, honey, wasabi paste and a pinch of salt in a small bowl. Place garlic cloves in a small bowl and cover with rice vinegar mixture. Let stand for 15 minutes. Stir to mash garlic. In a large bowl combine edamame, cabbage and carrot. Add dressing and toss to coat. Add chicken and toss to combine. Serve on a bed of lettuce or mixed greens. Sprinkle with green onions and sesame seeds.

Sift together flour, bran, sugar. In separate bowl combine milk with soda. Add oil. Add to soda mixture. Add to dry ingredients. Mix well. Knead briefly. Divide into 3 equal pieces. Form into loaves. Place in greased loaf pans. Bake in 375 degrees oven for 1 hour. Cool before slicing. Serve warm. Makes 3 loaves.

In a medium size bowl, beat together the eggs, soy sauce and sake. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the carrots and onions and cook until tender-crisp, about 4-6 minutes. Add the beaten eggs and cook until almost set but still wet in the center, about 1 minute. Stir in the rice and cook until the rice is heated through and the eggs are set. Season with the salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Lightly brush both sides of one slice of bread with butterplace buttered side down on griddle and sprinkle with cheese. Grill until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown on bottom and crisp on edges. Repeat with second slice of bread. Meanwhile slice pear into 1/8 inch slices. Heat 1/2 tsp butter in skillet over medium-high heat until butter is foaming. Add pears and saute until pears are lightly browned and tender. Spread bottom slice of bread with salad dressingtop with lettuce, pear, and remaining slice of bread. Cut into wedges.

In large bowl, combine flour, oats, brown sugar, and butter. Press mixture firmly in bottom of 13x9 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, in small bowl combine preserves, extract and 1 cup almondsset aside. Spread evenly over crust. Combine 1 cup almonds with 1 tablespoon flour. Sprinkle over top. Bake 15 to 20 minutes more or until light golden brown. Let cool completely in pan. Cut into bars.

Place a can of sweetened condensed milk into a large bowl or a saucepan. Heat over a low flame stirring constantly until the milk has a thickened consistency. Remove from heat and stir in the chocolate chips and vanilla extract. Pour into a glass bowl or a 9x9 pan lined with foil and spread out to make it an even thickness. Sprinkle with walnuts if desired. Allow to cool before cutting into squares.

In a large skillet sauté onion and green bell pepper until soft. Add tomato sauce. Increase heat and bring to a boil. Add rice. Reduce heat to low. Cover skillet. Cook 10 minutes. Add chicken broth. Increase heat. Cook until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Cool. Preheat oven to 375. Cut bell peppers in half lengthwiseremove seeds and ribs. Place pepper halves in a greased baking dish. Spoon 1/4 cup of the rice mixture into each pepper half. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Cook on stove or in a crockpot. Use medium heat for crockpot. Cook until thickened. Add cinnamon and nutmeg. Serve with sliced bananas.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, mushrooms, bell peppers, eggplant & saute until tender. Stir in tomato sauce & chicken brothstirring occasionally, until mixture thickens. Season to taste with thyme leaves & mix in rice. Cook until rice is tender.

Preheat oven to 400f. Coat a shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Cut tomatoes in half. Place cut side down in baking dish. Add a little water to pan. Cover with foil. Bake until tomatoes are soft. In a bowl combine red wine vinegar, olive oil, whole grain mustard and basil. Whisk until mixture is smooth. Cut tomatoes in half and add to bowl. Add parsley and feta. Toss to combine. Season with pepper.

Brown ground beef with onion. Add tomatoes and their juice and simmer until liquid is reduced by half. Add carrots and beans and simmer for a few minutes more. Add beef gravy and simmer. Serve with biscuits and butter.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the linguine until al dente. Drain the pasta and place in a bowl. In a large skillet, combine the tomatoes, garlic, and basil. Bring to a boil over high heat. Stir to blend. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer about 10 minutes. Add the linguine to the tomato mixture. Stir to blend. Season with salt and pepper. Add the olives and feta. Toss well. Serve immediately.

Butter a 3 quart baking dish. Heat butter in a small saucepan. Add brown sugar and cook until melted. Remove from heat. In a medium bowl, beat together egg noodles and brown sugar mixture. Add beaten egg and beat until well mixed. Add butter, pecans and cinnamon. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 40 minutes. Sprinkle with confectioners sugar. Let stand 15 minutes before cutting.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine potato cubes in a bowl. Dot with butter. Add onion. Season with pepper. Bake in a greased shallow baking dish at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until potatoes are golden brown. Stir together soup, sour cream and milk. Remove potatoes from oven. Pour soup mixture over potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. In a separate bowl, combine ham, broccoli, corn flakes, butter, salt and pepper. Sprinkle over potatoes. Bake for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender about 20 minutes or until you can easily pierce them with a fork. Drain potatoes and place in a large mixing bowl. Heat the margarine over medium heat and saute the shallot and garlic for about 2 minutes. Add potatoes and rosemary and mix thoroughly. Add the nonfat milk and lightly mash the potatoes with a fork or potato masher. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350. Scrub potatoes and boil them in a medium pot of water with about 1/4 tsp salt until tender. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. In a small saucepan heat 1/2 cup milk and 2 tbsp of butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Melt the cheese in the microwave. Place the potato halves open faced on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Add the melted cheese to each potato half. Break an egg into each potato half and pour in the milk and seasonings. Bake for 20 minutes or until the egg is cooked. Serve immediately.

Sprinkle venison loin with salt and pepper. Drizzle with cooking oil and place loin in a shallow pan. Cover and marinate in refrigerator 3 to 4 hours. Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Place loin in a shallow pan. Add water to pan to cover the loin. Bring to boil. Cover and simmer 1 1/4 hours. Remove loin to a platter. Remove bay leaf and onion from liquid. Place loin on serving platter. Pour enough liquid to cover loin. Garnish with thyme sprigs. Serve hot.

Place cinnamon stick and nutmeg into water and bring to the boil. Simmer for about 5 minutes or until the liquid is reduced by half. Drain the fruit and set aside to cool. When the liquid has cooled slightly, add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the spices and continue to simmer for about 3 minutes or until the sauce has reduced by half. Remove from the heat and stir in the Drambuie. Set aside until completely cool then place the fruit into sterilised jars and cover with the syrup. Seal and store for up to 3 months.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Remove any excess fat from chicken breasts and cut into bite-size pieces. In a skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Sprinkle in flour and stir until lightly browned. Stir in broth, half-and-half and mustard. Bring to a boil. Add tomatoes, parsley and peas. Reduce heat and simmer until sauce thickens. Add in capers. Transfer mixture to a 3-quart casserole. Sprinkle bread crumbs on top. Bake uncovered 20 to 25 minutes.

Cut steaks into 1 inch strips. In medium bowl, combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar and ginger. Add steak strips and marinate in refrigerator for 2 hours. Remove steak strips and cut into 1 inch strips. Saute in hot oil for 3 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add onion and saute until softened. Add steaks and saute until heated through. Serve over rice.

In a small bowl combine shrimp with oregano, salt and pepper. Place shrimp mixture on half of the pizza. Spread remaining half with pesto sauce. Sprinkle with garlic-herb goat cheese and red pepper flakes. Bake according to package directions for 18 to 20 minutes.

Preheat broiler. Dissolve garlic and brown sugar in 1/2 cup water. Add butter. Place salmon fillets in a baking pan. Pour garlic mixture over salmon fillets. Sprinkle with red onion. Bake uncovered under broiler until fish flakes easily. Meanwhile pour beer into a saucepan. Boil until reduced to 1/3 of original amount. Pour over salmon. Serve with rice or potatoes.

For the filling, combine brown rice with scallions and parsley. Saute rice in a skillet until lightly browned. Add the cheddar cheese and the silken tofu. Continue to stir the cheese mixture until melted. Season with pepper and hot sauce to taste. In a blender, combine the soymilk and the tofu. Pour the mixture into the unbaked pie shell and bake in the oven for 1 hour. Let cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine all ingredients except oats in a large mixing bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until well blended. Stir in oats. Drop mixture by heaping tablespoons 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes or until set. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from baking sheets. Makes about 36 cookies.

Fry bacon until crisp. Brown meat and onions in same skillet. Add carrots and potatoes. Add enough water to cover 2 inches above ingredients in skillet. Cover skillet. Cook until tender. Season with garlic salt and pepper. Serve with toast or crackers.
