Place chickens in bottom of crock pot with all the herbs (use 2 sprigs of each). Sprinkle with salt. Add all the other vegetables. Add wine and pour water over all to cover. Cook on low overnight or until done. Take chickens out and shred them (or leave them whole). Add the chicken back to the crock pot and reheat it with the juices for a few hours before serving. Serve with mashed potatoes. Serves 4-6.

Sprinkle veal with salt and pepper. Dip in flour. Brown veal in butter in skillet or saute pan until done. Remove veal and saute onions in the same pan with the butter left in the pan. Add fresh mushrooms and saute until onions are tender and mushrooms are soft. Add the white wine and boil for a minute or two. Add the heavy cream and mix well. Return the veal to the pan and serve over rice or pasta with the au jus and parsley sprinkled on top.

Soften the cheese in the microwave for about 1 minute. Put the crab meat into a food processor and process until it is fine. Add the softened cream cheese and process until smooth. Add the lemon juice, shallots and hot pepper sauce to the crab mixture. Mix well. Place the mixture into a buttered casserole dish. Top with the toasted almonds. Bake at 375 for 25 to 30 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with crackers.

In a medium saucepan heat milk to boilingpour into a medium bowlstir in soup mix until dissolved. Stir in cheeses until melted. Set aside to cool. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a medium bowl stir together cream cheese and Parmesan cheese. Set aside.Unroll dough onto a lightly floured surfacecut in half lengthwise. Roll each piece up tightly like a jellyrollcut into 1 inch pieces.Place 1 teaspoon cream cheese mixture in center of each piecebring edges up to form a pinwheelplace on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven until golden brown (about 15 minutes). Cool slightlyserve warm or at room temperature.

Brown the chicken in a skillet with butter. Add onion and garlic salt to the skillet. Cook until the onion is soft and clear. Add the soup and milk to the skillet and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook until the mixture is thickened and bubbly. Add the noodles and chicken. Pour into a large baking dish. Top with American cheese. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes at 350 degrees F or until the cheese is melted and the edges are bubbly. Serve with green beans or broccoli.

Mix sauerkraut with apple, butter, onion & caraway seed. Place chops in baking dish. Spread sauerkraut mixture on top of pork chops. Sprinkle with french onion soup mix & brown sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 45-60 minutes until pork is done. Serve with rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Separate dough into 8 biscuits. Roll each dough round into a 6-inch circle. Spread pizza sauce on half of each round. Sprinkle with cheese. Place on a lightly greased 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden. Meanwhile, in a medium skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Stir in onion. Drain. Spoon over biscuits. Yields 8 servings.
Combine oatmeal, raisins, sesame seeds, sunflower seeds, pure maple syrup, crunchy peanut butter, and vanilla in a large bowl. Mix well. Shape into small balls or roll into a log shape. Refrigerate.

In a large saucepan combine butter and sugar and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until butter and sugar melt together and mixture comes to a boil. Continue to cook and stir until mixture reaches soft ball stage on candy thermometer (234 degrees f). Remove from heat and add vanilla and evaporated milk. Stir until smooth. Stir in chocolate chips and miniature marshmallows until melted and smooth. Pour into buttered 8-inch square pan and cool until firm. Melt walnuts and drizzle over top of fudge. Cool and cut into small squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f and lightly spray a 12 cup muffin tin with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients (flax meal through salt). In a smaller bowl whisk the eggs and canola oil together. Add the sugar free syrup and vanilla extract and whisk well to combine. Add the wet ingredients to the dry and stir with a wooden spoon until just combined (do not over mix). Spoon batter evenly into the prepared muffin tin and bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden and a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Makes 12 muffins. Serve warm or at room temperature. Muffins can be frozen up to 1 month in an airtight container. Thaw at room temperature and reheat in the microwave for 5 to 10 seconds or toast in the toaster.

Combine first 3 ingredients in large bowl. Add beeftoss to coat. Cover and marinate in refrigerator at least 3 hours. Meanwhile, prepare glaze. Combine next 4 ingredients in small saucepan. Bring to boilboil 1 minute. Remove from heat. Thread 2 beef slices onto each of 18 skewers. Place skewers in shallow dish. Reserve marinade. Brush skewers with glaze. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Brush with glaze. Bake 30 minutes longer or until beef is done (145 degrees F). Serve with reserved marinade. Yields 18 servings (1 hors d'oeuvre per serving).

Prepare brownie mix according to package directions. Cool completely. In a medium bowl combine cookie mix and butter. Mix well. Spread over top of brownie. Bake in preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes or until edges begin to brown. Remove from oven and allow to cool completely. Spread frosting over top.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the sugar and cocoa. Add the flour, baking powder and salt, and mix well. In another bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract and water. Stir in the flour mixture just until blended. Spread the batter into the prepared baking dish and bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Do not overbake. Cool and cut into squares.

In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, bring tomato juice to a simmer. Add tomatoes and cook for 30 minutes. Using an immersion blender or regular blender in batches, blend soup until smooth. Add basil and continue blending until basil is pureed into the soup. Transfer soup to a clean saucepan and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in heavy whipping cream and butter. Season with salt and pepper. Top each serving with 1/2 teaspoon grated parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Prepare the brine by combining kosher salt, brown sugar, water and lemons. Bring to a boil and stir until the salt and sugar dissolve. Remove from heat and allow to cool completely. Remove the zest and pith from the lemons and reserve for later use. Combine the black peppercorns, mustard seeds and coriander seed and reserve for later use. Cut the lemons into quarters and reserve for later use. Once the brine has cooled completely, combine the brine, reserved lemon zest and pepper mixture with the chicken breasts and stir to coat the chicken. Place the chicken in a large plastic bag or a glass bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate the brined chicken overnight or for up to 24 hours, turning the bag or bowl over once during that time to evenly distribute the brine. Remove the chicken from the brine and allow it to air dry on a wire rack for 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Season the chicken breasts with black

Boil water to a full rolling boil and add asparagus spears. Cook for 1 1/2 minutes or until tender but still bright green. Drain and cool slightly. Drain and cool slightly. Cut each spear into thirds lengthwise to form strips. Cut each spear into thirds lengthwise to form strips. Combine cream cheese and prepared horseradish until well blended. Divide roast beef into 12 even portionstop each with horseradish cream cheese mixture and roll up tightly. Arrange 3 spears crosswise over each roll up and serve with additional horseradish cream cheese for dipping.

Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add oil to pan and brown roast on all sides. Remove from pan and place in crockpot along with chopped onions, green enchilada sauce, green chilies and 3 cups of chicken broth. Add oregano and garlic cloves to crockpot and stir to combine. Place hominy into crockpot and top with remaining 2 cups of chicken broth. Add adobo sauce and stir to combine. Cook for 6-8 hours on low or until pork roast is fork tender and hominy is tender. Serve with a sprinkle of chopped cilantro and shredded lettuce. Serve with warm corn or flour tortillas and salsa if desired.

Melt brown sugar and honey in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in corn flakes and nuts. Pour mixture into an ungreased 13x9x2-inch pan. Press down to form an even layer. Cool in pan for 30 minutes. Cut into 24 bars. Melt chocolate in the top of a double boiler. Dip bars in chocolate and place on waxed paper to set. Makes 24.

Boil potatoes in water until done. Cool to room temperature then cube or slice and place in large bowl. Hard boil eggs and then cube or slice them and add to the potatoes. Peel and dice onion and add to potatoes. In a separate bowl combine the mayonnaise with the dried parsley, salt and pepper. Mix all the ingredients well. Serve on a bed of lettuce leaves.

In a 1-quart casserole dish, arrange the peach slices evenly in a single layer. Combine cinnamon and brown sugar in a small bowl and sprinkle over the peaches. Cover with a light layer of cake mix. Top the cake mix with a light layer of butter. Cover the butter with another layer of cake mix and butter. Bake in a preheated 350f oven until the cake is golden, about 1 hour. Serve warm or cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grate zucchini and squeeze out excess liquid. In a large bowl, combine zucchini with butter and light sour cream. Sprinkle with salt and fresh ground pepper. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve warm.
Microwave potatoes until soft. Mash with sour cream. Add cream cheese and chives. Mix. Season. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake until cheese is melted. Garnish with bacon.

Cook onions and mushrooms in a skillet until tender. Add butter and swiss cheese and stir until melted. Stir in soup until heated through. Spread onion mixture on each slice of bread. Broil in toaster oven or oven until brown. Serve with soy sauce for dipping.

Crush sponge cake in a food processor. Add topping mix. Blend well. Press evenly into the base of a 10 inch (25 cm) spring form pan. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Whisk together yogurt, fruit and almonds. Pour mixture over cake mixture. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Serves 8 - 10.

Sift flour with baking soda and salt. Beat butter and sugar in large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla until well blended. Stir in flour mixture. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour or up to 2 days. Preheat oven to 425. Roll dough into walnut sized balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheets 2 inches apart. Bake until edges are golden brown and centers are set, about 12 minutes. Cool cookies on pans for 2 minutesremove to racks and cool completely. Sprinkle with macadamia nuts and chips before serving.

In large bowl combine sugar, flour, eggs, baking soda & vanilla. Mix well. Stir in nuts and pineapple. Spread in well-greased 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 5 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely.
Spread mustard on one slice of bread. Spread mayonnaise on second slice. Top one slice with cheddar cheese and apple. Top with ham. Cover with second slice of bread. Slice in half and serve.

In a small saucepan, combine water, stevia and evaporated milk. Stir well. Add chocolate. Cook over medium heat until chocolate is melted. Stir constantly. Pour mixture into an 8 inch square pan. Stir in nuts. Cool. Cut into squares.

In a medium saucepan saute onion in butter until tender. Add mushrooms and saute until golden brown and liquid has been absorbed. Add rice and saute for 2 minutes. Stir in consomme, water and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender and fluffy. Garnish with dried parsley if desired.

Brown the beef in a skillet with the bacon. Drain. In a bowl combine the soup, beef mixture, mushrooms and bacon. Spoon into a lightly greased 11x7-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the crackers. Melt the butter in a small saucepan. Stir in the flour. Add the milk. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir until the mixture is smooth. Pour over the beef mixture. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Serve with a toothpick.

Pour 1 tablespoon instant decaffeinated coffee and hot water in a cup. Add 2 packets equal sugar substitute. Stir until dissolved. Fill cup with ice cubes. Pour in 1 cup of low-fat chocolate frozen yogurt. Top off with soda water.

Cook broccoli in a small amount of boiling water for 3 minutes. Drain and set aside. Cook potatoes and onion until tender. Add broccoli and stir together. Mash with butter and chicken broth. Stir in parmesan and season with pepper and garlic powder. Top with cheddar and bake for 10 minutes.

Put the cloves, cinnamon sticks and star anise in a teapot and pour over boiling water. Steep for five minutes. Add in the ginger and chili and let steep for a further ten minutes. Pour into teacups and sweeten with honey and lemon juice. Garnish with orange slices.

Peel and thinly slice potatoes. Heat butter in large frying pan and add potatoes. Cook over low heat until golden brown. Remove from pan into ovenproof dish. Add milk to pan juices and bring back to the boil. Add onions. Cook until soft. Remove from heat and stir in cheese. Add to potatoes. Sprinkle with parsley and bake in oven at 375 degrees f. for 30 minutes. Serves 6.

Pound the garlic with the salt until the garlic is lightly browned. Add the olive oil and basil leaves and mix well. Let stand for 10 minutes then add the vinegar and lemon zest. Blend until smooth. Add the mustard and blend until incorporated. Stir in the pepper to taste and serve immediately or refrigerate up to 3 days in an airtight container. Makes 1 cup. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 3 days in an airtight container. Makes 1 cup.

Clean and debead mussels. In a large saut pan over medium-high heat, cook shallots, garlic and thyme until soft. Add guinness. Add half-and-half and bring to a boil. Add mussels and reduce heat to medium. Steam until mussels open. Remove mussels from broth and set aside. Strain broth and keep warm. Add mussels and bread to broth. Garnish with parsley and lemon. Serve with french bread.

Preheat oven to 425. Place chicken in a zip-top plastic bag with soy sauce and red wine. Close bag and shake to coat. Heat 1 Tbs. oil in a heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken to skilletsaute until browned on both sides. Transfer to a plate. Add brown sugar, garlic, oregano and ground ginger to skilletstir 1 minute. Add wine mixture to skilletbring to a boil. Reduce heat to mediumcook until sauce thickens, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Return chicken to pancook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon sauce over chicken. Serve with the rice.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion & garlicstir until softened. Add cooked chicken, tomatoes with juice, green chilies, & cumin seedstir well. Add water & bring to a boil. Add salt & black pepperstir well. Remove from heat & allow to cool completely. Place 1/2 cup of mixture on each tortilla & fold over to make tacos. Top with lettuce & shredded cheese & serve immediately.

Slice the jalapenos lengthwise. Remove the seeds and membranes from the jalapenos. Cut the peppers into strips. In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese, low-fat cheddar cheese, and green onions. Stuff the peppers with the cheese mixture. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the peppers are tender. Serve hot.

Mix artichokes, mayo, cheese, and garlic powder in a medium bowl. Place chicken breast halves in an ovenproof dish. Top each breast with an equal amount of the artichoke mixture. Bake uncovered at 375f for about 30 minutes. Or until juices run clear when pierced with a fork. Serve hot or cold.

In a small bowl stir together cinnamon and sugar. Roll each biscuit in mixture to coat. Place about 1/2 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown. Press a kiss into center of each biscuit. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from baking sheets to wire racks. Cool completely. Makes 4 dozen.

Devein and butterfly shrimp. Saute garlic in oil. Add shrimp and hot sauce. When shrimp are almost cooked through, add 2 cups of water to the pot and bring to a boil. Add salt. Reduce heat and simmer until water is almost evaporated. Serve with rice.

Boil a kettle of water and set aside. Mix the prawns with the spring onions, coriander and white fish in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Melt a little of the oil in a frying pan and add a spoonful of mixture into the pan. Cook for a couple of minutes on each side until golden brown. Repeat with the rest of the mixture until you have eight cakes. Beat the eggs in a bowl and dip each cake in the egg and then roll in the breadcrumbs and place in the oven for 10 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve with sweet chili sauce.

Cook pasta in boiling water until al dente. Drain. In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add bacon and onioncook until onion is tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Add tomatoes. Cook 2 to 3 minutes more. Add pasta to skillet. Cook, stirring constantly, until heated through. Stir in basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with basil leaves if desired.

Brown beef in a large skillet. Add onion soup mix. Add eggs and stir. Add heavy cream and cook. Add mustard and pickle slices and stir. Pour into a 9×13 glass dish. Spread with mayonnaise. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with lettuce and tomato. Serve with a side of pickles.

Mix yogurt with honey until blended. Combine fruits in a bowl. Spoon yogurt mixture over fruit. Sprinkle with walnuts and coconut. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate up to 6 hours. Garnish with a mint sprig if desired.

Peel cucumbers and cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Combine in a bowl with onion and toss well to coat evenly. Let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Meanwhile, in a small bowl stir together sour cream and half-and-half until well blendedstir in vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Chill cucumber mixture, covered, until ready to serve. Just before serving, stir cream mixture into cucumber mixture and toss gently to coat evenly. Makes 4 servings.

Wash beans and put in a colander and put under cold water and swish around for several minutes. Drain beans. Put in a large pot and cover with cold water by 2-4 inches. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to low and simmer until tender about an hour or so. Add in tomatoes and tomato paste and cook for about 1 hour or until the beans are tender and the sauce is thick. Turn off the heat and add the garlic and onions and stir. Stir in the parsley and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Lightly coat a bundt pan with cooking spray. Add frangelico to cake mix and mix well. Bake for 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the middle comes out clean. Cool the cake completely on a rack before removing from the pan. Beat heavy cream until it forms stiff peaks then add sugar. Frost the cooled cake with the frosting then sprinkle shredded coconut over the top.

To make the tomato basil sauce: heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and shallot and saute until the shallot is translucent and the garlic is light brown but not burned. Add the tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes have reduced by about half and the mixture is thick and chunky. Add the basil and cook until just wilted. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook the angel hair pasta according to the package directions. Drain and toss with the tomato basil sauce and parmesan cheese. Place the chicken breasts in the same pan the pasta was cooked in. Pour the remaining water from the pasta cooking liquid into the pan and cover. Simmer over medium heat for 15 to 20 minutes. Check the chicken for doneness. When the chicken is done, remove it from the pan and shred it. Stir the shredded chicken into the pasta. Add more parmesan cheese and toss to combine.

In a medium saucepot over medium heat, heat the milk and butter until the butter is melted. Stir in sugar and chocolate chips until the chips are completely melted. Remove from heat. In a medium bowl stir together the egg yolks. In a small bowl combine the cinnamon, vanilla and salt. Add the milk mixture to the egg yolks. Stir until blended. Pour into 6 small ramekins. Place the ramekins in a baking pan. Add enough boiling water to the pan to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake in a 350f oven for 30 minutes or until set.

Combine first eight ingredients in a saucepan. Stirring constantly bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Cut hot dogs into thirds. Thread hot dogs and pineapple chunks onto wooden skewers. Grill hot dogs 2 minutes on each side or until done. Brush hot dogs with sauce. Serve hot.

Sprinkle both sides of the round steaks generously with garlic powder and black pepper. Place steaks into crock pot. Add stuffing. In a bowl combine cream of mushroom soup, water, onion soup mix and butter. Pour over steaks and stuffing. Cover, cook on high for 3-4 hours. Makes 4 servings.

Boil milk and water together. Add coffee powder. Stir well until coffee powder dissolves completely. Add sugar to taste. Stir well until sugar dissolves completely. Stir again. Let stand for a while. Cool completely. Add cream to taste. Mix well. Serve chilled. Garnish with a pinch of nutmeg on top if desired.

In a large bowl, cream together shortening and sugar. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Mix in cake flour, salt and cinnamon. Stir in melted chocolate and nuts if desired. Pour into a waffle iron and cook according to manufacturer's instructions. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in 10-inch skillet over low heat. Add pecansstir until coated. Cook 3-4 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from heatstir in caramel topping. Roll crescent rolls into 3/4-inch-wide strips. Arrange strips side by side in a 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Top with nut mixture. Bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes or until crescent rolls are golden brown. Serve warm.

Combine all the fruit and raisins in a large nonreactive pot and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer until the fruit is soft. Mash with a potato masher or food processor. Stir in the sugar, lemon juice and zest. Taste for sweetness/tartness and add more if necessary. Chill for at least an hour before serving. Garnish with walnuts if desired.
Chop rhubarb and onions together. Combine with all other ingredients. Cook until thickened. Cool and refrigerate.

Preheat a grill or broiler to medium-high. Place ribs on a grid over a drip pan and broil 5 inches from heat, turning once, until browned and cooked through (an instant-read thermometer should read 135 degrees). Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl and stir until blended. Remove meat from ribs and discard bones. Pour barbecue mixture over meat and toss to coat. Serve. Serves 4 to 6.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium high heat. Season turkey with 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper and brown on both sides (10-15 minutes). Remove turkey from pan and set aside. Add onion to pan with garlic clovecook until onion is translucent (about 5 minutes). Add chili powdercook 1 minute longer. Stir in chicken brothbring to a boil. Return turkey to pan with brothcover and simmer over medium low heat (about 1 hour). Remove turkey from pan. Shred meat from turkey with two forksreturn to pan. Stir in tomatoes with their juicebring to a boil. Stir in beanscook over medium low heat about 5 minutes. Season with remaining teaspoon of each salt and pepper. Serve with sour cream, shredded cheese, avocado, cilantro, and jalapeño slices.

Sprinkle chicken with pepper and place in a 12-inch ovenproof skillet. Pour over 1/4 cup dressing and drizzle with oil. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Add stewed tomatoes and 1 tablespoon dressing and bake for 5 minutes longer. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Makes 2 servings.

In a medium bowl, whisk together vinegar, honey, broth and bay leaf. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and pepper. Cook for about 3 minutes or until slightly softened. Add Brussels sprouts and cook for about 3 minutes or until tender. Add vinegar mixture and mustard seeds. Cook for another minute or so. Add celery salt and pepper. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.

In a heavy saucepan combine brown sugar, corn syrup and margarine over medium high heat. Bring to a boil. Add vanilla and baking soda. Stir for about 1 minute until well combined. Pour into a 9x13 inch pan and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool for 30 minutes then spread on melted chocolate. Top with chopped pecans. Allow chocolate to set before cutting. Store in an airtight container in fridge.
Boil macaroni in water with onion and butter until tender. Add diced tomatoes and garlic. Add seasoning to taste. Sprinkle with parsley and basil for garnish.

Place cherry filling and lemon juice in crock pot. In a small bowl, combine salt, pepper, mace and bouillon granules. Rub mixture on all sides of chops. Lay chops flat in the crock pot. Cover and cook on low heat for 6-8 hours or until chops are tender. Serve chops over rice, hot dogs or potatoes.

In a large mixing bowl, mix together the spinach, onion, olive oil and butter. Then add the eggs, milk and flour. Finally add the baking powder and mix well. Cook in a waffle iron. Serve hot with melted cheese.

Soak beans overnight in water. Drain beans. Place bacon in a large pot with the pinto beans. Cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until pinto beans are tender. Season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder and cayenne. Serve with cornbread.

In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, cinnamon, ginger, baking soda, and salt. In another bowl, mix shortening, egg, and molasses. Combine the wet ingredients into the flour mixture. Roll dough into a ball. Flatten the ball in the center of a baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Cut into 1-inch squares.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Mix butter with curry power until the mixture is smooth. Roll each banana slice in the mixture and then coat with the corn flakes. Place the banana slices on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake the banana slices for 5 minutes. Drizzle the slices with honey before serving.

Combine cream cheese and powdered sugar until creamy. Beat in vanilla and food colorings until combined. Add chocolate and pecans, blend well and pour into a 13x9x2-inch pan. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until firm and cut into squares. Store tightly covered in the refrigerator.

In a small skillet over low heat, combine butter, brown sugar and almonds. Stir constantly until melted. Remove from heat and add crackers and maraschino cherry halves. Spread mixture evenly between crackers and refrigerate for 1 hour or until set. Cut into squares and store in refrigerator or freezer. Makes about 18 servings.

Peel and cut carrots and potatoes in 1/4 inch slices. In a large pot, cover with water. Add carrots, potatoes and onion. Cook over medium heat until vegetables are tender. In a small bowl, combine milk and flour. Stir into vegetables and cook until thickened. Stir in butter and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Cook bacon until crisp. Crumble and set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together vinegar, sugar and pepper. Gradually add oil, whisking constantly. In a large salad bowl combine lettuce, onion and crumbled bacon. Toss with vinegar mixture. Serve on individual salad plates with egg slices.

In a medium saucepan combine milk and chocolate flavored syrup and heat over medium-high heat until just simmering. Stir in cinnamon and heat through. Divide hot chocolate into mugs. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with chocolate chips and cinnamon sticks. Serve immediately.

Cut 1 lb. Sharp cheddar cheese into small cubes. Cut 12 ounces Monterey jack into small cubes. Cube 2 1/2 ounces cream cheese. In a medium mixing bowl combine mayonnaise, pickle juice, and mustard and stir to blend. Fold in the cream cheese. Add the cubed cheeses and the pimentos and stir to combine. Season to taste with hot pepper sauce and horseradish. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours and up to 3 days. Serve on a thick slice of white or wheat bread. Or you can put the mixture in a ziploc bag and use as a dip for vegetables. Makes enough for 12 burgers.

Heat oven to 400. Scrub potatoes but do not peel. Cut into 1/2-inch slices. Heat 1 tablespoon butter in an oven-proof skillet or gratin dish over medium heat. Add potatoes to butter. Cook without stirring about 1 minute. Stir potatoes to coat evenly. Add cream. Cover skillet. Bake for 45 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with garlic, salt and pepper. Bake uncovered for 5 minutes more or until potatoes are tender. Stir in 1 tablespoon butter. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake about 5 minutes more to melt cheese. Makes 4 servings.

Combine soda crackers and nuts in a large bowl. Put aside. Mix sugar and egg whites until frothy. Beat in vinegar and vanilla. Add baking powder and baking soda. Stir in crackers. Spread into a 12x8 inch pan. Bake at 325 for about 20 minutes. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

Combine the eggs and milk and beat together. Stir in the flour and salt and beat until smooth. Let stand for 30 minutes. Heat a 10 inch nonstick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Add the butter and swirl to coat. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter into the skillet. Tilt and swirl to coat the bottom of the skillet. Cook until the bottom is lightly browned and the top is dry and beginning to pull away from the pan. Turn over and cook the other side. Repeat with the remaining batter. Fill the crepes with whatever you like. Fold into quarters and roll up.

In a medium bowl, combine the white pepper with 2 tablespoons of the egg yolk and 1/4 cup of water. Combine the remaining egg yolk with 1/4 cup of water in a separate bowl. Place a large saute pan on low heat and add enough clarified butter to coat the bottom. Add the swordfish and cook for 5 minutes on each side. Add the macadamia nuts to the saute pan and cook for 2 minutes. Add the sherry and lemon juice. Remove from heat and let stand for 2 to 3 minutes. Spoon the fish onto a plate and cover with the egg yolk sauce. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Mix chicken and corn in large bowl. In a separate bowl, combine taco seasoning mix and water. Pour over chicken mixture. Stir in chilies and cheese. Pour into pie crusts. Bake 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Boil pasta in salted water according to package directions. In a small bowl, stir together pasta sauce and garlic cloves until combined. Cook tofu according to package directions or use pre-packaged baked tofu. Drain pasta, reserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking water, and return pasta to pot. Add pasta sauce mixture and 1/2 cup pasta cooking water, and stir until combined. Add baby spinach and tofu cubesstir until spinach is wilted and heated through. Serve over pasta with additional grated Parmesan cheese if desired.

Season chicken breast with seasoning salt. In a large skillet heat butter and olive oil over medium heat. Add chicken breasts and cook until golden brown. Remove from pan and set aside. Add wine to skillet and scrape the brown bits from bottom of pan. Add stuffing mix and cook for 1 minute. Add cream of chicken soup and whisk until smooth. Add cheese and chicken breasts. Cover and cook 10 minutes longer. Remove from heat and let set for 5 minutes. Serve in bowls.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan or line pan with parchment paper. In the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing until fully incorporated. Add the flour and baking powder and mix until just combined. Mix in the milk and heavy cream. Add the zest and juice from 1 lemon and the lemongrass and mix to combine. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and cool completely in pan before removing and storing in an airtight container. Makes 1 loaf, 10 servings.

Heat oil in a Dutch oven or heavy skillet over medium heat. Add onion and carrotcook until softened. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add ground beef. Cook and stir until beef is browned. Add tomatoes and 1/2 cup water. Simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in parsley and basil. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in Romano cheese. Serve with pasta.

Place dough on lightly floured surface. Roll out to 1/8 inch thickness. Cut into 4 x 4 inch squares. Place 2 teaspoons spinach in center of each square. Top with 1/2 teaspoon feta cheese, 1/2 teaspoon monterey jack cheese and 1/2 teaspoon chopped green onion. Sprinkle each square evenly with 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder and 1/4 teaspoon of each pepper. Fold edges of dough over filling. Pinch edges to seal. Place 1 inch apart on greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Serve warm. Makes 4 dozen rolls.

In a shallow dish, combine the eggs and thyme. Dip the chicken into the egg mixturesprinkle with salt and pepper. Dip the chicken into the flour mixtureshake off the excess. Dip the chicken into the egg mixture againsprinkle with salt and pepper. Dip the chicken into the flour mixture againshake off the excess. Repeat until all of the chicken pieces have been dipped twice into the egg mixture and twice into the flour mixture. Place the chicken pieces on the cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until the chicken is done. Remove the chicken pieces from the oven. In a small bowl, combine the Swiss cheese, ham, and mustardspread an even layer of the mixture on each chicken piece. Return the chicken pieces to the oven for 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Remove the chicken from the ovenlet stand for 2 minutes. In a small bowl, combine the bread crumbs and buttersprinkle evenly over the chicken pieces. Return the chicken pieces to the oven for

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place one tortilla in center of baking sheet. Spread 1/2 cup cheese over the tortilla. Top with 1 egg. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheese. Top with second tortilla. Brush top tortilla with butter. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until tortilla is golden brown. Remove from baking sheet. Cut in wedges. Serve with a side of sour cream and salsa.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place flour into a large bowl. Add the beer and stir well with a fork to combine. Add the butter and the remaining ingredients and stir well with a fork. Grease a 9×5 loaf pan with cooking spray or butter. Pour the batter into the pan and bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the loaf. Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with honey if desired.
Chop tomatoes and cucumbers. Mix together. Add italian seasoning. Pour over salad. Drizzle with olive oil and vinegars. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve chilled.

In a large bowl, combine the sugar, eggs and salt. Beat until smooth. Add the flour and baking powdermix well. Chill dough for 1 hour or until easy to handle. Lightly grease two 12-cup muffin tins with cooking sprayline with paper baking cups. Press 1 tablespoon of dough into each cup, firmly pressing around edges of cups. Place 1 teaspoon raspberry jam in center of each tart. Fold the edges of the dough around the jam, pinching together to seal. Bake for 20 minutes or until the tarts are golden brown. Remove from ovencool on wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove from pancool completely on wire rack. Spread with whipped creamsprinkle with nuts. Yields 2 dozen.

In a heavy pan, heat the olive oil and saute the leek and curry powder and turmeric over low heat for about 10 minutes or until the leek is soft. Add the garlic and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the squash and saute until tender. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Cool and puree in a blender. Return to pan. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and garnish with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of chutney.
Toss the apples with the sugar and cinnamon. In a large bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients with the apples. Pour into a 10 x 13-inch pan and bake for 30 minutes. Serve with ice cream.

Preheat oven to 375. Combine oregano, lemon juice, pepper and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a shallow bowl. Place flour in a separate bowl. Dip each breast in flour, then dunk in the oregano mixture, coating evenly. Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Place coated chicken breasts in the skillet and cook until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer chicken breasts to a baking sheet, brush both sides with the lemon juice mixture, then sprinkle evenly with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Bake until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink inside, about 10 minutes. 4 servings, 7 points each.

Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a saucepan. Add jell-o gelatin. Stir until dissolved. Remove from heat. Cool 2 minutes. Beat ice cream in a medium bowl until soft. Beat in gelatin. Stir in 2 cups milk. Divide half of the mixture into 4 cups. Top each with 2 tablespoons pineapple tidbits. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve the remaining mixture with a spoon.

Season fillets with garlic salt. Dip in flour. Fry in butter or oil until lightly browned on both sides. Spread each fillet with half of the sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with half of the parmesan cheese. Bake in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until fish is opaque and tender when pierced. Serves 4.

Add the eggs to a sauce pan and cover with water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat. Add the flour while whisking constantly. Add the sour cream while whisking constantly. Add the dill weed while whisking constantly. Serve over hot toast.

Grease and flour 2 8 x 4-inch loaf pans or 1 9 x 13-inch pan. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl with mixer on low speed, beat 1 cake mix, 1 cup water and 1 cup vegetable oil 2 minutes. Beat on medium speed 2 minutes more. Pour into pans. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in small bowl, stir together sweetened condensed milk and hot fudge. Spread over warm cake. Cut into squares. In small bowl, beat together 1/2 cup milk and 1 envelope cool whip until just blended. Top each square with a dollop of whipped topping and a Skor candy bar piece. Serve immediately. Makes 30 servings.

In a large bowl, beat together the sugar and cornstarch. Add the orange juice and beat well. In a small bowl, beat together the eggs. Add the eggs to the orange mixture and beat until just combined. Transfer to a small pot and place over medium heat. Whisk constantly until the mixture is thick and begins to bubble. Remove from heat and stir in the butter and orange rind. Cover the surface of the curd with plastic wrap and refrigerate until cool. Spoon curd into a small container and place in the freezer until set. Makes about 1 cup.

Bring rice and water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes. Add milk and continue to cook. Add sugar and cinnamon. Stir occasionally until rice is tender. Serve warm. Prep time does not include cooking time.

Heat a large frying pan over medium heat. Sprinkle pork chops with pepper and paprika. Add chicken bouillon cubes to water and bring to a boil. Add onion. Add enough water to cover chops. Simmer for 25-30 minutes. Serve with noodles or rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a medium bowl whisk together almond flour, cocoa powder, coffee and sea salt. In a large bowl whisk together grapeseed oil, agave nectar and vanilla. Add wet mixture to dry mixture and whisk until well combined. Add baking soda and whisk until combined. Form dough into 12 evenly sized balls. Roll balls in cocoa powder and place them about 2 inches apart on baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Allow to cool for 1 minute and then transfer cookies to wire rack. Melt dark chocolate in microwave for about 30 seconds and drizzle chocolate over cooled cookies. Allow chocolate to set for 30 minutes. Serve.
Combine strawberries, kiwis and sweet peppers in a medium bowl. Toss lightly with the lemon juice and red pepper. Stir in cilantro and sugar. Chill before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.

Combine water and sugar in medium saucepan over medium-high heatbring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in cranberries and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes more or until cranberries pop. Cool slightly and remove from heat. Discard cinnamon and cloves. Puree cranberry mixture in blender until smooth. Add sour cream and orange zestchill 1 hour or overnight. Serve with mint leaves.

Prepare pie crusts as directed on package. Divide filling between crusts. Bake in a 375 degree oven until a knife inserted 1 inch from edge comes out clean (about 45 minutes). Cool completely before serving. Garnish with whipped cream or sweetened whipped cream if desired.

Preheat grill or broiler to high. Cut eggplant in half lengthwise, then cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slicestoss with 2 tablespoons oil in a bowlseason with 1/2 teaspoon each of the salt and pepper. Grill or broil until softened and browned on both sides, about 4 minutes per side. In a bowl toss the cherry tomatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon each of the salt and pepper, and the capersset aside at room temperature. In a medium bowl toss the ricotta with the basil, remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oildivide among 4 plates, top each with the roasted eggplant slices and the cherry tomatoesdrizzle with balsamic vinegar and serve at once.

In a small bowl whisk together hoisin sauce, peanut butter, vegetable oil, minced garlic, and cayenne pepper. Heat a small saucepan of water over medium-low heat. Bring to a simmer. Add chicken stock, fish sauce, and white pepper. Add more water if needed. Stir in peanuts. Transfer to a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Serve sauce at room temperature.

Mix first five ingredients. Stirring constantly over medium heat bring mixture to boil, then boil 1 minute. Stir cornstarch into cold water until smoothgradually stir into boiling mixture. Cook and stir 2 minutes longer or until thickened. Cool completely. Stir in butter and vanillaspoon into greased 1 1/2 quart casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until set.

In a large non-stick skillet heat olive oil over medium heat and add zucchini and carrots, cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally and add garlic and cook for another minute or so. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with fresh parsley and basil and serve immediately or chill and serve later.

Lightly grease a large 13 x 9 baking pan. Cut croissants into 1/2-inch strips. Place in a single layer in prepared pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Beat eggs with milk and thyme. Pour over croissant layer. Arrange shrimp over top. Bake at 350 for 50 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with green onions.

Pour pudding mixture over crushed pineapple and stir to combine. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Place in a 9x13 inch pan. Let stand 10 minutes until set. Cut into cubes with sharp knife and arrange on a bed of lettuce. Sprinkle with mandarin orange segments and chopped walnuts. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and mix well. Add the dry ingredients and mix well. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface. Cut into squares. Bake for about 15 minutes until lightly golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Store in tightly closed container.

Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl. Transfer to greased 9x13-inch baking pan. Bake uncovered at 350° for 30 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into squares. Serve warm or refrigerate for 24 hours before serving.

Place potatoes in a medium saucepancover with water. Bring to a boil. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the potatoes are done. Drain the water. Return potatoes to the saucepan. Mash with butter and crushed red pepper flakes and salt. Serve immediately.

Heat oil over high heat, brown roast all sides on high heat until browned (about 10 minutes). Lower heat to medium-low to cook for 3-4 hours until meat is tender when pierced with a fork. In the meantime combine paprika, thyme, garlic, onion, tomatoes, scotch bonnet pepper, vinegar and sugar (optional) to form a sauce. Remove roast from pot, shred meat and return to pot and add sauce. Serve on rolls with slaw, rice or potatoes or all three.

In a small saucepan over medium heat combine cranberries, pears, sugar, cider vinegar, ginger, cloves, cinnamon stick. Simmer until thickened and cranberries start to pop. Stirring often, simmer for about 10 minutes more, until most cranberries have popped, stirring often to keep from scorching. Remove from heat and add raisins. Let cool completely. Serve on crackers with thinly-sliced sharp cheddar cheese or use as a sandwich spread with meats. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.

Wash and clean ox tail thoroughly. Chop onion and carrots finely and keep aside. Wash and clean potatoes and peel off skins. Clean tomatoes and blend to make tomato puree. Heat oil and fry chopped onion and carrot until tender. Add cleaned tail and stir fry till it changes color. Pour 4 cups of water and add chopped tomatoes and blended tomato puree and 4 cups of water and boil it for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes add potatoes and let it simmer for 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

Peel and devein shrimp. Melt the butter in a skillet and saute onions and shrimp together. Add cream cheese and stir till it melts. Add lemon juice and mayonnaise. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve over pasta or rice. Can also be used as a spread for crackers.

Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Combine first 6 ingredients in a small bowl. Dip chicken in buttermilk mixturecoat with bread crumb mixture. Place chicken in a single layer in a shallow baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cilantro. Bake for 25 minutes or until done. Makes 4 servings.

Place asparagus in a large pot and cover with water. Cook until tender. Remove asparagus and set aside. Melt margarine in pot. Add onion and saute until tender. Add potatoes and saute until tender. Add chicken broth. Cover and simmer 10-15 minutes. Add asparagus and mix. Add white pepper and nutmeg to taste. Add cream and lemon juice. Garnish with asparagus tips.

Combine the cranberries, sugar and lime zest in the bottom of a slow cooker. Stir in the water until all of the cranberries are covered. Cover the slow cooker and cook for 4 hours on low. Stir the sauce well. Cook for another 30 minutes until the sauce is thick. Serve hot or cold.

In a bowl combine soy flour, protein powder, seasoning salt, garlic powder, water. Whisk until all dry ingredients are dissolved. Whisk in egg. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add 2-3 Tbsp of mixture per pancake. Cook until set on both sides. Serve warm with tomato sauce.

Cut melon into cubes and place in a pitcher or punch bowl. Add 1 cup of white wine and 1 cup of brandy to pitcher. Add 1/3 cup of triple sec and stir. Add 1 cup of sparkling water and 4-5 mint sprigs and stir gently. Add ice cubes if desired and stir gently. Add limes to taste. Serve chilled in a punch bowl or individual glasses with a sprig of mint on top of each glass for garnish.

Prepare the broth by combining the water and chicken broth in a large pot over high heat. Add the orzo and cook according to the package directions. In a separate pan, saute the asparagus in olive oil with the crushed red pepper until just tender. Season with the salt and pepper. Drain the orzo pasta and stir in the asparagus. Add the dressing. Top with the parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Spray a 9 x 12 baking dish with cooking spray. Layer the pineapple in the pan. Melt the butter and combine with the brown sugar. Pour over the pineapple. Place the pound cake on top of the pineapple. Melt the butter and brush over the pound cake. Bake at 375 degrees for about 40 minutes or until the cake is lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack. Remove from the pan and invert onto a serving plate. Top with ice cream or whipped cream if desired.

Add olive oil into skillet. Add sliced onions and garlic clove. Cook until translucent (about 10 minutes). Add mushrooms and continue cooking over low heat for another 3 minutes or until mushrooms are soft and beginning to release their juices. Add white wine and allow to cook for a few minutes until the wine has almost fully evaporated. Add a pinch of salt and a few grinds of ground black pepper. Add bay leaf and continue cooking for another couple minutes. Serve with whatever you like!
Cook rice according to directions. Add olive oil and basil. Salt and pepper to taste. Add cherry tomatoes and mozzarella. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Crush Oreo cookies in food processor or blender. In a large bowl, cream together cream cheese and butter. Stir in powdered sugar until well blended. Beat in milk until smooth. Stir in pudding mix and vanilla. Beat in 1 cup Oreo cookie crumbs. Spread batter into 9 in spring form pan. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Beat cream cheese and butter until blended. Stir in powdered sugar. Fold in whipped topping. Spread over cake. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Spread remaining Oreo cookie crumbs over top. Refrigerate for another hour. Cut into wedges. Yield: 12-15 servings.
Mix graham crackers, butter, sugar, and pecans together. Press into 9 by 5-inch loaf pan. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 25 minutes. Cool. Cut into 1 inch cubes.
Saute garlic and onions in butter. Add cream. Stir until heated through. Add cajun seasoning and parmesan cheese. Stir until smooth. Serve over pasta.

Slice sausage and brown in a large fry pan over medium heat until no longer pink. Add onion and cook until softened. Add broth and worcestershire sauce. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in flour and pepper until well blended. Stir in sour cream and cook until thickened. Serve over cooked noodles garnished with parsley.

Purists use only avocados, white onion, cilantro and kosher salt in their guacamole. If you want more flavor you can add jalapenos and/or lime juice. Cut avocados in half and remove pit. Scoop avocado into a bowl. Mash with a fork until chunky. Add remaining ingredients and stir. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat the oven to 350. Pound out the chicken breasts to about 1/2 inch thick. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium high heat. Slice the tomatoes in half lengthwise. Salt and pepper the chicken breasts on both sides. Dip the chicken in the flour. Shake off excess flour. Add the broth to the pan. Add the lemon juice. Add the tomatoes. Simmer for 3-4 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Arrange the chicken in the pan. Add the capers. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Beat together butter and sugar until light. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Combine with dry ingredients. Pour into greased deep dish pie plate. Cover top with thin sliced apples. Sprinkle with brown sugar and dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat egg in 1 cup milk in medium bowl. Add flour, baking powder and salt. Beat with mixer until smooth. Spread in 13x9 inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Arrange apple slices on batter. Sprinkle with nuts. Beat the remaining milk with the egg yolk and 1 tbs of sugar. Pour over apple. Bake 35-40 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack. Drizzle with glaze. Combine 1/4 cup milk with 1 tbs sugar and 2 tbs water. Heat in microwave 30-40 seconds or until heated through. Stir until smooth. Drizzle over pie.

Cream butter and sugar. Add egg. Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda. Sift into butter mixture. Stir until combined. Divide into two parts. Add food coloring to one half. Chill. Roll out thin. Cut with cookie cutters. Bake at 350f. Cool. Decorate.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the flour. Cook and stir until lightly browned. Add the milk and cook and stir over medium heat until thickened. Stir in the cheeses. Cook and stir until melted and smooth. Serve with a vegetable of your choice.

Slice cucumber and onion on the bias into thin strips. Combine rice vinegar, sugar and toasted sesame oil and whisk until sugar dissolves. Combine cucumber and onion with basil leaves and dressing in large bowl. Chill at least 1 hour before serving to allow flavors to blend. Serve over rice or noodles or alone as a side dish.
Serve vanilla ice cream in a dish. Drizzle the ice cream with espresso. Garnish with chocolate curls and chocolate syrup.
Brew 2 cups of dark roast coffee. Add a can of sweetened condensed milk. Add a teaspoon of vanilla extract. Add 6 cups of ice cubes to the brew. Put in a tall glass. Top with whipped cream.

In a large skillet, brown kielbasa in a small amount of vegetable oil. Drain and set aside. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Place the kielbasa, chicken breasts, celery, onions, bell peppers and tomatoes into a crockpot. Pour in the prepared seasoning mixture. Cook on low for 6 hours. Serve with rice.

Wash and trim rhubarb stems. Slice rhubarb thinly and put in a heavy-bottomed pot with sugar, oranges and lemon juice and zest. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 20 to 25 minutes. Add gingerroot and simmer for another 5 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. When mixture is cool enough to handle, remove rhubarb stems and strain marmalade through a colander into a bowl. Cover and refrigerate for 2 weeks before using.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Combine soup with mayo. Stir in cooked macaroni. Toss in cheese. Add mushrooms, onion and garlic. Toss again. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease two 9x5x3 inch loaf pans or line with parchment paperspray with cooking spray.Combine the first 7 ingredients in a large bowlstir well with a whisk. Beat together the butter and sugar with an electric mixer until creamy. Add the egg and vanillamix well. Stir in the flour mixture until just combined. Spoon into the prepared pans.Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before turning out onto wire racks to cool completely.To make the icing, beat together the confectioners' sugar and milk in a bowl until smooth. Drizzle over the cookies and allow to set.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease an 8 inch square pan with butter. Peel yamsmash in a large bowl until smooth. Stir in eggs, then sugar, baking powder and salt. Fold in melted butter. Spread into prepared baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until puffed and golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream if desired.
Wrap brie with aluminum foil, place in shallow baking dish and bake for 15 minutes. Slice brie in 1/2 inch slices. Serve with sliced onions, raisins and walnuts.

Melt butter over medium heat in large skillet. Add shrimp, onion and garlic salt, stirring occasionally until shrimp is opaque. Add salt and basil, stirring until well blended. Remove from heat, cool slightly. In another bowl combine flour with 1/4 cup of water and remaining 1/2 teaspoon garlic salt. Add to shrimp mixture, stirring until blended. Add vinegar, stirring until blended. Serve warm over hot cooked pasta. Garnish with chopped parsley.

In a large stockpot bring chicken broth to a boil. Add noodles. Simmer until noodles are tender, about 10 minutes. In a medium skillet heat olive oil. Add onion. Cook over medium heat until translucent. Add broccoli. Cook until tender. Add broccoli to soup. Season with salt, garlic powder and fresh ground pepper. Stir in milk. Ladle into bowls. Sprinkle with cheese. Garnish with parsley.

In a large mixing bowl combine graham crackers and melted butter. Press into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool. In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, combine milk and chocolate chips. Heat to 120f or until chips melt completely. Remove from the heatstir in coconut. Spread coconut chocolate mixture evenly over crust. Chill until firm. Cut into bars. Makes 24 bars.

Toast graham cracker in a 400 degree oven for about 10 minutes. Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Boil 30 seconds then remove from heat. Quickly pour over the graham cracker in a greased 8x8 baking pan. Spread evenly with a spatula. Sprinkle with cashews. Refrigerate. Cut into squares.

In a wok, heat 2 tablespoons of canola oil until smoking. Add the croutons and stir-fry until golden brown. Transfer to a plate. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil to the wok. Add the garlic and stir-fry until aromatic. Add the soy sauce to deglaze. Add the chicken and stir-fry until browned. Add 2 cups water, cover and bring to a boil. Stir in the sugar. Cook until tender. Stir in the croutons. Transfer to a bowl. Garnish with scallions. Serve with white rice.

In a large bowl combine the greens with the apple and the dried cranberries. Sprinkle with the walnuts and toss. Combine the vinegar, mustard, oil and salt and pepper in a small bowl and whisk to blend. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently until evenly coated.

Boil sweet potatoes in their jackets until tender when pierced with a sharp knife. Drain and place in a large bowl. Add white sugar and vegetable oil and mix. Line a cookie sheet with wax paper and place sweet potatoes on the paper. Let cool until you can handle them. Mash the potatoes with a fork or potato masher. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Refrigerate until serving. You can also add green onions and chopped pistachio nuts.

Combine sea salt, sesame seeds, onion flakes and herbes de provence in shallow dish. Beat eggs and milk together in another shallow dish and put flour in a third shallow dish. Dip chicken tenders in flour, then egg mixture, then coat well with sesame and spice mixture. Melt butter in heavy medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add onion and cook until softened and slightly golden, 5-7 minutes. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink and juices run clear when chicken is cut into pieces, 5-7 minutes. Pour sherry vinegar into pan and scrape up any browned bits from bottom of pan. Add fresh herbs and season with salt and pepper. Toss gently and serve immediately over rice.

Take 2 eggs and hard-boil them. Grind the meat finely with the flat leaf parsley. Season the meat with the salt and pepper. Take 4 pieces of salami and cut them into small pieces. Dry the pork shoulder well. Mix together the seasoned meat with the salami and breadcrumbs. Cut the pork shoulder into 4 pieces. Take the 4 pieces of pork and roll them up. Sew them together. Take 2 eggs and beat them. Dip the braciole into the eggs. Roll them into the breadcrumbs. Fry them in the olive oil. Take a pan and put some of the pasta sauce in the bottom of the pan. Put the braciole in the pan. Add more pasta sauce on top of the braciole. Cook the braciole on the stove for 30 minutes. Cook the pasta. Take the pasta out of the water and mix it with the braciole. Add the grated romano cheese. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Mix together cake mix, sour cream, eggs and water. Beat with an electric mixer until well blended, about 1 minute. Stir in chocolate chips and pudding mix. Spread in the prepared pan and bake for 35 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Cut into squares and serve.

Drain and chop the vegetables into small bite sized pieces and place in a large bowl. In a small bowl mix together the dressing. Toss the vegetables with the dressing and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Pastry for one 9-inch pie. Place the flour on a smooth work surface. Cut in the fat and lard until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the sugar. Quickly mix in the egg yolk and water until the mixture just forms a ball. Cover the pastry with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour. Remove the pastry from the refrigerator. Divide the pastry into two portions. Roll out one portion on a lightly floured surface until it measures 12 inches by 10 inches. Roll out the second portion of pastry in the same manner. Place one pastry round on a 9-inch pie plate. Fill with mincemeat. Dot the top of the pie filling with butter. Cover with the remaining pastry round. Trim the pastry edges, leaving a 1-inch overhang. Fold the overhang underneath and press the edge to seal. Cut decorative vents in the pastry top. Brush the top of the pie with the egg wash. Place the pie on a baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 4

Combine vinegar, orange juice concentrate, honey and red pepper flakes in a medium bowl and whisk until sugar has dissolved and mixture is well blended. Season with salt and pepper. Add the oil in a slow, steady stream and continue to whisk until emulsified. Refrigerate until ready to serve. In a large bowl, add the sliced cucumbers and grape tomatoes. Drizzle with enough dressing to coat and toss to coat. Add the green onions and toss again. Arrange on a serving plate. Top with salad greens. Serve immediately.

Combine beef, salt, pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, liquid smoke, water and cinnamon stick in food processor or blender. Mix thoroughly to combine. Line cookie sheet with waxed paper or parchment paper. Spread meat mixture out evenly to about 1/4-inch thickness. Let meat mixture dry for 24 hours, or until very hard. Slice with sharp knife into desired thickness. Store at room temperature for 24 hours to further dry. Serve as snacks or garnish for foods.
Beat pudding with milk until smooth. Mix in cherry pie filling and almond extract. Spoon into individual glasses. Top with whipped topping and garnish with macaroons.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Prepare bisquick baking mix according to package directions, and stir in 1/2 cup of the parmesan cheese, pepperoni and garlic powderset aside. In a large skillet, heat the remaining 1/2 cup parmesan cheese and pepperoni over low heat until meltedadd the pizza sauce and stir well. Unroll the crescent rolls onto 2 baking sheets and separate into trianglesbrush each triangle lightly with the butter. Spoon 1/4 cup of the pepperoni mixture evenly onto the wide end of each triangle. Roll up each triangle tightly and place seam side down on the baking sheetpinch seams closed and place 2 slices of pepperoni on top of each twist. Brush the top of each twist with buttersprinkle evenly with parmesan cheese. Bake for 12 minutes in the preheated oven until golden brown. Serve immediately. Yield: 2 dozen breadtwists.

Drain apricots and save juice. Combine apricots, oranges, and juices in a saucepan, cover and cook over low heat until softened, about 15 minutes. Pour through a sieve over a bowl and set aside to cool. Combine juices with pineapple and lemon juice in a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and boil for about 15 minutes or until mixture thickens. Stir in sugar and pine nuts. Transfer to a bowl and let cool before placing in jars and refrigerating.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add 1 tablespoon of salt to the water and cook the pasta until al dente. Strain the pasta and set aside. In a small bowl whisk together the eggs and yogurt until combined well and set aside. In a medium sized saucepan heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the flour and stir well with a wire whisk until the flour becomes a light brown color. Add the chicken broth and whisk well until thickened. Add the salt and pepper and nutmeg and stir well. Add the pasta and stir well until all the pasta is coated with the sauce. Add the parmesan cheese and stir well until the cheese is completely melted. Add the eggs and yogurt and stir well until all the yogurt is completely mixed into the pasta. Garnish with the parsley and serve immediately.

Dry swordfish with a paper towel. Rub both sides with the seasoning mixture. Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place the fish in the skillet and cook for about 4 minutes on each side, depending on thickness. Serve with rice.

Butter a 2-quart baking dish. Arrange the potatoes in a single layer in the baking dish. Combine the brown sugar, granulated sugar, butter and cinnamon. Melt the butter in a small saucepan. Stir in the brown sugar and granulated sugar. Add the apple juice. Cook until sugar is dissolved. Spread over the sweet potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 45 minutes. Combine the brown sugar, granulated sugar, butter and cinnamon. Melt the butter in a small saucepan. Stir in the brown sugar and granulated sugar. Add the apple juice. Cook until sugar is dissolved. Spread over the sweet potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 45 minutes. Combine the brown sugar, granulated sugar, butter and cinnamon. Melt the butter in a small saucepan. Stir in the brown sugar and granulated sugar. Add the apple juice. Cook until sugar is dissolved. Spread over the sweet potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees F

Drain the tofu and cut into 8 even pieces. Combine the spinach, onion and seasoning in a large bowl. Drizzle with 2 teaspoons of the oil and toss well to coat. Spray one side of each bread slice with cooking spray. Place 2 slices on a large baking sheet and divide the spinach mixture between them. Top each sandwich with 1 piece of tofu and the remaining bread slice. Bake 8 minutes or until the tofu is lightly browned and the bread is toasted. Cut each sandwich in half diagonally. Serve with the mustard. Makes 4 servings.

In a small bowl combine ground beef, onion soup mix and egg. Form into four patties and set aside.In another bowl combine worcestershire sauce and seasoning salt. Mix well and set aside.In a separate bowl combine the self rising flour and beef broth until well combined and set aside.In a large skillet add two tablespoons of oil and brown the hamburger patties on each side over medium high heat. Add the mixture of the beef broth and seasoning salt and simmer until the gravy thickens. Remove from the heat and serve hot on mashed potatoes. Serves four.

In a small bowl, mix together crabmeat, onion, celery and parsley. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on each fillet and place a 1/2 crabmeat mixture on each fillet. Top with a piece of butter. Sprinkle with lemon juice and cayenne pepper. Place in a small casserole dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees for about 10 to15 minutes or until the fish flakes easily.

Grease two 8-inch cake pans or line with paper liners. In the bowl of an electric mixer cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. In another bowl combine the flour, baking soda, and saltstir into the butter mixture alternately with the lemon extract. Spread the batter into the prepared pans. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for five minutes on the pans then remove to cool completely on wire racks. To make frosting combine the sugar, lemon extract, and 7-up sodastir until smooth. Spread the frosting between the layers of cake and frost the top and sides of the cake. Decorate with candied lemon slices if desired.

Place the chicken thighs in the crock pot. In a bowl mix together the lime juice, chicken broth, garlic cloves, thyme leaves and pepper. Pour the mixture over the chicken in the crock pot. Turn the crock pot to high and cook for 3 hours. Stir the rice in and cook for another hour. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Combine cider, cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon sticks in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 10 minutes. Straindiscard the solids. Serve the cider warm or over ice. Add sugar to taste. Serves 4.

Melt margarine in a large heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add vanilla and sugar and stir until sugar dissolves. Add the corn syrup and stir until mixture reaches a soft ball stage on candy thermometer. Remove from heat and add popped popcorn. Stir until well coated. Spread on wax paper and sprinkle with nuts. Cool thoroughly.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Cut squash into 1 inch cubes. Toss squash cubes with melted butter, maple syrup & nutmeg & salt & pepper to taste. Place on a greased baking sheet & bake 15 minutes or until tender & lightly browned on the edges.

Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan. Cook and stir until mixture comes to a full rolling boil over medium heat. Boil for 5 minutes or until mixture reaches soft ball stage (236 degrees f). Remove from heat and quickly stir in vanilla and walnuts. Pour mixture into prepared pan and allow to cool before cutting. Makes 1 1/2 dozen pieces.

Preheat crockpot to low setting. Mix mushrooms in a bowl with ranch dressing mix, and butter until coated well. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Place in crockpot and cook on low until mushrooms are tender 3 to 4 hours. Stir occasionally to make sure mushrooms don't burn. Serve as a side dish or in a sandwich.

Beat egg whites in large bowl at medium speed until foamy. Add 1/4 cup sugar and beat until soft peaks form. Add flour and potato starch alternately with baking powder, beating at low speed after each addition until smooth. Divide batter among six 4-inch-diameter round cake pans coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 for 14 minutes or until cake springs back when touched in center. Cool completely in pans on wire racks. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add remaining 2/3 cup sugar and waterstir constantly until sugar dissolves. Bring mixture to a boil and cook for 2 minutes or until light amber in color and bubbly. Pour sauce evenly over cakes. Let stand until sauce cools slightly. Cut each cake into three piecesarrange, cut sides up, on serving plate. Pour any remaining sauce over cakes. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the refridgerator up to 2 days.

Mix together the flours, xanthan gum, and baking powder. Beat together the eggs and sugar. Add the brown sugar and the cinnamon. Stir in the egg mixture into the flour mixture and then add the zucchini and squash. Spray a 10-inch pie dish and pour the batter into the dish. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a bowl whisk together flour, cornmeal, pumpkin pie spice and baking powder. In another bowl combine yogurt, pumpkin puree, egg white, Splenda Brown Sugar Blend and vanilla extract and stir until well blended. Add to flour mixture all at once and stir just until moistened. Pour batter into a greased 9x13 inch pan or an 8 inch square pan. Bake at 350F for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes on a wire rack before cutting into bars to serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Divide the pesto into 4 portions. Spread each portion over 2 triangles of the puff pastry. Top each with a pinch of Parmesan cheese. Fold the other half of each triangle over the filling. Press edges firmly together. Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Brush pastry stars lightly with egg yolk. Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving. Makes 8 stars.

In a medium sized saucepan over medium-high heat, bring the butter and the broth to a boil, add the rice and let it cook for approximately 8 minutes or until all the liquid is gone and the rice is fluffy. Add the wine, shallots, and soy sauce and cook for another two minutes. Season with salt and pepper and serve warm.
Mix all together in a medium bowl and press onto bottom and sides of a 9 inch pie plate to form crust. Refrigerate for one hour before filling.

Wash and chop a medium-sized watermelon into chunks. Put in blender with 4 cups of water and 2 cups of frozen lemonade concentrate. Blend until smooth. Add 1/2 cup of fresh lemon juice and blend. Pour into pitcher and serve over ice. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 2 loaf pans or line them with parchment paper. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons oil over medium heat. Add turkey, onion and apple and saute until browned and cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain off fat and transfer turkey mixture to a large bowl. Add the remaining oils, mustard, rosemary and poultry seasoning and mix to combine. Add oats and mix to combine. Stir in 1 cup of cranberry sauce and mix to combine. Pour into loaf pans and bake 45 minutes or until done. Remove loaves from pans and serve with remaining cranberry sauce and gravy.

Preheat oven to 450. Wash potatoes. Cut in half and place on a rimmed cookie sheet. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast in oven for about 30 minutes or until potatoes are soft. In the meantime, place a large skillet over high heat. Add olive oil and once hot add in the onion. Cook for 3-4 minutes until onion is translucent. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute. Turn heat down and add the paprika, cooking for 1-2 more minutes. Once the paprika is cooked, add in the spinach, parsley, lemon juice, and parmesan cheese. Salt and pepper. Remove potatoes from oven. In the same skillet you cooked the onions in, place the potatoes, seasoned veggies, and lemon juice mixture. Mix everything together. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve hot.

Put water and sugar into large, heavy-bottomed pan and set over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring occasionally, until the mixture reaches 245 F on a candy thermometer. This will take 20 to 25 minutes. (If you don't have a thermometer, you'll know you're there when the mixture is amber colored and starting to thicken.) Remove from the heat and pour the hot syrup into the bowl of an electric mixer. Add the egg yolks and whip on high speed until the mixture has cooled to room temperature and is thick and creamy, about 5 minutes. Stir the vanilla extract into the mixture. Meanwhile, place the cream into a small saucepan. Heat over medium heat until the cream just begins to boil. (Avoid letting it boil over.) Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the vanilla extract. Set aside to cool slightly. Once the cream is cool enough to handle (but still warm), whip it into the egg yolk mixture until the mixture is thick and stiff. Pour the mixture into the bowl of an ice

Preheat oven to 350. Coat chops with flour. Brown in skillet with butter. Place half the onion slices in bottom of greased casserole dish. Top with chops. Pour half the soup over. Repeat layers. Bake 1 hour. Garnish with remaining onion slices. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Blend the butter and fine sugar together until creamy. Add the unsweetened chocolate and vanilla and blend well. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Pour into an unbaked frozen pie crust. Bake for 55-60 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center of the pie comes out clean. Cool and refrigerate. For the whipped cream, beat the cream until soft peaks form. Add the confectioners sugar and continue beating until stiff. Spread over pie and serve.

Beat eggs. Add baking powder, salt and pepper. Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Pour egg mixture in pan. As eggs start to set, sprinkle with cheese. When eggs are cooked, fold over to cover cheese. Serve immediately with green onion on top.

In a medium pot over medium heat, add olive oil. Add the onions and sauté for about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and sauté for another minute. Add the lentils, the water and the dried chili. Bring to a boil. Simmer over low heat until the lentils are soft. Season to taste. Serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Cut squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds with a spoon. Place cut-sides up in a baking dish with 1/4 inch of water in the bottom. Bake 30 minutes or until soft when pierced with a knife. In a small saucepan, combine the maple syrup and sage leaf over medium-high heat until boiling, 1 to 2 minutes. Let cool slightly, then drizzle over the squash halves to serve.

Heat oven to 450 degrees f. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add brown onion and saute until slightly caramelized, about 5 minutes. Add mullet and cook for an additional 5 minutes or until fish is just cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. Transfer fillets to a baking dish and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and pour white vinegar over fillets to cover. Let cool for 30 minutes. Garnish with parsley and serve at room temperature with lemon wedges.

In a large saucepan combine the apples, water and sugar. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce the heatsimmer uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes or until apples are tender. Remove from the heat. Stir in the cinnamon and cloves. Cool slightlypuree with an immersion blender. Serve warm. Makes 4 cups.

Fill a large paper bag with the asparagus spears, sliced lemon, extra virgin olive oil, bay leaf and salt and pepper to taste and seal tightly. Place the bag on the grill or in the oven and steam for about 12 minutes or until the asparagus is tender and the lemon has begun to soften. Remove from the heat and allow the asparagus to cool for about 1 minute. Unwrap the asparagus and serve.

Preheat the oven to 300 degrees. Season the lamb shoulder with the sea salt, crushed rosemary, chopped garlic, and black peppercorns. Heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan. Add the oregano. Fry the lamb shoulder in the oil until brown on all sides. Pour off the excess fat. Add the red wine vinegar to the pan. Add a cup of water to the pan to make a sauce. Bring to a boil. Place the lamb in a 13 x 10-inch pan. Pour the red wine vinegar sauce over the lamb. Cover tightly with foil. Bake for 4 hours. Uncover the lamb. Add a little water to the pan to make a sauce. Pour the sauce over the lamb. Bake for another 2 hours. Turn the lamb over. Continue cooking until the lamb is tender. Turn the lamb over again. Continue cooking for another 30 minutes.

In a large skillet cook noodles according to package directions until tenderdrain. Meanwhile, combine butter with half-and-half. In a large bowl, combine noodles with butter mixture. Stir in cheese and dressing mix until blended. Spoon into two 1-1/2-quart baking dishes coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until hot. Sprinkle with more cheese if desired. Makes 4 servings. Edit. Any flavor of salad dressing mix can be substituted for Italian dressing mix.
