In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, pepper, garlic and sausage and cook until sausage is no longer pink. Add pineapple chunks and juice, mango chutney and chili powder and simmer for 1 minute. Serve over rice.

Drain beans, chop onions and bell peppers into food processor. Add dressing mix and egg. Process until well mixed. Add breadcrumbs until well mixed. Form into patties. Fry in olive oil until browned on both sides.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large flameproof casserole combine the chicken pieces and onion soup mix and add the crushed tomatoes, tomato puree and basil. Bring to the boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the chili pepper and simmer for 10 minutes longer. Sprinkle in the stock cube and add the wine vinegar. Bring to the boil and transfer the chicken mixture into a small casserole and bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve with rice.

To a large sauce pan, add the water, salt and brown sugar. Stir until the salt is dissolved. Add the chicken and bring the mixture to a boil. Turn down the heat to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes. Remove the chicken from the brine mixture and pat dry with paper towels. Place the chicken in a large bowl or resealable plastic bag with the olive oil. Toss to coat the chicken with the oil. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. When ready to cook the chicken, grill it over medium-high heat or broil it in the oven. Cook until the meat is no longer pink inside and the juices run clear when you cut into the thickest part of the meat. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce or with a drizzle of your favorite barbecue sauce.

Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add sugar and datesstir until smooth. Remove from heat. Cool for 5 minutes. Stir in glace cherries. Working with moist hands, form mixture into 1 inch balls. Roll balls in coconut. Store in airtight container. Makes approximately 4 dozen balls.

Season the chicken as desired. Brown the chicken on all sides in hot olive oil. Cover with onion soup mix and broth or water (about a cup) and cover the pot. Bring the pot to a boil on high heat and then reduce heat to a simmer and cook for about 10 minutes or until the chicken is done. Remove the chicken and shred the meat. Return the shredded chicken and any juice to the pot and add the cream of mushroom soup and milk, stirring well. In a large bowl add the cooked rice and stir in the shredded meat and creamy soup mixture until evenly distributed and season as desired. Serve hot.
Mix ranch salad dressing with dill and dried parsley. Place fillet on baking sheet. Drizzle dressing on salmon. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Cut each chile in half lengthwiseremove seeds and membranes. Sprinkle each inside of chile evenly with 1/4 cup of the cheese. In a medium bowl, stir together the eggs and butter. In a separate bowl, combine the flour and baking powder. Stir the flour mixture into the egg mixture until well blended. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the mixture into each chile half. Bake in the preheated oven until the tops are golden brown. Serve warm with salsa.

Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl. Form into 1 inch balls. Melt 1 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan. Cook the meatballs for 5-8 minutes until browned. Cook for a further 5-10 minutes in a 180c oven. Serve with your favourite pasta and sauce.
Mix together all the ingredients. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve over cooked pasta.

In a large bowl combine crisp rice and 1 cup chocolate chips. In a saucepan combine the corn syrup and butter. Heat over medium heat until boiling. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla. Pour over crisp rice mixture. Stir until chocolate chips are evenly coated. Pour into buttered 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 300 degrees for 20-25 minutes. Do not stir. Sprinkle remaining chocolate chips over top. Let stand for 10 minutes. Using a buttered spatula, loosen the edges and turn out onto a cutting board. Cut into squares.

Cut peaches into 2 inch pieces. In a 9-inch omelette pan melt butter over low heat. Whisk eggs together with milk. Add liquid honey, vanilla extract. Pour mixture into the pan. Cook until omelette is set. Sprinkle with sliced almonds. Top with 1 teaspoon of icing sugar. Serve with fresh fruit.

Place all ingredients except tea and milk in a saucepan. Add water to a depth of about 1-inch. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then lower heat and simmer for about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Strain into a heatproof pitcher. Cool completely. Add tea. Add milk. Pour over ice. Stir. Garnish with a sprig of mint.

Wash and peel potatoes and turnips. Cut both to 1/2 inch dice. Place in large skillet. Add 1/4 inch water. Bring to boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered 5 minutes or until tender. Add onion and garlic to skillet. Cook 1 minute. Stir in salt and pepper. Serve sprinkled with parsley. Serve with meats or fish.
Combine black beans and frozen corn kernels in a medium bowl. Add salsa and mix well. Chill and serve with tortilla chips.
Preheat oven to 400f. Dip each chicken breast in pasta sauce. Top each breast with mozzarella cheese and parmesan cheese. Bake for about 10 minutes or until internal temp is 165 degrees.

Mix mashed potato with egg and grated cheese. Form into balls the size of a large walnut. Roll in breadcrumbs and fry in hot oil until golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper and serve with tomato ketchup or mayonnaise.

Mix sugar, almond extract, and salt together in a bowl. Add tart cherries and stir well. Roll pastry out to fit a 9 inch pie pan. Put a few teaspoons of almond extract in between the layers. Lay cherries in bottom layer and dot with butter. Cover with top crust. Make sure to seal the edges well so that the juices will not run out. Crimp edges with a fork. Cut several slits in top crust to allow steam to escape while baking. Bake at 450 for 20 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cool on wire rack for 2 hours before slicing.
Spread bread with pesto sauce. Layer with taleggio cheese and sun-dried tomatoes. Place on top arugula and prosciutto. Drizzle with olive oil. Serve with eggs.

In a medium saucepan, combine caramels and water and melt over low heat (stir constantly). Remove from heat and stir in pecans and crisp rice. Spread mixture onto wax paper or foil and let cool completely. Melt chocolate chips and shortening together in the microwave (or in top of double boiler). Spread chocolate mixture over caramel layer and refrigerate for 1 hour or until chocolate has hardened. Break into bite size pieces and enjoy.

1. beat the eggs with milk, salt and pepper. 2. fill the ziploc bag with the ham, cheese, hash browns, and the rest of the stuff that goes in it. 3. pour the eggs into the bag and then the bag in the boiling water for about 8 minutes (it will puff up, let it sit for about a minute). 4. cut the bottom of the bag with scissors to let it drain out of the bag, put it on a plate and serve it with toast or anything else you want with it.

Mix lime juice, orange juice, orange marmalade, ginger, dried mustard and salt. Stir in hot pepper flakes and set aside. In a small skillet, melt 3 tablespoons of butter. Place fillets in skillet. Cook 5 minutes on each side or until fillets are cooked through. Remove from heat and brush with 1/4 cup of butter. Serve with glaze.

In a large skillet or pot over medium heat, add mussels and wine. Cover pot and cook 5 minutes. Stir and cover again. Cook another 5 minutes or until mussels open. Remove pot from heat. Stir in parsley. Serve with crusty Italian or French bread. Enjoy.

In a saucepan of boiling water cook the rice according to the package directions. In a separate saucepan heat the butter. Add the onions and saute until translucent. Add the frozen peas. Add the cooked rice. Stir in the chicken broth. Season to taste. Allow to cool. Line a ring mold with plastic wrap. Lay the mixture into the mold. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate until firm. Remove from the fridge 10 minutes prior to serving. Arrange lettuce leaves on a plate. Remove the ring from the mold. Place the ring on the lettuce leaves. Garnish with a bit of grated cheddar cheese. Serve.

Heat bacon grease in a skillet, add cornmeal and cook for a few minutes while stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add baking powder, baking soda and salt, stirring constantly. Add buttermilk and egg and stir constantly again. Add pepper and butter and stir once more. Pour mixture into a greased 9 x 12 pan and bake for 1 hour at 350.

Peel potatoes, celeriac and onions. Cut potatoes into large chunks, celeriac and onions into small chunks. Cook in a pot of water until tender but not mushy. Remove vegetables from water, allow to cool slightly. Blend vegetables with butter in a food processor until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with any type of meat dish or as a side dish for dinner or brunch.

Peel and devein shrimp, reserving shells for stock. Cut shrimp into 1/2-inch pieces and set aside. In a blender, combine tomatoes, onion, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, cumin, garlic, lime juice, salt and pepper to taste. Blend until smooth. Add shrimp and toss well to combine. Serve with shells for dipping or tossing with the salsa.

Cook pasta in a large pan of boiling water according to packet instructions. Drain well and return to pan. Heat oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add mushrooms, chives, garlic and mustard. Cook for 1-2 minutes until mushrooms are tender. Add ham and cook for a further 1-2 minutes. Add peas and cook for 1 minute. Add creme fraiche, season with salt and pepper and toss through pasta. Serve immediately with a sprinkling of parmesan cheese.

In a small bowl whisk together the soy sauce, lime juice, honey and ginger until the honey dissolves. Sprinkle the chicken on both sides with garlic powder and sprinkle each breast with 1 tsp. of the ginger marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Grill chicken over medium heat, turning once and basting with remaining marinade until cooked through and well browned on each side. Serve immediately.

In a medium heavy saucepan combine sugar, corn syrup, and 1/2 cup water. Place over medium heat. Stir with wooden spoon. Bring to a boil and cook until mixture reaches 300f on candy thermometer. Remove from heat immediately. Stir in baking soda until mixture foams up. Immediately stir in vanilla and nuts. Drop mixture onto greased wax paper by teaspoonfuls, 2 inches apart. Let cool completely. Break into pieces. Makes 1 pound peanut brittle.

In a shallow roasting pan, pour water to cover the bottom of pan. Add brisket. In a large bowl, combine the remaining ingredientspour over brisket. Cover pan with foil. Bake in oven at 250 degrees for 8-10 hours or until fork tender. Remove the meat from the pan. Cover the pan with foil. Turn the oven off. Set the oven to the broil setting. Place the roasting pan in the oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

Add green onions and scotch bonnet peppers to blender. Blend on low until chopped. Add garlic cloves. Blend on low until garlic is chopped. Add white wine vinegar and brown sugar. Blend on low until well mixed. Add ground allspice. Blend on low until well mixed. Add dried thyme and salt. Blend on low until well mixed. Add black pepper. Blend on low until well mixed.

Cream the sugar and butter together. Beat in the peanut butter. Add the powdered chocolate milk mix. Combine the dry ingredients. Stir in the dry ingredients. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 9 minutes. Makes about 2 dozen.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Cut the fennel into wedges and trim the top and root of the onion. Peel and trim the sweet potato and carrot. Place the fennel and onion on a baking sheet and drizzle with oil. Roast for 30 minutes. Add the carrot and sweet potato and continue to roast for another 30 minutes. After roasting, sprinkle with salt and pepper and fresh rosemary.

Mix cream cheese, monterey jack, worcestershire sauce and liquid smoke until smooth. Stir in bacon and chives. Spread mixture evenly in an unbaked pie shell or large cookie sheet. Bake for about 1 hour or until firm and lightly browned on top. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve with assorted vegetables.

Dice pineapple and remove tough core from center of pineapple. Dice onion and garlic cloves. Blend together pineapple juice, sherry and brown sugar in a medium sauce pan. Stir in rosemary leaves and garlic cloves. Bring to a boil and reduce to medium heat. Cook until mixture is syrupy and thickens about 15 minutes. Place pork loin chops in sauce pan in a single layer. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes until tender. Turn chops over half way through cooking time. Serve with rice or noodles.

Mix cocoa, sugar, milk and margarine. Add vanilla and mix well. Add oatmeal, then stir in peanut butter. Let the dough chill for 1 hour. Make cookies with your hands or with a teaspoon. Chill until set.
Combine coffee, cinnamon and saffron in a coffee maker and add water to fill the water resevoir. Brew coffee as usual. Stir 2 tbsp honey into coffee.

Mix tequila, soy sauce and honey in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Lower heat to medium-low and cook for about 10 minutes or until it has thickened a little. Remove from heat. Stir in dijon mustard, cloves, hot sauce and fresh cilantro. Set aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a shallow bowl or plate, combine 1/2 teaspoon coarse salt, ground pepper. Dip each chicken wing into the salt mixture, then dunk the wings into the tequila sauce. Place the wings into an ungreased baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until they are cooked through. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Cream butter and sugar together, add one yolk at a time, then add extracts. Stir in flour until dough forms. Roll dough into a 1 inch ball. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten slightly with your palm. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 minutes. Remove from oven and cool on wire rack. Makes 2 1/2 dozen cookies.

Cook macaroni in a large pot of boiling water until tender. Drain pasta and rinse under cold running water until cool enough to handle. Drain again in a colander. Add macaroni to a large mixing bowl along with the soup, peas, and cheese. Stir until well combined. Spread mixture in a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight. Bake in a preheated oven set to 400 degrees f until hot and bubbly about 45 minutes. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.

Prepare lime jello according to package directions. Add 1 can pineapple, 2 cans pineapple juice, 1/2 can sweetened condensed milk. Mix well. Chill. Prepare rice according to package directions. Serve chilled rice and pineapple mixture in parfait glasses. Garnish with whole maraschino cherries.

Pour 3 cups of water into small saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in agar-agar flakes, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 3-5 minutes. Set aside to cool slightly. Meanwhile, combine 3 tablespoons of instant espresso with 3 cups of hot water. Stir to dissolve. In small bowl, mix together soy milk, tofu, maple syrup, cocoa powder, vanilla extract and sea salt. Stir to combine. Once agar-agar mixture has cooled slightly, add tofu mixture and whisk to combine thoroughly. Stir in espresso mixture. Spoon mixture into pie crust. Chill at least 4 hours or overnight. Serve with whipped cream on top, if desired.

In a heavy 4 quart pot heat the olive oil. Add the leeks and cook over low heat until soft. Stir in the fish stock, mustard and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Season with salt and pepper. Place the fish fillets in the soup. Cover the pot and cook for 10 to 15 minutes until fish is done. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve hot.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta. Cook until al dente, about 9 minutes. Drain pasta in a colander. Return pasta to pot. Add 1/2 cup olive oil, garlic, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, baby spinach, and pine nuts. Toss well. Serve immediately or at room temperature.

Chop cucumber and red pepper into 1/2 inch pieces and place in a bowl. Salt to taste and cover with ice water for 15 minutes to crisp cucumbers and peppers. Drain and pat dry. Toss with lettuce and parsley and set aside. Cut avocado into 1/2 inch pieces and place in a bowl. Add chili pepper, lime juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss with cucumber mixture and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. On a cutting board with a sharp knife, slice each crescent into 10 strips. Roll up the strips to form a crescent. Place the rolls on a baking sheet. Brush the rolls with the mustard. Top with the cheese and sausage. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Let cool for a few minutes. Serve warm.
In a large bowl combine tomatoes, onion, cilantro and cumin. Stir in adobo sauce and vinegar. Season with salt. Gently stir in oil until combined. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

Place salmon fillets in a shallow dish. Melt margarine and mix in sugar and soy sauce until well blended. Add in dry sherry and blend well. Pour over salmon fillets and let marinate for 15 minutes. Grill for about 2 minutes on each side.

In a large bowl combine potatoes, olive oil and garlic. Toss well to coat evenly. Spread potatoes evenly on two baking sheets. Roast for 1 hour 30 minutes to 1 hour 40 minutes, turning once halfway through roasting. In the last 15 minutes of roasting season with rosemary, parsley, mustard, lemon juice and butter. Salt to taste. Serve hot, warm or at room temperature.

Season chicken with seasoning. Coat chicken with flour. Brown chicken in butter. Remove chicken from pan. In pan add cereal and stir until toasted. Stir in butter. Add seasoned chicken. Cover. Bake at 350f for 25-30 minutes or until done.

Spread 1 tablespoon goat cheese over pita breads. Top each with 1/4 cup pesto, 1/4 cup sun-dried tomato, and 1/4 cup goat cheese. Wrap sandwiches in plastic wraprefrigerate up to 6 hours. In each sandwich, cut 1/4 inch from each edge to form 1/2 moon shape. Open sandwichesplace on plates. Serve with remaining pesto for dipping.

Cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon to a plate lined with paper towels. Set aside to drain. Cook the potatoes in a large skillet with the green pepper, onion and 1/2 teaspoon salt until tender, about 10 minutes. Remove the vegetables from the pan with a slotted spoon to a plate lined with paper towels. Heat the olive oil over medium heat in the same skillet and add the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add the bacon. Cook until crispy, about 1 minute. Set aside to drain. In a large bowl combine the vegetables with the bacon and the cooked potatoes. Add the cheddar cheese and eggs and mix gently until combined. Heat the olive oil over medium heat in the same skillet and cook the eggs until set on each side. Divide the eggs evenly among the four plates with the vegetable mixture on top of each egg. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

In a slow cooker, combine the steak with the seasoning salt. Add the onion and green pepper. Layer in the vegetables and gravy mix. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 hours. Stir in the peas and noodles and cook 30 minutes longer. Serve with crackers.

Slice zucchini into thin strips and saute in hot oil until tender. Add onion, mushrooms and green pepper and saute until tender. Add taco sauce and cheddar cheese. Place on tostados and top with sour cream and tomatoes.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Rinse the leg of lamb and pat it dry. Make several long slits in the leg of lamb and stuff with garlic. Season the leg of lamb with lemon and pepper. Combine the flour and the salt and pepper in a shallow dish. Dip the leg of lamb in the flour mixture, then brown it in the hot oil over medium-high heat. Place the leg of lamb in a shallow baking pan and roast for 1 hour. Pour the chicken stock into the pan. Baste the leg of lamb with the stock. Bake for 30 to 40 more minutes. Sprinkle with mint jelly and serve.

Remove ramp leaves and thinly slice ribs. In a large skillet, add olive oil over medium high heat and saute pork ribs for about 4 minutes on each side or until slightly browned and cooked through. Remove pork from skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add ramps and saute for about 3 minutes or until slightly wilted and tender. Next add garlic cloves and cook for about one minute. Add habanero peppers and cook for another minute or until slightly softened. Add vinegar and allow mixture to simmer for about one minute or until slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper. Top cooked ribs with ramps and habaneros and serve.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Place the sprouts in a baking pan and toss them with the olive oil. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper to taste. Roast in the preheated oven until tender and browned, about 30 to 40 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Drain yogurt, saving 1/4 cup for serving. Mash yogurt with green onion. Stir in cream cheese and feta. Season with oregano, black pepper, and paprika. Place cherry tomatoes in a shallow bowl. Stuff with cream cheese mixture. Chill for 1 hour. Serve with reserved yogurt.

Cook ground beef in skillet over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain off fat. Return meat to pan. Add cheese. Stir until melted. Season with garlic and seasoning. Serve on hamburger buns. Makes 4 servings.

Steam broccoli until crisp tender. Melt butter in a medium skillet. Add flour. Cook over low heat until mixture is golden brown. Gradually add milk stirring constantly until mixture is smooth. Remove from heat. Add tuna, cheese and broccoli. Season to taste. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 30 minutes at 350f.
Pour orange juice into a glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir in carbonated lemon-lime beverage. Add an orange slice for garnish. Makes 1 serving.

Place one pie shell in a 9x13 baking dish. Mix all ingredients except french fried onion rings together. Pour into pie shell. Top with remaining pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Serves 6.

Mix all the ingredients together and shape into 1" meatballs. Heat 1/2 tablespoon oil in a non-stick skillet and saute the meatballs 1 minute on each side or until brown. Pour in tomato sauce. Cover and simmer 30 minutes. Serve with pasta and garnish with basil leaves.

Slice bread into four equal parts and place on a cutting board. In a pan over low heat, melt butter. Crack egg into butter. Let the egg cook for about 3 minutes or until the egg is cooked but not dry. Flip over the egg so it is cooked on both sides. Place the cooked egg on the bottom half of the bread and top it with orange marmalade. Top it off with the second piece of bread. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 2 (9 inch) round cake pans. In a large bowl combine the cake mix and the sour cream. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in the eggs one at a time. Beat well after each addition. Stir in the oil, water and vanilla. Stir in the morsels. Divide batter evenly between prepared pans. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove from pan to cool completely on a wire rack. Frost with chocolate icing.

Grease a 13x9 inch baking pan. Combine margarine and marshmallows in a large microwave safe bowl. Microwave uncovered for 4-5 minutes or until marshmallows are softened. Stir until completely melted. Add the creamy peanut butter. Stir until well combined. In a large bowl combine the rice krispies, oats and sesame seeds. Pour the marshmallow mixture over the dry mix. Stir until well coated. Spread into the baking pan. Sprinkle with raisins and chopped peanuts. Let stand for 10 minutes. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Cut into 18 bars. Makes 18 bars.

In small bowl, mix cream cheese and garlic. Stir until smooth and well blended. Spread evenly into 13x9x2-inch glass or ceramic dish. Arrange tomato slices over cream cheese. Sprinkle with pepper. Chill at least 1 hour. Serve with crackers.

Cut squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds and discard. Cut squash into 1/2 inch thick slices. Cut peppers into similar sized pieces. Heat large saute pan over med heat. Add squash and peppers and saute 5 minutes or until squash is tender. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Stir in parsley and parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Melt butter in large saucepan over low heat. Add sugar and cocoa. Stir until smooth. Add milk and cornstarch. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture thickens and boils. Remove from heat. Cool to lukewarm. Beat egg yolks. Gradually add 1 cup of the hot mixture to egg yolks. Return to saucepan and cook and stir until thickened. Remove from heat. Add chocolate chips. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold into chocolate mixture. Refrigerate 2 hours or until thoroughly chilled.

Preheat the oven to 400f. Line a large baking sheet with aluminum foilspray with cooking spray. Pierce the potatoes several times with a forkplace on the baking sheet. Roast for 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. Cool for 10 minutespeel skins offmash with a fork. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the bell pepper and chilicook for 4 minutes or until the vegetables are tender, stirring frequently. Stir in the garliccook for 2 minutes or until the garlic is fragrant. Stir the potato into the vegetable mixturestir in the cream cheesecook for 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted and well blended. Stir in the milkcook for 2 minutes or until the potato mixture is smooth and thickened. Stir in the corianderseason with salt and pepper. Serves 4.

Heat 2 cups of water in saucepan until almost boiling. Add tea bags. Steep 5 minutes. Add sugar to taste. Remove tea bags. Add cranberry juice cocktail. Add wine and orange slices. Add cloves. Simmer 5 minutes. Serves 10.

Place a slow cooker on high heat. Sprinkle both sides of chicken with salt & pepper, onion powder & chili powder. In the slow cooker stir together red enchilada sauce & condensed soup. Place chicken on top of sauce mixture & cook 4 hours. Add black beans & cook 1 more hour. Sprinkle with shredded cheese & top with tortilla chips. Serves 8-10.

Prepare gelatin as directed, cool. Pour into 9 inch pie plate. Chill until firm. Meanwhile combine cranberry sauce and juice from can of pineapple in a small bowl. Beat well. Stir in oranges and pecans. Spoon over gelatin and chill until firm. Serve topped with Cool Whip.
Combine beef, coffee, soy, salt and butter and cook until no longer pink. Serve on poppy seed rolls. Serve with lettuce and ketchup or mustard.

Bring coconut milk and whole milk just to boiling in heavy saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in tapioca and sugar and cook until tapioca is tender and mixture is thick. Remove from heat and stir in egg. Pour into large greased 9x9-inch baking pan and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Stir in fruit and spread in pan. Combine coconut and raisins and sprinkle over fruit. Bake for another 30 minutes or until set. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a medium bowl mash beans with a potato masher or fork until almost smooth. Stir in jalapeno pepper and a small pinch of salt to taste. Preheat grill or grill pan over medium high heat. Brush tortillas with oil on one side of each tortilla. Place tortillas on grill or grill pan with oiled side down. Spread 1/2 cup of the bean mixture evenly over half of each tortilla. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup cheese. Top with 1/4 avocado and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons cheese. Top with remaining tortilla half. Cook tortillas until cheese is melted and tortillas are slightly charred and grill marks appear on each side, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Cut tortillas in half and serve with lime wedges.

In a pitcher, stir together cranberry-raspberry juice, red wine, Grand Marnier and sugar until thoroughly mixed. Refrigerate 15 minutes. Add orange and lemon slices. Place cranberries in a small bowl. Add club soda. Pour sangria into glasses. Add fresh berries. Garnish with sprigs of fresh mint. Serves 6 to 8.

In a medium bowl stir together the cocoa powder and 1/4 cup sugar. In another bowl beat together the cornstarch and 1/4 cup sugar until well blended. Add the cocoa mixture and beat until thoroughly combined. Beat in the cinnamon, instant coffee granules and vanilla until well blended. In a medium saucepan over medium heat whisk together the milk and butter. Add the cornstarch mixture and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat. Beat in the remaining 1/4 cup sugar. Return to heat and bring to a boil. Cook and stir until thickened and smooth. Remove from heat. Add vanilla and stir to combine. Pour into serving dishes and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. 3 pts. Each.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add macaroni and cook for 10 minutes or until al dentedrain and cool on a wire rack. In a large bowl, mix together macaroni, chili, tomato sauce, ketchup and chili powder. Transfer to a 9-inch pie plate or 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle evenly with cheddar cheesebake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Makes 6 servings.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add tomato sauce, apple juice, vinegar, and next 6 ingredients. Cook over medium heat until thick and bubbly. Transfer mixture to 4-quart slow cooker. Arrange roast in slow cooker. Pour tomato mixture evenly over roast. Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 6 hours. Remove roast from slow cooker. Skim fat from cooking juice. Discard fat. Stir together cornstarch and water. Add cornstarch mixture and next 4 ingredients to cooking juice. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened. Spoon over roast. Yield: 6 servings

Brown pork chops in fat. Remove chops and set aside. Sauté onion in fat until softened. Add tomatoes, green pepper and marjoram, thyme and season to taste with consomme. Return chops to pan cover and simmer for 1 hour or until done to your liking. Fluff rice with a fork. Mound in center of each plate. Place pork chops on top and spoon over sauce. Serve immediately.

Bring frozen potatoes wedges to room temperature. Preheat oven to 400. Place in a baking pan with the sliced onions. Mix together sour cream, cheddar cheese and garlic. Sprinkle over potatoes. Bake in the oven for 45 minutes. Serve topped with crumbled bacon and parmesan cheese.

In a heavy skillet, melt the butter and add the onions and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook slowly until the onions are golden and caramelized. Add the balsamic vinegar and stir until the liquid evaporates and the onions are glazed with the vinegar. Sprinkle with pine nuts and serve over steamed cauliflower. Serve with steamed broccoli and carrot medley if desired.
Cut papaya lengthwise, removing the seeds. Fill papaya halves with fruit mixture. Sprinkle with almond granola and mint. Serve chilled.

In a small bowl, mix together crushed crackers, seasonings and melted butter. Place chops in a large zip top bag and add crumb mixture, seal bag and shake to coat well. Heat oil over medium heat in large skillet until hot. Working in batches, fry chops 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately.
Pour 1/2 of the wine into a large pitcher. Add the pineapple tidbits, apple and sugar. Toss to combine. Add the lime juice. Top with the club soda. Stir and serve over ice.

Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlicsaute until golden, about 6 minutes. Add chickencook until browned on both sides, about 6 minutes. Add broth and next 4 ingredients (broth through red chili powder)bring to a boil. Add hominyreduce heat to medium low, and simmer until chicken is cooked through and hominy is tender, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from heat. Serve with lime wedges.

Preheat oven to 475 degrees. Season beef with salt and pepper on both sides. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add rosemary and garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Add mustard and herbs and continue sauteing until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add beef and saute until brown on all sides. Add wine and stir to deglaze pan. Transfer beef to roasting pan and place in oven. Roast until internal temperature reaches 120 degrees F (about 14 minutes per pound), then transfer to a wire rack and allow to rest for 10 minutes. Slice and serve with pan sauce.

Dissolve yeast in warm water. In large bowl combine yeast mixture and 1 cup of flour and mix well. Add remaining flour and cornmeal and knead until dough is no longer sticky. Divide dough into four equal portions and form each into a ball. Place each ball on an oiled baking sheet and let rest until dough has doubled in size (approximately 1 1/2 hours). Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place each ball on a greased cookie sheet and bake 10 minutes or until golden brown and crisp on the outside.
Cut avocado into chunks. Chop onion. Combine avocado and onion. Season with salt and pepper. Serve in a lettuce leaf as an appetizer.

Wash broccoli, then place in boiling water for about 1 minute. Drain, rinse with cold water, drain again and set aside. In large bowl combine broccoli, onion, cheese, raisins, bacon and mayonnaise. Combine vinegar, worcestershire sauce, sugar and salt. Mix in with the broccoli mixture. Toss lightly and refrigerate for about an hour.

Cut green beans into 2-inch pieces. Saute onions and green beans in butter until tender-crisp. Add skim milk and cream of mushroom soup. Simmer until heated through. Serve over rice or pasta. Sprinkle with french-fried onions. Serves 4.

Wash and peel the beetroot and slice into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces. Place the beets in a bowl and cover with water. Leave to soak for at least an hour or preferably overnight. Drain the beetroot and place in a large saucepan with the vinegar, water, sugar and spices (except the salt). Bring to the boil and then simmer for about 1 hour or until the beets are tender and the liquid is reduced by half. Remove the spices and season with salt and pepper. Let the beetroot cool and place in a sterilized jar. Pour the liquid over the beetroot and seal the jar. Refrigerate for up to a month.

Pre heat oven to 400 degrees F. Beat biscuit mix and margarine with a fork or pastry blender until crumbly. Spoon about one-fourth of the mixture into each of four paper-lined muffin cups. Press mixture over bottom and sides of each cup. Bake for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and place one chicken breast in each cup. Sprinkle with half of the parmesan cheese. Bake for another 12 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly. Sprinkle each chicken breast with lemon juice and the remaining parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------.

Whisk together sour cream, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, garlic and salt until well blended. Stir in buttermilk, red wine vinegar and pepper until smooth. Stir in parsley and feta cheese. Refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving. Makes 1/2 cup. Serve on salads.

Grease the inside of a crockpot with a little olive oil and pour in the pasta. Pour the pizza sauce over the pasta. Add the hamburger, mushrooms and onion. Add the cheese on top. Add the pepperoni. Cook on high for 1 hour then on low for 3 hours. Serve with your favorite toppings.
In a small bowl combine all the ingredients and stir until well combined. Add popcorn and stir until evenly coated. Store in an air-tight container for up to a week.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly butter a 9 inch pie plate. Beat the eggs and milk together. Add the cornbread stuffing and turkey and mix well. Add the cheese and spices and mix well. Pour into the pie plate. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes. Let cool for 20 minutes before serving.

Saut the broccoli florets in the butter. Cook until tender. Add the tomatoes and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Add the broth and cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the orzo pasta and the shrimp. Cook until the shrimp are cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with dried basil. Serve hot.

Heat oil over medium high heat. Add garlic to heat for a few seconds only. Add tomatoes and heat for 5 minutes stirring occasionally. Add red pepper flakes to taste. Serve with pasta or over chicken or fish.
Spread ham on bottom half of roll and top with swiss cheese and bacon. Place cheddar cheese on top half of roll and place on top. Serve immediately.

Cut pear into wedges and remove seeds. Toss with lemon juice and cinnamon stick. Thread pear and apricot pieces onto 4 skewers. In small saucepan combine preserves and rum. Bring to a boil. Brush fruit with glaze. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a medium saucepan. Stir in milk. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils. Boil one minute. Remove from heat. Add butter and vanilla. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 50 minutes. Serve with whipped cream.

Combine the cherry gelatin and water in a small bowl. Let soften for 5 minutes. Add the cherry pie filling and stir well. Refrigerate. In a large bowl combine the crushed pineapple, cream cheese and sour cream. Beat until smooth. Beat in the sugar and vanilla. Spread half of the mixture in a 9 inch pie plate. Spread the cherry mixture over the cream cheese mixture. Spread the remaining cream cheese mixture over the cherry mixture. Garnish with the toasted pecans. Chill for 4 hours. Serves 8.

Cook sausage and onion over medium high heat until cooked through, approximately 4-5 minutes. Drain well and set aside. In saucepan, combine sausage and onion with alfredo sauce and water and simmer over medium heat until heated through. Meanwhile, thaw breadstick dough at room temperature until soft (about 30 minutes). Unroll breadstick dough onto floured surface and roll out to desired size (about 12x12 inches). Spread with alfredo sauce mixture and top with frozen green peas (if using frozen). Roll up dough and seal edges (using flour as needed). Cut roll into 12 slices. In shallow dish, mix 1 cup Parmesan cheese and 1 cup bread crumbs until well combined. In shallow dish, beat eggs with 1 tablespoon water and 2 teaspoons milk until blended. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat (or lightly coat pan with cooking spray). Dip rolls in egg mixture, then in cheese/bread crumb mixture (pressing crumb

In 2 1/2 quart saucepan, heat butter over medium heat. Add celery and cook until tender. Stir in rice and cook until lightly browned. Drain. Add water, cover and cook 7 minutes. Uncoverstir in beef and cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees until heated through and cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.

Juice two oranges and two limes in a bowl. Mash avocado into bowl. Add cilantro, tomatoes, onions and serrano peppers. Mix well. Season with sea salt and garlic. Serve with chips or with tortilla chips or use as a dip with your favorite chips or vegetables.

Heat oven to 375f degrees. Grease a baking dish with margarine. Lay pork chops in dish. In a large skillet cook onion, bell pepper in butter until tender. Add pineapple and juicecook until mixture is thickened. Pour over pork chops and bake for 30 minutes or until chops are no longer pink in the center. Serve with rice.

Bring potato mix and corn to a boil in large saucepanstir in milk, cream cheese and hot sauce. Add tomatoes and green chilies and cook 5 minutes or until heated through, stirring occasionally. Garnish with parsley.

In a large bowl combine olives with the rosemary, thyme, parsley, garlic, lemon juice, lemon zest, salt and pepper. Mix well. Transfer mixture to a large jar. Add olive oil. Cover tightly. Store at room temperature 4 hours before serving. Makes 2 cups.

Boil the spaghetti in lots of salted water until it is cooked al dente. When it is ready, drain the pasta and reserve the water in the pot you cooked it in. In another large pot, heat the oil over medium heat and add the pancetta. Fry the pancetta for 2-3 minutes, until it is crisp and the fat has rendered out and turned golden brown. Add the onion and garlic and stir them for a minute or two. Pour in the pasta water and stir the mixture for 2-3 minutes until it is slightly thickened and smooth. Add the spaghetti and toss until well coated and hot throughout. Make sure the water from the pasta pot is still hot and add the eggs to it one at a time, whisking and stirring rapidly as you add them to avoid scrambling the eggs. Season with black pepper and stir in the grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese. Stir until the cheese has melted and the sauce is thick and smooth. Serve in bowls or on plates and garnish with parsley and extra Parmigiano-Regg

Heat olive oil in large saute pan. Add onion and saute until softened. Add green beans and saute until crisp tender. Add tomatoes and oregano and saute until tomatoes are warmed through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Lightly spray a shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Mix together Bisquick mix and milk until soft dough formsstir in egg and peaches. Spoon batter into baking dish and bake for 20 minutes or until top is golden and a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. Serve with whipped cream and sprinkled with ground cinnamon.

Combine the evaporated milk, peanut butter, marshmallow creme, chocolate chips, vanilla extract, and butter in a sauce pan over low heat until the mixture reaches 234 degrees F on a candy thermometer. Pour into a 8x8 inch greased pan and allow to cool for about 1 hour. Cut into pieces and store in an airtight container in the refrigerator until ready to use.

In medium size bowl, combine the soup, milk and onion. Set aside. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a 3 quart baking dish layer half the potatoes, then half the kielbasa. Add half the soup mixture. Sprinkle 1/3 of the cheese over the top. Repeat layers twice. Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top. Bake uncovered in the preheated oven for 1 hour or until potatoes are tender.

Peel apples and dice. In saucepan combine apples with water. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 20 minutes. Strain through colander. Add raisins, cinnamon sticks and sugar to juice and simmer for 10 minutes. Add brandy and bring to a boil. Add brown sugar. Remove from heat. Serve warm.

In large saucepan, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add sugars. Cook and stir until mixture boils and turns a dark caramel color. Stir in vanilla. Remove from heat and stir in baking soda. Quickly stir in popcorn and nuts. Spread on wax paper to cool. Store in air-tight container.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Mix together the flour, salt, sugar, mustard powder and sunflower oil. Add the cayenne and mix. Add the cheese and mix. Add the egg and milk and mix well. Pour the batter into greased muffin tins. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Allow to cool for at least 10 minutes before removing them from the muffin pan.

Melt chocolate chips and wax in a microwave safe bowl. Mix in crispy rice cereal. Cool slightly. Shape into 1-inch balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Place on waxed paper. Refrigerate 2 hours. Melt paraffin wax in double boiler. Dip chocolate balls in wax. Return to wax paper. Let stand 5 to 10 minutes. Store in plastic bag.

Dissolve the jello in the boiling water. Mix together the jello and the cottage cheese. Chill until ready to serve. Fold in the cool whip. Arrange the fruit and nuts on the top of the salad. Serve with a cherry.

Hull and wash the strawberries and set aside to dry. Place the heavy whipping cream into a bowl and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold the chocolate and vanilla together and gently fold into the whipped cream. Gently stir in the strawberries and mix until well combined. Place into a pretty bowl and sprinkle with the powdered sugar. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Core apples and slice in half. In a small bowl, combine cinnamon and sugar. Add apples to the bowl and toss well to coat. Transfer to a greased baking dish. Bake 20 minutes or until tender. In the meantime, toast 2 pieces of bread. Cut apple halves lengthwise into 4 wedges. Top each slice of toast with an apple wedge, a slice of cheese, a dollop of butter, a sprinkle of cinnamon-sugar mixture, another slice of bread. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F.In a small bowl, mix together 1 cup thousand island dressing and 1/2 cup water. In a large bowl combine 1 (16-ounce) package crescent rolls with dressing mixturegently toss until dough is moistened throughout. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough to 10- x 15-inch rectangle.Spread with dressing mixture to within 1/2-inch of edges. Sprinkle with 1 cup Swiss cheese and 1/2 cup corned beeftop with 1 cup sauerkraut and 1/2 cup Swiss cheese and corned beef.Starting with a long side, tightly roll dough up jelly-roll style. Cut into 1/2-inch slicesplace 1-inch apart on lightly greased baking sheets. Bake 13 to 17 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 5 minutes on baking sheetsremove to wire racks to cool completely.Garnish with parsley.
Combine first 4 ingredients in a large ziplock bagadd steaks. Close bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Remove steaks from bag and discard marinade. Grill steaks 12-14 minutes per side.

Place all the ingredients in a heavy-bottomed pot. Bring to a boil over high heat. Lower the heat to medium and simmer for 30-40 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the uzvar cool. Strain the uzvar through a fine sieve. Store in the fridge for up to a week. Prep. Time includes marinating time.

Cook potatoes in hot chicken broth until fork tender. Drain and cool slightly. Cube or slice potatoes to desired size. In a small bowl combine the vinegar, oil, salt, pepper, sugar and onions. Add potatoes to mixture. Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours to blend flavors. Add 1 tablespoon butter per potato just before serving. Sprinkle with chives before serving.

Combine oil and cornstarch in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook for about 2 minutes and make sure oil is hot enough that the cornstarch is bubbling. Cut wonton wrappers into four squares. Dip into oil and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Fry for 2 minutes or until crisp. Remove with slotted spoon and let dry for about 10 minutes.

Cook potato in boiling water 15-20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Mash potato. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine apples, liquid honey, and oil. Cover and refrigerate. Cut potato mixture into small pieces. Add potato to apple mixture. Add enough water to just cover potato pieces. Add salt and pepper. Toss well. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve warm.

Pound steaks to 3/4-inch thickness. Combine flour, salt and pepper. Dip each steak into flour mixture, shaking off excess. Brown steaks on both sides in hot oil. Remove steaks from skillet. Add onion to skillet. Cook until tender. Add mushrooms. Cook until tender. Return steaks to skillet. Pour in tomatoes and wine. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until steaks are tender. Add garlic powder. Stir until well blended. Sprinkle with Italian seasoning. Makes 4 servings. Serve over hot cooked noodles.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add elbow macaroni and cook for 6 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a medium saucepan heat milk and velveeta cheese until cheese is melted. In a large bowl combine cooked macaroni with velveeta mixture. Stir in taco seasoning. Add salsa and green onion. Mix well. Spread in a 9x13x2 inch baking dish and bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Serve hot.
Saute mushrooms in butter until almost done. Add celery and onion and saute until onion is tender. Add peas and cook until tender. Add seasoning and pimientos and heat through.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice and dijon mustard. Season with salt to taste. Add lettuce leaves to the bottom of each plate. Top with tomatoes, cucumber slices and olives. Drizzle with dressing just before serving.

Combine flour and yeast in a mixing bowlstir together. Combine water and oil in a saucepanheat to between 120° and 130°. Remove pan from heat. Add oil mixture and herbs to flour mixture. Mix until a soft dough forms. Turn the dough out onto a floured surfaceknead until smooth and elastic. Divide the dough into 24 equal portions. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size. Preheat oven to 350°. Spray a baking sheet with non-stick cooking spray. Shape each portion into a ball. Place balls on the baking sheet. Flatten balls with a rolling pin into 4-inch-wide circles. Bake until golden brown and puffy. Brush with oilsprinkle with cheese and herbs. Bake until crisp.

In a large saucepan of boiling water, add vegetables. Cook for 5 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a food processor, add vegetables. Add salt and butter. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

In a small saucepan heat 1 tbsp oil over med-high heat. Saute onion 5 minutes. Add broccoli and mushrooms. Cook 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Remove from heat. In another pan bring rice and 1 1/2 cups broth just to a boil. Cover, reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Add vegetables to rice mixture. Cook 5-10 minutes. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup broth. Season with salt, pepper and thyme. Serve.

Follow the directions for the boxed cake mix to make the cupcakes. Let cool. Place 1/4 cup whipped topping in the center of each cupcake. Pipe lemon icing around the top of the cupcake. Place sprinkles in a shallow bowl. Dip the tops of the cupcakes into the sprinkles. Serve.

In a heavy skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add the celery and cook, stirring occasionally for 5 minutes. Add almonds and cook for an additional minute. Stir in the sherry wine and cook until it evaporates, about 3 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper. Serve as a side dish with meats or poultry.

Place chicken breasts in pot with water and cover. Bring to a boil and reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken is done. Remove chicken from pot and shred with 2 forks. Add soup and milk and heat through. Meanwhile, stir together egg substitute, self rising flour and buttermilk until well mixed. Drop by spoonfuls into pot of chicken and soup. Simmer for 5 minutes and serve. Serving suggestion:Serve with a green salad and sliced tomatoes and onions.

In medium bowl, stir together shortening, peppermint oil and 1/3 cup milk until smooth. Add candy coating and stir until smooth. Stir in remaining milk until smooth. Add 2 cups crushed crackersstir until well blended. Press into 9x13 inch pan coated with cooking spray. Cool completely. Melt remaining candy coating as directed on package. In small bowl, beat cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Spread over base. Refrigerate until chocolate is set. Cut into squares. Store leftovers in refrigerator.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove bacon and set aside on paper towel. Add onions and sweet bell pepper and cook until onions are translucent, about 10 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add cooked rice and black beans and season to taste with coriander, bacon, worcestershire sauce and Tabasco sauce. Stir until well combined. Transfer to serving plate and top with bacon bits and parsley. Serve immediately.

Put the egg yolk in a bowl with the mustard. Whisk together until smooth. Gradually add the sunflower oil while still whisking. When the mixture has thickened, add the lemon juice. Stir in the white pepper. Makes about a 1/4 cup. Store in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to a month.

Cut tomatoes in half and slice into quarters. Peel and slice green pepper and yellow pepper into strips. Cut zucchini into 1 inch chunks. Slice red onion into quarters and place in a colander in the sink. Sprinkle with salt and let sit for 10 minutes. Rinse and pat dry. Slice in thin rings and set aside. To make dressing combine dressing and basil in blender or food processor until smooth. Cut cheese into small pieces and place in a large serving bowl. Add tomatoes and dressing mixture and gently toss together. Add zucchini, green pepper and yellow pepper and gently toss together. Arrange rings of red onion over top of salad and serve immediately or chill for up to one day.
Mix cereal, flour and baking powder. Add butter and sugar. Stir in beaten egg. Roll into balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten each ball down. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Heat milk and half-and-half cream until very hot. Remove from heat. In a bowl beat the eggs well. Add sugar and salt. Add the hot milk mixture. Stir in the vanilla. Add the flour and baking powder and stir well. Melt the butter and stir into batter. Let stand while you heat the frying pan. Melt a small amount of butter in frying pan. Pour one 2 ounce portion of batter into the pan. Tilt the pan until the batter coats the bottom of the pan. Cook the blintz on each side until golden brown. Serve hot with apple butter or with your favorite jam.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Heat tortillas in microwave for about 15 seconds. Place 1-2 tablespoons of cheese in the center of each tortilla. Spread the cheese out evenly to the edges. Spread ham over the cheese. Crack an egg onto each tortilla. Spray a small bowl with cooking spray. Beat the egg with the spray in the bowl. Sprinkle the egg with salt and pepper. Top the egg with green onions. Place the burritos on the baking sheet. Bake until the egg is set. 10-15 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut onions into wedges. Brown roast in hot oil until all sides are brown. Place roast into slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients. Cook on low for 8 hours or until roast is tender. Remove roast from cooker. Keep broth in cooker. Shred roast. Pour broth through sieve. Add water to broth until 1 quart is reached. Stir cornstarch into 1/4 cup cold water to make a slurry. Add cornstarch slurry to broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Pour over roast. Serve roast and broth over rice.

Heat butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add leek and saute for 5 minutes. Add potatoes and cauliflower florets and saute for 5 more minutes. Add 1/4 cup milk and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add remaining milk and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and white pepper. Serve hot with a drizzle of walnut oil.

Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet and cook the chicken 6 minutes per side. While the chicken is cooking, saute the shallots in the whiskey for about 4 minutes. Add the cream and bring it all to a simmer. Add the tarragon and let it simmer 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and let it cool. Meanwhile, slice the lemon and rub the chicken with the juice and salt. Pour the whiskey cream sauce over the chicken and serve.

Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8x8-inch square baking pan with non-stick spray.Combine the flour, salt, and baking powder in a bowlset aside.In a large bowl, beat together the eggs, sugar, Nutella, brown sugar, vanilla extract, and reduced-fat peanut butter until well blended. Stir in the flour mixture until just combined. Spread the batter into the prepared pan.Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the pre-heated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownies comes out clean.Let brownies cool completely before slicing.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan. Add Splenda Brown Sugar Blend and Splenda Sugar Blend for Baking. Add eggsmix well. Stir in vanilla. Add flour and cinnamonmix well. Add oatsmix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto lightly greased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on baking sheets for 1 minute. Remove to wire racks to cool completely. Store in airtight containers. Makes 6 dozen cookies.

Clean and slice all capsicums and yellow peppers lengthwise. Heat oil in frying pan. Add onion and saute until translucent. Add all vegetables and cook until tender. Remove from pan and set aside. Blend eggs and egg yolks in blender. Add ricotta and feta cheese and seasoning. Pour mixture into pan and stir. Bake at 375f until firm. Sprinkle top with pine nuts and parmesan cheese. Serve as an appetizer or as a side dish.

Combine marinade ingredients in small saucepanbring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Pour over beef in shallow dishturn to coat all sides of beef. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Remove beef from marinadediscard marinade. Place beef on rack in shallow baking pan. Bake at 425 for 20 minutes or until desired doneness (165f for medium rare). Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing across the grain. Serve with rice or noodles.

Prepare pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in small bowl combine lemon juice, oil, garlic and basil. Set aside. Place squash and tomatoes on 2 lightly oiled grill trays. Cook 5 minutes or until tender. Remove from grill and let cool slightly. Cut squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds and discard. Cut crosswise into 1/4 inch thick strips. Cut tomatoes in half. Dice. Toss squash and tomatoes with pasta and lemon mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Beat egg whites until foamy. Add sugar 1 tbsp at a time beating well after each addition. Add vanilla. Add salt. Beat until stiff. Spoon into 9x13x2 baking dish. Bake until meringue is firm. Remove from oven. Fold in pudding mixture. Fold in bananas. Spread meringue on bottom of crust. Add cream cheese filling. Cover with other crust. Refrigerate.
Mince pork. Mix pork with all remaining ingredients. Form into 4 links. Grill over medium heat until cooked through.

Sprinkle the duck breasts with the salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat until very hot. Add the duck and cook for 5 minutes. Turn the duck and cook for 5 more minutes. The duck should be nicely browned. Add the balsamic vinegar and continue to cook until the vinegar evaporates and the duck is cooked through. Add the asparagus to the skillet and cook until crisp-tender. Season the asparagus and the duck with additional salt and pepper, if desired. Divide the asparagus and the duck among 4 plates and top with the mesclun leaves and radicchio. Serve at once.
Prepare hot coffee. Stir in chocolate syrup and extract. Top with cocoa powder and whipped cream.

In a large bowl combine popcorn, oil spray, nutritional yeast, chili powder, salt, garlic powder and onion powder. Toss well. Spread on baking sheet. Bake for 1 hour, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crisp. Cool before serving.

In a large mixing bowl, combine butter, sugars and egg. Blend well. Add vanilla and salt. Stir in flour and walnuts. Chill for 1 hour or overnight. Preheat oven to 375f. Shape dough into 1 inch balls. Place on ungreased baking sheets about 2 inches apart. Bake for 9 to 10 minutes or until cookies are light golden brown. Cool on wire racks for 2 minutes. Remove from sheets and cool completely on wire racks. Makes 2-1/2 dozen cookies.
Coat chicken with the corn flakes mixture. Cook as directed for chicken broth, baking chicken 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl, toss together apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and lemon zest. Fill an unbaked 9 inch pie plate with apple mixture. Place 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon lard in a large resealable plastic bag. Add cold water 1 tablespoon at a time until mixture forms a crumbly dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide dough into 2 portions. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a 12 inch round. Place one round over applestrim to fit. Fold edges under and seal. Brush with remaining 1 tablespoon butter. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup sugar and 1 tablespoon cinnamon. Sprinkle over crust. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cool for 20 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Season chicken with cumin, chili powder and garlic salt. Bake on a foil lined baking sheet for about 30 minutes or until done. Cut each breast into 4 pieces. Mix all the sauce ingredients together and pour over the chicken. Top with sliced avocado and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for an additional 5 minutes. Serve with rice or noodles.

Melt butter and cooking oil in a large pan. Add coconut and nuts. Stir well. Spread mixture evenly on bottom of a 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking pan. Set aside. In a mixing bowl, combine cake mix, eggs, and milk. Beat with a mixer until smooth. Spread the batter evenly on top of the coconut-nut mixture. Bake for 40 minutes or until cake is golden brown. Remove from oven. Carefully invert the pan onto a serving platter. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Cut into squares.

Melt butter in a small saute pan over medium heat. Add the onions and parsley and saute until softened. Stir in the salt, pepper and tomatoes. In a bowl combine the egg yolks and half-and-half. Beat well. Add the egg yolk mixture to the saute pan and stir gently. Cook for a couple minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the egg whites. Divide among 4 ovenproof dishes. Bake in a 325 degree oven until the egg whites are set and the omelets are puffed. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Beat eggs together. Stir together biscuit mix, oil, and eggs until crumbly. Stir in chilies, onion, garlic, and cheddar cheese until blended. Spread mixture on the bottom of an 8-inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Arrange zucchini over the top. Bake for 40 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). Line cookie sheets with waxed paperset aside. Beat eggs slightly. Add sugar, almond extract, and shorteningmix well. Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, and saltblend well. Stir in the flaked coconutmix well. Roll into 1 inch balls. Place 2 inches apart onto waxed paper lined cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool completely. Arrange 1 cherry in center of each macaroon, pressing slightly into macaroon. Makes about 5 dozen macaroons.

Preheat oven to 450f. Roll out the dough to fit the pizza pan. Spread olive oil over the pizza crust. Top with onions and pesto. Place the spinach in a colander and pour boiling water over to wilt. Drain and spread over the pizza. Top with feta cheese and sun-dried tomato. Bake for about 15 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

Trim fat from brisketsprinkle with salt and pepper. In slow cooker combine vegetables with 2 tablespoons of the oilseason to taste with thyme, salt, and pepper. Layer brisket on top of vegetablesdrizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons of oil. Covercook on HIGH 6 to 7 hours or on LOW 8 to 9 hours or until beef is fork-tender. Add cabbagecovercook on HIGH 1 hour or on LOW 2 hours or until tender.

Mix together madras curry powder, orange juice, ginger, garlic and salt in a bowl. Heat olive oil over medium-high heat until hot. Add chicken and brown. Add marinade and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered until done. Remove from heat. Stir in green onions. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 475f. Combine mustard, herbes de provence, and black pepper in small bowl. Rub loin all over with mustard mixture. Place loin in roasting pan. Roast for 30 minutes. Turn meat over. Roast an additional 30 minutes for medium-rare.

Preheat oven to 200 C/400 F.Cut the potatoes into slices, then into strips, about 1/2 inch thick.Mix together the onions, garlic, chili powder and cumin.Place the fries in a shallow baking dish. Pour the oil over the fries to cover. Sprinkle the spice mixture over the fries. Season with salt and pepper.Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.Remove the fries from the oven, sprinkle with lime juice and serve.

In a large pot saute bacon until crisp. Drain off all but 1 Tbs. of the fat. Add the onion and saute until soft. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant. Stir in the cumin and saute for 1 minute. Add the beans and stir to coat. Add the tomato, water and bouillon. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the sugar and simmer for 5 more minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve in soup bowls and garnish with chopped scallions and cilantro. Serve with white rice.

Put shrimp in a bowl and cover with flour. Beat eggs and dip shrimp in eggs and then dip in breadcrumbs. Add a little butter and oil in a pan and fry shrimp in batches until crisp and golden brown on both sides. In a saucepan, heat tomato sauce and add shrimp back into saucepan. Turn heat off and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and parmesan cheese on top. Serve with pasta.

In a food processor, add peaches, black beans, red pepper flakes, onion, garlic clove, cilantro, lime juice, apple cider vinegar and salt to taste. Pulse until blended. Taste, and add more lime juice or pepper to taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Sift together the rolled oats, plain flour, caster sugar, coconut and sesame seeds. Rub the margarine into the flour mixture until it resembles breadcrumbs. Stir in the golden syrup and bicarbonate of soda. Stir the mixture together until it comes together into a ball. Knead lightly, wrap the dough in cling film and chill for 30 minutes. Roll the dough out to 5cm thickness. Cut into rounds using a 5cm cutter. Place the biscuits onto a greased baking tray. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 C for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks.

Place sliced strawberries and sugar in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand for 15 minutes. Mix pineapple with ice cream and spread in the bottom of each of 8 parfait glasses or tall wine glasses. Drain strawberries and layer on top. Top with a dollop of cool whip.

Mix brown sugar with dry mustard. Spread on ham. Sprinkle with cloves and cinnamon stick. Pour root beer over ham. Place ham in roasting pan and bake at 350 for about 45 minutes or until ham is cooked through. Remove from oven and set aside. In a small saucepan combine orange juice, lemon juice and rind and brown sugar. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced to 1/3 cup. Stir in steak sauce and pour over ham. Return ham to oven and bake for 15 minutes more or until glaze is slightly thickened. Remove from oven and let ham stand for 10 minutes. Remove ham from pan and serve.
Peel and quarter cucumbers. Pour vinegar, salt, and sugar into a bowl. Add the cucumbers. Stir. Let stand for about an hour. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine the vinegar, egg yolks, salt, and water in a medium saucepan over medium heat, whisking constantly. Cook, whisking frequently, until mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon (about 3 minutes). Remove from heat, add sugar all at once, beating constantly until mixture thickens again (about 3 minutes). Remove from heat, add lemon extract and cool to room temperature (about 45 minutes). Sift the flour into the mixture, beating until smooth (about 1 minute). Place 1 pie shell in a 9-inch pie plate. Pour filling into the pie shell, spreading to fill the plate. Bake for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F. Continue baking for 30 to 35 minutes or until filling is set. Cool to room temperature.

Mix sugar and cornstarch together in a saucepan. Add milk, stirring to make sure there are no lumps. Add cocoa and bring to a boil over medium heat. Add margarine and vanilla and continue stirring until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Serve warm or cold. Garnish with whipped cream and cocoa powder if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a small bowl combine plum preserves and garlic. In a medium bowl combine remaining ingredients except the plum preserves mixture and the chops. Add the chops and coat well. Place the chops in a baking dish and spread the plum mixture over the chops. Bake uncovered for one hour or until the internal temperature reaches 145 degrees F. Serve immediately.

Wash and rinse peaches and cut in half. Put the peaches into the crockpot. Add the cinnamon and cloves. Mix well and add sugar. Cook on high for 2 1/2 hours. Reduce heat to low and cook for 2 1/2 hours. Remove the cinnamon and cloves. Pour into jars and seal.

To dissolve gelatin: In a small bowl, soak gelatin in hot water 2 minutes or until gelatin is softened. In a medium bowl, whisk together strawberry gelatin and hot water until gelatin is completely dissolved. In a blender or food processor, combine gelatin mixture with lemon juice and pineapple juice until smooth. Chill for 1 hour or until mixture is slightly thickened. In a large bowl, mix together gelatin mixture and bananas until well blended. Chill for 1 hour or until mixture begins to thicken around edges of bowl. Prepare a 10-inch springform pan with cooking spray. Line the bottom of pan with plastic wrap. Spoon gelatin mixture into prepared pan. Chill for 8 hours or overnight. To prepare topping: In a blender, combine equal parts of equal and water until smooth. Chill for 1 hour or until thickened. Pour topping over chilled gelatin mixture and chill for 1 hour or until set. Remove sides of pan and carefully remove plastic wrap. Slice and serve immediately or store refrigerated for up to

In a saucepan, combine rhubarb, 1/2 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water. Cover and simmer over medium heat for 15 minutes. Mix cornstarch with 2 tablespoons water until smooth. Stir into rhubarb mixture and cook 1 minute longer. Cool to room temperature. Spoon into individual serving bowls. Top with mixed berries. Chill. Serve with whipped cream and more berries.

Combine apple juice, lemon juice, soy sauce, and honey. Place pork in a shallow baking dish. Pour half the marinade over pork. Cover baking dish with plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or up to 8 hours. Remove pork from marinade and pat dry. Place pork in a single layer on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400 degrees for 12 minutes. Turn pork and bake 8 to 12 minutes or until pork is no longer pink in center. Combine remaining marinade in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 2 minutes or until sauce thickens. Pour sauce over pork. Serve immediately.

Trim broccoli and cauliflower into florets. Steam until tender. In a bowl combine broccoli and cauliflower with orange juice, shallots, orange peel, scallions, pepper and salt. Toss gently with olive oil. Cover with foil. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.

In a pitcher, combine wine, sprite, rum and brandy. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to let flavors blend. Add ice cubes. Serve in tall glasses over fruit slices. Garnish with a slice of lemon and lime. Makes 6-8 servings.

Brown ground beef in a Dutch oven with onions over medium heat for about 8 minutes or until meat is no longer pinkadd whole tomatoes with their juice, water, worcestershire sauce, creole seasoning, and pepper. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes. Add okrasimmer uncovered for 5 minutes or until okra is tender. Serve over rice.

Slice the zucchini in half lengthwise. Cut out the seeds from the center. Dry the zucchini with paper towels. In a small bowl mix together the garlic and the flour. Beat the eggs and the soy sauce together in another bowl. Dip the zucchini in the flour mixture. Next dip in the eggs and then roll in the bread crumbs. Heat the olive oil in a skillet or frying pan. Fry the zucchini for about 3 minutes per side, until they are browned and cooked through. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine cottage cheese and spinach. Add soy sausage. Pour into a 1-1/2-quart baking dish. In a separate bowl, combine the eggs and milk. Beat until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the cheese and vegetable mixture. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and green onions. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes.

Cook noodles as directed on package. Drain. Melt butter in a 2 quart casserole. Add noodles. In a separate bowl, beat eggs with sugar, salt, and black pepper. Pour over noodles. Bake at 350 for 35 to 45 minutes. Serves 8.

Combine water, sugar, bananas and ice cubes in blender. Blend until smooth. Strain through a fine sieve into large punch bowl. Add frozen orange juice, lemonade and pineapple juice. Blend well. Add ginger ale. Garnish with bananas and mint leaves.

Cook pasta according to package directions. In a large skillet, brown flank steak and add brown gravy mix, stirring. Add carrots and snow peascontinue stirring and add soy sauce and hot sauce. Add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Simmer about 10 minutes. Drain pasta and place in a bowl. Top with meat mixture and enjoy.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with foil. In large skillet, cook onion in bacon fat until tender, about 3 minutes. Add ground beef, breadcrumbs, onion, oregano, pepper and salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until beef is cooked through, about 15 minutes. Transfer beef mixture to a large bowladd egg yolks and tomatoes with juice. Stir until just combined. Shape mixture into 1 1/2-inch meatballs. Place meatballs on prepared baking sheets. Bake until cooked through and browned on all sides, about 25 minutes. Meanwhile make sour cream sauce in a saucepan. Cook onion and garlic in the butter until onion is translucent. Stir in tomato paste and cook until it has darkened slightly. Stir in beef stock. Bring just to a boil then pour the cream slowly while whisking the sauce. Cook until thickened about 5-7 minutes. Serve meatballs with the sauce poured around the

Combine dry ingredients. Add vanilla. Add milk & egg. Then add oil & chocolate chips. Bake at 350 for about 45 minutes or until knife comes out clean. Cool for 20 minutes then ice with chocolate frosting. Serve to family & friends. Serves 8.

Cook noodles in boiling water. Drain and cool. Lay turkey bacon strips flat on a microwave safe plate. Cook in the microwave 4 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Chop. Cook onion and turkey bacon together in a non-stick skillet over medium heat until onion is tender. Stir in noodles and sour cream. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve.

Heat olive oil in a large heavy based saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft but not coloured. Add carrots and saute for a further 2 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute or until golden. Stir in beef and brown well. Add all remaining ingredients except the honey and cook uncovered for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Add honey and cook for a further 5 minutes or until liquid is thick and syrupy. Serve with rice.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the rosemary and saute for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and cook over a medium heat for 5 minutes or until just cooked through. Stir in the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the honey and balsamic and cook for 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Pour cream into medium saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove from heat. Add maple syrup. Stir in egg yolks and vanilla. Pour into 8 ramekins. Bake until set about 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool. Refrigerate. Serve.

In a heavy 2 quart saucepan, combine 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup butter. Stir over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Raise heat to medium high and boil 1 minute. Remove from heat and add 1 1/2 cups heavy cream. Return to heat and stir over medium heat until mixture thickens enough to lightly coat back of a spoon. Add 1/2 teaspoon hazelnut extract and stir until blended. Cool.

Sprinkle mozzarella cheese evenly over muffin. Spread tomato sauce over muffin and top with tomatoes and basil. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut into 4 equal servings. Makes 4 servings. Serving size 1 muffin

Cook pasta according to package directions. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add carrot and broccolicook and stir until crisp-tender about 3 minutes. Add chicken broth and cook until almost evaporated about 2 minutes. Add ranch dressing and cook until heated through about 30 seconds. Add pasta to skillettoss to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash potatoes and prick with a fork. Place in a shallow baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with the oregano. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Roast until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter and sugar together. Beat in egg. Add vanilla extract. Sift flour, baking soda and salt. Add to butter mixture. Stir in popcorn. Roll into small balls. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool. Combine melted chocolate and butterscotch topping. Dip cooled balls into topping. Let stand until set. Roll in pecans.

In a 9 x 13-inch baking dish, combine stuffing mix with condensed cream of chicken soup. Place chicken breasts in the stuffing mixture and turn to coat. Top with frozen mixed vegetables. In a small bowl, combine sour cream and milk. Pour over the chicken mixture. Bake for 45 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter, flour and seasonings. Cook until browned. Add milk and cheese. Heat to boiling. Add potatoes. Simmer, uncovered, until potatoes are tender. Add onion and pimientos. Cook until heated through. Serves 4.

Mix the flour and sugar in a bowl. Add the ghee and cardamom powder. Add the milk little by little and knead to a dough. Heat ghee in a pan. Add the sliced almonds and cashews. Fry till golden. Cool and set aside. Knead the dough well. Divide into 8 portions. Roll out each portion into a circle and spread a little ghee. Sprinkle the fried nuts and roll into a roth. Make a hole in the center. Heat ghee in a pan. Place the roth in it. Fry till it turns golden. Remove from ghee and drain on kitchen towels. Serve hot.

Boil potatoes whole in water until tender. Peel off skins and slice into small cubes. Fry bacon in skillet until crisp. Drain on paper towel. Drain onions in colander. Add water to bacon drippings. Bring to boil. Add sugar and vinegar. Heat until sugar dissolves. Add potatoes. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in bacon, onions, salt, pepper. Cool. Add parsley. Serve chilled. Serves 6.

In medium saucepan combine all ingredients except water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 2 minutes. Add water, bring to boil, then lower heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in water and return to low heat. Cook until thickened. Cool. Store in refrigerator in tightly closed jar. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

In medium sauce pan, cover peaches with water. Add 1/2 teaspoon of the salt substitute. Bring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 5 minutes or until peaches are tender. Drain peaches. Set aside. In medium bowl, mix together the chicken, wine, onion, red bell pepper, 1/4 teaspoon of the salt substitute, the garlic, and the oregano. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken mixture. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Add the broth. Bring to boil. Add orzo. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 10 minutes or until orzo is tender. Stir in peaches. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until heated through.

Combine water, powdered milk, sugar, egg yolks & salt in heavy 2 quart saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly until thickened & mixture coats back of spoon (about 12 minutes). Strain into pitcherstir in whiskey & let cool to room temperature. Beat egg whites with mixer until soft peaks form. Fold egg whites into eggnog mixture.
