Mix cream cheese, milk and lemon juice until smooth. Add vanilla extract to taste. Spread about 1 tablespoon of the mixture on each slice of bread. Top each slice with a tablespoon of cherry pie filling. Sprinkle each slice with slivered almonds. Wrap each sandwich in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight before serving.

Heat frying oil. Add potatoes and fry until softened and golden. Add onions and bell pepper and fry until softened. Add tomatoes and cook until softened. Add eggs and mix well. Add salt to taste and nutmeg. Serve warm.

Combine 1 cup water and fruit pectin in a small saucepan and stir over medium heat until thick. Add sugar. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add blueberries and cook over medium heat until blueberries are tender and mixture is thick and bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Ladle into hot sterilized jars. Process for 5 minutes in a boiling water bath canner. Makes 5 half-pint jars.

Put tea bags in a heat proof container. Cover with pineapple juice. Cover and let stand for 30 minutes. Add lemon juice, cinnamon sticks, cloves and allspice. Heat on medium for 10 minutes. Remove tea bags. Add brown sugar and stir. Add ice cubes if desired. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl beat together eggs, flour, yogurt and oil until smooth. Add sugar and mix well. In a separate bowl whisk together baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add to egg mixture and mix well. Heat a griddle over medium heat until hot. Brush with vegetable oil. Pour batter onto griddle by 1/4 cupfuls. Cook pancakes until tops are covered with bubbles, about 2 minutes. Flip pancakes and cook until the undersides are golden, about 1 minute more. Serve pancakes hot with blueberries.

Pound meat to 1/4 inch thickness. Heat skillet over medium heat until hot. Add 1 tablespoon vegetable oil. Add meat in single layer. Brown meat, turning once, about 5 minutes. Remove to plate. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil to skillet. Add garlic and ginger. Cook 30 seconds. Add soy sauce, worcestershire sauce, and liquid smoke. Cook, stirring, until thickened. Add meat to sauce. Cover skillet. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve over rice. Makes 6 servings.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Put potatoes in large pot and cover with water by 1 inchadd butter. Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and boil gently until potatoes are very tender and can be pierced easily with fork (about 1 hour). Drain potatoesadd 1/2 cup water and return to pot. Add brown sugar and orange and lemon juice and stir welllet stand while making glaze. To make glaze, stir sugar, water, and cinnamon in small saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolvesbring to boil and boil 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanillaset aside until potatoes are done. Transfer potatoes to bowl and pour glaze over potatoes and toss to coat well. Return potatoes to pot and cook over medium heat until glaze is thickened and coats potatoes (about 5 minutes). Season with mace and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine all the ingredients except for the chocolate chips. Mix well until fully combined. Grease a small baking pan with butter or coconut oil and pour the batter into the baking pan. Bake for 30-40 minutes until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the banana bread to cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine cornstarch, brown sugar, soy sauce, ground ginger, garlic powder, onion powder. Add chicken to bowltoss to coat. Heat 2 teaspoons olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken to skillet. Cook chicken for 2 minutes each side. Add bourbon to skillet. Bring to a boil. Cook for 1 minute or until liquid is almost evaporated. Bake uncovered in preheated oven for 20 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve with rice.

Place apricots in small bowl. Add lemon juice, stirring until apricots are coated. Add other fruits. Stir until evenly distributed. Microwave on High 2-3 minutes or until fruits are plump, stirring frequently. Remove from microwave. Stir in honey. Spoon fruit mixture into bowl. Serve warm or chilled.

Combine mango, red pepper, scallion and fresh cilantro in a bowl. Whisk together red wine vinegar and grapeseed oil in a small bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Toss mango mixture with quinoa and black beans.

Combine the half-and-half, chipotle chile, orange rind and cumin in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally until slightly thickened. Add the shrimp and cook until opaque, stirring occasionally. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease two 9x5" loaf pans. Combine the first four dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, beat together the oil, pumpkin, water, eggs, vanilla, and cinnamon until smooth. Add the dry mixture to the wet and mix well. Spoon into pans. Bake for one hour. Cool in the pans for 5 minutes then remove to cool completely. Makes two loaves.

Cut chicken into strips. In small saucepan, combine chicken bouillon, hot water, soy sauce and sesame oil. Bring to a boilremove from heat. Combine cornstarch with wine and stir until smoothgradually add to saucepanboil until thick. Add chickencook 3 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Drain pastaplace in bowl. Add chicken mixturetoss to coat with sauce. Top with sesame seeds.

Cook pasta in a pot of boiling salted water until al dente, about 12 minutes. Drain the pasta in a colander. Toss the pasta with the beans and corn and transfer to a serving dish. Stir in the basil just before serving. Drizzle with the oil, vinegar and peppers. Serve immediately.
Rub chicken all over with the marmalade mixture and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Bake at 350F for 1-1/2 hours. Serve with rice and green salad.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, toss potatoes, squash and zucchini with oil and seasonings. Spread in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Bake until tender. Serve immediately.

Spread light mayonnaise on the inside of the bread slices. Sprinkle the inside of the bread with the turkey, avocado, radish sprouts, rosemary, basil leaf and garlic powder. Grill the sandwiches for 2-3 minutes per side until the bread is browned and the cheese is melted. Slice the sandwiches in half and serve.

Blend cream cheese, mayonnaise and sour cream in large bowl. Add cocktail sauce. Mix well. Add shrimp, mozzarella cheese, green onions, green pepper and tomatoes. Spoon into 8x8x2 inch baking dish or into individual baking dishes. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve with crackers or bread.

Cut the taro root into 1" cubes and boil them for about 20 minutes in salted water. Drain and rinse them. In a skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add onions and saute until softened and beginning to brown. Add the garbanzo beans and taro root. Stir in the lemon juice and tahini. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine the heavy cream, granulated sugar, and semisweet chocolate morsels. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is smooth, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. In a medium bowl, whisk the egg yolks. Gradually add the hot chocolate mixture to the egg yolks, whisking constantly to keep eggs from scrambling. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 glass baking dish. Cover with foil, and bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until set. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with a sprinkle of semisweet chocolate morsels. Serve at room temperature or refrigerate until ready to serve.
In a medium bowl, combine all of the above and mix well. Cover and refrigerate. Serve as a sandwich spread or appetizer with crackers. Serves 12.

Heat oil over medium heat in large saucepan or dutch oven. Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is soft and translucent, about 10 minutes. Add spinach, tomato paste, curry powder and salt. Cook until spinach is wilted and liquid is evaporated, about 10 minutes. Add tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in brown sugar and cook until potatoes are tender. Serve with cilantro leaves and lime wedges for squeezing.

To make this recipe less spicy, leave out the jalapeno or reduce the amount of hot sauce. To make this recipe more spicy, add more jalapeno or increase the amount of hot sauce. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Store in the refrigerator. Makes enough for 2 servings. Serve with tortilla chips.

Place chicken parts into a bowl and add salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat and add the chicken and cook for a few minutes each side or until browned. Add the onions and garlic and fry until golden. Add the rosemary and cook for a further minute. Place the chicken onto a baking tray and pour over the pan juices. Bake in a preheated oven for 1 hour at 180c. Baste every half hour or so.
In a large bowl combine the soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, and the green onions. Add the oysterstoss to coat. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Mix vanilla ice cream and strawberry ice cream topping in a blender until well mixed. Pour into a freezer safe container. Place in freezer for 1 hour. Combine chocolate ice cream and nuts in blender. Mix well. Pour over vanilla mixture in freezer safe container. Place back in freezer for 1 hour. When ready to serve top with fresh mint leaves.

In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and lime juice. In a large bowl toss the avocado, mango, pepper, and basil. Season with salt and pepper. Place a few tablespoons of the avocado mixture onto each of the toasted ciabatta rolls. Top with the black olives and sprinkle with the feta cheese.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until softened and translucent, about 5-6 minutes. Add the potato and the broth and cook for an additional 5 minutes or until the potato is tender. Add the water and the corn. Cook for about 5 minutes more. Add the heavy cream and bring to a low boil. Add the cucumber and the parsley and stir well. Season with the salt and pepper and serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.

Peel and cut the potatoes into cubes. Boil in a pressure pan. Once the potatoes are done, drain the water and put the potatoes in a pan. Add all the other ingredients. Toss the potatoes well and let them cook. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 150 degrees Celsius (325 degrees Fahrenheit). Grease a 25 cm (10 inch) round cake tin. In a bowl place the caster sugar and the chopped dark chocolate and place over a pan of simmering water. Stir until melted and smooth. Beat the butter with the almonds until creamy and light. Beat the eggs lightly and add to the butter and almonds. Add the melted chocolate and sugar, and beat until thoroughly combined. Pour into the greased tin and bake for about 1 hour. Cool for 5 minutes and turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Sprinkle the top of the cake with icing sugar and serve.

In a large bowl combine all the marinade ingredients (except the chicken) and mix well. Now add the chicken pieces and mix well. Marinate the chicken for a minimum of two hours or overnight. In a pressure cooker add a tbsp of cooking oil. When oil is hot add the chicken pieces and cook for about half a minute. Add the marinade and cook for about one minute. Add the coriander leaves and green chilies. Cover and cook under pressure for 6-8 minutes. Remove from heat and allow the pressure to release naturally. When the pressure is released open the pressure cooker and discard the coriander leaves and green chilies. Add the remaining marinade and cook for another one minute. Serve hot with rotis or naan.

Place chuck roast into a crock pot. Add 1 quart of water. Add 2 bouillon cubes. Add onion. Turn crock pot to high. Cook for 3 hours. Stir in ketchup, mustard and worcestershire sauce. Continue to cook on high for 1 hour. Serve on buns. Serves 8.

Bake potatoes at 375 for one hour. Cool and peel. Combine in a bowl with milk, melted butter and sugar and mix well. Add pineapple and mandarin oranges and mix. Pour into a buttered 9 x 13 pan and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool slightly and serve with whipped topping.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook fettuccine until al dente and then drain and set aside. In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of butter and 2 tablespoons of olive oil together over medium heat. Add 2 cloves of minced garlic and cook for a couple minutes or until fragrant. Add 1/4 cup heavy cream and bring to a boil. Cook for 1 minute and then add 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste. Reduce heat to low and slowly add in 1/2 cup parmesan cheese and 1/4 cup romano cheese. Continue to cook for a couple minutes or until cheese is melted and then add cooked pasta and 2 tablespoons parmesan cheese. Toss well and serve immediately.

Combine chocolate chips and butterscotch chips in a large microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high for 1 minute and stir until chips are melted. Stir in 3 cups of the cereal. Press mixture onto waxed paper to form a 10x15-inch rectangle. Cool completely. Melt remaining chocolate chips in a small bowl in the microwave for about 1 minute. Spread chocolate over cooled cereal layer. Top with remaining cereal. Cut into squares.

Grease two 9 x 13 inch pans. Mix cocoa, water, baking soda. Add sugar gradually to cocoa mixture. Cream butter. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add vanilla. Gradually add flour to cocoa mixture alternating with the sour milk. Divide batter between two pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350. Place one tablespoon of the cheese mixture in each muffin cup. Bake 10 minutes or until the mixture is firm. Serve with crackers.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides. In a bowl stir together the honey, lavender and pepper and salt. Pour over chicken and stir until the chicken is completely coated. Cover and cook for about 20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through. Uncover and cook an additional five minutes or until glaze is thickened.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts. Cook 5 minutes each side or until done. Remove from skillet. Cover to keep warm. Heat remaining oil in skillet. Add remaining 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts. Cook 5 minutes each side or until done. Remove from skillet. Add broccoli floret to skillet. Cook 2 minutes or until tender crisp. Remove from skillet. Add vegetables to skillet. Cook 2 minutes or until crisp tender. Combine chicken, vegetables and dressing. Serve over mixed greens.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly coat a 12 inch pizza pan with cooking spray. Spray both sides of tortilla with cooking spray. Layer with cheese, egg whites, potatoes, bacon bits, onion, pepper, salt, and worcestershire sauce. Roll up. Place seam side down on the pizza pan. Bake for 15 minutes until browned. Serve with salsa.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut the pork tenderloin in half horizontally to make two thin pork fillets. Sprinkle both sides of each fillet with garlic powder, salt and black pepper. Rub the pork tenderloin with the ground cumin on both sides. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add 3 tablespoons olive oil to the skillet. Cook pork tenderloin for 3 minutes per side until browned and crisp. Transfer to a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes in the oven until cooked through. In a bowl combine 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, the dry white wine, the chicken broth, and minced garlic. Brush the mixture on both sides of each pork fillet and bake for 15 minutes or until cooked through. Cut each pork fillet into slices about 1 inch thick. Serve immediately with your favorite side dish.
Brown sausage, drain. Add bread crumbs, egg, sage, apple sauce, cinnamon candies. Mix well. Form into balls. Bake at 350 degrees until browned.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 9-inch loaf pan. In a medium bowl, mix together 3 cups of flour with the beer. Let rest for 5 minutes. In a large bowl, mix together the remaining 2 cups of flour with the brown sugar and baking powder. Add the salt. Add the beer mixture and stir until just combined. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 40 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.

Preheat the oven to 400F/200C. Peel the potatoes and cut them into large chunks. Pour 1 tablespoon of olive oil in to the base of the ovenproof dish. Place the potatoes in the dish, sprinkle with rosemary and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Add the butter to the potatoes, then pour over 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Toss together to coat the potatoes thoroughly. Place in the oven for 40 minutes, turning the potatoes once half way through cooking time. Meanwhile, peel the onions, leaving the root end on so that they look like lollipops. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add the onions, season with salt and pepper, then cook for 15 minutes until the onions are caramelized. Pour in the balsamic vinegar, then cook for a further minute before adding the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and tossing together. Serve the potatoes on top of the onions, sprink

Combine cocoa and vanilla. Beat in milk. Gradually beat in salt and hot water. Add 6-8 drops green food coloring. In another bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients. Stir into the cocoa mixture. Spoon into 4 serving cups and serve immediately.

Cut apples into quarters, remove cores and thinly slice each piece lengthwise into 1-inch slices. In small bowl, combine lemon juice, celery and Swiss cheesetoss until coated. In another small bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard and salt and pepperstir well. Add to the apple mixturetoss to coat. Spread filberts evenly onto bottom of large platter. Arrange apples over filbertsspoon mayonnaise mixture over apples. Top with lettuce leaf. Makes 4 servings.

Place chicken pieces in shallow dish. Combine marmalade, barbecue sauce, worcestershire sauce, vinegar, lemon juice, cayenne and garlic powder. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Place chicken pieces into crock pot. Cover and cook on low 6-7 hours. Stir occasionally. Serve chicken over rice.

Cut the lemons and limes in half and squeeze the juice into a large pitcher or jar. Cut the strawberries into small pieces and add to the juices. Pour in the cold water and add the sugar, stirring until dissolved. Refrigerate for a few hours and serve over ice cubes.

Heat olive oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add garlic and saut for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add broth and tomatoes. Simmer for 5 minutes or until broth is heated through. Add tortellini and basil and simmer until tortellini is heated through, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with shaved parmesan cheese before serving if desired.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Wash potatoes and sweet potatoes well. Pierce potatoes with fork. Bake in the preheated oven until the potatoes are soft when pierced with a fork, about 45 minutes. In a small bowl, combine margarine and onion. Remove potatoes from the oven and cool until they are easy to handle. Peel the potatoes. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise. Remove the sweet potato from the skin. Scoop out the potato flesh into a bowl. Mash the potatoes with the onion mixture. Stir in the milk. Season with salt, if desired. Spoon the potato mixture into the potatoes. Bake in the preheated oven until the potatoes are heated through, about 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the egg yolks and sugar in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Beat constantly until the mixture thickens and is golden. Remove from the heat. Beat the mascarpone cheese until fluffy. Add the egg yolks a little at a time. Place about one third of the cheese mixture in the bottom of the baking dish. Top with the ladyfingers. Add another third of the cheese mixture. Repeat. Top with the remaining cheese mixture. Bake for about 30 minutes or until set. Cool. Beat the whipping cream until stiff. Fold in the orange liqueur. Spread over the top of the dessert. Grate the chocolate over the top. Chill before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the purple potatoes in a large bowl and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with the Mexican oregano, garlic, salt and black pepper. Toss well to evenly coat all sides of the potatoes. Spread the potatoes on a cookie sheet or baking sheet. Roast the potatoes for 15-20 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle with fresh chopped cilantro. Serve warm. Makes about 6 servings. Serve hot with your favorite Mexican meal.

First you will need to make your pudding. Beat cake and milk together. In another bowl combine pudding and milk. Fold in cool whip. Spread mixture evenly between the cake. Chill for two hours. Spread coconut over the top. Chill for another hour. Cut into squares.

Cream together crisco and peanut butter. Add sugar and brown sugar. Beat well. Beat egg and add to creamed mixture. Add flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Roll into balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 for 12-15 minutes or until cookies are done. Cool on wire racks.

Combine the rice and milk in a heavy saucepan over low heat. Stir occasionally until the mixture comes to a boil. Cook over moderate heat until thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the cream and honey. Add the cornstarch and enough cold milk to make a thin paste. Stir into the hot mixture and boil for 30 seconds. Remove from heat and stir in the cinnamon. Serve hot.

In a bowl, cream together shortening and sugar. Beat in molasses. Beat in egg. Sift together flour, soda, spices. Stir into molasses mixture. Roll out on floured surface to 1/2-inch thickness. Cut out with gingerbread men cutters. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 6 to 8 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 5 dozen.
Slice bacon into 1/4 inch slices and fry in skillet. Drain. Add frozen spinach and onion. Add egg and cook for about 2 minutes. Add bacon. Add sugar and vinegar. Mix together well. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 2 quart casserole dish with butter or nonstick cooking spray. In a 2-quart saucepan, combine the cream of mushroom soup, milk, and onion soup mixheat over low heat until hot and bubbly. In a large saucepan of boiling water, cook the egg noodles according to package directionsdrain. In a large bowl combine the cooked noodles, frozen vegetables, can of tuna (drained), and mushroom-cheese mixture. Stir until well mixed. Transfer the mixture to the prepared casserole dish and sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the edges of the casserole are browned.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Spray 9x13 inch baking pan with nonstick cooking sprayset aside. Cook hash browns as directed on package. Crumble sausage into medium bowladd cooked hash browns. Stir in cheese until meltedset aside. Beat eggs in large bowl until blended. Stir in milk and mustard. Pour into baking pan over hash brown mixture. Bake uncovered 40 to 50 minutes or until set. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting into 48 squares.
Combine cheese with powdered sugar and lemon juice. Fold in cool whip. Spread over pie crust and top with a sprinkling of grated lemon rind. Chill several hours before serving.
Rub chicken pieces with lime juice and oil. Sprinkle with garlic salt and grind with pepper. Grill or bake over medium heat. Serve with a lime wedge. Great for sandwiches.

Place potatoes in a medium saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and boil for 10 minutes. Drain. Return potatoes to pan. Add butter and milk. Mash with a potato masher or blend in blender until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add watercress and blend until smooth. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot over medium high heat. Add in pasta and cook for about 8 minutes or until al dente. Meanwhile in a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add in the garlic and saute for 2 minutes or until soft. Add in the tomatoes and cook for an additional 3 minutes. Add in the cannellini beans and saute for 2-3 minutes more. Stir in the pasta and add in the pecorino romano cheese. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 325 F. In a large bowl, combine the flour, spices and salt. Cut in the butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. In a small bowl, beat the egg and stir in the molasses. Add to the dry ingredients all at once. Mix just until the dough comes together. Divide dough in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll each half of the dough to 1/8 inch thickness. Cut out the shapes with cookie cutters. Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheet to wire rack to cool. Decorate the cookies as desired.
Mix the swiss cheese and butter together in a bowl. Add the tart cherry, mayonnaise, dijon mustard and green onion. Mix thoroughly. Serve on crackers, toast, bagels, pita breads.

Mix all the sauce ingredients in a bowl and set aside.Thread the chicken onto the skewers and place in a dish. Pour half of the sauce over the chicken. Cover and marinade for a minimum of 30 minutes. Remove the chicken from the marinade and reserve the marinade.Cook under the broiler or grill until chicken is done. Baste the chicken frequently during cooking. Serve with reserved marinade.

Cut chicken into bite sized pieces. Combine garlic with salt and pepper. Dip chicken into seasoning mixture. Heat butter and oil in saucepan over med heat. Add flour and stir. When flour is lightly browned add chicken broth and milk. Heat to boiling. Add chicken and mixed veggies. Reduce heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until chicken is tender. Remove chicken and stir in hot sauce. Add cheese. Return chicken to mixture. Serve hot.

Heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until the butter foams. Season the veal with salt and pepper then add to the skillet. Cook the veal until it is browned all over then place it on a plate. Lower the heat to medium and add the brie to the pan along with the pasta. Cook for about 2 minutes. Add the beef stock, cover and cook for another minute or two. Transfer the pasta to the plate with the veal then add the flour to the pan, stirring to combine it with the pan drippings. Add the milk and whisk to combine then bring it up to a simmer over medium-high heat and cook until thickened. Remove from the heat then whisk in the butter, 1 tablespoon at a time until the sauce is smooth and creamy. Stir in the parmesan cheese then arrange the pasta and veal in the bottom of an 8-inch square baking dish then top it with the sauce and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the breadcrumbs
Shred the cabbage and carrot and place in a large bowl. Mix in the mayonnaise and vinegar. Stir in the walnuts and sprinkle with jerk spice to taste. Chill until ready to serve.
Mix lemon pepper salt garlic powder and soy sauce with brown sugar and water. Mix well. Rub on both sides of the fish. Grill fish 3 to 4 minutes per side or until cooked through.
Place potatoes and onions in saucepan and cover with water. Cook until potatoes are tender. Mash with potato masher. Add butter and cream. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 400f. Combine the light brown sugar, butter and sugar in a medium bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Add the eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition. Add the salt and heavy cream and beat well. Mix in the strong coffee until the batter is well combined. Pour the batter into unbaked pastry shells. Bake for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped walnuts. Reduce the heat to 325f and bake until a wooden toothpick inserted into the center of a pie comes out clean, about 35 to 40 minutes. Let cool on a rack. Serve at room temperature.

Mix sugar, shortening, eggs & milk. Add banana, then sift together flour, baking powder & soda, & salt. Add to sugar mixture. Stir just enough to moisten. Pour into greased 9x5 loaf pan. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake at 350 degrees for 45-60 minutes. Toothpick should come out clean.

In a shallow bowl, beat eggs with a fork. In another bowl combine flour, cayenne pepper, paprika and salt. Heat oil in deep frying pan until it is 350 degrees f. Dip each chicken piece first in the egg wash then in the flour mixture. Place in the hot oil and fry for about 4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

Place a shallow pan of water in a 450 degree oven. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms. Cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add green onions. Cook 2 more minutes. Drain off excess fat. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Add to mushrooms. Brush salmon fillets with olive oil. Place fillets skin side down on broiler pan. Place pan in oven. Broil 5 to 6 inches from heat for 7 to 8 minutes. Remove salmon from pan. Spread with mushroom mixture. Return salmon to broiler pan. Broil 5 minutes longer, turning once. Serve with pasta.

Preheat the oven to 350. Place the cod fillets in a shallow baking dish. Season with thyme and basil. In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the oil. Add the onion, season with salt and pepper, cover the skillet tightly with a lid, and cook for 10 minutes or until softened. Add the plum tomatoes and their juice. Simmer over low heat until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon. Spoon the onion mixture over the cod fillets. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with olives. Serve with steamed rice.

Rub the potatoes with olive oil and then sprinkle with salt and pepper and place in a baking dish. Heat the oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat and brown the chicken in the oil about 2-3 minutes per side until nicely browned (about 6-8 minutes total). Transfer the chicken to a plate and keep warm in a 200 degree fahrenheit oven. In a small bowl combine the flour, garlic powder, parsley, basil, salt and pepper and stir well. Add the butter and stir until the butter is evenly distributed throughout the mixture and it has a crumbly texture. Transfer the mixture back into the skillet and cook over medium-high heat, stirring frequently until it is a rich brown and has a nutty aroma (about 2-3 minutes). Immediately remove from the heat and add the brown sugar, stirring well and mixing in the brown sugar until it is evenly distributed throughout the mixture. Return the chicken to the skillet and add the juices from the plate

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spread the artichoke hearts in a single layer in a 10-inch oval baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the garlic and 2 teaspoons of the olive oil. Drizzle over artichoke hearts. Roast for 15 minutes. In a small bowl, combine the remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, the lemon juice, and the salt and pepper. Set aside. Drizzle the warm artichoke hearts with the lemon-olive-oil mixture and sprinkle with the butter. Serve hot.

Spread one side of the bread with 1 teaspoon of the mustard-mayonnaise blend. Spread the other side with 1 teaspoon of the butter. Layer the sandwich with the ham, 1/4 of the tomatoes, 2 slices of the gouda cheese, and the chives. Top with the remaining bread. Grill the sandwich in a panini maker until the cheese has melted. Makes 1 sandwich.

Mix together the turkey, scallions and carrot. Add the egg and breadcrumbs and form into 1 inch meatballs. Heat the oil in a large frying pan and saute the meatballs for 4 minutes. Add the teriyaki sauce and cook for another 4 minutes. Sprinkle the sesame seeds over top. Serve immediately.

Peel jicama and slice. Peel carrot and julienne. Peel apple and grate. In a large bowl combine jicama, carrots, and apple. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, water, sugar, salt, and cayenne pepper. Add dressing to vegetables. Stir. Serve on lettuce or other greens. Serves 4.
Place all of the marinade ingredients in a food processor or blender. Pulse until the mixture is smooth. Use the marinade to marinate meat for 1 hour before cooking.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine soup and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer for 10 minutes or until thickened. Stir in milk. In a small bowl, combine milk, peanut butter, 1/4 cup water, and 1/4 tsp vanilla. Stir into soup mixture. Heat through. Garnish with whipped cream.

Spread mayonnaise on the inside of each roll half. Top one half with pork, ham, swiss cheese, pickles and mustard. Cover with other half of roll. Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sandwich and fry until golden brown on one side, about 2 minutes. Turn sandwich over and fry until golden brown on other side, about 2 minutes longer.
Combine all ingredients in medium saucepan and stir until well blended. Heat over low heat for about 3 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
Pour strawberry pie filling over a layer of vanilla ice cream. Top with a layer of bananas. Sprinkle pecans over all. Serve with lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Spread egg onto baking sheet. Place orange roughy fillets in egg mixture and turn to coat. In another bowl, combine bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle fish with lemon pepper and garlic powder. Dip fish in egg, then roll in breadcrumb mixture. Place on baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes in preheated oven. Turn fillets over and bake another 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter 2 small baking dishes or one 9x12-inch baking dish. In a small skillet over medium heat, saute onion in butter for 3 minutes. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Pour in milk and stir well. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Stir in 1/2 cup cheese. Spread 1/4 of the mixture in each baking dish. Cut fish into 1-inch pieces and arrange over mixture. Top with remaining milk-cheese mixture. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Bake for 15 minutes or until fish is cooked.

Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add broccoli and carrotssaute until crisp tender. Stir in garlicsaute 30 seconds longer. Combine honey, broth, and water in a medium bowl. Whisk in oil. Pour mixture over vegetables. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook until liquid is reduced by half. Season to taste. Serve over rice.
Boil potatoes until tender (about 10 minutes). Drain well and return to pan. Add cream cheese, milk, dill weed and butter. Mash well. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with roast beef or ham.

In skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tbs butter and saute 1 tbs flour until light brown. Stir in curry powder and salt and cook for about 30 seconds more. Whisk in 1 cup chicken stock and cook 2 minutes. Whisk in 2 tbs heavy cream and egg yolk and cook until heated through and curry sauce has thickened slightly. Serve over chicken or vegetables and garnish with lemon wedges.

Place turkey giblets in a 4-quart microwave-safe casserole or saucepan with water to cover. Microwave on high for 15 minutes or until giblets are just cooked through. Drain well. Reserve 1/2 cup turkey drippings. In a medium skillet, saute celery and onion in drippings until crisp-tender. Combine drippings, flour and seasonings. Add giblets and liquidstir until smooth. Cook and stir over low heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened. Serve over turkey or stuffing.

In a large skillet brown ground beef with onion. Add seasonings and tomato and simmer uncovered until meat is cooked through. Drain liquid from skillet and stir in macaroni. Add enough water to cover macaroni. Add cheddar cheese and stir until melted and smooth. Serve hot with bread if desired.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain orzo and set aside to cool. Place vinegar, pesto sauce, salt, and pepper into blender. Process until smooth. Add olive oil slowly while blender is running. Set aside. Cook chicken in boiling water for 10 minutes or until no longer pink. Drain and set aside to cool. In a large bowl combine orzo, spinach leaves, tomatoes, onion, chicken, parmesan cheese, pesto dressing. Toss to mix. Serve at room temperature or cold. Serve with salad or bread if desired.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Rinse the asparagus in cold water. Place the asparagus in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Drizzle the olive oil over the asparagus. Sprinkle the asparagus with the garlic and lemon zest. Season with the lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Roast the asparagus in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine bread crumbs, parsley, salt, garlic, and butter in a bowl. Divide evenly between 4 chicken breasts. Lay 1 chicken breast in an aluminum foil-lined 9 x 13 baking dishcover with 1/2 of the bread-crumb mixture. Top with 1 more chicken breast, then cover with remaining bread-crumb mixture. Cover tightly with foil. Repeat with remaining chicken breasts and bread-crumb mixture. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until chicken is no longer pink in center. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place chicken in a large bowl. Sprinkle with Shake N Bake and toss to coat chicken evenly. In a medium bowl, combine pasta, oil and buttertoss to coat pasta evenly. In a medium saucepan combine chicken broth, tomatoes, parsley, basil, garlic powder, oregano and parmesan cheese. Cook over medium heat until sauce thickens, about 10 minutes. Pour sauce over pasta mixturetoss to coat evenly. Transfer pasta mixture to a greased baking dish. Sprinkle chicken with parsleyplace evenly over pasta mixture. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.

Cook elbow macaroni in a large pot of boiling water until tender. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add beef and cook, breaking up with a spoon, until browned. Drain. Add onion and cook until tender. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in tomato soup. Bring to a boil. Stirring often, simmer uncovered for about 5 minutes. Stir in macaroni and water. Bring to a boil. Simmer, covered for 10 minutes. Stir in sugar, salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes more. Serve warm.

Melt chocolate in microwave or double boiler over low heat until smooth. Heat vegetable oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat until a deep fryer thermometer reads 375f or until a small piece of potato chip dropped into skillet sizzles when removed immediately. One at a time, dip each chip into chocolate and allow excess to drip off before placing on a wire rack set over a baking sheet. Sprinkle with pistachios, sea salt and cayenne pepper, if using. Repeat with remaining potato chips. Let stand until chocolate is set.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Rub salmon with butter. Sprinkle with brown sugar and bourbon. Bake 10-15 minutes.

Cook rice according to package directions. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place a 9x13-inch baking pan in the oven to heat. Rinse the inside and outside of the whole chicken with hot water. Pat dry. In a small bowl, combine the hot broth with the yogurt and stir well. In a second bowl, combine the mustard with the soy and ginger. In a third bowl, combine the honey and salt. Remove the pan from the oven and place the chicken breast-side down in the hot pan. Brush the top of the bird with the broth mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Brush the top of the bird again with the mustard mixture. Brush the top of the bird again with the honey mixture. Roast for 1 hour. Remove the bird from the pan and let it stand for 10 minutes. Remove the chicken meat from the carcass and shred with your fingers. Add the meat to the rice and toss to combine. Serve with the lemon slices.

In a mixing bowl, combine the eggs with the all-purpose flour, sugar, salt & pepper until well blended. Stir in the corn. Heat about 1 inch oil in a frying pan until very hot. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls into the hot oil & fry until golden brown & crisp, turning once to brown evenly. Drain on paper towel-lined plate. Serve with ketchup or any other sauce you like.

Boil or bake the potatoes until they are tender. Cut in half and scoop the flesh out with a spoon. Mash the flesh with the sour cream. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the diced onion and grated cheddar cheese. Spoon back into the skins and sprinkle with more cheese if desired. Bake at 350 degrees until the cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Combine sugar and light corn syrup in a large pot over medium heat. Cook until the mixture comes to a boil and is about 240 degrees fahrenheit. Remove from heat and stir in gelatin until dissolved. Return the mixture to the heat and cook until it reaches 250 degrees fahrenheit. Remove from heat and add butter and food coloring. Stir until the butter is melted and the mixture is combined well. Divide the mixture among lollipop molds and let cool completely at room temperature. Insert lollipop sticks into the center of the molds and place in the refrigerator overnight until firm. Remove lollipops from the molds and serve or store in airtight container.

In food processor, combine garbanzo beans, tahini, water, lemon juice, olive oil. Process until smooth. Add garlic, 1/8 teaspoon salt, cumin seed, cayenne pepper. Process until well blended. Add parsley. Process until well blended. Transfer to serving bowl. Serve with pita chips. Refrigerate in tightly covered container for 1 week.

Place bread in a single layer on a baking sheet and spray with cooking spray. Bake at 325 degrees for 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven and spread mustard on the bottom side of the bread slices. Top each slice with ham and cheese slices. Spread with honey mustard and place in a panini maker and cook until cheese has melted and bread is crispy. Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour two 9-inch round cakepans. Sift the flour, baking powder, and salt together into a large mixing bowl. Beat the oil and the brown sugar in another large mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs, one at a time. Add the water and the vanilla and beat until smooth. Add half of the flour mixture and beat on low speed. Add half of the milk and beat on low speed. Repeat with the remaining flour mixture and the remaining milk. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans and bake for 30-35 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool for 10 minutes in the pans on wire racks. Remove from the pans and cool completely. Meanwhile, prepare the chocolate sauce. Melt the chocolate and the shortening together over low heat in a heavy saucepan. Stir in the confectioners sugar and vanilla. Serve the cake slices with the chocolate sauce poured over them.

Cook brown rice according to directions on box. Drain peas. Stir together soup, water & rice. Pour mixture into greased baking dish. Bake at 375 degrees f for 20 minutes or until heated through. Stir in tuna & peas. Top with cheese slices. Bake 5 more minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and saute until browned. Add garlic, rosemary, thyme, parsley, and sage. Saute 1 minute. Stir in flour. Cook 1 minute. Add wine, stirring constantly. Cook 1 minute or until thick. Add lemon juice.

Place 4 chicken breasts on a piece of aluminum foil. Sprinkle with salsa, beans and corn. Fold foil over breasts to make a sealed packet. Bake in 400 degree oven for 30 minutes. Serve with warm flour tortillas.
Mix together sugar, water and salt. Heat to dissolve. Cool. Stir in vanilla. Chill. Store in refrigerator. Use as a mixer with cola.

Cut the chicken breasts in half lengthwise and then cut each half into 3 pieces. Add the chicken to a crockpot. Combine the other ingredients. Pour over the chicken and stir to combine. Cook for 4 hours on low. Serve over rice.
Blend all of these ingredients together and serve on crackers with lettuce or tomato.

Line a baking sheet with wax paper. Melt oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic powder and dill weed and stir. Add lemon juice and stir until combined. Add dressing mix and stir until combined. Pour over baking sheet. Bake 45 minutes. Remove from oven and stir. Bake 30 minutes longer or until browned. Cool completely. Store in airtight containers. Makes 10 servings.

Combine the butter and sugar in the bowl of a mixer. Beat until light and creamy. Add the eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition. Add the water and beat until incorporated. Add the citric acid and beat until just combined. Spread the magic spread into the crust. Bake at 350 degrees until bubbly, approximately 30 minutes. Cool completely.

Heat olive oil in large pot over medium heat. Add scallions, celery rib, onion and cook 5 minutes or until onion is tender. Add chicken broth, peas and peapods. Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer 2 minutes or until peas are tender-crisp. Remove 1 cup mixture. In blender or food processor puree remaining mixture. Stir in mint leaves and 2 tablespoons yogurt. Serve with remaining yogurt sprinkled with mint leaf.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook pasta until al dente. Drain. While pasta is cooking, heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sausage and brown until cooked through. Add the pepper and onion. Saute until the pepper is tender. Stir in the sauce and heat through. Add the pasta and stir to combine. Serve sprinkled with basil.

In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, heat oil and garlic for about 2-3 minutes, until fragrant and lightly browned. Stir in vinegar, mustard and salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat and let stand until cooled slightly. Tear lettuce into bite-size pieces and add to dressing in skillet and toss well. Top with shredded romano and serve immediately.

Place flour, baking soda and salt into bowl and mix well. Cut butter into flour mixture using two knives or pastry blender. Add sour milk. Mix until dough is firm enough to handle. Turn out onto a floured board. Knead lightly until smooth. Roll out 1/2 inch thick. Cut into four squares. Bake on ungreased baking sheet at 425F for 10 minutes.

Mix together the sour cream, cream cheese, and worcestershire sauce and set aside. Dice the chicken and add it to the mixture. Add the parmesan cheese and stir it all together. Place it in a baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips, crackers or veggies.

In a large bowl sift the flour, baking powder and mustard powder. With a knife or pastry blender cut in the cold butter and cheese until crumbly. Stir in the milk until the dough forms a ball. Divide dough in half and pat each half into a 1/2 inch thick disk. Cut each disk into quarters and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 425 degrees for about 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Let cool on a rack. Brush with melted butter before serving.

Thaw peas in microwave. Bring to a boil in a saucepan, season with salt and pepper and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in dill. Let cool and mix with artichoke hearts. Serve with green onions and a drizzle of olive oil.

Cook sausage in a skillet over medium heat until no longer pink, 8-10 minutes. Drain off fat and cool sausage in a large mixing bowl. Combine remaining ingredients in a smaller bowl. Add sausage and mix well. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake at 350 f 20-25 minutes.

Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees. Cut sausage links in half. Place cut side down in baking dish. Add olive oil and saute onion and peppers in dish until tender. Sprinkle sausage and veggies with tomato sauce. Bake uncovered for 30-45 minutes. You can also brown the sausage and veggies first. Serve over cooked pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine sugar and corn syrup in a saucepan. Stir over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Bring mixture to a boil and boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in butter and nuts. Spoon filling into a greased 12-cup muffin pan. Separate dough into triangles and place over filling in pan. Bake in preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until golden brown.
In a small bowl combine the margarine, mustard, and mayonnaise. Put the wieners on a skewer, then dip them into the mixture. Serve on a Q-tip.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, combine flour, sugar and salt. Blend in margarine until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Add water and mix until the dough holds together. Gather dough into a ball. Shape into a disk and wrap with plastic. Chill for 1 hour. Roll out dough to fit your pie pan. Bake 15-20 minutes. Cool.

Spread pizza sauce onto one side of each slice of bread. Place slices of cheese and pepperoni in pizza sauce. Top with another slice of bread. Place sandwiches in panini maker. Grill sandwiches until golden brown and cheese is melted. Remove from maker. Brush sandwiches with butter. Cut in half. Serve immediately.

Place peppers in a small bowl and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat and boil for 15 minutes. Drain and place in a food processor. Add garlic and process until smooth. Add walnuts and process until smooth. Season with salt and hot pepper flakes. With a spoon, press into a serving dish. Bake in a 350f preheated oven until bubbly and browned, about one hour. Cool slightly. In a small bowl combine molasses and oil. Pour over red pepper mixture and toss to coat. Cover and chill overnight. Serve with crostini or bread.

In a 9x13 baking dish or roasting pan, mix together all the ingredients except the mushrooms and the garlic. Add the chicken pieces and stir to coat. Bake for one hour. Stir every 15 minutes. Cook for about an hour or until the chicken is done. Add the mushrooms and garlic and stir. Cook for an additional 10 minutes. Serve with hot, cooked rice.

Heat oil in large saute pan over medium heatadd onions and garlic, and cook 2-3 minutes. Add tomatoescook 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add basil and buttercook 1 minute more. Meanwhile, in a large pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta until tender but firm. Drain pastaadd tomato sauce mixture and gorgonzola cheesetoss well. Divide pasta among 4 warmed platessprinkle with parmesan cheese. Yield: 4 servings

Cook potatoes and eggs in boiling salted water. Drain and cut potatoes into bite size pieces. Cool. In a large bowl, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise and sugar. Mix well. Add the potatoes and onion. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour mixture into a greased 1 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes until heated through. Top with bacon bits before serving. Serve warm. Serves 4.

Heat oven to 325 degrees F. In large bowl with electric mixer, beat cake mix, eggs and sour cream on low speed until blended. Beat on medium speed about 1 minute or until well mixed. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour into 12-cup fluted tube pan. Bake 55 to 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutesremove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack. In small bowl with electric mixer on low speed, beat pudding and milk until blendedbeat 1 to 2 minutes until thickened. Frost cake with pudding.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place skate in a shallow roasting pan and place in oven to warm. Slice garlic cloves thinly and place in small pot with oil and vinegar. Cook over low heat until oil begins to separate from sauce. Stir in paprika and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in butter and whisk until melted and blended. Pour sauce over skate and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a medium bowl, cream the butter and sugar until fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla. In another bowl combine the flour and baking powderstir into the creamed mixture. Stir in the chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Store in an airtight container.

In large saute pan combine butter, dark brown sugar, ground allspice, nutmeg. Cook until mixture begins to bubble. Add banana liqueur and dark rum. Stir until blended. Arrange banana slices on top. Place pan under broiler until liquid bubbles. Serve immediately.
Heat water to boiling. Add coffee. Add sugar and cardamom. Stir until dissolved. Remove from heat. Add milk. Stir. Pour into cups. Drizzle with chocolate syrup. Garnish with whipped cream.

Cut tofu into bite-sized cubes. Put all the sauce ingredients in a small bowl. Set aside. Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the tofu. Cook over medium-high heat until the tofu is golden brown. Remove from the pan. Put the tofu cubes in the sauce bowl. Set aside. Heat the sauce over medium-high heat until boiling. Remove from the heat. Add the tofu cubes. Stir until the tofu is coated. Add the chopped peanuts. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with steamed rice.

Line a pie dish with the crumb crust. In a small saucepan combine milk and butter over medium heat until the mixture boils. Reduce heat and stir in marshmallow creme and sweetened condensed milk. Stir until combined and pour into pie dish on top of crumb crust. Chill for 8 hours or overnight. Spread whipped topping on top of pie before serving.

Grate carrot using the large holes on a box grater. Place in a large bowl. Add butter and mix. Add brown sugar and stir. Add water one tablespoon at a time until dough is firm enough to roll into coins. Roll coins and place on wax paper. Chill. Store in the fridge.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Pound pork chops to 1/2-inch thickness. Combine egg, seasoning salt, and garlic powder. Mix well. Place flour in a shallow dish. Place breadcrumbs in another shallow dish. Dip chops in egg mixturethen coat with flourthen dip again in egg mixturethen coat with breadcrumbs. Place coated chops in a shallow baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and pour in the soup mixture. Cover with foil and bake for 10 minutes longer. Uncover and bake an additional 5-10 minutes longer or until juice of pork chops is clear when cut to the center with a knife. If desired, serve with rice, noodles, or pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with foil. In a large bowl combine the hoisin sauce, vinegar, honey, shallot, toasted sesame oil, red pepper, pepper, and onion powder. Mix well. Place the chicken wings in a large bowl. Pour the marinade over the chicken wings. Turn them to coat evenly. Cover the bowl and refrigerate at least one hour. Remove chicken wings from the marinade. Place them on the baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 35-45 minutes. Turn after 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cream together the butter and pumpkin. Stir in the egg and milk. Combine the dry ingredients and stir into the pumpkin mixture. Fold in the nuts and raisins. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted into the muffins comes out clean. Cool on wire racks. Makes 12 muffins.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet. Drain. Add green beans and onionmix well. Transfer to a casserole dish. Mix together cream of mushroom soup and waterpour over the beef mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Cook pasta according to directions. Rinse under cold water. Drain and let cool. In a small bowl combine sour cream, mayonnaise and ranch mix. In a large bowl combine pasta, chicken, roasted peppers, basil and scallions. Add dressing and mix well. Cover and chill at least 4 hours before serving.

In a bowl combine brown sugar with the rest of the ingredients. Place the pork strips in a dish or a ziplock freezer bag. Pour the marinade over the pork. Seal the bag or cover the dish. Marinate overnight in the refrigerator or up to 24 hours in the freezer. Remove the pork from the marinade. Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Put the pork strips in a baking dish. Bake for 40 minutes, basting with the marinade occasionally. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375. Grease 8x8 inch baking dish. Mix together spaghetti sauce and water. Set aside. In a small bowl combine biscuit crumbs with 1/2 cup of the sauce mixture. Press crumb mixture firmly over bottom of baking dish. Layer with mozzarella, then remaining sauce. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley and mushrooms. Bake an additional 5 minutes until heated through.

Peel and dice potatoes. Cover with cold water. Bring to boil and cook 10 to 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and return to pot. Mash. Blend in salt and half and half. Add butter and mix until smooth. Stir in bacon. Cook over low heat until warmed through. Stir in cheddar and sour cream. Garnish with chives. Serve warm.

Remove collard greens and kale from stems. Wash leaves. Cut leaves into 1/2-inch strips. Heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and saute 1 to 2 minutes. Add greens and saute 10 minutes. Add lemon juice. Saute 5 minutes longer or until greens are wilted.

Combine salt, garlic and black peppercorns in a plastic bag. Add chicken and toss to coat. Put chicken wings in bag and refrigerate for 12 hours. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a bowl stir together soy sauces and honey. Drain chicken and discard marinade. Add chicken to sauce. Bake 45 minutes. Flip wings and bake 30 minutes more.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add the black beans with the salsa and the next 4 ingredientscook 4 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Reduce the heat to low. Cut the flour tortillas into 4 equal trianglesplace 1-1/2 cups of the bean mixture down the center of each tortilla triangle. Sprinkle with the green onions. Fold each tortilla over the fillingroll up tightly. Wrap the quesadillas securely in plastic wrap. Refrigerate up to 4 hours or until ready to cook. Melt the reduced-fat cheese on each side of the quesadillas in the hot skillet until melted. Makes 4 servings (2 quesadillas each).

Boil water and add anise seeds and cinnamon sticks. Simmer 10 minutes and remove from heat. Steep tea bag 2 minutes. Remove tea bag and add anise seeds and cinnamon sticks. Add sugar and honey and stir. Add lemon juice and stir. Serve hot.
Combine all ingredients except red potatoes and barley. Bring to boil. Cover and simmer for 1-1/2 hours. Add potatoes and barley. Simmer 1 hour more.

In a large pot over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook until transparent. Add the potatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add the boiling water. Add chicken bouillon cubes and frozen chopped broccoli. Stir. Cook for 30 minutes. Stir in the cheese. Cook for 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season lamb generously with sea salt. Place lamb in a small roasting pan. Combine honey, mustard and rosemary. Spread half the mixture over lamb. Roast for 20 minutes. Remove lamb from the oven. Using a pastry brush, spread remaining honey mustard mixture over lamb. Roast for another 1 hour. Sprinkle the garlic zest over lamb. Roast for another 1/2 hour. Remove from oven. Let rest for 10 minutes. Slice and serve.

Cook grits in a large pot of boiling water, stirring often until they are cooked through but still slightly firm to the touch. Drain grits in a colander and transfer to a large bowl. Add the Velveeta cheese, butter, eggs and salt. Mix with a spoon until combined. Add jalapeno and red bell pepper to mixture. Spread into an 8-inch square baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until set. Let cool and serve with salsa or sour cream.
Heat oven to 350f. Beat flour with milk and shortening. Add sugar, vanilla and salt. Bake in greased pan for 30 minutes or until firm.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Add the pork and cook until browned. Drain in a colander. Heat the broth to boiling. Add the meat and cook 2 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Place in crock pot. Cook on low for 8 hours. Serve on tortillas with cheese and salsa.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Drain sour cream and mix with parmesan cheese. Season with paprika and salt. Coat fish with sour cream mixture. Place fish skin side down on baking sheet. Bake fish for about 20 minutes. Serve with a salad.

Peel and cube potatoes. Cook in boiling water until tender. Drain and add honey, mustard and corn oil. Stir until combined. Add onions and toss until combined. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve as a side dish or as a main dish.

Mix dry ingredients. Add egg and milk. Blend well and set aside. Heat oil in skillet. Pour batter in skillet. When pancake is browned on one side flip it over and add 3-4 chocolate chips in each pancake. Repeat. Top with whipped cream and strawberries or blueberries or any other fruits you like and sprinkle powdered sugar on top.

In a large saucepan combine the sugar and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook until a small amount of syrup dropped into a cup of cold water forms a soft ball. Remove from heat. Add the karo and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Pour into a large bowl. Add the popcorn and the butter. Beat until mixture is blended. Drop by spoonfuls onto a parchment covered baking sheet. Let stand at room temperature overnight. Store in an airtight container. Makes 3 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cut carrots into 1/4-inch cubes. Place in a large saucepan and add chicken stock. Bring to a boilreduce heat to a simmer and cook for 3 minutes. Place carrots in a greased 9-in. square baking dish. Combine honey, butter, salt, pepper and nutmeg in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until butter melts. Pour over carrots. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with almonds.

Place the flour, butter and sugar into the bowl of a food processor and pulse for 10 seconds or until the mixture resembles bread crumbs. Add the desiccated coconut and pulse until just combined. Transfer the mixture into a lightly greased 20cm x 30cm baking tray. Press the mixture down firmly, making sure it is evenly spread throughout the tray. Bake the base for 20 minutes or until golden brown and crisp. Remove from oven and set aside to cool. Whisk the condensed milk with the passionfruit pulp until smooth and well combined. Once the base has cooled slightly, spread the passionfruit mixture evenly over the base. Cut into bars once the mixture has set firmly, about 1 hour or until the bars can be easily removed from the tray. Store the bars in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

Preheat oven to 220c/200c fan/gas 7. Rinse potatoes well under cold running water then pat dry with paper towels. Put them on a roasting tray with a little water from the sink to cover the bottom of the tray. Roast for around 1hr 15min or until tender. While the potatoes are cooking, make the sauce by melting the butter in a small saucepan over a low heat then stir in the flour with a whisk. Cook for around 1min then stir in the cream with a wooden spoon. Bring it slowly to a gentle simmer then cook for around 2-3min or until thickened then remove from heat. Once potatoes are cooked, use a fork or spoon to smear out the flesh of each one into a circular shape then return to the roasting tray. Cut each tomato into four wedges then arrange them on top of the potatoes. Pour over half of the sauce then sprinkle with the spring onions and remaining sauce on top. Scatter over the cheese then season well with salt and

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly grease a 12 inch pizza pan. Mix all the dry ingredients together. Add milk and water, stirring well. Divide evenly into 4 greased muffin cups. Bake for 15 minutes. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add meatbrown and drain. Add taco seasoning and stir. Pour over baked cornbread. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 5 minutes. Serve with lettuce, tomatoes, and taco sauce.

Combine butter, cumin, oregano, chili powder, thyme and cayenne pepper. Spread on both sides of steak. Cook to desired doneness. Meanwhile combine blackened seasoning with oil and put aside. Grill steaks 2 to 4 minutes per side or broil about 4 inches from heat about 4 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Turn once and brush with blackened seasoning during the last 2 minutes of cooking time.
In a small bowl combine butter, basil, parsley, shallot, seasonings and lemon juice. Store tightly covered. Use to baste or brush on meat, seafood and vegetables while cooking.

Heat oil in a pan and add cinnamon, cardamom and cloves. Saute for a couple of minutes then add rice. Stir rice and saute for a few minutes more. Add sugar, salt and saffron and stir. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover and simmer for about 20 minutes or until done. Add pistachios and mix well and serve.

Cut chicken breasts into thin strips. Mix flour and curry paste together in shallow dish. Beat egg and milk together and put into another shallow dish. Put breadcrumbs and coconut flakes into another shallow dish. Dip chicken first into flour mixture then into egg mixture and finally into breadcrumbs and coconut flakes mixture. Heat oil and fry chicken strips for 3 minutes on each side until they are cooked through and golden brown. Serve with mixed vegetables and coconut cream sauce.

Peel and core apples. Combine cinnamon, nutmeg, water and lemon juice. Add apples. Set aside. In small saucepan, combine sugar and flour. Add butter and stir with wooden spoon until mixture is crumbly. Sprinkle over apples. Bake at 350 degrees F. until apples are tender and crisp mixture is lightly browned. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350f grease and lightly flour a 9x13 inch pan. Beat cake mix, egg and water for 30 seconds. Add butter and beat well. Add half of the snickers candy bars and half of the pecans. Spread batter into the pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Dissolve cream cheese and powdered sugar in the microwave for 1 minute. Stir until smooth. Add the eggs and beat well. Spread the filling over the cake. Bake for another 20 minutes. Sprinkle with the remaining snickers and pecans. Bake for 20 minutes longer. Let cool completely. Frost with the remaining cream cheese mixture. Cut into squares.

Sauté the minced garlic in 1 t. Olive oil. Add the rice. Stir for one minute. Add the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Add the dill weed and the onion powder. Cook until all the liquid is absorbed. Fluff the rice with a fork. Serve as a side dish.

Crumble the ground beef and season with the banana peppers, ground cumin, barbecue sauce, salt & pepper to taste. Shape the meat into 4 patties. Grill over medium high heat until the patties are well done (about 4-5 min per side). Assemble the burgers by adding cheddar cheese on the top bun, burger patty, onion slices & bacon on the bottom bun. Makes 4 servings.

Mix together first 8 ingredients in medium bowl. Stir in sugars, maple syrup and egg replacermix well. Shape dough into 1 inch ballsplace 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Makes 3 dozen cookies.
Prepare the pudding according to package directions. Fold in the kix cereal. Add the other ingredients. Mix well. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Store in an air-tight container.

Brown beef in skillet, drain fat. In a crock pot combine beef, tomatoes and green chilies, cheese and the remaining ingredients. Cook on high for about an hour or until hot and bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips.

Mix cake mix and pudding together. Add eggs, oil and water and stir until just mixed. Pour into 9 x 13 pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool. Frost with powdered sugar and squeeze lemon juice and drizzle with butter. Let sit and chill for 30 minutes or so. Cut and serve.

Dip fish in beaten egg. Roll in parmesan cheese. Heat oil in skillet. Add fish to oil. Fry for 2-3 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with paprika. Drizzle with lemon juice. Serve with rice, pasta or vegetables.

Mix everything together in a large bowl. Add the chicken breast and coat thoroughly. Place chicken on skewers and refrigerate until ready to cook. Cook over an open fire or campfire. Flip every few minutes. Cook until the chicken is no longer raw and has a nice char on it. Serve with ranch dressing.

Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flour until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Cook and stir until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 minute. Stir in salmon and seasonings. Pour into 2-quart casserole. Beat egg yolks lightly. Add 1/3 cup milk to egg yolks. Stir into hot mixture. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into egg mixture. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until set. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Serves 8.

Heat oil in a griddle pan or a large frying pan. Slice plantains crosswise into 1-inch thick slices. Add to hot oil. Fry until browned on one side. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Flip plantains over. Sprinkle with more brown sugar. Fry until golden on the other side. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg. Fry until the plantains are tender. Top with fresh cilantro. Serve with honey on the side for dipping.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine orange juice and zest. Cook until reduced by half. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Pour the yogurt into a parfait glass. Spoon the orange mixture over the yogurt. Sprinkle with the granola. Serve immediately.

Mix the masa harina flour with the chicken broth. Heat the corn oil until hot. Drop 1 tsp of corn oil into each corn husk and then 1 tbsp of masa mixture. Roll husk around masa mixture tightly. Wrap the corn husk around the masa mixture tightly so it looks like a tamale. Steam the tamales for 20 minutes or until they are cooked through. To make the green tomatillo sauce, place all of the ingredients except the green tomatillo sauce into a food processor. Blend until smooth. Refrigerate until ready to use. When ready to serve, add the green tomatillo sauce to each tamale, serve with a spoonful of sour cream if desired.

Heat a heavy pot with a lid and add the olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the roast and brown all sides. Add the onions and saute until tender. Sprinkle the roast with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, mix the porter and beef broth. Pour over the roast. Bring the liquid to a boil. Reduce heat to a low simmer and cook for about 2 hours. Remove from the heat and let the roast sit for 20 minutes. Remove the meat from the pot and place on a platter. Skim the fat from the cooking juices and pour into a small saucepan. Simmer until the liquid reduces to about a quarter cup. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter. Pour the gravy over the roast and serve.

In a medium bowl, combine soy sauce and sugarmix well. Add porktoss to coat. Thread pork onto wooden skewersplace in shallow glass or ceramic baking dish or in a zipper-type plastic bag. Pour marinade over pork. Cover or seal bagrefrigerate overnight or at least 8 hours. Heat grill or broiler on high heatcoat grill rack or broiler pan with cooking spray or line pan with foil for easy cleanup. Remove pork from marinade and discard marinade. Grill or broil pork strips 8 minutes on each side or until pork is no longer pink, turning once and brushing frequently with melted butter or margarine during last few minutes of cooking. Serve immediately with rice.

Prepare the crock pot by adding water. Place the chicken breasts in crock pot. In a blender combine salsa, corn, beans, corn, salsa, water, chicken broth and flour tortilla. Pour the mixture over the chicken breasts. Cover and cook for 6 to 8 hours or until chicken is tender. Serve over cooked rice with cheddar cheese topping. Serves 6 to 8.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and oreganocook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the escarole, parsley, beans, 1/4 cup of the chicken broth, the remaining 1/4 cup of the water and the remaining 1/4 cup of the oil. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 10 to 12 minutes or until the escarole is tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Makes 4 servings.

Drain solid white tuna. Combine tuna with mayonnaise and add parmesan cheese and sweet pickle relish. Blend in onion flakes, curry powder, dried dill weed and garlic powder. Spread between 2 pieces of white bread. Cut crusts off bread and cut sandwiches in 4 equal wedges.

Pound chicken to 1/2 inch thickness. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add chicken in a single layer and cook until lightly browned on both sides. Remove from pan and set aside. Increase heat to high, add garlic and lime peel. Cook until garlic is golden, about 1 minute. Add lime juice and ginger and cook until mixture thickens and reduced by half. Add chicken back to pan, top with red pepper flakes and orange sections. Cook until chicken is no longer pink and heated through, about 2 minutes. Serve with brown or white rice.

In a large bowl, toss together pears, raspberries, sugar and honey. Spread mixture into an ungreased 9-inch square baking dish. In another bowl combine oats, margarine, cinnamon and nutmeg. Sprinkle evenly over pear mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes or until topping is golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Mix first 5 ingredients in a saucepan until well blendedcook over medium heat until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in coconut. Pour over bananasspread evenly in pan. Bake for 40 minutes. Serves 12.

In a large mixing bowl, combine cream cheese and mayonnaise. Add the tuna and Old Bay Seasoning. Mix well and refrigerate for a few hours to allow the flavors to blend. To serve, top with a sprinkling of freshly chopped parsley. Serve with your favorite crackers.

Preheat oven to 375f. Coat 13 by 9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Peel sweet potatoescut into 1/2-inch cubes. Place in large bowl. Add butter, maple syrup, brown sugar and cinnamon to sweet potato cubestoss to coat. Spread mixture into prepared baking dishcover with foil. Bake 40 minutes, stirring once or twice during baking time. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake 5 minutes longer or until heated through. Cool 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
In a large pot, saute the bacon until crispy. Add the potatoes and cabbage and saute until tender. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and serve.

Beat eggs, sugar & vanilla until light and frothy. Add custard powder & beat well. Beat the egg mixture & mix well. Add flour & bicarbonate of soda & beat well. Add milk & beat until well mixed. Pour into greased and lined 18cm cake tin. Bake at 180 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean. Leave to cool for 10 minutes & then turn out onto wire rack to cool completely. Dust with icing sugar.
Heat oil in pan. Add green and red bell peppers and onions. Saute until crisp tender. Add tomato sauce. Cook for 15 minutes. Add spaghetti and simmer 15 minutes longer. Serves 6-8.

Mix milk with 2 eggs, salt and pepper. Soak thick bread slices in mixture. In a skillet melt 1/2 stick of butter. Arrange soaked bread slices in the skillet. Grate some orange peel over the slices and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Cook 5 minutes or until light brown on each side. Serve with orange slices and more powdered sugar.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. In a bowl, cream together the almond paste and butter. Add the sugar, and beat until well blended. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla.In another bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to the batter alternately with the milk, beginning and ending with the flour mixture. Pour batter into prepared baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.Remove from the oven, and let cool. While the cake is cooling, make the frosting. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar, butter, cream of tartar, and water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from the heat, and stir in the almond extract. Let cool for 10 to
Combine tomatoes and red onion in medium bowl. Add mint and season to taste with lemon juice and pepper. Toss gently and let stand 30 minutes. Garnish with lemon wedges.

In small sauce pan, combine cornstarch and sugar, stirring until mixture is well blended. Add cinnamon and nutmeg, stirring well. Pour 1 cup boiling water over mixture, stirring constantly. Stir until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat, add lemon juice, stirring well. Add blueberriesstir gently until berries are evenly distributed throughout mixture. Refrigerate 2 hours or more. Serve over ice cream, pancakes or waffles. Makes about 1 cup sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Wash green beans and trim. Cut off stem end of mushrooms and cut into 3/4-inch slices. Melt butter and shallots in a skillet and cook until tender. Add mushrooms and cook until almost tender. Add green beans and cook until they are tender-crisp. Add thyme. Stir well. Turn into an 8-by-8-inch baking dish and sprinkle with pine nuts. Bake until beans are tender-crisp and nuts are golden brown. Turn beans several times while baking. Serve with a drizzle of Madeira wine.

In a small bowl combine soy sauce, red onion, garlic, ginger, sesame oil and rice vinegar. Set aside. Heat a small amount of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season the steak with salt. Add the steaks to the skillet, cook for 2-3 minutes per side for medium rare. Remove from the heat and allow the meat to rest for 3-5 minutes before slicing into strips. Add the broccoli to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the soy sauce mixture to the broccoli. Cook for another 2-3 minutes. Serve over rice. Serve with steak.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp, remove bacon and pour drippings into slow cooker. Saute onion in drippings until tenderadd beans and all other ingredients except baking soda and water and stir well. Add baking soda and water. Stir well and cover and cook on high heat setting for about 2 hours or until bubbly hot, stirring occasionally during cooking time. Remove beans from slow cooker and place in baking dish. Bake uncovered at 400 degrees for about 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Serve hot with crackers, bread or hamburgers.

To prepare crust, break crackers into small pieces. Combine butter and crackers in a plastic bag and crush until fine crumbs form. Press onto bottom of a 9-inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. In a large bowl beat pudding mix and milk with a wire whisk until well blended. Add vanilla and mix well. Spoon pudding mixture into pie crust. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Garnish with ice cream and Cool Whip. Cut into wedges. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cook beef with onion and green pepper until browned. Drain. Add cabbage, tomatoes, green chilies, soup and spices. Put into a 2-quart baking dish. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

Crush graham crackers. Add butter and combine. Press into the bottom of a 9 inch pie pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Let cool. Mix cream cheese and key lime juice. Whip heavy cream to medium peaks. Add whipped topping and lime zest. Spread over crust. Chill. To serve top with whipped cream and key lime wedges.

Pre-heat oven to 425 deg f. Whisk together the flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Stir in applesauce, milk, egg substitute and vanilla until well blended.
