Fold in almonds and pour into greased muffin cups. Bake in pre-heated oven until muffins are well-risen and a tester comes out clean, about 18 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Store tightly covered.

Cook sausage and peppers in skillet over medium heat until thoroughly cooked, about 5 minutes. Drain off any excess fat. Add cream cheese and sour cream. Stir over low heat until cheese is melted and well blended. Fold in olives and seasonings. Serve with chips or crackers.

Sauté onion and garlic in butter until tender. Stir in cream of mushroom soup and milk. Add mushrooms and heat through. Stir in parmesan cheese. Drain pasta and toss with cream mixture. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

Boil potatoes in their skins in lightly salted water until they are tender. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot. Mash the potatoes with the butter. Add the soup and sour cream. Stir until the mixture is smooth. Fold in the celery, cheese and green onions. Season to taste with garlic salt and pepper. Transfer to an 8 x 8 baking pan. Sprinkle with potato chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve warm.

In a large mixing bowl add chickpeas and feta cheese, toss to combine. Add cherries and black olives and toss to combine. Add parsley and toss to combine. Add lettuce and toss to combine. In a small mixing bowl whisk together olive oil, lemon juice and garlic clove until well combined. Pour over chickpea feta and olive salad and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Scrub potatoes, slice into thin rounds. Cook potato rounds in boiling water for 15 minutes. Drain potatoes in colander. Combine margarine, eggs, onion powder and pepper in a large bowl. Add potatoes to egg mixture. Gently toss to coat. Spray a 13x9 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Spread potatoes in pan. Sprinkle cheese over potatoes. Mix half-and-half with seasoning packet. Pour over potatoes. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan or microwave safe bowl. Stir in the oatmeal. Cook and stir over medium heat or in microwave for 5 minutes or until mixture is thickened. Stir in milk and applesauce. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir in raisins and cinnamon. Top with a sprinkle of Splenda. Makes 4 servings. WW points per serving 4.

Preheat oven to 350. Beat eggsadd brown sugar, oil, milk and vanilla. Sift together flour, salt, oats and baking soda. Add dry mixture to wet mixture. Stir until well mixed. Add raisins and walnuts. Grease a cookie sheetdrop by spoonfuls onto the sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes.

Boil beets until tender. Remove beets from heat and cool. Peel beets and cut into cubes. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine vinegar and sugar until sugar has dissolved. Stir in beets and cook until heated through. Serve hot or cold.

Mix biscuit mix with milk and egg in large bowl according to package directions until dough is smooth and forms into ball. Divide dough into 12 equal pieces. Using hands, roll each piece into ball and place one inch apart on ungreased baking sheet. Press one pepperoni half into center of each ball of dough. Sprinkle each with half of basil leaves and half of red pepper flakes. Bake at 425°F for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from baking sheet to cool for 1 minute before serving. Makes 12 servings.

Combine the first three ingredients and mix well. Add the chicken pieces and toss well. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour or overnight. Heat the coke in a large skillet over medium-high heat until reduced by half. Add the chicken pieces and cook for about five minutes on each side or until no longer pink inside. Season with salt and pepper and serve over rice or noodles.
Beat milk until frothy. Beat in sugar, cocoa, and custard powder. Pour into baking dish. Bake at 190c for about 45 minutes or until set. Serve hot or cold.

Heat oil over medium heat. Add onions & garlic. Cook until onions are soft & transparent. Add oregano, cumin & chicken broth. Bring to a boil & reduce heat. Simmer 20 minutes or until hominy is soft & tender. Add green chile peppers & black olives & continue cooking for an additional 2 minutes or until mixture is heated through. Serve immediately garnished with avocado slices & green onion. Makes about 6 servings.

In a large skillet brown the meat. Drain off excess fat. Stir in the onion. Mix the rest of the ingredients together and add to the skillet. Simmer until the sauce thickens. Stir in the macaroni & cheese dinner mix. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Grease a 9-by-13-inch baking pan. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, crumble sausage and cook until no longer pink. Remove from heat. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, bread crumbs, mustard, salt and pepper. Pour into pan. Top with sausage. Sprinkle evenly with cheese. Bake uncovered for 45-50 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Serve warm.
Combine first 7 ingredients. Top with yogurt. Serve immediately. Makes 12 servings.

Combine soy sauce, water, honey and ginger in a large saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir in ginger. Let cool. Remove meat from bone and cut into bite-size pieces. Add meat and green onions to marinade and let marinade overnight. Preheat grill or broiler. Drain meat from marinade, discard marinade. Grill or broil meat for 5 minutes. Brush with sesame seed oil and broil another 2 minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve. Serves 4.

In a food processor, pulse tomatoes until chopped. Transfer to a bowl. Whisk together the cream, butter, mustard and lemon juice in the processor. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add tomatoes and pulse again to combine. Set aside. Spread the bread with the tomato butter. Arrange on a platter. Serves 4.

Cut potatoes and onions into 1/4 inch slices. Cover with cold water, bring to a boil. Boil for 10 minutes. Drain. Fill fryer with 2 inches oil. Heat to 350 degrees. Fry potatoes and onions until lightly browned. Drain. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In a large heavy pot with a lid, add olive oil. Add whole chicken. Cover. Cook over low heat for about 10 minutes. Add garlic cloves. Cook for about 10 minutes. Add bay leaves. Stir. Add white wine. Cook over low heat for about 45 minutes. Salt to taste. Serve over rice.

Place cucumber in a colander and toss with 2 tbsp of the sugar. Let stand 10 minutes. Drainpat dry. Place cucumber in a large bowl. Add mandarin oranges and onion. Toss gently. Combine 1 tbsp sugar and next 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Sprinkle over salad mixture. Toss gently. Chill before serving.

Mix flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and nutmeg. In large bowl, cream butter, brown sugar, and eggs together until well blended. Stir in flour mixture just until combined. Divide dough into thirds. On lightly floured surface with floured rolling pin, roll each dough portion into a rectangle approximately 12 by 18 inches. Sprinkle each rectangle with apple juice. Place 2 cups of pecans over juice. Roll up rectangle tightlypinch edges to seal. Cut each log into 1-inch slicesplace about 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 12-14 minutes or until light brown. Cool for 1 minute before removing from pans. Makes about 36 cookies.

In a large bowl, combine cereal, pretzels and peanuts. Add chocolate chips and vanilla chips. Melt vanilla chips and oil in a large saucepan over low heat. Pour over the cereal mixture and stir until coated. Pour onto waxed paper. Spread out and let cool. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat a grill to medium heat. In a medium bowl combine honey mustard, limeade concentrate and cuminstir until well blended. Place chicken in a shallow dish. Pour marinade over chicken. Turn to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Place chicken on grill and cook over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until done. Grill pepper and pineapple 5 minutes or until lightly browned and crisp tender. Cut chicken into strips. Serve with pepper and pineapple salsa.

In a crock-pot combine ground beef, onion, tomatoes and green chilies, tomato paste, ranch dressing mix and taco seasoning mix. Cook on low 6-8 hours. Stir well. Add canned corn and beans. Cook on high 1 hour. Serve with tortilla chips. Serve with sour cream and shredded cheese.

To prepare the frogs, rinse and pat dry. Melt chocolate with shortening and pour into plastic bag. Cut the corner of the bag and use to pipe out the frogs. Set aside to harden. To prepare the filling, combine the egg white and water, and stir. Add the powdered sugar and cinnamon and beat until smooth. Stir in the extract. Add the food coloring until the desired color is reached. Fill the frogs with the filling. Store the frogs in the refrigerator. Serves about 20.

Mash the potatoes in a large bowl. Stir in the coconut and nuts. Stir in the vanilla. Mix thoroughly. Then shape the mixture into walnut sized balls. Roll each ball in powdered sugar. Then roll each ball in dipping chocolate. Allow the chocolate to set before storing.

To prepare the spinach: 1. Cut off the stems from the spinach leaves and discard. 2. Bring 3 inches of water to boil in a large pot. Add the spinach leaves, reduce the heat to low, and cook for 3 minutes until the leaves are bright green but still crisp. Drain the leaves and squeeze out the excess moisture using your hands. 3. To prepare the dressing: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and pine nuts, stirring for 1 minute. Add the spinach leaves, raisins, salt and pepper to taste, stirring for 1 minute more. Serve hot or cold.

Marinate steaks for 30 minutes in the refrigerator. Heat olive oil and gingerroot in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add marlin steaks and cook 3 minutes per side for medium doneness. Place steaks on platter. Add lemon juice and mustard to pan. Simmer over medium heat 1 minute. Season with pepper. Pour over steaks. Sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve immediately.
Soak the onion in water for a few minutes to take the edge off. Combine the yogurt with the onion and cucumber. Season with salt to taste and a little pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 8 inch square baking dish. Melt butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Add brown sugar and cook, stirring constantly until sugar dissolves. Add banana and cook until well mixed. Remove from heat and stir in flour, baking powder and salt. Spread evenly into prepared baking dish. Bake 25 minutes. Spread chocolate chips evenly over the top. Bake another 5 minutes or until set. Cool slightly before serving.

Peel apples. Quarter apples and remove cores. Place apples in a large saucepan and add water to cover apples. Bring mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 30 minutes. Remove apples from liquid. In a food processor combine cooked apples, sugar, cardamom, lemon juice and a pinch of salt. Process until smooth. Return to saucepan. Stir in additional 1/4 cup water if needed. Stir frequently until mixture thickens. Cool completely. Store in the refrigerator in an airtight container. Serve over oatmeal or toast.

Brown meat in Dutch oven over medium heat, stirring to break up clumps. Stir in onioncook until tender. Stir in remaining ingredients, except potatoes and cornsimmer, covered, 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add potatoescontinue simmering, covered, about 15 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender. Add cornheat through. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Grease baking sheet with olive oil. Wash zucchini, then slice into 1/4-inch rounds. Coat zucchini rounds with oilsprinkle with herbs and cheese. Bake until zucchini rounds are golden brown and crisp, 12-15 minutes. Serve hot or at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

Melt butter and add 12 squares of semi-sweet chocolate. Blend well. Add sugar and blend until smooth. Add eggs and blend until smooth. Add vanilla and salt and blend until smooth. Pour into pie shell and bake at 325 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until filling is set and center is not runny. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Slice brie round into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Spread each slice with pineapple preserves. Sprinkle each slice with 1/4 teaspoon brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon coconut flakes and 2 tablespoons honey-roasted peanuts. Serve as an appetizer with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour three 9×1-1/2 inch round baking pans. Mix carrot cake mix and water together in a large bowl. Stir in oil and eggs until just combined. Stir in pineapple and nutspour into prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes. Allow to cool 5 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks. Decorate with raisins and serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 375f in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and saltcut in the shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs stir in the sugar and eggs. Combine the beer and milk in another bowl and stir into the flour mixture until just moistened. Fry pancakes in melted butter in a heavy frying pan over medium heat turn once and cook until both sides are golden brown about 2 minutes each side. Makes about 12 pancakes.

Rinse chicken livers and pat dry with paper towel. Combine flour and salt and pepper to taste in shallow bowl or plastic bag. Dip livers into flour mixture and shake off excess. In large skillet, heat butter and oil over medium-high heat until hot. Add livers and brown on both sides (about 4-5 minutes). Add onions and garlic and cook until tender, about 5 minutes more. Add sherry and cook until liquid is reduced by half (about 1-2 minutes). Serve warm.

Chop chicken breasts into small pieces and cook in a frying pan with a little bit of olive oil and butter. Add the mushrooms and onions and cook until tender. Add the rice and chicken broth, bring to a boil and simmer for about 20 minutes. Let stand for about 5 minutes. Serve and enjoy.
In a blender, combine the milk, sugar and vanilla. Add the orange juice and puree until smooth. Pour into a tall glass. Top with ice cubes and a slice of orange. Stir gently. Enjoy!

Mix together 1/2 cup of sour cream with 2 cups of fresh or frozen berries. Let set for at least 1 hour or overnight. Mix together 1/2 cup of sour cream with 2 cups of fresh or frozen berries. Let set for at least 1 hour or overnight. In a large bowl, mix together 1 1/2 cups of sour cream with 3/4 cup of fresh or frozen berries. In a small bowl, stir together 2 tablespoons of sour cream with 1/4 teaspoon of unflavored gelatin. Pour the warm sour cream mixture over the gelatin mixture. Pour the mixture back into the large bowl and stir well to combine. Set aside for 1 hour or overnight to set. After the mixture has set, chill for 30 minutes before serving.

Mix together honey and chili powder. Cut 1/3 cup butter into cubes. Put 1/2 stick butter cubes in a 9x13 baking dish. Place chicken pieces in dish. Drizzle chicken with 1/4 of the honey mixture. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup chili powder. Add 1 cup of water to dish. Repeat twice more. Bake uncovered in 325 oven for 1 hour. Serve with rice.
In a large bowl, add sugar and hot water. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add lemon juice. Peel and pit peaches. Slice peaches. Add sliced peaches to bowl. Cool and serve.

In a medium saucepan, combine the vanilla bean with the milk. Bring just to a boil over medium heat. Remove from the heat. Cover the saucepan with a lid and set aside for 1 hour. Strain the vanilla bean mixture into a medium bowl. Discard the vanilla bean. In a slow cooker combine the vanilla bean mixture with the sugar. Stir in the water. Sprinkle the baking soda over the mixture. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Remove the lid and stir in the baking soda. Cook on low for another hour or so. Pour into a glass jar. Cool. Refrigerate.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until onion is tender, about 5 minutes. Add vermicelli and cook until it is almost tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in broth and tomatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with pepper to taste and cheese to serve.

To make dressing combine lemon juice, garlic and oil in a bowl. Drain bacon and cut into strips. In another bowl toss lettuce, tomatoes and cheese. Drizzle dressing over top and toss well. Top with bacon, nuts and croutons.

Cook bacon in large heavy pan until crisp. Remove bacon, drain, and reserve 1 tablespoon bacon drippings in pan. Crumble bacon into bits. Add onion, celery, and water to drippings. Cook and stir until tender. Add red pepper, garlic powder, and Rotelheat through. Stir in broth and beans. Simmer covered 15 minutes. Stir occasionally to keep from sticking. Add cheeseheat through. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Spray 13x9x2-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain, reserving 1 cup of liquid. In medium saucepan, combine soup, mayonnaise and cheddar cheese until cheese is melted. Add macaroni, celery, peppers, onion and pimientosmix well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with reserved macaroni liquid. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until bubbly. Top with crackers.

Cut chicken breasts into strips. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, sugar and toasted sesame oil. In a large bowl, combine the chicken strips with the marinade. Refrigerate at least 3 hours or overnight. In the rice cooker bowl, combine the rice with the vegetables and chicken broth. Cover with lid. Cook rice according to manufacturer's instructions. Before serving, remove the garlic and ginger. Stir in green onion.

In a large mixing bowl stir together flour, salt and sugar. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl beat together the egg yolks, vanilla extract, buttermilk, and melted butter. Stir the egg mixture into the dry ingredients just until combined. Beat the egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff peaks formfold into the batter. Heat a waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions. Spoon batter into the hot waffle iron and bake until the waffles are golden brown and crisp. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve immediately with whipped cream or syrup.

Boil water in large saucepan. Cook macaroni for 8 to 10 minutes or until tender. Drain on wire rack or colander. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).In small bowl, beat together eggs and milk.Combine pasta, butter, cheeses and seasonings in large bowl. Stir in egg mixture until blended. Pour into 2 quart baking dish. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve warm.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until hot. Add scallion and cook for 1 minute. Add the couscous and cook, stirring frequently, until golden brown about 8 minutes. Reduce heat to low and add the water. Cover and cook 8 minutes or until couscous is tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper and sprinkle with pistachios.

Wash green beans. Cut off ends. Cut into 2 inch pieces. Heat oil. Add onion and garlic. Saute until soft. Add bell pepper. Saute until soft. Add linguica sausage. Cook until brown. Add allspice, crushed red pepper flakes. Cook one minute. Add tomato sauce. Add beans. Cook until heated through. Serve over hot rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, combine the brown sugar, butter and eggs. Beat well. Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Add to the butter mixture. Stir until blended. Spread into a greased 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes in preheated oven. Stir the milk and vanilla together. Spread over top of brownies. Sprinkle the chocolate chips on top. Bake for an additional 5 to 10 minutes. Cool. Cut into 2 inch squares.

Mix everything together in a blender until smooth and creamy. I don t have a blender, but I m sure you could make it without one too. If you do it by hand, just make sure that you get the protein powder really mixed in or it will separate out when the yogurt freezes and you won t like that. I like to make this in the morning and eat it for dessert later in the day because the flavor gets a little stronger as it sits in the freezer. I just leave it in the freezer for a couple of hours and it s ready. I also like it frozen in little dixie cups. I find that I eat less that way because the portions are smaller and I don t like frozen yogurt with a big spoon! I just suck it out of the little cup through a straw! I hope you enjoy it!!

In a large bowl combine the cabbage, cranberries, and green onions. Mix the mayonnaise, orange juice concentrate, cilantro, sugar, salt, and black pepper in a small bowlpour over the cabbage mixture and toss gently. Refrigerate for one hour or until ready to serve.

In a small bowl combine all glaze ingredients and mix well. In another bowl combine salt and pepper and add cutlets. Dip cutlets into glaze and place on a preheated grill for about 4 to 5 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Serve cutlets on a platter and spoon glaze over top. Serve with mashed potatoes and green vegetable or salad.

In a 3 quart saucepan, saute celery and onions in butter. Add garlic. Add the tomatoes and water. Add the brown sugar and seasonings. Cook over medium heat 5 minutes. Blend until smooth. Add flour and stir. Cook and stir until thickened. Serve hot.

Cook the orzo as directed on the package. Heat a skillet over high heat until hot. Add shrimp and cook for 1 minute on each side or until the shrimp turn opaque. Transfer shrimp to a serving platter and cover to keep warm. Add the diced tomatoes, feta cheese and oregano to the skillet and cook for 2 minutes or until the feta is melted and the tomatoes are heated through. Pour over the shrimp and serve immediately with lemon wedges and scallions sprinkled over the top.

Saute sausage, onion and green pepper until browned. Add eggs and milk and stir well. Add salt and dry mustard to taste. Spray a deep dish baking dish with non-stick spray. Add half of the bread cubes. Spoon sausage mixture evenly over the bread. Top with the remaining bread. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake, uncovered at 350 deg for about 1 hour. Makes a great brunch item or dinner.

In a small skillet heat the oil and the sesame seeds until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Let cool and then pulse the sesame seeds in a blender until finely ground. In a bowl combine the cabbage, green onions, and noodles with the sesame seeds and toss lightly to combine. In a small bowl whisk together the vinegar and soy sauce and pour over the cabbage mixture. Toss again and serve or chill for at least an hour before serving. Garnish with the sliced almonds.

Dredge the cubes steaks in flour and brown them in hot oil in a large skillet. Mix the bouillon, water, mushroom soup and onion together in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Put the steaks in a baking pan. Pour the liquid mixture over them. Cover tightly with foil. Bake for 1 1/2 hours at 350f. Uncover the steaks and bake for 15 minutes longer, or until the liquid is thickened and steaks are baked through.

In a large saucepan, saute garlic in olive oil until it begins to brown. Add tomatoes and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes or until most of the liquid evaporates. Stir in tomato paste and cook for a minute or two. Add the oregano and cook for one more minute. Season with salt and pepper and add the parsley. Taste and adjust seasonings. Serve over pasta.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut potatoes into 1/4 inch thick slices. Place on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with dried rosemary, thyme, salt and pepper. Bake for about 10 minutes until crispy. Serve with butter and/or sour cream.

Peel and chop potatoes. Put into a pot with water. Bring to boil. Peel shrimp. Add shrimp into the boiling water. Boil for about 4 minutes until shrimp turn pink. Remove from water. Peel fish. Add fish into the boiling water. Boil until fish turns white. Remove from water. Chop fish. Take 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Add parsley. Add shrimp into olive oil. Add fish. Add lemon juice. Add chopped garlic. Add chopped parsley. Add salt and pepper. Mix well. Serve hot.

Combine sugar, 1 cup water in heavy saucepan. Boil without stirring over medium-high heat until syrup reaches hard-crack stage (270 degrees on candy thermometer). Remove from heat. Stir in almonds. Pour onto waxed paper. Sprinkle with cinnamon & salt.

Wash rice until water runs clear through it. Combine the rice and water in a medium size saucepan and bring it to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and cover. Simmer rice until it is tender, about 20 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork. Drizzle with the butter and oil and stir well. Sprinkle with garlic and onion and serve right away.

Dissolve the gelatin in boiling water. Add the pineapple juice. Add blueberries. Place in molds or bowls. Chill until firm. In a medium bowl, beat together the cream cheese, Splenda granular, sour cream and vanilla until smooth. Spread over the set gelatin. Sprinkle with toasted pecans. Chill until ready to serve.

Sprinkle the round steaks with garlic powder. Place the steaks in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove the steaks from the oven, turn them over, and return them to the oven for an additional 15 minutes or until the steaks are done to your liking. Meanwhile in a large skillet cook the corn in the broth for 5 minutes. Add the celery, onion, and salsa. Cook for an additional minute. Add the black beans. Remove the steaks from the oven. Top each steak with equal amounts of the black bean mixture. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with the rice on the side.

Brown the ground beef and drain the fat. In a large pot, combine the ground beef, tomatoes with liquid, macaroni, bouillon cubes, and water. Bring to a boil. Add the rest of the beans (except the green beans). Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes or until macaroni is cooked through. Stir in green beans.

Puree the bananas in a food processor or blender until smooth. Add the peaches, cinnamon, nutmeg and sugar substitute until well mixed. Add the blueberries and stir until combined. Place in freezer container and freeze for at least four hours. Serve with waffles or pancakes or on its own as a snack!
Combine all ingredients in bowl. Pour over shredded coleslaw mix and toss to coat. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve in lettuce cups or on sandwiches.
Melt butter in large skillet. Add beanscook uncovered 8-10 minutes or just until tender, stirring occasionally. Add lemon juice. Stir in mustard. Sprinkle with almonds. Add hazelnuts.

In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar together until smooth and fluffy. Add the egg and mix for 1 minute. Add the flour and milk and mix until incorporated. Add the salt and baking powder and mix for 1 minute. Add the cheese and mix until incorporated. Place the pretzels onto the baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

In a large bowl, combine cabbage and carrot. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredientsmix well and pour over cabbage mixturetoss well to combine. Refrigerate until serving time. This recipe is from Karol Z for the cooks of America.

Sift together flour, cocoa and baking soda. Set aside. Beat shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla extract and beat for another minute or two. Add sifted dry mix and beat until just combined. Add the coffee and the sour cream and mix well. Pour batter into a greased and floured 9" or 10" tube pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about an hour and a half or until the cake tests done in the center when inserted with a toothpick or cake tester. Cool in the pan for about an hour and then remove and cool completely before frosting. Frosting: Mix powdered sugar and butter together in a bowl with a fork until smooth and creamy. Add the vanilla extract and the milk and stir until smooth and spreadable. Spread the frosting over the top and sides of the cake. Sprinkle with chopped toasted almonds if desired.

Saute the garlic in the oil over medium-low heat for 2 minutes. Add the parsley and cook for 30 seconds. Add the shrimp, sprinkle with the lemon juice, season with salt and pepper, cover the pan, reduce the heat to medium-low, and cook for 3 minutes. Serve hot with pasta or rice

Cut broccoli into bite-sized florets. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add broccoli and stir-fry until crisp-tender. Add soy sauce to pan and stir to coat broccoli. Remove from heat. Add garlic and lemon juice and stir to combine. Serve immediately.

Wash and hull the strawberries and set aside. In a medium bowl, mix together the sweetened condensed milk and lemon juice. Add in the whipped topping and mix together. Place in a large bowl and set aside in the fridge to chill for a minimum of 1 hour. In a medium sauce pan, heat the butter and chocolate chips together over medium heat, stirring constantly, until completely melted and smooth. Pour over the chilled strawberry mixture and stir together, blending well. Spoon into serving bowls or glasses and top with whipped topping and a few chocolate sandwich cookies. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray an 8x8x2-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Melt butter and chocolate in a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in sugar. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Stir in flour and chocolate chips. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with moist crumbs attached. Cool completely. Makes 12 servings.

In a large pan with a tight fitting lid add 5 cups of water and bring to a boil. Add the noodles and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Remove noodles with a slotted spoon and drain. Add the olive oil to the water and bring to a simmer. Add the lemon juice and the parmigiano-reggiano and stir until melted. Season to taste with black pepper. Add the noodles and toss well to combine. Garnish with the parsley.

In a large saucepan, combine broth and frozen vegetables and heat through, about 5 minutesdo not boil. Remove from heatstir in vegetable juice and tomato paste. Heat through againdo not boil. Remove from heat. Stir in herbscover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight to blend flavors. Serve with alphabet pasta and garnish with basil leaves. Serves 4 to 6.
Cut onion in half from root to tip. Lay cut side down in foil-lined pan. Top with 2 tbsp butter. Add the honey. Bake at 375 degrees until tender. Serve with crackers.

Cook pasta in boiling water according to package directions. Add bacon. Cool pasta mixture. Stir together pasta mixture and chicken. Add diced tomatoes with their liquid and rosemarytoss lightly. Spoon mixture evenly on 4 plates. Sprinkle with cheese and olives. Garnish with artichokes.

Wash cucumber under cool running water. Pat dry with paper towel. Place cucumber slices in a shallow bowl. In a small bowl combine vinegar and oil. Whisk to mix. Season with salt & black pepper to taste. Pour vinegar mixture over cucumbers. Sprinkle with mint. Let stand for 30 minutes before serving.

Wash and rinse spinach well. Wrap in paper towel and microwave for 3 minutes at high setting. Set aside. In pan, saute the onion with butter until onions are transparent. Add pepper and stir. Add spinach and stir until cooked. Pour in the coconut milk and cook for about 5 minutes. Pour in peanuts and cook for an additional minute. Remove from heat and serve hot
Boil red potatoes until tender. Drain and place in large bowl. Add sour cream and mayonnaise. Stir in vinegar and dill. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or chilled.

Prepare lobsters. Preheat oven to 350f. Cut each lobster in half lengthwise through the tail. Remove all the meat from the tail and reserve for later. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Drop the lobster halves into the boiling water for two minutes. Remove the lobster halves and shock them in a bowl of ice water for two minutes. Drain the lobster halves and set aside. Melt butter in a saucepan. Add breadcrumbs and stir over low heat until breadcrumbs are golden. Remove from the heat and stir in the lobster tail meat. Place the lobster halves in a shallow dish. Pour the lobster filling into each half. Sprinkle each half with 2 tablespoons tarragon salt and pepper. Drizzle 2 tablespoons vegetable oil over each lobster half. Bake for 20 minutes or until the lobster is cooked through. Serve with drawn butter.

Cut the flank steak into 1-inch slices. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, brown sugar, green onions, and sesame seeds. In a small bowl, whisk together the sesame oil, olive oil, minced garlic, pepper, and ground ginger. Place the flank steak slices in a resealable plastic bag and pour in 2/3 of the marinade. Seal and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Remove and discard the marinade. Place the steak slices in a large bowl and pour in the remaining marinade. Toss to coat. Grill 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Serve on a bed of baby spinach and top with shredded carrots. Garnish with sesame seeds and a sprig of green onion.

Bring water and butter to boil in a saucepan over high heat. Add green beans and simmer for 5-6 minutes until tender. Add celery, garlic and rosemary. Simmer for 1 minute. Add basil and parsley. Serve.

Cook white rice as directed on package. When rice is done cooking set aside. In a small skillet cook onion until translucent. Add garlic and cook an additional 10 seconds. Combine cooked rice, onion/garlic mixture, ro-tel tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, salt, pepper to taste, water and cooking oil. Stir until well blended. Serve hot. Serves 8.

Brown hot dogs in butter. When cooked through, remove and place on bottom of 9x13 inch pan. Top with 2 cups of frozen corn and half the salsa. Repeat with another layer of franks and the remaining corn. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours. Uncover and bake an additional 10 minutes. Serve with tortillas and the remaining salsa.

Line an 8 x 8 inch pan or a cookie sheet with wax paper. Melt chocolate over double boiler. Add corn flakes, nuts and stir until well combined. Spread on prepared pan and refrigerate. Cut into small squares.

In a small bowl, whisk together the mustard, vinegar and oil. Place the vegetables on the skewers. Brush with the dressing and sprinkle with the herbs. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to blend. Grill for 8 to 10 minutes, turning once, until the vegetables are tender. Tastes great with grilled chicken breasts.

In large skillet or pot brown ground beef. Drain fat. Add green pepper and onion and cook until tender. Add celery and garlic powder and Italian seasoning. Cook until tender. Add small shell pasta and pasta sauce. Cook until heated through. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top and cover. Cook until melted.

Place chocolate and butter in microwave safe bowl. Microwave on high for 1 minute. Stir well. Microwave another minute. Stir again. Add sugar and milk. Whisk until smooth. Add vanilla and whip with mixer until light and fluffy. Refrigerate and serve cold.

Cut the scallions into 3-inch pieces. Cut the ginger root into thin slices or small pieces. Heat the oil in a small saucepan over medium heat until it is very hot but not smoking. Add the ginger and scallions and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add a pinch of salt and remove from heat. Cool before using.

Cut bread into 6 equal slices. Prepare dressing as directed on bottle. Spread 2 tablespoons dressing over each bread slice. Top with feta cheese. Next lay on half the roasted red peppers and the lettuce. Top with 1 tablespoon of the diced deli chicken and 2 tablespoons of the grape tomatoes. Top with remaining roasted red peppers and lettuce. Fold sandwich together. Cut into 4 equal pieces. Serve with remaining salad dressing on the side. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In large bowl beat together shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat until creamy. Stir together flour, salt and baking powder. Gradually add to mixture beating until mixed thoroughly. Divide dough into 3 or 4 portions. On lightly floured surface roll each portion into a 10-inch rope. Flatten each rope to a 1/2-inch thickness. Cut into 3/4-inch lengths with a sharp knife dipped in flour. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown around edges. Cool on baking sheet 2 minutesremove to wire racks to cool completely. Frost with frosting. Store in refrigerator or freezer.

In a 9-inch pie plate, combine eggs and milk, and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add butter and flour and stir until smooth. Add baking powder and mix well. Spoon into prepared pie plate. Arrange cheese slices and green chilies and peppers on top of batter. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool slightly before cutting into wedges and serving.

In medium saucepan, melt 1 tablespoon butter. Stir in rice and cook over medium heat for 1 minute or until lightly toasted. Stir in consomme, water, and 1/3 cup green onions. Cover and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heatstir in remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Combine mushrooms and remaining 1/3 cup green onions in small bowlset aside. Serve rice topped with mushroom mixturesprinkle with oregano.

Cook the asparagus in boiling salted water until tender-crisp, about 2 minutes. Drain well in a colander set over a bowl and let cool for a few minutes. Mix the mustard and rosemary in a small bowl. In a large bowl, whisk the lemon zest into the oil until it is bright yellow. Add the asparagus and the mustard mixture and toss to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Let stand for up to an hour at room temperature or for up to 3 hours in the refrigerator before serving. Serve at room temperature or cold.
Place all ingredients in slow cooker and cook on high for 8 hours or low for 6 hours.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add garlic, yellow onions, tomatoes and green chilies. Saute until the garlic is golden brown. Add kale. Stir and cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the mixture to a casserole dish. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve warm.

Cook penne according to package directions. Drain and place in a large bowl. In a small saucepan, combine soup, cottage cheese, and milk. Cook over medium heat until warmed through. Combine with penne. In a small bowl, combine sour cream, cottage cheese, milk, garlic powder. Add to penne mixture. Stir in spinach. Top with cheese. Broil 4 inches from heat until melted. Serve with breaded chicken patties.

Cut the dill pickle into small pieces. Add the pickle to a blender and add the onion. Add the cayenne, garlic cloves and vinegar. Blend until smooth. Add the canning salt and water. Pour the mixture into the canning jars and let set for 24 hours. Then refrigerate for one week before serving. Makes 1-2 quarts.

Mix heavy cream, garlic and crushed red pepper flakes in small saucepan. Bring to a boil on medium-high heat. Stir in vodka and reduce heat to low. Simmer until mixture is thickened slightly, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, cook penne in boiling water until al dente. Drain pasta and return to pan. Add diced tomatoes, parmesan cheese and vodka sauce. Toss well. Serve with parmesan cheese on top.

Heat the olive oil in a medium saute pan. Add the sausage and cook until brown. Add the garlic, then crushed tomatoes. Simmer until the tomatoes are thickened. Add the wine. Simmer for 1-2 minutes. Add the cream, sage and sun dried tomatoes. Cook for another 1-2 minutes. Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling water until al dente. Drain the pasta and add to the sausage sauce. Toss to combine. Sprinkle with the spring onions. Serve immediately.

Combine ground beef and egg with a fork. Add dry breadcrumbs and 1/3 of the honey. Blend well. Press 3/4 of mixture onto the bottom of a greased 9x5x3 loaf pan. Combine remaining honey and remaining ingredients. Pour over meat mixture. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Uncover. Bake 30 minutes longer. Cool. Serve.

Mix all the other ingredients until blended. Pour into a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Cool 10 minutes before slicing. Drizzle with the glaze. In a small saucepan, combine the apple jelly, mustard, onion and thyme. Cook over low heat until the mixture thickens slightly. Stir in the sour cream. Serve with the meatloaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet over medium heat cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels and reserve 1/4 cup bacon fat. Saute onion in bacon fat until tender. Set aside. Whisk together eggs and cream. Fold in onion and bacon. Combine spinach and cheese in a large bowl. Add egg mixture and stir to combine. Pour into pie plate. Bake for 30 minutes or until set.

Slice strawberries and place in a bowl. Add gelatin to 1/4 cup cold water. Microwave 30 seconds to dissolve. Let cool 5 minutes. In a large bowl, combine cream cheese and sugar. Beat until blended. Add egg whites. Beat until stiff. Add gelatin mixturestir to blend. Fold in strawberries. Spoon into a 3-cup mold. Chill 4 hours or until firm. Run a knife around the edge of the mold to loosen mousse. Unmold onto a serving plate. Garnish with mint leaves.

Prepare gelatin according to package directions. Cool completely. Fold in ice cream. Fold in orange juice. Divide among 4 parfait glasses. Refrigerate 1 hour or until firm. Arrange mandarin orange slices over gelatin. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve.

Hard boil the eggs for 10 minutes. Peel and cut in half. Mash the curry powder in a small bowl with the mayonnaise. Blend in the milk. Spread curry mixture on the cut side of each egg half. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and chopped parsley. Makes 4 servings.

Cook the pasta as per the instructions on the packaging. Heat the oil in a pan then add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute. Add the lemon juice to the pan then stir in the parsley. Add the pasta to the pan then toss well to combine everything together. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese to serve.

In a bowl combine the first 6 ingredients. Beat the egg and milk together in a separate bowl. Dip the chicken in the egg mixture then into the flour mixture. Place on a wire rack on a baking sheet and let rest 15 minutes. Pour vegetable oil in a deep pan until it reaches 350 degrees F. Fry in small batches for 10 minutes until chicken is golden and crispy and cooked through. Drain and pat dry with paper towels.
In a blender container combine all ingredients. Blend on low speed for 30 seconds then on high for 15 seconds. Chill until ready to serve. Makes about 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat butter and sugars on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add vanilla, orange zest, baking powder and saltbeat until combined. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.With mixer on low speed, add flour 1/2 cup at a time and mix just until combined.Mix in the sesame seeds by hand.Using a medium cookie scoop (or 2 tablespoons), scoop dough onto prepared sheetsflatten to about 1/2-inch thick and place about 2 inches apart.Bake cookies until they are set on top and golden brown around the edges, about 20 minutes. Transfer to wire rack to cool completely.Once completely cooled, cut cookies diagonally into triangles.Return cookies to baking sheets, cut side up, place in oven and bake for another 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook chicken until no longer pink. Combine enchilada sauce, sour cream, beans, cilantro, chilies and taco seasoningset aside. In a large bowl combine chicken and 1/2 cup cheese. Spread about 1/4 cup enchilada sauce in a 13-inch by 9-inch baking dish. Spoon in 1/3 of the chicken mixture. Spoon 1/3 of the beans mixture over the chicken. Top with tortillas. Spoon 1/3 of the enchilada sauce over tortillas. Sprinkle with 1/3 of the cheese. Continue layering, ending with cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Wash potato. Pierce skin with fork. Tuck bay leaf underneath skin. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Rub with butter. Wrap in foil. Bake 1 hour or until potato is tender. Unwrap potato. Discard bay leaf. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400f. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chickencook 2-3 minutes or until browned. Remove from skillet. Add remaining oilswirl to coat pan. Add bell pepper, snap peas, water chestnuts, and 2 tablespoons sweet and sour sauce. Cook 1 minute or until bell pepper is crisp-tenderstir in remaining sweet and sour sauce. Place chicken on top of vegetables. Bake 5 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve over rice.

Boil the water with the dandelion flowers until you have 2 cups of juice. Strain the juice through cheese cloth. Add the lemon juice and the vanilla bean. Stir well. Add the sugar to the pot and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Once the mixture comes to a boil, boil on medium heat until you get the jelly consistency. Pour the jelly into containers of your choice and store in the fridge. The jelly will keep in the fridge for about 3 months. Serve cold with ice cream.

In a shallow bowl combine eggs and milk. Beat well. In a separate shallow bowl combine bread crumbs, cheese and spices. Place bread in a 9x13 baking dish. Top with egg mixture. Sprinkle with bread crumb mixture. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Saute onion in a pan until soft. Add the diced tomatoes with juice and bring to a boil. Add the brown sugar and spices. Simmer about 2 minutes. Serve hot or cold on a plate or bread cube. Garnish with parsley or chives if desired. Makes 2 servings.

Dredge steaks in flour mixed with salt & pepper. Fry in hot oil in a large skillet until brown on both sides. Remove from pan & set aside. Saute celery & onion until tender. Stir in diced tomato & season to taste with salt & pepper. Return steak to pan & add water & cover. Simmer 1 hour or until tender & serve over noodles or rice.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the green onion in the oil for 1 minute. Add the salmon, green chilies, peas, and corncook, stirring occasionally until thoroughly heated. Remove from the heat. In a bowl whisk together the eggs, milk, and biscuit mix. Pour into the skillet. Bake until top is golden brown. Serve with sour cream.

Brown the sausage patties in a large skillet. When the sausage is cooked through, remove it from the pan with a slotted spoon. Pour off the fat. Add the butter to the pan. Cook over medium heat until the butter melts. Add the flour. Cook for 1 minute while stirring constantly. Slowly add the milk. Stir constantly until the gravy thickens. Return the sausage to the pan. Add the milk. Stir until the gravy thickens. Add the milk. Stir until the gravy thickens. Serve over biscuits.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line baking sheet with parchment paper or silpat baking sheet. In a large bowl, combine butter and superfine sugar with an electric mixer. Beat together until light and fluffy. Beat in zest and salt. Add flour 1/2 cup at a time and beat to combine after each addition. Add coarse sugar and combine. Using a tablespoon measure or cookie scoop, place dough 2 inches apart on baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes and rotate the pan. Bake 10 minutes and rotate pan again. Bake another 5 minutes and remove from oven. Cool 10 minutes and remove from sheet with a metal spatula or parchment paper. Store in airtight container.
Mix together all the ingredients. Spread onto the bread, top with the bacon and enjoy.

Prepare instant pudding according to package directions using 1/2 cup low-fat milk in large bowlstir in remaining milk, condensed milk and lemon juice until blended. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Spread 1/3 of the pudding in 8-cup (2-quart) glass baking dish. Top with 1/3 of the bananasspread 1/3 of the remaining pudding on top of the bananas. Repeat procedure with remaining bananas and puddingspread top with remaining pudding. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate for 2 hours or until set. Garnish with cool whip and vanilla wafers. Yield: 8 servings.

Prepare raspberry jell-o according to package directions and set aside to cool slightly. Fold in frozen raspberries. Combine jello mixture with canned whole berry cranberry sauce and crushed pineapple in juice. Chill in refrigerator until set and serve.

In a medium mixing bowl, beat Bisquick, milk, egg and mustard until smooth. Pour into a greased mini-muffin pan, filling each well to the top. Bake at 400 degrees for about 8-10 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool. Prepare sandwiches by spreading a thin layer of mustard on each bottom of sandwich. Place a piece of turkey on one slice of bread and a piece of ham on the other slice. Place one slice of bread on top of the other slice of bread. Carefully remove one of the mini-muffins from the pan and place it on top of the sandwich. Press down gently to adhere. Repeat until all sandwiches are assembled. Remove and serve. Makes 24 mini-sandwiches.
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Chill. Combine lemonade and gelatin and pour into a mold. Top with frozen whipped topping. Freeze.

Peel lemons. Using a citrus zester or paring knife, remove zest in long strips. Cut zest into thin slices and set aside. In a medium saucepan, combine zest, 3 cups water and 1/4 cup sugar. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer until mixture is reduced to about 1 cup, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool completely. Add lemon juice and stir well. Strain mixture through a sieve or colander over a pitcher. Discard zest. Stir in 2 cups cold water. Serve over ice cubes.

Boil the tomatoes in a pan with little water for 15 minutes. Drain the water and discard it. Grind the tomatoes in a blender. Add all the powders and seeds. Fry in oil till the color changes. Add water as needed. Cool and grind it in a mixie. Serve with rice.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sausage and cook until browned and crumbled. Add the onions and green peppers. Cook, stirring occasionally until the vegetables are tender. Add the beer. Cover and simmer until liquid has reduced by half. Serve on hot dogs or on a bun. Makes about 4 servings.

Combine water and sugar in a medium saucepan over medium high heat until the mixture boils. Continue to boil for 15 minutes until the mixture has turned a deep amber color. Turn off the heat and slowly whisk in the cream of tartar and the butter until melted. Continue whisking until the mixture is smooth. Continue to whisk as the mixture cools to room temperature. Refrigerate in an air tight container up to 1 week. Serve over ice cream or use as a dip for fruit or cookies.

In a large pot melt margarine and saute onion over medium heat until soft. Add rice and cook until it is brown. Add remaining ingredients except for the chicken and bring to a boil. Reduce to simmer and cook for 30 minutes. Add the chicken. Remove from heat and stir. Cover and let set for a few minutes. Serve and enjoy.

Lightly grease an 18x12cm baking tin. In a bowl mix together the flour and oats. Put the butter and sugar into a large bowl and beat until light and creamy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the vanilla essence. Stir the flour mixture and rolled oats into the creamed mixture. Spread the mixture evenly into the prepared tin. Sprinkle the jam evenly over the top and bake in a preheated oven at 180c/350f for 35-45 minutes until the top is golden and the mixture is set. Leave to cool for a few minutes before cutting into squares.

In a saucepan over low heat, combine light butter and flour until smooth. Stir in salt and pepper and cook 3-4 minutes or until thick and bubbly. Add milk slowly and stir until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in cheddar cheese until melted. Add sherry wine and nutmeg and stir to combine. Place 2 tilapia fillets in a shallow baking dish and spoon about 1/3 cup cheese sauce over each fillet. Sprinkle with paprika and top with 1 canned crabmeat drained and flaked. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork and sauce is bubbly. Serve with rice and salad.

Slice avocado in half, remove pit. Scrape avocado into a bowl. Mash avocado using the back of a fork. Add mushrooms, cilantro, vinaigrette, and lime juice. Stir to combine. Serve in hollowed out halves of avocado.

Brew the tea and let it cool. In a blender or food processor combine the tea, yogurt, oat bran, flax seeds, and cranberry juice. Add the honey. Blend until smooth. Add the berries and pulse the blender until smooth. Add a little more juice if needed. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cut pumpkin into 2-inch pieces. Toss pumpkin pieces, olive oil and 1/2 teaspoon salt and pepper in baking dish. Cover with foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions. Cut bacon into small pieces and cook in skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain excess fat and cool. Toss cooked pasta and pumpkin in large bowl. Add bacon, pesto and 1 cup Parmesan. Toss well. Garnish with remaining Parmesan.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In 12 inch skillet, melt 1 tbsp. butter over medium heat. Add chicken and season with salt and pepper. Cook until no longer pink in the center. Transfer to plate. In the skillet, stir together remaining 3 tbsp. butter and stuffing mix. Cook and stir until browned. Add condensed soup, wine, chicken broth and peas. Bring to boil. Return chicken to skillet. Cover. Bake for 35 minutes. Uncoversprinkle with cheese. Continue to bake until cheese is melted. Serves 6.

Mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Stir in melted butter. Add milk and beat to form a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide into 16 equal portions. Roll each portion into a 4 inch rope. Place on a greased baking sheet. Brush with egg and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes. Yield 16 breadsticks.

Put the first five ingredients in a heavy saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir until the mixture comes to a rolling boil. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in pecans. Quickly pour into a buttered baking dish (8 x 8 x 2 inches) or a sheet of wax paper. Let set for 1 hour. Cut into squares.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter with the olive oil and cook the onions until soft and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the broccoli and pine nuts, stirring to combine and cook until the broccoli is crisp-tender and lightly browned in spots, about 5 minutes more. Add the wine and cook until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 2 minutes more. Add the lemon juice, season with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Spray a 13x9 pan with cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine the garlic salt, onion flakes, barbecue sauce and beer. In a 13x9 pan combine the chicken and the barbecue beer mix. Cover with foil. Bake 1 hour. Uncover and bake another 30 minutes.

Preheat waffle iron. Combine dry ingredients in large bowl. Combine sour cream and milk in separate bowl. Beat together eggs and sugar in third bowl. Add dry and wet to egg mixture and whisk well. Add butter and banana and whisk again. Cook and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 13x9-inch baking pan with foil, extending foil over sides. Grease foil. In a large bowl, combine raisins, almonds, 1/2 cup granulated sugar and lemon peel. In another bowl, mix together butter, remaining 1/2 cup granulated sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice and salt. In a separate bowl, beat egg until frothy. Stir in egg mixture. Pour into baking pan. Sprinkle raisin mixture over top. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. With 2 spoons, pull biscuit pieces apart into bite-sized pieces. Return to pan. Bake 15 minutes. Spread biscuit pieces evenly over top. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool 10 minutes. Lift from pan using foil overhang. Cool completely. Store in an air-tight container. Makes 18 servings.

Prepare a large skillet by brushing it with a little oil. Slice the steak into pieces about 1 inch thick. Peel the onion and cut it into wedges. Peel the garlic and mince it. Combine all the ingredients in the skillet. Toss well and cook over medium heat until the vegetables are soft and the beef is tender. Serve over the noodles.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. In a medium bowl stir together the powdered sugar, cocoa powder, vanilla extract and salt until smooth. In a mixer bowl combine the butter and sugar until creamy. Add the egg and mix until just combined. Blend in the dry mixture. Stir together the flour and baking sodaadd to the butter mixture. Mix until just combined. Stir in the pine nuts and chocolate chunks. Drop the dough by rounded teaspoons onto the prepared baking sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake for 9-10 minutes, or until the tops are firm to the touch but the centers are still soft. Cool for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Mix together the first five ingredients. Add egg and mix well. Add milk and mix again. Add oil and lemon juice and mix. Pour into a greased 9 inch square baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes. Sprinkle with poppy seeds and cool for at least an hour before cutting.

In a large bowl combine butter with the flour and sugar. Add the egg yolks and vanilla essence. Roll the mixture into 1 inch balls. Place the balls on baking trays. Bake for 15 minutes. Leave the cookies on the trays to cool for 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Decorate the cookies with a red icing. Melt the chocolate in the microwave for 20 seconds. Use the melted chocolate to decorate the cookies.

Cook the pasta sauce in a saucepan over low heat, and simmer uncovered for 10 minutes. Cook the rice in a large pot of boiling water until it is tender and all the water is absorbed. Cook the capsicum and the onion in a large frying pan over low heat until soft. Remove the capsicum and the onion from the frying pan and place in a small bowl. Fry the bacon in the same frying pan for a couple of minutes until crisp and golden brown. Remove the bacon from the frying pan and place it in a small bowl. Remove the bacon and onion from the frying pan and place them in a small bowl. Sprinkle the capsicum and the onion over the top of the mixture and then sprinkle the cheese over the top of the mixture and then sprinkle the cheese over the top of the mixture. Bake the casserole in the oven for 20 minutes until the cheese has melted and browned slightly on the top. Serve the casserole immediately. Serve the casserole immediately.

Drain tuna. Add onion. Cool to room temperature. Mix in spinach. Add breadcrumbs. Add cheese. Beat eggs. Add to mixture. Heat oil in skillet. Drop mixture by the teaspoon. Fry until brown. Serve with lemon wedges.
Mix all ingredients together (except breadcrumbs), shaping mixture into a loaf and place in oiled 8x4 loaf pan. Top mixture with breadcrumbs and bake at 350f for 40 to 50 minutes.

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned and no pink remains. Add garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Add lemon juice and vinegar, cook 1 minute more. Remove from heat and add salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with oregano and serve over pasta or rice.

Combine all ingredients except shrimp and skewers. Put shrimp and skewers into marinade and refrigerate 2 hours. Remove shrimp and skewers from marinade. Discard marinade. Grill shrimp until cooked through and firm to the touch. Serve with the reserved marinade.

Combine sugar, vinegar and molasses. Set aside. Peel onions and slice in half lengthwise. Lay face down in a baking dish. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook until onions are tender. Lay the bacon strips over the onions. Spoon the syrup over the top. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Cover potatoes with water and boil until tender. Drain and mash with milk, butter, and salt. In a large skillet saute onion in olive oil until soft. Add tomatoes and simmer until thick. Cook meat in water and stock until browned. Drain off fat. Mix potatoes, tomatoes and meat together. Season to taste and place in a casserole. Mix bread crumbs with butter and parsley and sprinkle on top. Bake for 1 hour in a 350f oven.

Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Add the chicken pieces skin side down, and cook for 8 minutes until the skin is golden. Turn the chicken over, add the leeks to the pan, along with the lemon zest. Stir in the rice and cook for 1 minute. Pour in the stock, bring to the boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cover the pan with a lid or foil, and cook for 15 minutes. Once the rice is cooked, remove from the heat. Stir in the lemon juice, along with the parsley. Add the frozen peas to the pan and stir through. Season to taste. Divide the risotto between four serving dishes. Top each portion with a few tablespoons of parmesan cheese and a little mint. Serve immediately.

Mix together the tomatoes, salt and pepper in a shallow bowl or pan. Heat butter in skillet. Add onions and cook until softened, 2-3 minutes. Add flour and cook for 1 minute longer. Add milk and cook, stirring constantly, until smooth and bubbly. Add tomatoes, parsley, thyme, and cook 1-2 minutes more or until thickened. Remove from heat. Spread evenly into an 8x8x2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until bubbly.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. In a large bowl combine the cooked chicken with the mushrooms and mushroom soup. Spread in the baking dish. Sprinkle with pepper. In a small bowl combine the Bisquick and milk to make the topping. Spread over the chicken mixture. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until browned.

Remove the stems from the mushrooms and wash them. Saute the garlic with the oil until golden brown. Add the mushrooms, season with salt, pepper and basil. Fill the mushrooms with the mixture and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes until the cheese melts. Serve as an appetizer or with spaghetti or other pasta dish.

Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat well. In another bowl combine flour, baking soda and cream of tartar. Gradually add dry mixture to butter mixture. Chill 1 hour. Divide dough into 6 pieces. Roll each into a 10 inch rope. Pinch into 1 inch pieces and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet then remove to wire rack to cool completely. Decorate with frosting.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Slice squash in half lengthwise. Remove seeds. Slice each half into six rings. Toss rings with soy sauce, honey and garlic. Place in a single layer in a baking pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until tender.

Melt butter and sugar in a pan. Add vanilla. Beat 3 eggs in a bowl. Add flour, cocoa, baking powder, salt. Beat well. Mix with butter mixture. Add peppermint patties. Pour batter into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes. Cool.

Place the beans in a 9x13-inch baking dish. In a medium bowl combine the ground beef with the bbq sauce and the baking mix. In a medium saucepan combine the milk and butter and bring to a boil. Stir in the baking mix and baking mix and continue stirring until thickened. Stir in the beef mixture and pour over the beans. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese. Bake at 375 for 30-40 minutes until bubbly. Serve with extra barbecue sauce for dipping.
Cook macaroni in salted water according to package directions. Drain. Combine macaroni with butter. Mix in cheese. Add milk to desired consistency. Season with black pepper.
Combine the coffee and the chocolate syrup. Add the ice and the milk and blend. Add the sugar to your taste.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion. Cook until softened. Add beans, corn, rice and tomatoes. Cook for about 2-3 minutes, then add tomato sauce. Remove from heat. Season with garlic, salt and pepper. Let cool. To make the wraps, place about 1/4 cup of the bean mixture onto each tortilla. Roll up the sides and roll tightly. Serve immediately. Makes 12 wraps.

Heat oven to 375f. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook and stir until browned and no longer pink in center. Drain and set aside. Heat remaining tablespoon of oil in a dutch oven over medium heat. Add onions and cook and stir until softened, about 5 minutes. Add chicken and cook and stir until warmed through. Add tomatoes, green chilies and ro-tel. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in beans and corn. Stir in taco seasoning mix and ranch mix. Bring to a boil. Pour into a 2 quart casserole dish. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered 30 minutes. Serve with sour cream and tortillas.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine chicken, 1/2 tsp. salt and 1/4 tsp. pepper in a large bowl. Add watertoss to coat. Coverrefrigerate overnight. Drain chickenpat dry. Combine raisins, brown sugar and 1/2 tsp. salt in a small bowl. Heat chili sauce, ketchup and sherry in a 1-quart saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until sauce is slightly thickened and reduced by half. Remove from heat. Add cherries and remaining 1/4 tsp. salt and 1/4 tsp. peppertoss to coat. Discard any remaining sauce. Arrange chicken in a single layer on a large shallow roasting pan coated with cooking spray. Spoon about 3/4 cup sauce over each breast. Bake at 350 for 50 minutes or until done. Drizzle with remaining sauce. Sprinkle with cherries and raisins. Yield 4 servings.name

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a small bowl, combine the butter, green chiles, and cheese together. Place 1 buttermilk biscuit in the center of a baking sheetspread with about 2 tablespoons of the cheese mixture. Top with another biscuitcontinue until all biscuits are used. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Allow to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 x 12 pan. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the cocoa and 4 tbsp oil and mix until smooth. Remove from heat and set aside to cool to room temperature. In a large bowl, combine the eggs and the remaining 2 tbsp. of oil and beat well. Add the cocoa mixture and mix well. Add the Splenda and the vanilla extract and mix well. In another bowl, combine the flour, salt and baking powder. Stir the dry mixture into the cocoa mixture until just mixed. Stir in the nuts. Pour into the greased pan and bake for about 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool and cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Season pork chops with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour. Sear pork chops on both sides until browned. Remove pork chops from skillet and set aside. Reduce heat to medium and add mustard and onion to the skilletstir until onion is translucent. Stir in chicken stock, then add pork chops back to skilletcover and cook in the oven for 1 hour 15 minutes, or until a meat thermometer reads 150 degrees F (65 degrees C). Remove from oven, sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Clean and cut collard greens into 1 inch wide strips. Add to pot of boiling water with turkey legs and cook for 1 hour or until tender. Strain and discard turkey bones. Blend sugar and salt with water to make a thin paste. Add to collard greens and stir. Heat through but do not boil. Serve with cornbread or biscuits.

Saute the onion in the oil until tender. Combine the soup, milk and worcestershire sauce. Stir into the onions and heat to boiling. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Stir in the pork and the potato and heat through. Serve over cooked noodles or rice. Serve with frozen peas.
Combine pork and all the seasonings. Add water, and mix well. Drain potatoes and combine with pork. Place in pie crusts and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

In a large mixing bowl cream together the butter and the sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and beat well. Mix together the dry ingredients and add to the creamed mixture. Add the rice krispies and the lemon rind. Mix until well blended. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350f for 10 to 12 minutes. Do not over bake. Let cool completely before removing from baking sheet. Store tightly wrapped. Makes 48 cookies.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly grease baking sheet. Arrange tortillas in 1 layer on prepared baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes or until lightly browned and crisp. Spread beans on tortilla rounds. Top with peppers and onion mixture. Top with taco sauce. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper flakes and four-cheese mexican blend cheese. Bake 2-3 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Combine lemon juice, olive oil, thyme, garlic clove, onion, and salt and pepper to taste. Spread the mixture on both sides of the fish. Place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees fahrenheit for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve with brown or white rice.

Preheat oven to 350. Combine cake mix with eggs. Pour half of this mixture into a greased 9"x13" baking dish. Top with cherry filling. Pour remaining batter over the cherries and bake for 50 minutes. Let cool on counter for 10 minutes. Carefully flip cake over onto serving plate. Top with whipped topping and more cherry filling if you like.

Cut bacon into pieces and fry in a large skillet until crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels. Brown the ribs in the drippings. Add cabbage and onion and brown for several minutes. Add carrots and apples. Add cider and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in bacon and caraway seed. Cook an additional 2 minutes. Serve with rice or dumplings. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat grill to high. Coat trout with oil and season to taste with salt and pepper. Cook 4 minutes per side, or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Drain off excess oil. Place trout on plates and spoon cashew-garlic mixture on top of each fillet. Garnish with parsley and lemon wedges. Serve with hot cooked rice.

Combine rice with 1-1/2 cups water in medium saucepanbring to a boilcoverreduce heatsimmer 10 minutesremove from heatlet stand 5 minutes. Meanwhile combine onion and vegetable oil in medium nonstick skillet over medium heatcook 15 minutes or until onion is golden brownstir in tomatoescook 5 minutes or until liquid evaporatesstir in cucumbercook 2 minutes moreseason with salt. Fluff rice with forkspoon tomato mixture over ricesprinkle with cilantrogarnish with lemon wedgesserve immediately with lemon wedges.
Mix all together in a bowl and chill for several hours before serving. Add more mayo if you like it creamier.

Preheat waffle iron according to manufacturers instructions. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. In a medium bowl, combine the eggs, milk, cooking oil and vanilla. Stir into dry ingedients just until moistened. Add the chocolate chips. Stir just until blended. Spread 1/4 cup of the batter into each section of the waffle iron. Bake according to manufacturers instructions or until waffles are golden brown. Serve immediately.

Combine sugar, flour, salt, lemon zest in bowl of electric mixeradd butterbeat until crumbly. Stir in milk. Place in a greased 8-inch square pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove from ovenstir in lemon juice and egg yolksbake 20 minutes longer or until a wooden pick inserted near center comes out clean. Meanwhile, beat egg whites in a large bowl until stiff peaks formfold in confectioner's sugarspread over lemon mixturebake 5 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack. Makes 12 servings.

Heat oil over medium heat in large soup pot. Saute onion and carrot for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir chickpeas into onion mixture. Heat over medium heat for 1 minute or until chickpeas are coated. Add stock, bay leaf, salt, pepper, and lemon juice. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cover, reduce heat to low, and cook for 1 hour or until chickpeas are tender. Serve with warm crusty bread.

Melt butter in pan. Add shrimp and saute for 3-4 minutes. Add red peppers and saute until tender. Stir in shallots. Pour in cream and whisk in white pepper and paprika. Pour over cooked pasta. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8x8 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder and cinnamonset aside. In another bowl, cream the butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs and vanilla extract until combined. Add the flour mixture and stir until just combined. Pour the batter into the prepared panspread into an even layer. Sprinkle the raisins over the top. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until the top springs back when lightly touched. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 15 minutes before cutting into squares and serving.

Sauté the onion and kielbasa until the kielbasa is browned and the onion is translucent. Add the apple and cook 5 minutes longer. Add the sauerkraut and broth to the kielbasa mixture and cover the pan with lid or foil. Simmer for 20 to 30 minutes. Stir in caraway seed before serving.
Place spanish rice mix, water, chicken and beans in a large pan. Add tomatoes, green bell pepper, chili powder and cumin. Simmer for 20 minutes. Serve.

Wrap corn in a large piece of heavy duty aluminum foil and place in a large baking dish. Pour in enough water so the corn is covered by at least 1 inch and sprinkle the ice cubes over top. Cook 20-30 minutes until corn is tender. Remove from water and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12 cup muffin pan, or line with paper baking cups. Mash the bananas in a small bowl. In a large bowl, cream together the sugar, applesauce, bananas, and butter until smooth. Beat in the egg until combined. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt. Stir the banana mixture into the dry ingredients just until moistened. Fold in the chocolate chips. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups. Bake for 18 to 22 minutes in the preheated oven, until the edges are firm to the touch. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan to cool completely on a wire rack. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the pizza crust onto a baking sheet. Sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese. Top with the mushrooms, artichoke hearts, and black olives. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Spread salad dressing over the top of the crust. Sprinkle with the garlic. Bake for an additional 5 minutes in the preheated oven.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. In a small bowl, combine the sugar and salt. Drizzle the sprouts with the olive oil. Stir to coat. Toss to combine. Transfer to a baking pan. Roast the sprouts for 20 minutes. Stir halfway through the cooking time. Remove the sprouts from the oven and sprinkle with the bacon. Stir to combine. Serve garnished with the green onions. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Grease a baking sheet. In a large bowl combine the applesauce, dried mixed fruit, rolled oats, flour, desiccated coconut, sunflower seeds, sesame seeds, pumpkin seeds and sugar. Beat the eggs, combine them into the dry ingredients and mix well. Spread the mixture on the baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes. Remove from the oven and cut the bars into squares. Allow to cool before storing in airtight containers.

Preheat oven to 375f. Fill pastry shell with berries, sprinkling with 1/3 cup sugar and 1 tablespoon cornstarch. Combine remaining 2 tablespoons cornstarch and 1/4 cup water in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring until mixture thickens. Stir in 1/4 cup butter, lemon juice and 1/3 cup cream cheese until smooth. Spread over berries. Bake 30-40 minutes or until pastry is browned and filling is set. Cool slightly. Serve warm or cold topped with whipped cream.

In a crock pot combine the beef stew meat with the chili sauce and water. Add the onion soup mix, brown sugar, mustard, vinegar, and celery. Cook on low for 4-5 hours. Serve with steamed rice and your favorite vegetables. Serves 4-6.

Toast cornmeal in a dry skillet over medium high heat until it starts to turn light brown. Stir often and do not walk away from it. It will burn quickly. This is important. It will take about 10-15 minutes. Transfer to a blender and add vegetable broth and water. Blend until smooth. Add kosher salt and stir to combine. Spread into an oiled shallow baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees until golden brown and firm. This takes about 45-60 minutes. Remove from oven and garnish with scallion and fresh tomato sauce.

Combine apple juice, light raisins, salt and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boilcook 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Cut pork chops into 1 1/2 inch chunks. Add pork to the saucepan with raisins and applesstir to combine. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Simmer 15 minutes. Place 2 tablespoons cooked rice in each of 4 serving bowls. Add chops and sauce to rice. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. Garnish with apple. Makes 4 servings.

Slice off the top of a medium pumpkin. Using a spoon, scrape out all of the seeds & stringy fibers inside the pumpkin. Chop all of this up into smaller pieces & add to a soup pot with 6 cups of vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat & simmer for 30 minutes or until the pumpkin is softened. Once softened, puree soup into a smooth texture using an immersion blender or regular blender. Season with ginger, lemongrass, scallions & white pepper & add 1/4 of a can of coconut cream. Stir to combine. Heat soup over low heat for 5 minutes & serve topped w/ a little bit of lime & a sprinkling of kaffir lime leaves. Serves 4-6 people.

Melt butter over medium heat. Stir in creole seasoning until blended. Add lemon pepper and rosemary. Add lemon juice and tabasco sauce. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Add shrimp. Cook and stir for 3 to 5 minutes or until done. Drain and serve.

Season the chicken pieces with poultry seasoning. Brown the chicken pieces in a skillet. Remove the chicken pieces and set aside. Add the bacon to the skillet and cook over medium heat until the bacon is browned but not crisp. Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon and set aside with the chicken pieces. Add the rice to the skillet and stir over medium heat until the rice is browned. Pour in the chicken broth and stir constantly until the liquid is absorbed. Pour in the cream of chicken soup, milk, bacon, chicken pieces, and poultry seasoning. Stir to combine. Season with paprika, salt and pepper to taste.
