Cook minute rice according to directions. Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 2-quart baking dish. In a medium bowl combine sausage, rice krispies, cheese and 1/2 cup soup. In another bowl whisk together eggs and remaining soup. Pour sausage mixture into baking dish. Pour egg mixture over sausage mixture. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

In a saucepan combine butterscotch chips and water. Cook over low heat until butterscotch is melted. Cool slightly. In a bowl combine sugar, flour and instant coffee and mix well. Add melted butterscotch mixture and mix well. Add 1 egg at a time until well blended. Add buttermilk and mix well. Pour into a greased and floured 10 inch bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 10 minutes. Cool 10 minutes and turn out onto a serving plate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the chocolate and butter. Heat in the microwave for about 30 seconds, until melted. Stir until smooth. Add the sugar and continue stirring until the mixture is smooth. Add the eggs and the vanillastir until blended. Sift the flour into the mixture and stir just until combined. Fold in the nuts and the chocolate chips. Spread batter evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool and cut into bars.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with foil. In a large bowl, combine the crab boil seasoning and 1 teaspoon of the kosher salt. Add the cauliflower and toss until well coated. Spread the cauliflower evenly onto the prepared baking sheet. Roast for 20 minutes. Add the onions and garlic. Roast 10 minutes longer, until the cauliflower is browned in spots and very tender. Transfer the cauliflower mixture to a large bowl. Add the lemon juice and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt. Toss. Serve with the cocktail sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Slice bananas. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sugar to melted butterstir to combine. Add bananas, cook until bananas are tender. Remove from heatadd milk and vanilla. Beat until well-combined. In a medium bowl combine white bread and milk chocolate candy barsset aside. In a large bowl whisk together eggs. Whisk in banana mixture. Add bread mixturemix well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely before cutting.

In a large saucepan, combine the chocolate chips, corn syrup, vanilla, evaporated milk, and butter. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until chips are melted. Remove from heat. Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla wafer crumbs. Spread in an 8 x 8 inch baking pan. Top with chopped nuts and coconut. Refrigerate until set. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix together chili powder oregano red pepper flakes and salt. Brush each side of bread cubes with 1 tbsp. olive oil. Sprinkle cubes lightly with chili powder mixture. Place cubes on cookie sheet and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from cookie sheet and cool completely. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese. Serve.

Wash potatoes and cut into quarters. Place potatoes on an ovenproof plate. Combine butter, onion and mushrooms. Drizzle over potatoes and sprinkle with thyme and garlic salt. Bake at 400f for 40 minutes. Serves 4.

Place the strawberries and lime wedges into a blender and blend until smooth. Strain the mixture into a pitcher and stir in the simple syrup and cachaca. Pour the mixture into glasses and serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic & cook until lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Add tenderloin & brown well on all sides. Transfer to plate. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons of fat in skillet. Add rosemary & thymecook 30 seconds. Stir in brothbring to boil. Add garlic & cook 2 minutes. Add parsley & season to taste. Spoon sauce over tenderloin.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Peel potatoes and boil until tender but firm when pierced with a knife. Drain potatoes and return to pot they were boiled in. Mash potatoes with butter and cinnamon and brown sugar. Add marshmallows and mash with potatoes until they are incorporated well. Spoon into buttered casserole dish and sprinkle with streusel. Bake for 25 minutes or until lightly brown and bubbly.

Season roast with fajita seasoning mix and coat with vegetable oil. Place in crock pot. Add tomatoes, water, and rice. Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours. Shred meat with 2 forks and stir into rice. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days. Garnish with parsley if desired.
Saute onion and scallion in oil. Stir in rice and soy sauce. Add mushrooms. Stir and cook until rice is heated. Serve.

Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla and almond extract. Combine the flour and baking powder. Gradually beat into the butter mixture. Stir in the almonds. Roll into 1 inch balls. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until cookies are lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Dust with confectioners sugar.

In a large saucepan over low heat, combine the sugar, margarine and evaporated milk. Cook for 6-7 minutes or until the temperature reaches 160 degrees. Add the chocolate and stir until smooth. Add the marshmallows and stir until completely melted. Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan or 8 x 8-inch square pan. Cool completely before cutting into squares or bars. Makes approximately 36 servings.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine coffee and half-and-half cream and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat and stir in coffee liqueur and cinnamon schnapps. Strain into a large bowl and set aside. In a large mixing bowl, combine whipping cream and fine sugar. Using a hand mixer, beat until mixture is thick and forms soft peaks. Spoon one cup of the coffee mixture into a glass and top with one cup of the whipped cream. Repeat layering until you reach the top. Garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon and a dusting of fine sugar.

Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C). Prepare the grill for indirect grilling.Rub the garlic cloves into the lamb racks and place on a roasting rack over a baking sheet. Place in the oven for 10 minutes to warm the lamb through.Mix together the lemon zest and lemon juice. Remove the lamb from the oven and brush generously with the lemon mixture. Sprinkle with rosemary and black pepper.Place the lamb in the center of the preheated grill and cook until the internal temperature reaches 125 degrees F (52 degrees C), about 1 hour and 15 minutes for medium rare. Remove the lamb from the heat and tent with aluminum foil for about 10 minutes before carving and serving.

Peel the tops off the chilies. Remove the seeds. Cut the tops off the chilies to make them flat on one side. Chop the tops and mix them with the rest of the chopped chilies. Put the mixture in a large bowl. Mix in the cheese. Combine the breadcrumbs and the eggs in a medium bowl. Add the breadcrumb mixture to the chili mixture. Stir until well blended. Add the cumin, oregano, salt and pepper. Stir until blended. Pour the mixture into a greased 8 x 8 inch pan. Bake at 350f for 30 to 35 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Beat the cream until stiff. Stir into the soup. Chill. Garnish with parsley. Serve chilled. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place the salmon fillets in an oven proof pan. Sprinkle with brown sugar and lemon juice. Sprinkle the crushed red pepper flakes over the fillets and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and pour the bourbon over the salmon fillets. Return the salmon fillets to the oven and bake for 5 minutes more. Serve the salmon with rice or noodles and garnish with parsley.

Heat oil in wok or large skillet. Add garlic and stir-fry till golden brown. Add red chilies and stir for 2-3 minutes. Add mushrooms and onions and stir-fry for 4 minutes. Add basil and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add cooked rice and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add soy sauce. Add green bell pepper and long beans and stir-fry for 1 minute. Garnish with basil leaves. Serve.
Mix first 4 ingredients thoroughly. Add oil and paprika. Add salt and pepper to taste. Store in refrigerator. Can be used for dressing or sauce. Serve with any kind of meat or fish.

Combine garlic and scallion in a food processor. Add tofu and pulse to break up. Add soy sauce and sesame oil and pulse again until all ingredients are well combined. Heat a wok with vegetable oil over medium high heat. Add tofu mixture and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add red pepper flakes and sugar. Cook 30 seconds longer and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

Spray one side of each slice of bread with the cooking spray. In small bowl mix eggs whites and cinnamon. Beat with whisk until foamy. In another bowl combine milk and vanilla. Add to egg whites. Heat skillet over medium heat. Place bread slices into skillet. Cook for 3 minutes, or until bread is golden brown. Flip bread over and cook for another 2 minutes. Serve with syrup.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Cut ends off zucchinislice in half lengthwise to make boat. Remove seeds from inside. Place each zucchini half, cut side down on baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cheese and toppings. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until zucchini is tender. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 9x13 pan. In a medium bowl, mix together butter and sugar. Stir in honey and rice bubbles. Spread mixture into pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into squares.
Combine all ingredients except sesame seeds. Marinate at least 1 hour. Grill or broil chicken on skewers. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve with rice.

Heat the stock to a simmer in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic, onion, ginger, cinnamon sticks, star anise, bay leaves and a pinch of salt and let simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add soy sauce and stir to combine.

Beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Add lime zest and salt. Mix to combine. Gradually add sugar one cup at a time, beating until mixture is stiff and shiny. Fold in coconut. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake at 300 degrees F for 30-35 minutes or until edges are lightly browned and centers are firm. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan and cool completely. Makes about 2 dozen.

Rinse chickpeas well. Drain. Transfer to a food processor. Add olive oil, vinegar, garlic, and cumin. Season with salt. Pulse until smooth. Transfer to a serving bowl. Add chopped green onions, parsley, feta cheese, lemon juice. Serve over a bed of fresh greens.
Peel and core pears. Cut in half and place in crockpot. Add remaining ingredients. Cook on high for 1 hour. Stir. Cook for an additional 1/2 hour. Serve warm.
In a bowl, combine broccoli, corn, pepper and onion. In a separate bowl combine rice wine vinegar, brown sugar and sesame oil. Mix both and serve.

In large saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch and lemon-lime drinkmix well. Cook and stir over medium heat until thick and clear. Stir in mandarin oranges and grapefruit sectionsheat through. Serve over lettuce in individual salad plates. Garnish with grapes if desired.

In a large bowl, mix together the cream cheese and the sour cream. Blend in the refried beans. Fold in the parsley and chives. Sprinkle the top with the cheeses. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with tortilla chips or crackers.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c).Line rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil. Combine tomato paste, water, vinegar, chili powder, garlic, cayenne pepper, and cumin in saucepan over medium heatbring to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heatlet cool slightly.Place chicken wings in large plastic bagadd tomato mixtureclose bag tightly, shaking to coat.In large bowl, combine flour, sugar, paprika, chili powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, cumin, and black pepperset aside.In small bowl, lightly beat egg whites until foamyset aside.Heat oil in deep fryer or large skillet over medium heat until hot. Remove wings from marinadedrain well. Working in batches, dip wings in flour mixture, then in egg whites. Fry in hot oil about 8 minutes per batch or until wings are golden brown and crispdrain on paper towels.Place wings in

In a small bowl combine cream cheese, onion and horseradish. Add Worcestershire sauce. Mix well. Cut out 12 circles from the bread. Place a heaping tablespoon of the cream cheese mixture in the center of each circle. Top with ham. Roll up. Serve with sour cream or ranch dip.
Drain hominy and place in a medium bowl. Add onions and green peppers. In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Pour over salad and toss gently. Refrigerate. Serve on lettuce if desired.
Preheat oven to 350f. Season chicken with taco seasoning and parsley. Dip in flour, then coat with cornmeal. Bake in a shallow dish for 45 minutes. Serve with your favorite toppings.

Brush each side of chicken with olive oil. Sprinkle with pepper and grill for about 10 minutes, turning once to prevent burning or charring. Slice each tomato in half and sprinkle each half with black pepper. Grill tomatoes until they begin to get soft about 10 minutes. Cut olives in half. To assemble: Arrange 2 or 3 chicken breasts on each plate, alternating with tomato halves. Sprinkle with olives. Sprinkle with herbed feta cheese. Garnish with fresh basil and fresh parsley. Serve with your choice of side.

Combine ground beef and sausage. Add salt, pepper and chili powder. Mix in onion. Add cracker crumbs and egg and combine. Form into 1 inch meatballs. Brown in oil. Combine tomato juice and cornstarch and add to browned meatballs. Bring to a boil and cook over low heat 5 minutes. Serve with hot cooked rice.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add noodles and cook until tender but still firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Drain. In a large bowl combine eggs with apricot nectar and mix well. Add noodles and toss to coat. Transfer to a 13 by 9 inch baking pan. In a small bowl combine remaining ingredients. Spread over noodles. Bake in a 325 degree oven for 1 hour or until set.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Separate the rolls into individual squares. Combine the sugar and cranberries in a small bowl. Sprinkle the walnuts over the filling and place a small piece of butter in each square. Fold the squares into triangles and place them onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake in the preheated over for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Place chicken stock and morel mushrooms in a large pot. Bring to a boil over high heat. Once boiling reduce heat to low and cook until mushrooms are tender. Strain mushrooms and return stock to pot. Stir in cream and cook over medium heat until bubbly. Season with black pepper and salt and keep warm. Heat a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil and butter and melt. Whisk in flour and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Whisk in 1 cup of hot stock from pot. Continue whisking until mixture is smooth. Add remaining stock from pot and bring to a boil. Add celery and onion and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in mushrooms. Serve soup in bowls topped with fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 350f. Unroll biscuits and separate. Press each biscuit into a 5-inch circle. Combine the tomato sauce and milk in a small bowl and mix well. Divide evenly among circles. Top with ham slices and cheese slices. Fold into triangles. Bake on an ungreased baking sheet for about 12 minutes or until golden. Let cool slightly before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 10x4 inch loaf pan.In a large bowl, combine bananas, coconut, pecans, chocolate chips, rum, eggs, vegetable oil, flour, baking powder and salt. Beat until smooth. Pour into the prepared loaf pan.Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven, and allow to cool for 10 minutes in the pan. Remove from pan, and allow to cool completely on a wire rack.Wrap in plastic wrap, and store in the refrigerator. This bread will keep for 3 days in the refrigerator.

In a medium bowl, toss the onions with the ketchup, vinegar, maple syrup, mustard and smoked salt. Reserve for later. Heat a grill or grill pan over medium heat. Toss the chicken legs in the smoky seasoning blend. Grill the chicken legs until cooked through. Remove from heat and top with the onion mixture. Serve immediately.

Preheat a sandwich press. Butter two slices of bread. Add spinach and top with a thin layer of the olives. Add the mushrooms and a layer of the tomatoes. Top with a layer of cheese. Season with the pepper and flakes. Top with the second slice of bread. Cook in the sandwich press for 4 minutes or until the bread is crisp and golden and the cheese is melted. Cut the sandwiches in half and serve.

Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a medium-sized skillet over medium heat until foamy. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add shrimp and cook until firm and opaque, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer shrimp to an 8 x 8-inch glass baking dishset aside. Melt remaining butter in skilletadd flour, stirring constantly until golden brown. Remove from heatstir in clam juice and evaporated milk until smooth. Stir in half-and-halfreturn skillet to heat until thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in sherry wineheat throughseason with salt and pepper to taste. Spread half of the sauce over the top of shrimpsprinkle with mozzarella cheesecover with remaining saucesprinkle with remaining cheesecover with remaining saucesprinkle with paprika. Bake until cheese is golden brown and bubbly, about 15 minutes. Serve with crackers.

To make chocolate sauce, combine milk and chocolate syrup in a saucepan and stir over low heat until smooth. Add nuts and stir until combined. Remove from heat and cool. To assemble sundae, place a few scoops of vanilla ice cream in a glass. Add chocolate sauce and swirl to cover. Top with chocolate ice cream and marshmallow creme. Garnish with whipped cream.

Bake pie crust for 5 minutes at 350 degrees. Meanwhile combine pudding mix with milk and stir until smooth. Remove pie crust from oven and add pudding mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for an additional 10 minutes. Remove pie from oven and sprinkle with cherry pie filling. Cool and refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Cook quinoa according to package directions and let cool slightly. Slice vegetables into thin strips and place them in a medium bowl with a sprinkle of seasoning salt and a few drops of garlic oil. Mix gently. Beat eggs in a small bowl and then add to vegetables with soymilk and quinoa. Pour into a 9×13 inch baking dish and bake for 25 minutes or until the center is set.Remove from oven and top with breadcrumbs and cheese. Return to oven and bake for an additional 5 minutes or until the top is lightly browned.Serve hot.

Melt the butter over medium-high heat and then add the mushrooms and salt and pepper. Fry the mushrooms for about 5 minutes, shaking the pan occasionally to prevent them from sticking. Remove the pan from the heat and add the dill and vinegartoss well. Divide the mushrooms and lettuce among individual serving plates and drizzle with the oil and vinegar mixture.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cream butter with sugar. Add egg and beat until light. Blend in dry ingredients. Stir in cranberries. Press dough into 8-inch square pan. Cut into 9 squares. Brush with cream. Bake 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees. Bake 15 more minutes or until golden brown. Makes 9 scones.

Mix the gelatin and warm water until smooth. Beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add the gelatin mixture to the cream cheese mixture and beat until smooth. Add the tomato soup. Add the green pepper, onion and shrimp. Combine well. Refrigerate. Garnish with shrimp. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Place ground beef in a large bowl. Add onions and mix well. Combine remaining ingredients. Add to beef mixture and mix well. Spread into a 13- x 9-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Bring the stock to a boil in a large saucepan. Cook the pasta until al dente. Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, carrots and celery. Season the vegetables with salt and pepper. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and thyme and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the lentils. Season the lentils with salt and pepper. Pour the stock into the pan. Simmer until the lentils are tender and the liquid has been absorbed. Add the pasta to the pan and toss. Serve in bowls, topped with the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the onion and garlic cloves and saute until the onion turns golden brown. Stir in the spices and saute for another minute or so. Add the tomatoes and bring the mixture to the boil. Stir in the coconut milk, reduce the heat to low and simmer for a minute or so. Remove from heat and pour the mixture over the salmon fillets in the baking dish. Bake for about 12 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve hot with cooked basmati rice or couscous.

Beat together the eggs and sugar until very light and fluffy. Sift together the flour and baking powder and then add this and the vanilla extract to the egg mixture. Beat well. Spray two pizzelle irons with nonstick vegetable oil spray and place them in the oven (do not turn the oven on). Heat the irons in the oven for 2 minutes. Remove them from the oven and pour the batter into the irons. (There should be enough batter for two pizzelles in each iron.) Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 3 minutes or until the pizzelles are just starting to brown. Cool for a few minutes and then lift each pizzelle off the iron with a spatula. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 20.

Place cornstarch in the bowl of an electric mixer. Add sugar, salt, and milk and whisk to blend well. Cook mixture over medium heat in medium saucepan. Cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture thickens to the consistency of cream. Add eggs one at a time to mixture, whisking thoroughly after each addition. Cook and whisk for 2 more minutes. Remove from heat and place mixture in bowl of electric mixer. Whisk in half-and-half and vanilla extract. Chill thoroughly in refrigerator. Add papayas to mixture and blend thoroughly with an electric mixer. Freeze in your ice cream freezer according to the manufacturer's instructions. Yield: 1 1/2 quarts.

Combine the chicken, pineapple tidbits, green onions, water chestnuts and ground ginger in a large bowl. Stir in the mayonnaise, sour cream and salt and pepper to taste. Chill for several hours or overnight before serving with almonds for garnish.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Form into an oblong shape on baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes and gravy.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine flour, brown sugar and white sugar. Stir until combined. In a separate bowl, combine milk and vanilla. Gradually add the flour mixture. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat and allow mixture to cool. When mixture is cool, beat in the butter. Fold in the miniature chocolate chips. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve with ice cream.
Spread bread slices with vinaigrettetop with tomatoes and pepper strips. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.

Combine the cucumbers and onions in a bowl. Toss with cider vinegar and let stand for at least one hour. Add the sugar and salt and pepper and refrigerate for 2 hours. To serve spoon the cucumber mixture into a bowl and top with a dollop of sour cream and fresh dill.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 cookie sheets with parchment paper or foilset aside. In a large bowl, stir together the sugar, baking soda, salt, and vanilla extract. Stir in the peanut butter until smooth. Add the egg and stir until combined. Stir in the chocolate chips, then fold in the peanuts. Drop batter by tablespoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake in preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or until set. Cool cookies on wire racks.

In a medium saucepan combine water and cornstarch stirring to dissolve the cornstarch. Add sugar and stir to dissolve the sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Boil 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from the heat and add butter, stirring until butter is melted and sauce is smooth. Remove from the heat and stir in orange and lemon juice, orange peel and lemon peel. Chill before serving.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown hamburger and drain fat. Add coleslaw mix and onion. Cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain the fat from the skillet and heat oil in the skillet until hot. Place one wrapper in the skillet and brush the edges of the wrapper with a small amount of the beef mixture. Lay a scant 1/4 cup of the beef mixture in the center of the wrapper and roll up like a jelly roll, folding in the sides as you roll. Fry until brown on all sides. Remove from the skillet and place in a warm area until all the wrappers are fried. Serve with the sauce on the side.

In a large bowl, combine 3 cups of flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 4 tablespoons vegetable shortening. Add 1 1/2 cups of boiling water and mix well. Add 1/4 teaspoon of cream of tartar and 1/2 teaspoon of food coloring. Knead the dough well for about 5 minutes and store in an airtight container. The dough can also be colored with food coloring and used as a glaze for cookies or cupcakes.

In a large pot over medium heat, add olive oil. Add garlic and onion and saute for about 2 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes and diced tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered for about 1 hour. Stir frequently. Once the sauce has thickened slightly, add fresh basil leaves and cook for an additional minute. Serve over penne rigate. Enjoy.

Mix cream, icing sugar, mascarpone cheese in a large bowl. Whisk until smooth. Add the irish cream and white chocolate. Mix well. Layer 1/3 of the cake in a 12-cup glass serving dish. Pour 1/3 of the cream mixture over the cake. Continue layering with the remaining cake slices and cream mixture. Refrigerate for a few hours. Serve in bowls topped with berries. Garnish with chocolate curls.

Combine brown sugar with onion powder and lemon pepper seasoning in a small bowl. Spread mixture evenly onto the top of each salmon fillet. Lay fillets skin side down in an oven safe pan. Melt the butter and drizzle over the salmon. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until the fish is just cooked through. Store remaining spice mixture in an airtight container for future use.

Prepare the marinade in a shallow dish or bowl by mixing together the lemon juice, olive oil, onion and seasonings. Add the chicken breasts, cover, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 350 F. In a shallow dish, combine the bread crumbs, seasoning salt, pepper and paprika. In a large skillet heat 2 inches of oil to 350 F. Remove the chicken from the marinade and shake off the excess. Dip each breast into the bread crumb mixture to coat. Fry the chicken, turning once until golden brown. Place on paper towels to drain. Place the chicken on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until cooked through.

Peel mangoes and slice off flesh into a bowl. Mince or chop very finely to form a chunky sauce. Add ground nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice, and caster sugar to taste to the mangoes. Chill in refrigerator 1 hour before serving. Serve with fish or fowl as a relish.

Sift together flour, salt, and oatmeal. Blend in oil and syrup. Stir in vanilla. Press into a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Bake for about 20 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Sprinkle with jam. Bake for about 5 minutes more. Cool. Cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. In a large bowl combine bananas, oil, vanilla and sugar. Beat well. Add baking mix. Stir well. Fold in nuts if using. Spread batter into prepared baking dish. Bake uncovered for 40 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the centre comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375f. Remove seeds and white pith from pepper. Arrange pepper flat side down on small baking sheet and roast 20 minutes until pepper is just tender. In small bowl combine mayonnaise, capers, parsley, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Cut pepper into small pieces and mix into mayonnaise. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Makes about 1 cup.
Brown ground beef in skillet with onion. Add cream of mushroom soup, beef broth, ketchup, water, and pasta. Simmer until pasta is cooked through. Top with cheese. Serve.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and cool in ice water. Cut potatoes into quarters or eighths. Heat bacon grease in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until translucent and softened about 8 minutes. Add potatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add chicken broth, bacon and thyme. Boil until most of liquid evaporates. Cool mixture slightly. Mash potatoes with milk and mustard. Add lemon juice and remaining ingredients and mix well. Serve warm or cold. Serves 8.

Spread tortillas with cream cheese spread. Sprinkle with spinach, zucchini, artichoke hearts, green olives, pepperoni, gouda cheese. Fold up like a burrito and serve with a salsa or your favorite dipping sauce. Serves 2.

In a mixing bowl combine cereal and butter. Press into a 9 inch pan and set aside. In another bowl combine the honey and the walnuts and mix well. Pour over the cereal mixture and press down well. Place in the refrigerator for about an hour or until firm. Cut into squares. Melt chocolate and drizzle over the cereal. Store in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Grease a 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Combine the cake mix, oleo, eggs, and water. Spread evenly in pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool completely. For filling, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in powdered sugar and vanilla. Spread over cooled crust. Sprinkle coconut on top of filling and press lightly. Chill at least 1 hour. For topping, beat nuts until crumbly. Spread evenly over coconut. Chill at least 1 hour more. Cut into bars. Store refrigerated or freeze.
Mix all ingredients well in a small bowl. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours before serving. Makes 1 cup.
In a bowl layer the prepared pudding and strawberries. Top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream. Sprinkle with shaved chocolate for garnish if desired.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the curry paste and cook until fragrant. Add the coconut milk and simmer until the curry has thickened. Add the pork and cook until golden brown. Add the fresh pineapple and red capsicum. Stir through the cashew nuts and cook until heated through. Serve immediately.

Melt butter over medium heat in heavy skillet. Add pine nuts and cook until brown, about three minutes. Add garlicsaute for one minute. Add gnocchicook over medium heat until lightly browned. Add spinach and stir until wilted. Add salt, pepper and cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper. Cream together the butter and sugar. Beat in the vanilla and almond extracts. In a separate bowl combine the flour, salt, baking soda and baking powder. Stir into the butter mixture until incorporated. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by teaspoons onto prepared baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until set. Remove from baking sheet and allow to cool. Drizzle with powdered sugar.
Peel red beets and boil until tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Combine with horseradish and remaining ingredients. Refrigerate for 24 hours before serving. Serve with meats.

Cook pasta in salted water until al dente. Meanwhile cook pancetta in skillet until crisp. Add onion and cook over medium-low heat until softened, about 6-8 minutes. Add heavy cream and sherry winebring to a simmer and cook for about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in gorgonzola. Season with nutmeg and parmesan cheese. Toss pasta with sauce and serve immediately.
Pour cola into glass. Add cherries and sugar and stir. Pour into glass and add ice cream to fill. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly coat a shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Place tomatoes in dish. In a small bowl combine shrimp, garlic and salt. In another bowl toss together basil, olive oil and tomatoes. Place shrimp mixture on top of tomatoes. Pour basil mixture over shrimp. Bake until shrimp is pink (approximately 10 minutes). Serve immediately.

Place water in a saucepan with the steel cut oats over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes. Stir in brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. Cook for another 2 minutes. Stir in milk. Serve warm.

Divide the pizza dough in two equal portions. Roll each portion into a rectangle shape and place in a greased loaf pan. Spread 1/2 of the sausage evenly on the dough. Top with the mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with the Romano cheese and the Parmesan cheese. Beat the egg and brush the dough with the egg wash. Bake in a preheated 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) oven until the bread is golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack. Cut into slices and serve immediately or save for later.

Grease two 9-inch-diameter loaf pans with vegetable oil spray. Stir together flour, baking powder, and baking soda in a large bowlset aside. Stir together mashed bananas and apple juice concentrate in a separate medium bowlset aside. Add oil and vanilla extract to mashed banana mixture and stir until combined. Add flour mixture and stir until combined. Stir in nuts and raisins until evenly distributed. Pour into prepared pans. Bake in preheated oven until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean (about 50 minutes). Cool in pans on wire racks for 10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely on wire racks before slicing. Makes two loaves.

Mix together the first six ingredients and pour into an unbaked 9 inch pie shell. Bake at 425 for 20 minutes and then lower the temperature to 375 and bake for another 20 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Let the pie cool completely before serving and garnish with whipped topping and a sprinkle of additional sugar substitute if desired.

In a skillet cook sausage and bell pepper until sausage is browned and vegetables are tender. On pizza crust spread pizza sauce. Top with sausage mixture and fried onions. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes.

Mix the cake mix with the water and 2 egg whites. Spray a 10 x 14 inch pan with pam. Spread the cake mixture evenly. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Beat together the cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Beat in the whipping cream and the junket. Spread over the cake. Freeze for at least 2 hours. Garnish with sliced strawberries.

Beat dairy-free margarine and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs one by one and mix well. Add flour and baking powder and beat well. Add rice milk and mix well. Divide between patty cases and bake in preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Cool in tin for about 5 minutes before removing and cooling on wire rack.

Combine butter and brown sugarmix until smooth. Add egg and vanilla and blend well. Add dates. Add cereal and coconut. Stir until well mixed. Press mixture into a 10-inch skillet. Bake at 325 F. for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 1 hour. Cut into 6 wedges. Serve at room temperature. Store in an airtight container. Makes 6 servings.

Marinate the drumsticks in a large plastic bag with the barbecue sauce and hot sauce. Refrigerate for up to three days or freeze for up to one month. Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Remove the drumsticks from the plastic bag and sprinkle with the oregano and cumin. Place the drumsticks on a baking sheet lined with foil or parchment paper. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, and turn once halfway through baking.

Place the chicken in the slow cooker and pour the rest of the ingredients over the top. Cover and cook on high for 4 hours. Turn off and let stand for 1 hour. Shred the meat with two forks. Heat through on high for 20 minutes. Serve over rice.

In small bowl, combine vinegar, ginger and sugar. Set aside. Trim asparagus and cut into thirds. In wok or large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until very hot, about 1 minute. Add garlic and asparagus and stir-fry until bright green, about 1 minute. Add vinegar mixture and soy sauce and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until asparagus is tender and liquid has evaporated, about 2 minutes. Stir in sesame oil. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve as an appetizer or side dish. Makes about 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 350F/180C. In a large bowl beat brown sugar & white sugar together until light & fluffy. Add egg yolk & vanilla essence & beat until combined. Add flour & stir to combine. Stir in white chocolate chips. Roll into 18 balls & place on a lightly greased baking tray. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Allow cookies to cool for 5 minutes before removing from tray.

Beat cream cheese, pineapple and cool whip. Add syrup and mix well. Put into a refridgerator for a couple of hours. Then add the pecans. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Great with ham or roasted chicken.

For the base, place the digestive biscuits into the base of your tart tin and break them up with your fingers. Pour the melted butter over and use the back of a spoon to spread the mixture evenly. Refrigerate until ready to use.For the chocolate topping, place the chocolate into the bowl of a double boiler and melt. Allow to cool for a few minutes.In a separate bowl whisk the eggs and the cream together with the vanilla essence and caster sugar until the mixture has thickened. Add the cooled chocolate and whisk until smooth.Pour the chocolate mixture over the biscuit base and place the tart back into the fridge to set.For the filling, remove the seeds from the oranges and place the flesh into a blender with the sugar and eggs. Blend until smooth.Spoon the mixture over the chocolate layer. Use the back of a spoon to make swirls. Bake for 35 minutes at 160c. Allow to cool and set.Decorate the top with some chopped dark chocolate and the orange zest
Place all ingredients in a large pot and cook over medium low heat for 2 hours. Stir frequently. Add more basil if you like. Remove bay leaves. Serve over pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9-inch tart pan or pie plate with cooking sprayline with foil, extending foil over edges of pangrease foil. Combine brownie mix, melted butter and eggspress into prepared panspread with 1 cup marshmallow cremesprinkle with 1/3 cup of the chocolates. Bake 20 minutes or until brownie is setcool completely on wire rack. Whip heavy cream until soft peaks formfold in remaining 1/2 cup marshmallow creme and 1/3 cup chocolatesspread over browniesprinkle with remaining chocolatesfreeze 3 hours or until firm. To remove from pan, place foil-lined pan on a piece of waxed paperinvertpeel off foilcut into wedgesgarnish with mint.

Prepare brownie mix as directed on box and pour into greased and floured pan. Bake at 375 for 18-20 minutes. Cool completely and cut into squares. Melt together butter and chocolate chip cookie mix and frost squares with frosting. More.

Preheat oven to 350f. Beat eggs and milk together in shallow dish. Combine pretzel crumbs and Parmesan cheese in a second shallow dish. Dip chicken pieces into eggsthen coat with pretzel mixture. Place in a single layer in a baking panbake for 30 minutes or until juices run clear and chicken is cooked through.

Place all ingredients in a medium-sized saucepan. Bring to a boil and then simmer for 20 minutes, stirring frequently. Strain through a strainer set over a bowl. Cool and store in the refrigerator. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a 9×13 inch baking dish with 1 pie crust. Mix together the smoked ham, egg yolks, sour cream and gruyere cheese until smooth. Season with salt and pepper, and add a few grinds of nutmeg. Pour the mixture into the baking dish and sprinkle the remaining pie crust on top. Bake the quiche for 15 minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and bake for 45 minutes longer, until the pie crust is golden brown and the filling is set.

Preheat oven to 375f. In large bowl cream brown sugar, white sugar, margarine and eggs until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Add dry mixture to creamed mixturestir until blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded teaspoons 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 8-10 minutes or until light brown around edges. Remove from ovencool 1 minute before removing from sheets to cooling racks.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place potatoes and evaporated milk in a large bowl. Stir in celery soup. Add eggs and beat well. Stir in onion powder and salt and pepper to taste. Spray a casserole dish and place mixture in dish. Sprinkle tuna and cheddar cheese on top and bake for about 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender and mixture is set. Cool slightly before serving.

Bring 4 quarts water to boil in large pot. Add pasta, stir. Cook 10 minutes or till tender but firm to bite. Drain, rinse with cold water to stop cooking. Drain well. Whisk together oil, mayonnaise and lemon juice. Pour over hot pasta. Add parsley and basil. Gently toss to combine. Cool 15 minutes. Add chicken and artichokes. Gently toss. Add Tabasco to taste. Garnish with almonds. Chill. Toss again before serving.
Boil water and pour over coffee. Strain and add sugar to taste. Juice oranges and add to coffee. Slice oranges and add to coffee. Add whipping cream to taste. Serve over ice.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, heat the oil and cook the onion and carrot in the oil until golden. Combine potatoes, carrots and onion in a large mixing bowl. Add the eggs and matzo meal. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees.

Mix the Ritz cracker crumbs, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. Combine egg and milk. Dip pork chops into egg mixture, then into crumb mixture. Place chops on a greased baking dish. Melt butter. Pour the butter over the chops. Bake 35-40 minutes at 350 degrees or until chops are no longer pink. Serve with cooked rice or mashed potatoes.

Drain cucumbers in colander or sieve. Combine the soy sauce, vinegar, oil, sugar, chili and 3/4 teaspoon salt in a small bowl. Add the drained cucumberstoss gently to coat. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cut each breast into 3 equal pieces. Mix bread crumbs and cheese together in a shallow dish. Beat egg and milk together in a shallow dish. Combine rosemary, basil, oregano, black pepper, and parsley flakes in another shallow dish. Dip each piece of chicken into milk mixture, then roll in cheese mixture until well coated. Dip into egg mixture, and then roll into bread crumb mixture until well coated. Place on baking sheet. Bake for 20-30 minutes, or until cooked through and crumbs are golden brown.
Combine cream cheese, cumin, onions, jalapeno, and cheddar cheese in a bowl. Form into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap. Roll in chips. Cut into pieces. Serve with bell peppers.

Heat the oil in a medium-sized saucepan over medium heat until it is very hot but not smoking. Add the semolina all at once, stirring constantly until the mixture is dry (about 2 minutes). Add the sugar and continue stirring until the mixture is very dry (about 10 minutes). Add the water gradually while continuing to stir vigorously. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat and then reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice and the cinnamon stick. Serve warm. Top with almonds. Serves 4.

Cut sausage into 1 inch pieces and place in a saucepan with the wine. Cook over low heat 5 minutes. Add dry soup and stir until well blended. Add cheese and lemon juice and heat until cheese is melted. Serve in fondue pot with french bread.

Place beef steak in crock pot and add broth, salt, pepper, garlic powder, sweet onion and mushrooms. Cook on low 6-8 hours or until steak is tender. Remove steak from crock pot and cut into bite size pieces. Stir in the cream of mushroom soup, browm gravy mix and mushrooms. Cook 15 minutes longer. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes.

Cook linguine in a pot of boiling water. In a wok or skillet, heat sesame oil until very hot. Add chicken breasts and saute until lightly browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and keep warm. Add mushrooms and saute until browned. Add garlic, ginger and cayenne and saute until fragrant. Add hoisin and soy sauce and bring to a boil. Add linguine and toss to coat. Top with chopped green onion and serve.

Preheat oven to 375. Sift together flour, sugar and baking powder. Add egg. Beat well. Add dates, boiling water and baking soda. Add milk. Pour into a 9x9 pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Cool in pan before frosting.

Beat cream cheese in large bowl until fluffy. Add sugar and eggsbeat until blended. Stir in lemon juice and vanillamix well. Refrigerate until firm. Preheat oven to 350. Unroll doughroll up tightly, pinch ends to seal. Cut dough crosswise into 1/2-inch slices. Press a tablespoon of cream cheese mixture in center of each slicefold ends over mixture to form a triangle. Place onto greased baking sheetsbake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks.

Slice peppers about 1/8-inch thick, discarding seeds and pith. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat until hot. Cook peppers until tender and beginning to brown on both sides, turning once. Sprinkle evenly with coarse salt and serve immediately with lime wedge for squeezing over the peppers.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. In a large skillet, cook onions in oil over medium heat until soft. Add bacon. Cook until bacon is browned. Add pasta to bacon mixture. Toss lightly. Add 1/2 cup water and cook over low heat for 1 minute, tossing occasionally. Remove from heat. Add fresh ground black pepper. Stir in parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet, brown the spam with the potato and onion until the potato is almost tender. Stir in the pineapple and juice and bring to a boil. In a small bowl, stir together the mustard and pepper. Pour the mixture over the spam mixture and cook until thickened. Transfer to a casserole and bake uncovered for 15 minutes.
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl. Place chicken in a 9- x 13-inch baking dish. Pour sauce mixture over chicken. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Toss together bread crumbs and milk in a bowllet soak for 10 minutes. Butter 2-quart casserole dish. Layer half of bread crumbs into the bottom of prepared casserole dish, then arrange half of asparagus spears over bread crumbs. Sprinkle with half of prosciutto and half of asparagus. Pour half of egg mixture over asparagus and prosciuttosprinkle with half of Parmesan and asiago cheeses and half of chives. Repeat layers with remaining bread crumbs, asparagus spears, prosciutto, asparagus, egg mixture, Parmesan and asiago cheeses, and chives. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 1 hour. Sprinkle with lemon peel and season with cayenne before serving.

Combine flour and salt. Cut in butter until crumbly. Beat together the eggs and sugar. Stir in the cinnamon and vanilla. Add in the flour mixture and stir together. Add pecans and mix well. Spread mixture into the prepared pie crust. Bake for 30-35 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool for 1 hour before cutting. In a saucepan, heat chocolate chips and peanut butter over low heat until melted. Stir in the milk until smooth. Pour over the top of the pie. Refrigerate at least 2 hours to allow the topping to set up. Serves 6-8.

Shred mozzarella, romano and parmesan cheeses. Mix together in a bowl. Add freshly ground black pepper. Stir in finely chopped fresh garlic. Stir in extra virgin olive oil. Drizzle in fresh lemon juice. Spread on bread before toasting.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and garlicsaute until mushrooms are browned. Stir in spinach and cook until spinach is wilted. Add basil and winecook until most liquid evaporates. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve over hot pasta.

Combine rice and milk in a medium heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low, cover pan and simmer until liquid is absorbed and mixture is thick, about 30 minutes. Stir in cornstarch mixture until smooth. Beat with a wooden spoon until mixture is slightly thickened. Add rosewater, almonds, pistachios, and cinnamon. Beat well to distribute ingredients evenly. Pour into a greased shallow 13x9x3-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered until top is golden brown, about 45 minutes. Serve warm with a syrup or jam on top.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Heat oil and garlic until garlic is lightly browned. Add chops and brown on both sides. Sprinkle with herb mix. Add sherry and cook for 5 minutes. Place chops on a foil-lined baking sheet and bake 10 minutes or until chops are well done.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Prepare dough according to package directionsroll out into 24 equal pieces. Place each piece on a greased baking sheetflatten out to a 1/4 inch thickness. Place 1/2 teaspoon of pizza sauce in the middle of each piecetop with 1/4 teaspoon mozzarella cheese and 2 pepperoni slices. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 7 to 10 minutes. Serve immediately or cool to room temperature before storing in airtight containers for up to 1 week. Makes 24 mini pizzas.

Combine gelatin with boiling water in medium bowlstir 2 min. until completely dissolved. Add cranberry saucestir until slightly thickened. Add chopped nuts. Pour into 9x13" pan coated with cooking sprayrefrigerate 4 hours or until firm. Cut into 4 rows by 1-1/2" strips. Top with celery. Makes 10 servings.

In a small skillet saute onion and pepper until tender. In a bowl combine dressing with next 8 ingredients. Arrange chicken on top of vegetables. Pour dressing mixture over chicken. Bake at 375 for 1 hour or until chicken is no longer pink. Serve over cooked pasta or rice.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Line baking sheet with foil and coat with cooking spray. Cut eggplant in half lengthwise and remove seeds and white pith with spoon. Cut into 1/4-inch slices. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add eggplant slicescook until lightly browned and tender, about 6 minutes per side. Turn once. Remove from skilletset aside. In small bowl, stir together Havarti cheese and pesto sauce until well blended. Spread cheese mixture onto one side of each bread sliceplace on baking sheet. Top each sandwich with eggplant slices. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease 9 x 13 pan. Combine zucchini, eggs, milk, cheese, salt, and baking powder in large bowl. Spoon into prepared pan. Stir together breadcrumbs and butter. Sprinkle over zucchini mixture. Bake 30 to 35 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine red wine, frozen orange juice concentrate and lemon in a large bowlchill overnight. Add fruit and stir to coat. Cover and chill 4 hours or overnight. Just before serving, stir in sugar and serve in individual glasses.

In a large bowl combine soup, onion, egg, salt, pepper. Add breadstir until moistened. Stir in beef. In a medium bowl combine tomato sauce, soy sauce, sugarset aside. In a 9x13 inch baking pan spread 1/2 of the beef mixture. Spread 1/2 of the tomato sauce mixture. Repeat layers. Cover and bake at 350 for 1 hour. Remove from ovencool 10 minutes. Yield: 12 servings.
Mix ground beef, steak sauce, garlic powder, black pepper and worcestershire sauce in a large bowl. Shape into patties. Grill or broil 10 minutes on each side or until done.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl combine the cracker crumbs, butter, cheddar cheese and parmesan cheeseset aside. Butter a 9x13 inch pan and place 1/2 of the cracker mixture on bottom of pan. Place fillets of sole in pan with cracker crumb mixture on top of fillets. Top with remaining cracker mixture. Drizzle fish with melted buttersprinkle with lemon pepper seasoningcover with foil. Bake for 15 minutesuncover, bake for an additional 15 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Peel carrots and potatoes. Cut into bite-size pieces. Place in a large saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat. Drain vegetables. Mash with a potato masher. Stir in milk and bouillon cube. Cook and stir until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with sour cream and sprinkle with chopped chives.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the trout fillets in the oil. Remove the trout from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, cook garlic in the oil for about 1 minute. Add the vinegar, water and salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and add bay leaf and trout. Reduce heat, cover and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and cool for about 10 minutes. Serve with steamed rice. Makes 4 servings.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saut until softened. Stir in dried basil, bay leaf, rosemary. Cook, stirring constantly for 3 minutes or until fragrant. Add bulgur and stir to mix. Add warm water. Reduce heat to low and simmer until bulgur is tender and water is absorbed, 15-20 minutes. Remove bay leaf and basil. Mix in lemon juice and season to taste with salt & pepper.

Heat oil in pan. Add mushrooms and soy sauce and cook 3 minutes or until tender and browned. Sprinkle with feta cheese and bake 2 minutes or until cheese melts. Garnish with crumbled bacon and serve with baked potatoes.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease or spray 15x10x1 inch baking pan. In small bowl combine flours, brown sugar, baking soda, salt, and buttermix well. Press into prepared pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until set. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with nuts. Melt chocolate chips over low heat. Spread evenly over bars. Let cool. Spoon carmel ice cream topping over top of chocolate chips. Let stand for about 30 minutes or until set. Cut into bars. Makes about 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss potatoes with oil and season with salt and pepper. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with rosemary and bake for another 5 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Cut in half or quarters. Garnish with additional rosemary if desired.

Heat butter in a saucepan over low heat. Add mushrooms and onion. Saut until tender, about 3-5 minutes. Increase heat to medium. Add flour to pan. Continue sauteing until flour is golden brown. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream. Add lemon juice and parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Serve on toasted bread. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet saute onion and garlic in 2 tablespoons of the olive oil until lightly browned. Add spinach and saute 1 minute. Add tortellini, cooked basil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook until heated through. In a small saucepan melt butter. Add the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, the remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper and the heavy whipping cream. Heat until hot. Spoon tortellini mixture into shallow 1 1/2-quart serving bowls. Top with heavy whipping cream mixture. Garnish with Parmesan.

In a large bowl, cream butter and brown sugar together until smooth. Beat in banana, egg and vanilla. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and saltstir into the creamed mixture. Form into 1-inch balls. Roll the balls in the toasted peanuts. Place 2 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 9 to 11 minutes or until set. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the baking sheet to a wire rack to cool completely.

Sauté onion and garlic in oil until tender. Add sausagecook until no longer pink. Add spaghetti saucesimmer. Cut zucchini into small cubesadd with broth and water. Simmer for about an hour until zucchini is tender. Remove bay leaf. Ladle soup into bowlstop with shredded mozzarella cheese. Serve with spaghetti noodles and basil leaves.

Place roast in crockpot and pour in beef bouillon granules and beef broth. Cover and cook on low for 4 hours. Remove roast and place on platter. Stir together flour and beef bouillon granules and stir into roast liquid until smooth. Return roast to crockpot and heat through. Serve with mashed potatoes and gravy.

In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except tortilla chips. Spread in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle cheese over top and bake an additional 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cook noodles according to directions on the box. In a large bowl combine the noodles with the other ingredients except the parsley. Refrigerate overnight to blend flavors. Garnish with parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 400. In a large mixing bowl combine the butter and sugar. Add eggs and juice and vanilla. Add flour, cornmeal and baking powder. Add blueberries. Spoon batter into lined muffin pans. Sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar. Bake 15-20 minutes.

Combine blueberries, balsamic vinegar, ketchup, sugar, garlic powder and salt in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, then turn down to simmer and cook until blueberries are soft and broken down. Serve over grilled meats and vegetables.

Cut the steak into serving portions. Mince the garlic. Heat the oil in a pan. Dip each piece of meat in the garlic and oil. Season with salt and pepper. Lay the pieces on a plate and sprinkle the parmesan over them. Put the breadcrumbs on a plate and roll each piece of meat in them. Return to the pan and brown quickly on each side. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). In a medium bowl, combine potatoes, onions and caraway seeds. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast in the preheated oven until potatoes are golden and tender, about 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 1.5 quart casserole dish with butter. Spread hash browns in the bottom of the casserole dish. Sprinkle ham and cheese over the top. In a medium bowl, beat eggs and egg substitute. Stir in milk. Add in salsa, mustard and black pepper. Pour over the top. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes.

Cook noodles as directed. Cook chicken breasts in a pan with a little oil. Cut chicken into small pieces. Add dressing and ground ginger to chicken and cook on low heat. Cook celery, carrots and cashews in a small amount of oil. Add to chicken and dressing. Cool slightly and add to salad.

Melt butter in small saucepan over low heat. Combine flour, sugar, rolled oats and coconut in large saucepan. Stir in butter. Mix well. Add bicarb and hot water. Cook for 5 minutes. Pour into greased 18cm x 28cm tray. Bake in moderate oven 180c for 20-25 minutes. Cool. Melt chocolate. Spread over base. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine breadcrumbs, parsley flakes and garlic powder/garlic salt in a shallow bowl. Dip the chicken in the egg white. Coat with the breadcrumb mixture. Place the chicken in a baking dish. Combine balsamic vinegar and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Pour the mixture over the chicken. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Boil eggs for 20 minutes. Cool completely. Peel and slice eggs. In a small bowl mix scallions and mustard and let stand for two minutes. Add egg slices and mix well. Spread evenly on the bottom slice of bread. Top with lettuce and cover with second slice. Cut sandwich into halves and serve.

Preheat oven to 350F (175C). Spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray and set aside. Cream together the oil and sugar. Beat in the unsweetened applesauce and vanilla until well blended. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda and cinnamon. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet and mix until combined. Pour into the pan and bake for about 35-40 minutes or until the cake springs back when gently pressed in the center. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serves 12-16.

Combine all the lettuce dressing and parmesan cheese in a mixing bowl. Add crispy bacon and crumbled parmesan. Add salt and pepper to taste. Layer lettuce in a bowl and sprinkle with red onion. Cover with bacon dressing and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add garliccook and stir until golden brown and beginning to caramelize. Add brown sugarcook until melted and bubbly. Stir in soy saucecook 1 minute more. Lay chicken on top of caramelized mixture. Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven, basting with sauce from pan every 5 minutes.

Heat oil in a large saucepot over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in soy sauce, water, and spinachcook 1-2 minutes or until spinach is wilted. Stir in green onions and garliccook 1 minute more. Serve with rice. Makes 6 servings.

Saut onion and garlic in oil. Add beef, salt, pepper, tomatoes and cook until beef is browned. Add macaroni mix, milk and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir. Add american cheese. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve.

Split crescent rolls in half horizontally and place on cookie sheet with sides touching. Spread mustard on bottom half of each crescent roll. Add meat and cheese and top with other half of crescent roll. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes. Makes 12.

Line a 20x20cm square baking dish with baking paper, leaving an overhang of paper at two opposite sides of the dish. Peel and slice apples and place in a single layer in prepared dish. Melt butter and sugar in a saucepan over a medium heat and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Beat eggs and golden syrup together in a large bowl. Add cooled butter mixture and whisk until well combined. Sift together flour and spices and stir into egg mixture until well combined and a thick batter forms. Spread mixture evenly over apples in baking dish. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes, until top of cake is golden and a skewer inserted into the centre of cake comes out clean when removed. Remove from oven and allow to cool in dish for 10 minutes before transferring to wire rack to cool completely. To make whipped cream, beat cream until soft peaks form. Add sugar and continue beating until soft peaks form again. Spread whipped cream over cooled cake and serve.

Put a few of the raspberries into 4 cups of boiling water and steep for 5 minutes. Remove the berries and add 1 tea bag to each of the cups. Stir and add 1/2 cup of ice cubes to each cup. Garnish with the raspberries and orange wedges.

Sprinkle scallops with mustard and season with salt and pepper. Butter a baking dish and arrange scallops in it with the flat side down. Layer with sliced strawberries. Drizzle with wine and bake for about 20 minutes. Top with blue cheese and whipping cream, and bake for another 5 minutes.

Beat eggs with the other ingredients in a bowl until smooth. Heat oil in frying pan and pour in the egg mixture. As the mixture starts to set, stir to scramble the eggs and let them cook until done to your liking. Serve on toast or pita bread sprinkled with parsley and squeezed lemon juice.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat. Add white onion and cook until onions are tender and translucent 4-5 minutes. Add cabbage and cook for an additional 4-5 minutes until tender. Stir in rice and mix well with onion and cabbage mixture. Add water, tomatoes and salt and pepper to taste. Bring mixture to a boil and then cover the skillet with a tight fitting lid and reduce heat to low. Cook for 20 minutes or until rice is tender.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Brown ground beef and drain. Add spaghetti sauce. Add macaroni and mix well. Place in a casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with garlic bread.
Combine meatballs with ketchup, brown sugar and liquid smoke. Cook on stove over medium heat until heated through. Put meat mixture on sandwich buns. Top with onions and serve.

In a small saucepan melt the butter. Stir in flour and cayenne pepper. Bring to a boil and cook about one minute. Stir in milk and cheese until melted. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool. Form into small balls and roll in toasted pecans. Place on a baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes.

Combine sweetened condensed milk and bottled lemon juice. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese, vanilla extract and sugar until light and fluffy. Stir in cherry pie filling and pour into prepared crust. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and pour lemon mixture into center of pie. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Cool pie completely.

Combine gelatin powder with boiling water in medium bowl, stir to dissolve. Combine coffee and coffee powder in medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heatstir in gelatin mixture until dissolved. Strain coffee into large bowl. Refrigerate until cold. Beat cream in large bowl until soft peaks form. Gently fold cream into coffee mixture. Spoon into 6 (3/4-cup) dessert glasses or molds and refrigerate 2 hours or until set. Unmold onto dessert plates or serve in glasses. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Serves 6-8.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a 2 qt. baking dish or 9x13x2 pan, combine all the fruit in the pan. Mix together the bisquick, sugar and milk until smooth. Pour over fruit in pan. Bake 40 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Into large bowl measure all ingredients except granola cereal and chocolate chips. Beat on medium speed until well blended. Stir in cereal and chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes until lightly browned. Cool slightly before removed from pans onto wire rack.

Preheat oven to 400. Toss the green beans, tomatoes and onion in a bowl with the olive oil and toss well to coat. Sprinkle with fennel seed, hot pepper flakes and cumin. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a shallow baking dish. Roast for 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Transfer to a serving plate and sprinkle with parsley. Serve with warm crusty bread.

Combine all the ingredients in a medium size pot over medium high heat and cook until the apples are soft and the mixture is thick and clear. You can use this filling for apple pie, apple tarts or just pour it over vanilla ice cream.

Mix the sugar and sour cream in a saucepan. Stir constantly over low heat until the mixture thickens and bubbles. Stir in butter and white chocolate chips. Pour into a 9x13 inch pan. Spread marshmallow creme over the mixture. Top with walnuts. Cut into squares or use a pizza cutter to make rectangles.

Soak 1 package of bacon in hot tap water for 5 minutes to render some of the fat. Squeeze excess water out of bacon and crumble into small pieces. Heat 1 TBS vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook 5 minutes. Add bacon and cook 2 minutes longer. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes. Add cream cheese and cook 1 minute longer. Spoon 1/4 of mixture into each of 4 ungreased 6-inch pie plates. Bake at 400 degrees 10 minutes. Spoon remaining mixture over chicken in each plate. Bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Makes 4 servings.

Line an 8×8 inch pan with foil, letting it overhang the sides. Spray with cooking spray. Melt chocolate chips with butter or margarine in a large microwave safe bowl. Stir in the condensed milk. Spread into the pan. Sprinkle with the orange zest. Sprinkle with the pecans. Refrigerate 30 minutes or until firm. Lift foil with fudge attached out of the pan. Cut into squares. Store covered in the refrigerator.

Place cranberries in a saucepan with water to cover by about one inch. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then lower to a simmer and cook, uncovered for about twenty minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Place berries in a large strainer lined with cheese cloth over a large bowl. Tie off cloth and gather berries together. Let sit for about twenty minutes to drain juices. Put cranberry juice in a large bowl with sugar and cloves. Pour in orange juice. Add lemon juice. Let sit for about twenty minutes to infuse flavors. Pour through strainer into glasses filled with ice cubes and serve immediately.

Cut up the cabbage into very thin strips. Add the bell peppers to the cabbage, sprinkling on the pickling salt as you go. Let it sit for a few minutes while you prepare the other ingredients. In a large pot, combine the vinegar, water, sugar, hot pepper flakes, mustard seed and garlic cloves. Stir well. Add the cabbage and bell pepper mixture to the vinegar solution, then pack into sterilized jars, filling them right to the top with the brine solution. Tighten the lids firmly onto the jars. Refrigerate for several months before serving.

Mix cream cheese and sugar together in large bowl. Beat in eggs one at a time until smooth. Pour into pastry shells. Bake in pre-heated oven at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until center of the pie is set. Remove from oven and cool. Top with caramel ice cream topping and chopped pecans before serving.

Preheat the oven to 400f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and rosemary in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine the butter and buttermilk. Add the dry ingredients to the wet and gently stir to form a soft dough. Dump the dough onto a floured surface and gently knead a few times until it forms a soft dough. Pat it into a 6-inch circle. Cut the biscuits with a knife into 10 wedges. Place the biscuits on the baking sheet and brush with the milk. Sprinkle the top of each biscuit with the cheese. Bake until the biscuits are golden and puffy. Transfer the biscuits to a wire rack to cool. Makes 10 biscuits.

In a large bowl, cream together the shortening and sugars. Add the egg, molasses, vanilla, and spices. Beat until blended. Combine the flour, baking soda, salt and spicesgradually stir into the creamed mixture. Stir in the raisins and nuts. Drop by tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool on wire racks. Makes 4 dozen cookies.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in skillet over medium high heat. Cook chicken breasts 5 to 6 minutes per side. Remove chicken from pan. Add remaining tablespoon of butter to pan. Add onion and green peppersaute until tender. Add chicken and rice to pan. Add sour cream and salsa. Stir well. Serve over chicken. Sprinkle with cheese.

Spread mayo on both slices of bread. Place cheese on bottom slice of bread. Place tomatoes on top of cheese. Place ham on top of tomatoes. Top with lettuce. Place turkey on top of lettuce. Top with bacon. Top with top slice of bread. Cut sandwich into 4 wedges. Serve.

In a large bowl sift together flour, baking powder, soda and salt. Make a well in the center and add egg. Gradually add milk and sour cream to egg mixture. Stir just until smooth. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or heavy skillet over medium heat. Pour or scoop batter onto hot surface using 1/4 cup measuring cup or large spoon. Cook until bubbles break the surface. Turn and cook until golden brown. Makes 5 pancakes. Serve with butter and syrup.

Preheat the oven to 350F. Grease and flour a 9-inch square baking dish. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the maple syrup and butter and bring to a boil. Add the sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the egg and stir. Remove from the heat. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt and cinnamon. In a separate bowl combine the milk and vanilla. Add the milk mixture to the flour mixture and stir until just moist. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle the nuts on top of the batter. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the centre of the cake comes out clean. Let stand for 5 minutes before removing from the pan. Turn out onto a plate. Serve warm.

In a double boiler or in the microwave, cook the egg yolks slowly until thick and creamy. Meanwhile, bring the butter and the lemon juice just to boiling in a saucepan. When the butter has melted, pour the lemon juice into the eggs, beating constantly with a whisk or blender. Stir in the butter, one tablespoonful at a time and season with the lemon juice and white pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Mix together cornmeal, breadcrumbs, cayenne pepper, salt & freshly ground black pepper. Dip chicken into mustard then coat with mixture. Arrange on baking sheet. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Baste with honey mixture during baking.

Core apples leaving 1 inch of stem on each apple. Cut each apple in half and remove seeds. Set apple halves on baking sheet cut side down and sprinkle each half generously with cinnamon sugar. Place cut side of rolls around each apple half so that rolls completely encase apple halves. Using kitchen shears or scissors, cut each roll in half, leaving apple halves completely inside rolls. Bake in 400 degree oven until apples are tender about 20 minutes. Serve hot drizzled with orange juice and sprinkled with cinnamon sugar.

Thaw broccoli. In a saucepan, cook margarine and water chestnuts over medium heat until margarine is melted. Add soy sauce and bring to boil. Add broccoli. Cook until tender. Serve over rice or noodles.

Cut the eggplants lengthwise. Rub with the salt. Leave in a colander for 1 hour. Then wash the eggplants. Boil the eggplants for 10-15 minutes. Drain. Add the peppers to the eggplants. Cook for 15 minutes. Add garlic cloves. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Add the lemon juice. Serve hot with parsley.

Soak samp and beans for at least 8 hours or overnight. Drain and rinse well and place them together with the onion, potato and tomatoes in a large saucepan with enough water to cover everything. Add the bouillon cube and curry powder and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for at least an hour or until the beans and samp have broken down and are very soft and tender. Turn off heat and let stand for a few minutes to cool down. Serve warm with a dollop of sour cream or a bit of melted butter on top.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel parsnips and slice into thin ribbons using a mandoline or knife. Place parsnip ribbons in a mixing bowl with melted unsalted butter, sugar & salt. Mix well and transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes, tossing once halfway through. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a large bowl combine all the vegetables with olive oil, garlic salt, oregano, pepper and garlic. Toss to coat. Spread the vegetables out on a baking sheet and bake for 40 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with parsley.

Cook pasta in 2 quarts boiling salted water for 13 minutes or until al dente. Drain. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, stirring until fragrant (1 to 2 minutes). Add scallions and spinachcook until spinach is tender (3 to 4 minutes). Stir in pasta and cook until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in feta cheese. Season to taste with salt.

Brown beef in skillet. Add vegetables. Saute until vegetables are tender. Drain any excess fat. Add rice, soup mixes, seasoning and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer 30 minutes. Remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve with green onions.

Peel and core 5 pounds of apples and slice them into 1/4 inch thick slices. In a large pot or dutch oven combine the apples, 3/4 teaspoon of the salt, 1 tablespoon of the brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon of the cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon of the fresh ginger and the chopped garlic cloves. Bring to a boil over medium high heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until the apples have softened. In a blender or food processor combine the vinegar and remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt with the remaining 3/4 teaspoon fresh ginger and the chopped cloves and grind to a smooth puree. Pour the vinegar mixture into the pot and cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the remaining 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon and 1/2 teaspoon of the cloves.
Peel and grate cucumber. Place in colander to drain. Mix yogurt with cucumber and garlic. Add salt to taste. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

In saucepan melt butter over low heat. Add kielbasa and cook about 1 minute. Add flour and cook about 1 minute. Stirring constantly. Add milk and stir until smooth. Add vegetables. Add turkey. Season with salt and pepper. Divide meat mixture into pies crusts. Top each with second crust. Cut slits in the top crust. Brush top crusts with egg wash (egg yolk mixed with water). Bake at 375 for 40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 8x8x2 inch baking dish. Combine sour cream and cream cheese. Add asparagus spears. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Combine horseradish, mustard and seasonings. Spread over asparagus. Bake 20-30 minutes. Garnish with green onions.

Melt butter in medium saucepan. Add sugar and stir over medium heat until mixture boils. Add in cream cheese. Stir until smooth. Add cool whip and strawberry jell-o. Beat until well blended and add boiling water. Fold in frozen strawberries. Pour mixture over pretzels in baking dish. Refrigerate until chilled.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Combine cream cheese spread with chicken and bacon in a bowlspread into an 8-inch tortilla. Sprinkle with salsaroll up tightly. Place the rollups on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven.

In a 3-quart saucepan, heat the butter over medium heat until it is melted and bubbly. Add the water, increase the heat to high, and bring to a boil. Add the polenta and stir. Reduce the heat to medium. Cook for 5 minutes until the polenta has thickened. Stir in the mushrooms, parmesan cheese, half-and-half, salt, and pepper. Remove from the heat. Pour into a serving dish and serve. Makes 4 servings.
Bring to a boil the brewed tea and sugar. Add the sliced peaches. Cover tightly and let steep for 5 minutes. Strain tea into a pitcher. Chill at least 2 hours. Serve over ice.

Wash beans and place in a large pot. Cover beans with chicken broth. Add the bacon (fat, too), red pepper flakes, and salt. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Drain liquid from beans (if there is any) and place the beans in a pot to the side. Add water (if needed) to the broth that was drained from the beans. Add the beans to the pot. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until the beans are tender. Do not overcook. Remove the pot from the heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
