Remove the beans from the pot with a slotted spoon into a serving bowl. Serve immediately.

Combine peanut butter, milk and egg with mixer. Add vanilla. Mix well. Stir in baking mix. Spread into a greased and floured 9 inch by 13 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Melt chocolate and butter in microwave. Stir until smooth. Pour over bars and let cool. Cut into bars.

Dry the fish thoroughly. Coat each fillet with the coriander seeds. Season with salt. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan or skillet over medium heat. Add the fish and fry for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Add the vinegar and water. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Serve with sliced lemon or lime wedges.

Place onion soup mix into crock pot. Sprinkle over meat and season with paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, oregano and basil. Add beef broth. Cover and cook on low 8-10 hours. Slice roast and serve over noodles or mashed potatoes. Mmmmmm!

In a small bowl, combine the mayo with the scallion and purple onion. Add the shredded Jarlsberg and mix until smooth. Spread over the top of the bagel tops. Broil in the oven until the cheese is bubbly and starting to brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except pie crust. Spoon into a lightly greased 10 inch pie pan. In a separate bowl, combine ingredients for pie crust and roll out onto a floured surface. Cut into 4 inch circles with a cookie cutter or glass. Place dough circles over filling. Fold edges of crust to form a rim. Press edges firmly together to seal. Place tarts onto a parchment paper lined cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes in preheated oven, or until crust is golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Yields 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Blind bake the pie shell for 15 minutes. Beat the cream cheese and cream together until smooth. Add the chicken base, Tabasco Sauce and tarragon. Beat until blended. Fold in the spinach and cheeses. Pour the mixture into the pie shell. Bake for 30 minutes. Reduce temperature to 300 degrees. Bake for an additional 15 minutes. Allow to cool completely before cutting.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl mix together the oil and vinegar. Add the sugar substitute and season with the salt and pepper to taste. In a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish toss the cabbage with the vinegar mixture. Add the soy sauce and mix well. Bake for 20 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Combine the cabbage with the carrot and green onions. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with the chopped green onions and serve.

Blend yogurt and garlic in food processor. Add mustard and process until smooth. Place lemon juice in small bowl. Dip chicken legs in lemon juice and then into yogurt mixture. Press coating into both sides of the legs. Coat in corn flake crumbs and then in breadcrumbs. Place in single layer on baking sheet. Refrigerate 15 minutes. Preheat oven to 400. Bake chicken until golden brown and cooked through, 15-20 minutes. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and season with the salt and pepper. Cook until the mushrooms begin to soften. Remove from the heat. Arrange the mushrooms in 1 layer on the pizza crust. Sprinkle with the mozzarella and the basil. Bake at 425f degrees for 10 minutes. Top with the tomatoes and the oregano. Bake 3 to 5 minutes longer, or until the cheese is melted.
Cook potatoes and hamburger together. Drain. Add can of vegetable soup and can of cream of mushroom soup. Stir well and add potato chips on top and bake for about 30 minutes.

Cook pasta according to directions on package. Drain and reserve 1/3 cup of the pasta water. Place the pasta, rosemary and garlic flakes into a large serving bowl. Add the reserved water and olive oil and toss to coat. Add the ricotta and tomatoes. Toss again to blend. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Makes 4 servings.
Heat oil over medium heat. Add potatoes. Cook until lightly browned on both sides. Add garlic. Continue cooking for 2-3 minutes. Add bell peppers. Cook until soft. Serve with butter or sour cream.

In large nonstick skillet cook bacon over medium heat, stirring occasionally, 8 minutes or until crisp. Remove bacondrain on paper towelscrumble. Add onion to drippingssauté 2 minutes or until tender. Add cream cheesecook and stir 1 minute or until melted. Remove from heatstir in Worcestershire Sauce, mustard, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and Worcestershire Sauce. Cut off stems of mushroomsdiscard stems. Spoon mushroom mixture evenly into mushroom capstop evenly with bacon. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

Pick over the plums to be sure they are clean and dry inside and out. Put them in a non-aluminum pot and pour in the water. Bring to a boil and then cover and simmer for 1 hour or longer. When they are very soft, add the sugar and the butter to the pan. Cook over medium heat and stir constantly for about 10 minutes or until the mixture is thick enough to coat a wooden spoon with a thin film of the mixture. Let the butter cool for about 10 minutes and then beat with an electric mixer. Add the orange rind and juice and beat until blended well. Pour the butter into a serving bowl and cover with wax paper directly on the surface of the butter. Refrigerate and serve as is or spread on toast or crackers. Makes 3 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 2 9-inch cake pans. In a large bowl, stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Using a pastry blender or two knives, cut butter into flour mixture until it resembles coarse meal. Make a well in the centre of the mixture. In a small bowl, lightly beat egg and stir it into the milk. Stir into flour mixture until just combined. Gently stir in raisins. Divide dough evenly into two portions. On a lightly floured surface, pat each portion into a 7-inch circle. Cut each circle into 8 wedges. Place wedges, cut side down, 1/2-inch apart on prepared baking sheets. Brush with milk. Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Serve with butter and strawberry jam.

Peel potatoes and cut into very thin sticks. Place in boiling water and boil for 5 minutes. Remove and run under cold water. Place in large mixing bowl and add canola oil and spray. Place on cookie sheet and spread evenly. Bake for about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with lemon pepper and kosher salt.

Mix together 1/2 cup of cornbread with 1 cup of soft bread crumbs, 1/2 cup of minced celery, 1/4 cup of minced onion and 3/4 teaspoon of poultry seasoning. Chop 2 hard-boiled eggs and add them to the mixture. Mix well with a fork. Combine 1 egg, 2 1/2 cups of turkey broth and 3/4 teaspoon of poultry seasoning in a large saucepan. Heat until mixture reaches a boil, then lower heat to medium-low. Put the cornbread mixture into the saucepan and stir to combine. Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pan. Let the dressing cook for 30 minutes or until it has absorbed all of the broth in the pan.

Lightly beat egg white. Add the nuts in one layer, then sprinkle with the sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until nuts are lightly browned. Combine cinnamon, cayenne pepper and salt. Toss nuts in seasoning.

Drain pork and beans and add the beans to the can of pork and beans. Add onions and smoked bacon and heat to boiling point. Stir in catsup and barbecue sauce, then add brown and white sugar to taste. Cook until sugar dissolves and the mixture is slightly thickened. Serve hot.

Cut green beans in half lengthwise and set aside. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add green beans and salt. Cook for 5 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add lemon juice and zest. Toss and serve immediately. Serves 4.

Beat cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth. Add condensed milk and sugar and mix until well combined. Add baking powder, baking soda and cornstarch. Stir in lemon juice and vanilla. Fold in sour cream. Pour into a graham cracker crust. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until set. Refrigerate for 3 hours before serving.

In a large skillet, melt the butter. Add the kielbasa and cook over moderate heat, turning, until browned all over. Add the mustard and stir. Add the beer and bring to a boil. Add the cabbage and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until the cabbage is softened and the liquid has evaporated, about 15 minutes. Season the cabbage and kielbasa with salt and pepper and serve.

Season the chicken with thyme, garlic salt and pepper. Dip the chicken breasts in milk then breadcrumbs. Place in a baking dish and bake in oven for 20 minutes or until cooked through and golden brown. Remove from oven and place each breast on a slice of pesto spread mozzarella cheese on top and top with parmesan cheese. Broil until the cheese is golden brown and bubbly.

In large bowl, combine shrimp, spices, ketchup, worcestershire, honey, green onions, garlic cloves, lime juice and cilantro. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Thread shrimp onto skewers. Grill over medium heat for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes per side or until done. Brush with lime juice during last 2 minutes of cooking. Sprinkle with cilantro.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Whisk together sour cream and lemon juice in a small bowl until smooth. Whisk in Worcestershire and celery seed. Toss together chicken and breadcrumbs. Dip chicken into sour cream mixturethen roll in breadcrumbs. Place chicken in a 13×9 baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 30-35 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Makes 4 servings.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Combine peanut butter and soy sauce in a bowl. Add sugar and whisk until smooth. Heat 1 tbsp oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and stir-fry 30 seconds until fragrant. Add noodles and cook 1 minute. Add sauce and stir-fry 1 minute. Add sesame oil and stir-fry until warmed through. Sprinkle with peanuts and serve immediately with chili oil and cilantro.

Crumble the bread with your hands into a bowl. Add the spaghetti. Stir in the broccoli. In a separate bowl combine the oil, butter, lemon juice, cumin, and garlic. Pour the mixture over the spaghetti mixture. Toss gently until thoroughly mixed. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serves 6 - 8.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook onions until soft and translucent 5 minutes. Stir in lentils and saut for 2 minutes. Pour in wine, cook until evaporated about 30 seconds. Stir in broth, saffron, prosciutto, thyme, bay leaves, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and simmer over medium heat until lentils are tender 30-40 minutes. Stir in parsley. Serve over rice with parmesan cheese if desired. Serves 8-10.

Place the garbanzo beans in the bowl of the food processor. Add the garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, ricotta cheese, salt, black pepper, allspice, and parsley. Process until smooth. Transfer to an airtight container or serving bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours. Serve with raw vegetables or as a dip for pita bread.

In a small bowl, combine cilantro and onion. Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper and dip in cilantro mixture. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil until shimmering. Add chops and brown on both sides. Add cumin and chili powder and cook until meat is no longer pink. Add tomatoes and simmer 10 minutes. Serve with rice.

In a saucepan, bring cream to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in raspberries. Let stand for 15 minutes. Chill in refrigerator until ready to use. In a small bowl or cup, stir together powdered sugar and kirsch. Spoon raspberry mixture into chilled dessert glasses. Spoon a small amount of the topping over each glass. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.
Combine black beans, corn, rotel. Top with sour cream. Serve in tortillas.

Grease a 13 x 9 baking dish with butter. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine flour, baking powder, cinnamon, kosher salt in a bowl. Whisk together the brown sugar, eggs and vanilla extract in a bowl until smooth. Add the sugar mixture to the flour mixture and stir to combine. Pour into the baking dish. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes. Let cool completely. Spread the topping over the bars and bake for 5 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Roll out dough into a 12x8 inch rectangle on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Spread half of the pizza sauce in a thin layer on the dough. Top with remaining ingredients. Fold dough over and pinch to seal. Bake 25 minutes. Cool slightly before slicing.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wrap beets tightly in foil. Roast for 1 hour, or until tender when pierced with a knife. Unwrap and let cool slightly. Peel and chop beets into a large bowl and toss with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine the cream, sour cream and horseradish. Add beets and onion, tossing well. Add lettuce and dill. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to one day ahead. Makes 4 servings.

Toss the asparagus spears with the peppers and onions. Spray skillet with cooking spray. Saute vegetable mixture for about 4 minutes or until asparagus are crisp tender. Stir artichoke hearts into vegetable mixture. Heat through. Toss with balsamic vinegar just before serving.

In medium saucepan, combine brown sugar and butter and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture boils and sugar is dissolved. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add evaporated milk and vanilla and cook for additional 2 minutes or until smooth. Remove from heat and add powdered sugar and nuts. Stir well and pour into a greased 11 x 7 inch dish. Chill for 2 hours and cut into squares.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Slice the sweet potatoes into 1/4 inch rounds. Toss the potato rounds with the butter. Sprinkle evenly with the adobo sauce and the chipotle. Roast in the preheated oven until tender and golden brown, about 30 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper.To make the chipotle honey butter, stir together the butter and honey in a small bowl. Stir in the chipotle. Season to taste. Serve the potatoes topped with the chipotle honey butter. Makes 6 servings.

Prepare cauliflower florets by rinsing them under cool water. In a large stock pot heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic cloves, celery ribs, diced tomatoes, red curry paste and saute for 4-5 minutes. Add vegetable broth to the pot. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Add cauliflower florets. Cover the pot. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat. Add coconut milk and milk. Stir to combine. Puree the mixture using an immersion blender. Return to the heat. Simmer for 3-5 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sift together the flour, baking powder, and kosher salt into a bowlset aside. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heatstir in the brown sugar until dissolved. Stir the eggs into the butter mixture one at a time, whisking after each addition to incorporatestir in the almond extract. Remove the mixture from the heat, then stir in the flour mixture until well blended. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dishsmooth the top with the back of a spoon. Bake for 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top is golden brown. Sprinkle the almonds over the top of the brownies after removing from the oven. Allow to cool to room temperature before cutting into squares.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Beat egg, milk and margarine together. Add honey. Mix dry ingredients. Add wet. Mix until just moist. Fold in apple. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Serve with ice cream.

Place pork ribs in crock pot. In a bowl combine cream of mushroom soup with lipton onion soup mix. Pour over ribs. Cover with lid. Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. During the last 15 minutes of cooking time add carrots and fresh mushrooms. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with potato salad or coleslaw. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line the bottom and sides of a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooked rice. Layer half of chicken evenly over the rice. Top with tomatoes and 1/2 cup soup. Sprinkle with half the cheese. Layer with remaining chicken and remaining tomatoes. Spoon soup evenly over chicken. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. In a small bowl, combine stuffing mix and margarine until blended. Spread evenly over rice. Bake 40 minutes or until chicken is tender and mixture is heated through. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Boil potatoes until tender. While potatoes are cooking cook the egg whites. When potatoes are done drain them and place in a large bowl. Mash with a potato masher until smooth or use a food processor. While potatoes are still warm add in all other ingredients except the chopped parsley, green onions & tuna in water. Stir until well mixed. If needed add some more lemon juice. Cool completely. Chill overnight or for at least 4 hours to let flavors develop. Right before serving mix in tuna, green onions & parsley. Serve with lettuce leaves & tomatoes.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook pork until browned, stirring occasionally, about 4 minutes. Add green onions and gingercook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add broth and cayennebring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes or until pork is cooked through. Stir in soy sauce and pastacook 4 minutes or until pasta is tender. Stir in mung bean sproutscook 1 minute or until heated through.

Cook vermicelli in boiling water 5 minutes or until tenderdrain and set aside. In a 3-quart saucepan cook rice and 1 teaspoon of salt in boiling water to cover 20 minutes or until tenderdrain and rinse with cold water. Melt butter in a 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Add ricecook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add vermicellicook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add brothcook 1 minute or until heated through, stirring constantly. Stir in saffroncook 1 minute or until heated through, stirring constantly. Add almondscook 1 minute or until heated through. Sprinkle with seasoning salt before serving.

Mix spinach, muenster cheese and onion together. Add low fat cottage cheese and mix well. Add beaten eggs and parmesan cheese. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Bake about 35 minutes until set. Garnish with pimiento strips. Serve hot or cold. Serves 4.
Puree yogurt with cider. Add cinnamon and apples. Chill. Combine with celery, pears, grapes and raisins. Top with lettuce leaves. Sprinkle with nuts. Serve as a main dish salad or a side.

Place egg in a small bowl and add a little cold water. Beat well. Combine vinegar, sugar and mustard in a separate bowl. Add the flour gradually. Continue beating until thick. Add the warm water and beat until smooth. Add the egg slowly. Cook in double boiler until thick. Cool slightly. Add the salt and pepper. Serve over lettuce.

Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F/Gas Mark 4. Peel apples and cut in half. Remove seeds and core. Cut each half into quarters. Add to a saucepan with sugar, butter, breadcrumbs, cinnamon and 250ml/9fl oz water. Simmer for 1 hour. Whisk cream until firm peaks form. Fold in lemon juice. Spoon over pudding. Dust with icing sugar and scatter with hazelnuts.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and onioncook until onion is translucent. Add chicken broth to skillet, stirring to combine. Add tortellini and cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes with juicestir to combine. Cook for 2 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wiltedabout 1 minute. Stir in parmesan cheesecook for 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Combine cheese, mayonnaise, and sauces in a medium bowl. Spread 1/3 cup mixture over a sheet of wax paper. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup cheese. Top with 1/3 of the bacon. Repeat procedure twice. Roll up the paper around the cheese mixture. Place the seam side down in a shallow dish. Top with the green onions and pecans. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into 1/3" slices. Serve with crackers.

Crush chocolate and mint cookies together until fine crumbs are formed. Combine cookies with cream cheese until well mixed. Add green food coloring until desired color is achieved. Spread into pie crust. Chill until ready to serve. Top with chocolate and mint cookies and whipped topping. Garnish with mint leaves and chocolate curls.

Melt the unsweetened chocolate in a saucepan. In another saucepan bring the coconut milk and egg yolks to a boil. Remove from heat. Add the chocolate and mix well. Put the mixture back in the saucepan and heat over low heat until it thickens to the consistency of mousse. Stir in the vanilla and salt. Chill until ready to serve.

In a small skillet heat butter until it melts. Add shrimp and season with paprika, salt and cayenne pepper to taste. Cook for 3 minutes on each side over medium high heat or until shrimp are firm and opaque. Add lemon juice and serve hot or cold. Serve over rice or noodles or any pasta you like.

Lightly spray a 9 inch pie plate with cooking spray. Arrange zucchini slices in a single layer. Top with mozzarella cheese. Beat egg with a fork and brush over zucchini and cheese. Sprinkle with onion. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until zucchini is tender.

Scoop out avocado flesh and place in a food processor. Add lime juice, avocado, nutmeg, and cayenne pepper. Pulse until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. In a large pot, bring broth to a boil. Add avocado mixture and whisk until smooth. Remove from heat and add heavy cream. Serve warm.

Heat a grill over a fire of charcoal. Brush the grill grate with oil. Remove the seeds and veins from the poblanos. Brush the poblanos with the oil. Grill the poblanos over the direct heat, turning once, until the skin is charred black all over. Transfer to a paper bag. Let stand until cool enough to handle. Remove the peppers from the bag. Peel and seed the peppers. Coarsely chop the peppers. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over moderately high heat. Add the tomatillo, onion, shallots, and garlic and cook until the vegetables are softened. Add the cream and bring to a boil. Add the poblanos. Cook over moderately low heat for 15 minutes. Season the sauce with salt. Melt the butter in a large heavy skillet over moderately high heat. Add the shrimp. Cook until the shrimp are just opaque in the center. Transfer the shrimp to a platter. Spoon the sauce over the shrimp. Garnish with cilantro and serve.

Combine cake mix and water and mix well. Pour into a greased 9-inch round cake pan and bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely. Prepare jell-o gelatin dessert according to package directions. Pour into a large bowl and add rhubarb and sugar. Toss gently to combine. Spread on top of the cake. Sprinkle with toasted coconut and freeze. To toast the coconut, spread on a cookie sheet and place in a 300 degree oven until lightly browned. Cool completely.

In a large dutch oven over medium heat, brown chicken breasts in olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add potatoes, celery and soup mix. Add enough chicken broth to cover potatoes and chicken. Cover and cook for 20 minutes or until potatoes and chicken are tender. Remove chicken and shred. Discard skin and bone. Add peas and carrot and cook 3 additional minutes. In a small saucepan, heat cream of mushroom soup until it begins to boil. Add rice mix and continue to cook over medium heat until rice is cooked and soup is thickened and creamy, stirring constantly. Add shredded chicken and heat for 2 minutes. Serve with sour cream and cheddar cheese for topping.

Combine first 3 ingredients in a small bowlmix well and set aside. Cook chicken in a large skillet over med-high heat 4 min on each side or until doneremove from skillet. Stir teriyaki sauce, cornstarch mixture, water chestnuts, and carrot in the same skilletheat to boiling. Remove from heatstir in chicken. Combine rice noodles, lettuce leaves, and almonds in a large bowladd the chicken mixturetoss gently to coat. Garnish with green onions if desired. Serve with additional teriyaki sauce and soy sauce for dipping if desired.

Peel and seed the cucumber and grate it using the fine grating blade in a food processor. Place the grated cucumber in a large pitcher or glass and add the remaining ingredients. Stir well and chill in the refrigerator for about 2 hours or until well chilled. Serve over ice cubes.

Combine shortening, sugar, eggs, molasses, and sour milk. Add flour, soda and salt in small amounts alternating with enough sour milk until dough is smooth. Roll out 1/3 inch thick on lightly floured boardcut in desired shapes. Place on greased baking sheetbake in preheated 350f oven for 10 minutes or until light brown. Remove from baking sheet while still warmsprinkle frosting on top of each cookie. Makes about 3 dozen.
Remove the tops of the cherry tomatoes. Mash the inside with a fork to make a cavity. Divide the horseradish into the tomatoes. Replace the tops. Dot each tomato with a bit of bacon.

In a food processor combine all ingredients except tortillas. Pulse the mixture a few times until it is smooth. Remove from the processor and place into a bowl. Using a spatula spread the mixture onto tortillas. Cut into squares.

Remove the stems of the mushrooms and chop them finely. Melt the butter in a small skillet and saute the stems until they are soft. Set aside. In another pan saute the mushroom caps in a little butter until they are lightly browned. Spoon the mushroom stems in the mushroom caps. Fill the caps with chevre and sprinkle with the seasoned breadcrumbs. Put the mushrooms in an ovenproof dish. Top with the grated parmesan. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes.

Brown the lean ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat until well-brownedadd the onion, peppers, garlic powder, prepared yellow mustard, ketchup, brown sugar and Worcestershire saucebring mixture to a boil over medium-high heatsimmer over medium-low heat about 45 minutesstir occasionallyremove from heatallow to coolplace in a 2-quart casserole dishserve with buns.

In a medium skillet melt butter and add American cheese cubes. Stir until melted. Add cumin powder, garlic powder and rotel tomatoes & chilies stirring until well mixed. Transfer to a microwave safe bowl and place in microwave for 1 minute. Stir until smooth. Serve with chips or crackers.

Beat the eggs in a large mixing bowl until they are well mixed. Add the milk and beat again until well mixed. Add the butter, flour, cheese and seasonings and mix until smooth. Add the cooked chicken, creamed corn and parsley. Pour into a greased quiche dish and bake for 30 minutes until firm to the touch. Serve hot or cold.

Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a large pot or dutch oven over medium heat. Add onions and saute until soft and translucent. Add garlic and serrano and saute until softened, about 30 seconds. Stir in laos powder and continue to cook for 2 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add remaining 4 tablespoons of oil and lime juice. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 25 minutes. Add fish sauce and stir to combine. Add chicken and simmer until cooked through. Stir in lime juice and green onions. Ladle into bowls and garnish with green onions. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 f. Line a 9-inch square baking dish with aluminum foil. Prepare crust by combining oats and sugar. Mix in melted butter, and press the mixture evenly into the bottom of the baking dish. Bake for about 10 minutes. Cool completely, and then fill with peaches and cream. Mix the egg, sugar, and vanilla extract in a bowl until blended. Add the cream and beat until the mixture is well blended and slightly thickened. Pour evenly over the oat crust. Bake in the preheated oven for another 30 minutes, or until the custard is set and the top is lightly brown. Serves 6-8.

Season the smoked salmon with some salt and pepper. Heat butter and add eggs. Continue stirring until eggs are well scrambled. Add milk and continue stirring until milk is absorbed. Add smoked salmon and continue stirring for 1 minute. Spoon out into plates. Sprinkle with basil leaves. Serve with warm toast.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook onion and olive oil until onion is tender, about 5 minutes. Add the cooked rice, beans, corn, tomato sauce and chili powder. Stir to combine and cook 5 minutes longer, or until heated through. Pour mixture into a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Smooth top. Place polenta on top of rice mixture. Sprinkle top with cheese. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes or until polenta is browned on top.

Combine flour, sugars, nutmeg and salt in a large bowl. Set aside. Beat butter and egg together. Beat buttermilk, butter and egg mixture into dry mix until smooth. Heat oil in a deep fryer or deep heavy pan. Add doughnut batter by tablespoons. Fry 3-4 minutes. Turn and cook other side 3-4 minutes. Remove from oil with a slotted spoon. Let doughnuts drain on paper towels. Serve warm with icing.

Cream butter and sugar, add eggs and beat. Stir in banana. Stir in flour, baking powder and salt. Add nuts and raisins. Drop by teaspoonfuls on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Roll in powdered sugar. Makes 5 dozen.

In a small bowl stir together sugar, chili powder, pepper, cumin, paprika, salt and dry mustard. Set aside. Sprinkle salmon with salt. Place salmon in a shallow dish. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup of the dry rub mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Spray grill rack with cooking spray. Preheat grill to medium. Remove fish from marinade and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup dry rub mixture. Place fish on rack of preheated grill. Cook 5 minutes. Turn fish and cook 5 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Makes 4 servings.

Combine ginger, sesame oil, soy sauce, chinese wine, star anise, cinnamon stick in a sauce pan. Simmer for 1 minute. Add the chicken breasts. Cook for 10 to 12 minutes or until chicken is done. Add the bok choy. Cook for 2 minutes or until wilted. Stir in the brown sugar. Cook for 30 seconds. Serve over cooked rice.

Heat oil in a frying pan and fry the wings until they are light brown. Add the ginger and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the soya sauce and water and boil until the liquid reduces. Add the chilies and coriander and serve.

Puree the peaches in a food processor or blender. Add the gingerroot puree, soy sauce, sesame oil, and 3 tbsp. of water. Blend well. Place in refrigerator to chill. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat 2 tbsp. of canola oil in a large saut pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken to pan and cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side until browned. Remove chicken from pan and set aside. Add 1 tbsp. of canola oil to pan. Add the red onions and cook for 2 minutes. Add the chicken back to pan. Add 1/2 cup of chicken stock. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover pan with lid. Simmer 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Transfer chicken to platter. Add the reserved puree to pan. Cook 2 minutes or until puree is reduced by half. Pour puree over chicken. Top with toasted sesame seeds. Serve with rice.

Slice salmon to about 1 inch thick. Cut about 1 inch off each end of the bagel halves. Spread each bagel half with a thin layer of cream cheese. Top each with a thin slice of salmon. Sprinkle with green onion and parsley. Top with red caviar. Cut each bagel half into quarters. Serve with lemon wedges.

In large bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking soda and salt. Beat butter and sugars in large mixer bowl until creamy. Add eggsbeat well. Stir in vanilla and flour mixture. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Let cookies cool on baking sheets for 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 6 dozen cookies.

In a large saucepan, combine the potatoes and waterbring to a boil and cook until tender but not mushy. Drain the potatoes, return them to the saucepan and beat with the milk and the butter until smooth. Fold in the parsley and season with the salt and pepper. Transfer the potatoes to a serving dish and sprinkle with the cheese.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Meanwhile, combine soup, milk, cream cheese, mustard and pepper. Heat to boiling. Stirring constantly. Add frozen veggies to pasta mixture. Pour soup mixture over pasta. Toss to combine. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spray two 15 x 10 x 1-inch baking pans with cooking spray. Cut each pastry sheet into six 4-inch squares. Place 1 tablespoon mozzarella cheese on each square in a line down center of square, leaving 1/2-inch from each side of square. Arrange 3 green pepper slices crosswise over mozzarella. Place 4 slices smoked ham crosswise over green peppers. Place 1 pineapple slice crosswise over ham. Sprinkle with oregano leaves. Fold one side of pastry over filling to form triangle. Fold opposite side over to meet first side and press firmly together to seal pastry. Repeat with remaining pastry squares. Place pastry triangles seam side down on baking pans. Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. Makes 36 appetizers (2 per serving).

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease muffin pans or line with paper liners. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. In a medium bowl, combine milk and eggs and beat until well mixed. Add the milk mixture to the flour mixture and stir just until combined. Add oil and mix until just combined. Stir in almond extract and poppy seeds just until combined. Spoon into prepared muffin cups. Bake for about 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

In a saucepan, combine all of the dry ingredients and the soymilk. Bring to a boil and stir constantly until the mixture thickens. Add vanilla and stir in the sugar to taste. Serve immediately in a cup.
Dissolve gelatin in water. Add sugar and salt to taste. Cool. Add mayonnaise and lemon juice. Fold in sauce and oranges. Put in a mold. Chill and serve with walnuts.

In a large pot with a lid over medium heat, cook the bacon until crisp& brown the chicken pieces on all sides in the drippings. Add the onions& carrots and cook until softened, stirring occasionally. Add the potatoes& sweet potatoes and cook for a few minutes until the potatoes have begun to brown on the outside. Add the corn& water& stir to combine& bring to a boil& cook for 8 minutes or until the vegetables are tender but not mushy. Stir in the milk& the cinnamon& salt& pepper to taste. Cook over medium heat until the milk thickens slightly& heat through. Serve with hot cornbread or crackers & fresh parsley. Serve in large bowls & garnish each serving with the bacon & the chicken thighs. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). In a small bowl, combine the chili powder, cinnamon, cumin and pepperset aside. In another small bowl, combine the brown sugar and Tabasco sauceset aside. Trim any excess fat from the tenderloin and discard. Combine the oil with the spices and brown sugar/Tabasco mixturerub the spice mixture evenly onto all sides of the tenderloin. Place on a shallow baking dish and bake for about 25 minutes or until an instant-read thermometer reads 145 degrees f (63 degrees c). Let rest for 15 minutes and serve. Serves 4-6.

Shred the squash and onions in the food processor or shred them by hand. Mix the shredded squash and onions, add the egg whites and salt and pepper. Mix well. Form into small patties and fry in oil. Serve hot.

Boil the potatoes until they are tender. Cut them up and set aside. Mash the other potatoes in the bowl of the mixer. Add the onion and the miracle whip. Mix until blended. Add the russet potatoes. Add the vinegar, salt and pepper. Mix well. Add the dill weed. Serve.

Heat oil in skillet and saute garlic until fragrant but not browned (about 1 minute). Add brussels sprouts and cauliflower and toss to coat with garlic oil. Season with salt and pepper. Pour in stock and cover the pan, cooking on medium-low heat until vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in capers and lemon zest and juiceremove from heat. Transfer vegetables to platter and keep warm while making the butter. In medium bowl, combine butter and mustard with the minced garlic and parsley. Taste and adjust seasonings with more salt and pepper if needed. Spread the warm vegetables with the butter and serve immediately.

Bring water to boil in medium saucepan. Add cabbage & cook 20 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add bacon & cook until crisp. Stir in sausagecook until browned. Add cabbage mixture & heat through. Add salt & pepper.

Preheat oven to 350. Wash pumpkin and butternut squash thoroughly, and cut them in half. Scrape out seeds and place the flesh cut side up on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 1 hour or until squash is soft. Transfer to a large pot and add chicken broth and spices. Bring to a boil over high heat and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 20 minutes or until flavours are melded. Using a blender or a food processor, purée the mixture until smooth. Stir in evaporated milk and return to a simmer. Serve in bowls topped with cinnamon whipped cream. Garnish with diced pumpkin and parsley if desired.

Place garbanzo beans on a rimmed baking sheet with olive oil. Place pan in oven and bake at 375 f for 30 minutes or until beans are crisp and golden brown. Remove from oven and add roasted garlic cloves to beans. Combine cumin, cayenne pepper, thyme and olive oil. Drizzle over beans and toss together gently. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with feta cheese sprinkled over the top.

Mix 1 cup margarine with 2 1/2 cups of graham cracker crumbs, then add 4 eggs, 1/4 cup powdered sugar, 1/2 tsp vanilla, 1/3 cup milk, 1 1/2 cup of crushed pineapple (reserving 1 cup for top), 1/2 cup of sliced banana (reserving 1/4 cup for top) and mix until well blended. Pour into a 9x13 greased baking dish. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. Cool slightly. Frost with frozen whipped topping, then sprinkle with pecans and top with reserved banana slices and cherries. Serves 8-10.

In a large skillet, saute the ground beef with the onions and green peppers until the beef is browned. Add the colby cheese. Remove from heat. Place 1 tsp of cooked rice in the center of each eggroll wrapper. Place about 1/4 cup of the meat mixture in the center of the wrapper. Fold the wrapper up and around the meat mixture, pleating the wrapper as you go. Place the wrapped meat in the skillet with the sauce. Brown until all sides are browned. Drain. Serve with sweet and sour sauce.

Combine the sugar and cornstarch in a heavy saucepan. Add the water and stir over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Bring the mixture to a boil and boil over medium heat for 3 minutes or until it becomes a clear syrup. Remove from heat. Add the butter and salt and stir until the butter melts. Add the drink mix and stir until it is evenly blended. Pour the mixture onto a lightly greased baking sheet and allow to cool completely. Once the mixture is completely cooled break into pieces. Place in a single layer on a baking sheet and place in the freezer for 3 hours or until it becomes hard.
Mix together coleslaw and dill. Spread mustard on one side of rolls. Top with salami and coleslaw mixture. Add havarti cheese to the other side of rolls. Cut rolls in half and serve.

Sprinkle chicken breasts with curry powder. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high. Add chicken and brown on each side. Add apples and celery. Cook until chicken is done. Mix honey and raisins. Add to chicken and cook until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley.

Prepare the bell peppers by cutting off the top. Remove the seeds and pith. Reserve the top. In a large skillet over medium heat cook the onions in 1 tablespoon of oil for 5 minutes. Add the lamb, pine nuts, raisins, allspice, cinnamon, salt & pepper to taste. Cook until lamb is browned. Drain any fat. Stuff the peppers with the mixture. Place the tops on the peppers. Bake in the oven at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until peppers are tender. Serve with lemon juice.
Mix cornmeal and salt and slowly add whole milk to make a mush consistency. Serve with warm butter.
Peel cucumbers and slice thinly. Combine sour cream, freshly chopped chives and a little salt and pepper. Spread on cucumber slices. Serve cold.

Melt butter in a large heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Stir in sugar. Bring to a boil and boil 3 minutes. Stir in baking soda. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Pour over popcorn. Spread onto two cookie sheets. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 for 30 minutes. Stir often. Cool completely. Store in airtight container. Makes 2-1/2 pounds.

Cut up chicken, celery and green onion into chunks. Put in large mixing bowl. Add lemon juice, mayo, relish, prepared mustard, salt and pepper. Mix well. Garnish with hard-boiled egg cubes if desired.

Cook potatoes in salted water until fork tender. Drain and cool slightly. Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Place in large bowl and toss with celery and green onions. Mix ham with mayonnaise and add to potatoes. Add lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve chilled.

Peel the stalks of the asparagus. Blanch them in boiling water for 2 - 3 minutes. Remove from water and immediately plunge into cold water. Drain. In a pan melt the butter. Add the mushrooms and saute for a couple of minutes. Add the shallots and cook until soft. Add the asparagus to the pan and cook for a few minutes until crisp tender. Season with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Serve with coriander.

Melt the marshmallows in a double boiler. Stir in the milk. Fold in the crushed pineapple. Chill until ready to use. Layer marshmallow pudding between graham crackers. Top with whipped cream. Makes 8 servings.

Cook rice in milk until soft. Add vanilla and butter. Remove from heat and beat together egg yolks and sugar until mixture is smooth. Add this mixture back into pudding. Pour into greased pie plate or dish and bake at 375 until set about 30 minutes. Cool completely and place in fridge for at least four hours. To serve sprinkle with sugar and torch with a blow torch (optional).

Drain the tuna from the can. In a large bowl mix the tuna with the corn. Add the green onions and the pepper. Pre- heat a sandwich maker. Spread the mixture into 2 slices of the bread. Cook the sandwiches in the sandwich maker for 3 minutes. Serve hot.

In a small bowl combine sugar and corn syrup. In another small bowl combine almonds and butterstir until well mixed. Add sugar and corn syrup mixture and stir until well mixedpress into an ungreased 9 x 13 inch pancool. Cut into squares. Makes about 3 dozen pieces.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Grease a deep dish pie plate or 9 x 13 glass baking dish. In a bowl mix cream cheese and eggs until blended. Stir in heavy cream, parmesan cheese, italian seasoning and garlic powder until well blended. Spread evenly into prepared baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with pizza cheese and mozzarella cheese. Bake until cheeses are melted and the edges of the quiche are golden brown. Cut into wedges. Makes 12 servings.

To make the filling, melt the bittersweet chocolate with the corn syrup and brown sugar in a sauce pan over low heat until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is shiny. Remove from the heat and add the egg yolks and vanilla. Whisk well until the mixture is smooth and thick. Beat the egg whites to soft peaks in a clean bowl, then gradually beat in the salt. Gently fold the egg whites into the chocolate mixture until just combined. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until the filling has thickened slightly. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Spoon the filling into the tart shells. Bake for 20 minutes or until the filling is set. Allow the tart shells to cool completely before removing them from the tart pans. Garnish with whipped cream if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Melt butter in skillet and saute the onion and peppers until soft. Add the corn and cook until tender. Add the broth and wine and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Arrange scallops on top. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over the vegetables.

Preheat the oven to 180c/350f/gas mark 4. Heat a frying pan and add the duck and garlic. Fry until the duck is browned all over and the garlic is crisp and golden. Put the duck in a roasting tin and add the remaining ingredients except the cornflour. Cover the tin with foil and roast for one hour and fifteen minutes or until the duck is cooked through and the juices run clear when pierced with a knife. Remove from the tin and set aside for five minutes before slicing and serving with steamed rice and stir fried vegetables.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Peel and cut sweet potatoes into wedges about 3/4-inch thick. Place in a large bowl, add oil and toss to coat. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Spread potatoes evenly in a single layer on a large baking sheet and bake 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine apple slices and next 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Drain sweet potatoes and toss with apple mixture. Drizzle with 1/3 cup butter. Bake 10 minutes. Toss and bake 10 minutes more.

In a large bowl combine salad greens and green onions. Toss to combine. In a small bowl whisk together oil, vinegar and fresh lemon juice. Season with rosemary, salt and pepper. Pour over salad. Top with shrimp and tomatoes. Top with crumbled feta cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, saute onion in olive oil until softened. Add garlic and saute 1 minute. Add bell pepper, chili peppers, and cilantro leaves. Reduce heat. Cook 15 minutes or until soft. Serve as a sauce for meat, fish or rice. Or add a bit of water and cook down until it thickens. Use as a base for soups. May be frozen.

Brown kielbasa in skillet. Add scallions and cook 1 minute longer. Add the rice and cook 3 minutes more. Stir in the beef broth and the frozen vegetables. Cook over medium heat until the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the frozen broccoli and cook 5 minutes more. Season with the garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste. Serves 3 to 4.

Preheat the oven to 350F. Sift the flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Cream the butter and sugar together and add the vanilla essence. Beat in the eggs and milk. Combine the dry ingredients and add to the wet ingredients. Stir just until combined. Do not overmix. Divide the batter among the muffin cups. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-17 minutes or until the tops spring back when touched lightly. Let the muffins cool for 5 minutes in the pan before removing them. To make the glaze, combine the jam and powdered sugar. Drizzle over the cooled muffins.

Rub carrots and onions with salt and set aside. Place vinegar, water, jalapeños, garlic and oregano in a large pot. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add carrots and onions. Reduce heat to low and cook for 15 minutes. Drain and pack in hot jars. Cool to room temperature. Once cooled, add oil to cover, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Wipe rim of jars with a clean, wet paper towel. Center lid over jar and screw band down until resistance is felt. Process in a boiling water bath for 15 minutes. Remove from canner and let rest undisturbed for 12 hours. Store in a cool dark place. Carrots will keep refrigerated for up to one month.

Lay the lamb racks flat on cutting board and cut in half lengthwise. Trim all excess fat from the lamb and sprinkle with black pepper and paprika. Heat a skillet and add breadcrumbs and olive oil until crumbs are golden brown. Place in bowl and set aside. On cutting board sprinkle fresh parsley and basil and lay lamb racks on top. Drizzle with lite olive oil. Cover with breadcrumbs and sprinkle with garlic and basil. Refrigerate for one hour. Remove from refrigerator and place in oven for one hour or until tender and done.
Brown hash browns in frying pan with butter. Add garlic powder to taste. When hash browns are cooked through, add half-and-half to the pan to heat through. Serve.

In mixer bowl, cream together butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla until well blended. Combine flour, salt and baking soda. Blend into creamed mixture. Stir in oats and chocolate chips by hand. Drop by teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on pan for one minute then transfer to wire rack. Makes about 50 cookies.

Marinate steaks in refrigerator in marinade for 1 hour or up to 4 hours. Remove steaks from marinade. Reserve marinade. Heat grill. Coat steaks with remaining marinade. Grill steaks 1 minute on each side. Turn and grill 1 minute on each side. Continue to turn and grill steaks until done to your liking. Serve with remaining marinade on side.

To make the cream cheese spread: blend cream cheese with a little mayonnaise. To assemble sandwiches: Spread 1 tsp of the cream cheese mixture onto 2 of the tortillas. Divide the ham and swiss cheese between the 2 tortillas. Top with lettuce, pineapple preserves. Roll up the tortillas. Slice in half. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease muffin cups or line them with paper cups. In a large bowl, combine the flour, rolled oats, baking powder and soda and set aside. In another bowl, cream together the butter and sugar. Beat in the egg and mashed bananas. Stir in the dry ingredients just until moistened. Fold in the raisins and walnuts if using. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups, filling each about three-quarters full. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until muffins are golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the center of a muffin. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat and add the onion and the bell pepper and cook for a couple of minutes or until the vegetables are softened. Stir in the garlic and cook for about another minute or until fragrant. Add the tomatoes, the water and the salt and pepper to taste. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the tomatoes have softened and the water has evaporated and add the eggs and stir the mixture. Cover and cook for another 2-3 minutes or until the eggs are just set and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Core the apples and remove seeds. Cut into thin wedges and place in a large bowl. Combine splenda and water in a small bowl and add to the apples. Add the margarine and cinnamon. Toss to coat apples. Transfer to a shallow 2-quart baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Toss together the cabbage, carrots and onion. In small mixing bowl, combine the pine nuts and raisins and set aside. In a separate small mixing bowl combine the mayonnaise, malt vinegar and mustard. In another small mixing bowl combine the sugar and salt and pepper. Toss the dressing mixture with the cabbage and carrots. Add the pine nuts and raisins. Chill and serve.

In a medium bowl beat heavy cream until stiff peaks form. Add coffee. Fold in vanilla extract and sugar. Fold in chocolate. Pour into individual cups or a glass serving bowl. Refrigerate until set. Top with shaved chocolate and chocolate candy bar pieces.
Cook chicken, broccoli, mushrooms, and Alfredo Sauce in a saucepan. Pasta in another pan. Combine all ingredients into one pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together the first five ingredients. Add the shortening and vanilla. Beat the eggs and add to the mixture. Add the nuts. Bake in a greased 8-inch square pan for 25-30 minutes or until the center is set. Makes about 12-15 squares.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Cut the sage leaves in half and lay 1 half on each piece of chicken. Season the chicken with the pepper and sprinkle the other half of the sage over the top of the chicken. Wrap each piece of chicken with a slice of ham. Place the sage halves on top of each piece of chicken. Lay the sun-dried tomatoes on top of each piece. Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof frying pan. Add the chicken and cook for 2 minutes. Add the wine and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the creme fraiche and cook for 1 minute more. Transfer the frying pan to the oven and bake for 30 minutes. Serve the chicken with the sage leaves on the side.
In a large bowl combine all ingredients. Toss to coat. Transfer to airtight container and refrigerate overnight. Serves 2.

Cut the eggplant lengthwise in half, then cut each half into 1 inch cubes. Place the cubes in a large bowl. Add the salt to the eggplant. Toss well until the eggplant is coated. Transfer the cubes to a colander or drain basket set over a bowl. Drain for 30 minutes. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the eggplant cubes. Cook until browned on all sides. Add the soy sauce and vinegar to the skillet. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes. Add the garlic. Cook uncovered for 5 more minutes. Season the adobo with the freshly ground black pepper. Serve the adobo over the white rice.

Beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth and fluffy. Add lime juice and zest and beat well. Add vanilla and eggs and beat until well combined and smooth. Pour into pie crust and bake for 1 hour. Cool cheesecake for about an hour before cutting into wedges and chilling in refrigerator for several hours or overnight.

Combine brown sugar, shortening, vanilla, eggs, and baking powder and beat well. Combine whole wheat flour and old fashioned oats. Add to sugar mixture alternately with shortening mixture. Shape into walnut sized balls and roll in sugar. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack.

Beat the butter and granulated sugar together. Add the flour and salt and mix well. Add the vanilla and the eggs and mix well. Roll the dough into walnut sized balls and place on a baking sheet lined with wax paper. Place the baking sheet in the freezer for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 10 inch tube pan. Combine dry ingredients. In a separate bowl combine butter and sugar. Add bananas and beat until fluffy. Add eggs and beat well. Stir in dry ingredients and milk. Pour batter into prepared pan. Sprinkle with poppy seeds. Bake 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes in pan then remove from pan and cool completely. Drizzle with powdered sugar.
In a large bowl beat together Crisco, powdered sugar and meringue powder until fluffy. Add water and vanilla and beat well.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut chicken tenders into strips. Arrange the chicken strips on the baking sheet. In a small bowl, combine the olive oil with the garlicbrush the mixture over the chicken. Sprinkle the chicken with the baslamic vinegar. Bake for 10 minutes. In a small bowl combine the balsamic vinegar with the honey. Place the chicken into a ziplock bag and add the chicken broth, one tablespoon at a time, until the chicken is covered. Place the chicken back into the oven for an additional 10 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink inside. Remove the chicken from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Divide the chicken among 4 plates. Drizzle with the balsamic glaze. Serve with fresh parsley. I used boneless skinless breasts and cooked for 10 min. Then added the liquid. I let cook for 20 minutes. I did
Soften gelatin in cold water. Stir in whipping cream then add the peppermint candies. Pour mixture into prepared pie crust. Chill until set. Spread with whipped cream.

Heat 1/4 cup olive oil with the garlic cloves in a small heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook just until the garlic is soft. Stir in the anchovies. Let cool. Meanwhile in a food processor combine the butter with the whipping cream and the rest of the oil. Process until smooth. Remove the garlic from the oil. Spoon the dip into a large bowl and garnish with the garlic. Serve with warm vegetables. This is also great with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Slice potatoes 1/4 inch thick. Wash green beans and pat dry. In large bowl toss potatoes and green beans in olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in shallow pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until potatoes are done. Remove from oven and top with ham. Return to oven and bake for 5-10 minutes longer or until potatoes are crisp and brown. Serve immediately.

Mix all together in a large bowl. Melt shortening in a large microwave safe bowl. Pour over ingredients and stir until coated. Pour into greased 13x9 inch pan. Cool. Break into bite size pieces. Store in airtight container.

In a heavy sauce pan combine sugar, buttermilk, bourbon, butter, baking soda. Cook over medium heat until candy thermometer reads 234 degrees F. Remove from heat. Stir in pecans. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Makes about 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the hens in a baking dish. Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the flour and stir until a paste forms. Add the chicken broth and sherry and whisk until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the sauce over the hens and cover the dish with foil. Bake until the juices run clear when the thigh is pierced with a knife. About 1 hour and 15 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Unroll the rolls and separate into triangles. Press each triangle together into a crescent shape. Place the crescents on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 8 minutes or until golden brown. While the rolls are baking, mix together the cream cheese, butter, brown sugar and honey. In a small bowl combine the orange rind, almond extract and milk. Brush the rolls with the orange glaze. Sprinkle with the almonds. Allow the glaze to set. Serve warm.

Wash lettuce well under cold running water. Drain well on paper towels or in a salad spinner. Cut lettuce into wedges. Place in a large bowl and set aside. Mix together mayonnaise, sour cream, yogurt, vinegar, garlic and salt. Fold in dill and chives. Place in refrigerator to let flavors blend for a few hours before serving. Arrange lettuce wedges on a serving platter. Drizzle with dressing. Garnish with tomatoes, avocado, cucumber and chives if desired. Serve immediately with lemon wedges or store covered in refrigerator for up to 12 hours before serving.

Spray a medium skillet with nonstick cooking spray. Heat over medium-high heat until hot. Add 1 tortilla to skillet. Cook for 30 seconds. Remove from skillet. Add half of cheese and half of bacon to the uncooked side of the tortilla. Fold over halfway. Add half of the mexican-style corn to the fold. Continue layering until the tortilla is completely filled. Place in a shallow baking pan. Repeat with remaining tortilla. Bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with scallion and salsa. Cut into wedges and serve.

In a bowl combine raspberries and lemonade until the raspberries are well coated. Place mixture into pie crusts and refrigerate for 2-4 hours. Once ready to serve top each pie with Cool Whip Topping and sprinkle with yellow food coloring for color.

Season the chicken breasts with the seasoning salt. Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breastscook for 5 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the skilletset aside. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil to the skillet. Add the mushroomscook 5 minutes. Add the garlic powder. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the alfredo sauce. Return the chicken to the skillet. Cover the skillettransfer to a 4-quart crock pot. Cook on low for 3 hours. Stir in the spinachcook another hour. Transfer the chicken to a serving platter. Spoon the sauce over the chicken. Garnish with the parsley.

Boil pasta in salted water until just tender. Drain well and rinse with cold water. Set aside to cool. Cook hocks for 2 1/2 hours or until tender. When cool enough to handle, remove meat from hock bones and cut into large pieces. Cut capsicums into small pieces. Finely chop chives and set aside to garnish. Combine pasta, capsicums, ham and chives with vinegar, sugar and curry powder. Gently toss to combine. Serve at room temperature with chives to garnish.

In large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add mushrooms and cook 2 minutes. Add ham and cook 2 minutes longer. Stir in eggs and cook until set. Sprinkle cheese over top of omelette. Cook until cheese is melted and serve immediately.

Toast the rice over medium heat in oil until fragrant and golden brown. Add water and salt and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat for 10 minutes or until water is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir occasionally while cooking. Remove from heat and cover with foil for 5 minutes before serving.

Pour some oil into a skillet and heat over a medium flame. Add salt & pepper and parmesan cheese and stir. Break the eggs into the pan and stir gently. Cook until the eggs are cooked as desired. Serve immediately.

In large bowl mix together flour, baking powder and salt. In small bowl combine egg and milk. In another bowl combine sugar and shortening. Beat shortening mixture until light and fluffy. Beat in egg mixture and almond extract. Add flour mixture and stir until well combined. Turn into lightly greased 11x7x1-inch baking pan. Sprinkle evenly with toasted almonds. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool in pan on wire rack. Cut into 1-1/2 inch squares. Makes about 32 squares.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter to the pan. When the butter is melted add the onion. Saute for 3 to 5 minutes or until translucent. Add the green bell pepper, salt and black pepper. Stir and saute for 3 to 5 minutes or until the bell pepper is soft. Add the turkey. Break apart the meat using a spoon. Stir frequently until the turkey is cooked through. Place 1/2 of the meat mixture on each bun. Top with 1 slice of cheese. Broil until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.
Slice apple and carrot and spread peanut butter on tortilla. Top with apple and carrot. Roll up. Sprinkle granola over top and serve with toasted wheat germ.

Cook ground beef and onion in a skillet over medium heat until done. Drain well. In a large saucepan combine remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Stir in beef mixture. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 5 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 220 degrees C. In a large mixing bowl, sift together the flours, spice and sugar. In another bowl, lightly beat the eggs then mix in the buttermilk, yoghurt, and vegetable oil. Fold these into the flour mixture. Stir in the berries then divide the mixture evenly into the prepared muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes or until the muffins are well risen, golden, and cooked through.

Rinse the beans and place in a colander in the sink and run cold water over them until they are cool enough to handle. Remove the beans from the colander and place in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and whip on medium speed for about 2 minutes or until the beans are completely broken down and the mixture resembles mashed potatoes in texture. Add the onion and garlic and mix until evenly distributed. Add the crushed red pepper flakes, olive oil and soy sauce and mix until evenly distributed. Add the red wine vinegar and mix until evenly distributed. Add the water and salt and pepper and mix until evenly distributed. Heat the oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium high heat and saut the beans in the oil until they are hot and have an evenly coating of oil and are slightly browned on the bottom. This will take about 6-8 minutes. Taste and adjust the seasonings. Serve hot.

Beat pudding mix and milk together. Pour half the pudding into a 9 by 13 pan. Top evenly with the fruit. Sprinkle 1/2 cup sugar over the fruit. Pour remaining pudding over fruit. Sprinkle top with remaining 1/2 cup sugar. Chill. Cut into squares. Makes about 6 servings.

Cook spaghetti noodles according to package directions. Drain pasta thoroughly. In a large mixing bowl, combine pasta, greens, tomatoes, olives, chicken, and black bean garlic sauce. Cover and chill for at least 2 hours. Just before serving, gently toss in italian dressing. Serve with crusty bread.

Remove stems from broccoli rabe and place in a steamer basket over boiling water in a large pot. Cook until bright green, 4 to 5 minutes. Remove from steamer basket and place in serving dish. Add olive oil to pan used for steaming broccoli rabe and saute garlic until lightly browned. Remove garlic from pan and add crushed red pepper flakes to remaining oil. Toss cooked broccoli rabe in oil mixture, sprinkle with garlic and salt & pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Saute onion in vegetable oil until tender. Add ground beef. Brown until done. Add diced tomatoes. Stir. Add cooked macaroni. Season with paprika, dried oregano, chili powder and garlic powder. Simmer until well blended. Serves 6.

Grease a mug or small bowl with cooking spray. Mix together the first five dry ingredients (flour through salt) in a small bowl. Combine the egg, milk and oil in another bowlthen add the vanilla extract, mixing well. Pour the liquid mixture into the mug or bowl. Stir the dry mix into the liquid to make a batter. Microwave on high for 30 secondsthen on high for an additional 30 seconds. Allow to cool slightly before serving. Top with whipped cream or ice cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Place lamb on a rimmed baking sheet and rub with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Roast for 15 minutes. Turn lamb and reduce heat to 350 degrees F. Roast for 20 minutes or until desired doneness is achieved. While lamb is roasting, combine thyme and rosemary with 2 tablespoons olive oil in a small bowl. Remove lamb from oven, brush with half of herb mixture. Sprinkle lamb with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Return lamb to oven and roast 10 minutes longer or until desired doneness is achieved. While lamb is roasting, combine remaining herb mixture with garlic in a small bowl. Remove lamb from oven and brush with remaining herb mixture. Let lamb stand 5 minutes. Slice into individual servings. Sprinkle with additional herb mixture and serve.
Boil potatoes in a large pot with salted water for 10-15 minutes until tender. Drain. Add butter, milk, and dressing mix. Mash with a masher. Add green onions. Serve warm.

Spread a layer of beans on a baking pan. Top with a layer of cheese. Crack eggs over cheese. Sprinkle with salsa and scallions. Bake at 350 degree f for 20 minutes or until eggs are cooked. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Steep the spices in 2 cups of the coffee for 5 minutes. Strain the spice mixture into a small saucepan and add the half-and-half. Heat until the mixture comes to a simmer. Serve in a glass filled with ice cubes. Top each glass with 1 tablespoon of the spiced half-and-half. Serves 2.

cook the noodles in salted water with a little oil. Mix potatoes and onions together in the large pot and boil with the salt. Strain the noodles and add to the potatoes. Add cheese and milk and heat until everything is melted. Add the butter and mix. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Bone the chicken breast. In a small bowl combine the mushrooms, cornflour, rice wine and sesame oil. Mix well. Heat the stock in the pot until it is boiling. Add the mushroom mixture and watercress. Cover and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the chicken breast and cook for about 4-5 minute. Season to taste with the salt. Garnish with the shiitake mushroom caps and watercress. Serve hot.
In a large pot add all ingredients. Bring to a boil and cook 10 minutes until thickened. Cool and store in refrigerator. Serve with ham at Christmas or anytime.

In a small bowl, mix together the butter and beef bouillon cubes. Rub the mixture evenly over the entire onion. Wrap each onion in aluminum foil and place directly on the grill over indirect heat. Cook for 1 hour or until the onion is fork tender. Remove from grill and let cool for 10 minutes. Unwrap the onion and slice into rings. Serve warm or cold. Makes 4 servings.

In a medium bowl combine mustard and vinegar. Slowly add in olive oil while whisking until combined. Add lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Set aside while you steam your potatoes. Place potatoes in a steamer basket and steam over boiling water until tender. Remove from heat and add potatoes to bowl with vinaigrette and toss. Add dill and toss again. Serve immediately or allow flavors to blend for a few minutes. Serves 6.

Preheat the broiler. Rub the fillets with the lime juice. Sprinkle both sides with the salt and black pepper. Broil the fillets for 8 to 10 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with the lime wedges.
Beat butter until fluffy. Add sugar, water, milk. Cook until boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour into greased 9x9 pan. Cool for at least one hour. Cut into 12 squares.

Prepare the batter by combining all of the dry ingredients. Add the beer gradually while mixing with a whisk until you have a smooth batter consistency. Let it sit for 30 minutes or so while you heat your oil to 350 degrees F in a large frying pan or deep fryer. Dip your fillets in batter and fry for 5 minutes or until brown and flaky. Remove from oil, place on paper towel lined plate or platter. Sprinkle with old bay seasoning before serving. Enjoy your fried perch with a nice salad or french fries and your favorite tarter sauce.

To prepare the starter, put the milk in a jar or container and add the active starter. Cover the jar and let it sit for several hours or overnight until it is very frothy. Stir the pancake mix into the milk-starter mixture until you have a smooth batter. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium high heat and drop spoonfuls of batter into the pan. Flip the pancakes when the edges are lightly brown. Drizzle the pancakes with syrup or honey before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine brown sugar, vanilla, egg and beat until smooth. Add flour, baking soda and salt. Add nuts. Drop by teaspoon fulls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8 to 10 minutes. Do not brown. Remove from cookie sheet immediately. Cool completely. Makes about 1 1/2 dozen.

Drizzle pork chops on both sides with honey. Coat chops evenly with lemon juice and soy sauce. Press garlic clove onto each pork chop. Let stand at room temperature for about 15 minutes. Preheat broiler. Place pork chops in a shallow baking dish or baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Broil for about 6 minutes or until a thermometer inserted in the thickest part of pork chop reads 155 to 160 degrees f. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400. Cut squash into 1/2 inch slices. Toss with garlic cloves and oil. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Bake until tender when pierced with a fork, about 25 minutes. Sprinkle with gomashio.

Mix mayonnaise and honey mustard together. Mix in turkey and celery. Season with pepper to taste. Fill phyllo cups with turkey mixture. Top with cranberries. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through. Top with cheese and nuts. Serve warm.

Prepare an ice ring by pouring boiling water over lemon balm leaves, strain the liquid into a bowl and set aside for at least half an hour. Put the lemon balm liquid and sugar into a saucepan and heat until the sugar dissolves. Let cool then pour into glasses and top up with chilled water and ice. Garnish with lemon balm leaves or flowers.

Cut off top of tomatoes to make them stand up. Set tomatoes aside. Place remaining salsa ingredients in blender. Puree until smooth. Pour mixture into tomatoes. Bake for 1 hour at 300. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 12 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. In a medium bowl combine breadcrumbs and 2 tablespoons butter. Add sugar, cinnamon and apple. Mix well. Divide mixture evenly among prepared cups. Bake 12 minutes or until golden. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and lemon juice. Brush over warm apples. Cool. Combine remaining 1 tablespoon butter, cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Spread on cooled apples. Serve.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, milk and light corn syrup. Stirring occasionally until boiling. Add pumpkin and stir until smooth. Add salt, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla and butter. Reduce heat to low. Stir until butter is melted. Remove from heat. Add nuts. Stir until well combined. Pour mixture into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Cool and cut into 16 bars.

Cut each breast half in half. Combine the barbecue sauce and mustard in a small bowl. Spray a cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Place the chicken halves on the cookie sheet. Brush each half with half of the barbecue sauce mixture. Top with half of the bacon and half of the cheese. Bake in a 350 degree f oven for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink and the bacon is crisp. Sprinkle with scallions and tomatoes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Bake pie crust for 6 to 8 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. In a medium bowl, beat together the eggs and milk until well blended. Add the green onion, salt and pepper, nutmeg and flour. Blend together well. Add the zucchini and cheese. Pour into cooled pie shell. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes or until set. Let cool before cutting into wedges to serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Beat together butter and vanilla until creamy. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time beating until blended. Mix in flour mixture. Spread batter in baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and stir in chocolate chips and pecans. Spread evenly over batter. Sprinkle with additional chocolate chips. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Cut into bars.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add mushrooms and cook until softened. Remove from heat and cool slightly. In a medium bowl, mix gouda with breadcrumbs and parsley. Stir in almonds and sun-dried tomatoes. Fill each mushroom with mixture. Garnish with chives and serve.

Combine onion and butter and saute over medium heat until onion is clear and tender. Cool onion mixture and then combine with beaten eggs. Blend in cheese and cream, then season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour into unbaked pie shells and top with sliced chives. Bake at 400 degrees until set or about 40 minutes. Cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease 2 (9-inch) loaf pans. In a large bowl, beat together sugar and butter until light. Add banana and vanillabeat until smooth. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Beat in soda. In a small bowl, stir together the buttermilk and baking soda. Alternately add flour and buttermilk mixture to batter until combined. Fold in walnuts. Divide batter between the pans. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bread comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pancool completely. Wrap in foilstore at room temperature up to 3 days or freeze up to 2 months. Makes 2 loaves.

In a large bowl, combine cream cheese and butter and blend well. Beat in the pumpkin and the spices until smooth. Gradually add the sugar and beat until smooth. Spread into a baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine the gingersnap crumbs and melted butter. Spread over the top of the dip. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes or until dip is set.

Combine butter, sugar and pecans in food processor or blender until finely ground. Press mixture into ungreased 9-inch pie plate. Bake at 375 for 8 minutes or until lightly browned. Beat powdered sugar, milk and extract until smoothspread over crust. Bake for 3-5 minutes or until glaze is set. Cool completely on wire rack. Cut into wedges.

In a large bowl combine garlic, rosemary, salt, pepper and red wine. Add lamb to bowl and toss to coat. Place in slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for 4 hours. Add potatoes and olives. Cover and continue cooking on high for 1 hour or until potatoes are done. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Spray 8-inch nonstick skillet with cooking spray. In skillet, beat eggs, water, salt, pepper and milk until well blended. Heat over medium heat until thickened, stirring constantly. Turn heat to low. Sprinkle 1/3 of beans on half of egg mixture. Top with 1/3 of cheese. Spread 1/3 of salsa over cheese. Sprinkle with remaining 1/3 of cheese. Top with remaining 1/3 of beans. Top with remaining 1/3 of salsa. Spread remaining egg mixture over salsa. Sprinkle with remaining 1/3 of cheese. Bake at 425 for 10 minutes or until center is set. Cut into wedges. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Heat the oil over medium heat in a large stock pot. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add the onions & saute for about 5 minutes. Add the peppers and continue to cook until the onions are translucent. Add the tomatoes & simmer for another 5 minutes. Add the beef stock & bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat. Mash up the bread & add to the soup. Add the salt & pepper. Serve hot.

Place kielbasa in bottom of slow cooker. Add pineapple chunks and pineapple juice. Mix cornstarch, lemon juice, and brown sugar in a small bowl until smooth and pour over meat and fruit mixture. Add onion and green pepper. Cook on high setting for 4 hours or on low setting for 6 hours. Add maraschino cherries and serve.

Cook rice according to package directions. In 2-quart saucepan, combine rice, soup mix and water. Heat to boiling. Stir in pork chops. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve with vegetable or salad.

Mix stuffing mix and hot water in bowl. Line pie pan with pastry and pour in stuffing mixture. Cook for 40 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove from oven and add turkey and gravy and mix together. Return to oven and continue cooking for 15 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with fresh fruit or salad.

Cook ground beef in fry pan until browned. Break up into smaller pieces as it cooks. Brown sausage in same pan. Remove from pan and set aside. Add onions to pan, saute until translucent. Add tomato paste and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Simmer sauce for 20-30 minutes. Add meat back in and stir well to combine.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until they are very tender. Drainreturn them to the pot with enough cold skim milk to cover them by an inch or so. Let them soak for at least 30 minutes. Drain potatoes and place them in a food processor fitted with the steel blade. Pulse to mash themcontinue pulsing while gradually adding the garlic and shallot until they are completely incorporated. Transfer potatoes to a large bowladd tuna and mix well. Season with vinegar, oil, and dill.
