Combine all the above in saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium. Stir occasionally until grapes are translucent. Remove cinnamon stick and cloves. Pour into glass jar. Let cool.

Place 2 whole chickens in a stockpot filled 1/2 way with water, add the onions, carrots, celery & leaves, garlic cloves and salt & pepper to taste. Cook over medium heat for 1 hour, skimming the stock to remove the foam that rises to the top of the liquid. Strain the stock & store in the refrigerator for 24 hours. Strain the stock again & bring it to a boil in the same pot over medium-high heat. Add the dumpling dough & cook uncovered for 30 minutes or until dumpling dough rises to the top of the stock. Remove from heat & let cool to room temperature. Serve in soup bowls & garnish with parsley or dill if desired.

Cream butter and sugar together until light. Beat in the egg white. Fold in the dry ingredients. Chill dough for 1 hour. Roll dough to 1/4 inch thick. Cut into desired shapes with cookie cutter. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-12 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

Mix together sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, olive oil, vinegar and basil. Spread brie cheese on one side of bread. Arrange tomatoes and basil on top of brie cheese. Top off with other slice of bread and press down until cheese is fully covered with the tomatoes. Slice in half and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 13x9x2-inches baking pan. In large bowl beat eggs and milkstir in sugar and vanilla. Stir in spaghettiplace in prepared pan. Bake 50-60 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool 10 minutesremove from pan to wire rack to cool completely. In small bowl combine cream, cinnamon and butterspread over cooled cake. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into squares.

Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together. Add milk gradually, stirring just enough to make a soft dough. Chill dough at least one hour or until ready to roll out. Roll dough out thin on a floured surface and cut with a fluted pastry cutter or use a glass to cut circles. Place one heaping tablespoon of blueberries on half of the circle. Fold over to form a triangle, pressing edges to seal. Place on a greased baking sheet. Brush top with milk and sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar mixture if desired. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm.

Mix garbanzo beans with flour, salt, pepper and cayenne pepper until smooth. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Drop the mixture by tablespoon into hot oil and fry until browned. Serve hot with lemon wedges and hot sauce if desired.

Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a large non-stick skillet. Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper on steakbrush with melted buttersprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Place on skilletcook 5 minutes on each side or until desired doneness (for medium, 145F). Remove steak from skilletcover to keep warm. Add onion and green peppers to skilletcook 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Stir in beef brothcover and simmer 3 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Spoon vegetables evenly over steaksprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Melt remaining tablespoon of butter in microwave-safe dishadd flourwhisk until smooth. Gradually add 1/4 cup waterwhisk until smooth. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup waterwh

Melt chocolate chips with evaporated milk. Add the vanilla extract. Add the sugar. Stir until well blended. Add the heavy whipping cream. Blend again. Pour into 8 individual dessert dishes. Top with chocolate curls. Garnish with fresh strawberries.

In a small bowl or Ziploc bag, combine lemon juice and mustard. Add herbs and oilmix well and set aside. Clean and pat dry chicken tenderloins with paper towels. Rub chicken with lemon mixture and place in a Ziploc bag or in a shallow dish and chill for at least 30 minutes or up to several hours. Preheat oven to 425F. In a medium skillet or grill pan, heat oil. Add chicken and saute until cooked through and golden brown on all sides, about 4-5 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to a baking sheet and place in oven for another 10-12 minutes. Remove from oven and let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a large dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, carrots and celery and cook until onion is soft. Add ground turkey and cook until no longer pink. Add chicken broth and seasonings and bring to a boil. Add potatoes and simmer until potatoes are tender. Add corn and simmer until heated through.

Brown beef over medium heat in a large skillet. Remove beef from skillet and drain fat. Add garlic, onion and pepper and saute until onion is translucent. Return beef to skillet and stir in enchilada sauce. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in black beans and water. Cook for 5 minutes. Add macaroni and simmer for 5 minutes longer or until macaroni is tender. Garnish with cheese and chili pepper.

In a large bowl mix together flour, milk, sugar and salt. Add eggs and stir just until mixed. Add butter and stir until melted and mixed in with the flour mixture. Add the corn. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until firm. Cool and cut into squares. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

Slice liver into thin strips about one-third inch wide. Dip in flour and fry in hot oil until brown on both sides. Remove from pan and set aside. Heat oil in the same pan, add onions. Stir until browned. Stir in mustard, turmeric, chili powder and ginger. When onions are tender, add liver strips. Season with pepper. Let liver heat through. Serve on bread or rice.

Combine the eggs with the hominy in a large bowl and beat well until blended. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heatadd the green peppers and cook for 1 minute. Add the hominy mixture and continue cooking for 1 minutestir in the bacon. Cover and cook for 10 minutes over low heat. Remove from heat, add the cheddar cheese, and stir until melted. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Bring broccoli to boil in 2 cups of water with chicken boullion. Strain and save the liquid for another use. Return broccoli to pan and add the rice. Stir until heated through. Stir in cheese and serve immediately.

Cook the noodles according to package instructions. Add the tomato paste, tomatoes with oil and garlic to a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally until thickened. Add the parsley. Drain the noodles, return to the pan. Add the sauce, tossing to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut potatoes into wedges and place in bowl. Add olive oil, salt and pepper and garlic powder. Toss well. Place in baking pan. Bake for one hour. Flip potatoes over and bake for another hour. Remove from oven. In small bowl mix butter and hot pepper sauce. Stir well. Spread mixture over potatoes and bake for another five minutes. Sprinkle with bleu cheese salad dressing. Serve hot.

Mix the soy sauce, cayenne pepper and garlic powder together in a small bowl. Pour half the mixture over the beef in the slow cooker. In a small bowl combine the vinegar and sesame oil. Pour over the beef. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours. Stir in the remaining half of the soy sauce mixture. Cook for an additional hour. Serve over white rice with green onions.

Preheat oven to 350. Prepare stuffing as directed on package. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Stir in vegetables and water, bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, covered for 10 minutes. Remove vegetables with slotted spoon. Stir in cream of chicken soup and seasoning and simmer 5 minutes. Arrange cooked chicken breasts in bottom of a 9 x 13 baking dish. Top with vegetables and stuffing. Combine sour cream and soup and pour over stuffing. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake covered for 40 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 10 minutes or until browned.

Bring 4 qts of water to a boil. Add 2 cups salt and 2 tablespoons of olive oil to boiling water and stir. Cook ravioli and drain. Place spinach and tomatoes in a large bowl with ravioli. Toss with onion powder and parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with Parmesan cheese.

Boil macaroni and drain. In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine the milk and 2 cups Velveeta cheese until the Velveeta cheese is melted. Mix with the macaroni and cheddar cheese until well combined. Add salt to taste. Turn off heat. Serve immediately.

In a skillet, melt the butter over medium-low heat. Add onions and cook for 10 minutes until onions are tender. In a medium saucepan bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Stir in the rice and cook 10 minutes or until tender. Stir the rice into the skillet. Add the chicken stock, salt, and pepper to taste. Cover the skillet and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

In 6-quart saucepan cook onions and ginger in butter until tender. Add flour and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in broth and bring to boil. Add carrots. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool for 10 minutes. Pour mixture through strainer into large bowl. Discard solids. Add cream and orange rind. Stir to blend. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Place the sweet potato wedges in a bowl. Add the yellow onion, gingerroot, pineapple juice, olive oil and salt. Stir well to combine. Transfer to a baking dish. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes until potatoes are tender. Remove from the oven. Heat the olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the salmon fillets and cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side until the fish is cooked through. Season with salt. To serve place a wedge of sweet potato on each plate. Top with a salmon fillet. Sprinkle with fresh ground black pepper and slivered almonds. Garnish with fresh parsley.
Slice pound cake into 1/2 inch slices. Top with mini marshmallows. Top with semi-sweet chocolate chips. Top with caramel ice cream topping. Top with nuts. Enjoy!

Heat a small saute pan over medium heat and add the cumin, cardamom seeds and ground coriander. Stir for 30 seconds, then add the cayenne pepper and the butter. Saute the spices for about 1 minute then remove from the heat and set aside to cool to room temperature. When cooled, add the bananas and stir until well blended. Transfer to a serving bowl and chill until ready to serve. Serve with raita and warm naan bread.

Cut eggs in half lengthwise and remove yolks. Place yolks in bowl. Add avocado, green onions and pickle juicemash with fork. Blend in mayonnaise and dressing mix. Stir in salsa. Fill egg white halves with yolk mixture. Garnish with salsa.

Combine all the dry ingredients in a bowl. Add eggs and mix well. Add milk and mix again. Add melted butter and mix one last time. Let stand for 15 minutes. Heat griddle to 400 degrees. Pour batter 1/4 cup at a time and turn when brown on one side. When all the batter is used, remove to a plate. Repeat until all batter is used. Serve with lingonberry preserves and butter.

In a large dutch oven over medium heat cook ground beef. Drain excess fat. Add onion to the beef, cook until onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Add mixed vegetables, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, water, macaroni and seasonings. Simmer for 10 minutes or until macaroni is tender. Serve with crackers or french bread.

Rinse the oysters under running water. Drain. Put the oysters on an ungreased shallow baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the peppercorns, salt, ground mace, and the sherry wine. Pour over oysters. Cover the dish with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight. The next day, strain the liquid from the oysters and reserve. In a medium-size bowl, combine the cider vinegar, the remaining sherry wine, and the tabasco sauce. Pour over the oysters. Refrigerate for 1 day before serving.

In a sauce pan, bring water to a boil and add onion and taco seasoning mix. Stir well and continue boiling for about 10 minutes. Add the couscous and continue boiling until couscous is tender. Turn off heat and allow the couscous mixture to cool slightly. Stir in the tofu. Place taco shells in a baking pan and spread the couscous mixture evenly in the shells. Bake in a 400 degree oven for about 15 minutes until hot and bubbly. While the shells are baking, prepare the other taco fillings. Warm the taco shells for about 10 seconds in a microwave oven. Top the shells with your favorite taco fillings. I use the mexican-style stewed tomatoes and taco seasoning mix from the recipe above. Serve with shredded lettuce and shredded cheddar cheese.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, and cook until the onion is softened and translucent. Add the pumpkin puree, vegetable broth, water, nutmeg, soy milk and season with salt and pepper to taste. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until the sauce thickens to a creamy consistency, about 8-10 minutes. Stir in the pasta until it is coated with the sauce. Stir in the parsley.

In a large pot of boiling water add the mussels and chicken broth. Cover and steam for 15 to 20 minutes. Add the white wine. Stir and cover. Cook for 15 more minutes. Discard any mussels that have not opened. Serve with crusty bread and lemon wedges.

Heat a 10-inch cast-iron skillet on medium-high heat. Add oil to pan. When oil is hot add egg to pan. Flip egg halfway through cooking. Once egg is cooked to your liking remove from pan. Top egg with arugula leaf. Drizzle barbecue sauce on top of arugula. Sprinkle sharp white cheddar cheese over sauce. Finish with cilantro. Cracked black pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. Combine dry ingredientsset aside. Beat egg substitute with milkadd bananas. Add sugar and melted butterbeat until smooth. Add dry ingredientsbeat just until combined. Spoon into muffin cupssprinkle with grape-nuts. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Makes 12 muffins.

Saute onion in butter for 2-3 minutes or until tender. In a bowl combine onions with egg, salt and pepper to taste. Combine with squash and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes or until tender.

Cut turkey breast into strips. Combine flour, curry powder, turmeric and chili powder. Toss turkey strips in mixture. Beat egg in small bowl. Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add turkey strips to skillet. Cook 2-3 minutes each side. Drain on paper towels. Makes 2 cups. Serve over rice.

Combine all ingredients in a 2 quart saucepan and bring to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and let cool for 15 minutes. Strain through a fine mesh strainer. Pour syrup into airtight containers. Let cool completely before refrigerating. Store refrigerated for up to 3 months.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan. In large bowl, sift flour with baking soda and salt. In a seperate bowl, beat eggs well until frothy. Gradually add sugar, beating well. Add vanilla and pineapple juicebeat well. Stir in flour mixture. Stir in pineapple and nuts. Pour into panspread evenly. Bake for 30-40 minutes until a cake tester or wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the overcool completely before frosting. In a medium bowl, combine the evaporated milk with the butter until smooth. Gradually add the powdered sugar until the mixture is spreadable. Frost the cake.

Place all ingredients in the blender in the order listed. Cover and blend until smooth. Serve immediately or store in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 hours. Stir before serving. Makes 2 servings. Nutrition Facts1/2 cup serving: 115 calories, 2 grams fat, 1 gram saturated fat, 15 milligrams cholesterol, 15 milligrams sodium, 16 grams carbohydrate, 1 gram fiber, 1 gram protein. Diabetic Exchanges: 1/2 fruit, 1 fat.

Slice bananas into thin slices and place into a greased baking tin. Sprinkle with honey and sultanas and bake for 5 minutes at 200 degrees celcius or till light brown. Serve on a bed of yoghurt with walnuts and cinnamon.

Cut the cookies apart at the cream filling. Place the sherbet in a bowl. Melt the chocolate chips in a microwave oven and stir until smooth. Dip one half of each cookie in the chocolate and place in the sherbet. Arrange the licorice and marshmallows to resemble caterpillars. Place a red-hot candy at each end of the caterpillar. Place the red-hot candies on the back of the caterpillars. Decorate with candy eyes and candy gummy worms.

Sprinkle the gelatin into a medium bowl and pour in boiling water and stir till gelatin dissolves. Add cranberry juice cocktail and stir till dissolved. Refrigerate for a few minutes till slightly thickened. Add apples and cranberries and stir till blended. Add celery and walnuts and toss till blended. Pour into a serving dish and chill at least an hour. Serve cold.

In a large skillet heat the oil over medium high heat. Add the mushrooms and onion. Cook until the mushrooms are soft. Add garlic and cook for one minute. Add broth and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and cook until thick. Serve over noodles or with vegetables.
In a food processor combine all ingredients until they are finely ground and blended. Rub into pork roast or chops and let sit for 30 minutes before cooking.

Preheat the oven to 220 degrees C (425 degrees F). Peel the celeriac and slice into 1cm (1/2 inch) discs. Put the discs in a pot and add the stock and water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain and allow to cool a little. In a large saute pan heat the walnut oil and saute the shallots for 2 minutes. Add the celeriac and stir for 3 minutes or until the celeriac is tender but not browned. Add the blue cheese and stir gently for 2 minutes. Season to taste with the salt and pepper and transfer to a greased 18cm x 28cm (7 x 11 inch) baking dish. Crumble the walnuts over the top and place under a preheated grill for 4-5 minutes or until the gratin is hot and golden. Serve immediately with a side salad.

Pour strong coffee into large mug or 6- to 8-ounce glass. Add 2 tablespoons sugar and stir until dissolved. Add 2 tablespoons chocolate pieces and stir until dissolved. Add 1/2 cup of half and half and stir until dissolved. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix teriyaki, soy sauces, garlic powder, onion powder and black pepper until well combined. Place chicken wings in shallow bowl with teriyaki mixture. Cover wings with mixture and put on baking sheet. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Brush wings with pure maple syrup and bake for another 15 minutes or until done. Serve with celery sticks or carrot sticks for dipping.

In large bowl combine cornmeal, rice flour, millet flour, xanthan gum, sugar and salt. Stir well. Add water. Stir until smooth. Allow mixture to sit for at least one hour at room temperature. After one hour knead mixture on lightly floured surface until dough is no longer sticky. Cover and allow dough to sit at least one more hour. Roll dough out into desired shape. Add desired toppings. Bake at 425 until dough is firm. Cooking time will depend on thickness of crust. Allow crust to cool at least 15 minutes before cutting.

Slice the bananas lengthwise, then cut them into halves or quarters depending on their size. Place a chocolate bar in the center of each banana slice. Slice the chocolate bar into pieces that fit the banana slice well. Set in a glass container in the freezer until ready to use. To assemble the banana splits, spread a layer of ice cream on each banana slice. Top the ice cream with a dollop of whipped cream, a piece of the chocolate bar, a maraschino cherry, a piece of cinnamon stick, a sprinkling of chopped peanuts, and a sprinkling of grated chocolate. Serve immediately.
Brown hamburger & onion in skillet. Add carrot & potato. Drain excess fat. Add tomato soup & milk. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Serves 4 to 6.

Boil green beans and peas in a pot of boiling water. Drain and set aside. Make the dressing by putting the olive oil, lemon juice and rind in a bowl. Stir in the sugar and salt and pepper. Toss the beans and peas with the dressing and garnish with mint.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Pound chicken breasts to 1/4 - 1/2 thickness. Spread each piece with about 1 tsp mustard. Layer prosciutto on top of mustard. Layer a slice of swiss cheese on top of prosciutto. Roll the chicken and secure with toothpicks. Brush each side of chicken with melted butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake 25 minutes. Combine soup and wine in a small saucepan. Heat to a simmer. Whisk in cream. Pour over chicken. Bake an additional 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Remove toothpicks and serve.

Bake cake according to package directions. Cool 10 minutes. Pour pudding over top of cake. Spread lemon juice on top of pudding. Chill 10 minutes. Drizzle with powdered sugar. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Remove excess fat from meat. Cut meat into 1/4-inch strips. Place meat strips into 4-quart slow cooker. Add sage, sugar, dry mustard, onion powder, and pepper. Mix well. In medium skillet, cook sausage over medium-high heat until meat is no longer pink. Drain and add to slow cooker. Spray a 9-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. Pour sausage into baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven, and serve. Makes 16 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet. Add tortillas one at a time. Fry for 30 seconds on each side until lightly browned. Remove tortillas and place in 9 inch pie dish. Sprinkle with 1/2 the cheese. Add chicken and remaining cheese. Spoon 1 cup enchilada sauce over chicken. Place in oven. Bake 15 minutes. Melt remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in skillet. Stir in flour and stir constantly for 1 minute. Slowly add water and continue stirring until mixture thickens. Add remaining 1/2 cup enchilada sauce. Stir over low heat for 1 minute. Serve with enchilada sauce.

Cook steaks to desired doneness. While steaks are cooking, cook the pizza sauce. Add the onion and garlic and saute until translucent. Add the pizza sauce and let cook until hot. Add the cheese and cook until cheese is melted. Spoon sauce mixture onto top of cooked steaks. Serve steaks with pizza sauce mixture.

Mix cocoa and sugar. Beat in egg whites and vanilla. Mix in cornstarch and baking soda. Spray a 13x9x2 inch pan with nonstick spray. Bake at 350 degrees F for 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool and frost. Frost with the following:Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Add cream cheese and vanilla. Spread over cooled brownies.
Cut squash into 1/4-inch slices. In a large skillet saute squash and onion in hot margarine until tender. Stir corn into mixture. Heat through. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve hot or cold.

Beat together the shortening, margarine, brown sugar, and eggs until light. Stir in the vanilla. Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl. Add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 9 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Makes about 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine flour, cumin, salt and black pepper in small bowl. Pat pork dry with paper toweldredge in flour mixture. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook pork, 3 minutes on each side. Remove pork from skillet. Add garlic to skilletstir until golden. Whisk in orange juice and lemon juice. Return pork to skilletstir until pork is coated with pan juices. Serve with orange wedge.
Mix the flour and cinnamon together. Mix in the apples. Add the butter. Add the egg and milk. Spoon into an ovenproof dish. Bake at 350F for about 45 minutes.

Cook tortellini as directed and set aside. In a large skillet over medium high heat add the oil. Add the onions and red pepper and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and continue cooking for another minute or two. Add the broccoli and continue cooking for another minute or two. Add the white wine and continue cooking for another minute or two. Add the cooked tortellini and cook for another minute or two. Add the lemon juice and tarragon and stir. Place in a serving bowl and top with the Parmigiano-Reggiano.

Remove the skin from the chicken breasts and cut each in half lengthwise. Sprinkle the chicken on both sides with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine the dried rosemary, oregano and basil. Rub the herb mixture into the chicken breasts on both sides. In a skillet saute the chicken in a small amount of fat free chicken broth until the juices run clear when pierced with a fork. In a small sauce pan combine the apricot preserves, honey mustard and water. Cook over medium heat until the mixture is smooth. Pour the sauce over the chicken and simmer for 2-3 minutes or until the chicken is heated through. Serve over rice.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add pork chops. Add water. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Add applesauce and red apple. Continue to simmer for 5 minutes. Remove pork chops and keep warm. Add minute rice and cinnamon. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle rice with sugar. Serve pork chops over rice.

Combine garlic, honey, molasses, gingerroot, soy sauce and sesame oil in a bowl. Skewer pork tenderloin. Brush with mixture. Place on grill. Baste occasionally with mixture. Cook until done. Remove from grill. Top with green onions. Serve with rice. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Mix the graham wafer crumbs with the butter. Add the icing sugar and orange juice to form a paste. Divide the cherries evenly among 6 dessert plates. Top each cherry with a large spoonful of the paste. Sprinkle each with a few drops of coconut. Serve at once.

In sauce pan, combine all but rice. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add rice. Cover and cook 15 minutes. Stir. Add peas. Cover and cook additional 5 minutes or until rice is tender. Serve.
In a large pot combine clams, garlic, onion, parsley, breadcrumbs, water and wine. Cover and let simmer for 20 minutes. Serve in a bowl over pasta. Serve with lime wedges. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Mix peanut butter and butter in large microwave-safe bowl. Microwave for 30 seconds at 70-percent powerstir. Repeat every 30 seconds until mixture is smooth. Stir in powdered sugarmicrowave 1 minute at 70-percent powerstir. Stir in candy coatingmicrowave 30 seconds at 70-percent powerstir. Melt in microwave 1 minute at 70-percent powerstir. Let stand 5 minutes or until thickened. Dip candy in melted candy coating to coat completelyplace on waxed paper or in a single layer on baking sheet. Let stand 5 minutesremove to wire rack. Repeat until all candy is coated. Refrigerate for 20 minutes or until candy is set. Store in tightly covered container for up to 1 week.

Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Brown the corned beef and onion in the oil until browned. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl combine the sauerkraut, potato & cheese pierogies, corned beef and onion. Mix thoroughly and pour into baking dish. Top with provolone and bake at 350&degF for about 40 minutes or until the provolone is melted and browned on top. Serve with Thousand Island Dressing.

Season steak on both sides and brown in olive oil and butter in skillet over medium heat. When steak is brown on both sides, pour off excess fat. Pour in water, soy sauce, and seasonings and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender and juices run clear when pierced with knife. Sprinkle with dried parsley and oregano and serve immediately.

Bring water to a boil over high heat. Slowly add cornmeal and reduce heat to medium. Whisk constantly. Cook for 30 to 45 minutes or until desired thickness. Cool slightly. Mix turkey and gravy mix. Add to polenta mixture. Pour into a buttered 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes. Let cool. Cut into 16 servings.

Heat the oil in a large fry pan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and ginger and saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the pork and leek and saute until the pork is browned and the leek is tender, about 2 minutes. Stir in the sake and kimchee and cook until the liquid has evaporated and the pork is well coated with the kimchee mixture, about 1 minute. Add the soy sauce and tofu and cook until the tofu is heated through and coated in the sauce, about 1 minute. Transfer to a platter and garnish with scallions. Serve with rice.
Mix chicken with soups and spices. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour into a 3 quart casserole dish and bake 350 for 1 hour or until done.

Cut mushrooms in half and remove stem and seeds. Season with salt and pepper, set aside. Slice chicken breasts horizontally and pound thin. Lay a slice of ham on each piece of chicken and top with a slice of provolone cheese. Roll and secure with wooden skewers or toothpicks. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook mushrooms until brown on both sides. In a small bowl combine the cream of mushroom soup with enough whole milk to make a gravy-like consistency and mix well. Add white wine and whisk well. Add mushrooms and chicken broth and bring to a boil over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add the chicken rolls and cook for approximately 5 minutes per side or until the cheese has melted. Remove from heat and serve over rice.

Place chicken in shallow baking dish. In a small bowl combine lime juice, salt and pepperpour over chicken. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Saute onion and bell pepper until tender. Stir in olives and orange juicecook and stir until thickened. Remove chicken from ovenstir in onion mixture. Sprinkle with almonds and serve.

Preheat broiler. In a 9 by 13 inch baking dish, arrange the red bell pepper, green bell pepper, onion and italian sausage slices in layers. In a small bowl, combine cheese and parsley. Top with cheese mixture. Bake at 450 for 15 minutes or until hot. Combine pasta and sauce. Spoon over hot vegetables. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat grill. In a medium bowl combine chicken thighs with lime juice, garlic and tarragon. Season with salt and pepper. Place in a single layer onto a grill tray. Grill for 8 minutes per side until browned and cooked through. Serve with fresh lime and hot sauce.

Preheat oven to 375 deg f. Pound each chicken breast between 2 sheets of plastic wrap to 1/4 inch thickness. Sprinkle with sea salt and black pepper. Mix olive oil with lemon juice in a bowlplace in another bowl with rosemary. Coat one side of each breast with oil mixtureplace in a baking dish. Turn over the breasts so the oil side is up. Repeat with the remaining oil mixture. Sprinkle both sides of the breasts with the seasonings and bake in the oven for 15-20 mins. Turn once during cooking. Remove from ovenlet rest for 3 mins before serving. Serve with roasted potatoes and green beans with chopped rosemary. Makes 4 servings.

Heat butter and oil in a large pan and saute the onion and zucchini for 5 minutes. Add the potatoes and continue cooking for 10 minutes. Add the stock cubes and 800 ml water and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the cream and simmer for a further 5 minutes. Season to taste and serve.

Mix all ingredients except salmon in a small bowl and set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add garlic and ginger. Stir-fry 2 minutes. Add coleslaw mix and stir-fry 2 minutes longer until coleslaw is wilted. Add fish sauce mixture to skillet and stir to combine. Add salmon to skillet. Turn heat to low and simmer until salmon is cooked through, 3 to 5 minutes. Serve soup and salmon topped with cilantro and scallions. Sprinkle with sesame oil before serving. Serves 4 to 6.

Beat margarine and shortening at medium speed with an electric mixer until creamy. Add sugarbeat well. Add eggs 1 at a timebeating well after each addition. Stir in extract. Add flour alternately with milk. Stir in coconut. Bake in a greased and floured tube pan at 350f for 1 hour. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove from pancool completely. Combine glaze ingredientsdrizzle over cake. Cut into wedges. Makes 18 servings.

Place fresh mushrooms in a heavy pot. Add broth. Simmer, covered, for about 25 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Stir in onion powder, black pepper and browning sauce. Whisk together milk and flour until smooth. Add milk mixture and cook until thickened. Remove from heat and serve.

Season the pork loin with ground ginger, dry mustard, ground cinnamon and low sodium soy sauce. Arrange the peach halves on top of the pork loin and place them on a roasting rack set inside of a roasting pan or foil-lined baking sheet. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until the pork loin is cooked through to an internal temperature of 145 degrees f. Remove the pork loin to a cutting board and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing into 1/2-inch thick slices. Place the cooked pork loin on a platter with the peaches arranged around it. Spoon the glaze over the pork loin and serve immediately.

Bring salted water to a boil in a 3-quart saucepan. Add spaghetti and cook according to package instructions. Meanwhile, heat 1 tbs oil in 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Add sausage. Cook until browned. Add onion and cook until onion is golden brown. Add garlic clove, tomatoes, baby spinach, and red pepper flakes. Cook until tomatoes are heated through. Drain spaghetti, reserving 1/4 cup cooking liquid. Add cooked sausage mixture and 1/4 cup reserved cooking liquid to spaghetti. Cook 3 minutes. Transfer to serving platter. Sprinkle with parsley.

Cook the potatoes in boiling water for approximately 10 minutes until just tender, drain well and place in a bowl and add the extra virgin olive oil and vinegar. Season with the wine and mustard and mix well. Place in the fridge overnight to marinate. Toss with the onions and herbs just prior to serving and place in a serving bowl garnished with parsley and serve at room temperature. This is a dish that can be made a day in advance.

Add the pork chops to the pot and sear them over high heat for 2-3 minutes per side. Turn off the heat and add the soy sauce, honey and water. Put the lid back on and set the Instant Pot to high pressure for 10 minutes. When the time is up, do a quick release and then shred the pork with a fork. Add the sesame oil, ginger and sriracha to the pork and stir. Taste and add more salt and black pepper if desired. Add the hoisin and stir again. Serve with rice and enjoy.

First season the fries with the blackening seasoning and bake according to the directions for the fries. Then put a pile of the french fries on the plate and top with some cheese sauce. Then layer the hamburger meat over the fries and top with the monterey jack cheese. Return it to the oven until the cheese is melted and serve with ketchup.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. Sprinkle breadstick tops with cheese mixture and bake until breadsticks are golden brown and cheese is bubbly and light golden brown, about 15-20 minutes. Serve warm with oil for dipping.

Fry bacon until crisp. Cut into small pieces. Cook onion in bacon drippings until translucent. Mix bacon, onion, brown sugar, cornstarch, salt, vinegar, water, red cabbage. Bring to a boil. Lower heat. Stir often until cabbage is tender.

In a small bowl whisk together the honey, pineapple juice, and mint. Season with salt to taste. Bring a pot of salted water to boil. Add the carrots. Cook for about 1 minute. Remove carrots from the water using a slotted spoon. Place the carrots on a plate and drizzle with the honey-mint sauce. Sprinkle with the mint leaves and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 8 by 11 inch baking dish. In a large bowl whisk together the eggs, milk, sugar and cinnamon until well blended. Add the bread cubesstir to coat. Spoon half of the mixture into the baking dish. Bake for 35 minutes. Remove from the oven. Spoon the remaining bread mixture on top. Bake for an additional 35 minutes. Sprinkle with jam, if desired. Serve immediately with orange juice.
Beat butter and powdered sugar together until fluffy. Add vanilla extract and heavy cream, beating until smooth.
Prepare a shaker with ice. Pour in vodka and lime juice. Add ginger and shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Top with ginger ale and garnish with a lime wedge and a sprig of candied ginger.

In a large pot combine cabbage, onion, apple, salt and water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 1 hour or until tender. Strain cabbage mixture. Return cooking liquid to pot and bring to a boil over high heatadd fettuccine and cook until tender but firm to bite, stirring occasionally. Remove from heatdrain pasta and combine with cabbage mixture in a large bowlstir in butter, poppy seeds, parsley and salt to taste. Serve hot or cold

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Sprinkle 4 pieces of raw chicken with salt. In a small saucepan over medium heat, add wine, stock, vinegar, and pink peppercorns. Simmer 5 minutes. Add butter and continue to simmer until reduced to 3/4 cup. Remove from heat. Set aside. In a separate bowl, combine blueberries with sugar and mix well. Place the chicken in a large baking dish. Pour the wine/stock mixture over the chicken. Sprinkle the blueberry mixture over the top. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from oven and pour sauce over the top. Allow to rest 5 minutes before serving.

Sprinkle chicken breasts with ranch dressing mix. Place in crock pot with half the buffalo wing sauce and butter. Cook on low for 6 hours or high for 4 hours. Slice the chicken and serve on sandwich buns with the remaining buffalo wing sauce on the side for dipping.

Mix together the ground chicken with the ginger and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Add the sweet chili sauce and the cornflour and mix until incorporated. Add the water chestnuts and mix again. Divide the mixture into 12 portions and shape into balls. Place on a tray lined with wax paper. In the meanwhile, place the wonton wrappers on the tray lined with wax paper. Put some of the chicken mixture into each wonton wrapper and fold over and press the edges together until they are sealed. Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed pan or wok over medium heat. Carefully place the dumplings in the hot oil and fry for about 2 minutes on each side until they are golden brown and crispy. Remove from the heat and serve immediately with sweet chili sauce or soy sauce and lime wedges.

Place rolls on baking sheet. In small bowl mix together sugar, brown sugar and cinnamon. Squeeze shortening from tube over tops of rolls. Sprinkle with cinnamon/sugar mixture. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until rolls are puffed.

Boil eggs for 12 minutes. Cool. Peel and slice in half. Add mayonnaise, salt and pepper. Mix well. Fill with relish, and top with chopped onion and paprika. May be made ahead and refrigerated for up to a week.

Cook macaroni as directed on package. Melt butter in medium skillet over medium heat. Add hamburgercook until browned. Drain excess fat. Stir in taco seasoning and milk. Add macaroni. Cook until macaroni is heated through. Serve in a bowl with salsa.

In a medium sized bowl stir together water and cornmeal. Bring to a boil. Stir in bouillon cubes and beans. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer for 20 minutes. In a small bowl combine evaporated milk and eggs. Whisk well. Add to cornmeal mixture and stir until smooth. Pour into 8x8-inch pan and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 400f for 20 minutes or until golden. Serve immediately.

Bring a pot of water to boil and cook the spinach for 2-3 minutes or until it turns bright green. Drain and place in a serving dish. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over low heat and add the garlic for 1 minute. Stir in the pine nuts until they begin to brown. Add the spinach leaves to the skillet and toss until hot through. Season with salt and pepper and top with the basil leaves and prosciutto pieces. Top with parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to directions and drain. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add cooked and diced chicken. Add heavy cream and milk. Stir in zest and liquid smoke. Add pasta and cheese. Stir until cheese is melted. Taste for seasoning and add more salt or pepper if necessary. Serve hot.

Put olives and garlic in a bowl and pour over the olive oil. Add tomato paste and water and mix well. Marinate in refrigerator for 4 hours. Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Drain olives and pat dry. Place olives in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until olives are lightly browned. Stir in harissa and thyme. Return to oven and bake for another 5 minutes. Remove from oven and add the lemon slices. Serve hot or cold.

Mix lemon juice, yogurt, mint leaves, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Reserve 1/4 of the mixture for the chicken. Rub the chicken all over with the remaining yogurt mixture, and refrigerate for 1 hour. Mix ginger, garam masala, and chili powder. Rub the chicken with the spice mixture. In a large skillet, heat 2 teaspoons of the canola oil over medium heat. Add the chicken, and cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side, or until browned. Transfer to a plate. In the skillet, heat the remaining canola oil over medium-high heat. Add the remaining yogurt mixture, ginger, garam masala, chili powder, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Cook for 1 minute. Return the chicken to the skillet. Cook for 5 to 6 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve with rice.

Combine jelly, butter and worcestershire sauce in small sauce pan. Heat over medium heat until butter melts. Combine jelly mixture, white onion, salmon fillets in 9 x 13 baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add jalapenos and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 6-8 minutes. Add tomatoes and onion and cook until softened and beginning to brown. Stir in salt. Add tequila and cook until liquid is gone. Sprinkle cheese on top and cook until cheese is melted and bubbly. Top with cilantro. Serve with tortilla chips.

Drain syrup from peaches and pat dry with paper towels. In a bowl combine liqueur, sugar and mascarpone cheese. Place peaches, cut sides up, in an ungreased 10-inch pie pan. Spoon about 1/3 cup liqueur mixture over each half. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes or until juice is bubbly. Cool for 20 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream.

In a small bowl, sprinkle gelatin over 1/4 cup of boiling water. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in remaining 3/4 cup water. Beat in the strawberries. Chill until partially set. Fold in remaining ingredients. Refrigerate.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Add strawberries and toss in saucepan. Melt butter in another saucepan over low heat. Add heavy cream and mint sprig. Simmer until butter is melted and sauce thickens slightly. Serve over pasta and top with parmesan cheese.

Peel and cut pumpkin into small pieces. Peel and grate carrots. Heat oil in a stock pot over medium heat. Saut onions and garlic until tender. Add pumpkin and carrots. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender. Puree in a blender or food processor. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crusty bread. Makes 4 servings.

Wash the asparagus. Cut the stems into 2-3 cm pieces. Slice the mushrooms into 3 cm pieces. Peel and slice the garlic cloves. Melt the butter in a large skillet. Add the asparagus and mushrooms. Season with salt and black pepper. Stir to mix the ingredients. Add the garlic. Cook 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Cook spinach in a large nonstick skillet over medium-low heat 2 to 3 minutes or until wilted. Drain. Cool slightly. Chop spinach. Mix together spinach, tomatoes and mozzarella cheese. Spoon into a resealable plastic bag. Seal bag. Snip off 1/4 inch from corner of bag. Squeeze spinach mixture into center of each chicken breast. Roll up chicken. Secure with wooden skewers. In shallow dish combine Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Place chicken in dishturn to coat. Heat olive oil in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until done.

In a large bowl combine beef, barbecue sauce, spaghetti sauce, and brown sugar. Marinate in refrigerator for 12 hours or overnight. Drain. Lay beef out flat on a flat baking pan. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 45 minutes. Flip over. Bake for 45 minutes more. Cut into strips. Serve with toothpicks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place eggplant slices in a bowl and pour just enough water to cover bottom of bowl. Let stand 10 minutesdrain and pat dry with paper towels. Place eggplant slices on lightly greased baking sheet and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until golden brown and tender, about 10 to 15 minutes per side. Mash tomatoes and avocadomix in remaining ingredients and refrigerate until serving. Serve on crackers or toast.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray two baking pans with cooking spray. Take a tortilla and spoon about 1/2 cup of meatloaf and salsa evenly across the tortilla. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of cheese on top. Fold in half and place in pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until the quesadilla is warm. I think they would be good with refried beans and salsa too.

1) combine chicken, soy sauce, sherry and garlic granules in a large resealable plastic bag. Marinate in refrigerator 30 minutes. 2) heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chickenstir-fry 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Add snow peas, carrot, cashews, chicken broth, cornstarch and salt. Stir-fry 3 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Cook noodles as directed on package. Serve chicken mixture over noodles. 365 quick, easy inexpensive dinner menus.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl combine bread crumbs, butter, onion and celery. Mix in parsley flakes, poultry seasoning and pepper and salt. Add chicken broth and mix to form a soft ball. Shape into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve with gravy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine cream cheese, sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Blend well. Pour into graham cracker crust. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until set. Cool. Top with pie filling and chocolate wafer. Refrigerate.

Grease two 9 x 5-inch loaf pans or a bundt pan. In a large bowl, beat butter with sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in extract. Add sour cream. Blend well. Stir in coconut. Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda. Beat into creamed mixture just until blended. Spoon batter into prepared pans. Bake at 350 for 45-55 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes in pan on a wire rack. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack. Makes 2 loaves or a bundt.

Put urad dal flour and rice flour in a mixing bowl and mix well. Heat oil in a tava/flat pan, add fenugreek seeds and when they crackle, add mustard seeds and curry leaves and let them splutter. Pour in the buttermilk and add the salt and mix well. Add the urad dal flour and rice flour mixture and mix well again. Switch off the stove and let this mixture sit for a while. When the mixture has cooled down a bit, start spreading it thinly on the tava as shown in the picture. Cook each side for 30 seconds to one minute and then turn over to cook on the other side as well. Drizzle with oil and serve hot with sambar and chutney.

Core apples, quinces, and cranberries, cut into quarters. Combine all in 2 quart casserole dish, sprinkle with sugar and cover with water. Cover with foil and bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until soft. Cool completely. Blend all together in blender or food processor until smooth. Pour into freezer container. Freeze until set- 6 hours or overnight. Yields 2 cups.

In a 3 quart pan add water, bouillon cube, garlic and chicken breast and let cook for about 20 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink. Add angel hair pasta and cook for an additional 8 minutes. Add mixed salad green and serve.

Sift flour, cornstarch, baking soda and baking powder into a large bowl. Add sugar, salt and egg. Stir in ice water until batter is smooth. Set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a fryer or deep-fat fryer to 360 degrees. Dip vegetables in batter to coat well. Fry until golden. Drain well on paper towels. Serve with tempura dipping sauce.
In a blender combine juice, ice cubes and raspberries. Process until smooth. Add apple and yogurt and process until smooth. Pour into glasses. Garnish each glass with 2 raspberries.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Remove any soft stem from the eggplant and discard. Coat eggplants with cooking spray. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. In a small bowl, mix together vinegar, soy sauce, and pepper flakespour over eggplants and bake for another 10 minutes or until eggplants are fork-tender. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.
Mix beans and cheese. Add picante sauce and tabasco sauce. Spread into a 9 x 13-inch casserole dish. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a small bowl combine the rosemary, olive oil, lemon juice and salt and pepper. Add the onion. Put the fish in the pan with the onion. Bake until the fish flakes easily, about 25 minutes. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut each chicken breast lengthwise in half. Place each breast half between 2 sheets of waxed paper or plastic wrap. Pound with meat mallet or rolling pin until about 1/2 inch thick. Place 1/2 cup milk in small bowl. Place 1 teaspoon Dijon in separate small bowl. Combine breadcrumbs and 1/2 teaspoon dried tarragon in another bowl. In another small bowl, place remaining 1/2 teaspoon dried tarragon. Dip each breast half into milk to coat both sides. Dip each breast half into Dijon to coat both sides. Coat both sides of breast half with crumb mixture. Place in single layer on non-stick cookie sheet sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for 40 minutes or until juice runs clear when thickest part of breast is pierced with fork. Garnish with fresh tarragon, if desired.
In a large mixing bowl combine all the ingredients and mix well. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. Garnish with cilantro leaves before serving.

1) Put the lemon juice and water in a pitcher and stir to combine. 2) Add the granulated sugar and stir until it is fully dissolved. Stir in the jalapenos and ice cubes and pour into glasses. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and saute until soft. Add tomato paste and cook for one minute. Add tomatoes and their juices, vinegar and water. Bring to a boil and add the rest of the spices. Simmer for about an hour or until the mixture has thickened. Stir in chickpeas and cook for about ten minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve over rice or with crusty bread.

In a skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in cabbage and cook until crisp-tender. Add apple and apple cider vinegar. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Stir in sugar and celery seed. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve warm or chilled.

Place the ground beef in a large stock pot. Add 1 gallon of water and the bouillon cube. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours. Strain. Pour the beef broth into clean pint size mason jars. Label and store in refrigerator.

Combine cottage cheese, egg yolks, flour, wheat germ, and salt and pepper in a large bowl. Stir in spinach, olive oil, and salt and pepper. Shape into patties. Melt margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pattiescook for about 3 minutes per side or until browned. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet or saute pan with a lid over medium-high heat, combine olive oil, garlic, chicken breasts, and season with salt and pepper. Cook the chicken until no longer pink (about 5 minutes per side). Once chicken is cooked through remove from pan and set aside. In the same pan add baby spinach and a little bit of water from the chicken broth (about 1/4 cup), cover the pan with the lid, and cook for about 30 seconds or until spinach just wilts. In a separate pan with a lid over medium heat bring chicken broth to a boil. Once it begins to boil add whole wheat couscous (do not stir) and cover the pan with the lid. Cook for about 8 minutes or until couscous is tender and fluffy. Once couscous is ready add in the tomatoes and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the chicken with the spinach mixture on top of the couscous, garnish with parsley, and enjoy!

In a large mixing bowl, cream together margarine, oil and sugar. Blend in eggs. Combine dry ingredients and blend into creamed mixture. Divide dough into 10 balls and roll into 3-inch circles. Place 1 inch apart on a greased baking sheet and bake at 375f for 10 minutes. Cool for 1 minute on pan and then transfer to wire rack to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Blend first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Beat butter mixture until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla, applesauce, flour, baking soda, & salt. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by spoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes. Remove to wire rack. Cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350. Toss chicken breasts in sweet and sour sauce. Place chicken in a casserole dish. Add bell pepper and onion. Pour chicken broth over the chicken. Bake for 35-45 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Serve over uncooked rice.

Cut pork into two equal parts. Marinate in adobo sauce for one hour or more. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a deep pan, heat oil and brown the pork shoulder on all sides. Remove pork and add onions, garlic and pepper. Saute until onions are translucent. Add adobo seasoning and sofrito sauce. Cook for ten minutes. In a large bowl, combine water and vinegar. Place pork in the bowl and add the water mixture. Cover and marinate in refrigerator for at least two hours. Remove pork from marinade and place in roasting pan. Add sofrito sauce and cover with aluminum foil. Roast for two hours. Remove from oven and uncover. Cook for another hour or until pork is fork-tender. Serve with rice and beans.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 13x9x2 inch pan with foil, with ends of foil extending over sides of pan. Grease foil with vegetable oil. Prepare cake according to package directions for a 13x9x2 inch pan. Spread into prepared pansprinkle with lemonade and sweetened condensed milk. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 25 minutes. Remove from oven, and cool completely. Combine pudding and milk in a bowlstir well with a whisk. Cool completely, spreading evenly over cake layer. Refrigerate for a few hours to set. Cool completely, spreading evenly over cake layer. Refrigerate for a few hours to set. Spread with Cool Whipgarnish with lemon peel and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 375 F. Combine cake mix, eggs, oil, and water in bowlbeat on medium speed until well blended. Pour into greased and floured 9x13 pan. Bake for 35-40 min or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely. In small bowl combine mandarin oranges, pineapple, pudding mix, and milk until well blendedspread over cooled cake. Spread with Cool Whiprefrigerate overnight. In small bowl combine powdered sugar and milk until blendeddrizzle over top of cake. Garnish with fresh fruit if desired.

Combine all dry ingredients. Combine all liquid ingredients. Place bread pan into bread machine. Add dry ingredients. Add liquid ingredients. Select dough cycle. Remove dough from machine. Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth. Roll out on floured surface. Fold 1/3 of the dough over the remaining 2/3. Roll out again. Fold again. Repeat 1 more time. Roll out on floured surface. Roll up dough. Pinch edges to seal. Place seam side down on bread pan. Cover with plastic wrap. Let rise until doubled. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes. Remove from pan. Brush with honey glaze. Sprinkle with poppy seeds.

Combine boiling water and gelatin. Pour over 1 cup crushed pineapplelet stand 2 minutes. Add 3 cups cold pineapplestir until blended. Add soda and juicestir well. Pour into 13x9x2-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm. Garnish with whipped topping.

Cook the rigatoni according to the package directions until tender, but firm to the bite. Drain and set aside. Cook the sausage in the skillet until browneddrain and set aside. Heat the oil in the skilletadd the onion and saute until tender, about 3 minutes. Add the marinara sauce and cook until heated through. Add the pasta and sausage and heat through. Sprinkle evenly with the mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and browned.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together the butter and the sugars until light and fluffy. Add the vanilla and eggs and beat until the mixture is creamy and well combined. Sift together the flour and baking powder. Add the flour mixture alternately with the milk, beginning and ending with the flour. Blend in the peaches. Pour the batter into the greased and floured baking pan. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until done. Serve warm with cream or ice cream.

Mix peach jello with boiling water and allow to set. Cut peach ice cream into cubes and place in a bowl. Add pudding mix and allow to set. Cut the whipped topping and place in a bowl with the peach jello cubes. Add the peach ice cream cubes and mix well. Spoon into pie shell and refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve cold.

In a large skillet, cook mushrooms and peppers in butter for 2 minutes. Add soup, milk, broccoli, chicken and nutmeg. Cook over medium-low heat for 5 minutes or until heated through, stirring occasionally.

Saute onions with the oil for 5 minutes over medium heat. Add the chilies and cook another 10 minutes or until the chilies are softened. Add the potatoes and enough boiling water to cover them by 1 inch. Stir the potatoes to make sure they are well coated with oil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer until the potatoes are tender. Season with salt and serve immediately.

Brown chicken in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion. Cook 2-3 minutes or until onion is tender. Add taco seasoning and water. Cook 1 minute longer. Stir in diced tomatoes and chilies. Cook 5 minutes. Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. Combine pasta and sauce in a large bowl. Top with cheddar cheese. Serve with a side salad.

Mix flour, baking soda and cocoa in a medium bowl. Set aside. Beat butter, applesauce and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla and mint extract. Add egg white and beat until combined. Add the flour mixture and beat until dough comes together. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Preheat oven to 375f. Roll dough into 1 inch balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes until cookies are set. Cool on wire racks. Dip the top of each cookie in the melted chocolate and let stand until set. Makes 5 dozen.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large bowl, beat together the butter and white sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the vanilla extract and instant coffee granules. Beat in the hot water. In a small bowl, combine the flour, cocoa powder and saltstir into the coffee mixture. Stir in the walnuts. Shape the dough into 1-inch ballsplace on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until the balls are no longer shiny (about 10 minutes). Remove from the oven and cool on the sheet for about 10 minutes. Roll the cooled butterballs in the icing sugar to coat. Store in an airtight container.

To make the vinaigrette, combine the olive oil and concentrate in a measuring cup with 1/4 cup of water and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Shake well. To prepare the salad, combine the endive and apples in a large salad bowl. Add the cranberries and green onion. Pour the vinaigrette over the salad and toss well. Garnish with the walnuts. Makes 6 servings.

Heat butter and graham cracker crumbs in medium saucepan over medium-low heat until butter is melted and crumbs are moistened. Cool about 10 minutes. Press mixture into bottom and up side of 8-inch square baking pan. Bake in 350 degree oven for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle chocolate chips over top. Melt chocolate in microwave in 15 second increments. Spread chocolate over top. Top with miniature marshmallows. Microwave for about 40 seconds until marshmallows puff up. Cool in refrigerator. Cut into bars. Store in refrigerator. Makes about 16 bars.

Mix cake mix, water and oil in bowl until crumbly. Press firmly into greased and floured 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes or until crumbly is golden brown. Cool completely on rack. Combine milk and pudding mix in medium bowl and mix well. Add eggs and beat well. Pour over crumbly and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Before serving, spread top with whipped cream and sprinkle with heath bars.

In a saucepan combine the raspberries, sugar, vinegar and water. Bring to a boil. Cook, stirring frequently, until reduced to 1 1/2 cups or desired thickness. Cool completely, strain and discard raspberries. Keep covered in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Use in place of raspberry syrup in recipes for a lighter flavor.
Slice mangoes and blueberries into 1/4 inch thick slices. Squeeze lime juice on top of mango and blueberries. Sprinkle with crystallized ginger. Top with dollop of whipped cream.

Cut each avocado in half and remove seed. Chop tomatoes and mozzarella. Add olive oil to skillet and heat over medium heat. Add garlic cloves and basil to oil. Saute until garlic is fragrant, but not browned. Remove from heat and let cool. Combine avocado halves with tomato and cheese mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve with balsamic vinegar.

In a blender, put in lemon juice and make a fine paste. Marinate chicken in lemon juice. Add in salt and pepper and cumin seeds. Mix well and refrigerate for an hour. Heat oil in a pan and fry chicken with the marinade. Stir till it turns golden brown. Serve hot.

Cook linguine according to package instructions, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water. Melt the 1/4 cup of butter in a large skillet. Add the garlic cloves and saute until garlic is golden brown. Add the heavy cream and cook until it begins to simmer. Add the 1/4 cup of parmesan cheese and the 2 tablespoons of parsley flakes and the 1/2 teaspoon of basil flakes. Remove from heat and stir in the reserved pasta water. Add pasta to sauce and toss until evenly coated. Serve immediately with additional cheese and basil flakes on top if desired.

Combine all ingredients in a saucepan over low heat. Cook until the sugar dissolves. Remove from the heat. Let it cool. Once it is completely cooled, place in a glass jar or bottle and store in the refrigerator.

Heat olive oil in a pan and add the chicken tenders. Season with salt and pepper and cook for 4-5 minutes on each side. Meanwhile cook the potato wedges in the oven for 25-30 minutes at 180c. Cook the bacon on a low heat until crispy. Break the eggs into a pan with some water and cook until the whites are set and the yolks are still runny. Toast the bread on both sides and butter each slice. Assemble the sandwiches by spreading the dressing on the bread, add the lettuce then the bacon followed by the eggs. Add a sprinkling of parmesan and a few wedges of potato on each sandwich before folding the bread in half and serve.

Melt butter over medium-low heat in heavy saucepan. Add onion and saute until softened and beginning to brown. Add garlic and saute 1 minute more. Add squash and toss to coat with onion mixture. Add tarragon and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350 F. In a medium mixing bowl combine the spinach and the stuffing mix. Stir in the margarine until the spinach is coated. In a separate bowl combine the mozzarella and egg. Stir the mozzarella and egg mixture into the spinach mixture. Chill in the refrigerator for one hour. Form into balls and roll in the Parmesan cheese. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

Beat cream cheese and cheddar cheese in a large bowl until creamy. Beat in sour cream and seasonings. Fold in crab meat. Spoon into a lightly greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Makes 10 servings.

Dissolve unflavored gelatin in cold water. In a separate bowl combine the evaporated milk with the pink lemonade concentrate. Stir in the gelatin mixture. Pour into pie shell. Chill for at least 4 hours before topping. In a small bowl, combine the sugar and red food coloring. Beat until smooth. Beat in the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Spread the meringue on top of the pie. Bake for 2 minutes. Cool completely before cutting. Makes 8 servings.
Mix the frozen fruit with the powdered sugar and pour into serving bowl. In another bowl mix the yogurt with the biscuit crumbs. Mix the two together and serve.

Spread tuna salad on the bun of one half of the sandwich. Sprinkle on the cheddar cheese. Place the other bun half on top. Spread peanut butter on the outside of the sandwich. Sprinkle on the corn kernel and banana chips. Slice the banana to look like sails on the top of the sandwich. Cut the sandwich in half diagonally. Serve with potato chips.

Melt butter with caster sugar and cinnamon in a pan. Cook over low heat until melted and bubbly. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Beat the eggs with the milk and then stir in the butter mixture. Pour the mixture into a buttered dish and bake for 30 minutes at 180 degrees or until the custard has set and is just golden on top. Cool on a rack and dust with icing sugar before serving. Serves 6

In a saucepan over low heat, melt butter and brown sugar together. Stir in light corn syrup and vanilla extract. Remove from heat and stir in salt. Stir oats into mixture and toss well. Spread evenly onto ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with chocolate chips. Let stand for 1 minute, then spread chocolate evenly with spatula. Sprinkle with walnuts and let stand for 2 minutes more or until chocolate is set. Remove from cookie sheet and cut into bars or squares.
In a large bowl add red candies, applesauce, boiling water, red jello mix. Stir until dissolved. Refrigerate overnight or until set. May top with whipped cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a pie pan with shortening or cooking spray. Beat together eggs, cheese and cream until blended. Pour mixture into prepared pie crust and bake in preheated oven until set, about 1 hour. Let stand for about 20 minutes before cutting.
Thinly slice cucumber and onion. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Refrigerate overnight. Can be stored for 2 weeks.

Combine red hot sauce, oil and 1/4 cup water in medium bowl. Toss in chicken to coatcover. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chickencook 3 minutes on each side or until done. Transfer to platterkeep warm. Heat remaining 1/4 cup water in skillet until simmering. Add 1/2 cup flourstir until thickened. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon saltremove from heat. Stir in remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Cream sugar and shortening. Add egg. Stir in flour, salt, and nutmeg. Add apple. Shape into 1-inch balls. Roll into nuts. Place 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 8- 10 minutes.

Bring 1 cup water to boil in large potremove from heat. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Add cherries and lemon juicelet stand 15 minutes. Strain liquid through cheesecloth-lined sieve into large pitcher. Add tea bags and star anisesteep 15 minutes. Remove tea bags and anisestir in mint sprigs. Refrigerate up to 2 days. Serve over ice.

Cut soup bone into large pieces and put into a large pot. Add onion and celery and saute over medium heat until onion is translucent and celery is tender. Add garlic powder, basil and bay leaf and saute for 1 minute. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and add soup bone and meat. Add salt and pepper to taste and simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour until meat is very tender. Add orzo and simmer for 5 minutes. Add cheese and stir until melted. Serve in bowls topped with cheese and crushed crackers.

Peel potatoes and cut into quarters. Boil in water until tender. Drain potatoes. Combine onion and remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Add potatoes to mixture. Bake uncovered at 350f for 20 minutes. Stir. Cover and bake another 20 minutes. Uncover and stir. Cover and bake another 20 minutes. Stir. Cover and bake another 20 minutes. Uncover and bake 10 minutes. Stir and serve.

Pre-heat a charcoal grill to high. Drizzle the courgettes with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill for 2-3 minutes on each side until tender. Remove from the heat. Toss the courgettes with lemon juice and parmesan cheese. Crumble over the walnuts and sprinkle with cayenne pepper. Serve immediately.

Place asparagus in a single layer in a 9x13-in baking dish. Bring butter and brown sugar to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add chicken broth and stir until melted and combined. Pour mixture over the asparagus and bake at 350 degrees f for 15 minutes or until asparagus is tender and glaze is bubbly. Makes 4 servings.

Combine the whole wheat flour, bread flour, salt, sugar and Splenda in a mixing bowl. Pour in the beer and stir just until the mixture forms a dough. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes or until the dough is soft and elastic. Place in a greased bowl and turn to grease the top of the dough. Cover the dough with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for about an hour or until it has doubled in bulk. Punch the dough down. Roll out the dough to 1/4-inch thickness on a lightly floured surface. Cut the dough into 2-inch squares and place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 400 degrees F for 8 to 10 minutes or until the edges are golden brown and the bread is firm. Makes 4 dozen bread squares.
Cut fennel bulbs in half. Slice thinly. Combine all other ingredients in small bowl. Pour over fennel bulbs. Toss lightly. Serve.

Saute the mushrooms in olive oil until tender, then add the onion and red pepper. Continue cooking until the onion and red pepper are tender. Add the garlic powder, lemon juice and wine. Cook until the liquid has evaporated and serve.

Cut chicken into 1/4 inch slices. Put in plastic bag. Pound chicken to 1/4 inch thickness with flat side of meat mallet. Dip each chicken piece in egg and then in bread crumbs to coat. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Fry chicken slices until browned on both sides. Remove from skillet and drain on paper towels. Cook pasta sauce and pour 1 cup over each bread. Arrange 4 chicken slices on each hero. Sprinkle each with 2 tablespoons mozzarella cheese. Bake in preheated 400 degree oven for 5 minutes or until cheese melts. Top with remaining pasta sauce. Yield: 4 servings.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Remove 2 of the bread dough balls from refrigerator. Roll them out to 10-inch circles. Brush each circle with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Sprinkle each circle with 1/4 teaspoon of the black pepper, 1/8 teaspoon of the italian seasoning, 1/2 tablespoon of the mozzarella cheese and 1/4 teaspoon of the parmesan. Arrange the slices of the pepperoni on each circle in a single row. Starting at one end of the row, roll the circle like a jelly roll. Transfer to a baking sheet. Repeat for remaining 2 bread dough balls. Brush the tops of the rolls with remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Sprinkle the rolls with remaining 1/2 tablespoon of the mozzarella cheese. Bake 30 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before slicing.

In large pot over high heat, add oil. Add green beans and cook until crisp tender. Add broccoli and cook until tender. Add zucchini and green onions and cook until tender. Add stock and cook until liquid is reduced by half. Add pesto and pepper. Simmer. Remove from heat and serve.

Soak bread in milk. Add chilies, coriander leaves and yogurt. Mix well. Add semolina and knead to form a stiff dough. Divide into equal portions. Shape into discs. Dip into red chili powder. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Bake at 180 degrees C for 10 minutes. Serve hot.
Combine all ingredients except nuts. Pour into mold and refrigerate. 4 hours or overnight. Before serving add nuts and stir.

Grease 9x13x2-inch baking dish. In large bowl beat together sugar, oil, eggs and vanilla until well blended. Stir in apples and walnuts. In medium bowl combine flour, baking soda, nutmeg and cinnamonadd to sugar mixture and stir well. Spread batter in baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes or until cake tester inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 15 minutesinvert onto wire rack to cool completely.

Cut meat across the grain into 2 inch strips. In a skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Cook steak until no longer pink. Remove steak with slotted spoon to a plate. Add ramen noodles to skillet. Combine soy sauce and broth. Pour over ramen noodles. Cook until noodles are tender. Meanwhile, cook frozen vegetables according to package directions. Serve steak with noodles mixture over vegetables.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Coat chicken with italian dressing and wrap with foil. Bake 20 minutes and then slice into 1/4 inch strips. Prepare lettuce leaves by removing the outer leaves and washing well under cold running water. Tear into large pieces and place into serving bowl. Add chicken and sprinkle with tomatoes and hummus. Makes 4 servings.

Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the chicken until browned on all sides. Remove from heat and set aside. Combine the feta and scallions. Season with a little salt and black pepper. Slice the baguette in half. Spread the inside with olive oil and sprinkle with a little black pepper. Top with the chicken and the mixture of scallions and feta. Drizzle with a little balsamic and top with the cherry tomatoes.

Pit plums and remove skin. Cut plums in half and slice. Place plums in a pot with ginger, chilies, clove, cinnamon and allspice. Pour vinegar over plums and spices. Add sugar and stir to dissolve sugar. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to medium. Simmer for 10 minutes or until plums are soft. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Pour into a sterilized container. Keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the green beans. Stir in the cornstarch. Add the teriyaki sauce. Add the carrots. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Serve over steamed rice.

Boil potatoes. Drain. Add soup and cream of mushroom soup. Stir in onion. Add velveeta and melt. Pour into a baking dish. Top with nacho cheese flavor doritos. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Serve immediately.

Mix blueberries, sugar and cornstarch and pour into the bottom of one unbaked pie crust. Dot with butter pieces and place top crust over the filling and crimp the edges firmly. Bake at 375 for about 1 hour or until the crust is light brown and the fruit is thickened and bubbly.

Cut the peppers lengthwise into 1/4 thick slices. In a small bowl combine olive oil, garlic, lemon rind, pepper flakes and salt. Heat the oil mixture for 1 minute in the microwave. Remove the mixture from the microwave and let cool slightly. Cut the mozzarella cheese into 1/4 thick slices. Place the peppers on a large plate and sprinkle with the cooled oil mixture. Top with mozzarella cheese slices. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or longer until serving time. Garnish with basil leaves and drizzle with fresh lemon juice. Serve chilled.

In a large frying pan or skillet, saute onion and green pepper in olive oil until tender and translucent, about 2 minutes. Add garlic cloves and cook for another minute. Add whole tomatoes, wine and stock, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the sauce is thickened and reduced to half the volume. Meanwhile, rinse fish and pat dry with paper towels. Drain tomatoes and discard seeds and skins. In a separate small saucepan, warm the oil with the oregano, parsley and basil for about 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes and the olives and turn off the heat. Remove the snapper from the refrigerator and pat it dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with oil and lemon juice. Broil or grill for about 2 minutes on each side and serve with the sauce and the garnish.

Mix flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a bowl. Add butter cut into small pieces. Mix together with your fingers. Add milk, vanilla and light brown sugar. Knead into a firm dough. Form into small balls and place them 3 cm apart on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 190c for 15 minutes or until they have just turned a golden brown. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Beat together the boiling water, butter and brown sugar. Drizzle over the biscuits. Makes 40 biscuits.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9-inch pie pan. Peel and seed squash. Cut squash into small chunks and put in a large pot with sugar and spices. Add enough water so squash is covered and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and cook until squash is tender, 20-25 minutes. Cool slightly and puree in a blender or food processor until smooth. Beat eggs until frothy. Add sugar and cream and beat until well blended and smooth. Add squash puree and beat until combined. Pour into pie crust. Bake until center is just set, 40-45 minutes. Serve warm or cold.
Place the tea leaves in a teapot. Fill with boiling water and let it stand for 5 minutes. Strain the leaves and add milk and sugar to taste. Pour into a teacup and enjoy.

Wash and wipe the mushrooms dry. Heat olive oil in the pan and saute the onions and garlic. Add lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Set aside. Heat butter in the pan and fry the mushrooms for about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with flour and saute for 1 minute. Add the cream, egg yolks and breadcrumbs. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into baking pan. Bake in oven for 1 hour at 180 degrees. Sprinkle with parsley.

Cook macaroni in boiling water according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Combine cottage cheese and spinach in a large bowl. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heatstir in garlic and Sriracha sauce. Cook until cheese is melted. Add cheddar cheese and stir until cheese is completely melted. Stir cottage cheese mixture into macaronimix well. Serve immediately and enjoy!

In a small saucepan, combine 1/2 cup water, cornstarch, 1/4 cup sugar and lemon zest. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened and bubbly. Remove from the heat and whisk in 1/4 cup lemon juice. Cool. In a small bowl combine milk and vanilla. In another bowl beat whipped topping until soft peaks form. Add milk mixture and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold in cornstarch mixture.
