Fold in lemon juice. Divide into four bowls and color with food coloring. Refrigerate at least 2 hours. Top with whipped topping and sprinkle with zest.

In a large bowl, beat egg until foamy. Add the sugar. Stir in the nuts. Mix in the dates. Add milk and vanilla. Beat in flour. Spread into a 13 x 9 baking pan. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes. Cool. Cut into 3 inch bars. Makes 18 bars.
In a tall glass, add coffee, half-and-half cream, coffee ice cream and club soda. Add a dollop of whipped cream and serve immediately.

In a large bowl toss together parsley, coriander, lemon zest, lemon juice, garlic cloves and ground cumin. Remove the skin from haddock fillets and place in the marinade, cover with cling film and leave for 30 minutes in the fridge. Heat olive oil in a large non-stick frypan over medium-high heat, add haddock fillets to pan in batches and cook for 3 minutes per side or until cooked through. Serve with watercress dressed with olive oil, lemon juice and seasoning.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Mix together the berries and the sugar and let sit for 15 minutes. In a small bowl, combine the flour and the granola. Add the butter and stir until the mixture resembles course crumbs. Press into the bottom of a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Spread the berry mixture over the crumbs and top with the vanilla yogurt. Bake for 40 minutes or until the top is brown.

In a large bowl mix biscuit dough. On a lightly greased cookie sheet place dough in a round circle. Press dough into pan to cover the bottom. Bake 10 minutes at 400F. While the dough is baking cook sausage and melt cheese together. Mix eggs and milk. Pour over crust and bake 10-15 minutes longer until egg mixture is cooked. Remove from oven and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Allow to stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter and saut the onion until golden. Add the mushrooms and saut until soft. Add the broccoli and saut until bright green. Remove from heat. Stir in the flour and salt and pepper to taste. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the flour mixture and saut until the mixture is lightly browned. Add the chicken broth and the red wine. Cook until thickened and the broccoli is tender. Remove from heat and stir in the cream. Serve immediately.

Melt butter and saute onion and garlic until tender. Remove from heat and stir in flour. Slowly add half-and-half and bring to boil. Add mozzarella cheese and stir until melted. Remove from heat and stir in fontina and provolone cheese. Add pepper and parsley. Toss with pasta and top with parmesan. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut sausage into bite-size pieces and cook until done. In a large bowl, combine potatoes with remaining ingredients and toss to coat well. Transfer to a shallow baking dish and bake for 45 minutes or until potatoes are fork-tender. Stir in sausage and continue to bake for an additional 10 minutes or until the potatoes are crisp on the outside and the edges are lightly browned.

Sauté onions and green onion in butter in a saucepan until tender. Add lima beans. Add chicken broth. Heat to boiling. Add cornmeal. Cook for 5 minutes. Add fish and mushrooms. Cook until fish is done and liquid has thickened. Add parsley and dill. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly coat french bread slices with olive oil. Bake until crisp. Spread with caesar salad dressing. Top with lettuce, shrimp and cheese. Bake until cheese melts.

Melt the margarine in a skillet. Add the celery and onions and saute until they are soft. Sprinkle the flour over the celery and onion mixture. Stir and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the milk and cook until mixture is thick and smooth. Add the parsley and cook for about 1 minute more. Remove from the heat and add the eggs. Mix well. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle the top with the bread crumbs and dot with butter. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until the bread crumbs are brown.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease and flour 9x13 pan. In large bowl mix sugar, oil, eggs and vanilla. Beat well. Add orange juice and zest. Sift together flour, salt and baking powder. Stir into sugar mixture. Stir in cocoa. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until center is set. Cool completely before cutting. Dust with confectioners sugar. Cut into squares.

Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan and add the onion. Sweat for 5 minutes. Add the paste and stir fry for 2 minutes. Stir in the coconut milk. Bring to the boil and cook for 1 minute. Add the stock, fish sauce and brown sugar. Bring to the boil and cook for 3 minutes. Add the bamboo shoots and peas and cook for 1 minute. Add the chicken and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the basil and serve. Serves 4.

Cut cucumbers into 1/2-inch pieces. Combine vinegars, sugar, and salt in small saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until mixture is reduced by half. Stir in sesame seeds. Pour dressing over cucumber pieces. Let stand for at least 1 hour before serving.

In a small bowl combine oyster sauce and beer. Cut the beef steaks across the grain into strips about 3 inches long and 1/2 inch thick. Thread beef onto skewers and marinade in the beer mixture for 1 to 2 hours in a covered dish in the refrigerator. Preheat the grill or broiler to high heat. Grill or broil the beef until cooked through, about 5 minutes. Serve the steaks with a drizzle of the remaining beer mixture and a sprinkle of black pepper and freshly ground pepper.
Mix all together until smooth. Chill. Roll into balls. Roll in colored sugar.

Melt butter in a sauce pan over low heat. Add onion and saute for 5 to 7 minutes until onions are translucent. Add tomatoes, tomato paste and herbs and saute for 10 minutes. Add sugar and salt and pepper to taste. Add chicken and bring to a simmer for about 20 minutes. Remove chicken from potage and allow to cool. Add heavy cream to potage and reheat. Ladle into bowls and top with chicken. Serve with grated parmesan cheese.

Combine first four ingredients in a teapot. Pour in 2 cups boiling water. Cover and steep 15 minutes. Strain. Serve iced with a splash of lemon and honey. Add ice cubes if desired. Garnish with fresh mint leaf. Serves 4.

Brown chicken in a skillet with butter. Remove chicken from skillet and place on paper towels. Pour off drippings from the skillet leaving the butter behind. Pour hot sauce over the chicken then put it back in the skillet along with the melted butter. Stir until well coated. Top tortilla chips with chicken mixture and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Top with green onions and ranch dressing.

In a large saute pan on medium heat add butter and saute onions until translucent. Add in the flounder fillets and cook for about 2 minutes per side, depending on thickness. Add in the italian seasoned bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, lemon juice and salt and pepper. Cook another minute or two until the bread crumbs are crisp on top. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

Boil onion and water for about 10 minutes or until onion is tender. Add lentils and cook another 20 minutes or until tender. Add seasoning, garlic and tomato sauce. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until sauce thickens and lentils are tender. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese and parmesan cheese and simmer until cheese is melted and sauce is thickened, about 5 more minutes. Serve sauce over pasta or with vegetables or bread. Makes 4 servings

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Spread cut side down on baking sheets. Bake 5 to 7 minutes or until golden brown. Spread top halves of buns with mayonnaise. Top with relish and onions. Place bottom halves of buns over filling. Top with fish fillets and cheese slices. Bake 1 to 2 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease and flour 2 loaf pans. Cream together sugar and butter. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add almond extract. Add flour, baking powder, salt alternately with milk, beating after each addition. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Pour into 2 loaf pans. Bake 1 hour or until cake tests done. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack. Dust with confectioners sugar. Makes 2 8x4x2-1/4" loaf cakes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a muffin tin with butter or nonstick cooking spray.Combine applesauce, agave nectar, egg and butter in a large mixing bowl. Beat well with an electric mixer.In another bowl, combine baking soda, baking powder and saltstir into applesauce mixture until combined.In a small bowl, combine white flour and whole wheat flourstir into applesauce mixture until just combined. Fill each muffin cup about half full. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown. Let cool slightly before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spread pizza sauce over both sides of each Italian roll. Arrange meatballs evenly over each slice. Top with mozzarella cheese, then wrap rolls loosely in foil. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Unwrap rolls, top with your favorite condiments, then serve.

Dip each fillet in the flour mixture. Shake off excess. Dip in beaten egg. Press nuts onto the top and bottom of each fillet. Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes. Drain juices from pineapple. Combine with remaining ingredients. Serve fish with pineapple salsa. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------.

Place chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of boiling water. Stir constantly until chocolate is melted and smooth. Set aside to cool slightly. Beat eggs lightly. Add corn syrup, sugar and butter and mix well. Add chocolate mixture and vanilla. Mix thoroughly. Pour into pie shell and bake for 35-45 minutes or until edges are set and center is firm. Cool before serving. To serve, dust top of pie with confectioners sugar and garnish each portion of pie with a few walnut halves. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Butter a 3-quart baking dish. Peel carrots and cut into 1/2-inch pieces. In a large pot, combine carrots, 1 cup water, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon white pepper. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain carrots in a colander over a bowl and reserve carrot liquid. In a large bowl, whisk eggs. Whisk in heavy cream. Stir in carrots. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, combine broth and soupheat through. Add cilantro and pepperstir well. Place half the tortilla chips in a shallow serving bowl. Top with half the soup mixture and top with remaining chips and remaining soup mixture. Top with avocado slices and cilantro sprigs. Makes 4 servings
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss carrots with the oil. Season with the salt & pepper. Roast for about 20 minutes or until the carrots are tender. Sprinkle with the feta cheese & parsley.

Microwave water until hot. Add the white sugar, molasses and lemon juice. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add vanilla and stir well. Peel the peaches and cut into thin slices. Put the slices of peaches in the saucepan and microwave for 2 minutes on high power or until heated through. Serve warm over cake or ice cream.
Stir lemon yogurt in blender. Add vanilla-flavored soymilk, heavy cream, lemon zest, honey, and berries. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately or freeze in a loaf pan for later.

Grease and line 12 x 8 inch baking tin. Break hazelnuts into pieces and put into a food processor. Blitz until finely ground. Add butter and blend until crumbly. Beat together the eggs and brown sugar in a bowl. Stir in the chocolate and butter mixture. Stir in the flour and baking powder. Pour into tin and bake for 25 minutes until slightly firm to the touch. Leave to cool in tin. Cut into squares and dust with icing sugar before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease and flour 9x5 inch loaf pan. In large bowl, combine oats, 1 1/2 cups flour, oats and 1/2 cup sugar. In smaller bowl combine egg, milk and oil. Stir egg mixture into oat mixture. Stir in remaining flour, baking powder and salt. In small bowl combine raisins and 2 tablespoons sugar. Add to batter. Spoon into prepared pan. Bake for 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove from pancool completely on wire rack. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a small saute pan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlicsaute for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add broccoli florets and cauliflower floretstoss to coat with oil. Transfer mixture to a baking dish. Add salt and pepper to taste. Bake for 25 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese if desired. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 450. Peel potatoes and slice into wedges. In a large bowl, toss potatoes, olive oil, rosemary and crushed red pepper. In a large baking pan spread the potatoes in a single layer. Bake 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice. Sprinkle with garlic. Return to oven. Bake 5 minutes more or until crisp. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Dissolve the mustard in the white wine. Stir in the cream. Cook the chops in the butter in the skillet over medium heat for 3-4 minutes on each side. Transfer the chops to plates. Spoon the sauce over the chops and serve. Serve with potatoes or rice.
Place ice cubes in blender container. Add tequila, curacao, and triple secblend until smooth. Fold in lime sherbet until well blended. Pour into glasses and serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

Place all the seasoned breadcrumbs in shallow dish. Put the eggs in another shallow dish. Cut the chicken into strips about 1 inch wide. Dip each strip into egg and then into breadcrumbs. Place strips on greased baking sheets. Bake at 400 degrees F 10-15 minutes until golden. Serve with ranch dressing.

Put the black peppercorns and the white pepper in a blender or food processor. Pulse to crack them into fine pieces. Put the cracked peppercorns and the salt into a medium-size resealable plastic bag. Add the steaks. Seal the bag and turn to coat the steaks. Remove as much air as possible and seal the bag. Refrigerate the steaks for at least 1 hour. Meanwhile, in a medium-size saucepan bring the half-and-half to a simmer over medium-low heat. Add the butter and the Worcestershire and Tabasco. Add the steaks. Cover the pan and cook over low heat for about 3 minutes per side. Remove the steaks and keep warm. Boil the liquid until slightly thickened. Pour over the steaks. Makes 4 servings.

Rub each chicken breast with salt. Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain and set aside. Saute onion until tender. Add the chicken to the skillet and brown on both sides. Drain and set aside. Return the onions to the pan and add the bacon. Mix well. Add the lemon pepper seasoning. Add the brow sugar. Bring to a boil. Add the wine. Add the reserved chicken and the colby monterey jack cheese. Cover and cook for 10 minutes on low heat or until the cheese is melted.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add celery and saute until tender. Add flour, mix well. Cook for one minute. Add broth slowly while whisking. Cook until thick. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer for one hour. Serve with sour cream.

Boil water in a saucepan with a few pinches of salt. Cut parsnip into 1/2 inch dice and place in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and place into a bowl with butter. Melt butter over low heat, then turn off heat and pour over parsnip cubes. Toss to coat and sprinkle with salt, mustard and pepper to taste. Transfer to a baking dish, top with breadcrumbs, and bake in a 350 degrees fahrenheit oven until golden brown, about 25 minutes.

Peel and cut potatoes into 1 inch pieces. Cover and boil in salted water until tender. Drain and return to pot. Add butter and sour cream. Mash until smooth. Add cheese and stir until melted and combined. Season with salt and pepper. Spray nonstick cooking spray on a baking sheet. Place potatoes in sprayed baking sheet. Bake until potatoes are warm and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425. In a small saucepan, combine the potatoes with the water and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce the heat to medium low and cook until tender. Drain potatoes and return to the pan. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the bacon until crispy and set aside. Add the chili powder and cook for one minute. Add the potatoes and mix. Add the bacon and mix thoroughly. Transfer the potatoes to a baking dish and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake until the cheese is melted and the potatoes are heated through. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place the baking potatoes in the microwave to cook them until they are soft. Peel the skin from the baking potatoes. Cut the baking potatoes into thin strips. Place in bowl with the butter and mix well. Pour into an ungreased baking pan and bake for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with the paprika and serve.

Peel, core, and quarter apples. Toss apples with sugar, butter, flour and salt. Put into a 10-inch pie pan. In a separate bowl whisk together eggs, milk, and vanilla. Pour over apples. Bake at 375 degrees for 1 hour. Let cool 1 hour before serving.

Drain tuna. Pat dry with paper towels. Add flour. Dip tuna pieces in flour. Melt margarine in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add tuna pieces. Brown on each side. Remove tuna. Add onions to skillet and saute until tender. Add white wine. Cook for a couple minutes to reduce. Add milk and cook until mixture is thick. Remove from heat. Add tuna pieces. Stir to coat with sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over toast. Garnish with tomatoes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups.In a large bowl, cream together oil and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and applesaucemix well. Combine flour, baking powder and spicesstir into creamed mixture just until moistened. Fold in carrots and walnuts. Divide batter evenly among prepared muffin cupsbake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Cool muffins in pan 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large saucepan cook onions in butter over medium heat for 30 minutes. Add flour and stir for 1 minute. Add milk all at once. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in nutmeg. Place in an oven-proof serving dish. Combine bread crumbs with the 1/2 cup melted butter. Sprinkle over top of the pearl onions. Bake for 25 minutes.

Toast sesame seeds in oven until golden. Cool and grind in food processor. In a medium bowl combine sesame seeds, poppy seeds, thyme leaves and olive oil. Spread mixture over pita bread. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator.

Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions and saut for 2 minutes. Add carrots and sausage and cook for 8 minutes or until onion is soft and sausage is no longer pink. Add broth and beans and bring to a boil. Simmer uncovered for 10 minutes. Add pesto and season with salt and pepper. Serve with grated parmesan cheese.

Melt the butter in a large skillet. Add the wine, lemon juice and garlic. Bring to a boil. Add the shrimp, cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Sprinkle the shrimp with the parsley. Season with salt. Serves 4.

In a skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until browned on both sides. Add the soup and water. Cover and cook over low heat for 20 minutes or until chicken is tender. Stir in mushrooms and broccoli and cook another 2-3 minutes. Serve over minute rice.

Peel and cube the potatoes. Boil in water until tender. Mash and let cool. Add the rest of the ingredients except the oil. Heat oil in a skillet. Drop the potato mixture by the teaspoonful and fry until brown. Turn and brown the other side.

In a medium saucepan add the potatoes and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook until potatoes are tender but not falling apart. Drain water and allow potatoes to cool slightly. In a large sauté pan heat 1 tbsp of the butter over medium high heat and add the onion and cook until translucent. Add the green beans and ham and sauté for 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat and add the potatoes and remaining butter. Stir until combined and serve.

Melt 1 tbsp of the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the leeks and onions and saute until softened. Add the potatoes and saute for 1 minute. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes, until the potatoes are soft. Add the quinoa and saute for 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Crumble the cheese in a mixing bowl. Add the mayonnaise, prepared mustard and tabasco sauce to the bowl and stir until all the cheese is smooth. Put some mayonnaise on the outside of both sides of the bread. Put about 1/2 cup of the mixture on the top slice of bread, spreading it evenly with the back of a spoon. Top with the bottom slice of bread, pressing the sandwich gently to remove any excess mixture that may be between the slices. Cut the sandwich into 4 triangles or squares and serve at room temperature.

Heat oil in frying pan or wok over medium heat. Place chicken in pan with oil. Cook until chicken is no longer pink inside. Remove chicken from pan. Combine remaining ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a boil. Add chicken back to pan. Simmer about 5 minutes longer, until heated through. Serve over hot rice. Garnish with parsley and sliced almonds if desired.

Heat the broth over medium high heat. Add the onion and celery and cook for about 5 minutes until soft. Add the carrots and garlic and cook for about another 5 minutes. Add the rice and thyme and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Top with the parsley.

Cook 4 medium potatoes in boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender. Cool and cut into 1in cubes. Combine potatoes and remaining salad ingredients in a large bowl. Add additional salt and pepper to taste. Cover and chill until ready to serve. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cut each chicken wing into 3 pieces.Mix together the soy sauce, ginger, crushed red pepper flakes, and five spice powder in a large bowladd chicken wings. Toss to coat evenly with sauce.Arrange chicken wings on a baking sheet, and bake in the preheated oven until the chicken wings are crisp and the sauce is bubbly, about 20 minutes. Serve immediately.
Spread one side of each slice of bread with honey mustard. Layer turkey, salami, cheese and ham. Top with onions, tomatoes and lettuce. Spread top of sandwich with honey mustard. Cut in half.

Cut off the top of each orange so you can fit it over a shrimp head like a cap. Use a sharp knife to slice down the sides of each orange peel to remove the segments. Squeeze out the juice of 1 orange and put aside. Use a micro-planer to grate 1 orange zest. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil on a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add 10 garlic cloves, stirring constantly to prevent burning. Cook for 30 seconds. Add 1 1/2 pounds shrimp and cook for 1 minute on each side or until shrimp turn opaque. Add 2 tablespoons orange zest and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add 2 tablespoons orange juice and 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar to skillet and stir to mix well. Serve over hot cooked pasta.

Cut chicken fillets into thin strips. Combine ginger and apricot nectar in a bowl. Add chicken pieces and marinate for an hour or until ready to cook. Drain and pat dry with paper towel. Heat a wok with oil. Add the strips of chicken and stir-fry for two minutes. Add the sherry and soya sauce and continue cooking for a minute. Add the water and cornstarch and stir-fry until it thickens. Garnish with green onions and serve over rice.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add kale and cook for 2 minutes, until slightly softened and bright green. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside. Add potatoes and boil for 6 minutes until cooked through but still firm. Drain and return to pot along with mushrooms and garlic. Toss with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss kale with remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil and spread out in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Roast in oven for about 8 minutes or until just barely starting to brown and crisp up on edges, turning once. Serve on plates topped with potatoes and mushrooms.

Grease two 8x8 inch baking pans. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix first five ingredients. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Stir in margarine. Add milk and sugar. Beat until smooth. Pour into pans. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden and toothpick comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes before cutting. Serve with butter.

Place cinnamon stick, cloves and water into small pot and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and let sit for at least one hour. Remove cloves and cinnamon stick. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add lemonade concentrate. Chill and serve over ice cubes.
Mix together popcorn, corn pops and corn chips. Add chocolate chips. Place in air tight container. Store in a cool place.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Peel sweet potatoes and apples. Cut sweet potatoes and apples into 1/4 inch slices and arrange in a 13x9 inch baking dish.In a medium bowl, combine corn flakes and orange juice. Spray a 13x9 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Pour orange juice mixture over apples and sweet potatoes. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Increase heat to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Combine corn flakes and orange zest in a small bowl. Sprinkle over apple and sweet potato mixture and return to oven. Bake for 8 minutes or until golden. Let cool for 3 minutes. Serve.

Split jalapeno peppers in half lengthwise. Remove seeds and white pith from halves. Stuff each with a slice of cooked bacon, a cube of cheese and a spoonful of cream cheese. Wrap each with a slice of bacon. Secure with toothpicks. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 to 40 minutes.

Beat shortening with sugar for 3 minutes or until light and fluffy. Beat in egg. Add flour, baking soda and saltmix well. Stir in mincemeat with hands until evenly distributed. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 degrees f for 8-10 minutes or until light brown. Cool for 1 minute before removing from cookie sheets to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c).Line a baking sheet with aluminum foilset aside.In a small bowl, combine the cheddar cheese and black pepperset aside.In a medium bowl, beat the eggs with the butter until well blended.In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until crispremove from the pan and drain on paper towels.Wrap each egg in a slice of baconplace in the egg mixture.Wrap each bacon-wrapped egg with a slice of cheddar cheese.Place the eggs on the prepared baking sheet.Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the bacon is cooked through.Serve with the salsa and english muffins.

In a large skillet with a little butter saute the garlic until it begins to turn brown. Add lime peel and juice and parsley. Add shrimp and saute until pink. Add butter and sugar. Stir in cayenne pepper. Stir in Worcestershire sauce.
Put all the ingredients in a food processor. Process until smooth. Spoon the mixture into a small bowl. Serve with grilled meats.

Heat the olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant and golden, about 2 minutes. Add the onion and cook until softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the white wine and cook until the wine is reduced by half. Add the tomatoes with their juice. Bring to a boil and add the dried herbs. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the tomatoes break down and the sauce thickens slightly, 5 to 6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Preheat the oven to 375°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil. Pat the ocean perch dry with paper towels. Arrange the fish on the baking sheet and sprinkle with the kalamata olives and feta cheese. Pour the tomato sauce over the fish and bake until the fish is opaque and cooked through and the feta cheese is golden and melted, 10 to 12 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine the first six ingredients in a bowl. Spoon into an 8-inch square baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350 for 40 minutes. Mix the ketchup with the milk and stir into the hot meat mixture. Spoon over the top. Bake 15 to 20 minutes longer or until center is heated through. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Sprinkle chicken with cumin, paprika, turmeric, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt and cinnamon. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken until browned on all sides. Transfer to a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve chicken with rice or noodles. Serves 4.

Melt butter and peanut butter together in medium saucepan. Add sugar and evaporated milk. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture reaches soft boil stage and thickens. Add peanut butter chips and vanilla. Mix well. Pour into greased 9x13 pan. Cool. Sprinkle with peanuts. Cut into 2 1/2 inch squares. Store in refrigerator.
Slice all the veggies. Add to a saute pan. Add the dressing mix. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir. Cook for 5 more minutes. Eat.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add pasta and cook for 8-10 minutes until al dente. Drain and set aside. Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Saute the green onions and garlic until fragrant and lightly golden. Add the white wine and scrape the bottom of the pan to deglaze. Stir in the pasta and add the pepper and salt to taste. Remove from the heat and stir in the remaining 6 tablespoons of butter and the fresh parsley. Serve immediately.
Melt butter in a skillet. Add lotus root and cook over medium heat until lightly browned. Add soy sauce and cook until liquid evaporates. Add bonito flakes and cook until flakes are crispy.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Arrange rounds on baking sheet. In small bowl, combine cheese, bacon, garlic powder & sugar. Divide mixture evenly between rounds. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Spread each round with Miracle Whip. Top with onions & celery salt. Makes 18 servings.

Place fillets on a greased broiler pan. In a small bowl combine orange juice, brown sugar, bourbon, soy sauce, garlic, chives and green onion. Pour over salmon fillets and marinate in refrigerator 2 hours, turning once or twice. Remove fish from marinade. Place on greased broiler pan and broil in oven 4 inches from heat source 4 minutes on each side until fish flakes easily with a fork or until desired degree of doneness is reached. Garnish with lemon wedges and fresh chives or green onions. Serve with rice or pasta.
Grate cabbage and mix with mayonnaise and sour cream. Add maple syrup, salt and pepper. Chill before serving.

In a large bowl, stir together coleslaw mix, chicken, teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, garlic powder, and 1 tablespoon sweet and sour sauce. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place 1 egg roll wrap in skillet at a time. Brush with water using pastry brush. Place 1/4 cup filling in the center of each wrap. Bring 2 corners together to form a triangle, folding over to form a triangle. Fold bottom corner up, and roll toward the top corner. Repeat procedure with remaining wraps. In a small bowl, stir together remaining sweet and sour sauce and water. Serve salad in egg rolls with sauce for dipping.

Preheat the oven to 350. Sift together cake flour and baking soda. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the sugar and cocoa. In a large bowl, combine the sugar-cocoa mixture, vanilla, vinegar and vegetable oil. Beat until smooth. Alternately add the dry and wet ingredients. Beat for 2 minutes. Pour into two greased and floured 9 x 5-inch loaf pans. Bake for 35 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes in pan. Remove from pans. Cool thoroughly. Spread with frosting and top with nuts. Frosting:1/2 cup vegetable shortening1 cup confectioners sugar1/2 tsp vanilla extractCombine the shortening and sugar. Beat until smooth. Add the vanilla. Spread over cooled cake. Makes 2 loaves.

Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and garlic and cook until softened, 2 to 3 minutes. Add apricot preserves and stir until smooth. Add remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Stir in lemon juice and hot sauce and cook until reduced to a glaze, about 5 minutes. Season to taste with creole seasoning. Place chicken in skillet and toss to coat. Cook until warmed through. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with brown rice and steamed green beans. Serves 4.

Cut the tongue into slices about 1/4 inch thick. Add the vinegar, water, sugar, onion slices, pickling spices, mustard seeds, bay leaf, and garlic cloves to the vinegar mixture. Simmer until the tongue slices are fork tender. Remove the tongue and the vegetables from the mixture. Let cool. Place the tongue slices in a covered container, and refrigerate overnight. Remove the tongue slices from the pickling liquid and slice into bite size pieces. Mix the vinegar and water mixture and pour over the tongue slices. Store in the refrigerator. This pickled tongue will keep for at least 3 weeks.

In a blender or food processor combine 3 garlic cloves and tomatillo. Blend until smooth. In a large bowl combine with 1/2 cup of water and 3 tablespoons of seasoning. Stir until combined. Add 1/2 teaspoon of sea salt and 1/4 teaspoon of chipotle puree. Stir until combined. Chill for 1 hour. Serve with chips.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Spray a large baking pan with the cooking spray. In a small bowl whisk together the mustard and the paprika. Add the potatoes. Toss with the mustard mixture. Spray a large baking pan with the cooking spray. In a small bowl whisk together the mustard and the paprika. Add the potatoes. Toss with the mustard mixture. Spray a large baking pan with the cooking spray. In a small bowl whisk together the mustard and the paprika. Add the potatoes. Toss with the mustard mixture. Spray a large baking pan with the cooking spray. In a small bowl whisk together the mustard and the paprika. Add the potatoes. Toss with the mustard mixture. Spray a large baking pan with the cooking spray. In a small bowl whisk together the mustard and the paprika. Add the potatoes. Toss with the mustard mixture. Spray a large baking pan with the cooking spray. In a small bowl whisk together the

Peel the lemons and slice each one in half crosswise. Using a vegetable peeler or sharp knife, remove the lemon rind from each half. Slice each lemon half into thin slices and place in the bottom of a tall glass or parfait glass. Pour the limoncello into the glasses. Using a whisk, beat the heavy cream in a medium size mixing bowl until it is thick and forms stiff peaks. Add the caster sugar and beat until the sugar is dissolved. Pour the cream over the limoncello and lemon slices in the glasses. Sprinkle the crushed amaretti cookies on top of the cream mixture. Serve immediately. Serves 1.

Cut fillets into serving pieces. Salt and pepper both sides. Dip in flour, shake off excess. Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add flounder and cook until tender. Remove from skillet and set aside. In same skillet melt butter. Add wine and lemon juice and cook until mixture boils. Add capers and parsley. Add flounder pieces and heat through. Serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.

Mix together sugar, egg and vanilla until well blended. Combine with the butter and shortening and blend well. Add the sifted flour and mix thoroughly. Chill for 1 hour. Roll out on lightly floured surface and cut with a variety of cookie cutters. Place on ungreased cookie sheets and bake in 350f oven until set and lightly browned - about 10 minutes. Cool on racks and frost with vanilla icing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl combine 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 minced garlic clove and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Drizzle bread slices with remaining oil mixture and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt. Arrange bread on baking sheet and bake 10 minutes or until lightly toasted. In medium bowl, combine 1/2 cup apple, 1/4 cup walnuts and 1/4 cup bleu cheese salad dressing. Spoon about 1 tablespoon apple mixture onto each toast. Top with 1 hard-cooked egg. Garnish with apple and walnuts. Makes 6.

Heat the butter in a large pan and fry the onion and garlic. Add the potatoes and leek and fry for a few minutes. Add the stock and cayenne. Bring to the boil then reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Add the chorizo sausages and simmer for a further 5 minutes. Serve in warmed bowls sprinkled with the coriander leaves.

Drain the scallops and pat dry with paper towels. Combine rice wine vinegar and soy sauce with water. Add salt and pepper to taste. Place scallops in a plastic bag and pour the marinade over the scallops. Seal the bag and refrigerate for 10 minutes to marinate. Mix the cornstarch and egg in a bowl. Combine the breadcrumbs and salt on a shallow plate. Drain the scallops from the marinade and dip the scallops first into the egg mixture and then into the cornstarch mixture and then into the breadcrumbs. In a large skillet heat oil over high heat until very hot. Fry the scallops for about 1 minute on each side or until golden brown. Remove from skillet and drain on paper towel to absorb the oil. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add the penne pasta and cook for 6-8 minutes or until al dente. Cook the chicken breasts in the olive oil until golden brown. Season with the chili, mushroom and baby spinach. Add the asparagus and cook until tender. Add the pasta and cook for 1 minute. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and basil. Stir in the parsley. Serve immediately.
Place banana, crushed pineapple, milk, honey and ice cubes in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour into 3 glasses and top with whipped topping, chocolate syrup and a maraschino cherry.

Heat vegetable oil in a small saute pan over medium heat. Add scallions and cook for 1 minute. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Stir in the chicken stock and bring to a boil over medium heat. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add chambord liquor, rice vinegar, soy sauce, honey, black pepper and cornstarch. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil again. Turn heat down to low and let simmer for a few minutes longer.

Spray a pizza pan with cooking spray. Roll out dough and place in pan. Spread with olive oil. Cook garlic in olive oil until golden brown. Remove from heat. Spread over dough. Add tomatoes and basil. Spread artichokes over tomatoes. Sprinkle with cheese and red bell pepper. Bake at 425 degrees for about 20 minutes or until crust is golden.

Place biscuits in an 8-inch square baking pan. Bake 15 to 18 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely on a wire rack. Whisk yogurt and topping until blended. Serve biscuits topped with yogurt mixture and blueberries. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and lemon peel if desired.

Cut the dates in half lengthwise, remove pits and set aside. In a medium bowl combine breadcrumbs with egg, balsamic vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, 1/4 teaspoon pepper and 1/4 teaspoon salt, mixing well. Divide mixture in half. Press one half evenly over bottom of each date half. Top each with 1/4 cup beef mixture and 1/4 cup bacon mixture. Cover each with remaining breadcrumb mixturepress to seal. Place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with additional Worcestershire sauce if desired. Makes 10 mini meatloaves.

Combine the eggs and flour in a bowl. Stir in the corn syrup, sugar, rum and butter. Mix thoroughly with a wooden spoon. Pour into pie shells. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 50 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

Combine milk, water and salt. Heat over medium-low heat. In small mixing bowl add eggs. Beat well, add milk mixture and beat well again. Pour into non-stick skillet that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Cook over low-medium heat until done, about 10-15 minutes or until eggs are set and cooked through. Remove from heat. Add pepper and whipped cream cheese to eggs while still hot. Stir until cheese is melted and mixed throughout the eggs. Serve immediately.

Bring broth, quinoa, and 1/2 teaspoon salt to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat, stirring often. Reduce heat and simmer until broth has been absorbed and quinoa is tender, about 15 minutes. Turn off heat and stir in corn, salsa, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir in avocadomash with a potato masher or fork until slightly chunky. Stir in cilantro and lime wedgeserve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450. Coat wings with honey in a large bowl. Add chili powder, soy sauce and lime juice. Coat with chicken wings and mix well. Place wings in a single layer on a greased baking sheet. Bake wings 30 minutes, turning wings once or twice. Serve wings warm with a side of ranch dressing.

Mix ground beef, egg, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes together and form into 3 patties. Put hot dog slices around beef patties. Wrap beef patties with bacon slices. Secure with toothpick. Grill or broil for 6 minutes. Top with barbecue sauce. Serve on hoagie buns.

Beat together oleo, brown sugar, and egg until creamy. Stir in dry ingredients. Chill dough overnight or for several hours before rolling out and cutting out cookies. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface about 1/4 inch thick. Cut out cookies with a large cookie cutter or a glass. Place cookies about 1 inch apart on a baking sheet that has been lightly sprayed with cooking spray or that is covered with parchment paper. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Store in an airtight container.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and smash with a fork. In a small bowl, mix together milk and ranch salad dressing. Add potatoes and mix well. Sprinkle with pepper and serve with chives.
Combine all ingredients in a blenderblend until smooth. Chill thoroughly. Serve with vegetables.

Combine creamed corn and eggs. Beat well. In a large bowl combine cornmeal and flour, add baking powder and salt. Mix well and add the butter and sugar. Stir until flour is moistened and add the egg mixture. Stir until well mixed. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 50 minutes or until golden brown. In the last 15 minutes of baking sprinkle the cheese and chilies over the top of the cornbread and cook until cheese is melted and cornbread is done. Serve hot with honey drizzled over the top if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In large skillet, brown beef. Add in onion and mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are tender. Add in mustard. Cook another minute. Remove from heat. Mix in sour cream. Add in parsley. Place mixture in a baking dish. Bake 10-12 minutes or until beef is no longer pink. Top with parsley.

Cut off the stem of the broccoli and slice the florets thinly. Heat the olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan and add the garlic and broccoli. Saute for about 2 minutes. Add a small amount of water and cover the pan. Cook for about 8-10 minutes, or until broccoli is tender. Stir in the crushed red pepper flakes. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon juice. Serve hot. Garnish with cashews.

To soften the dried shiitake mushrooms, put in a bowl with enough warm water to cover for 20-30 minutes. Drain. Heat stock in a saucepan. Add mushrooms, peas, eggs and stir. Add the rest of the seasoning. Add salt and msg. Heat through and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease two 8 inch square baking pans. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder. In another bowl, combine milk and oil. Add the milk mixture to the flour mixture. Beat well. Divide the batter into the two prepared pans. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely. In a large mixing bowl, beat butter, vanilla and salt until smooth. Gradually beat in powdered sugar until light and fluffy. Add milk until desired consistency is reached. Spread frosting between layers and over top. Decorate with chocolate shavings if you like.

Mix apple pie filling, butter, splenda, and eggs in large bowl. Add vanilla and mix thoroughly. Stir in graham cracker crumbs, baking powder and salt. Stir in milk and walnuts. Spray large glass baking dish with cooking sprayspread batter evenly in baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 to 35 minutes or until done. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch square baking dish. In a medium skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pandrain on paper towels. In a medium saucepan, combine potatoes, green chiles, celery soup, milk, and bacon. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in bacon, bell pepper, onion, and cheese sauce mixpour into prepared baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheesebake until cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash sweet potato and pierce several times with a fork. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. While potato is cooling, combine raisins, sunflower seeds and maple syrup. When potato is cool, slice open and spread topping. Refrigerate until serving. Makes 2 servings.

Pour orange juice into shaker, add ice cream to shaker, then pour in ruby red grapefruit juice, orangecello liqueur, grenadine, heavy cream and cream of coconut. Shake well until mixed. Strain into a shot glass or cocktail glass. Garnish with orange slice.

Brown ground beef and onion. Drain. Combine beef and onion with taco seasoning. Add tomato sauce. Add whole kernel corn. Spread mixture into a 2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Make bisquick batter. Pour batter over meat mixture. Bake 1 hour at 350 degrees. Serve with taco sauce. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Heat oven to 375. Cut rolls in half horizontally. Place in a single layer on baking sheet. In a small bowl combine butter, mustard, horseradish, worcestershire sauce, onions, poppy seeds and mix well. Spread each half of roll with mustard mixture. Top each roll with a slice of cooked ham and cooked turkey. Bake 10 to 12 mins or until cheese is melted.

Melt butter in slow cooker. Add chicken, salt and pepper. Cook about 20 minutes until cooked through. Add garlic and cook 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce, wine, basil. Cover and cook for 20 minutes more. Add shrimp and cook 15 more minutes. Serve over rice.

Combine the brown sugar, white sugar, flour and milk in a saucepan. Cook and stir until thickened. Cool to room temperature. Beat the cream, vanilla and cinnamon until thick. Fold in the cooled sugar mixture. Spoon into a 9 inch pie plate. Chill for 2 hours.
Spoon the ricotta cheese onto the toast and top with a spoonful of the yogurt. Slice the mango and arrange on top of the ricotta. Drizzle with the passion fruit pulp and serve.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees celcius. Beat together bananas and sugar until smooth and creamy. Add eggs and beat again. Fold through flours, cornflour and baking powder. Heat oil in frypan and spoon mixture into oil to make fritters. Cook for approx 2 minutes each side or until golden brown. Transfer to oven and bake for approx 10 minutes or until cooked through. Dust with icing sugar and serve warm with ice cream or custard.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray. In small bowl combine first 4 ingredients. Pour into baking dishreserve remaining 2 tablespoons onion mixture. Mix beef and reserved onion mixturespread evenly over onion mixture in dish. Bake uncovered about 40 minutes or until meat thermometer reads 160 degrees f. Sprinkle with remaining onion mixture. Bake uncovered 10 minutes longer or until meat thermometer reads 165 degrees f. Serve with sliced onion. Makes 8 servings.

Proof yeast by dissolving in warm water (not hot) for 5 minutes. Combine all other ingredients in large bowl. Kneed until smooth. Let rise until doubled. Roll out to desired thickness. Add toppings. Bake at 450 for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

In a small bowl stir together the salsa and sour cream until smooth. Spread artichoke hearts in an 8-inch pie plate or in a 9-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle evenly with the cheese. Top with the sour cream mixture and sprinkle evenly with the green onions. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with cilantro before serving. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Heat oil over medium heat and add onions. Cook until softened. Add sweet potatoes and carrots and cook for a minute or two. Add stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender. Blend with chili oil until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste.

In large nonstick skillet over medium heat melt butter, add cabbage & stir. Cover & cook about 10 minutes or until tender. Stir in sugar & vinegar. Cook stirring constantly & stirring occasionally until heated through & sugar is dissolved. Season to taste & sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve immediately or refrigerate to serve later.

In a medium bowl, combine kefir, mayonnaise, yogurt, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, chives, parsley, salt, and pepper and mix well with an immersion blender. Or puree with an electric blender until smooth. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Use immediately or refrigerate up to 2 days. Shake well before using.

Put the steak in a single layer in a large nonstick skillet. Cook over medium-high heat for 8-10 minutes on each side or until the internal temperature reaches 145 degrees. Combine the oil, onion, water, bouillon cube, mustard, worcestershire sauce, adobo seasoning, and garlic powder in a blender. Cover and blend until smooth. Pour the mixture over the steak. Cook for 2-3 more minutes. Serve immediately.
Put sugar into cocktail shaker and add ice cubes. Muddle kumquats and orange wedges in shaker. Add cranberries and shake well. Strain into glass. Top off with Grand Marnier.
muddle basil in the bottom of a tall glass add lemon and lime slices, gingerroot and 5 spice powder add honey and wine stir muddle and add ice add chives and top with fresh basil and serve.
Brown hamburger and onion in skillet. Drain. Combine with remaining ingredients except for green beans. Pour into baking dish. Top with green beans. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour.

Bring a medium pot of water to boil over high heat. Add orzo pasta and cook until it is al dente, about 10 minutes. Drain well. In a large bowl, combine the orzo pasta and snap peas and toss to combine. In a small bowl combine the lemon juice and olive oil. Whisk together and toss with the orzo and snap pea mixture. Season with the coarse salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 10-inch tube pan or bundt pan with shorteningdust with flour, tapping out excess. In a large bowl, beat eggs until blended. Beat in oil, sugar, flour, baking powder, cocoa, baking soda and vanilla until smooth. Beat in milk. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes in pan on a wire rack. Remove from pancool completely on wire rack. Frost with chocolate frosting.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place chicken in shallow baking pan. Cover with mayonnaise, turning chicken over to coat. Sprinkle with dry onion soup mixset aside. Blend together mayonnaise, dressing and preserves until smoothspread over chicken. Bake 1 hour or until juices run clear when thickest part of thigh is pierced with fork. Spoon rice over chickensprinkle with parsley and serve.

Brown hamburger with onion in a large skillet until no longer pink. Stir in tomato soup and tomato paste. Bring to a boil. Stir in remaining ingredients. Simmer on low heat for 30 minutes. Serve over hot spaghetti or pasta shells. Serving size is 1 cup sauce with 1/2 cup pasta.

Toast black peppercorns and garlic over medium heat in a small skillet. Transfer garlic and peppercorns into a blender or food processor and pulse until a fine powder is formed. Add cilantro leaves and pulse a few times more to roughly chop. Combine peppercorn and garlic mixture with lime juice and zest, sugar, fish sauce and soy sauce. Season with salt and set aside. Heat oil and sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook for a few minutes on each side, until just cooked through. Remove from pan and set aside. Pour sauce mixture over chicken and toss until well coated and serve immediately.
Wash and dry the beans. Toss the beans with the olive oil in a bowl. Add the pepitas, kosher salt and rosemary. Toss to coat well. Add the garlic to taste.

Cook the fettuccine according to package directions in a large pot of boiling salted water. Drain. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, brown the bacon over medium heat. Remove the bacon and crumble it. Add the green beans and yellow pepper to the skillet. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and water and bring to a boil. Add the pasta and basil and toss to combine. Transfer to a large serving bowl. Serve with the crumbled bacon and the parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 250f. In a medium bowl, mix together the first six ingredients, reserving 1/4 cup of the egg white mixture for later. Add the peanuts and toss to coat evenly. Spread the mixture evenly on two baking sheets coated with cooking spray. Bake for 15 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in the reserved egg white mixture and return to oven for 15 minutes more. Let cool completely before serving.
Microwave onion and curry paste for 1-2 minutes until soft. Add vegetables and cook for another 1-2 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and microwave for another minute or two. Serve over rice.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add chicken to skillet and saute until browned on both sides. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add fresh thyme to skillet and saute until fragrant. Add endive and saute until tender-crisp. Add chicken broth and honey and bring to a boil. Return chicken to skillet and reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer until chicken is cooked through. Toss in lemon juice and parsley and serve.

Cut turkey into small pieces and set aside. Heat oil and stir-fry onion and mushroom until fragrant and onion is slightly browned. Add celery and stir-fry for another minute. Add water chestnut and stir-fry for another minute. Add turkey and stir-fry for another minute. Add soy sauce and stir-fry for another minute. Stir in brown sugar and salt to taste. Serve and enjoy.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over moderate heat. Add the beef and stir-fry until the meat is browned. Transfer the beef to a plate. Add the lettuce to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the lettuce is wilted. Return the beef to the skillet. Add the carrots and chili pastes. Cook until the carrots are crisp-tender. Spread the mixture evenly over the bottom half of the baguette. Top with the remaining baguette half. Cut the sandwich in half to make 2 sandwiches. Serve with the nuoc cham sauce for dipping.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In an ovenproof pan or dish, mix apples, sugar, water, lemon juice and egg. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, combine cinnamon with sprouts and toss to coat. Pour apple mixture around sprouts. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until apples are tender but not mushy. In the last 5 minutes of cooking, toss sprouts with butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve warm with butter, if desired.
Combine egg yolks with beef. Add seasonings and mix well. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff and fold into beef mixture. Form into small balls and fry in butter. Serve with lemon sauce.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine sugar and margarine and cook until smooth and creamy stirring frequently. Remove from heat and add milk and cocoa. Pour mixture into a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes then sprinkle with oats and peanut butter. Return to oven for 2 minutes and remove. Sprinkle with vanilla and place in freezer for 1 hour. Cut into 12 squares and serve.

Place potatoes in a pot of cold water and bring to a boil. Boil for 10 minutes or until potatoes can be pierced with a fork easily. Drain potatoes and place in a mixing bowl. Mix in onion and eggs and season with salt and pepper. Add mayonnaise and ranch dressing mix and stir well. Serve cold.

In a large bowl combine flour, baking powder, artificial sweetener, salt. Cut margarine into flour mixture. Blend well. Add pineapple and egg. Spoon into greased or paper lined muffin cups. Bake at 400f for 15-20 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

Melt butter in heavy large pot over medium heat. Add onion and saute until tender. Add potatoes and broth. Cover and simmer over medium low heat until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Remove bay leaves and puree in blender until smooth. Stir in cheese and salt. Serve topped with chopped parsley.

Mix together flour, salt and baking powder. Add shortening and cut in with a pastry blender or 2 forks until mixture resembles a coarse meal. Add milk all at once. Stir just until all flour is moistened. Turn onto lightly floured surface. Knead until dough is smooth. Roll dough into a rectangle 1/4 inch thick. Cut into squares using a biscuit cutter or large glass. Place 1/2 teaspoon of filling in the center of each dumpling square. Fold up the edges to form a triangle. Place triangles on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degree fahrenheit for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 40 dumplings.

Cook the brown sugar and the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir until the butter melts. Add the peaches and corn syrup and cook until the peaches are softened and the sauce is syrupy. Remove from the heat and stir in the ginger. Arrange the ice cream and the peaches in the bottom of a 3-cup glass and drizzle with the sauce. Garnish with the walnuts and serve.

Cut sausage into 1/2-inch pieces. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sausagecook 5 minutes or until browned. Remove sausage from skillet. Add green pepper, celery, and flour to skilletstir until flour is lightly browned. Stir in broth, tomatoes with juice, sausage, kidney beans, bay leaves, oregano, thyme, crushed red pepper flakes, and black pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer uncovered 20 minutes. Discard bay leaves. Garnish with parsley.

Butter an 8-inch square baking pan. Melt marshmallows and butter in a heavy saucepan. Remove from heat. Add the cereal and mix until well coated. Press firmly into prepared pan. Let set until firm. Melt chocolate chips. Spread over top of bars and refrigerate until firm. Cut into bars. Makes about 2 dozen bars.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Spread sauce on crust. Arrange tomatoes and mushrooms on crust. Top with onion and sausage. Sprinkle with mozzarella. Bake 10 minutes or until crust is crisp and cheese is melted. Sprinkle with basil.

Using a paring knife, remove the tops of the cherry tomatoes. Squeeze the lemon over the tops of the tomatoes. Sprinkle with capers and pimentos. Fill with brandy, a few drops at a time. Sprinkle with lemon zest. Garnish with parsley. Serve at room temperature.

Soak bread in milk until it is very soggy. Then heat fry pan with butter in it. When butter starts to bubble, place bread in pan. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes on each side. Serve with sugar-free strawberry jam on each piece of bread. This is the best french toast ever!!
Peel cucumber and chop into medium chunks. Place cucumber in a food processor along with all other dressing ingredients and process until smooth. Chill for at least an hour before serving.

Peel and seed the tomatoes and remove all seeds and pith. Dice into small cubes and set aside. Finely dice the onion and cucumber and set aside. In a heavy skillet cook the tomatoes and onions in water until the tomatoes are tender, about 5 minutes. Add the cucumber and cook until tender. Drain the mixture through a colander. In a medium bowl combine the tomato mixture with the remaining ingredients. Let cool and place in sterilized jars and process in boiling water bath for 5 minutes or until the seal is set. Makes about 10 pints.

Combine first four ingredients in a 2-quart saucepan over low heat. Cook until melted. Stir in marshmallows. Pour into a greased 8-inch square baking pan. Let cool and cut into squares. To make the crust, crush the graham crackers until they are fine crumbs. Mix with melted butter and press into the bottom of a 9-inch pie pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until the crust is lightly browned. Cool before filling with fudge.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat a baking dish with cooking spray. Rinse potatoes and cut into quarters. Place potatoes in baking dish and sprinkle with onion. Drizzle with salad dressing. Bake for 20 minutes or until potatoes are fork-tender. Stir and sprinkle with cheese. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Season with pepper and salt. Serve warm. Serves 4.
Puree basil, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, pine nuts, cheese and olive oil together. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper. Serve with bread or vegetables.

Simmer onions and cape gooseberries in vinegar and spices until tender. Remove from heat and mash with potato masher. Add remaining ingredients and continue to mash. Let cool. Refrigerate at least overnight. Makes 2 cups.

In large skillet, heat butter and wasabi over medium heat until melted and slightly thickened. Stir in popcorn and remove from heat. Stir in salt and sugar until coated. Transfer to large bowl and cool. Store in air-tight container.

In a small skillet, heat butter over medium heat until melted. Add onion and cook 10 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. Divide onion among 8 bread slices and top with herring fillets and tomato slices. Sprinkle with watercress and season with pepper to taste. Roll each sandwich up and place on plates. Serve with lemon wedges and mayonnaise for dipping.

In a large saucepan combine the sugar, vinegar, salt and spices. Bring to a boil. Add the onions and reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered for 30 minutes. Add the cucumber and cook for 5 minutes more. Remove from heat and pack into hot sterilized jars leaving 1/4 headroom. Seal. Process in a boiling-water bath for 5 minutes. Cool. Yields 1 1/2 pints.

Cut apples into 6 wedges each. Set aside. Heat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Unroll dough. Cut into 12 squares (each about 3 inches square). Spoon about 1 1/2 teaspoons apple pie spice into center of each square. Place apple wedge on top of each spice mound. Fold opposite corners together to make a triangle. Place triangles 1/2 inch apart on ungreased baking sheet. Brush with melted buttersprinkle with sugar and apple juice concentrate. Bake 12 minutes or until golden brown.

Combine all meatball ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well and form into meatballs about the size of a golf ball. Brown them in a large skillet in the olive oil until all sides are browned. Place in a baking dish and bake at 425 for about 20 minutes until done. Then cover with pasta sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prick sweet potatoes all over with fork. Place on cookie sheet. Bake until soft. In small bowl, combine brown sugar, flaked coconut, pecans, butter, vanilla extract and cinnamon. Add salt to taste. Spread over sweet potato halves. Bake 10 minutes longer. Serve hot. Top with marshmallows as desired.

Combine the lemon jello with 1 cup of boiling water. Stir thoroughly, let cool a bit and add the crushed pineapple. Mix well, add the lime jello and continue mixing well. Refrigerate till set. Chill the small curd cottage cheese in a large bowl or in a 1-gallon freezer bag for 4 hours or overnight. Mix the cheese and the miracle whip or mayonnaise, and blend well. Spoon the pineapple mixture into the bowl of the small curd cottage cheese mixture. Mix well. Serve immediately or chill for 2 hours or overnight. Garnish with whipped cream if desired.

Rinse millet and place in a saucepan. Add the milk and water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer, covered for about 20 minutes. Stir frequently to keep from sticking. Add raisins and mix. Serve warm with maple syrup and a sprinkle of ground cinnamon. Serves 2.

Wash and dry the black olives. Cut each olive in half crosswise. Combine olives, tomatoes, and salt in a large bowl. Stir in the garlic, thyme leaves, and pepper. Spoon into a serving bowl. Drizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with the fresh parsley. Serve at room temperature. Serves 4.
Combine all ingredients in food processor. Pulse until smooth. Place in serving dish. Top with bacon, scallions. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a large bowl combine shortening and sugar. Beat in the egg and blend well. Add the cake flour, baking powder, and baking soda. Beat until smooth. Add nutmeg. Beat in sour milk and vanilla. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for about 15 minutes. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the chicken fillets and sprinkle with the fresh thyme. Cook for 10 minutes, turning once. Add the olives and cook for 3 minutes longer. Stir in the lemon juice and cook for another minute. Add the wine and cook for another minute. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with salt.

Heat olive oil and butter together in a frying pan or wok on high heat until the butter is foaming. Add the shrimp, seasoning well and cooking them for about 30 seconds on each side, until pink. Add the ginger and cook for another 30 seconds, then pour over the orange juice and cook for about 30 seconds. Turn the heat off, then add the honey and stir to coat the prawns evenly. Serve immediately.
Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain. Combine sour cream, mayonnaise, peppers, tomatoes, onions and dill. Gently mix with cooked pasta. Top with salmon.

Sort the lentils. Soak them in water for 1 hour. Drain the lentils. Cook in boiling water for 20 minutes. Drain the lentils. In a skillet, heat the oil. Add the onion. Stirring regularly. Add the red bell pepper. Cook until they are softened. Add the cumin. Add the lentils. Add the red pepper. Stir. Add the water. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the lemon juice. Serve hot.

Combine all ingredients in blender or food processor. Process until smooth. Place in ice cream maker according to manufacturer s instructions. Freeze 1 hour before serving. Serve in waffle cones or on wafers.
Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water. Drain. Melt butter with garlic. Add pasta to the pan. Stir. Add shrimp, cheese, parsley and pepper. Toss.

Mix 1/2 cup peach juice and cake mix until smooth. Press into 10-inch pan and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool in pan. Combine remaining peach juice with margarine, powdered sugar, nuts, coconut, cinnamon and vanilla. Spread over cake. Cut into squares.
Place a 6 oz brie round in the center of a plate. Top with 1 T caramel apple dip and sprinkle with mixed dried fruit. Arrange crackers and cashews around the cheese. Serve with an apple.

Peel apples, leaving stems intact. Cut into quarters. Cut each quarter into 6 slices. Place in shallow baking pan. Add carrots. Pour water over all. Salt to taste. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 2 hours. Uncover. Add margarine or butter. Stir until melted. Add sugar. Stir well. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Stir until blended. Add dried tart cherries. Stir. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

In a skillet, saute chicken in butter until golden on both sidesremove and keep warm. Add soup and water to skillet and stir until heated throughstir in pepper. Arrange chicken on a serving platter and top with broccoli mixture. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef. Drain the fat. In a 4-6 quart stockpot, combine the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat. Cover and simmer for 1 hour. Stir in the browned beef. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

Sift together the flour, bran, raw sugar and salt. Make a well in the centre of the flour mixture. Break the egg into the well and add the milk. Beat with a fork until smooth. Transfer to a pastry bag. Pikelets are very quick to cook. Heat a non-stick frypan. Squeeze about 1 tbsp of mixture into the frypan. Smooth out with the back of a spoon. Cook 1 minute or until the pikelets are golden brown. Turn over. Cook 1 minute. Repeat with remaining mixture to make 4 pikelets. Dust with icing sugar to serve.

Wash fruits. Slice grapefruits and oranges in half. Remove seeds. Cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Place in a large bowl. Add sugar to fruit. Stir in cinnamon stick. Cover. Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours. Stir before serving. Sprinkle with mint leaves.

Brown ground turkey in skillet. Drain fat. In a large stockpot add ground turkey, tomato sauce, beans, chili powder, cumin, salsa, salt and water. Cook for approximately 20 minutes or until heated through. Serve with sour cream, cheddar cheese, and sliced green onions if desired.

In large saucepan over medium heat, add brown sugar, butter, water and nuts. Heat until mixture comes to a boil. Continue boiling for 3 to 4 minutes. Pour into ungreased 9 inch pie dish. Bake for 10 minutes or until set. Place refrigerated biscuits on top of hot caramel mixture. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until golden brown. Cool before serving.

Place potatoes in blender container and add 1/2 cup milk and 1/4 cup sugar. Blend well and pour into 9-inch pie shells. Beat eggs slightlyadd remaining milk and sugar and vanilla and pour over potato filling. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray a small baking dish. Place fish in a shallow bowl. Combine the apricot nectar, french onion soup mix and the lemon juice in a medium bowl. Spoon sauce over each fish piece. Bake uncovered in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped mint just before serving.

Heat oven to 400F. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Tear spinach into large pieces. In a skillet or wok, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add spinach and stir-fry until wilted, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to baking sheet and bake until crisp and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Heat oil in a large skillet over moderately low heat. Add mustard seeds and cook until they pop. Stir in onion and cook until tender and golden brown. Add garlic and cook one minute. Stir in cumin, coriander, turmeric and cayennecook 1 minute. Add tomato, eggplant and potatocook over moderately high heat until vegetables are tender. Stir in cilantro and saltcook one minute. Serve with rice
In a large stockpot add all ingredients and bring to a boil and simmer for about 2-4 minutes or until beans are tender. Drain beans and set aside in a bowl. Add some butter and serve hot.

Cook the tortellini according to package directions. Meanwhile, slice the zucchini into thin strips on the diagonal. Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add zucchini and tomatosaute until tender-crisp. Add onionsaute for 2 minutes. Add cooked tortellinitoss to combine. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. Serves 2 to 3.

Place 4 apples in a microwave-safe bowl or dish. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Cover with plastic wrap and microwave at 50% power for 5-6 minutes or until apples are tender when pierced with a knife. Uncover and cool slightly. In a small bowl, combine juices, brown sugar and liqueur. Stir in strawberrieschill until serving. Cut the apples into wedges or slices and serve with strawberry sauce. Garnish with a sliced strawberry or a sliver of almond if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan, drain off fat and set aside. Sauté onion and garlic in bacon fat until transparent. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add flour and stir well. Add cream cheese and blend until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and heat through. Add bacon and heat for a few minutes. Serve with crackers.

Place tortillas directly on grill or heat in toaster oven. While tortillas are heating, make dressing. In a small bowl, combine all dressing ingredients and whisk. Spread dressing mixture over tortilla and top with blue cheese, walnuts, and pear. Place back under heat and serve.

Bring 1-1/2 quarts water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon baking soda. Add noodles. Cook 1-2 minutes until al dente. Drain noodles in a colander. Rinse noodles with cold water. In a small bowl combine ginger and vinegar. Add noodles and toss well. Add chives. Set aside. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium-high heat. Add tuna. Cook for 1 minute. Turn and continue cooking for 1 minute. Transfer tuna to a cutting board. With a sharp knife, cut tuna into thin slices. In a small bowl combine wasabi and remaining 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt. Spread wasabi mixture over tuna. In a small bowl combine remaining 1 teaspoon oil, lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, and chili paste. Add tuna. Toss well. Divide noodles among 4

In a sauce pan heat the butter over medium heat. Add the ginger, garlic and the black peppercorns. Fry for about 2 mins. Add the wine, soy sauce and sugar. Bring to the boil then simmer for 2 mins. Add the crabmeat into the pan and stir for a min. Remove from the heat. Serve with steamed rice.

Combine cereal with the parmesan cheese. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Wash the chicken breasts. Combine the seasoning mixture in a small bowl. Place the seasoning mixture in a plastic bag. Add the prepared chicken breasts. Seal the bag. Shake until the chicken breasts are coated. Place the coated chicken breasts in a baking pan. Bake for about 40 minutes or until cooked through. Combine the honey and mustard. Place the cooked nuggets in a large bowl. Pour the honey mustard mixture over the nuggets. Toss until coated. Serve with the remaining honey mustard mixture.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions, carrots, celery and cook until tender. Add split peas, vegetable broth and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 1 hour stirring occasionally. Stir in sweet potatoes. Cook until potatoes are tender. Stir in swiss chardcook until chard wilts, about 1 minute.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut the figs in half lengthwise. Arrange the fig halves in a single layer. Drizzle with the maple syrup and rosemary. Sprinkle with the mustard powder. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes.

Mix flour and spices in a large bowl. Cut chicken into pieces. Coat the pieces in the flour mixture and shake off any excess. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the coated pieces and fry until golden and crispy on the outside. Remove the pieces from the skillet and place on a paper towel to absorb excess oil. Serve immediately.

Mix together sugar and light corn syrup in a saucepan over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil and bubbles around edges of pan. Add in vanilla and creamy peanut butter and stir until combined. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Let cool and store in an airtight container in refrigerator. These are best stored in refrigerator because they are very soft at room temperature.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, cocoa powder and butter. Stir continuously until the mixture is smooth and chocolaty. Remove from heat and stir in the salt. Stir in the vanilla. In a small bowl combine the evaporated milk and the half-and-half. Add to the chocolate mixture and stir until well blended. Chill until ready to use. Reheat in a saucepan until warm.

Combine 2 cups apple pie filling with 2 cups water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Lower heat and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes or until thickened. Drain tortillas to remove excess water. Sprinkle with 3 tablespoons cinnamon. Spoon apple mixture over tortillas. Sprinkle evenly with 3 tablespoons margarine. Bake in preheated 350f oven for 10 minutes. Top each serving with 1 teaspoon almond flavoring. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. In a large skillet cook sausage over medium heat 6 to 8 minutes or until no longer pink. Remove from skillet. In the same skillet cook chicken and bell pepper over medium-high heat 5 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Drain. Stir in salsa, corn and cream. Spread in a 13x9-inch baking dish. Cut sausage into 1/2-inch pieces. Top the chicken mixture with sausage. Bake uncovered 30 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with tortillas.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add squash and cook, stirring frequently, until tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the peanutscook until the mixture is fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the sugarstir until the mixture is syrupy and well coated with the sugar. Remove the pan from the heatseason with the salt. Transfer the squash to a serving bowl. Serve warm or at room temperature. Yield: 1-1/2 cups.

Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add garlic and curry and cook for a minute or two. Add beans and cook for another minute. Add rice and stir. Add the chicken stock and cook for 12 minutes, uncovered. Stir in the cilantro. Season with salt.

Place chickens in the slow cooker. In a large bowl combine the ketchup, onion soup mix, and coca-cola. Pour half the mixture over the chickens. Cover and cook on high for 2 1/2 - 3 hours. Stir in remaining mixturecover and cook on high for 1 hour longer.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cook the lasagna noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a food processor combine the cream cheese and the salmon. Process until smooth and set aside. In a saucepan over low heat combine the pasta sauce and the mushrooms. Heat until the sauce is warm. In a 13x9x2 inch baking pan spread 1/2 cup of pasta sauce. Layer 6 noodles over the pasta sauce. Spread 1/2 cup of the cream cheese mixture over the noodles. Sprinkle 1/3 of the cheese over the cream cheese mixture. Repeat with 6 more noodles, the remaining cream cheese mixture and cheese. Top with the remaining 6 noodles. Pour the remaining pasta sauce over the noodles. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes until the cheese is bubbly. Garnish with the fresh dill sprigs and serve warm.

Make Jell-O according to package directions. Add hot water. Stir in pineapple tidbits. Refrigerate. Combine marshmallows, pineapple juice and pineapple tidbits in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook until marshmallows are melted and mixture is well blended. Remove from heat. Add cream cheese. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Add whipped topping. Mix well. Spread mixture on crust. Chill until ready to serve. Arrange oranges on top. Garnish with coconut.

In a frying pan, cook the bacon until crisp. Drain and set aside. Saute the onion and butternut squash until tender. Add the thyme and season to taste. Cook until the squash is tender. Add the spinach leaves and toss over heat. Serve topped with the bacon.
